description:
I heard about this place from a friend. Being a dessert lover, I dragged my lazy bum to this place and it was totally worth it. So many combos to choose from that I was almost lost. Decided to go with fruity nutella crepe! Wow!! Delicious crepes at a very low cost.
The place has a mini mart inside which sells most asian snacks! 
Only downside of this place is that there is hardly any seating area.
author: Sakshi S.

description:
I was craving for crepes since I tried the one at Packing House in LA. So I tried to find a good crepes like that. My boyfriend took me to Genki Crepes. It was a small place in a Mini-Mart. The crepes is made fresh and yummy. The ice cream didn't look good so we got a crepes without ice cream. Quick service and hot crepes for the cold weather 
Sweet, fresh fruits and tasty crepes!
Gotta come back any try more!
author: Dân T.

description:
We used to have a genki living back at home in SoCal and I thought they had the best crepes but unfortunately they closed down.. so when my friends and I came to sf over the weekend we saw that there was a genki and it also sold crepes so we thought it was the same!

Still not sure if it's the same or has any relation to genki living back at home but it was still super delicious!

It's located inside a mini mart.
I ordered the nutella, banana, strawberry with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. My go to always!

They called out my number and it was wrapped in a nice crunchy shell. We devoured the crepe. It was so good!! The only downside was that they didn't really slide up the strawberries or bananas so I didn't even get a strawberry cus my two friends took it. But other than that, we all loved the crepe and I would definitely come back!! Reminds me of the genki living we had back at home :')
author: Katelin N.

description: It's a cute little store with both crepes and treats. The crepes I've had on occasions were smaller than other places ive been to. Their prices are relatively similar, which is considerably pricier because of the smaller crepes. Usually it's somewhat busy on the weekends, so it does get crowded. Definitely no place to find parking or at least it takes forever
author: Shaeli Z.

description:
Whenever I'm in the area, this place is a must! I usually go here before I head back to SJ. Gotta get an order of egg puff on the road! It smells soooo good! Definitely delicious and crispy.

I also get a crepe, usually bananas, strawberries, Nutella, and vanilla ice cream. I like that the crepe is crispy. It can get messy, so get napkins!

Parking can be difficult, especially during dinner time on a weekend. I recommend having someone run in and order while the other person drives around until ready.
author: Anna N.

description:
No trip to San Francisco is complete without getting a nutella banana crepe at Genki because it's cheap, quick and delicious! Note that there is a $10 minimum to pay with a card. 

The only critique I'd say is to make sure you look at the expiration date when buying something from the Mini-Mart portion of the store. I bought air freshener and when I took a look back home, turns out it expired in 2016. I don't think air freshener really expires.. but it has been there for a while!
author: Amanda S.

description:
Convenient snack spot in a convenience store! My friend and I tried the coconut egg puff and lemon sugar crepe. 

The coconut egg puff had the perfect amount of coconut flavor and coconut bits. It was subtly sweet.

The simple lemon sugar crepe was not what we were expecting. We thought it would be a smear of lemon reduction or jam, but I think it was literally lemon juice dusted with powered sugar. We made a mistake. The flavors did not go well together at all. The crepe itself was okay. It was a little thicker and not like other Japanese crepes I've eaten before.

I'd probably stick to the egg puffs and try one of their over the top crepes next time.

The convenience store sells a bunch of Asian (Japanese, Thai, Chinese) snacks too!
author: Marilyn T.

description:
Cash only! 

Who doesn't love this place?

 A mini market with fresh sweet and savory crepes. For about $6ish you can create your own adventure with the amount of crepe fillings. I took my out of town guests here and they were delighted. Coming from the other side of town, I alway try to make a pit stop there!
author: Michelle C.

description: You really can't beat the price and convenience of this place. Only important thing to note is their $10 credit card minimum. (Which shouldn't be a problem if you just buy another crepe ;) also important to note that if the crepe gets cold on your walk home you can definitely nuke it in the microwave without compromising the crepe!
author: Maggie R.

description: My second favorite place for crepes beside Sophie's crepes in Japan town. Their drinks are pretty good too. Not much to say but this place won't disssapoint on crepes. It also have a good selections in drinks and snacks plus cute anime figurines. Must check out.
author: Christy V.

description:
Cozy, petite, ,grocery-store-combined crepe shop w/ a collection of Asian-made products. 

-Came here first-time on a Saturday afternoon. Overall ambiance is friendly, casual, and welcoming. Staff is attentive. Many young families & young adults in store when I visited. 

-The store has a variety of daily supplies, ranging from desserts (mochi ice creams, pop bars) to cleaning products (shampoo, skincare, etc.) The shop is rather authentic, for the furnishing & display resembles the local grocery shops in Asia. 

-Ordered 2 savory Crepes: Beef Sukiyaki & Avacado tomato. They are priced at $7~$8 each after tax.  For the price charged & the high rating on Yelp, I was expecting something super impressive. 

Personally did not find the taste or quality of the ingredients extraordinary. The marinated beef sukiyaki tasted salty like soy sauce, and the texture was a bit hard. I would call it very average. 

The avocado tomato doesn't taste anything special. Just a bit plain. I have had the same quality of crepes for a lower price. 

- Plenty of parking nearby, as well as fun giftshops & boutiques on the same street to shop around.
author: Jess W.

description:
Quick, yummy, reasonable, and a cool market.  What's not to love?

I am a repeat Genki Crepes & Mini-Mart customer, and I have only been in the neighborhood for less than a month!  The crepes are served fresh and come in sweet and savory varieties.  They also make egg puffs, which I personally have not tried, but I always see people ordering them. 
 Some crepes come with fresh cream and/or ice cream which really makes them even better.

While you wait for your treats, check out the market.  They sell lots of Japanese snacks, food, beverages, and even beauty products.  They also have other Asian treats but the market is mostly Japanese.

PROS: 
- Cool market
- Tasty crepes 

CONS: 
- None :)
author: Cimma S.

description:
Amazing as always.

Finally came back after a 4 year hiatus.
I moved from the city and now my new friend lives right next to Genki. 

I got the 26. Blueberry cheesecake crepe was just amazing. I ate some on the way home and had to Save the other half for later. I love both their sweet and savory crepes here.

Crepe was wrapped perfectly, no spill. The crepe was cooked superbly. Just the right crisp. 

The Asian candy/food assortment is fun the browse through while waiting.
author: Gage S.

description: Not a huge fan of crispy crepes but it was good for what it was. Fresh and the toppings were good - I got vanilla ice cream with Nutella and banana. Wish I bought more snacks inside, they had a great selection of KitKats, with cookies and cream, strawberry cheesecake, and more! Would come back to try some of the Japanese snacks.
author: Carlie C.

description:
I got the green tea ice cream + red bean paste crepe which was DELICIOUS. The green tea ice cream was creamy and authentic-tasting; and I liked how they layered the red bean paste within the folds of the crepe. The crepe was the right amount of crispiness and freshness - right off the pan. The warmth and crunchiness of the crepe complimented the coolness and smoothness of the ice cream well. 

Let's talk about the location. It's near a bunch of great restaurants and a farmer's market was wrapping up when we stopped by on Sunday. Perhaps a bit ambitious, but my fam and I walked to the Conservatory of Flowers after stuffing ourselves with crepes. If I'm ever in the area again, I definitely plan to try one of their fruit crepes! The only downside is their ambiance. Though they are uniquely and conveniently located within a mini mart, crepes are their main attraction and they would go far with some small tables and chairs. Perhaps the rustic feel adds to their charm. Summary: food 5/5, ambiance 2.5/5, service 3/5.
author: Tina C.

description: I love the crepes here. It is a little bit cheaper than Sophie's crepes in Japantown but that's because they have ice cream, not gelato. Still, the flavors that they offer are delicious and satisfies my cravings just the same. I also notice that Genki gives you more for your buck (more ice cream filled to the very bottom tip of the crepe). Delicious everytime!
author: Katherine N.

description:
This review is just for their dessert crepes. If you've ever been to Sophie's Crepes in SF's Japan Center then you will be familiar with the type of dessert product I'm about to rave about. 

For my first time here, I went with the Vanilla Ice Cream Crepe(with strawberries and nutella), and I believe I consumed this in one lick and one bite which produced extreme brain freeze. My point being, the crepe was fresh, not dry nor too crispy, the vanilla ice cream was creamy and not too icy, and the strawberries were freshly cut; All of which produced a product that screams I will come back for more.

You order and pay at the front counter and immediately adjacent, is the kitchen counter where they grill your crepe, slice, dice, and assemble your order. Straightforward and you should be in and out in no time with an impending sugar high.
author: Dennis W.

description: Yum! The crepe was so perfectly crispy and thin. I liked it even better than the crepe I had in Paris a few weeks ago. We got ours with Nutella and mixed fruit, and each bite was so delicious!
author: Jenny K.

description:
Came for the mainstream popular crepe place. Never came around to try and it was very lack luster.

Pretty cool that its a grocer as well.

Crepes are crispy, and honey flavored. Not bad at all. I ordered the mixed fruit, but the whip to fruit was off. Barely anything in the crepe, not enough whip.

Ordered honeydew milk tea, tasted artificial.

Belly good is hands down my fav.
author: Lynn C.

description:
This place looks kinda dumpy and poorly maintained.

BUT, Genki serves some of the best Japanese crepes out there. If you been to Tokyo, this place is better than the crepe places in Harajuku. Seriously!!! 

What makes Genki Crepes better than Japan? Well the crepe is hands down better. It has a light vanilla taste and slightly crispy and crunchy.  The japanese crepes in Japan are flaccid and soggy.  Dessert crepes in generally should be slightly crispy in my opinion. Why? well if you slathered a soft steamy crepe with nutella, ice cream and fruit, it will just melt into a nasty, soggy mess.  The slightly crisped crepe seals in the moist ingredients while providing a wonderful contrast in aromas, flavors and textures.  This why Genki is superior to most other Japanese crepes out there. This is why I will come here, knowingly seeing a roach... haha.
author: Jason C.

description:
You know those late-night cravings you get after 11pm? Don't deny it...you know you're guilty :) well this happened to me the other day and I was struck with a bad craving for something sweet. 

My cousin and I came to a consensus that a crepe would totally hit the spot. And this is where Genki's comes to the rescue. They are open late, which is a plus. They serve savory crepes as well as the sweet staples. It's kinda cool too how they have a little market where they sell Japanese snacks. Always a surprise to se what's in stock.

Anyways, I digress. I love the sweet crepes. I've tried the brownie crepe and the cheesecake one but I had to behave because summer is right around the corner haha;). I usually order the Nutella crepe with strawberries and bananas with a scoop of ice cream...it's delicious with mango or green tea but I got vanilla this time.

The crepe shell is crispy yet fluffy as the ice cream soaks with the Nutella. It's an ultimate guilty pleasure. I heard the savory crepes are good...I'll have to try it one day (I got my eyes on the smoked salmon one). 

Prices are good. Parking is somewhat difficult depending what time you go. It's worth the effort though!
author: Ralph N.

description:
Yummy and delicious crepes for an unbeatable price! Each crepe is around $5-7. Opted for the strawberry and mango crepe served in a perfectly crispy, thin crepe with a scoop of mango ice cream topped with strawberries and whipped cream. $10 minimum for credit card.

This place is located inside a grocery store in case you didn't figure that out from the name. There's lot's crepes to choose from and this place is also open late. This is a late night sweet treat to keep in mind. Until next time!
author: Nina Z.

description: Crepe was tasty, but I made the mistake of getting the cheesecake and blueberry syrup flavor. The cheesecake was tasty, but I couldn't eat a whole crepe to myself. It's just way too rich! I'll be back for a late night snack to share this then around.
author: Allie D.

description:
Genki is always on-point with their crisp, satisfying crepes. They pretty much perfected their craft. 

My recent order was a strawberry egg puff, and it was just as tasty as their crepes. To my surprise, each egg puff was filled with delicious strawberry jam!

I didn't realize that their puffs were made from the same mix as their crepes. The only difference between the two is their shape and form. It doesn't matter how you eat 'em, they are equally delicious! 

I highly recommend this place, especially to those newbies out there.
author: Elvine V.

description: It has been a long time since i came to this place for crepe. And i rarely write an update. Although this place is also a mini market, customers tend to only come here for their crepes. Had vanilla ice cream plus nutella, strawberry, and mango. If its just ice cream only, its $6.70 or so depending what flavor ice cream you get. But if you want to add toppings, it has extra. If its not too busy, they make your crepe quick. And the portion is quick big. Warning!!! It can be messy. But it still Yummy to my tummy. Its still tastes as good as i remember. This place definitely satisfied my sweet tooth
author: Julie N.

description:
My favorite crepe place. I will admit I'm biased having grown up eating from here since I was kid but I honestly think this is the best you can find in SF for the price and taste. Each crepe is approximately $5-7 dollars depending on what you order. 

There are a few other places in Japantown but they don't compare and charge higher prices. I've paid almost $8 for a strawberry Nutella crepe for 3 ingredients at Japantown while at Genki I can get the same for about $4.50. Crazy! Albeit, Japantown is more catered to tourists. 

Bring Cash here. Shop around the store while you're waiting for your crepe. It's fun to look around; they have random toys, snacks and asian skin care products. Open pretty late on weekdays and weekends too for a quick late night snack.
author: Kristy L.

description: Love the super crispy crepes. It was absolutely delicious! Wish the strawberries and bananas were a little more sweet, it wasn't really ripe. Lots of delicious options even with non-ice cream choices. Really want to try the banana, honey, and almond one next time. $10 minimum charge for credit cards, otherwise bring enough cash!
author: Fei S.

description:
Cheap! Delicious desserts!

2 things you can always count on any China towns are great food at even better price. This place doesn't look very appealing on the outside, but their reviews are more than impressive.

Being a crepe head that I am, we had to stop here for some crepe and whatever that look good right after lunch. Their crepes are huge, slightly soft with nice crispy crunch. I would like it a whole lot more if they actually offer the option to add ice cream to any crepes. For some weird reasons, that's only available to a few crepes on the menu. 

Also got myself some egg puffs. They are best eaten fresh out of the skillet and while still warm. It's so cheap too. I would definitely be a frequent customer if I lived in the area.
author: Ai Vy N.

description:
Picture this: it was and cold winter night.  My friends and I had just finished having some Korean bbq and were looking for a spot to fill our sweet craving.  We stumbled upon this little market which conveniently made crepes.  My lord, if I knew my life was going to be changed at that moment I would have found Genki long long ago. 
Their crepes are divine, as a fan I am in awe of the craftsmanship and pride those gentlemen take in making each crepe as tasty as the last.  The fruit is always perfect, and I mean perfect, not too ripe not too sweet, just perfect.  The crepes are crunchy but not burnt and they always seem to find the perfect balance between Nutella and whipped cream.  If you have not found yourself a frequent at this place, you better hurry up, these crepes will consistently satisfy your sweet tooth and you will not leave without a smile.
author: Paulina C.

description: Genki serves crepes and my all time favorite sugar packed Kona coffee- probably the best two-birds scenario I could think of. The crepe was delicious and fresh, with different ingredients swirling in harmony with each crunchy bite. Nutella fans should be pleased to know genki will provide.
author: David Y.

description:
My bud and I were finishing dinner and decided to walk around the neighborhood. We saw Genki and decided to peek in. I'm glad we did- this is definitely a hidden gem! I've never had an ice cream crepe, and this spot was the perfect intro.

ORDERED strawberry ice cream + kiwi. It was big enough for the two of us, and didn't break the bank (under $5 I believe). 

Highly recommend this location. There's spaces to sit down and enjoy the crepe, and hey- you can even grab a few essential items in the mini-mart.
author: Nicholas G.

description: Crepes for like $5? Sold. Easy go to - Nutella and banana. It's also a mini mart so of course I picked up some Hokkaido milk candy as well. I believe the minimum for credit card is $10 so have some cash handy!
author: Jennie C.

description: super cute and small shop in the outer richmond area! pretty good prices and yummy crepes. pretty use to find parking in the area, especially because the shop is open until late!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
I've been visiting this place ever since it opened and it always satisfies my cravings whenever I have a sweet tooth. I remember visiting here after school and perusing through the aisles of the mart inside, which hold unique asian snacks! I also like how this place opens until pretty late (11-12?).

Genki's crepes are some of my favorites. All of their sweet crepes have a crispy texture which pairs so well with the ice cream on the inside and are some of my favorite things to order from here. You can't really go wrong with any of their sweet crepes. I also love their eggpuffs because they're the perfect texture. I've only tried the original and red bean flavor but I can't wait to try more of them.

I'm giving it 4 stars and not 5 because one time I went and ordered a sweet crepe and the shell tasted a little too salty.
author: Joyce Y.

description:
Delicious crepes! My friends who are locals have been recommending Genki's and I'm glad I finally got the chance to go! I was at Burma Superstar for dinner just across the street and this was the perfect place for dessert.

I wasn't too hungry so I decided to share a crepe with Nutella, bananas, and vanilla ice cream with my bf. I like my crepes crunchy and they had the perfect crunchy texture :)
One of my friends also got the honeydew egg puffs which were surprisingly good!

Genki's is also a mini grocery store for Asian snacks and goodies so it was fun to walk around and pass the time. They have a few benches for sitting but I do wish they had tables and chairs so we can sit down and enjoy our desserts. 

It's street parking only so it might be difficult to park during busy hours but we lucked out and found metered parking across the street. I had a fun first visit and I'll be back for sure! :)
author: Marianne E.

description:
When you're craving an ice cream crepe look no further.

Fresh, crisp, and yummy. Hits the spot. I like the #2.. the green tea ice cream, with nutella, and strawberry and whipped cream.

I haven't tried the other ones they have but they all look really good.
author: Jessica S.

description: I love Genki Crepes! They have so many options for dessert and crepe toppings. The crepes are so crispy and filling. They also sell the spicy noodle challenge noodles here, I think it's $7 for the 5 pack! Their snack selection is also amazing. They also sell Ramune, the marble soda. Below is the green tea ice cream with red bean paste. #2 on the menu. Comes with whip but I opted out. Genki Crepes is a classic in the Richmond District and will be treasured forever!
author: Caitlyn S.

description: Getting crepes here is always a must when I'm in SF!! It's usually not busy and they're super quick about making the crepes. While you wait for your snacks you can shop around the store! Their crepes are always crispy and yummy.
author: Ha T.

description:
I'm a dessert crepe kind of girl, so that's all I've tried at Genki Crepes! This place definitely gets busy at night, so expect a 10+ minute wait if you're looking for a sweet treat after dinner. 

I've tried #2 green tea ice cream with lychee & #6 mango ice cream with strawberries. Both are pretty good in their own ways, so I'd recommend going with whatever flavor ice cream and fruit you like! The crepe itself is perfectly crispy when you first get it. About 5-10 minutes later, the ice cream starts melting and the crepe starts to get soggy and softer, which made me not want to eat the crepe anymore. Also, I typically don't like whipped cream much either, but their freshly made whipped cream is pretty good! 

*BRING CASH* if you come here! They do take card but with a $10 minimum, and a single crepe costs about $6-7. It's nice that this place is a mini mart too, so you can pick up a few drinks or snacks to reach the minimum. But I'd rather come with cash and not spend the extra money on an unneeded snack. 

Street parking around here is limited but not impossible to find. And there's really not much room to sit and hangout while enjoying your crepes here. But overall, this is still a decent crepe place!
author: Alison Y.

description: Ordered the sweet crepe (Strawberry, banana with nutella) this time around and it was pretty good. It was light and crispy. It only got soggy at the bottom with all the nutella. I usually order crepe with ice cream but without ice cream is a lot easier to eat! I wouldn't mind coming back if I was in the area again.  There's benches for you to sit and it's a mini supermarket (stuff you find in Japan).
author: Sherry Y.

description:
One of the better crepe places in SF. Their crepes are well sized and very crispy. They wrap it so there are 3 layers around your fillings. 

They have a good variety of fillings, but I tried green tea ice cream with red bean. Definitely tasted like an Asian dessert.

The set up is strange since it's also a mini Asian convenience store. There is a bit of a wait since a lot of people flock here after dinner. 

Food: 4.5/5
Value: 4/5
Service: 3.75/5
Overall: 4.5/5
author: Brian G.

description:
You can NEVER go wrong with crepes here. It's the best and I don't think you can beat the price either. For $5.30, it's literally heaven in a paper cone. They have a variety of ice cream options such as mango, red bean, green tea, vanilla, lychee, mango, and etc. You can get it topped with fresh fruits (even tropical ones like lychee and mango). If you want to do the whole shabang, you can add whipped cream and nutella. 

The batter of the crepe itself is what's really good. It's soft and chewy but also very crispy on the outside. Scoop some ice cream and take a bite of the crepe and it's just amazing. I decided to try their lychee ice cream today and it was just divine. I enjoyed the creaminess as well as the strong lychee flavor. Not many places serve lychee ice cream, so it's pretty unique that they have it here. 

Located inside a mini market right by a strip of restaurants and bars, I think it's the perfect spot for an after dinner/late night dessert. The workers are also really friendly and service is quick. If I'm ever in the area, I always make it a point to stop by.
author: Thy B.

description: I've been coming to Genki as long as I can remember, I love their crepes ! I love how their crepes are crispy and hot , yummmm! They also have every snack you can imagine and cosmetic stuff too ! They take credit cards with $10 purchase ! Best strawberry Nutella crepe in SF
author: Monica M.

description: Have a sweet tooth? Well this little hole in the wall has me visiting every time I'm in SF! The Nutella crepes are delicious! I always add ice cream, strawberries and cream, but go wild! There's so many delicious styles to choose from...
author: Kaity K.

description: I love Genki's! The crepes are delicious! The options for different crepes are damn near endless lol.. you can choose between a good amount of sweet and savory crepes! I preferably like my crepes sweet, so I also go with #24! Strawberry, Nutella and whip cream! If you get the chance, you got to stop by!
author: Va D.

description: The egg puffs in this place are the best I had so far living in San Francisco! Definitely recommend trying out the combo with some delicious milk tea :) enjoy !
author: Karim C.

description: I love this place. My favorite is #26 - blueberry cheesecake with ice cream crepe. Their imported merchandise is also top notch.
author: Angela M.

description:
was craving chocolate ice cream and got exactly what I wanted

the crepe was okay 

inside they sell lots of yummy snacks 

they also have a restroom if you ask nicely 

was easy to find parking outside
author: Marlena L.

description:
Cheap + delicious + great service.

Sweet crepes are approximately $5-7 and not only is the crepe itself very moist and sweet, they are also packed to the brim with toppings + whip cream upon request! Staff is very friendly as well.
author: Jackie Z.

description:
Cheap and delicious! hidden gem, inside a store. 

Order
-Nutella with vanilla ice cream 
-Nutella with Green tea ice cream (crepe was nice an d crispy! good balance of ice cream to crepe. Even with one and a half scoop ice cream, which at the time didn't seem much. )

Seating, there are benches by the entrance of the grocery store.
author: Sochietta K.

description:
I had crepe from this place 6 years ago on my first trip to SF and had it again just this past weekend and the taste was the same consistently amazing. The crepe is crispy surrounded ice cream and fruits of your choice. I got the vanilla ice cream and strawberry without any whipped cream. Everything all together tasted so good, not super sweet. This crepe place is also a mini mart that sells a lot of Asian snacks. The minimart seems really busy with constant customers late at night. 

Overall
Taste 5/5
Service 4/5 the crepe came out super fast
Parking 4/5 on the street
Price 5/5 worth it for the price
author: Thanasri T.

description: Best part about this place is that it's open late, so I can swing by after a late dinner and buy some bomb snacks and dessert. There's often a wait for the crepes and desserts, but it's not usually too long before you get your number called. Would definitely recommend the lychee ice cream with custard crepe if you're indecisive of what to choose!
author: Amanda L.

description:
Been to SF every year for the last 6 years and am sad I haven't tried this place before! The place is located inside of a small Asian market. Parking can be difficult because only street/metered parking is available. Be prepared to circle around for a little before being able to find parking (giving 1 less star for this). 

At first, I thought this place was overhyped, but after trying it, it definitely lives up to it! Not what you would imagine traditional crepes to be since this one comes super crispy & wrapped around an ice cream flavor of your choice + 1 free topping. I got the vanilla ice cream with strawberries which is so basic but honestly, paired really well with the crepe. The combination of the subtle sweetness of the vanilla ice cream, tartiness of the strawberries, & crunch/texture from the crepe is heavenly. My friend got the green tea w/ cheesecake bites which was really good as well! The cheesecake bites were actually decently-sized. They accept card but only for minimum purchases of $10. Service is quick & staff was very friendly. Overall, a great place - would definitely return!
author: Angela P.

description: I love matcha and I like the matcha ice cream here. Matcha ice cream is not super sweet like other places and you can actually taste the flavor. However, red bean paste is too sweet for me. I want to try the sesame egg puff too but since they don't combine it with ice cream, I just ordered matcha in a cone.
author: Giang N.

description: Wow this place has everything you could need, from crepes and bubble waffles, to a small convenience store filled with Asian snacks, goodies, and toys. The crepe we got was strawberry with red bean ice cream and whipped cream. The crepes are so crispy and crunchy and keeping its shape even with the wet filling. The pricing is reasonable 4-7 dollars depending on the filling of the crepe and if you get ice cream to not. And the bubble waffles (egg puffs) are also delicious. The convenience store is small but carries very interesting finds. It was so packed even on a Monday night.
author: Ellen G.

description: One of my favorite spots! It's so yummy here and it's always packed every time. Fresh fruits, Nutella, whip cream and whatever else you wanna add. Would literally drive an hour just to have their crepe! Yum yum
author: Jeannette C.

description:
The crepes here are incredible. The batter is made fresh and the crepe is light, fluffy, and has just the right amount of crisp without it feeling like a chip. This is my go-to place for crepes in SF (they're open late!)

I have a major sweet tooth so I always opt for a fruity one. I've tried their nutella/strawberry crepe and most recently their mango ice cream with freshly sliced strawberries. Both are SO on-point. I prefer the ice cream crepe just because the hot crepe melts the ice cream a bit and absorbs the ice cream.

My roommates ordered the savory turkey avocado jack crepe and they absolutely loved it as well! Every time we come, we just keep talking about when we plan to come back.
author: Andrea K.

description:
This was my first time trying crepes in Norcal and hands down, it has to be one of my top 3 favorite crepe places in California! 

Genki crepes is located inside a mini market and smells absolutely delicious from a mile away. They have a wide selection of crepes on their menu and it's very affordable. My friend and I shared a crepe because we were too full from dinner. We got the crepe with strawberries, bananas, mangos, nutella, and whipped cream. Right when we took a bite, we had a ratatouille moment. The crepes shell was so thin and crunchy! LOVED how thin the fruits are. 

After one bite, you'll keep wanting more! Everything melts in your mouth and tastes amazing. It's sweet and I would come back again. 

10/10 definitely would recommend!
author: Julie V.

description: I can't believe they don't have 5 stars! Just wait til you try this place. Let the 5 star reviews speak for themselves.. this is a must try in San Francisco. I had the peanut butter and bananas and of course had to add Nutella. It was delicious. Great stuff to check out in the mini mart, definitely stop by... I think it's worth going out of the way for!
author: Megan S.

description:
I had the green tea ice cream crepe with red bean paste and whipped cream. I was hesitant about eating this thing so close to my bedtime but it ended up being so worth it! The crepe was quite big but gone so fast. And the ice cream was amazing. I was surprised how rich it was with matcha flavor. I'm obsessed! I did find that overall the crepe was a little too sweet for me. I would have it with water or tea the next time around. 

It was also fun watching the crepe being made on the spot. I did wish that they scooped the ice cream later though instead of leaving the scoop of ice cream on the counter while prepping other ingredients. It was a sticky, drippy mess at the end when I peeled away the paper wrapping to get at that last bit. I thought I was gobbling it up pretty fast. My caution to you is to be wary of melting and have napkins on hand!
author: Lauren H.

description:
Love = ice cream crepes. I've been here a few times now, basically every chance I get to be in San Francisco! My favorite crepe is the green tea ice cream crepe with nutella. I've never had anything quite like this -- even at similar places in other cities! 

This crepe operation is small but efficient. People line up to pay inside this mini-mart along with others buying groceries and small items. I haven't ever had to wait more than 10 minutes before I have a delicious dessert at my disposal. Oddly enough my uncle who lives nearby was  the first to introduce me to this spot. He and my aunt used to live around the corner and it was a shopfront I passed by many times as a child when visiting. I'm not sure when they converted the front into a creperie but it was a great decision! Can't wait to return for more next time i'm around!
author: Tammy Y.

description: Omg! Why does this place have to be so far from me! I guess that's a good thing or else I would dessert here all the damn time. The crepes are so crispy and airy and perfect! Give me more!
author: Mizzie C.

description: Bomb [dot] com... Crepes were crispy, hot, and the portion was huuuge! Also open late, so that's a plus for my night owl self. I fw this place heavy, I'll be back for you my love
author: Khanh D.

description: Tried their egg puff for the first time. It was served HOT and crispy! It tasted super delicious. Try the coconut one. I enjoyed that.
author: Tammy C.

description:
Clement has so many good places to try. We wanted crepes and this place seemed decent. When you go in, it's a regular convenience store. They just decided to make crepes I guess. 

We ordered 4 mixed fruit crepes. We are more into sweet crepes than savory. We also ordered one mango smoothie.  It took longer than I expected. When done, they put them into little white boxes. 

When we started to eat, they were amazing. I liked them with Nutella better than the ones without. I wish they had more fruit though, but how much can you really pack in there though. 

Overall, great place for a quick crepe. But these crepes are not like the traditional fork and knife crepes.
author: Abu N.

description:
Awesome crepes, and conveniently located for dessert if you finish eating dinner at any of the plethora of restaurants in the Richmond district. There's no real seating because they're a mini-mart, but they do have a couple of benches to eat on if it isn't too crowded. 

A personal favorite is the #2 crepe with green tea ice cream and lychees topped with whipped cream. But I think its safe to assume all their crepes are delicious. They're a little skimpy with the fruits on the crepes, and it's a $10 minimum if you want to use credit, but those are the only two cons I could think of. Definitely consider dropping by this place for dessert!
author: Anderson H.

description: Always love Genki Crepe. I got my usual, the chicken and sweet-chili sauce crepe..as well as the smoked salmon and cream cheese crepe...and ended it with the blueberry sauce cheesecake crepe. It was all very delicious, but it's definitely a lot flatter than it used to be.
author: Adrienne L.

description:
2nd attempt - 
Dec. 16th 
Evening

Came back just to grab some egg puffs !! 

Taste: Custard, waffle like puffs that are warm. Not as sweet as I was expecting it to be... not bad not great. Just meh.
author: Jessica L.

description:
I got the chocolate cake crepe with whipped cream and hershey (number 27) and I really enjoyed it. They had little pieces of chocolate cake/brownies in the crepe and it was amazing. They have a huge variety of crepes going from sweet to savory to ice cream cakes. 

Make sure to have cash with you because they do not take credit/debit card for any transactions under $10. That was one thing I did not know about but luckily I had a little bit of cash. 

The interior looks exactly like a mini mart. At the front they make crepes where the register is and towards the back, they have some groceries and candy. If you order a crepe, just keep in mind that there is not much seating here so if it gets crowded, you might have to take your crepe to go. Overall, this is definitely a place I recommend.
author: Karishma K.

description: Love this place! Been going here since I was younger with my parents. My entire family loves to come here after being near the SFO airport. Amazing tasting crepes, can never find a crepe to top theirs! They're not too pricey either, like $7 a crepe I think, pretty large serving. On top of that they have a cute little market inside full of Asian goodies that might not be found elsewhere. Customer service isn't very personal but I've never had an issue with them. They get their jobs done.
author: Jasmine A.

description:
Absolutely love this place! Best crepe place in the city! It gets extremely packed in the weekends specially at night time but the service goes by fast. Out absolute favorites are:
* sebastians special: number six: mix fruits with mango ice cream, chocolate and caramel syrup, and whip cream. It's Nutella free for those who are allergic to nuts. 
*Valentina's special: number one: with banana, strawberry, mango, Nutella, lychee ice cream, whip cream. 

TRY THEM OUT!!!!!
author: Tina B.

description: I remember enjoying the crepes once upon a time. This go-round I tried the waffle stuffed with red bean.  The red bean was non-existent but they up charged for that.  boo!  The waffle itself tasted like the crepe and I was expecting chewy bubbles so it was a bit of a let down.  I will definitely need a redo of the crepe next time.
author: Cindy S.

description:
What a great find! My sweetheart brought me here to try their ice cream filled crepes, and it sure didn't disappoint. We ordered the green tea Ice cream with red bean paste, plus splurged on another order of egg puff (as a salute to my childhood, cuz I grew up eating egg puffs). I was pleasant surprised by the green tea ice cream! I could really taste the green tea, and that went really well with the red bean paste. The crepe on the outside was cooked very well with a bit of crunch. 

The egg puff was a perfect rendition of the egg puff of my childhood; crunchy outside and soft on the inside. Next time I'm going to try the red bean filled egg puff. I can't want to come back and sample more stuff!
author: Mei W.

description:
Delicious dessert place! If you're looking for a quick fix, this is the place to go! There's aren't any tables in there but there are some benches inside & outside, that were pretty full on a Saturday night. It's street parking so it can be a little difficult. 

I tried the crepe #2, which was green tea ice cream with red bean paste and whipped cream. It was yummy and had a great portion size. I also tried the original egg puffs and they were delicious!! They were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Even though I was so full, I kept wanting to eat more. 

The service was incredibly friendly and they were quick to make everything. While we were waiting, we just walked around the store because there are many snacks from Asia :) I highly recommend coming here for some quick dessert- definitely try the egg puffs!
author: Letty H.

description: A friend took me a here my first time! Since then whenever I've been here a couple of times! Small little mart with a crepe place! I tend to go here late nights when it doesn't get too crowed to find street parking. Summer nights a line can always form randomly! Doesn't matter if it's a week night or a weekend! Great ice cream portion size and the fruit you choose seems to always be sweet! They seem to know what they're doing! Because it still one of the best places you can get a dessert crepe! While you wait you can even shop around for other snacks!
author: Maricris C.

description: After dinner at China First, I decided to grab some dessert next door. I got the Nutella and banana crepe with vanilla ice cream. The presentation was really nice, but looks can be deceiving because the crepe was only decent. It was crunchy and I like mine a bit more soft. It was cheap and the ice cream was a nice addition, though! Pretty convenient if you're having lunch/dinner nearby as well!
author: Kelsey N.

description:
Delicious on the go crepes!

Unlike plated crepes, these ones are served wrapped in paper so you can be on your merry way, to walk around, eat, talk, and enjoy the weather. 

*Elbow rub- great spot to take a date for desert if the dinner or lunch before went good hahahaha this place will definitely get you some points.

My favorite is the strawberry and whip cream ! Simplicity hits the spot.
author: Leonora S.

description: There are more and more crepes places in SF nowadays but Genki is still one of the best in my opinion. Been coming here for years now and the place may have gotten more older and worn, but the crepes are just as delicious as it has always been. My go to crepe is the strawberry, nutella, crepe with your choice of ice cream. The place sells also boba, japanese snacks, drinks, and japanese action figures. Heads up, there's a minimum of $10 to use your credit card. Definitely recommended!
author: Jeanette Q.

description:
Our group got the following: milk tea, lychee ice cream, mango tea with boba, almond milk tea with boba, mochi, and some Asian snacks.  Everyone enjoyed their treats. The person with the milk tea wasn't blown away, but the prices for tea are so reasonable! I saw a ton of the crepes ordered and they look amazing! I want to return to try one! 

This is a small market with a counter to order from but no tables and chairs. There is a long bench that you might get to sit on, but otherwise plan to stand or walk with your dessert because they're pretty busy in the evening.
author: Susan G.

description: Solid 4 stars...tonight I had a chocolate craving so after dinner my honey and I were scrolling on clement and it hit me...I wanted chocolate and ice cream lol, so that's exactly what I got #8 ice cream crepe with whip cream and strawberries, my honey got the same thing minus the ice cream and strawberries...it definitely hit the spot
author: jonathan h.

description: After a late dinner....you want a late dessert. The perfect blend of Asian candies, snacks and treats all nestled into a creperie.......yes please  A friend brought us here.....you could smell the sweetness in the air walking in. Ice cream crepes, sweet and savory ones. Egg puffs, ice cream, juice blends and rows of Pocky, gummies, snack mixes, pastry buns and refrigerated items to cure any craving! Standing there drooling watching the hand make the crepes and then fill them with scoops of ice cream, fresh fruits and sugars. Holy Moly this is next level! They serve them in a perfect TO GO hand held wrapper....no mess! Genius....pure Genius!!! Thank You for topping off an already spectacular evening! See you soon!
author: Maea B.

description:
Went here because that was our only option late at night. It's a mini mart that sells lots of random stuff (in true Asian market style). You can get skin bleaching cream, a colander, a large bath sponge, Japanese candy, a fruit cup, ramen noodles, fried mushrooms, and dish soap ALL in this tiny little store. 

That aside, everybody in the world is standing in line here for crepes or ice cream. Line moves fast. There are a LOT of options, mostly dessert (strawberries, bananas, Nutella, etc.) But since I was hungry I was the one weirdo that ordered a turkey Swiss crepe. It's served in a paper cone so you can eat informally without utensils. Let's just say value is not an issue here. The thing was enormous, and they put like half a package of turkey in it, and half a block of cheese. I actually couldn't finish it because it was so much cheese. Like, the amount of cheese that would make the average person feel a bit ashamed (or was that because I was eating it in the dark in my car?). Flavor was decent. It's worth it, I see why people love it, I just didn't care for it much. Great for families, dates, friends, or dirty little late night cravings by yourself.
author: Annie M.

description:
Best crepes. Period. I always come through when I'm in the area.

They're also a grocery store full of snacks. So if you're munching, this place is it.
author: Arris B.

description: I love their crepes! Especially with nutella, fruits, and ice-cream.they have a big selection of asian snacks. Hate their long lines in the evening, cashiers that dont speak english and the overall wait time(:
author: Kate K.

description:
My friends and I were craving some dessert and decided on this place (since it was one of the few places open late at night). An Asian (Japanese?) convenience store w tons of candy/appliances and of course crepes! 

Peanut Butter + Banana Crepe ($4.95): Based on reviews I was real pumped! Except I really wasn't that impressed w this crepe but I'm thinking maybe I ordered the wrong thing lol. Not enough PB for my liking but what I really wasn't liking was the crepe itself. I'm not used to crepes being thin and crunchy but rather soft and fluffy. Didn't really satisfy my dessert craving to be honest.

May or may not try another crepe the next time I visit SF, we shall see. Check it out for yourself (:
author: Debra C.

description: OMMMMMGGGG! Had one last night and I can't stop thinking about it now! The crepes have the perfect crunch, it doesn't matter what's inside. MUST MUST MUST!!!!
author: Kryssy T.

description:
I've been here twice now and haven't failed either time.

Most recently, I came here and ordered a mixed fruit (mango, strawberries, and banana) + nutella crepe. So delicious! It was warm and served quickly! The crepe also has a bit of a crisp to it, which is nice. Just the edges. Wish it wasn't so far, but that's probably better because I would want to eat them everyday. There's also a couple benches in the store and a heated lamp in the entrance to keep people warm who are sitting on the bench near the door. 

Just a note though, they don't take credit card unless it's over $10.
author: Julie L.

description:
This placed is another hidden gem in the city. I first heard about this place from my friend and I had to try it! 

I walked in here and it was a Asian grocery store with the crepe area where you order your crepe. It's small inside, a long bench sits against the wall, and you pay when you order. They have all types of Asian goodies! I was so surprised that they had my green tea KitKats! All types of imported chocolates, drinks, and food! I loved it!

I ordered a nutella, banana, strawberry crepe and it was everything! Crepe was warm, fruits were fresh, and nutella was delicious!!! My family and friends sat and ate our crepes there and we loved it!

This spot gets busy, but the wait is worth it! Visit this place if you're not too far from the Sunset district! 

5/5!
author: Caressa Q.

description: I LOVE this place! My favorite crepe spot ever. Parking can be a little hard depending what time you go since it's just street parking. The market is really small but there's never been much of a line anytime I come. I always get a crepe with lychee ice cream, nutella, and strawberries. This place never disappoints! Love the crispy, soft crepes.
author: Tracey N.

description:
Overall: Friendly staff with short wait times and fresh ingredients, free street parking available after 6pm.

Food: We got the banana, whipped cream, and nutella crepes and it was incredibly satisfying and light. They whip the heavy cream to make fresh whipped cream, none of that Reddiwhip. There was a good balance of crispiness from the thin crepes and the chewy inside bits.
author: Jenny Q.

description:
Crepes! I've been coming here for the past few years whenever the craving strikes, and Genki's always hits the spot.

Choose from the premade ones or customize your own. I usually choose a premade one, but yesterday I made my own, and it was SO good. 

Choices of icecream: mango, vanilla , green tea, chocolate 

Top with fruit: strawberries, bananas 

Other: Nutella on your crepe, whipped cream, cheesecake , blue berry syrup

They also sell egg puffs and other Asian snacks in the store so you can look around while waiting. The line does get long after dinner time.
author: Corinna T.

description:
My go-to Asian crepe place in SF!! I've tried pretty much all the other ones (belly good, Sophie's, crepe temptations, etc.) and this one is my favorite! Genki serves crepes with a crunchier shell which I prefer over the soft/mushy ones. 

I always get a crepe w/ green tea ice cream, bananas, Nutella (complimentary whip cream!) 

There's always a line around 9pm no matter what day of the week it is. The wait might take a while but it is so worth it! They open late too!
author: Nancy C.

description:
This place never lets you down.
Small
Affordable 
Quick turnaround on your order
And always delicious
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Where is that smell coming from?  That delicious smell of crispy crepes?  Oh it's in this little convenience store?  Really?  Oh yes.  They have a wide variety of crepes sweet and savory that you can hold in one and and eat on the go.  They're made to order and hot when you get them.  I got a sweet one with iced cream, bananas, Nutella, and whipped cream.  So indulgent but so worth it.  
The store is fun too.  They have a bunch of that cute Asian novelty candy that I stocked up on for the kids.  This was a great find!
author: Kristina G.

description: This is my favorite place to get crepes ever which sucks because it's so far away from home. I love the endless flavor combinations on the menu, the authenticity, the efficient service, and of course, the quart of their crepes. Highly recommend!
author: Khloe L.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a kid.

The crepes here are BOMB, BOMB, and BOMB. If you're ever sitting at home and realize how much you love yourself and wanna treat yourself to something, you'll probably end up here. Your body is a temple and it deserves a weekly crepe cooked to perfection filled with nutella, strawberries, bananas, or various other fruits and topped with a generous scoop of ice cream of your choice :-)

This place gets pretty crowded at night but you never have to wait more than 10 mins to put in your order. Also while you wait can you check out their various Japanese snacks and beauty products. I often find myself coming for a crepe but leaving with a crepe in one hand and a bag full of Japanese snacks and drinks in the other. 

They only accept cash for orders less than $10 which is why you should just buy a basketful of snacks.
author: Courtni W.

description:
One of my favorite crepe places in San Francisco! I'm already drooling over the thought of it right now. 

Two of my friends and I got the crepes while my other friend got the egg puffs. My crepe consisted of matcha ice cream (always my go-to), lychee, and whip cream. They have their crepes on lock - it is light, soft, a little chewy but still has a crunch to it. My ideal crepe for sure! I also had a few egg puff pieces from my friend. You can't go wrong with that choice either. So, sooo good! 

Always worth the trip to Inner Richmond for this.
author: Emily M.

description:
I've been coming here years and I don't know why the server was so rude. 

I order two single scoops. Lady gives it to me in a single cup. I clarified to her and she took the small plastic cup and slammed it down on the counter and rolled her eyes at me. I couldn't believe what i was seeing. My date is a mild mannered guy and even he went wtf. Mexican guy who has been there forever, thank you for always making my crepes and eggettes the best they can ever taste for me. You have always been solid. This lady is a piece of work.
author: Stacey T.

description:
Found this place while waiting for our table at Burma Superstar and with hungry eyes we couldn't say no. 

Nestled inside an Asian ultra mini mart. We ordered #6 crepe + vanilla ice cream + chocolate cake. Which I thought was yummy brownies on Yelp photos. And the description for #6 literally read 'chocolate cake.' This is where it might get racist but I thought it was an Asian way of saying yummy brownie, haha. Don't make my mistake because instead it tasted like nasty-chalky-supposed-chocolate-cake. I've had better box of cake. & the vanilla ice cream was so vanilla, ugh. 


Maybe it was our choice of flavor. But I'm not a Nutella kind of person. Yes, I said it. And I don't like whip cream (I might lose some Yelp friends over this). So our options weren't many. 

Def not worth the hype or money. I didn't even finish it. That says a lot coming from a fattie.. 

P.S. I'm also Asian. Non-racist asian. Just probably craving brownies baaaad.
author: Grace L.

description: Cute little market on the less busy side of clement (beginning, close to arguello). It's a market in the back with standard groceries (mostly packaged) and some refrigerated stuff. At the front, they make crepes and bubble teas and smoothies, etc. I came in after dinner around 8pm to get something sweet and decided to get the sesame egg puffs or eggies. It took maybe 5 minutes and the Effie's were warm, crispy, and not too sweet which I like! The dough was a little more dense than I would prefer, but otherwise I enjoyed the little treat! Will have to go back  and try some other things next time I'm around the area. Fair prices and friendly service!
author: Nerissa C.

description: The crepes and egg puffs are made to order so it's always fresh. While waiting for your order, you can shop around the store for snacks. I ordered a crepe with Nutella, banana and vanilla ice cream. The crepe itself tasted mediocre and definitely better than the egg puffs. The egg puffs was crunchy and fresh; however, it was lacking in taste. The coconut bubble tea tasted alright and was stronger than the average bubble tea.
author: Susan L.

description:
This little mom and pop mini mart has not only a great selection of snacks, but a reasonably priced crepe bar that is to die for. There are countless options for both savory and sweet crepes, with modifications available for all and a ton of ice cream flavors to choose from. I ordered the apple & cinnamon & whipped cream and opted to add on vanilla ice cream. The crepe itself has this amazing texture that's both chewy and has a little crunch and the combination of all the flavors was like a better version of a fresh apple pie. 

There is only one bench by the entrance but because it is located in between a cluster of bars and restaurants, you have the option of finding other seating or just wandering around while eating, as I did. Make sure you grab a fork and napkins and don't let the ice cream melt all over you (even though I would say it's worth it).
author: Breanne B.

description: My favorite place for Japanese crepes. Definitely the best in the city, if not the best I've had in the country. Conveniently located right across the street from Burma Superstar, Koja Kitchen and a ton of other restaurants, it's a great post dinner dessert spot. You can't miss it (just sniff, you can't miss the amazing smell). I really love the crispy crepe (so much better than Sophie's in Japantown), and generous serving of Nutella. It's also a small grocery store with Japanese candies, snacks, ramen, drinks and toys. Fun to browse while you wait for your crepe. This is a must try!
author: Sally C.

description:
Eh.. Wasn't to thrilled about my sweet crepe. I got a crepe with chocolate ice cream, whipped cream, and bananas.

The ice cream taste like it's been in the freezer for years. My chocolate ice cream taste more like freezer burn rather than chocolate. I got 3 slices of banana and 2 small dollops of whipped cream in an overly baked crepe. 

Paid $6.70 when the menu said $5.70. I guess they add $1.00 tip.
author: Darlene M.

description:
My girlfriend and I decided to try out this place since we were in the area and I've heard so many good things about it. 

Right when we walked into the market we saw their crepe menu which is quite large. Although they had savory crepes and snack crepes, we both knew we wanted the ice cream crepes. They have some unique ice cream flavors which include mango, green tea, red bean, lychee, vanilla, chocolate, honeydew, etc. We ordered the #6 (Mango Ice cream + strawberries + whipped cream) which came with a generous scoop of ice cream. You can see them make the crepe fresh right in front of you which is cool too. The entire thing was pretty worth it for about $6, I just wish they added more sliced fruits so there would be enough for every bite of ice cream. Definitely a fan and would recommend if you're in the area.
author: Ryan J.

description:
The black sesame egg puffs are so good!!! As are the regular egg puffs

Their crepes have a very crisp texture to them, which I like.
author: Melody Y.

description: Very good place for dessert. The men are very happy and positive keeping the vibe nice. But the cashier was very rude and seemed liked we shouldn't be there.
author: Dennis M.

description: Strawberry, banana with Nutella and whip cream was delicious. This is a must visit for me when I'm in the city. It's inside a little mini mart where I love to get some snacks and new candies.
author: Chinh L.

description: I love their crepe and I come to buy it almost every week. But I hate to say that, I bought one tonight and I found a hair in the crepe. I thought that is mine but it is in the fruit and cream. And I've already eaten a few bites. So disgusting...
author: Chloe Z.

description: The crepes are delicious, especially if you add nutella.  The egg puffs are always cooked to perfection.  I've been here 3 times now and will definitely come back.
author: Priscilla S.

description:
Don't be fooled when you see two Mexican guys making Japanese crepes in a mini mart. It's legit ok. 

My roommate and I were on a diet. Then we walked into Genki and that all went down the drain. 

The crepe batter itself tastes like a soft version of a fortune cookie. It's made thin and crispy and then folded with all your favorite fillings inside. 

Chocolate Cheesecake: Oh boy. Where do I even begin with this. They literally cut up a slice of cheesecake and stuff it into your crepe. Then top it off with a giant scoop of chocolate ice cream. And squirt whipped cream all over that. 


Tip: This place easily gets packed so try going during rare hours like during a weeknight.
author: Jen P.

description:
We were in the Richmond district for dinner, and our friend suggested we go to one of his favorite crepe places in the area for dessert! I'm always down for dessert so I was quite excited to try it! I didn't quite know what to expect when we arrived at what appeared to be a small convenience store/supermarket but from the long line that was formed inside, I could tell it was definitely a local hot spot! 

The store sells lots of Japanese/Asian snacks and miscellaneous things like beauty products and cute Pop! figures etc. It was fun to browse them while you're in line! The smell of the freshly made crepes was very distracting though, and I spent most of my time trying to choose the type of crepe I wanted! They have sweet ice cream crepes, savory crepes, and snack crepes. Our group tried their ice cream crepes, which are available in pre-fixed fruit and ice cream combinations and customizable. Friends had the red bean ice cream crepe with banana, and the vanilla ice cream crepe with Nutella and banana. 

I had a strawberry ice cream crepe with Nutella and banana (I'm a sucker for Neapolitan haha) and it was just AMAZING. Way better than I could have ever expected and I was blown away by how much I enjoyed it! The crepe was made fresh and it hot and crunchy! It's a different texture than the pancake-y thin and flimsy crepes that I'm used to. I definitely preferred this one more! The ice cream, Nutella and banana is a classic combination and the flavors were wonderful--I was so greedy I almost wanted to order another one! 

Instead, we got some of their freshly made eggins instead, which are a Hong Kong snack that I adore (a bit similar to a waffle). I haven't had the opportunity to find a good place down here in Orange County that makes it, and seeing it on the menu made me so excited! I just got the original vanilla flavor, and it was perfect. It was made to order, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside--perfect in every way. 

If you're lucky enough to live in the area, or the SF Bay Area in general, do come and give this place a try. You won't regret it! ;)
author: Krystyl C.

description:
Crepes and egg puff here are solid and well worth the trip! For crepe, typically just get something simple like vanilla ice cream and strawberries. Its not as crazy as the ones in J-town mall, but quality feels overall better to me.. and they are open late!

For egg puff, my go to is the red bean. Really solid crispy on the outside, nice and soft on the inside. Better than any other egg puff in the city, hands down!
author: James S.

description:
Took my dad here and he liked it too! I ordered the lychee crepe. It came with lychee ice cream, condensed milk, and whipped cream. I was most impressed with the lychee ice cream. It was delicious and actually tasted like lychee, not fake or processed at all. Also their crepes are crispy, which goes well with the ice cream.

Crepes are made to order, and made fairly quickly. We waited about 5 minutes for ours.

There's an extensive menu, with other fruit related options, chocolate options, and even savory options too.

Also notable, Genki is inside of an asian supermarket/small store. So don't get confused when you finally stumble across it!
author: Julie L.

description:
Genki's really hits the spot for all my crepe cravings. I've been going here since middle school and I'm happy to see that this place hasn't changed. It's part crepe shop and part Japanese mart so you can get your Pocky, your Ramune drinks, and random Japanese knick knacks here as you wait for your crepe. 

The crepes here holds together very well. They aren't too crispy to the point that it breaks and crumbles easily and they aren't super soft where it gets soggy from the ice cream. It's the perfect balance of crispy and soft and the ice cream just sits perfectly in the center and never really causes too much of a mess since the crepe holds it all in.

Can't go wrong with the dessert crepes, especially when it's ice cream dessert crepes! I haven't tried their savory crepes so I can't comment on those. I think their egg puffs might be worth a try too since they have a lot of different flavors to choose from such as blueberry and sesame. 

There seems to always be people here no matter what time or day I come but it never gets too crowded. I think the fact that it is part mini mart means that there is no tables to sit at so no reason for people to overstay their visit too long. There is a long bench by the wall that you can sit on to eat your crepe but that's about it. 

Credit card minimum is $10. They have hand sanitizer to the left side of the ice cream display if you ended up getting ice cream on your hands.
author: Diana C.

description:
I can always rely on Genki to be open and to satisfy my sweet tooth. This place is always busy, especially on weekends so you have to bring your patience because this place is tiny. 

They specialize in crunchier hand-held savory and sweet crepes that are perfect for walking around the Inner Richmond neighborhood if you wanna "walk it off". I always order a strawberry and nutella crepe which runs around $6, while my boyfriend grabs the crepes that are filled with ice cream, nutella, and fresh whipped cream. 

It's a great after dinner treat! Bring cash because I believe they charge for credit cards unless your purchase is over $10, something like that. Also the parking here is getting worse and worse so pray to the parking gods over here so you can grab a crepe.
author: Stefanie S.

description:
These crepes are mobile! What sets them a part from your regular crepe shop is how Genki embraces the whole to-go concept. Crepes are usually a "sit down" type of dessert, but not here. Their crepes are given on a paper holder to make it easier for consumers to hold. You can walk with your crepe.. You can run with your crepe.. You can even dance with your crepe. YUM! Open late to satisfy your post-dinner sweet tooth.

Located along Clement which is known for their wide variety of Asian restaurants and markets. My personal favorite is the Nutella with bananas. Sometimes, with vanilla ice cream if I wanna treat myself. 

I like how they add a piece of foil at the bottom of the crepe so it doesn't drip all over your hands. The crepe is crispy on the outside, and soft in the middle after each bite. I usually share, but I'm always a little greedy when it comes to Genki.

***$10 MIN ON CARDS! If you're buying 1 crepe, make sure you have ca$h, or splurge on a 2nd one :)
author: Rachelle Y.

description:
Always come here for a crepe whenever wife gets her haircut.  Very tasty crepe with fresh fruit and a good portion of toppings.  Not very expensive either. 

Although I don't usually buy other stuff, the store offers other small snacks from Japan or Korea.
author: Michael L.

description:
Favorite crepe place in the city. You get the best bang for your buck here, and the crepes themselves are the absolute perfect texture and have the most amazing taste.

The premade combinations on the board are delicious and serve as great inspiration for creating your own crepe - they are very open to customizing your order, and the workers here are super nice and accommodating.

For some reason, my crepe took a little while to make, but my wait was on the longer side and it only took around 5-7 minutes. And oh boy, this crepe was totally worth the wait. I have no idea how they made the crepe skin so thin and crispy... but it was sooooo delicious. I honestly think that the crispy and thin crepe is what makes Genki stand out from other crepe places in SF - I usually don't like eating the excess crepe at the bottom, but at Genki, I gobbled it all up!

Also love that there is a minimart in the back, so during your short wait, you can take a walk around the mart and look at cool snacks and Asian trinkets - it's a great way to pass the short wait time.

Overall, I love the environment of Genki, the kindness and helpfulness of the workers, and the deliciousness of the crepes! I will definitely be back, many more times in the future!
author: Sheila D.

description:
CRAVING egg puffs (~$4.06)?
You've come to the right place. They're pretty fast, but can get crowded. THey have different flavors of egg puffs like red bean, chocolate, nutella, blueberry, etc.
author: Krystle T.

description:
Fast service, perfectly made scrumptious Crepe's filled with a bunch of goodies (perfect portion), and cheap!!! Who doesn't like a yummy treat that is also cheap?! The batter is fluffy with a nice slight crisp of the edges, along with the fluffy whip cream and fresh fruit. Even for a savory crepe, the filling is definitely juicy and cooked nicely. 
When I first came here, i did not expect it to be a small market,with that being said, Genki Crepe's is located within a small market that contains Japanese products and produce, along with yummy snacks!!!
author: Stacey M.

description: Crepes were perfectly made - on the harder side! ~$4 - 7
author: Anna L.

description: Came here on Wednesday around 11pm and still a lot of people! It has a creperie inside a mini grocery store with very decilous crepes and hong kong style egg puff. The price is very reasonable and service is fast, the egg puff is pretty good compared to its price.
author: Emily H.

description: I was never much of a dessert person but this place was spot on! I've been here multiple times and have left with a satisfying tummy. I love how this place has a little market with a bunch of Asian stuff. The people that make the crepes are always so nice and do their best to be as fast with making our orders. This place will always be busy so do expect to wait in line. The only downfall to this place is they need more seating to accommodate the constant traffic. I'm drooling over all the pics now.
author: Ashley P.

description: We got no.2 it came with red bean paste and green tea ice-cream also no.7 (Cheesecake+ Choc Ice-Cream). 2.5/5 The taste was not interesting and too sweet. For sure cannot bring us back again!
author: V J.

description:
I love crepes.
I decided to give it  a shot after frustrated seeing my favorite crepes place in JTown closed at that day.
After I tried it, I think Genki takes a shorter time to wait and it tastes fresh.
I love the strawberry mango.
Definitely go back when I'm around Clement street.
Otherwise, I'll go to Sophie's still.
It's good though, but Sophie's is still my fav..
author: Candice L.

description:
Came here for some crepes for dessert after dinner. I got the lychee with Nutella and BF got the cheesecake with the blueberry sauce. To be honest, not sure what the hype is about here. Our crepes were just OK, nothing special. I prefer the crepes in Japantown. Maybe it was just the flavors we chose, but if we were to ever come back, I will definitely get something different. The lychees didn't even taste fresh, it tastes like the ones where you can get inside the cans at an Asian supermarket. 

I would like to try the honeydew ice cream though if I were to come back.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Very nice place for a late night dessert  There is a good menu for crepes and pearl tea. The staff was very friendly.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Crepes are the highlight here but take a while (too be honest I dont normally love hard crepes but these are still good particularly with ice cream). I liked their egg puffs and milkshakes as well. I've had boba from them twice, once the banana milk tea was okay (the one from quickly's was better) and tastes like it sounds like. The passion fruit tasted good but was too sweet and the boba balls are hard and subpar but then again that isnt what this iconic middle school hangout is known for

4 stars in total 
2.5 for boba
author: Boba R.

description: GF took me here for the first time and there was a line out the door. This meant we had to wait, but it was worth the wait. Glad she showed me this place, worth every penny.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This review is only based on the egg puff ~~

If you're looking for the perfect egg puff that doesn't get soggy on you over time, where you can actually taste the flavor you ordered, such as honeydew, then you're most definitely in the right place !

The egg puff costs around $4+ tax I believe and is given to you in a paper bag that has holes to let the condensation air out to keep your egg puff crisp and delicious ! Be careful when you're taking it on the go or into your car because of the crumbs if you tilt the bag.

With a crunch packed with flavor in every bite, definitely come here to get your fix of egg puffs/eggettes !

There's also other Asian snacks such as instant noodles, candy, chips, makeup, etc. that you can also purchase!

I'll forsure be coming back when in the area :)
author: Jackie H.

description:
The smell of batter wafting down Clement draws in pedestrians. Genki's offers no frills sweet and savory crepes plus egg puffs and assorted drinks. 

There's also a small but adequate selection of ice cream flavors to choose from.

Genki's crispy crepes are akin to Sophie's, minus their foul attitude. 

I prefer soft, supple crepes like at Belly Good in Japantown but Genki's has something for everyone. 

Even if you're not in the mood for a crepe / HK-style egg puff / milk tea, Genki's is also a mini mart and they have a dizzying selection of Japanese candies to appease your sweet tooth + super kawaii toys and collectible figures. 

Street parking is hit or miss (you know how the Richmond is) and meters must be fed til 6pm daily, except Sunday's.
author: Geminyna J.

description:
5 Stars !!
A friend brought me there, and I tried the Savory crepe : Beef Sukiyaki + Green Onion + Cheese.. It's so bomb !!!  It's not exepensive at all and I would definitely go back there and try some more crepes.
author: Michael T.

description:
My name is Kristal and I've been to Genki Crepes three nights in a row.

I have no regrets. 

Genki Crepes will fulfill your dessert CREPE-vings. The crepes are big, crunchy (not soggy/or too soft), and full of flavor. 

I usually order the dessert crepe with strawberries, nutella, and whipped cream. They are very generous with how much fruit they give you, but the other ingredients don't overpower each other - a perfect balance. 

Quick service and open fairly late! Orders under $10 is cash only. There's a long bench inside, but besides that, not much seating. It's more of a grab and go spot. 

Genki crepes even offers egg puffs, boba, and smoothies. Its mini-mart also sells random asian snacks and drinks. 

A simple, but delicious place. My go-to crepe place in the city!
author: Kristal D.

description:
The crepes here are big and CRUNCHY! Not sure how I feel about a crunchy crepe because I'm so used to eating soft chewy crepe skin. But this was definitely a different experience. 

The taste was like a crunchy waffle, which I really enjoyed. For about $7-$8, you can get a scoop of icecream as well as fresh cut fruits with your crepe. Next time, I'll try an egg puff! 

Pros: 
Lots of street parking nearby. 
Open late! 
Cute little mini mart to check out while you wait for your crepe.
Takes credit card!
author: Sandra N.

description:
The crispy texture of the crepes here is amazing!

No wait on a weekend evening. We shared the green tea ice cream with red bean crepe ($6). It had whipped cream at the top and was so delicious but not overly sweet.

They also have a mini-mart where you can buy some Asian drinks or snacks while you wait for your crepe to be cooked. The minimum credit card purchase is $10 so unless you get more than one crepe you should bring cash.
author: Linda X.

description: Best crepes, at least to me. If you want the chewy kind of crepe you may not enjoy this place, which then I say. You suck. I always get the strawberry banana and Nutella with whip cream. I rarely share with my wife but when I do, I'm not happy about it, but I get over it. It's also mini mart with Asian snacks and drinks. No not boba. Think sprite or coke, but Asian versions.
author: Jake L.

description:
yup we went here again. This time we brought a few friends :)

The line was a lot shorter in the daytime vs. nighttime. I got a crepe with strawberry ice cream  and whip cream, and the other girls got a green tea one with cheesecake bites and a vanilla ice cream with nutella, strawberry and almonds. I also got an order of egg puffs since those things are soo addicting. This place will be part of our normal food places to stop by every time we go to SF.
author: Winnie P.

description:
Go for the egg waffle!

Lots of other stuff too, including crepes, but we went pretty much for egg waffles. And maybe some drinks.
author: Brian W.

description:
Damn Genkiiiiii. You never fail to satisfy my sweets craving. Genki's desserts are good at any time of the day. You can have it for breakfast, lunch, dinner or a late snack. I found this beautiful gem 6 years go. My friends live down the street and they introduced me to Genki and I instantly fell in love right there and then. I have also introduced Genki to my friends and family ever since. 

Their handmade crepes are perfectly made. The texture along with the yummy toppings compliment everything so well. My go-to crepes are the Green tea with cheesecake and mixed fruits with nutella. YUMMMMM
author: Annie D.

description: My go-to crepe place! I love how they are open late. On weekends the line is long and on weekdays, they are short. But you never have to wait longer than 5-10 minutes. They are around $7 each, and so worth it! The market has lots of yummy asian snacks and drinks. Parking is usually easy to find on the street.
author: Jess L.

description:
Don't come here!!! Especially during the weekday evening because you never know if you are going to getting fresh quality. Plus customer service is Sh!t

We come here so much and use to be fans for the sweet and savory crepes and the egg puffs as well. But the quality is so freaking inconsistent!! 
Most weekend morning, when its quiet the food is great. Sometime when its busy, my eggpuffs are way overcooked, or my crepes filling amount is inconsistent, but I never said anything before. 

1 star for the Crappy service. Maybe you had a tough day but don't take it out on the customer!! It you messed up on the order you should fix it without giving an attitude about it and skimp out on the food because you were upset you had to redo it jerk.

0 star for giving us FOOD POISONING from your savory crepes. 
How the heck did that happen?! Was it spoiled to begin with?! Did you forget to refrigerate the cheese?! We didn't have anything else that evening and based on timing it was definitely you. 

It the OWNER is reading this, you need to rethink about your employees' service and skills before you lose all your customer away due to sucky customer service and poor food hygiene.
author: Alice P.

description:
I've been here a handful of times especially when I lived in the avenues.

Cool little market next to the food ordering area. The dessert never disappoints. I've had the Thai tea smoothie with boba. I mean it's not a crazy drink but not many places serve it as a smoothie. Pretty bomb! Also always love their dessert crepes!

Service depends on how many people are there. Sometimes it takes a while. There are benches to eat but wish they had tables...
author: Allison S.

description: They have a lot of different options for your crêpe, which is great. The Crêpe was overdone and ended up being too crunchy. Certainly doesn't come close to a French Crêpe..
author: Sophia A.

description: Crepes are nice and crispy, just how I like them. I had the banana and Nutella one, and there was a good amount of Nutella. However, if you want to customize any of the options it gets expensive because they can't simply modify the set options when they ring you up.
