author: Allison Y.

description: Best crepes I've had in the Bay area. The place is small and the interior decoration is uncommon. However the crepes are on point. Highly recommend if you're in the area
author: Rafeed C.

description:
This place is always busy and there's a good reason for it. Freshly made, high quality crepes! Who would be able to resist? We always get the dessert crepes and they're always delicious! Have not tried the savory crepes so cannot comment on them. The coconut egg puffs are also spot on. It always fun watching them make the crepes as well. The lines may look long but the wait is never outrageous; you can also keep yourself occupied by browsing the interesting little store attached to the crepe area. 

Only disappointment here is that the red bean ice cream tastes like strawberry to my taste buds. 

Definitely check this place out!
author: J P.

description:
There's only one place to go for you late night Crapecapades and that is Genki!

You don't really need them, but you want them. Crapes, and or Boba! There are a few nice restaurants and bars in this area, so what better to have on your way home then a Taiwanese snack! This place doesn't look like much to the casual onlooker, it can get busy which says a lot about its quality. All of their snacks are great and I would even say that the quality and freshness of their milk teas are so nice you won't recognize them after years of Quickly drinks. 

Seriously, check this place out when you are in the area. It's really nice.
author: Steven C.

description: No other spot like this one.  Crepes are good and so are the savory meal crepes. 4 stars because you have to purchase up to $10 worth of items to use card.  Other than that take cash if must.
author: Meki T.

description: Haven't shopped in their shop but as for their crepes, pretty good! They do accept cards but there's a minimum requirement. Crepes are decently priced. Ordered the mango ice cream and fresh strawberries with whip cream. Their crepes are huge and made with just the perfect amount of crisp that it does not get soggy from the ice cream. Mango ice cream was a little bland, but I like that it wasn't overly sweet. And they give a good amount of fruit. Overall, good light snack.
author: Sally D.

description:
Must try place if you are in San Fran! We found this place last time we were here and had it multiple times over the course of our trip! So you know we had to come back!! Amazing hidden gem  this place is!!

We just get the ice cream crepes but I am sure we will try the savory ones soon! 

Ordered the cheesecake and vanilla ice cream a for sure must try if you like cheesecake and ice cream!!
author: Brandon C.

description:
First time trying this place, and at first glance I thought I was in crepe heaaaven. From the appearance to the first bite, I had to say I loved it! The vanilla with the nutella and banana all in one bite was perfect, I THOUGHT. 

Up until I took a few more bites and realized .. my crepe was freakin SALTY AF. I was blinded by its looks!! 
The crepe itself was very crispy, crunchy, and thin. Perfect right? Except it was just waaaay too salty, it made me very thirsty and really contradicted and ruined the entire crepe for me. The banana chunks were cut too thick, so it made me easily get tired/sick of it. 

To be honest, I really enjoyed it, but the saltiness really killed it for me. I had the vanilla icecream with banana & nutella crepe, and my friend had the green tea icecream with whipped cream crepe, and we both agreed they were good, except the fact that it was too salty.

Idk if it was just THAT day, perhaps they accidentally droppped the whole jar of salt into it or whatever, but I don't think I'll be coming back for more salt. :))

*Notice how redundant I was with the whole "salty" part... LOL
author: Tee Z.

description:
I had the crepe with chocolate ice cream and cheesecake bites. I liked that the cheesecake wasn't too sweet. I found the crepe to be great with the ice cream. It was crispy enough to contain the melting dessert and to provide a texture contrast. 

I love the minimart. It is full of fun Japanese drinks and snacks.
author: michelle l.

description:
This place is a local gem and a favorite of mine.

Whether you get a sweet or savory crepe, you're guaranteed to get something delicious. If you're in the mood for sweet, the strawberry and nutella crepe is warm and delectable. If you're a bit hungrier and crave something savory, the beef sukiyaki crepe is filling the beef is cooked to perfection. The green onions and beef combine into a slightly sweet and filling snack that's priced very fairly.

On top of the crepes, there's a variety of imported goods in the store, from candy and sodas to trinkets and toys. 

Combine all of this with the fact that Genki is open late into the night, and you can't go wrong with a visit here.
author: George K.

description:
This place has awesome desserts! They make the crepes fresh by the order. They serve serve ice cream, and egg waffles. Food was served hot and fresh. But I felt like the service could have been faster.  This location is also unique that they also sell Japanese snacks and other Japanese misc food. I bought some Japanese rice crackers since the prices are so reasonable compared to most places in SF.  

This place is a popular spot on the weekends to catch up with friends over dessert! I just wish they made it into a nice restaurant so you can sit at a table instead of standing around outside.
author: Julie L.

description: Awesome crepes and have a little bit of crunch. You can get sweet and savory crepes too. The market has a lot of good little candies and drinks too.
author: Aaron G.

description:
This just became my favorite late night dessert in SF. They close pretty late (around 11:30). And the crepes were delicious!!

We usually ordered the matcha green tea ice cream crepes with lychee toppings, and it's a bomb. The crepes were thin and crunchy while not being powdery. Ice cream was good and toppings were fresh.

Minus thing was this was not a place where you can sit down and chat. It's basically a mini-mart.

Also everytime we came here, the lychee ice cream was all sold out.
author: Tung D.

description:
No ice cream for me tonight but I did score a strawberry, banana, nutella crepe *winning* . What I like about the crepe shop here is that the crepe has this perfect crisp to it that's crunchy all the way through. I said I wasn't having dessert but since my friend was feeling down and dessert is the answer to everything. Gotta bite the bullet ( I know... I'm such a great friend). 

Lots of cute Japanese snacks here and you can just browse the entire store as you're waiting. I had one bite of my friends #1 crepe with the ice cream and if your not lactose or avoiding dairy like me. Get the ice cream!
author: Lindsay C.

description:
Cute & cheap!
This place is a small Asian market.
The crepe my boyfriend and I got was the one with different fruits & it definitely satisfied the cravings!
Would love to come back here after eating shabu again! Great dessert place.
author: Alexi G.

description:
So yum!  I am typically not a fan of sweet crepes but Genki has me hooked!  I have been here several times during my trips to the Bay Area & I am never disappointed.  Plus, it is opened late, perfect for when you are craving a sweet treat at night! 

The key to their successful crepes is that it is crispy!  The batter is nicely sweetened & there is a variety of toppings to choose from: spreads, fruits, ice cream, as well as a selection of savory crepes.

My favorite mix:
Nutella
Strawberries
Bananas
Green tea ice cream
(A fantastic mix to make your mouth salivate)

Perfect for on the go since it is packaged as a cone!  Also, do not forget to order their egg puffs which comes in many flavors!
author: Saleen D.

description:
Cheap, and good crepes open late?

TBH, I was never too big of a crepes fan until the girlfriend took me to this place. It's her go to spot for an afternoon/late night dessert, and I gotta admit, the lady got some taste.

Obviously it's a crepe place that's also a market, but it also serves pretty damn good ice cream, and egg puffs as well! Both the mango, and green tea ice cream tastes like world peace. The nutella, strawberry, and whipped cream crepe is not half bad either! I believe there's a limit for card so check out the other reviews.

The market itself is pretty plain jane asian 711 kinda thing. Honestly, it's just a haven for overpriced asian candies.
author: Peter N.

description: I used to come to this place a lot back in the day and I loved it! I haven't been in a while and I can honestly say, it was meh. The store is always fun but the place needs a good cleaning and the crepes a little less time on the griddle. Too crunchy and almost burnt. Thanks but no thanks.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
The only cute thing about this place is that it's half a creperie and half the cutest little Asian market for snacks, Asian Makeups and trinkets.

I ordered a strawberry, banana, nutella and vanilla ice cream crepe. The amount of nutella applied to my crepe was the perfect portion where as they skimmed on the banana and strawberry. What you see the picture is exactly what I received -3 half strawberries and 3 pieces of half sliced bananas. 

As much as their crepes were the perfect amount of toasted and the overall taste was good, I cannot for the life of me stand how crowded it gets here and how noisy everyone gets. You'd think that since there are people who live upstairs, that people would be more considerate. The line of people outside and gathered inside is always packed beyond belief and the wait for a crepe, is unbelievable. 

I'm not trashing this place but I'd much rather get my crepe, elsewhere.
author: Shilo B.

description:
Nutella Crepe with Bananas and Whipped Cream...yum.  Get ice cream in it too!  You probably can't go wrong with any of their crepes.  There's a reason why there's always a line, it's that good.  While you're at it, you can probably grab some snacks since it's a mini-mart too.

There's a few seats, so if you're lucky you'll find one by the time you get your order.
author: Geoffrey C.

description:
Crepe and ice cream with attitude.

My friend ordered the 2, 5, and 6 and the cashier person thought we said two 5s and 6. 

So we ended up getting two strawberries with an extra dose of attitude from the workers who produced our crepes. 

There's also a pokestop nearby so we witnessed 30 people dispersed after a lure expired. 

The crepe itself is a little salty but it goes great with the ice cream. It closes late so that's also nice.
author: Siamrath B.

description: Just okay. The crepes were really crispy, but I expected them to be sweeter and more like a dessert crepe. They also got my order wrong. I asked for honeydew ice cream with bananas and lychees and they forgot the lychees altogether. I wouldn't come back.
author: Codarus C.

description: I've never had a crepe before until waking into Genki. I decided to go without ice cream and that was a mistake. I asked if I could just add some ice cream to my crepe after the fact since it was so much crepe with some peanut butter and banana. They then said I could buy a scoop and add it myself. $3 for one little scoop of chocolate ice cream. If you go here, do not get a crepe without ice cream!! It's practically all dough.
author: Carmen H.

description: Really fantastic crepes for around eight dollars! They have Asian flavors such as red bean and green tea ice cream. They also have the Hong Kong style egg puffs that are pretty popular - you might have seen them at Asian tapioca places like Quickly. The crêpe restaurant also sells Asian snacks, such as peach gummies and pokey. They even have Japanese skincare goods such as Biore and Naive. One really cool bit to note about Genki is that some of the discontinued skincare items are 50% off. I would recommend anyone visiting San Francisco to swing by this crepe place/snack/Japanese makeup and skincare mart. And don't forget that the credit card minimum is $10 so it is best to bring cash!
author: Katherine L.

description: Came here for the egg puffs and to grab a few goodies from the grocery. Got the chocolate egg puff and it was splendid. Just be aware that there is a $10 credit card limit for those of you who do not carry much cash.
author: Ryan H.

description: I love the crepes!!! The crepe skin are so crispy! I highly recommend the dessert crepes they are so good!!!! I also come here for Japanese snacks and candy^^ I don't need to go all the way to Japan town for chips and goods they have it all here!
author: Coco B.

description: This is my first time writing on yelp. I think I should try it this time since the store deserves 0 star. I went there on Friday night to buy 4 fruit crepes. My parents couldn't finish half. The crepes, which the store is famous for, are totally lack of crunchiness and flavor. The topping fruit and ice cream are barely there. Did the owner know this? $7 per piece. Such a rip-off. Don't go there.
author: DT N.

description: Had an egg tart here - it was fresh, warm, crunchy and delicious. We were planning to take it home, but we ended up eating all of it while sitting on the bench inside the store. Saw a lot of crepes made and served while we were there, and all the customers seemed happy. Would recommend!
author: Jiwon K.

description: Been here plenty of times for my crepes. I usually come here since it's not close to my house but they have decent crepes so I rather go here then anywhere else. They have variety of crepes here from savory to sweetness! I haven't gotten the chance to try all of them since I usually order the same thing which is green tea ice cream with red bean! Mhmm...and then my boyfriend usually orders the savory crepe which has chicken in it and it's actually pretty good. Parking is usually street/meter parking so it's best to go at night since the meters are free. There's usually a long wait for this place since it's so popular lol. I try to come here on a week night b/c it's so packed.Other than that, I'll be back again soon probably. ;)
author: Monica W.

description:
YUM! Their crepes are excellent, I love that they are crispy and gives a generous amount of fillings within. It can get pricey when you start adding additional toppings, so beware! Minimum charge of $10 to pay with a card. 

Not a place to sit and eat your crepes!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Crepes are good. They will definitely satisfy  your craving which is why i cant give this place a one star, but the customer service is horrible! 
I wanted something simple, so I ordered ice cream with whipped cream and they said sorry they aren't allowed to whipped cream. Even if I pay for it. Really?! The only way I could add whipped cream is if I bought a full crepe or bought this thing called a volcano which has tapioca in it.
author: Emily H.

description: Hands down my favorite crepe place ever! Even though traditional crepes are served soft and not in conical form, the crispy crepe is so much tastier to me. The past two times I've gone to Genki, I've ordered the banana and Nutella crepe and it's super delicious. My friend has gotten the adzuki (red bean paste) crepe, which is really good too. The last time I went my crepe wasn't hot/warm, but I still would give a solid 5 because they're that yummy!! 10/10 would recommend.
author: Catherine T.

description:
Here's the exchange when ordering.

"What do you want?"

"#1 with Nutella and banana."

"Whipped cream?"

"No." *hands cash*

"Thank you, next?"

Fastest and quickest cashier ever! The ice cream crepes are a must try in SF. I always get Nutella and banana for the toppings, and get strawberry or vanilla ice cream. The crepes are crispy and ice cream is delicious. For the price, you can't beat it. Even when it's cold outside, you can't go wrong here.
author: Jaime F.

description:
This little market is usually known only by locals or those who have lived in the city for a period of time. It is part convenience store and Asian market. 

On any given afternoon or evening there is steady foot traffic from visitors and mostly students coming in for some snacks. 

Clement street is almost like a mini Chinatown ( the real Chinatown in San Francisco ) is miles away. 

Anything with Nutella is popular choice there for crepe filling or topping. There are a plethora or different combinations and they have Hong Kong egg waffles as well. Anytime I went there is was mostly because of a craving for some desert crepes. 

The employees are usually polite and very hard working. And they are prompt with the service. The popularity of GENKI has a lot to do with the affordable pricing and the location. 

Not everyone lives near Japantown or wants to drive or take a bus downtown every time the craving hits. It is nice to know that a place like GENKI exists for those who have a budget and a sweet tooth.
author: Gregory C.

description:
After seeing my friends checking in here on FB & IG I finally decided to try it out after having lunch. 

Finding parking was terrible but it was manageable after a few drives around the area. It's the city what more can I say about it. As you walk by it has a colorful store front and as you walk in their is a large menu on the top left wall. 

We were in for a surprise when we saw how many options were available. Their was no limit to how creative you could design your crepe. As well as endless options of beverages from smoothies, tea or ect.  My brain was lost in the sea of choices but was fortunate that cravings steered me to the perfect choices. 

#24 Strawberry with Nutella and Whip cream 
Egg puffs original vanilla

As we waited, we walked around the store to see all the Japanese goodies available and bottled drinks. I was defiantly amazed with the items that were available. We eventually had to stop and sit down before we bought to many goodies before our order was even ready. 

When we received the crepe we were surprised on how large it was but very excited. The first bite was incredible!! The strawberries were so sweet and fresh. The Nutella was so warm and the whip cream was perfect. The crepe itself was perfect, I loved how crunchy it was!! 

The egg puffs were delicious!! They were different from what we have tried, but exceptional! 

I can not wait until we go again!
author: Lindsay S.

description:
This is my favorite crepe spot in the city! I like both their savory and sweet crepes. 

If you want a light savory crepe the smoked salmon is a good one. Heavy - beef sukiyaki. Don't want meat - spinach, mushroom and cheese. There's a crepe for every mood I'm in. 

As for sweet crepes - they have crepes with and without ice cream. You can not go wrong with Nutella and fruits like banana and strawberry. Their green tea ice cream has a strong green tea taste which I like. 

Sometimes it's hard to decide between a savory or sweet crepe because they're both so good!
author: Michelle T.

description:
I love the concept of being able to hold my crepe like a cone. Genki allows you to enjoy your crepe with ice cream in the center!

I usually go for the banana nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream. This crepe is probably good for 2 people so sharing with your friends or family would be enough to fulfill your sweet tooth. The crepe is crunchy on the outside and covered with nutella inside.

This place only has street parking and has a $10 minimum on card payments. The minimart has items such as drinks, mochi ice cream, candy, chocolate, green tea kit kat and ramen packs.
author: Frances V.

description: I rarely go to San Francisco at all but I went out this one day to help out clean the office for my uncle and decided to get crepes from my little cousin's recommendation since it was just 2-3 blocks walk.  I expected the price to be high for the crepes being in SF but it was actually not that pricy compared to some other SF locations where it's pass $10 just for nutella and some bananas.  And it was just soooo goood!  Would definitely go back.  But I would say there was a lot of people when we went.  It was tasty for a good price! I want crepes now.
author: Hui B.

description:
Love Love Love Genki Crepes!

Everything about this place is drool worthy; from the dessert crepes to the egg puffs.
Definitely my go to spot for a dessert crepe! Mixed fruit with Nutella is my favorite.
Also love the coconut flavor egg puff. Delicious :P

I still have yet to try their savory crepes but it is on my list!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Wait why haven't i reviewed this place?  Been coming to this place for yearsssss!
Crepes are crunchy just how i like it! Quality of ingredients can be a bit better but oh well! This place just brings lots of memories. 
Not a fan of their boba though. Love the knick knacks they sell here.
author: Claire J.

description:
If you ain't been here are you really from SF?

Like this place is the bomb! I have never been disappointed after waiting in the crazy lines that happen on weekend nights.
author: Brian N.

description:
Whenever I am in the Richmond and I crave dessert, it's so difficult to choose. With three blocks filled with great food, why do I come to Genki Crepes?

Because they know how to do crepes. And the line tells you that everyone else agrees with me. You have the option of savory and sweet- I have only ever gotten sweet whenever I have bought a crepe from here. Order at the cash register, then wait for your number to be called. 

There's a huge menu with a huge selection of already made crepes. But if those choices are still not cutting it for you- you can pretty much order your crepe however you want. For example, I wanted my go-to nutella+strawberry+banana+ice cream crepe and that's what I ordered. No questions asked besides which flavor of ice cream I want. Be aware when you do this custom ordering nonsense- the price goes up rather quickly and easily. Bring cash unless you can hit the minimum (but this usually goes without saying at most places in SF).

Hand rolled, crispy, and super filling.
author: Arezou A.

description: Terrible service. My sisters and I walked in and we already got a bad vibe from the employees. While everyone had their crepes chopped up in bits and pieces to have a flat crepe my sisters were given the crepes with the whole fruit. They weren't expecting that so they asked if they could get theirs chopped like everyone else did and they all shook their heads no. Plus they didn't tell us it was $1 per every topping added. I also bought something from their mart (not crepes) and the cashier rolled her eyes at some other customer who was previously talking to her. We are not returning.
author: Fatima G.

description: I didn't think I would have the chance to post about Genki. But thanks to a spur of the moment road trip to SF I made sure to get myself one of these bad boys. I've searched hard and long for something just as good or maybe just as close to this in LA but with no luck. Genki just gets the crepe crunchy but doesn't flake and break into pieces. Their proportions are always on point too! I've been going to this place for years and it's one of those locations that you just have to always visit. If ever you're in SF in the Sunset area, treat yourself to a Genki Crepe, you won't regret it.
author: K Nicole D.

description:
This is my favorite to go place in SF for crepe! The skin of the crepe is so crispy it's making my mouth water as I type this review. 
Genki is located inside a mini asian market. The menu has a large varieties of crepes! From savory to dessert. 
I came here for dessert after eating around the area. I am a major green tea fan, so I got the green tea ice cream with red bean paste. My friends got the banana crepe with strawberry ice cream and the banana crepe with caramel syrup. They both praised the quality and the deliciousness of the dessert. Honestly, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu! 
The only downfall about this place is that it's cash only. I personally never carry any cash, so my friend had to spot me. So minus one star for that. Other than that, I would highly recommend coming to this place!
author: Shelly S.

description:
+ THE FOOD
Um... YUM! I ordered the mixed fruit crepe with nutella after dinner and I still devoured that quickly. The mixed fruit consists of banana, strawberry, and mango. They definitely do not skimp on the fruits because it was A LOT. All the fruits were very fresh, even the mango, which isn't in season! I loved how the nutella tasted with the fruits as it didn't overpower the flavor of the fresh fruits. The crepe itself was thin and crispy, just the way I like it. 

+ THE ENVIRONMENT
Loved the snacks in the mini-mart! They're very unique Asian snacks that you typically see in Hong Kong or Japan but rarely seen in the US. The aisles are pretty small and cramped but there is definitely a huge variety of snacks to buy. 

+ THE PRICES
My crepe was around $5.50, which is pretty decent for the size of the crepe. I probably wouldn't spend over $6 for the crepes though, if the prices ever went up.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Great crepes. The crepe texture is the perfect mix between crispy and soft.

I really appreciate how they spread the Nutella evenly through out the inside of the crepe. 

We ordered Nutella, banana, vanilla ice cream, and whip cream. My favorite combo.

It's a really nice addition that there is a Japanese market with lots of snacks there to get while you wait for your crepe.
author: Derrick C.

description:
Great crepes. 

I stumbled here once before while meandering around late night. People were coming crepes with funny shaped conicles and I asked them what it was just out of curiosity. 

Apparently they came from the other part of town because of the "cravings".

Unfortunately when I went in they just closed.

I vowed to come back some day but didn't write down the name or location.

And it was almost forever lost until one day I was meandering around in the morning catching Pokemon on the weekend when I came across their place again. 

I had to try it, even though I just had lunch, before it gets lost forever again.

I got the beef modseralla crepe and it was Amazing. It tasted like a peace of heaven in my mouth. 

I think I will go back there again anytime I'm in that area although there some other places I want to try there as well.

Go try it!
author: Sam B.

description: This is a cute little market. The best part of it is their crepe station. I have had the opportunity to try their crepes 3 times. They were all delicious. Good place for asian snacks as well.
author: Josh L.

description: We stopped in here because my husband wanted a crepe. Since I can't eat crepes I asked for a cup of ice cream with nutella drizzled on top. Basically what my husband ordered minus the crepe. The girl at the checkout was incredibly rude and flat out refused to take my order. We even offered to pay extra. So I went across the street to Toy Boat and spent my money elsewhere which I will continue to do.
author: mama c.

description: This was my first time here and I was not disappointed! I had the strawberry and Nutella crepe. It was simple, but fudging amazing! I also got some Haribo gummies! My sweet tooth was definitely satisfied :D
author: Tammy D.

description: My go to place for delicious crepes. I always go here after dinner for some dessert. I order the Nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream. It's usually pretty good and good amount of crunch. But today, the bottom of my crepe was a little soggy. Not much seating here to sit except for a bench along the wall. So if you go during a busy time, you might not have much room to sit and eat your crepe. It's also a market so it's nice to shop around while you wait for your crepe.
author: Jenny H.

description:
i didnt try their crepe. BUT THEIR EGG PUFFS ARE SO GREAT!
they have some bizarre flavors for egg puffs that i've never seen in other locations. 
(will upload a photo to show the selections)
there's like chocolate egg puff (which is somewhat normal), then they got coconut flavored, and even honeydew flavored!
so yes, i tried the honeydew. 
first reaction?
both my frnd and i were like "oh kay. this is interesting..."
but the more we bite into it, the more we like it!
definitely coming back to try the coconut flavored one haha. 

i'd give 5 star for the food, BUT i wish there's somewhere to sit there :( 
i didnt like holding food and eating and wlaking at the same time... but since there was no where to sit, we kinda had to do so. which was unpleasant.
author: Miranda L.

description: Nothing's changed about this place! I used to get crepes here every week about 7 or 8 years ago, and they still taste amazing. The crepes are relatively inexpensive, and taste so good. There's a good variety of sweet and savory crepes, and they are all equally great! There's usually a line that goes out the door, so be prepared for that. While waiting for your crepes, you can look around the store and even purchase other asian snacks. The only difficulty is that parking can be difficult to find at certain times.
author: Jhoanna E.

description:
I'm a fan of this place... but not for their crepes... it's the egg puffs that really hit the spot.

My friends and I were out on New Years Day and since we had a tiny dinner, we were starving around ten pm. With not many places open, we were glad to see Genki open and so well reviewed on Yelp. 

Genki is basically a tiny Japanese market, so you can get all your Japanese snacks. But the majority of the people there were definitely there for their desserts--they have egg puffs, crepes, pearl milk tea, smoothies, etc. If you need your Japanese snack craving, they got your back.

I tried the mango ice cream crepe with strawberries (#6 I think?). While the mango ice cream was spot on, the crepe was not. I can't tell if it was because they were super swamped that night and maybe they were making their crepes too quickly, but the crepe itself was terrible. The skin was super tough and crunchy... almost like a fortune cookie rather than a soft layer of dough that it should be. There are much, much better crepe places in the area. 

What didn't suck, however, was the egg puffs! My friends and I tried the red bean egg puff and the regular one. Honestly the red bean was hardly noticeable--there are just some red beans sprinkled into the dough, but the egg puffs were so good!! Super soft and warm and just sweet enough to be yummy.

tldr; Will definitely come back for egg puffs, but I think the crepes were meh--they may have had an off day though?
author: Jasmine X.

description:
Has anyone ever had a bad banana Nutella crepe? Hmm. Seriously, how many ways can you make that? What sets this place apart though is the vanilla ice cream, which makes the crepe that much better. 

I ordered mine to go and the scoop of vanilla ice cream was set aside in a small plastic cup, ready for me to pack into the crepe when I got home. The crepe itself is good -- slightly crispy yet chewy at the same time.

They have all kinds of stuff here. Still unsure? Then stick with the banana Nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream.
author: Lloyd B.

description:
Crepes are allll the rage in SF, and my go-to place is Genki. I always visit during the night time for some reason, and the line can be long, but does move quickly.

They have a long list of sweet and savory crepes. My favorite, however, is the crepe with vanilla ice cream, nutella, bananas and fresh whipped cream. SOOOOO GOOOOOOD! This comes out to about ~$5 which I think is super worth it. 

Parking is doable, I mean, you're in the Clement area so I personally don't expect VIP/BOSS parking whenever I'm making my way there. But they're mostly metered parking (free after 6pm!).
author: Kathleene E.

description:
Great little Japanese market that sells stellar dessert crepes. 

My favorite is the green tea ice cream with red bean paste! If its too cold, the strawberry and nutella or the egg puffs are a good alternative. They also have green tea kitkats and all sorts of Japanese snacks and sweets. I would pass on getting the smoothies or boba, there are better places along Clement.
author: Tiffany H.

description: I can't believe I'm just now writing a review for this place. Hands down my favorite dessert place in SF. My go-to order: Nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream, strawberries, banana, and whipped cream!  The first couple of bites you try to eat proper with a spoon. Then you say F it and smoosh the crepe into a taco form and chow chow away. I don't find myself in the Inner Richmond too often, but when I do, this place is a must. I always leave happy with Nutella marks on my face.
author: Grace V.

description:
Came here with some coworkers after having dinner across the street. It was my first time coming back to this place in about 5 years since I moved away for college. This used to be my go-to place for crepes in the city. I ordered my usual (number one), which is a crepe with strawberry or banana, vanilla ice cream, and whipped cream. 

The crepe itself was very crispy. I usually prefer my crepes to be on the softer side. But it wasn't a big deal... UNTIL I bit into and it was burnt! :( Luckily the flavor of the ice cream covered that burnt taste up a little. 

I liked that this place accepted card (because it seems like everyone relies on cards these days)! What I didn't like was there was a minimum of 10 dollars that you have to purchase in order to use that card. Luckily, I had some other people who came with me. So I just paid for their crepe. But if you come by yourself, you might have to buy a few extra items to reach that limit. But with such an abundance of asian snacks and drinks, it shouldn't be too hard. If you ever do need to reach that 10 dollar limit with your crepe order, I suggest the aloe drink, some pocky sticks, and shrimp chips! :D 

Parking is a hit or miss depending on what time you go. I try not to be greedy in finding princess parking and look for parking a couple of blocks away and that usually works!
author: Cynthia T.

description: Great take on crepes with tons of choices for fillings. I love the sweet more than the savory for sure. There's a bunch of authentic japanese foods you can buy as well!
author: Michael P.

description:
I am a huge fan of Genki Crepes! If you haven't tried this place yet, just go and you'll see why its some of the best!

Lets start off with the crepe. It's not your traditional soft crepe. It is closer to a waffle cone texture. It's slightly crispy which is a great contrast to the ice cream.

The ice cream is local. They use Mitchell's ice cream which is also a local favorite. 

A topping that I ALWAYS get is the chocolate cake. It is heavenly! Moist and fluffy but not too sweet.

I would give this spot 5 stars if it was a bigger facility and stocked up on fruit. I usually go near closing time during the weekends and they usually run out of mangos and the bananas they use at the end of the day aren't ripe enough (It seemed like they were taking from a batch for the next day).

As a whole, Genki will always a top spot I bring all my tourist friends to end a solid day in The City
author: Max M.

description:
You know something is up when you come here and you see a pretty hefty line where people just order the crepes.

The crepes are pretty huge as compared to the ones I'm used to. And they all have different kinds too from the sweets to the savory and to the specialties.

My dessert mango and strawberry crepe really filled me up. 

This place is a store too, but most people just stick with the crepes.
author: Mike C.

description:
definitely a good snack spot

I'm lactose intolerant, so i can't really vouch for the dessert crepes. I did have one with bananas, almonds, and stuff...it was whatever. As for savory crepes, the locks smoked salmon with wasabi and philly cheese is super good, never fails for me.
author: Aaron C.

description: One of the best crepe spots to go in SF or around this area for sure.  It's a great place to stop to get dessert and fill that sweet tooth craving as they have different choices to add into your crepe.  During the day they can get busy but night time is when it picks up business.  It's a nice dessert pick up after a meal since there are plenty of places to eat but this is my main choice to go for dessert especially for crepe.  Price to me is perfect compared to others and the quality too.  Staff is quick and there are other interesting things in this mini mart that you might find amusing to end up purchasing like oriental snacks, goodies, & toys.  I'd def recommend this place for sure.  Just beware of the parking but that's SF for ya.  It's good to walk anyways...
author: Oliver Q.

description:
Stars: 4.5

I love genki's! Best dessert crepes I've ever had so far.

First time I got #1 which is just Nutella, whipped cream, and vanilla ice cream crepe. Yes, it's so simple but it was love at first bite. The crepe is so perfectly made, thin and crispy. It just melts in your mouth. Yummy!!! I definitely recommend this one.

A few days ago I got the green tea ice cream with red bean. I can always go for green tea ice cream hehe.

I also got to try my friend's mango and strawberry crepe. I'm definitely getting that one next time!

Each crepe costs about $5. It's a bit pricey, but still worth it!
author: Lincy H.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend to check out this place, since I was craving for some crepes. I said it to by head why not, and try it out. 

I wouldn't say I love this place, but their crepes are descent. I think their prices are a little bit too expensive. I expected the price to be lower since it's not in the bay area. I got the fruit dessert crepe with vanilla ice cream. They were stingy with their fruits and ice cream. I only got a few slices of fruits and only 1 small scoop of ice cream. It cost about $7.

I would recommend to come to this place to try it out, maybe it was just my luck the person who made my crepe was a stingy person. Like I said it was not a bad crepe.  To add on, It's a small mini-mart that sells asian snacks but you can find them anywhere in the bay, so no big deal. You mainly come here for crepes not to shop.
author: Noel K.

description:
What a dessert life-saver when all the other dessert shops have closed and you don't want to go home to have a good cry just yet.

This is a cute Japanese convenience store filled with Asian snacks, skin products, and instant ramen. And crepes.

Came in around 10 pm and ordered a red bean and custard crepe with no ice cream because it was so cold outside. For $5, it came out quick, wasn't too sweet, and hit the spot. I perused some interesting looking Japanese candies and soups while I waited.

Points for the slightly crispy crepe and late-night hours. 

Deserves an A (4/5 stars) in the $10 and under bracket, for sure.
author: GG C.

description: Went to San Fran for the day and wanted a cute dessert place to eat at and Genki came up with tons of reviews so we decided to try it. For a second I was confused because it was a mini mart but the yummy smell of Crepes assured me it was the right place. It was the most amazing thing I have tried. I got a crepe with ice cream and Nutella & bananas. They have a cute little spot to sit outside also! Must try if you're near by.
author: Mary O.

description: I love the crepes that they serve here. I like how they make the crepe skin so crispy. I got a crepe with green tea ice cream, red bean paste, and whipped cream. It was really delicious and this place never disappoints. The only downside of this place is the little amount of seating and small area available. Of course I guess I can't complain since it's supposed to be a small market. But hands down, my favorite place to get a crepe in SF.
author: Annie H.

description:
Genki's Crepes is definitely on my list of Go-To places when in San Fransisco. They serve a large variety of crepe's that proves to the world that crepes don't have to be served on a fancy ceramic plate topped with mounds of whip creme and powdered sugar to be delicious-- it can simply be folded and eaten in a paper sleeve. Of course though, you can still add on whip creme if you like. Simple and delicious! 

One bite and you'll know that this will be probably the best hand-held crepe you will ever have in your entire life. The outside is slightly crispy yet chewy and they don't cheap out on the filling! I got the Banana and Nutella crepe and each bite was as good as the first! Everything was nice and hot. Perfect dessert after coming from Burma Star across the street!
author: Danny L.

description: I don't live in the bay but visit very often because of family and friends. This is always one of my must stop places. You really can't go wrong with any choice off their menu, I'm not ashamed to say I've tried almost all of their crepes.. hehe.
author: Courtnie W.

description:
Genki Crepes is a must for dessert especially after eating at PPQ Dungeness island.
There's quite an assortment of crepes to choose from... Some with ice cream others with cheesecake and then there's the savory flavored ones. I usually get an ice cream or cheesecake one. 
I love the way they make the great so nice and crispy and fill it with ice cream fruit and top it off with fresh whipped cream. Tonight I had the basic with vanilla ice cream, fresh strawberries, chocolate syrup and whipped cream.
Sometimes parking can be a little tough but it certainly is worth the effort.
author: Lyn L.

description:
I almost walked past by this place! It's located at the front of a mini mart for international sweets. Definitely a hole in the wall worth visiting.

They offer so many varieties of crepes and egg puffs for a great price. The crepe that I had tasted GREAT! Golden, crispy, and full of flavor. From now on, this will be my go-to crepe place in SF.
author: Dacia P.

description: Boba is just ok, but their crepes are lights out. Service is great, and the prices are affordable. Great spot if you're hitting up Burma Superstar for dinner!
author: Rob S.

description: This was amazing! Went here to try their ice cream crepes and I loved it! You have to go and try it. Can't wait to go next time and get the regular crepes!
author: Enxhi T.

description: Absolutely love this place! First they have all the yummy japanese candy (lychee gummies, hi-chew etc) for cheaper than usual. Second, their crepes! They are so light and delicious and I have dreams about the cheesecake crepe with blueberry sauce. The cheesecake is so light and fluffy and does not feel ridiculously heavy. I end up getting the same thing every time I am here but definitely want to try the egg waffles next time.
author: Rachel N.

description: Best crepe place in Bay Area hands down I will not go anywhere else best taste and crisp on crepe
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Whenever I'm craving dessert in the city, Genki Crepes always comes to mind first. Imagine a Warm Crisp Crepe filled with Authentic Green Tea Ice Cream, Whipped Cream, Bananas, Strawberries, and Nutella... so amazing and not too sweet, which is perfect! 

I came here last night after watching Cirque Du Soleil with the boyfriend. We were craving some late night dessert and drove 20 minutes from AT&T park just to get this delicious crepe. Despite the cold 20 degree San Francisco weather, we decided to get a scoop of green tea ice cream with our crepe. Every bite was worth enduring the cold for! Half way through finishing, I decided that one crepe was not enough for the two of us. I should have gotten two! Lesson learned.
author: MyTien P.

description:
I always come for their crepes, either after dinner or late night this place never disappoints! 

My personal favorite is #5 Green tea ice cream crepe with red bean and whipped cream! Simple but yet so damn delicious! 

My boyfriends favorite is the Nutella banana crepe with whipped cream. I like that one too, but I'll prefer my green tea over that any day! 

They also have some interesting Asian snacks, but kind of pricey for my taste. If you are craving a crepe in the city, this is the place to go!
author: Alice Z.

description:
I came to this small mini mart to fulfill my sweet tooth. I had my first ice cream crepe in Los Angeles, and I fell in love. So driving to SF is the only close thing I can get my hands on. 

I ordered #5 on the ice cream crepe which is a strawberry ice cream crepe with kiwi. The crepe itself was terrible! It was soooo salty, I didn't even finish the crepe. The ice cream itself wasn't even that good either. 

I also ordered a strawberry egg puff which turned out way better than the crepe. Flavoring was excellent and just the right amount of sweetness. However the quality of the egg puff was not what I'm used too. There was no puff, it came out flat and soggy. 

This location has a wide variety of Japanese flavored limited snacks. Cookie and cream kit Kat, strawberry kit Kat, and green tea pocky sticks. You get the picture.
author: Nga P.

description: I would say it's one of the better crepes I've had. A very simple place, and I went there around 12:00 on the weekend and there was hardly even a wait at all.
author: Sasha D.

description: Yummy crepes! I got the number 1, vanilla ice cream bananas strawberry and nutella.  Extra cost if you get one than one topping ($1 each topping) the crepes are located in the small mini-market. They have a small bench in the market that you can sit and wait for your crepe, but gets kinda crowded and stuffy so its better to wait outside.
author: Abby C.

description: As you walk down Clement street, you will be overwhelmed with the sweet smell of powdered sugar and crepes. You need to stop by, particularly for the custard filled crepe. Its amazing. It comes in a convenient ready to go package so you can walk and eat at the same time. They're super affordable too. When we went, there was a line so be ready for that. But you won't be able to resist that sweet aroma.
author: Bushra H.

description:
I always get the Nutella and strawberry crepe and it hits the spot! Delicious. The little market also offers many Japanese snacks and candies if you're into that, though they're slightly overpriced. There's also a small freezer with green tea ice cream and mochi ice cream. The boba here isn't that great though - I always come here for the crepes only; I'd go across the street to Quickly's if I really want boba. 

tl;dr amazing dessert crepes, mediocre boba, also has selection of overpriced Japanese snacks
author: Grace D.

description: The crepe itself was kinda burn and not as crunchy, the filling was ok. The price is more than some other places with not as much toppings. The plus side is the egg puff. The egg puff is crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. I'd come back for the egg puff but not the crepe
author: Danh T.

description: This has to be my favorite stop every time I come to San Francisco. The place is open very late so I always have time to make it my final stop. I have tried several different crepes and love them all!
author: Ivan C.

description:
I've been going to Genki since forever. Finally decided to write a review, but it's just going to add onto all the amazing reviews already posted over the past several years. Best crepes in SF and yes it's a minimart with cute little toys too, bad for me cause I have a soft spot for all those cute things and makes me spend more money while I'm waiting in line and waiting for my crepe.

There's usually a line, but it hasn't been too bad every time I go around dessert time (9pm). They're pretty fast and you should have your order ready by the time you're at the cashier.

Their crepes have a good flavor to them with a hint a vanilla and not too sweet (reminds me of a pancake). And perfect texture, crispy on the edges but still soft near the center, but it also depends who makes it, some of the workers might undercook it or overcook it. It's also been perfect every time I've been there, but I've seen some where the crepe was extra crispy. Plus I LOVE ICE CREAM and having ice cream in the middle of my crepe....mmmmm.....heaven. Their nutella crepes are also something you can never go wrong with if you're not feeling the ice cream. They also have ice cream flavors like green tea, red bean, and lychee. I'm not a fan of whip cream so I always ask for no whip cream. You can also substitute things if you don't like their combos (basically build your own crepe).

I have noticed they don't stuff it as much as they used to :(. Less fruit and less ice cream (guess they're trying to do me a favor). But still good.

I haven't tried anything else like their savory crepes or egg puffs. I definitely do want to try their egg puffs.

They do take card but minimum of $10, but 1 crepe is about $7 so if you aren't planning on treating or getting two or buying some extra goodies, you should bring cash.

They also don't have tables and chairs, but they do have two benches one inside and one outside where you can sit and wait for your crepe or eat it.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Stopped by here after taking a hike in Lands End. It was one of the few places in the area that was taking card and my friend was craving a dessert crepe.

Rating Breakdown:

1.5/2 Stars for Taste -- 
It's nothing special, not a bad crepe and not an amazing crepe either, but solid. The crepe skin is pretty crispy and thick, you definitely want to eat your crepe fast before it gets soggy/drippy. I got a turkey, cheese, and avocado crepe and it was pretty good. Lots of cheese and they weren't stingy with the avocado slices either. My friend got a lychee ice cream crepe with "custard", but the custard was just condensed milk drizzled on top. I wouldn't complain, since I think condensed milk comes straight from the breast of God, but my friend was pretty adamant that he wanted real custard. 

0.5/1 Stars for Value --
Around $6 for a dessert crepe and around $7-8 for a savory crepe. Not bad, but consider that you are essentially getting two scoops of mediocre ice cream in a giant cone for $6...

1/1 Stars for Customer Service -- 
The cashier was real patient even though my friend and I took forever to decide what we wanted. The crepes came out really fast.

Overall, not a bad place for a quick stop, but nothing special. No bonus star because I probably wouldn't come here again.

Quick tips:
This is also a little grocery store where you can buy Asian snacks and drinks...probably at a slightly higher price

They don't accept card for purchases under $10.
author: Abby W.

description: This place is worth the wait even on a crowded weekend. The service is fairly fast and the menu item selection is top notch considering this place is a mini mart also! It's fun to cruise the mini mart while waiting for your order. Plus they have Boba!
author: Josie V.

description: I used to love this place, but I feel like it has gone down. The mini mart used to be my favorite as I wait for my order. Their ice cream is always on point, but it's just ice cream and you could get that some place else. The crepes in my opinion used to be a lot better, but I'd still be back. The service was always whatever.
author: Maggie W.

description:
My husband & I have been going to Genki Crepes for a while now. We love getting their fruit & ice cream crepes and their egg waffles. The crepe has more of a crunchy consistency so it holds up well as a waffle cone with ice cream. It seems like more people have found out about this little place because it's always busy whenever we go now, but the wait usually isn't too long when there's a crowd.

The mini-mart has lots of cool little Asian toys and snacks to explore as well.

Tip: Always get Nutella with your dessert crepe!
author: Clarissa L.

description: Wish I could've tried their crepes because I've heard good things about them. Once I got there, the store was closed knowing I looked up the hours saying it was open. I think the owners were outside sitting on a bench and just lounging. It would've been a great common courtesy to tell me it was closed before I tried squeezing my way in behind a bench they blocked the door with. The store looked like it was open because of all the lights on and my friends and I took us 30 minutes just to be disappointed when we got there. Hopefully I don't experience this again if I ever give it a second chance.
author: Danielle L.

description:
I've heard good things about this place so I went for the crepes. Little did I know, it's also a little market that carries Asian snacks!

Simple strawberry and nutella crepe. I was extremely full so I wasn't planning on finishing it but it was gone within seconds... 0:-) It was thin and crispy with lots of strawberries.

The original eggettes are also one of the best I've had in the bay area. Highly recommend!
author: Mandy L.

description:
Best crepes I have had! They were crispy, not soggy and huge! 

I had strawberries and nutella. Cool hidden gem in an Asian convenient store.
author: Olivia A.

description: This is cute little Asian mart with a crepe corner. They make crepes with ice cream (and more) in them, and they are super delicious. They have 3 or 4 chairs inside but this isn't really a sit-down and hangout place.
author: Do P.

description: This place carries a great selection of Asian products that are not always easy to find. We also had a freshly made egg puff from here, which turned out to be pretty tasty. Love the ice cream crepes they sell at this place!
author: Carter C.

description: We love the mixed fruit, it is very delicious.  Check it out for yourself:)
author: Mega Team R.

description:
Yay I finally tried Genki Crepes! It is as good as everyone says. It is in a supermarket and it reminded me of Matsumoto Shaved Snow in Hawaii because it is a combo of a supermarket and dessert place. There was no line at around 7pm on a Saturday.

My two friends and I first shared a savory crepe. You can make your own which is great because you always want to personalize your crepe. We got chicken, mozzarella, mushrooms, and avocado. That is the best combo ever! You have to get the mushrooms and avocado for sure. It filled us up but we had to try the sweet crepe as well. 

Our sweet crepe had nutella, peanut butter, vanilla ice cream and bananas. It comes with whip cream but we opted without it. We were already full but we had to get a sweet crepe! It was actually a bit disappointing compared to our delicious savory crepe. The peanut butter was too thick and it made the crepe a bit too much. The ice cream started to melt and the outside crepe was getting soggy. Next time if I get a sweet crepe, I would for sure get nutella and banana and add strawberries and red bean. Ice cream would be optional depending on my mood.

Back in the south bay, Banana Crepe would be like Genki and Matsumoto in one!

**TIPS**
1) Split with friends because they are pretty big and it's great to try different flavors. 
2) There is a credit card minimum so most likely you will have to pay cash if you are buying one.
3) There are preset crepe options but you have the option to make your own.
4) Enjoy!
author: Amy H.

description: Best crepes in town. Visited almost every night during my week visit to San Francisco! Love the ice cream crepes they sell at this place! There isn't one thats isn't bad, all of them are good!
author: Moshe M.

description:
Parking was not easy! but my crepe was totally worth it!

Blueberry sauce, cheesecake, whip cream with marshmallows - SHUT THE FRONT EFFING DOOR!!!

I couldn't believe my eyes when they called #88 and handed me my crepe, Good God!!!

I thought I may have temporarily loss my mind as I began to devour the whole ENTIRE thing while walking back to the car.

Thank gosh I was running in the marathon the next morning, that is the only way I could EVER justify a treat of this degree in it's entirety.

I'm not quite sure I need to return, this may be the sort of thing you eat once in a lifetime and then suggest to others to try or maybe, just maybe I'll have another one (or some of one) in October before the Nike Women's Marathon :)

If you love sweets the way I do, I'm pretty confident you will enjoy Genki.

My son was so boring and ordered 2 scoops of chocolate ice-cream, I think his 12 year old mind couldn't wrap itself around just how much was going on in here. I don't usually allow him to eat sweets of this magnitude so he may have been a bit weary and probably wanted to see how I'd hold up after ordering such a decadent dessert :)

Good news is, I held up just peachy :)

Go here, if you want something a little bit different than ice-cream, cakes, cookies, pie etc.

Be ready to deal with the shitty neighborhood parking but your crepe will be worth every circle around that neighborhood to score a spot.
author: Candace L.

description:
Genki's crepes are ok, not the best compared to the ones from Japan town, but just ok.

After finishing my meal from Burma Superstar, I was craving for some desserts, and luckily Genki's was open until 12:30 am. 

Personally, to me, I felt that the menu lacked variety, but as every other Yelper had stated about this place, you can always ask the employees for a customized dessert.

And of course, as an every typical Asian, I had to order the #2 crepe with green tea, red bean, and whipped cream (and no, I did NOT order the crepe with nutella).

Now, although the toppings were delicious and the crepe was wrapped in a sturdy paper cone, the main issue that I had was with the crepe itself, which was more crispy rather than light and fluffy like the ones served from Japan town.

Overall, I did enjoy the crepe and the quick service, and I would definitely visit again if I'm ever in the area, I mean, seriously, who doesn't want a crepe at 12:30 in the morning?
author: Nathalie Y.

description:
The process is super easy. Order and pay at the counter. They will give you a number to wait for your order. The difficult part is what to order because all the combinations are great. 

While you wait for your order, take a stroll around the store. You will find Japanese candy, snacks, and drinks along an aisle with unique Japanese beauty goods. 

My go-to is the strawberry-banana-nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream! 

What's the verdict? I'm definitely a fan.
author: Irene O.

description: If you walk in Clement nearby the shop, the delicious smell forces you to enter and buy a crepe, (I'm not joking!!). There are a lot of options and you can choose between sweet or savory crepes. I've tried different flavours and they're all yummy. Even though often you will find a line, the service is really fast and usually in a few minutes your order is ready. Definitely a great place to try if you are in the area. -1 star because unfortunately they don't accept cards under $10.
author: Rob O.

description:
Love love absolutely love this place! My go to crepe shop when I have a sweet tooth. Crepes are crispy and quick service. In the back end of the shop is a mini-mart where they sell a variety of cosmetics to car fragrances to key chains and much more. Bottom line, crepes are delicious! 

Tip: uses the same batter mix for egg puffs -prefer the crepe
author: Angela L.

description:
My friends and I were looking for a dessert place close by after dinner and stumbled upon this place. Thank you Yelp!

We ordered an ice cream crepe with vanilla ice cream, nutella and strawberries. It was probably a bad idea to attempt to share one crepe with three other people but we still enjoyed it. The crepes are pretty big in size and they stuffed it with a decent amount of ice cream and strawberries. It was the perfect combo and who can say no to nutella?

Pricing is reasonable and it didn't take too long for our order to be ready. Parking may be an issue when coming here but if I am in the area again, I would definitely consider stopping back to try something new!
author: Melisa C.

description: Came for the ice cream and ice.cream filled  crepes. Really liked the litchi (lychee) and red bean (filled w actual beans) ice cream. The green tea was good (not bitter, not too sweet). You can share a crepe as it's pretty big. Genki sells all kinds of Asian snacks too. it looks like a convenience store w a couple  benches to sit to eat though not really a sit down place to hang out at.
author: Grace C.

description:
Like.. THE BEST CREPE PLACE I'VE EVER BEEN TO. I don't care what other people's tastebuds say because mine say that this place is the bombdiggity! 

The crepes are perfectly crispy and filled with whatever you want that they have! All sorts of ice cream flavors, fruits and more! I've yet to try the savory crepes, but those look yummerz too. But maan, I can't get over how perfectly crispy these crepes are every time I eat them. I'm not a soft crepe kinda gal, so this place is just.. THE BEST. My friend Monique introduced me to this place back in May 2013, and it's been my go to place in SF ever since! Plus, it's open LATE which is just awesomesauceee! It's so nice to top of the end of an exploration in SF with some delicious desserts from here. 

Also, it is rather inexpensively priced, and there's a small little Japanese market inside for snackers and stuffs! 

CON: It's a little difficult to find parking here sometimes.. It ranges from 5 - 40 minutes... totally worth the dancing taste buds though. GOOD LUCK!
author: Kim N.

description: My favorite crepe shop by far in the city the mini market is also super cute my friends and I go in to eat dessert and will buy some more snacks or drinks at the mart. I always get the green tea ice cream with azuki bean or the strawberry cheesecake crepe i really enjoy those two.
author: Wren X.

description: Our favorite crepe place!!!!  Each time we're in sf we have to stop by here.  I got a mixed fruit with Nutella.  Omfg I could roll down on the floor to soak up all the greatness in the crepe.  So happy after eating this.  My bf got the cheesecake with mixed fruit.  All I can say is damn! Delicious!!! Both orders came out to be around 4$each
author: Jackie N.

description: I had a great experience here tonight while I had my first ever crêpe with ice cream. I highly recommend customize your own I made a crêpe with peanut butter, nuntella strawberry, banana.  It was awesome.
author: John A.

description: One of the most unassuming-but-amazing places I've been to. Never been disappointed while coming here and have enjoyed plenty of awesome crepes. Strawberry or banana + Nutella and ice cream is fantastic, and there's plenty more on the menu to indulge in. Probably the best crepes I've ever had, highly recommend trying it out if you're on Clement.
author: John A.

description: Came here for dessert, and it was super yummy! We split the mixed fruit and whipped cream crepe. It was one of the thinnest crepes I've ever had! Really nice and crispy, and the fruits inside were really fresh and perfectly ripe. The best thing about it was that it didn't feel super heavy, even though these crepes are huge! Was not disappointed, and will definitely return if I'm in the area and craving a crepe!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Tried this place because it was close and open late. was not disappointed. got the #1 (vanilla ice cream crepe with Nutella and asked for whip). was so good. 
crepe was a really interesting texture, like nothing I've had before but was so good accompanied with the Nutella and ice cream. would definitely come back.
author: Briana Z.

description:
Who doesn't love crepes?! This place is inside a Japanese market and there is usually a line out the door. 

They're service is fast while their crepes are still served nice and neat. They have a HUGE selection of what you can put inside your crepe. Some options you wouldn't even think of until you see it as a choice! 

I definitely, in a heartbeat, would make a trip to SF just for Genki Crepes anytime of day. It is delicious and nothing less. On top of that, you can grab some favorite Japanese snacks from the market. It's convenient for the crepes to be an addition to the market!
author: Jenna T.

description: Very good crepes at great prices.   Better than what you'll find at Japantown. The egg puff was very good and crunchy.
author: Michael D.

description:
Honestly, I have never seen so many Japanese knick-knacks in my life. The store is small and quaint, but it is quite entertaining. There are tons of Japanese drinks and snacks. On the day that I went, the ramune prices seemed pretty decent. Coming from Denver, a bottle of ramune usually averages around $1.99. At Genki, they were selling ramnue for $1.49. That's a pretty good price savings in my book. 

After Yelping several crepe stores in my area, I stumbled upon Genki. On my way to this place, I saw a fairly large group of people standing out front. Obviously, this means that Genki is popular. This totally fueled my excitement! Upon entering, my original goal was to try a crepe. Actually, I was very excited to try one of their ice cream crepes. But, something else caught my eye. I became really interested in the little Hong Kong Egg Puff dessert. I hadn't seen anything else like it, so I had to try it! I ordered an original (vanilla), while my friend ordered a strawberry order. I also ordered a pina colada blended drink. Since this place was actually popular, there was a pretty long wait. So, please come patient since there tends to be a lot of customers at night (I assume). But, if you order the Hong Kong dessert, you need to be extra patient since our dessert took much longer to cook than the crepes. Thus, there were people behind us getting their orders first.

The dessert was actually quite pleasant. It comes to you piping hot in a ventilated paper brown bag. Although the exterior of the dessert is very soft when its hot, it will harden as it cools. But, the inside will remain spongy and soft. If you've ever had taiyaki, I relate it to this dessert. Just imagine the taiyaki without fillings though. Personally, I was not a fan of the strawberry flavor. The strawberry flavor had the same crunchy exterior and soft inside, but the flavoring felt very artificial. These little egg puffs were really fun to eat in my opinion. It sort of reminds me of popping a bread bubble into your mouth. Maybe I'm not making any sense to you, but you'll just have to try it yourself. It's a pretty pleasant experience. I definitely recommend the original (vanilla) flavor. 

As for the blended drink, it did taste very good. It was sweet and cold. But, the pineapple in the pina colada was pretty overpowering. I like the flavor of bananas and coconut, so I definitely missed though flavors that were supposed to be present in the pina colada juice. Also, I sort of thought that the juice would be more fresh and taste less artificial. But, I guess they didn't blend the drink with fruit. I think all the fruit on the counters went to toppings on the crepes. Although I didn't get a crepe, I saw others get them. While you think of the crepe skin as a very thin and soft like a pancake, the crepe skin here was more liken to a thinner fortune cookie. Rather than soft, it seemed quite crunchy. Although I'm sure it tasted swell, I look for traditional French crepe skins when I crave crepes.
author: Stephanie N.

description:
Pretty good. Lots of yummy asian snacks and drinks!! 

Crepes: pretty good. Fruits seem fresh. The only kind of down side is the crepe batter. It was kind of thick and really crunchy. But overall, yummy!!
author: Rachel K.

description:
Always a must go to when you have a sweet tooth on clement street....period.

Only tried the dessert crepes here but I have never been let down in the dozens of times I've visited. 

Plus points for having a unique assortment of imported snacks, drinks, and other novelties to shop through while you're waiting for your crepe to finish.

I don't give out five star reviews much. But when I do you better believe they earned it! 

My new goto here: Banana, caramel & custard crepe with honeydew ice cream.
author: Norris T.

description: The crepes are much, much cheaper than many boutique-like establishments. They also have more variety, and come in both savory or sweet options. If I have the time, I would definitely return here.
author: Alvin T.

description: This place is also a little asian mini mart. The worker who was here when we went was super rude to us, not nice at all. She wasn't even nice to the customers who came after us who were deaf. She could've at least smiled. Other than that, this place is a good for decent crepes when you're in China town. Came on a Saturday night around 630 and it was empty. There is a small bench to sit and eat but that's pretty much it. Crepes here are super crunchy, so it can get messy when you bite into it. The mango ice cream here is good and the crepes are average. The best one is the chocolate with cheesecake chunks! I would come back here but only if I was in the area, I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Maleah M.

description:
My friend loves crepes, and I knew that this would be a good place to take him. I like savory crepes, so I ordered the Smoked Salmon + Red Onion + Cream Cheese + Wasabi. He likes sweet crepes, so he ordered the Cinnamon + Apple + Brown Sugar with Nutella. I don't like crepes as much as he does, but it was probably the best crepe ever. I like the crispy texture of the crepe and you can never go wrong with smoked salmon either. However, I should've asked for my crepe without wasabi, because my nostrils were burning from it. 

I was very excited to read that a yelp reviewer found green tea Oreo's and cheese flavored Kit Kat's within the mini mart. Green tea and cheese are two flavors I love! They weren't in stock that day though... :(
author: Helen H.

description:
Love this place! It's a little hole in the wall shop that sells awesome desserts. Although, it gets pretty crowded and there's no place to sit and hang out, Genki still stole my heart at first bite. The mini mart items are Japanese imported and not too overly priced, but the desserts are bomb.com! I had the basic vanilla ice cream crepe with Nutella and strawberries. I was surprised to find the crepe to be not too sweet. It was delightfully light and crispy. I was a happy customer! 

I definitely recommend this place if you are in the mood for a quick dessert.
author: Em P.

description: This little Asian store carries all of the novelty Asian products you would find at an Asian Super Market. It's always busy, but the service is quick. The way they prepare their crepes are the best. I don't know what's in the dough, but it comes out almost like a soft waffle cone that hasn't quite hardened yet. They use quality ingredients, because even their plain vanilla ice cream is decadent. Try the Chocolate Cake and Vanilla Ice Cream Crepe #8. You won't regret it. Its hard to find parking, but parking a few blocks away is worth it. 4 thumbs up!!
author: Mo W.

description:
It's one of the better crepe places that I've tried, but I still find myself drawn to Sophie's Crepes instead.  I ordered my usual... strawberry, nutella, with vanilla ice cream crepe.  Comparatively, the crepe is much, much crispier than Sophie's.  It's almost as if it was overcooked?  The crepe had a very thick, stiff consistency to it, and like chips, pieces of the crepe broke off easily. There was only three pieces of strawberries at the top of my crepe, and I only found a couple more pieces of strawberries at the bottom.  Where were the strawberries in the middle!?  :c  I like my crepes crispy, but not crispy to the point where it almost crumbs away as you bite into it.  

Hyped in my opinion, so I'm not too impressed.  I think I'll stick to Sophie's.
author: Carena N.

description: Very genki place but well worth the wait. I ordered the ice cream and chocolate cake crepe. Would definitely come back!
author: Yousef T.

description:
Everytime I come to this place the line is always long. Who was cool about those places after you place your order, you can walk around the store which is full of imported goods like Candy makeup shower stuff and toys from Japan.

It takes about 15 to 20 minutes for your food to come out after you order but the food is really good.
author: Fran C.

description: I call this place the happy place. My bf and I randomly yelped this place and decided to try it out. I'm not lying, after we tried it, we've been going every night for the past few nights. Like HOLY MOLY, this place is AMAZING! I have never had such good crepes. I come here and I love to order the vanilla ice cream with nutella and banana topped with whipped cream. Each additional topping is $1 and the total is usually 6 bucks which is fairly cheap for sf. I'm pretty sure if you go to japantown the prices are probably like $9 or more. The first time when we got here, there was quite a few people, but the wait was not bad at all. We walked in, they have a little asian market, although things are fairly priced higher. They sell asian snacks which is a good place to pick some up if you're not hunting down a ranch 99 in the city. The second day, we came back, my bf wanted to try a savory crepe, so we ordered a mushroom with spinach and cheese, with added turkey for $1. Can I say I have never seen someone put SO MUCH cheese on a crepe, it was amazing!!!! Totally worth your bucks, and definitely tasty. They make the crepe both crispy and soft, sizzled in cheese or nutella whatever you like. This place definitely makes everyone happy! Love it!!!
author: Amy Y.

description:
Genki Crepes has been one of my go-to dessert spots in SF. I am not even a huge fan of desserts or sweets, but their dessert crepes always hit the spot. I went last night after not paying a visit in over a year, and the crepes were even better than I remembered. The crepe itself was perfectly cooked (just the right amount of crunch!). And with so many options from fruit to ice cream to other various toppings, the possibilities are endless. You'll find something for anyone.

I would recommend any combination, but I prefer the strawberry and nutella crepe. If your dinner still left you with enough room, I would go for the chocolate ice cream and cheesecake crepe -- seriously, so good and VERY filling. I always come for dessert and make a mental note to try a savory crepe, but have never gotten around to it. They look/smell great too, though!

The line/wait sometimes gets a little long, but it's worth it! I don't remember ever waiting more than 10 or 15 minutes. Plus you could explore the mini-mart while you wait, stocked with a bunch of great Asian specialty goodies. 

5 stars! I love Genki! :)
author: Greg J.

description: Best crepes in the city so far. Banana Nutella w vanilla ice cream and you're good to go.
author: Sam R.

description:
Whenever I'm in the city, I try to make a pit stop here. My fav crepe joint for sure!

It usually takes about 5-10 ish minutes (depending on how busy it is) for my crepes to be ready, in which I shop in the meantime. Lots of random good finds and an easy way to waste more money on cute stuff lol. The bathroom is pretty sketch but you can't complain when it's a mini market & it's cool that they even have one, let alone allow customers to use them. No complaints here ^_^
author: Justine V.

description: What's not to like?  Egg puffs, sweet and savory crepes and ice cream!  It was never disappointed!  Our last visit include coconut egg puffs ($3.75) and a banana peanut butter crepe (~$5) It was a perfect afternoon snack.
author: Fanny Y.

description:
Pros:
- cheesecake crepe (literally 2 slices of cheesecake in a crepe)
- egg waffle (WAY better than Eggettes and more authentic)
- Asian-style crepe (on the crispier side)
- long bench to sit on inside the market

Cons:
- warning: cheesecake crepe is a fairly rich/heavy dessert, so maybe don't get this after all you can eat shabu

Bottom line: great spot for dessert after stuffing your face with any of the Asian foods in the neighborhood. I wouldn't make a special trip to eat here, but I will probably come back when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Jiann M.

description:
3.5 stars - Egg puffs are good here, but service could be better.

$10 minimum to pay with a card.

Ordered an original egg puff/waffle and a sesame egg puff/waffle.

Since they messed up my friend's egg puff order 10 minutes earlier, I watched the cashier write down my order. Dude started writing it down, then crossed it out, and then rewrote what he crossed out.. I repeated my order once more.. in case he didn't get it the first time. 

As soon as I pay, one of the staff making the crepes, egg puffs, etc hands me an original.. the one my friend returned.. Would've liked a fresh one.. Hope they don't do this often.. Having worked in the food industry before, I know that mistakes are not resold. Anyways, this was a little irritating.

My friends and I ordered a bunch of difference flavors of egg puffs (they have over six different kinds). The flavors we tried were good but the consistency of each flavor varied a bit :/ 

Original seemed to be the most dense, while the sesame had a bunch of air pockets. Honeydew tasted like the Melona honeydew popsicles, not bad. Chocolate was good as well. Sesame would have been the best if it weren't for the air pockets..
author: Yvonne K.

description:
Incredibly insensitive and inefficient customer service. Ended up paying for ingredients I did not get without any accountability and a. acknowledgement of misunderstanding my request or b. accidentally making it wrong. 
 I live in the neighborhood and have been wanting to try Genki Crepes for some time. I asked for a pre set crepe on their menu, mixed fruit with either (nutella or whipped creme). I asked for nutella, specified NOT whipped creme, and asked how much for additional ice cream. 3 bucks? Great! Check. Until I realized the crepe they gave me had no Nutella on the way to my car. I went back, let them know, and chaos ensued. Rapid discussion amongst staff, confusion, inability to find my receipt, despite me saying my partner and I clearly recalled both asking for and paying for nutella (this crepe was almost $9 bucks), total disorganization as the line got longer and longer and I felt worse and worse at raising simple concern I hadn't gotten ingredient I paid for. They insisted I hadnt paid (despite not being able to find my receipt and me clearly remembering the additional cost). They ended up holding up the line trying to sort this all out which I offered a very simple solution for, find the receipt or just give me a side of nutella, you dont need to re-make the crepe, its fine, all good. Except it wasnt. They refused, asked me to pay for nutella which I had both asked and paid for. It was all so frustrating I left. 
It's just nutella, except its not, its the one ingredient I got in my car for, its the line of tons of people not getting attended to, and being made to feel like It was my fault. Really, really negative experience all around.

Also, canned mango? Awesome. Super happy I wasted $9.
author: leandra l.

description: The creeps are rally yummy here. Only reason I gave it four instead of 5 because it is a little bit pricey and they don't substitutions. I wanted Swiss cheese instead of cream cheese and they said no, which made me sad.
author: Okapi C.

description: This place would have received 4 stars, but a $10 minimum for credit card for a dessert place is so inconvenient. I ordered a lychee ice cream + custard crepe. The lychee ice cream was creamy and had the perfect lychee flavor.
