There were slightly too much whipped cream for my liking, but that was overlooked because the custard meshed well with all the flavors. If you flatten the crepe and spread the ice cream, then you can easily eat the crepe like a sandwich. It's light and satisfying for dessert.
author: Melanie H.

description: perfect for those days when you want dessert late at night, and feel like freezing your butt off at the same time (seating is limited to benches just inside the door, and some outside). crepes are pretty good size and good for sharing (but it's dessert, who shares), and the egg puffs are fresh and have a good crispy webbing to chewy bubble ratio.
author: Heather F.

description: I only come here for their famous crepes, although they do have a lot of interesting snacks and random stuff for sale since it's also a mini mart. The only other thing I would consider buying is a bag of green tea kit kats! Anyway, I love their sweet crepes. I've been coming here for years, but I think their prices have gone up and quality has gone down a bit. Two crepes with Nutella, vanilla ice cream, strawberries and bananas cost almost $18 yesterday... Which I think is overpriced considering they don't put as much fruit in it as they used to. They're still delicious though and the smell of freshly made crepes keeps luring me in!
author: Stephanie G.

description: YUMMMM!! As you walk by the smell makes you stop... once you try the crepes, I assure you you'll become a regular! And best of all, it opens late!!
author: Fiorella L.

description:
Call me coward but I did not enjoyed their ice cream crepes as much. Did not quite satisfied my dessert craving. I ordered:

- Lychee ice cream crepe

- Green tea ice cream crepe = added strawberry and banana

- Strawberry and whip cream crepe

As much as I would like to give higher rating, this place did not do it for me. I wish they gave more scoop of ice cream for their crepe instead of just one. I had better else where.
author: Owie N.

description:
I got a "mixed fruit" and nutella crepe here. Mixed fruit consisted of mango, strawberries, and bananas. It was unlike most crepes I've had in the past! The crepes were actually really crispy kinda almost like a really, really flattened out fortune cookie. It was so tasty! Especially dipped in nutella! It's actually pretty huge when you get it, and there's really quite a bit of fruit in there (not like some places where they "decorate" the crepe with a couple pieces of fruit). 

Food was tasty, however it takes them a long time to crank out those crepes! Luckily they have quite a view aisles of asian snacks, makeup, drinks, and other random stuff to look at while you wait. Made the wait time go by a lot faster!

One star was docked off because the girl who was running the cash register didn't look like she knew how to work the cash register and ended up over charged us for our crepes (she starred at the machine for so long in-between entering things too). I'll be paying more attention to the amount charged, but I definitely plan to make a stop there again in the future.
author: Angel K.

description:
Is it the best Japanese sweet crepe I've had? No, not really. 

But it's not entirely all that bad. The crepe is pretty sizeable and is a good balance between crispy shell and whatever substantial inner filling you choose. It's also not too expensive (give or take $5). That said though, I do wish that they have a design your own ice cream crepe option because I was totally craving green tea ice cream, but didn't really care for the canned lychee. 

They do have two tables outside for sitting and after noon (around 2-3), the sun will be facing the building which proves to be very comfy while you enjoy your crepe.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
There are 3 types of crepes: 1) overpriced but tasty French style crepes 2) average-priced and average-tasty Crepevine crepes 3) inexpensive and very tasty Japanese style crepes.  Seeing that Genki is inexpensive, very tasty, and cutesy Japanese style,  need I write more to justify the stars to luscious piles of whipped cream and toppings surrounded by a delicate paper-thin crepe fresh off the stove.  The fact that it is cone-shaped to be eaten on-the-go brings back childhood memories of ice cream cones from sidewalk ice cream trucks.

(Disclaimer: I didn't actually eat the crepe because I was stuffed from a duck feast from a celebration at China First across the street.  However, seeing the cheesecake crepe with actual chunks of cheesecake, chocolate ice cream, and whipped cream looked delish enough to merit a 4-star vicarious review) 

To convince you that this review is not bogus, I did try the HK egg puffs... a classic street food of my people :D Although I've never tried it before, I have seen it numerous times, whether it be in the native habitat of HK street food stands or imported into the HK style cafes of the SF Bay Area.  I thought the puffs would be hollow, so it was a pleasant surprise to find it filled with a chewy, mochi-like, blueberry-muffin-like filling: what a great addition to the already tasty crispy, freshly browned batter.  

What makes Genki Crepes even more awesome is the mini-mart are aisles of Japanese paraphilia complete with red bean buns (Doraemon's favorite), matcha Kit-Kat (bonus points for the Engrish "macha"), men's hairstyling products, and more.  

Conclusion: Solid crepes, HK egg puffs, and mini-mart--how else could I write a detailed review based on watching a friend eat a crepe, stealing bites of HK egg puffs from another friend, and browsing around the store.  Perfect (vicarious) dessert to complete the birthday celebration :3
author: Edna C.

description:
This would've been at least a 4 star review had I written it a couple of years ago. The first time I was here I ordered the red bean egg waffles and they were DELICIOUS. I grew up eating regular egg waffles from Chinatown in NY but these were so good. It was cooked perfectly as in the inside was soft while the outside was very lightly crispy. 

During this recent visit everything went down hill. I got 3 orders of the red bean egg waffles and 1 order of the melon egg waffles. The egg waffles were completely over cooked to the point that it felt like I was eating crackers. The fragrant red bean flavor was also lost. I always try to visit this place when I'm in San Francisco but now I don't think I'll be as eager to visit anymore.
author: Susan L.

description:
Good crepes and at a reasonable price. Very popular spot so parking is rough. There are tons of different types of crepes. I got the fatty-mc-fat-fat which is ice cream, muthafuckin CAKE, chocolate sauce, and whipped cream. My dining compatriots had more fruit-filled options, but not I!
This was a magical combination of hot and cold, crisp and soft- amazing textures and flavors combining. 
There's also a little store that sells various Japanese paraphernalia in the back.
author: Samir K.

description:
The crepes here are so yummy! I normally get a crepe with nutella and bananas. Simple enough, but the way they make their crepe is perfection. just the right amount of crisp. I tried it once with strawberry ice cream and I felt like it was taking away from the crepe. I always stick to my usual. 

It is located inside a small market that sells snacks. If you use card, there is a $10 minimum. Parking is tricky here on weekends, I normally have to loop around several times. This is a must try if you're in the area.
author: Tina H.

description:
I've been coming to Genki since high school, and while their crepes aren't bad, Genki is definitely not my go-to spot when it comes to crepes. 

Genki's crepes are ridiculously crispy. When you bite into them, it's sort of like biting into a chip. I've tried asking for my crepes to be made less crunchy, but whenever I do, my crepes are made way too soft. Additionally, I always ask for extra Nutella on my crepe, but oftentimes it's still not enough, but that's mostly because the Nutella is usually spread unevenly. 

There is a minimum credit card purchase of $10, which can be a bit hard to reach if there aren't more than two of you. 

Parking is also really scarce depending on when you go. One time I came here and spent more than 30 minutes looking for parking before I decided to give up and go home.

However, one thing I really like about Genki is its late night hours. It's a huge plus for people like me who crave dessert after a late night dinner.
author: Janelle C.

description:
Delicious! 
It's a great dessert option in the Richmond DIstrict! I usually get the strawberry and nutella crepe with ice cream or the cheesecake blueberry crepe. Both very tasty!

While you wait for your order, take a stroll around the store. You will find Japanese candy, snacks, and drinks along an aisle with unique Japanese beauty goods. 

Great shop and will continue to make my way back here!
author: Briana H.

description:
Always a stop for me whenever I go to Ocean Beach. 

I always go for the Strawberry Nutella Crepe with Vanilla Ice Cream and am never disappointed. It's also built into a nice little grocery story which makes it a nice little time waster when waiting for your food! 

10/10 will travel a few minute from the beach for crepes weekly
author: John S.

description:
Crepes are thin and flaky, they have a ton of awesome food, snacks, and anime trinkets. 

I got the blueberry + cheesecake + whipped cream crepe with melon soda. 

Will return.

Ten dollar minimum for card purchases was the only bummer.
author: Danielle B.

description: I had this the first time I visited the Bay Area 10+ years ago. I came back to relive that experience, but was devastated with the first bite where I immediately recognized that artificial green tea ice cream flavor that many cheap restaurants serve after dinner. I'm not sure if it is just my taste palette maturing over these years, if this store changed owners or they started deteriorating over time. I had an inkling of the trouble ahead when I walked in and thought it was noticeably dirtier than my memories had me believe. I also caught a glimpse of the green tea ice cream label before ordering which had cast some doubt in my mind about how good this was going to be. Sophie's in Japan town is now the gold standard to beat.
author: Thomas C.

description:
Cash only unless you order more than $10. 

I came here super excited with high expectations because I've wanted to go here since forever.  However,  I was kind of disappointed with Genki.  The top of the crepe was way too crunchy, and it lacked sweetness.  
It might have also been just because I prefer softer crepes to crunchy, hard crepes....but I thought that Belly Good Cafe & Crepes in Japantown and Q-cup in Milpitas were better.

The really cool thing is that Genki is also a mini-mart, and you can buy Asian goods.
author: Janine M.

description:
Amazing crepes filled with Nutella and banana? YUMMM
Sometimes we just come in for some serious snack shopping. And this place is always a source of amusement because where else will you find a** cookies (Couque D'asses)? It's alo called cat's tongue cookies. The cookies are actually quite delicious but the name is hilarious. :P  Pure marketing genius and Genki is great to carry them. Lol.
author: Missy X.

description: Ran into this place by accident after getting some hot pot. The long line attracted my friends and I to check it out! The menu looked really good and my friends and I got a strawberry nutella crepe. It was so delicious! The crepe was thin and crispy and you can hold the crepe and eat it to go. What a gem in the middle of inner Richmond. It was also cheap! I would definitely stop by again!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
2.5 stars

I must have ordered the wrong thing because my crepe was FLAT and I was jealous everyone else's which were round and full of stuff. I got a custard and banana crepe. Though it satisfied my dessert craving, the crepe was crispy on top and by the bottom it was kind of soft and chewy. It was filled with a thin layer of custard, which I could barely taste because there was more crepe than filling and probably about 3 slices of bananas. For a near $5, I don't think it was worth it, though the line of people at 11pm at night can counter that.

Overall, as I mentioned above - it wasn't bad, but I probably just ordered the wrong thing. I should have gotten a scoop of ice cream or something next time.

On the bright side though, it's inside a tiny market that sells super cute things and snacks that you can browse through (and spend more money on) while you wait for your crepe to be made.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
The best crepe I had ever tasted came from this hole-in-the-wall mini-mart.  This place is like a half Quickly, half 7-11.  We had walked about 20 blocks to get to this place from where we had dinner and so glad that it was worth the walk.

The crepes are crispier than most crepe places will make it and the batter used is just perfect.  My bf and I shared an ice cream and nutella crepe which was heaven.  Their crepe menu is pretty extensive.  The mini-mart has a whole bunch of random stuff thrown on shelves such as razors, figurines, and collectable soda, as well as asian version of snacks such as green tea kit kat.

Definitely a fan and I wouldn't mind coming back!
author: Michelle L.

description: Mmmmmm!!!!! Why aren't you in Vegas??? The flavor of the crepe made into a cone was soft and heavenly.I had the green tea and lychee crepe. I made a mess, I bit off the crepe until I got to the bottom. There is no place I've been to that is like this. I hope youll make your way to my city.
author: Rowena D.

description: Me and my friends came across Genki at 12 in the night just looking for a quick dessert, not sure if a small mart would make good crepes... But man these crepes are so bomb, especially the later at night it is! You can order a crepe cone filled with toppings and ice cream or just get a crepe with fruit and toppings only, or you can even order milk tea and milk shakes too! The crepes are slightly crispy to hold the toppings in but every combination I've had so far has been so delicious. If you're looking for something sweet I would definitely go here!
author: Brianna F.

description:
My fellow Yelper Michelle G. suggested this place a while back and finally made the trek to try out this joint...

...I must have totally missed the boat as the crepe was heavenly!!! :D

Ordered the nutella vanilla ice cream crepe that Yelpers were raving about and it was splendid! The crepe was warm and crispy while the nutella was hardened due to the cold vanilla ice cream. 

The vanilla ice cream was smooth and rich. The entire crepe was topped off with fresh whipped cream.

To think about it differently, the crepe reminded me of the Nestle Drumstick w/ a sugar cone in some chocolate dipped vanilla ice cream!
author: Derek S.

description:
My favorite savory crepe has got to be the beef sukiyaki! I get mines wither with mozarella or swiss. Whichever one works. I also add mushroom in the mix. Its crunchy, juicy, and filled with so much flavor! OMG. it is so good. I would've taken a picture but it tastes better than it looks. 

My favorite dessert crepe has got to be the cheesecake one. Its so delicious. Its rich, creamy, sweet, and so good.

Hands down the best crepes I've ever had.

Bring cash if you're only buying 1. Its a $10 minimum for card.
author: Lena V.

description: Got the Nutella banana Crepe with ice cream  so great all the way down to the last bite!!
author: Amanda D.

description:
So yums! Came here after a mediocre dinner at Halu and this made my night. We were enticed by the egg puffs, but were told there would be a 40-minute wait. WHAT? Ain't nobody got time for that, so we decided to order a crepe instead. We got a nutella, banana, strawberry, & vanilla ice cream crepe to share. It came out pretty quickly and it was so bomb! I hate spending money on crepes because I spent 6 years in French class, where I had to make crepes every semester. I've probably made at least 100 crepes, and they are ridiculously easy & cheap to make. However, this crepe is the bomb diggity and I'm so glad we got it.

We walked around the store and ate our crepe on the bench outside. The egg puffs kept calling our names because it smelled so freaking good. We ended up ordering it (hah, should've just done it earlier because we're fatties and we're used to waiting for food), and it only took 10 minutes! Those were also amazing - reminded me of the egg puffs we had in Shanghai and Hong Kong!

This place is definitely better than Sophie's crepes - if only it wasn't so far from me!
author: Lisa N.

description:
How this place has such high reviews is beyond me!

I ordered a crepe there with my friends the other day and I was greatly disappointed. 

First of all, that place did not look clean and the market part of the store was messy and not well-stocked. 

Secondly, I was really annoyed with the $10 minimum for using a credit card. It's the 21st century, how about we upgrade it. 

Lastly, the crepe didn't even taste good. Mine was burnt and I had high expectations from all of the positive Yelp reviews. Well those are definitely not true!
author: Jacki B.

description:
GENKI, how do you make the crepe batter so damn crispy and delicious?! UGH, I hate that I am craving this as I write this...

My go-to is the strawberry-banana-nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream. The green tea ice cream was a bit disappointing last time, so I now stick with the plain and simple. Perfect as dessert or even a mid-day snack. Heck, I would eat this for lunch. They fill up the cone, so be prepared to devour an amazing crepe and feel quite full and satisfied afterwards. 

Plus, it's inside a small Japanese mini-mart, so you can browse and see all the nifty (sometimes crazy and superficial) products that Asians make/use. Ha.
author: Suji C.

description:
Yummy dessert. I love the ice cream crepes. My go to is the mango strawberry Nutella crepe. Refreshing taste.  I have a sweet tooth and this sweet crepe hits the spot.  

I have not tried the savory crepe yet, but will plan to on my next visit.
author: Melissa M.

description: Yummy! Been going here since high school and we live on the other side of the city. That's how good it is. I alway throw away my number tho... lol if it's late night and you've got a sweet tooth this is the place to be. Defiantly waiting for my friends to crave this again.
author: Sasha M.

description:
Oh my, after all the hype with this place, it's about time I finally tried it!

I came here with my best friend and siblings on a semi-warm afternoon. After having a filling lunch, of course we'd be down for some sweet treats. And naturally, genkis came to mind since I never tried it before. Note: parking is really  scarce here. If you're lucky, you'll prolly find parking by the meter. But if not, residential is your best bet.

I was surprised to find that it was connected to a mini market. I had the idea that it was it's own store, but it's okay, it's pretty convenient. 

My sister ordered a green tea ice cream & red bean paste crepe, I ordered a banana, honey & almond crepe, and my best friend ordered a banana custard crepe. The batter is really crunchy and it's super sweet. It definitely works with the condiments :)

Sucks though cuz they only accept cash :(.

Definitely will come back to try the rest!
author: Jerianne G.

description:
I am crazy for the egg puffs! Kind of like a crepe, if the crepe has the texture of bubble wrap. I ate mine with lychee ice cream, mixing the warm crunch & soft cream.

The flavors of ice cream were great -- lychee, green tea, red bean. Hope to go back and try one of the killer looking crepes next time I'm in the bay area!
author: Rebecca L.

description: Compared to the other Japanese crepe places I have been to, this Japanese crepe place is unique...IN A GOOD WAY! I like how the whole crepe is crispy because it gives it more of a flavor experience. I got the strawberry nutella crepe and my friend got the green tea lychee crepe, and we were definitely both satisfied! The only thing that I was meh about was how we couldn't customize the crepe because I wanted certain toppings with ice cream, but it's alright because the flavor of the crepe was good!
author: Nicole B.

description:
Not normally a crepe fan but i love the crispy-thin-ness of these huge crepes.

I got a strawberry ice cream with nutella and bananas.  In the future I might try different ice creams before I just go with a combo.

i think crepes without the ice cream seem like a great bet too.  

$10 min for card.
author: Jun K.

description: I was a little skeptical walking into an Asian mini mart for dessert but I'm now a Genki fan. If you're seeing the photo..I know it looks disgusting...but it's blueberry cheesecake goodness. It's really sweet and large so you can share but I recommend trying a Genki treat at least once in your life.
author: Janell S.

description:
I want to like this place, but the crepes just doesn't do it for me. It seems lacked luster not only in taste, but in presentation as well. I'm used to the shops in japantown where the ice cream is shaped nicely and is peeking out of the cone, whereas this place is a melted scoop and is halfway into the cone. Drinks are just okay as well, nothing too special. Customer service could use some work as well. There was a time where I wasn't sure if I got the right order or not so I asked the person who handed it to me and she just looked at me, turned away and pretty much avoiding coming near me. 

However, I do like that half of the store is a market, so I can kill time while I wait for my order, but that also means very little space to wait/stand as well. 

Overall, I'll have to give this place a pass.
author: Renee Y.

description:
A must stop if you're in the area or SF proper in general. Loved that this place was open late when I had a sweet tooth craving. The crepes are both filling and delicious. I was expecting one of those dinky crepes you can get at restaurants on a plate, but NOOOO it's a HUGE crepe folded and served like an ice cream cone. ^^

For about $5 a crepe, these are nom nom nom and wallet friendly. I got the strawberry, nutella and cheesecake crepe. I enjoyed every bite of it. The crepe itself was a little crispy and thicker than a normal crepe which I loved. 

There is an asian market right past the crepe stand so you can get your fix of asian snacks and products while you wait for your crepes. 

There are also other snacks like boba and egg puffs. It's also pretty fun standing outside the window and watching the workers make the crepes and waffles! :D
author: Kevin C.

description: It's not too bad but pretty pricey. Paid about $9 for a green tea ice cream crepe with banana, strawberries, and whip cream. It was delicious but this is definitely something I can make easily make at home so pricing it at $7 a crepe plus $1 for each topping is too much.. Plus I usually have to circle around the business 3x before I find parking so.. Unless I'm conveniently in the area, I'll choose to pass.
author: Stephany Y.

description: I like the crepes here, their ice cream is the highlight of the whole thing. I'd get just the ice cream without a crepe actually, because I don't like crispy crepes, like they make it here. I like the soft type like they serve at Belly Good Crepes. That's ok though. The place also sells Asian snacks and other random things like shampoo. They do have a hidden small bathroom in like a janitors closet. They close pretty late for a dessert place, so I'd like to come here late night for a sweet treat.
author: Alice S.

description: I never would have guessed that my favourite dessert in San Francisco would have come from a small Chinese grocery store. The restaurant portion is tucked in the front corner of the store, where you can order a plethora of crepes and ice cream - everything from traditional American flavours to more uncommon ones like Green Tea Ice Cream and Red Bean Paste. I ordered a Chocolate Ice Cream and Cheesecake Crepe, which turned out to be a massive crepe in the shape of an ice cream cone (about the size of a football), stuffed with chocolate ice cream and cheesecake. It's definitely not your traditional crepe, but it's the best one i've ever had by far. I would do anything to go back to San Francisco and get another one.
author: Carolina S.

description:
5 words. Ridiculously bad service, good crepe.

Lets start off with the service. It was horrible! We walked in and immediately, my coworker goes and notice that the girl making the crepe did NOT look happy at all. Her face was literally black and you know she did not want to be there. We finally decided what crepes we wanted and we ordered. My other coworker goes, can I get a SOFT crepe with cheesecake, nutella, marshmallow, and blueberry. The cashier goes to tell us we can't do the blueberry in the soft crepe. My coworker goes, ok that's fine then. (I think she thought they'd make a crispy crepe and add the blueberry but the girl making the crepe misunderstood..but lets continue). Then, as we got our crepe, my coworker goes...uh..there's no blueberry but she charged me for it. Being the sweet girl that she is, she didn't say anything. But basically, they gyped us and OVERCHARGING  us for things that they cannot put in the crepe! 

She should tell us what they can add and what they cannot. Did no do anything to compensate that the fact that the overcharged us. Granted, it was only .85 cents but honestly, it's NOT the money but the principle.  Her crepe in total was 7 bucks and honestly, no worth it. This place just completely irked me the wrong way with people not knowing what they were doing. I ordered a green tea ice cream crepe with nutella and banana. When I got my crepe, the unhappy girl says "Vanilla crepe"...I got..uhhhh, I wanted green tea. IF in fact that it was a vanilla ice cream, I'd make them make another one. Once again, not a big deal but it's the principle that counts!

On the other hand, the crepes were really good. Crepe was perfectly thing and crispy so I've got to give them kudos for that, hence the extra star. But honestly, the service just rubbed me the wrong way. Would really rather try another crepe place next time than this place. I know they have a fan base, but I'm def. not one.
author: Denise L.

description: How can you hate on a crepe? That is seriously just evil. This thin pancake-y goodness filled with nutella, ice cream, and whipped cream...how can you hate it? I like my crepe not too crispy. They do a great job of making the crepe's crispiness perfect. I always order the banana nutella with green tea ice cream. Amazing! I always put nutella and banana in my crepes. Those are just my go-to. If you want to avoid waiting just come on a weekday! My sister and I came on a week-night and it was slow. They close late still so that's a plus for me! My late night cravings are definitely fulfilled. I really should try the other flavors...but I can't help myself.
author: Joey C.

description:
My favorite crepe place!! I go here all the time even when I'm not in the area the trip is well worth it!! 

Strawberry, Nutella, vanilla ice cream crepe with whip cream is the absolute best!!
author: Colleen K.

description: I did not expect this place to be where it was.  It is literally a small crepe place in a small Japanese mart tat sells random drinks and snacks.  Do not be fooled by the looks, as this place makes the best crepes I have ever eaten.  It definitely does live up to the hype, I went on a weekday but I expect during weekends its probably a long line.  The crepe is handheld and a really good size for the price and its really crispy compared to soft at other places, a really good dessert. One of the drawbacks of this place is there isn't much seating just a little outside eating so be warned.
author: Jacky S.

description: Our go to spot for after dinner dessert. The dessert crepes are made just right and will definately satisfy any sweet tooth. We often order a savory crepe to go and perfect for late night munchies. The egg waffles are awesome! Our son loves to snack on these. They must be consumed warm otherwise it becomes hard and stale. Find hard to find imported candy and snacks here. One of my favorite SF stops!
author: Grace H.

description:
The wait is long since its inside a mini Mart but your order will come out fast enough. 

You can pretty much add whatever you want to your crepe for an extra charge. I added Nutella, banana, and green tea ice cream! 

The price is adorable. And it's worth waiting in line.
author: Jennice K.

description: Crepe was pretty good. But the wrap was a bit over cooked and crunchy. I came there with a friend 10 minutes before they closed and thankfully they didn't close down the kitchen area (lots of places do). The place closes at midnight.
author: Chris M.

description:
This is my favorite crepe place in SF! I've tried a couple other ones in the city and I haven't found one that makes the crepe skin with just enough crunch on it. 

I usually only get the sweet crepes with ice cream and fruits or cheesecake, but you can actually mix and match the ingredients to your liking. I love the fact that you can customize it however you like. 

It's nice that they have a couple of benches for people to sit and enjoy their crepes on a nice day which is perfect. 

They also have a huge variety of Japanese candy and snacks so its nice to look around while waiting for your crepe, but its quite overpriced. 

There's also a minimum for credit card purchases so if you're only planning to buy a crepe, bring cash since they're all around $5 each.
author: Maybo L.

description: Seriously one of the best dessert places in SF. Price for the crepes is pretty reasonable, and it's fun to buy different Asian candies/drinks/snacks while waiting. Only annoying thing is that you can't pay with a card if your order is less than $10.
author: Betty B.

description: Not a big fan of desert so I wasn't expecting much from this place, boy was I wrong! Their savory crepes are no joke, would drive an hour just to get my hands on one! Haven't tried anything else here but will eventually.
author: Van P.

description:
Ahhhh! I'm so surprised I haven't written a review for Genki Crepes yet. I've been going here for the past 3 to 4 years, and it's hands down my favorite crepe place. EVER. 

I love how the crepe itself comes out CRISPY, warm, and sweet. Theres a wide selection of toppings and ice cream you can put inside your crepe, BUT THEIR WHIPPED CREAM IS FREAKING ON POINT AND TO DIE FOR. They also have premade combinations of crepes, and the green tea ice cream/red bean paste is on the top of my list. I alternate between that one and a vanilla ice creme/nutella/banana + whipped cream crepe!

This place is also a cute little Japanese markets that sells things like green tea Kitkats and Pocky all the way to Gatsy hair products and Shiseido face masks. They also sell the POP! vinyl figures that I collect. yay!
author: Linh H.

description:
Could a brother walk into a place for a sugary crepe fix and some Asian snacks WITHOUT hearing "nigger" and "f*ck" repeatedly coming loudly out of the loudspeaker radio? Cuz, that's what happened yesterday around lunchtime with two guys working there. Not cool. 

Now, I know this place plays a lot of jankey trendy music (read: auto-tuned until your ears bleed), but usually I ain't hearing all that. Gee, that would've been extra fun with the kids, and kids of course like to go since they have lots of sweets & toys. C'mon now. Quit frontin' like you a Tenderloin night club or filming a rap vid; y'all make French crepes on Clement Street's Chinatown on sunny Thursday -- dude, own it.
author: Ziggy J.

description:
My first time trying this place and my tummy thanked me after. Ordered the brownie crepe for me and banana, strawberry, whipped cream with nutella for hubby. Their crepe was crunchy, not the typical soggy/soft ones you can get somewhere else. I love that it gives a crunch when you bite into it and it goes perfectly with whatever ingredients you have in there. Hubby went back for round two after he devoured the first one and that says something about the quality of food they serve. 

They also have a mini mart where you can shop and get some asian goodies while you wait for your crepes. Their prices were affordable and budget friendly which is a big plus for me. It's far off from me so this place will definitely be my go to place whenever I'm in town.
author: Joy P.

description:
Came here after dinner at Troya with the fam.  Got the Crepe with Lychee ice-cream smothered in custard, the Crepe with Green tea ice-cream and red bean paste, warm fresh Vanilla Egg Puffs and the Thai Tea milkshake.

Crepes don't taste entirely fresh and soft, but the ice-cream and sauces in it are SO good.  4.5 stars.
author: Letitia L.

description: Amazing crepes! Just visiting through San Fran, but I've already been there twice in the three days I'm staying! Fast service, fresh made crepes, & generous servings--what more could you ask for? The crepes themselves are delicious as well :)
author: Christina J.

description: Genki is my to-go spot for snacks and crepes. I can vividly remember coming here when I was still in high school! Now I've successfully completed both college and grad school and it's still around! Amazing--since most stores open then pick up and leave within a small time period in the city. Genki has a variety of Japanese candies, chips, drinks, make-up, toys and accessories. The selection is overwhelming and I feel that the store has become more cluttered over the years. It's nice to look around and see what you can find in the sea of merchandise. I usually come here for the crepes when Japantown is closed. This time like every other time, I ordered the mixed fruit with green tea ice cream and my sister and her boyfriend ordered the green tea ice cream crepe with red bean. I don't know if it's me being away in LA for too long but when I kindly asked the cashier to have both nutella and whipped cream in my crepe (because I love to indulge!) she rejected my request. I was willing to pay more for it but she said that it would throw the chef off. It was either one or the other.?!?!?!?!?!?!?! I'm still alarmed by her comment. It doesn't take a genius to add a spread of nutella to the crepe, scoop a scoop of ice cream, top it with some mixed fruits and spritz some whipped cream on the top. But rules are rules and in this case, they weren't meant to be broken. I didn't want to make a scene and delay the long line behind me so I decided to go with the whipped creme. My crepe was a little naked. There was an inch of unfilled crepe crust spewing from the top. But all in all, it was a mediocre crepe. My only complaints were: the whipped creme tasted funny and the bananas were 2 inch long (not bite-size). Nothing special, but I'd probably come here again since it brings back fond memories from the past.
author: Amy T.

description: Ordered the green tea ice cream with red bean and lychee crepe with strawberry toppings. Highly recommend the green tea ice cream with lychee crepe. Wasn't a huge fan of the red bean. Also ordered the egg puffs and would recommend to others.
author: Kathy D.

description:
This is my go to crepe place...
-when I'm not satisfied with my meal prior
-when I don't want to drive to Japantown
-when I want a crepe just cause

The vanilla ice cream with strawberries and nutella never disappoint.  The crepe has a nice texture- not too crispy or soft.

*Tip:  Fold the tip of the cone on the bottom to prevent leakage
author: Linda N.

description: Ordered the nutella crepe and it was super yummy!  However, the hubby said his crepe was a bit soggy compared to mine.
author: Candice H.

description:
Came to this place after having dinner in SF with Davis Racing Dragon and UCLA's dragon boat team! I was really full from dinner and wasn't in the mood for some crepes but one of my friends convinced me to try one especially since I heard this place is really popular for their crepes. Pricing here is decent as well. 

Had my first bite and I fell in love! Who doesn't love a crepe with ice cream, nutella, and/or fruits in it!? It was so good. I have yet to try their other crepes with like ham, cheese, and other stuff in it. But I think I will get another of their ice cream crepe when I come back to SF and I am craving for a dessert crepe!

I recommend eating at this place as a dessert and if you are craving for crepes :]
author: Amy T.

description:
This is my late night go to place for dessert place.

Call me weird, but before I start choosing my ice cream crepe, I usually try the ice cream first.

The ones I have tried so far are:
Vanilla Ice Cream + chocolate cake (2/5)
-Chocolate cake was very dry, and I didn't really like it. I just finished the crepe and the ice cream instead. 
Chocolate Ice Cream + Cheesecake(3/5)
- Good mix, but luckily I was sharing this one with a friend. The cheesecake was a bit too much for me. If you're a big fan of cheesecake, go for it. 
Mango Ice Cream + Strawberry(4/5)
Strawberry Ice Cream + Kiwi  (4/5)
Vanilla Ice Cream + Strawberry (4/5)

Try to give everything a chance! I personally think getting other fillings other than dessert is weird. Sorry I cant review nutella because im allergic to hazelnut. Unless you pay me and give me an epipen, Ill try this for you haha
author: Allan W.

description:
#14 - Turkey, avocado, jack cheese, and sour cream crepe = so yummy!! And it's open late daily! Fast and decent customer service.

Doubles as a mini mart so there's bottled drinks and snacks.
author: CK G.

description: Can't go wrong with a late night crepe. Always smells so good right before you're about to walk in the store.
author: Rommel A.

description:
I probably would have missed this place if my friend hadn't stopped in front of me. When you look inside, you'll see that most of this place is a little Asian marketplace filled with a bunch of asian snacks you could find at 99Ranch, so that was unexpected. Multi-tasking, I see...very nice. Genki Crepes is at the front, next to the window. They had one cash register for both the little market and the crepe area so I can see how that could be a pain if I just wanted to buy one thing from the market and there were a bunch of people standing around waiting for crepes or to order. 

I got the Lychee ice cream crepe with custard and whipped cream on top and honestly, it was just okay. I've tried crepes in a lot of places, and I mean it did satisfy my cravings but it was pretty ordinary. I appreciated all the different choices though! I will definitely come back and try other things, both savory and sweet. The crepe itself was crispy on the outside edges, which I love because you get two textures and not just a floppy soft crepe. But what I was a little surprised by was the fact that the crepe by itself was definitely salty. I could TASTE the salt....and crepes usually have a hint of sweetness. It was interesting...but I think I would prefer a sweet crepe covering instead to complement the sweet ice cream, custard, and whipped cream inside. 

But do get the whipped cream! It wasn't too sweet and was really good.

Tip: when you get the crepe, it's basically a cone....so to get the most out of it, press down on it with both hands so that it's a little bit more flattened out. You can now bite into it like a sandwich! If you try eating it as is, around the edges as you would an ice cream cone, it'll get super messy and you won't get enough crepe per bite!
author: Kelly T.

description: Great crepes--so many options! They have savory and sweet crepes, and I often frequent this place. There is an Asian mini mart with it, with Asian drinks and snacks. Good atmosphere, clean, and friendly staff. The egg puffs and the #4 ice cream crepe are heavenly!
author: Tianna L.

description:
Whao, if it wasnt for the word Crepe in its name, I would have never expected it to be a crepe place. It's easy to overlook if you have never been here before because its slipped into the middle of a restaurant&grocery store and it looks like a convenient store, which it is. Inside, they sell japanese/korean imported beauty items, lots of good Asian snacks, some random household products, cold drinks, and many more. 

Just go for the dessert crepes! I love to customize my own crepe like usual, so I get the original batter with strawberry ice cream, strawberry fruit, mango fruit, whipped cream, and nutella. One thing I did not like was how they just put the entire half of the strawberry in which made the crepe collapse faster due to the weight of it. My total came out to be $7.22 (including tax).  However, if you dont know what you want just choose from their set combinations on their menu, which might be a little cheaper than customizing. They also sell snacks like egg puffs here which I find pretty tasty! They make it on the spot so it's very hot and fresh. 

Down side is they dont have seats, but they have one bench inside, which is not great when you have a group and even worse when theres a bunch of people there, you will definitely not find seats. Unless you can walk and eat, or stand the freezing cold, you will not be eating the crepe comfortably. 

they do take cards, but only if it's over $10!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/genki-crepes-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#-L9dgy8uGSPfXueMBgmSZw
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/genki-crepes-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#5_myuUVyZp9B-MAPhzagEg
author: Chena N.

description: Will this little shop is allway busy owill i love the dessert an u can stuck up on snack praking is not that heard to fine i love the strawberry and mango crepes or the mix crepes but pay a little bit more an they have the green tea ice cream with reb bean will i hope u have a happy Sunday an injoy rhe rest of your evening
author: Miko A.

description: The dessert crepes here are a must! I usually always get #1: Vanilla Ice Cream + Strawberry (option to choose between Banana or Mango or Strawberry or Nutella) + Whipped Cream. They are also pretty flexible about the ice cream flavor and you can even choose between Green Tea Ice Cream, Lychee, and Red Bean! Genki Crepes is always a delicious dessert option and this is our typical dessert spot if we're eating dinner in the Inner Richmond. All the dessert crepes are around $5.00. Make sure to bring cash if you're only buying one crepe- there is a $10 minimum for credit cards.
author: Grace L.

description: Their crepe are pretty good. Its crispy and hot.  Sometime the line is a little long. But they are pretty quick. Service with a smile does exist. The store has nothing... Crepe is good if you are in this area, since there are no other near by and there are better. Downside CASH only... Come on , it's 2017 !
author: Danny H.

description: You would think adding all those ice cream, Nutella, or/or whipped cream would make the crepe all soggy by the time it got to you but nope! The crepe was crunchy and held its figure quite nicely. I got the green tea ice cream with mangoes, strawberries, and whipped cream. It was delicious. My boyfriend opted for the strawberry I cream with strawberries and banana. Word of advice don't skip out on the whipped cream or Nutella, it's... Very bland. Not something to go crazy over but for some reason those two toppings totally change the whole experience.
author: Linda L.

description:
Been coming here for years.

My favorite is the lychee ice cream and red bean with whip.

I always take my friends and family from out of state here.
author: Teresa S.

description:
I saw that this place had a really high review average on Yelp so I stopped by, and wow am I glad that I did. Here I had the best crepe I've had in my life. No, I wasn't on something nor am I exaggerating when I make this bold statement. I got a sweet crepe with vanilla ice cream and nutella (hazelnut chocolate spread) and man was it delicious. 

The thing that sets these crepes apart from the rest of the pack is the crepe itself rather than what goes inside. It's freshly prepared, warm, and flaky with a crunchy consistency. I'm used to thick, chewy crepes that feel like pancakes, so this place definitely raised the bar for me when it comes to crepes.

My crepe was pretty big and made for a snack that could substitute itself in place of a meal. For all of that crepe it was only $4.95, which was way worth it. They have a large selection of sweet crepes with ice cream and assorted fruits, in addition to savory crepes with hot links, onions, cheese, meats, etc. 

The store itself is not only a crepe place but doubles as a Japanese corner store. They have 4 decent-sized aisles of Asian snacks, drinks, toys, and cosmetic products, which I found cool. 

I definitely recommend this place to anyone walking around Clement.
author: Stephen D.

description:
Wow this place has delicious crepes! I love the assortment of flavors they have. Most places only have the basic ice cream crepe with fruit and whipped cream. But this place has a cheesecake crepe, with blueberry sauce and whipped cream! Highly recommend if you like cheesecake. The almond milk tea was alright, nothing too special but it's good enough. I like the crispiness of the crepe too, it's not too crispy but not too soft either. 

Definitely will be coming back! I like how they have an assortment of Japanese snacks and candies as well.
author: Natalie W.

description: Genki is a completely below average establishment that makes unimpressive creeps that are incredibly high price. Unfortunately this isn't what encourage me to write this poor review. The service at Genki is horrible and the cashiers are rude and difficult to work with. I am completely disappointed with my experience and will NOT be returning. Thanks!
author: Albert H.

description:
Genki's Crepes til the day I die! 
Sweet or savory- this is your go-to place for crepes in the city.
 
Let me start off by talking about the egg puffs. Not too buttery and not too thick in the consistency of the batter. Perfect after-meal snack to munch on. Honestly, my favorite part was the smell of it. 

I recommend getting the vanilla, green tea, and red bean ice cream crepes! If you're going with friends, make sure at least one of you get nutella in it. It's a game-changer. The combination of the crepe, nutella, and ice cream is a party in yo mouth. What I love about the actual crepe is its slight chewiness with the tips being nice and crispy. 

There's not much seating except for a small bench since a majority of the space is a mart.
author: Jane S.

description:
I came here with my mom and my sister late at night. There was 3 people working there: a guy in the kitchen, a cashier, and another girl. The girl who was the cashier took my money, and my order together with other customers. She was wearing gloves. She then came in the kitchen and helped the guy. NEVER once she changed her gloves or washed her hands, she used the same gloves she touched money to prepare and TOUCH foods. At the same time, the other girl changed the bag of the garbage bin right in front of chairs full of customers eating. My mom got so mad. She said it was so disgusting and disrespectful.

I came here again because I think that the girl might forget to change her gloves and everyone makes mistake so she deserves a second chance. This time was the worst. The cashier was a different girl received money with bared hands and she NEVER ONCE WASHED HER HANDS before she prepared foods. She used the same hands she touched money before to touch foods. 

Its the law that you have to wash your hands before you prepare foods or even after you touch your face and hairs. It was good that I took a picture of that girl cutting bananas with her bared hands after touching money. I think that its probably not her problem but the owners's. They do not require their employees to wash hands or changing gloves after touching money. Thats why its so normal that the cashier can help the kitchen guy when its busy. They should know that money is very very very dirty!!!!!

I will never come back to this store and I hope the Department of Public Health will work on this case!
author: Petit L.

description: Some of the best crepes I have ever had. Me and my friends go all the time and I am always suggesting this place to new people. My personal favorite is the Nutella crepe with bananas and whip cream. Such a perfect treat, it has for sure become my favorite dessert place.
author: Sky G.

description:
Crepes!! I'm not a huge fan of sweets but this is what I consider "eye candy". Who needs all these 5 stars and thousands of reviews when your crepes are that beautiful. 

So I had to order the classic strawberries, nutella and whipped cream crepe. I kinda wish that I got it with ice cream but I guess it was too cold anyways.

We had to park a few blocks away because it was impossible to find parking anywhere. As I munched on my treat, I swear that I barely made it down a block before I finished it and wanted more. 

Other than the crepe, I wasn't able to try anything during my visit. They have a nice little store that sells a bunch of Asian treats in the back and they even have those infamous Kit Kat bars that people love. 

The service is okay too, they have a bunch of workers behind the counter but there's usually a long line so I guess they just want to speed things up.

** $10 CREDIT CARD MINIMUM**
author: Wiseley F.

description:
I LOVED this place. We walked here after dinner to get some dessert. It is located in a little store of all the best Asian candies/desserts/yogurt drinks/gummies that I grew up eating in my childhood. We ordered at the counter and brought our desserts outside to eat standing on the sidewalk--there aren't any tables to sit down but we didn't mind because it was sunny and breezy outside. 

My husband and I ordered an ice cream cone of lychee ice cream. Only in San Francisco can you find lychee ice cream...and it was excellent! I've seen lychee ice cream done in a sorbet but I really enjoyed the way that Genki Crepes makes it creamy/rich. 

Our friend ordered a strawberry and whipped cream crepe--you can also add ice cream if you so desire. I love that they roll up the crepe in a way that you can hold it in your hand and eat it just like an ice cream cone. I'm definitely coming back to try their crepes and other ice cream flavors!
author: Lizzy L.

description:
4 Reasons Why I Love Genki Crepes:
1. The crepe pancake itself is chewy and moist. One of the best I've had.
2. Whip cream tastes like real whip cream.
3. There's a candy store connected so you can browse around for a bunch of Asian snacks!
4. They open late. Great place to get your night time munchies!

Got the green tea crepe with red bean and egg puffs, but since there was a $10 credit card minimum, I also added in the Meiji Choco gummies.

I like how they flip the bottom of the crepe holder so the fillings won't drip onto you!

The egg puffs are alright. Eggettes have better egg puffs!

There's only 1 bench where you can sit. Wish they had more seating!
author: Vicki L.

description: Green tea ice cream with red bean paste crepe was good! The ice cream had more of a natural tea flavor rather than the usual sweet/cream flavor which I liked. The red bean was evenly distributed and the crepe itself wasn't too hard or soft. Good assortment of Pocky and other Asian snacks to buy.
author: Josh L.

description: What a find! Came here on a whim after going to the famous Burma Superstar across the street. Got the Green tea + Nutella + Strawberry with Whipcream crepe. It was delicious, unlike a lot of other places you get the crepe in a cone like shape. The crepe was remarkably crispy and the green tea was really good especially for a place that isn't specializing in ice cream. About 6-7 dollars a crepe, but they give you a massive serving!
author: Pat C.

description:
Crepes were relatively inexpensive, not clear about the customizing options. 
The crepe itself was very crunchy all the way through without being burnt; kept it from getting soggy as fast. Cash only for purchases under $10
Interesting posts on the bulletin board.
author: Trang B.

description:
So many different ones to choose from. We tried the Nutella and banana, mango ice cream and strawberry, and the smoked salmon cream cheese one. All of them were great! Thin and crispy crepes with good sized portion fillings.

Another plus is all the Asian snacks, candy, and drinks you can choose from.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Genki crepes are crunchy and generously filled. I love how it's also attached to an Asian market where you can grab snacks! Their hours are long so when all the others crepe places are closed, you can come here to fulfill your craving.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
So far my favorite crepe place in San Francisco so far!

When I first got there I was a tad surprised it was a tiny crepe store within a little grocery store. I'll admit the day I went, the two girls working there (I assume they are in high school) were just so lackluster. I could barely hear what the girl was asking when she was taking my order. I mean I'm sure these highschoolers would rather be out with these friends but just suck it up and up their personality a little.

Good thing the crepes were delicious! We got the red bean ice cream with banana and whipped cream. It was just perfect and heavenly :)
author: Kristina L.

description:
Genkis crepes are the best around. The crepes come in the shape of a cone and you can basically put whatever you want in it. I usually get Nutella with bananas and vanilla ice cream. The outside is thin and crisp which works really well with all the filling.

This place is also a mini-mart so while you're waiting for your crepes to be made, you can browse around for all your favorite Asian snacks and candy.
author: Amberlynn A.

description:
YUMMY!!!

Chocolate with cheesecake crepe!

Love that this place is a grocery store/hole-in-the-wall. The place is more of a to-go type of business model, but there is seating area and a bathroom in the store. Prices are decent, it's about $6/crepe. 

The service is fast, and the crepes are made to order + they're more than enough to eat for one person. I would share. There's seating along the wall in the store, but if you're on a date, take the girl a stroll! =]
author: Christina L.

description:
Genki Crepe is located in Richmond District of San Francisco. It took us about 15 minutes to get there on a St. Patrick's weekend after window shopping at Union Square. Also, parking was not difficult to find. This is not just a creperie, it is also a Japanese mini mart. Customer service is alright and they take credit cards. 

They offer three main categories of crepes: snack, desserts, and savory. There are literally more than 30 options for you in the menu, and you can still choose to make your own crepe. I went for a desserts crepe with honey dew ice cream and strawberry. Here, the crepe is not soft as being served at a French creperie, it is crispy.
author: Chau V.

description:
It's one of those places that you wait for your number to be called when your order is ready. Good thing it has a bunch of snacks and knick knacks to keep you busy while you wait. 

My dessert crepe of strawberry ice cream with nutella and whip cream was deeeelicious. I think it's because the ice cream was pretty solid within the warm, crispy crepe that had a nice melted layer of nutella in it along with the right amount of whipped cream that gets onto the corners of your mouth with each bite. It's the kind of bite you don't mind looking silly for. 

Sooo good. And the girl that served me looked anime. I felt like I was in a cartoon.
author: Sharon B.

description: So so so glad I found this place while visiting San Francisco! I highly recommend checking out this place while you're in town. It's a crepe shop attached to a Japanese market. There's a variety of flavors and the quality is amazing. There's also the option to get ice cream, even though I didn't because it was cold, but I am definitely going to try that next time!
author: Demi K.

description:
After Cajun house, we decided to grab a sweet dessert here on a Saturday afternoon. We got the chocolate ice cream with cheesecake crepe (6) and strawberry crepe (4) for $11. 

- I heard that Genki means good. Like Genki desu ka
- Gets busy fast. Good thing we came at the right time. After our order a hoard of college students came. 
- At first I thought this was Genki Living. LOL. It's not. Similar name. It's also a snack and toy store! Cool combo! 
- Crispy crepe. Almost overcooked. 
- Lots of ice cream and cheesecake! even at the bottom of the crepe!
- Your choice of whip cream! get it! free. 
- Lots of strawberries!
- Cheap. Not bad for $6 for an Ice cream crepe
- A must-go if you're in the area! 
- Still my all time fave crepe stop has to be Belly Good Crepes in Japantown. The cat crepe is just too cute with the frosted flake ears! aww! haha. xD
author: Chris C.

description:
Disappointed --
** The place: Grocery store + crepe front, "outdoor seating"= 1 tiny table

** Turkey/avocado crepe? Crepe was really crispy, Asian-style (tasted like thin fortune cookies). Better for sweet toppings, and the avocado was way too mushy and sorta brown, turkey was too slimy for me

** Egg puffs? They gave me chocolate ones instead of regular, buh. Tasted like coco krispies, too sweet for me and not chewy enough. They're also smaller than most egg puffs I've had elsewhere. 


Overall, it's okay if you're around and want a snack maybe...but eh.
author: Kristie C.

description:
I'm surprised I haven't written a review here..

So you know that one place you love to whore your visiting friends out to? This is my spot -- I take ALL my visiting friends here. NO SHAME.  

This review is based SOLELY on the crêpes.  It's personally my favorite.  I love that it's crispy but soft as well. I've had it with ice cream and I've had it with just whipped cream.  Still can't tell which one I love more.  haha Banana with Nutella is my go-to.  I had the strawberry last time and it was alright.  I think with strawberries, it can be a hit or miss with the strawberry (sometimes it's so bitter) but bananas, you usually can't go wrong.  

I seem to always luck out with parking here as well so YAY :) Thank you, Food Gods.  Street parking is the easiest in this area.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Genki Crepes sells more than crepes. it's also a japanese minimart
-sundries, beauty lotions,
-mochi, ice cream, soda, coffees, milk teas
-snacks, cookies, candies,
-ramen, japanese condiments, groceries

menu: sweet & savory crepes, smoothies, iced teas, blended drinks, hot drink

eats: mushroom, spinach, jack cheese savory crepe (5.15)
-took option of having crepe in a cone shape, very convenient
-deliz., every bite tasted fresh. 
-made to order. just a few minutes.
-cheap, probably a few $$ more elsewheres.
5 stars for good value, cheap eats.

crumbs:
-no seating available, just one bench..
author: Victor G.

description:
I've been to Genki's Crepes twice. Mainly for crepes.

I forgot what I ordered the first time, but this time I ordered #2 (green tea ice cream with either lychee or red bean paste). I opted for lychee based on my friend's recommendation.

The crepe itself didn't take too long to be ready. They give you a generous amount of ice cream and they put fruits both on top of the crepe and at the bottom of the crepe which is nice. I've never had lychee with green tea before but the combo isn't bad. I think I would prefer to have green tea ice cream with red bean paste though.

I like Genki's crepes because they make their crepes crispy. Other people might like softer crepe, but I like it crispy. This is the only other place that sells crepes that I approve of.

I like that they sell Asian snacks in the store too. I was so stoked to get green tea kit kats. They weren't there though....so I got oreo candy bars and oreo matcha green tea sticks. The snacks are pretty cheap and the novelty items are fun to look at.

Overall, okay place. I like it there.
author: Sofia R.

description:
This is a crepe/market place. I"m definitely amazed. They sell green tea kit kat here for 6.99! Apparently,the cheapest you can find!

They have a wide variety of crepes and egg puffs. First, I've seen peanut butter egg puffs, in fact, more than just three types of flavors. Unfortunately, I got the crepe instead. Green tea with red bean ice cream crepe! It was really delicious, but I just had a 7 course beef meal so I was able to eat a half before tossing it away. My heart felt a stabbed when I left half of my crepe behind. 

However, I will be back, and next time IT WILL BE WITH AN EMPTY STOMACH so I can eat to my heart desires without wasting any food.
author: Josie H.

description:
A hidden gem. When I first walked in, I thought it was a small asian grocery store, but I was pleasantly surprised when there was a crepe shop within the store. 

I ordered the strawberry Nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream. It was unusually warm in San Francisco, so it was a refreshing dessert for summer. The crepe was crispy and did not soak up the melted ice cream like I thought it would, which was a plus. 

The mixture of crepe, ice cream, and fruits make it enjoyable for almost everyone, from kids to older adults.
author: Joy L.

description:
These crepes are holy lordy GOOOOD. What is it about them that makes them different from any other dessert crepe..... Maybe the crunchy texture? Definitely the thoughtful fillings. Quality. Even the blueberry sauce cheesecake crepe wasnt too overly rich or sweet. That is the key- perfect balance. 

Also it doesnt hurt that the wait for Burma just across the street is usually hours long & why not get a crepe whilst waiting!
author: Lisa K.

description: Thanks to yelp, found this place. Went there for lunch and my 7 year old daughter couldn't find a savory crappe that sounded good, so she ordered the fruit one. I ordered the Char Sui one, but forgot that it had seaweed on it. As I was eating it, I noticed it tasted like the ocean and thought maybe the meat had gone bad. I don't recommend the char sui one with seaweed and cheese. I will be back, but will get one with ice cream next time.
author: Chris S.

description:
This is the only crepe place that I have been to while in the Richmond District.  This place is average; there is nothing that really sets this place apart from other crepe places.  It is clear that this place gets business because it is in such a good location.  There are a lot of surrounding restaurants that are open late.  The actual crepe making area is rather small, being enclosed by a sort of small junk food mart.  I would assume that most people wander around the store while their crepes are being made.  

The GF and I ordered a dessert crepe with kiwi, mango ice cream, and whip cream.  The crepe was made in a few minutes.  The presentation was as one could expect from an average crepery.  The crepe itself has a slightly salty taste to it.  Usually the dessert  crepes I have eaten are sweet and soft.  It did not bother me too much though.  The ice cream was the star of the crepe.  I absolutely love mango ice cream.  

There are some benches to sit on while eating the crepe.  Other than that, there is nothing much to say.  I would probably come back again, but would highly recommend trying the crepes at Belly Good Cafe and Crepes in Japantown.  Those are the best.
author: Victor L.

description:
Best Crepes in all of SF.  It's a grocery store, but don't be fooled.  So many options, and quick service.  The crepe isn't too dry, moist, hot, and the ice cream inside is the kicker.  I come here all the time when I'm around the Richmond, sometimes I even journey just to go to Genki.

Pick up some Asian candy on the way out :)
author: Andy V.

description: Amazing crepes with a crispy outer. They serve it in a cone shape which make it easy to eat on the go. The beef sukiyaki savory crepe was good.
author: Ryan L.

description: Nothing more to say other than the best crepes ever! I'll usually have it with ice cream or cheesecake bites. Recently had mixed fruit and whipped cream which was awesome. You really can't go wrong with any of the options they are all so good. My sister lives nearby, whenever I visit her, I make it a point to come here.
author: Mike S.

description: Good crepes and there wasn't a long line. I made a terrible mistake of adding cheesecake to my crepe. It was way too sweet and I got really full off of it. I'm a girl who will finish her entire crepe and not share a single bite. But my crepe, I couldn't finish because of that cheesecake. It was too much, but hey if you're a HUGE cheesecake fan, it'll be worth it. They don't skimp you out of it at all. Next time I'll just get a much simpler crepe. NOT TOO SHABBY THOUGH and not too pricey.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
Second time visiting Genki and it is just the best! They have awesome Asian candy snacks and they are so cheap compared to back home. We stacked up. They even had my hair product (which I've only seen in Asia and maybe Vancouver). Best part was that they were on sale so I got four of them. I am set for life now (well, for at least a couple years).

We also got two scoops of ice cream ($5) with bean paste. We tried green tea and red bean. Both were good, nice snack after lunch but I have to say the ice cream crepes are way better. Too bad my sis can't eat the crepe part. All good though.

Love this place for their dessert and all the goodies they have in the back.
author: Jonny M.

description:
It's been a while since I've had a crepe, and a good one on that note. With all the hot gossip bouncing around here and there, I had to put Genki on bookmark for my places to hit up in San Francisco!

Made weekend plans to come here with hood rat Amy W. for dessert! The sweet smell of crepes that greets you definitely works up your appetite. I had the mango ice cream with strawberry crepe and Amy had the green tea ice cream with lychee crepe. The total came out to be $10 plus tax, which isn't bad for crepes!  There's a $10 minimum for debit/credit purchases, which worked out perfectly! We get our number, wait about 5 minutes for our orders, and were on our way. Besides a bench, there isn't much seating, but the place is meant more to grab-and-go.

This has got to be the most memorable crepe I've ever had! From start to finish, the crepe didn't fall apart or get all sloppy like other crepes. If it's one thing that I distinctly remember, it's definitely the crisp and the warmth of the crepe against the ice cream. The whipped cream had a nice delicate fluff and the ice cream had the perfect texture, all evenly distributed so that you get a bit of everything with each bite. They're also very generous with the ice cream! The strawberries were fresh, but overly sour for my taste. It could've just been the time of day, but the overpowering sourness became too distracting for me to enjoy. Don't worry about having ate all the fruit on top - there's also fruit at the bottom to balance things out.

Genki is also a supermarket that sells all sorts of Asian goodies and cutesy knick-knacks. I like how they sell certain things in bulk because I can never have enough of my favorite munchies! The staff here are super friendly and work quick with their hands, but still take great care in preparing your order. I'd be down for another visit the next time I'm in the area and need a crepe fix!
author: Peter L.

description:
Such a glorious place to hit up for dessert after dinner. I usually go for the green tea ice cream crepe with red bean. Not too sweet, and the flavors are all stamped for approval by generations of Asians, so you can't go wrong. 

Small storefront, but there's negligible amounts of seating and you can always wander over to the park. 

If you're too lazy to make the trek to Japantown for Asian trinkets, they got 'em by the bucketload in the back.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Worth the trip through the filthy streets of Clement...dont believe me..look down at your feet.

I always order the nutella, caramel, and bannana. It is warm and it all melts together..it is heavenly.

I personally do not care for their savory crepes.

You can sit on the bench outside if you dont mind fending off the pigeons. I prefer to eat mine whilst walking.
author: David G.

description: I love this crepe, salty or sweet both is very good. I ate of beef, and the second strawberry and nutela. Try once, you will  return to try others flavors. Always I have a good a treatment
author: Nayara B.

description: I just moved into the neighborhood and couldn't be more pleased to have this awesome place a short walk away! Try the Nutella and strawberries!! Yum all the way! It is also a small market with some Asian novelty food items and Beauty products!!
author: Julianne O.

description: EXTREMELY Disappointed. I came because my friend suggested it, but it was just plain outright awful. I went to Sophie's after because those crepes are so much better. We got the Mango + Strawberry crepe. I feel like there you couldn't add toppings at Genki to make whatever kind of crepe you want. It's nice that you can shop around while you wait for your crepe though. The strawberries were sour, and the mango ice cream tasted a bit like durian, disgusting.
author: Kenny N.

description:
A little over a year later and I really would not go back for crepes. 

I came with my sister to grab some crepes on a Saturday afternoon. There was surprisingly no line when we arrived. As we browsed the menu I noticed that the dessert crepe items were already matched together for the combinations. I really did not remember this detail, but since I knew I was going to get green tea already, I asked to try the red bean ice cream. It was not bad at all. I would say that next time I would consider that if I did not like green tea more. Anyway, my sister stuck to her usual cheesecake and chocolate ice cream crepe and I stuck with my green tea lychee crepe. 

My little sister's crepe came out first and boy was it full. She started to eat hers and a few minutes afterward, my crepe was finished. I looked into the crepe and everything was sunken in. It was a measly amount of food compared to my sister's. As we left the store and as I was about to dig in, I notice an eyelash in the fold of the crepe. I go back and the girl apologizes and remakes my crepe. The new crepe was not as sunken but still had a small amount of filling. The ice cream was almost room temp, and so were the lychee and whip cream. The only thing I enjoyed about my crepe was the crepe itself. It was warm, crispy and sweet. I think if I were ever to come back to Genki's, I would probably just get a scoop of ice cream (but if the scoop is anything like my crepe's, I am better off paying for the pints from Safeway).
author: Alex T.

description:
+1 for their chocolate egg puffs
+1 for their Thai tea
+1 for their pricing
+1 for the other products they sell

If I hadn't been full off of Thai food from the restaurant nearby, I would have totally went for their crepes...the smell was just absolute perfection.
author: Susan A.

description: Not bad at all. Not the best and most stuffed crepe I've ever had, but their eggettes taste like fluffy, crispy goodness, and their crepes are flavorful. You can also shop around for some pretty overpriced Asian snacks and candy. It takes a while to make the crepes, and lines form at all hours of the day, so be prepared to wait 15-20 for your food. Definitely go with sweet over savory here, and don't expect Mitchell's or Smitten-level ice cream. It's just your basic Asian ice cream. Still, having a place stay open this late in Inner Richmond for take-out dessert isn't a terrible thing, and you won't break the bank. If I had the choice though, Golden Island or Kowloon every day of the week.
author: Danny C.

description:
My favorite crepe place in SF. Pretty crowded place especially on weekends. 

This is a Japanese/Asian crepe place. My staple crepe choice is strawberry banana with nutella, as well as a scoop of vanilla or green tea ice cream on the top. The crepe itself is made on the spot and super crispy; not the thick-torilla-like crepe. Those aint real.

Will come if i can travel easily in richmond area.
author: Ruxin H.

description: Reasonably priced. I love the crepes with or without ice cream. They don't seem to melt quickly which is ideal. The crepe itself is crunchy and fruits are usually fresh.
author: Fernilla S.

description: These little place offers the most excellent Asian desserts! I love their green tea with their battered crepe cone. Their green tea is definitely the good kind! They also have other delicious ice cream flavors and drinks. The store is a mini mart with other Asian snacks and toys as well.
author: Timothy Y.

description: Glorified quickly + eggette joint. Crepes tasted flavorless. Mango ice cream was good though. 3 small clumps of whip cream and halfed strawberries. Definitely not filled with ice cream like their picture suggests. Would not come here again. Might as well get a half gallon of mango ice cream from the asian grocery store...
author: Cathrin P C.

description: As a desert person, I think this place is awesome. Came here with friends. Ordered the banana with Nutella n ice cream which was delicious and I'll definitely be back. But far from Hayward.
author: Richi K.

description: Haven't been here since I found metal in my boba drink. Came here for crepes after dinner. I found the crepes too overly sweet. There's always a long line. Always bring cash because there's a $10 minimum to use card. The products in the store are overly priced.
author: Margaret D.

description:
This place has been highly recommended by many, so I had to see what the buzz was all about. 

I have to admit that the ice cream is great - very true (to the real thing) flavors - I esp. liked the green tea and red bean. Yet, I didn't see an option of just buying the ice-cream by itself. 

Now anytime I am on Clement with friends, I take them to Genki.
author: Nina M.

description:
Bottom line at the top: solid custom crepes but I wouldn't come back again.
--
Had #15 which has smoked salmon, cream cheese, wasabi and asked for it extra crispy which was a good call. The salmon was huge and pretty hacked up and a little fishy, but the crepe was still solid. The line can get long but it moves fast. A lot of people had incorrect orders and/or were misheard/overcharged so pay attention and be very clear with what you want. 

$10 credit card minimum otherwise bring cash!
author: Dahlia S.

description:
Love their crepes! After eating at King of Thai across the street I always make my way to get a crepe. I usually get fresh strawberries and whip cream and it hits the spot every time! Just love how hot, crispy and fresh the crepes are! You should definitely check it out!

Oh and the market is hella dope! They carry cool little trinkets and character stickers! I grab these for my daughter and she loves them every time! You must try this place if you're in the area.
author: Kristian H.

description:
So OVERDUE for a review here! I've been coming here since I was in middle school!! (2005?? Dang) I love this place for it's crepes & ice creams! Unfortunately as the years have gone buy, they have less candy & snacks BOO. None the less, this place always cheers me up & brings back great memories of my childhood. 

The make one of the kind crepes. Nice and crispy! Oh and their egg puffs are bomb too!! I just wish they had a "Genki perfume" so I can spray myself with the smell of the store *sweet crepe batter smell* 
**DROOLS** LOL
author: Ruhjeenuh Z.

description:
There is always a delicious aroma wafting from this place, and usually a small crowd there for a little late night dessert.
The crepes are delicious. The lychee and honeydew ice creams are yummy and I always get Nutella and whipped cream on mine. 
You can also pick up an assortment of fun Asian snacks and candies while you're there. I found botan rice candies, which have cool dissolvable wrappers and which my mom used to put in my Christmas stocking...so yeah, this place is cool by me!
author: Andrea F.

description: I really have a soft spot for this place. my go to place every time i'm on clement craving a dessert after dinner at like a Burma Superstar or Ono Grindz.  the mini mart to me is funny because i swear in all the years that i have gone, i can't recall anyone actually buying something back there.  but you can always count on roaming the aisles anyway to browse through an assortment of things you would find at a local Daiso while you are waiting for them to make the nutella crepe with ice cream goodness that is making me salivate while i write this review.  i honestly think the only reason why they have that $10 minimum is to force people to buy crap at the minimart, hahaha.  sigh...I miss and love this place.  for all its quirks.
author: Roland N.

description:
No! I'm not preggers!! at least that's what the hub thought due to my sudden spike of craving for genki crepes.  My cravings are mostly swift and severe.  For me to drive all the way from the East Bay just for Genki, sounds like a craving but more of an illness. 

The process is super easy. Order and pay at the counter. They'll give you a number and wait.  The difficult part is what to order because all the combinations are amazing. That's when you have to order everything and figure out what is perfect for you.  

I don't mind the wait. They have a vast Japanese candy selection and a small but fun makeup section.  Now the times I've been there the wait has not been terrible at all.  That's because I eat pretty damn early, senior citizen blue plate special, j/k, and we usually hit up the spot before post-dinner gathering. Whereas we hit this spot pre-dinner.  When you're craving, there's just no rhyme or reason. And NO-for the record there will be no stork delivery!
author: Michelle B.

description: AMAZING CREPES!!! I ordered number one which includes a scoop of ice cream with your choice of one side topping. I chose to have Nutella on my crepe with an addition of strawberries and bananas! Total of only 8 bucks for a huge crepe! The only thing I think the crepe needed was a bit more Nutella but if you have a big sweet tooth, this is the place for you!
author: Jeanette N.

description:
I come to this place every time I visit the Inner Richmond (specifically after I stuff myself a Burma Superstar) i love to stock up on tasty Asian candy like green tea kit-kats or those little chocolate mushrooms and grab a crepe to go that my boyfriend and I can split on our walk to the bus. I recently tried one of those egg puff waffle things and I must say they are addicting! Crunchy on the outside and soft and spongy on the inside...I imagine adding ice cream to it would make it a perfect desert. 

The store itself is kinda meh but the food they make is super tasty and the people that work there are incredibly efficient and very hard working so 4 stars for your guys!
author: Paige M.

description: late night snack! delicious, cheap, and yummy!! I love their crepes and would recommend anyone to come here to get their crepes. Satisfaction guarantee
author: Amy T.

description:
