Nothing better than a crepe shop near new Chinatown; finished up a great meal and was looking for something sweet to fill up my belly. In the mood for green tea ice cream and a crepe, I trekked down to Genki. 

The prices here aren't bad -- $3.95 for strawberry Nutella; $5 when adding green tea ice cream. Service was pretty slow and there were about two guys working the back. I walked around the shop too; interesting products but no matcha powder. Oh well. 

I was looking forward to my crepe- and quite frankly, it's REALLY difficult to screw up a crepe. Unfortunately, mine was completely overdone. The crepe was overly crispy and brown that it was impossible to eat especially with how wide they serve their crepes in a cone. The ice cream didn't have a strong enough matcha flavor and the strawberries were not sweet as well. I know this place is known for the egg puffs , but trust me when I say pass on the crepes.
author: Bryce F.

description:
Such a variety of Asian goods. From candy to even beauty products, this mini mart has it all. Their prices are not bad at all. I found the candy to be way more affordable than other stores that carry them such as Target, Safeway, etc. 
To top it off, they have a crepe station as well. We got the Nutella, strawberry, & ice cream crepe and it was under 5 bucks! Such a steal. Glad I found this little gem on Clement street. Also their hours are really good, so if you have a late night sweet tooth craving, check them out!
author: Sarah G.

description:
Came in, ordered, looked around the mini-mart while we waited for our crepes. I wanted Green Tea KitKat but they didn't have it =[

Ordered:

#4 $4.95 Lychee Ice Cream + Custard Crepe http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q&select=AxJ0O0GYPInPiHTp9RQNTg: the lychee ice cream had actual lychee chunks. I wish there was a bit more custard though.

#5 4.95 Strawberry Ice Cream + Kiwi Crepe http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q: I don't really like strawberry ice cream so I can't say if this was good or not.

#6 4.95 Mango Ice Cream with Strawberries Crepe http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q&select=dwlcvUVZQpgIq_i1vK-XrQ: fruity ice cream with fruits wrapped in a crepe, delish. I like mango and I like strawberries, I should have got this crepe instead of the Lychee Ice Cream + Custard Crepe. Next time, I'll get this one.

The crepes were a bit salty in my opinion. I wonder if they use different batter for the savory and sweet crepes and just got them mixed up. Maybe it was an off day. The edges of the crepe were too crunchy in my opinion. I want a crepe, not a fortune cookie.

$10 minimum charge for using a credit card. I like that. Most Asian stores don't even accept credit card.

Parking is hard so expect to circle a few times and to only find parking far away.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Me and the boyfriend decided to get crepes on a lovely Sunday. This place was recommended to us by my sister.  The first time I had crepes was a horrible experience which gave me doubts on crepes in general. 

But thank goodness for this place! There was a small line when we first got there which was around 1-2pm on a Sunday afternoon. There were only 2workers there.  We got the ice cream crepes and they were delicious! !

They open til late and so far, the crepes here are the best I've had. Looking forward to coming back!
author: B Y.

description:
I followed my friend into this place as she said "This should satisfy my cravings!" My thoughts: She's craving band-aids? Asian magazines? Don't tell me it's... anime figurines!?

No. CREPES.

Who would have thought there would be an awesome crepe place hiding out in the local convenience store? My favorite is the strawberry-banana crepe with mango ice cream. But I'm also partial to anything with nutella. 

Go crazy. Eat crepes. As many as you want.
author: Denise L.

description:
I always want to come to this place when I'm in the area with my friends! 
My friend says that this place is usually pretty packed, but it's worth it. Their crepes, both sweet and savory, is amazing. We got two beef sukiyaki crepes for dinner (since they're the sauciest, the other savory ones taste more like sandwiches) and shared a green tea with red bean paste crepe for dessert. So, so, so yummy! The size is perfect and there's enough content inside to just fill you up and be satisfied. 
We gotta come back and try their eggettes sometime!
author: Justine P.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE. Why can't San Jose have a crepe place as good as Genki's. Prices are decent. It's a half asian store, half crepe station. 

Nutella Crepe, with Strawberries, vanilla ice cream, whip cream and Mashmallows. 

I love how the crepe is crispy. Totally different from most crepe places I've been too. 

Last time I got Genki's I was lucky and found parking easily. But I'm pretty sure parking gets crazy later on in the evening. Always a go to place when I'm in SF.
author: Kiyana D.

description: I had the most amazing crepe here! 10/10 definitely going back. Parking around here is quite awful, parked about .3 miles away. Inside is a convenience store with all of these really cool snacks and you order your crepe at the cashier register. I got the Nutella, vanilla ice cream, and banana crepe! Amazing
author: Allison B.

description: Mostly a market with an area behind the counter for making crepes it is not fancy. Wanting a good dessert late though we stumbled onto this place and I am glad we did. I never had an ice cream crepe before. It was delicious. I would definitely go here again. Especially if it's late and I want something sweet.
author: Michael S.

description:
My reliable go-to spot for late night sweet dessert crepes. I always get the crepes with chocolate cake or cheesecake; and chocolate or strawberry ice cream because CAKE and ICE CREAM!

It's also one of the places I don't mind waiting for my order because it also doubles as a small convenience store with fun things to look at. The wait's never too long, though, so Genki hits all the right notes. Go!
author: Michael M.

description:
If you're craving for a crepe and live in the Richmond District, then there's Genki Crepes to feed your need. Tucked away within a mini-mart is where you'll find this neighborhood spot, as long as you manage to get lucky and find a parking spot. 

Here, I ordered the the cinnamon, apple, and brown sugar crepe. Within a mere matter of minutes, my crepe was freshly made, and ready to go. As far as taste goes, it is pretty solid. However, I'm not much of a sweet tooth, so I didn't enjoy it as much as my counterparts did. 

Nonetheless, for crepes I only know of 2 places that serve up some solid servings: Genki and Sophie's.
author: Michael W.

description:
I had my first cheesecake crepe in Japan 9 years ago, and I still remember eating it because it was the most amazing thing to me back then. My mind was blown.

I've always wanted to try Genki Crepes because I knew they had cheesecake here. I finally got the chance to try it out yesterday, and I thought it was ok, but nothing spectacular. The crepe was nice and crisp, and they put 3 thin slices of cheesecake inside topped with blueberry sauce and whipped cream. The blueberry sauce was sweet and a bit artificial tasting, which I guess was expected. The cheesecake was softer than a typical NY style cheesecake, and it seemed like the texture was trying to be closer to a fluffy Zanze's cheesecake. However, Genki's wasn't nearly as smooth or rich as Zanze's. Genki's texture felt a bit starchy. and its flavor needed to be cheesier. Next time, I'll have to give Crepe Temptations a shot.
author: Nei N.

description: The crepes here are always good! I like how crispy they make it! I usually order the Nutella Strawberry Banana w whip cream. The line here is always long! But worth the wait. :)
author: Thanh T.

description:
Nutella + Green Tea Ice Cream + Crepe = a happy belly!

I love this place so much! This was our default for dessert on those late study nights! 325! I took my family here to try their crepes and they fell in love. It's interesting because it is part of a mini asian market. They have a lot of dessert options. My favorite is the combo I put above. The mochi is okay, not that great, but it is dessert! Anything you get here is good!
author: Joyce D.

description: Nutella, bananas and vanilla ice cream crepe!!! Nom Nom Nom! What an awesome hole in the wall! Thank you for satisfying my sweet tooth! :)
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I love Genki Crepes! 

This is a Japanese mini mart + a crepe shop. The Mart would be two three scales below a Nijia but you will find interesting toys, Asian make up products, Japanese snacks, candies and drinks.

This review is strictly on the crepes. I always go for the classic strawberry banana, vanilla ice cream with Nutella~ the serving is huge and it's really delicious!!! 

I highly recommend eating out on clement and try Genki's for dessert.

One downside.. There aren't any seats.
author: Sarah K.

description:
GREEN TEA ICE CREAM + RED BEAN PASTE IN A CREPE?! YES PLEASE!

The moment I saw that on the menu, I just knew I had to get it. Green tea and red bean is one of my favorite combos ever so I knew I'd love it. It definitely did not disappoint me! Seriously, it was DELICIOUS! It was fresh, not too sweet and had a perfect crisp. The amount of ice cream and red bean was perfect for the size of the crepe and the flavors were just awesome together!

There are so many different crepe combos here and most of them sound yummy so you will probably never run out of flavors to try. There are savory crepes, ice cream crepes, and snack crepes. With so many options, there has to be one that you will like :) I know I'll definitely be coming back to try out more crepes!
author: Sandra N.

description: The crepes is thin and crispy.. the thinnest I've ever had and it's NOT soggy! Love it!
author: Mindy H.

description: Stopped by this place yesterday because of all the rave I saw on yelp. The crepe was delicious and it was a good portion but the mark down was for the rude cashier lady that was helping us out. It was only 6 o'clock in the evening so I don't really understand what she was so stressed about or maybe it was the customers. (But it really wasn't that crowded) it's too bad cause the actual people making the crepes and drinks were then nicest people (shout out to you guys!)
author: Isabel B.

description:
YAY! Crepes! 

The fam (aka me) had a sweet tooth after having a late lunch in the area so we decided to stop by and get some crepes. 

The order: Dessert crepe with nutella, strawberries and mango ice cream. 

The verdict: SUCH A FAN! I really liked how the crepe had some crispy/crunchy parts which made it kind of like eating ice cream from a waffle cone. They weren't too skimpy on the strawberries like some other places I've been, but it wasn't like they overloaded everything either. After eating lunch + the crepe, I was glad we didn't need to walk too far back to the car because I was definitely entering a food coma. Would definitely come back again, it's just a bit far from the heart of the city. :(

Tip: You can only swipe a card if you purchase something over $10!
author: Erica H.

description: I freakin love this place. The crepes are so crispy and have all the good Asian candy I love.  Trying to cut done on my sugar intake is hard when I have a craving. I don't have diabetes, but it's hard to stay away when you got a bad habit.
author: La-Rae A.

description:
Genki is great if you like your crepes crispy. The consistency of the texture is excellent. Every bite is just as good as the first. However I do like my crepe a little chewier and thinner so Genki is not my favorite. I prefer Sophie's to Genki slightly. 

I like their store layout. It was fun to browse through all the Asian snacks and drinks while waiting patiently for the crepe to be made.
author: Mona W.

description: Hmm...this place was poppin' on a Saturday night, and I can kinda see what the hype is about.  It's inside of a cute Asian grocery store, and there's an interesting selection of crepes.  Still, I wasn't impressed.  I ordered the green tea with red bean crepe, and the crepe itself was crispy and overcooked.  There was nothing soft about it.  What's worse is that my friend ordered a mango shake, and there was a hair in it!!  So gross.
author: Kristen H.

description:
The hot link mozzarella red onion crepe is so good here. I love biting into it and the cheese is all stringy and melted. $5.95 for this crepe really does fill you up. 

You can also custom make your own crepe but it's a bit more expensive. I've made my own Avacado, chicken, and mushroom crepe and it was alright. The mushroom and Avacado was overwhelming and I ended up not finishing it. 

OverallI, this place is really cheap and good. I just wish they had a similar crepe place near my area for the same deliciousness and price :(
author: Crystal N.

description:
This place is too good. I usually come here when my sweet tooth starts to whimpering. I usually just get a crepe with strawberries and whipped cream and it does the trick. The crepe is flaky on the outside and soft on the inside. YUMM

The ingredients are fresh and the store is convenient to buy other little trinkets - Japanese makeup, hair products, hair dye, a very wide array of drinks and stuffed animals and snacks.
author: Mabel Y.

description: The chocolate cake crepe was delicious. Cute little shop in the back to look around while waiting for the crepes.
author: Melissa A.

description:
I have four words to say: GREEN TEA KIT KATS!! Yes! They sell them here. I swear I've been searching everywhere for these bad boys and this little Japanese marketplace/dessert joint has them! 

OKAY, onto the main topic - CREPES. For someone who is not a big fan of sweet crepes, my mouth was in for a treat. I ordered the green tea crepe (#2) with cheesecake. Yes, your girl loves cheesecake on every type of imaginable dessert. 

It was really good and the portion was really big for the price ~$5-$7, unlike those dainty ones that cost a fortune that you will finish in 4 bites. They have the other usual fruity flavors as well and whatever creation you want to come up with. Also, if you're in the mood for boba, they have them here too. Definitely recommend this if you're a crepe lover and if you're in the SF area. 

They only have meter parking so bring quarters! And credit card charge minimum is $10.
author: Sally H.

description:
What can I say. I think Genki Crepes increased the happiness index of Inner Richmond. It's very smart to offer this in a Japanese convenient store. Because while people are waiting in line, sometimes they pick up a couple of novelty items from the aisles. 

There's a $10 minimum purchase for cards I think, and the average crepes are $7ish. So bring your cash, if you are going alone. But I doubt it since we got to share goodies with friends and lovers.
author: S W.

description: Yummm :P Their ice cream crepes are so simple but so good. My gf and I always think about coming here when we're in the area. It's just that good.
author: Joshua F.

description:
On a warm day in SF, after having dim sum nearby, my boyfriend and I walked past Genki crepes -- I wish I had the appetite to have a crepe, but instead we just had some bubble tea (I forget which flavor I ordered but I remember just thinking it was okay).

I like that there is a little bench out front for you to sit and enjoy your tea and/or crepe. I won't be back for a bubble tea but will definitely be back to try a sweet or savory crepe!
author: Siv L.

description:
Yummmm #8..vanilla ice cream with chocolate cake..it was GOOD..never had crepe in a cone before..the crepe was good itself bc it was crunchy..the ice cream was ok..not the best..had the best..but its vanilla so its ok..doesn't taste fake..the cake was good..and it was just plain good..i think i'd like to try the other flavors next time..a must come!

they also sell egg puffs which I will try next time..it's a small store that has other japanese goodies like candies n cookies..kinda cool..
author: Minerva L.

description:
Ah, good ol' Genki. Who doesn't love a shop that makes desserts and has shelves and shelves of little snacks of all sorts?

This is the spot to be at on Clement if you're looking for snacks. It's like a muthaeffin' candyland here. Oftentimes I spend waaay more than I intend to coming in... high or not. 
Sweet candy, sour candy, gum with flavors that only last a quick minute and a half, kawaii shaped chocolate, KITKATS! They have it all. And the thing is... you'll probably blindly grab random snacks because they appeal to you even though you don't know what they are because they all look so good and the packaging is so cute and colorful!
Wide variety of drinks that are appealing to the eye too, some of them are hit or miss.
MOCHI ICE CREAM! And they are stocked with the newest flavors. Say wuuuuut.

Stick with their dessert crepes. I ordered my first savory crepe there today (#14) turkey, cheese, avocado... forgot what else, but it was bland, boring and for the $6 I paid, I should have just walked down to cafe bunn mi and ordered a banh mi. Crepes can be customizable with additional add-ons but the dessert crepes on their menu seem sort of dull to me.

Min $10 for card by the way.
author: Jenny Y.

description:
Really good crepe spot, cheap too. The convenience store is cool too. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the cashier who took my order threw a fit when I asked for powdered sugar instead of whipped cream. 
I'll definitely be back though because the crepes are great and cheap, maybe I'll get a nicer cashier next time.
author: Harry L.

description:
Came here to get a crepe since I was in the area after dinner an wanted something sweet to end my night. For sure, the smell is better than the taste when it comes to creeps from genki. 
I had order their #4 sweet crepe which was lychee ice-cream with custard. 
I really did not like their crepe batter as it came out plain and bland and a tough texture. I was hoping for some good lychee ice-cream but came up full of air as cheap ice-cream uses a lot air to give it more volume at the expense of quality. And the custard that was supposed to be on my crepe looked like condensed milk all over. I couldn't really taste any sort of custard and was whatever...but for 5 bucks or so I did not really mind that much. 
Not sure why this place always have people coming for their mediocre crepes. Maybe it was just me and I ordered the wrong crepe? I'll rather stick with my belly good crepe in japantown.
author: Jason L.

description:
If you can find parking on this street, you better visit every single store on this street while you have the chance!

I always have to pop in and buy sweets somewhere, and Genki does have a decent variety on the menu for whatever you're craving: crepes/egg puffs/drinks. I once got a strawberry and cheesecake crepe with actual pieces of real cheesecake! However, their crepes are just ok to me. I like them crispy and even when I ask for it to be crispy, it's still a bit rubbery. There is a bit of a wait for your order so I appreciate that Genki also has a store full of Asian snacks so you can browse while you wait. And they have a few benches so you can eat your crepe without having to walk around with it on Clement and get it all over the place.
author: Stella C.

description: I used to love this place.. Now i hate it! I got the green tea crepe and this is how it looked like! Like rotten food! The crepe they gave me was soggy and the ice cream was melting!! I asked the cashier if he can give me a new one coz its melting he only said its really like that! What kind of customer service is that?!?! Bad bad bad!!! Dont come here!! Sophies crepe is better and the best of all crepes in sf. Wow i feel really bad for the owner... I wont go because customer service is extremely rude!! And no service at all!!!
author: Baby F.

description:
I finally tried a crepe from Genki: Red bean ice cream, fresh strawberries, and whipped cream ($4.95). The crepe was very thin and crispy. I didn't like how it was so brittle. You can see that it is cracked in multiple places. The batter reminded me of fortune cookies. The red bean ice cream was creamy but didn't have enough red bean flavor. Three stars. 

I do like their mini mart though (good selection of Japanese candy and snacks), so I gave them an extra star for their Japanese candy and snacks.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Get the Nutella crepes. That's all you need to know. It is SO GOOD. The smell alone is satisfying. The little market inside is more than adorable and they have so many little asian treats, if you don't leave happy, there is something wrong with you.

The server girls were so happy and helpful and the crepe makers are so fast, they expertly churn out the crepes like the crepe masters they are. 

If you want a a quick super satisfying treat after a night of going out, this is the BEST there is.
author: Molly S.

description: Came for a banana /strawberry / nutella crepe and it was great. Was able to eat while driving home , that was the best part ! It also had a market there where I was able to bring Home some snacks for 2m's dubs game ! A go to spot for a sweettooth .
author: Richard L.

description:
Crepes you say? There are crepes to be had? Count me in!

Have I ever told you that I may indeed contain the personality of a five year old that is charmed by dollops of whipped cream on top of green tea ice cream with red bean paste?

And the crepe, it was so crisssssppppyyyyyyyy. Combined with the softness of the ice cream. Magnifique! 

The mini-mart was also pretty cool to to shop for the weeaboos in your life. 
I saw drinks and Japanese candies here I've only otherwise seen online or at conventions. A pretty whimsical/fun experience!
author: Liss T.

description:
My friend took me to this place while I was visiting her in San Francisco. It's in a strip with other Asian restaurants. Genki is a cute mini mart with all sorts of yummy treats. Their crepes are perfectly crispy and the batter is tasty. I got lychee ice cream on my crepe and that was deliciously creamy. 

Even at midnight it was tough to find parking and there was a line at Genki. It's that good!
author: Dawnabelle R.

description:
When it's late at night, your in San Francisco and have a sweet tooth, chances are you will find me here at Genki's! 

The crepe's are delicious! My favorite crepe combination is the bananas slathered with Nutella hazelnut spread and vanilla ice cream. This combination on their slightly sweet, slightly crispy crepe batter is super good! The coconut flavored egg puffs are also a great snack choice! Nice and warm with a subtle coconut flavor. 

Genki's has got this vibe of half crepery but also part convenience store. The convenience store part is more a 7-11 but with only sweet beverages and candy. You will find really cool candy finds from Asia. My favorite is the green tea Kit-Kat bars from Japan. 

The store is typically a popular spot after 8PM so expect a wait when making an order. Prices are cheap. The employees are polite enough. Definitely a great spot in this part of SF!
author: Paul C.

description:
The best crepes I have ever had - but I love crispy crepes. And I even tried crepes in Paris!

My favorite (and only one I have ever tried) is the Nutella and Strawberry. I imagine the savory crepes are amazing but there so many delicious restaurants in the area (BURMA SUPERSTAR), that I only consider this place for my dessert!
author: Sunita M.

description:
Not the best crepe I've had but it was good enough to finish. 

All I wanted was a simple nutella crepe but the crepe was crispy. Ya, Idk about that.. 

However, I like how they sell funko pop toys.  So random yet so cool.  ahhahaha.
author: Criselle O.

description:
I've been going here since middle school, and I'm still coming back! :]

#13 (Tuna) w/ mozzarella is probably favorite crepe here at Genki's. The crepe is just crisp enough, but not crunchy. The tuna isn't flooded with mayonaise. The lettuce is fresh. The cheese will stretch for miles! It's a great crepe when you're hungry.

The classic nutella banana is probably my second most-ordered crepe from Genki. It's a simple crepe that's always delicious. However, I personally like my dessert crepes a bit on the soft side. It's a bit too crunchy for me at Genki. It's sufficient, but not amazing.


On a side note, Genki is't just a creperie, they sell all sorts of asian goods in the back. They have everything from fake lashes, to green tea ice cream, to totoro stuff animals.
author: Kennie D.

description: My co workers brought me here for the first time here yesterday , my first impression was where getting crepes from a mini market but as i saw the crepe menu alot of diffrent choices !im crepe lover ! One of the best crepes ive had!!
author: Tanya A.

description:
Love their crepes! Green tea ice cream with strawberries!! 
A must try if you're in the area!
author: Adrian T.

description: My favorite crepe place of all time. I've been going to Genki's ever since I started playing Enchantees. LOL so 3rd grade? They make the crepe have the right amount of crunch without having it complete break apart after the first bite. I also love that they have a little supermarket inside with all the asian candies! yum yum yum
author: Kelly S.

description: We ordered a strawberry and Nutella crepe and it was up to our expectations!  They were not stingy on the Nutella and every bite you get a mouthful of strawberries and Nutella.  It was not doughy like other places and definitely a great place to get your crepe fixes.
author: Austin Y.

description:
after going to San Tung restaurant nearby, I come here for the green tea and lychee crepe and my life is complete. I am not even kidding. Every single piece of this freaking crepe is worth dying for. The crepe is freaking crunchy and warm. The green tea ice cream is just sooo authentic and tasty that my body melt. And who could forget the sweet sweet lyche? Where did they get these lychee?? I went to supermarket and lychee is not as fresh and as sweet as this shop

Even though this place is super good amd popular, the service is very fast, as opposed to San Tung

The 2 drawbacks are that the ice cream may drip onto your hands if you hold the crepe. Grab tissues. Secondly, it's hard to find parking. 

But overall, I just die everytime I take a bite of that sweet, sweet green tea lychee crepe.
author: Anh P.

description: The cheesecake crepe with chocolate ice cream is my new favorite. It's so filling but so delicious!
author: Catherine B.

description:
Came here with some friends after having dinner at Q bar. I ended up not getting a crepe so I won't be reviewing that. I went for the taro milk tea with boba. It was really tasty. I asked for half sweet. I usually do this when ordering at any boba spot. They boba itself was jest...meh. Not spectacular. The actually drink was good. It tasted as if there there were actual pieces of taro in the drink. I'm not sure that there was. Could've fooled me. My husband happened to think it was some of the best tasting boba he has ever had. I beg to differ. It was good, but definitely not the best.  

The 4 stars I am giving is not just for the drink. Genki is a cute little store with awesome snacks. Snacks on snacks on snacks. They have green tea kit-kats here! Those are hard to find in general. This is a great place to stop by if you are looking for interesting new sweets and snacks.
author: Krystal A.

description:
I absolutely love their crepes! Their crepes are always on point, so crispy and soft. I always get it with green tea ice cream and lychee fruits. They dont serve cheap ice cream and the price is reasonable. I haven't got the chance to try other crepes because every time I go, I end up getting the ice cream crepes!

I would not recommend the egg puffs because they are overly sweet compared to other dessert places. I got the red bean flavor for $3.75 but there's no red bean flavor. You only taste sugar.
author: Angela L.

description: Meat crepes are surprisingly really good!  Cheese and pork, yes please.  Do try this.
author: Vicki T.

description:
Overall Impression: A place full of mystery and surprises. Get ice cream in a crepe cone, or grab some awesome Asian goodies. 

Cost: Everything is cheap. Almost everything in that store is under 5. And that is a great deal considering the variety of things that the place sells. 

Taste: We personally tried their red bean ice cream in a crepe cone (which tastes similar to a waffle cone), and it was delicious! I'm pretty sure you can't go wrong with anything on their crepe menu.

Customer Service: Helpful cashier who will allow you to customize your crepe in whichever way your heart desires.

Ambience/Atmosphere: More of a grab and go type of ordeal, as seating is limited.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Genki Crepes - oh how you are tasty but dangerous.  I think these things have at least 1000 calories, or the way I get it at least.

I always custom order my crepe: Cheesecake, Caramel, Pineapple or Strawberries, and Whipped Cream. Delicious but hello heart attack!  Just wish the crepe was better...softer, more flavorful, not quite sure...

The ice cream crepes are also good but can get quite messy.

Each crepe ranges in price from about $5-$6.

It's located in a small little market that carries lots of other asian snack, goodies, and even asian shampoo and makeup.  I love everything in here.

It's a bit chaotic in here, but head straight to the register to order.  Most other people are waiting around for their crepes or still deciding what to order.  There are a couple benches available for people to sit, but it's really a to-go kind of place.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Really good crepes! I had the nutella banana crepe and it was amazing. Some of my friends ordered theirs with ice cream and that looked good also. 

Lines can get long here, so beware. There are also fun little things to look at, we purchased some hello kitty band-aids for my daughter.  This is almost like a little mini-mart too, drinks are for sale, and some random vegetables and fruits. 

Will be back when i'm in SF for sure!
author: Heather S.

description: This place is busy on weekends so I tried it about a week ago. My crape was so burned and dry... really disappointed. I can make better crapes. it's like $6.50 after tax too. Too expensive for bad crapes.
author: C M.

description:
Crepe was good! I had mango ice cream, Nuttella, strawberries, and bananas with my crepe

Wait time: Fast although they had a line

Price: Cheap

I will definitely come back to try their other flavors.
author: Chau N.

description:
I think the only thing I like about this place is that it's half a store and half a crepe place. 

There's so many candy and drinks here! The prices can be acceptable depending on what you buy. I like the fact that they have a ramune here with a Pokemon label on it. :) Yeah, I would buy it just for that. There's a bunch of knick knacks here which I think is awesome. I could walk around for hella long..

I got their crepe once with green tea gelato only in it and it was alright. I didn't really like it that much. Their crepe was crispy, yes, but their ice cream was missing that little spark that really draws you in and makes you say, "HEY. THIS ICE CREAM IS AWESOME. WTH." And trust me, I have had that experience before at Sophie's Crepes in Japantown.
author: Venus L.

description:
YUM. Crepes. Sweet, savory. Enough said. Average price is $3-$5, which isn't bad considering crepes are actually mighty filling.

I've had the ice cream with nutella crepe before, but this time I got #31 (cinnamon, apples, and brown sugar). The apples were diced pretty small, but it was still pretty good in flavor. A nice light lunch after the Giants parade!
author: Leana L.

description:
After a dinner date with the beau, we stopped by Genki Crepes to get a sweet crepe for dessert. It was our first time here, so it caught us a little off guard when we realized that Genki was inside, and part of a grocery store.

There was a really long line, but we managed to slip through the crowd and into the store to take a peek at the menu. I estimate there being about 30 items on their menu--which included snack crepes, savory crepes, and ice cream crepes.

I was instantly sold when I saw the chocolate ice cream and cheesecake crepe (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/83dXgt2nG98JJG2F7ai8AQ?select=MYaZXhiWD2FZb5n4GfuMeg). There wasn't anything special about the ingredients alone, but they were spectacular together. The cheesecake was thick and cheesy and the cold ice cream really tied the cheesecake and fluffy crepe together.

I noticed that the ice cream crepes only had ice cream and one other ingredient. I am not sure if you can customize the ingredients, but it wouldn't hurt to ask. Street parking was very limited; we had to park and walk two blocks, so be prepared to walk. The staff was a little dull and boring--maybe they were tired? The crepe was great though, so I'll definitely come back the next time I am in the area.
author: Lien T.

description:
This small Asian convenience store is one of a kind! Not only can you buy cheap treats and drinks but you can get tasty, savory or sweet crepes! You can literally smell the delicious crepes cooking from a block away and realize why there is always a line out the door once you get closer. It's dangerous having this delicious snack so close to my apartment, especially when my boyfriend and I get a late night craving for something sweet! 

Genki Crepes offers many mouth watering options from chicken, cheese, and onion crepes to mixed fruit and nutella crepes to milkshakes with tapioca to egg puffs and more! Want ice cream and a crepe? No problem! Choose from many ice cream crepes that include cheesecake or chocolate cake in some of their options! 

Their prices are cheap, nothing really costs more than $6 or so depending what you have them add or substitute. They do have a $10 credit card minimum so if you're buying for one bring cash or grab something from the store like Yan Yan (mmmm). 

I've also had a smoothie from here-it was the perfect balance of all the fruit ingredients and only $4.50 I believe. 

The wait can be about 10-15 minutes sometimes but it is well worth the wait!
author: Ashley M.

description:
My first mistake was that I had just finished eating dinner. My second mistake was bothering to have more than just fruit and whipped cream in my crepe. Don't be like me. Dessert first and then your meal. Unless you're coming here for a savory crepe, in which case, just do both dinner and dessert here. 

Eat, be happy, and read all the cool stuff on the wall.
author: Loli L.

description:
My boyfriend spent several months raving about how great this place is. I can finally understand now. I know I've only been here once, but they're yummy! We shared a lychee ice cream and custard crepe. The shop is cute with all their snacks and other goods.

It kind of sucks that there aren't tables like some crepe places I've been to, but the benches by the entrance and outside aren't bad.
author: Anthea W.

description:
Terrible service. I came here with 8 others and ordered together. They ended up charging us for extra toppings and even an extra crepe. When I went back to the register to fix the error, the cashier just looked at it and refunded me for the cheapest crepe, sans extra toppings charged. Therefore, I proceeded to tell her that there were still errors on the receipt. She became defensive and started mumbling underneath her breath that I was CHEE SEEN ("crazy" in Chinese). Little did she know I knew exactly what she meant and I told her it was her error and I have the right to come back to fix the overcharged receipt (over $8 worth!). How dare she even call me names when I politely came up to fix HER ERROR?!? She refunded me the rest of the money by throwing the money on the table. 

CHECK YOUR RECEIPT.
author: Diana L.

description: Don't really know why this place is rated so highly because the crepe was very average. I got the honey banana almond crepe because those are literally my favorite things ever but I was really disappointed with what it tasted like...VERY average and something that I could have made at home. The ice cream flavors looked very tempting (they had lychee!!!!) but I was too full to get anything too heavy.
author: Mai S.

description: I got a custard and caramel crepe here... it was the weirdest dessert crepe I ever had because it wasn't sweet. How is it possible for carameland custard to not be sweet??? I was really confused by what I was eating... but the crepe shell itself had a good texture...
author: Lily L.

description:
I really like their sweet crepes, the best is strawberries & whipped cream. I also love they have at least 100 different drinks (juices, milkshakes, teas) as well as another 100 or so bottled and canned drinks of all types. The prices are really reasonable.

They have a lot of asian foods too, ranging from crackers to candies like Green Tea Kit Kats, shrimp chips, ramens, cartons of ice cream, sauces and tons more. They even have some beauty supplies like hair dye. 

The 4 star review vs 5 stars is because of their savory crepes. They use the same basic crepe for everything. And it's a very sweet crepe. It goes wonderfully with the dessert crepes, but it's gross with the savory ones. I wish they had a separate savory batter with no sugar in it. 

They have egg puffs too, which are interesting. Basically a crepe but in round bubbles rather than a flat pancake.
author: Venus S.

description: Great late night dessert place with a small Asian market with some tasty treats. The selection of savory and sweet crepes covers a good amount of ground. There are a couple of benches to sit on outside of Genki Crepes, but other than that there aren't many places to sit. Although the crepes were good, the boba drinks didn't taste great. Bottom line: good late night dessert, not many places to sit, don't order boba there.
author: Jaime W.

description: These crepes are huge! I've gotten cheesecake in it before & the portion is very generous. My go-to crepe would be strawberry, Nutella & vanilla ice cream. Parking sucks which is the only downside.. But it's SF what can you do!?
author: Tammy N.

description:
Went here yesterday because my sis in law and I wanted crepes. I will coming back for sure.
I like how it's on a cone form so it's not messy and you can eat it while you're in the car. I got the nutella with strawberries, bananas, vanilla ice cream, and light whip.
author: Beverly C.

description:
The ginger milk tea (no pearls) is really good. The cheesecake with blueberry sauce crepe was rich and while very good, I just couldn't finish it.

The crepes serving area is at the front entrance - this is basically a candy store, for real. You can get all kinds of Asian snack foods here. The only seating are small benches inside and outside the store, and there's no room for tables even if they wanted to put some in. 

Parking in this Inner Richmond area is not fun, but is easier to find after 8pm (not before). The place closes at 11:30pm weeknights and much later on weekends.
author: Peter L.

description: Best dessert crepes must haves when I'm in the area! I love the mixed fruit toppings, green tea ice cream with nutella, almonds and whipped cream to satisfy my taste buds ;) I'll also throw in an order of assorted flavored egg puffs as well!
author: Sunshine Z.

description:
I was with family and we ordered 1 crepe each for a total of 3 - red bean ice cream with bananas, green tea ice cream with red bean paste, and chocolate ice cream with cheesecake.

I personally enjoyed the red bean ice cream and we all really liked the bread part! Hands down best I have ever had for.the breading part. The cheesecake wasn't the greatest... had better. Green tea ice cream was good, too, But my brother said he had better..

Overall, I felt the one I got (red bean ice cream with bananas) were excellent! Would definitely go again to try the other ones out.
author: Yan L.

description:
Crepe was good even though what they put in there isn't much, the Mexicans making it seem to give a jack about giving rotten bananas (every slice inside my crepe were all rotten) to a customer. First impression was a no go.

After they had fixed my crepe, my ice cream was half way melted, cream were removed, and no sorry were even said. No bueno.

Crepe temptations it is!
author: ABC Z.

description:
The crepes are pretty good. I had the lemon and sugar crepe and ordered a side of the original flavor egg puffs. Wow, those little egg puffs are addicting! Warm, not overly sweet, and delicately chewy. It was a little reminiscent of those tasty little petite French Madeleine cakes, but in an airy, waffle, bubble-wrap egg kinda form. Hmmm... Not sure if that made any sense... Anyhow, all you really need to know is that they're indeed delicious. 

While waiting around for my order, I got to look around the store. They had cutesy Hello Kitty items scattered throughout and other Asian packaged candies and treats. 

The girl at the register was very friendly and helpful. The crepe and egg puffs came out fairly quick.

I dropped by after dinner. They were closing their doors at 10:30pm and thankfully I was able to make it in time to suffice my sweet tooth. The universe was definitely on my side. 

So if you haven't already been to Genki Crepes, drop in and give those waffle egg puffs a try! You might get hooked.
author: Ann S.

description:
I haven't tried their crepes yet which is probably what they're known for but this will definitely be my new go-to place for eggettes! Ordered the regular vanilla eggette.

Crispy yet soft and not burnt.  Batter not bland but full of vanilla taste. 

Highly recommend their eggette. Best eggette in town that I've tried thus far!
author: Henry P.

description:
After dinner, a stroll along Clement St for some sweets usually leads us to Genki.  From the front window, you can't miss what most people come here for...crepes and egg puffs.  The big menu board lists the various fillings and flavors that you can get your crepes and egg puffs.   

You place your order at the register and get a number for your order.  Depending on the day, your wait for your order can vary, but there usually is a wait.  You can wander around the store and check out the various Asian snacks items that they sell.  

The last couple of visits, we've been ordering the egg puffs.  Love that they have many flavors of egg puffs to choose from.  Of the ones we've tried so far, we like the coconut egg puffs.  Not overly sweet with good coconut taste with the slight chewiness to the puffs.  

There are no tables for you to enjoy your sweets, but there are a couple of benches inside and outside that you can park yourself to enjoy your goodies.  Great place on Clement to satisfy your sweet tooth before or after dinner.
author: Al L.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE. Looking for a place for dessert after dinner? Look no further. Genki is where it's at. The crepes here are just too good. This place masters the art of making crepes that are crispy yet chewy at the same time. It's crazy how these crepes aren't overly crispy, yet they also don't get soggy. How do they do it?! Maybe it's the batter or maybe it's the workers. I will never know, and I'm perfectly okay with that. Without a doubt, this is the first place I go to whenever I want crepes.

This place isn't just known for its crepes though. You've got to get their egg puffs as well. Not too many places in the city sell egg puffs, and of the ones that do, few (if any) make them as well as Genki does. Just like the crepes, the egg puffs are made to have the perfect chewy texture while having crispy edges. Pop one in your mouth and it just melts. I love it. No other place makes eggs puffs as good as these ones. That's a fact.

The line here can tend to get pretty long, as the line extends back into the store. It's almost as if it's all on purpose though. Standing in line causes you to end up looking around the store at the different toys, candy, foods, and drinks they sell there. Aside from the desserts they make, the mart itself is actually pretty neat. It's definitely fun to walk around looking at stuff as you wait for your desserts to be made. 

Come here whenever you're craving some yummy dessert! Maybe you want some crepes and egg puffs, and maybe your friend wants some boba and Hi-Chews. Well guess what, Genki will satisfy both of your guys' cravings! So stop by and satisfy your sweet tooth. Whoo hooooo.
author: Aaron W.

description:
A clutch after dinner spot  for a hot crepe - perfect for a chilly night in the city!

For about $5, you can get a hot crepe with toppings ranging from fruit, to nutella or caramel syrup, to ice cream of all flavors.

Thanks Genki for the delicious diabetes! :)
author: Breanne T.

description:
LOVE ITTT!
They have a bunch of crepes form savory to sweet. I have yet to try the savory crepes, (i have a hugeeee sweet tooth) Prices are very affordable/reasonable, worth the money! I always get the cheesecake crepe with chocolate ice cream. This place is also a mini market, with a bunch of asian products (candy, drinks, beauty products) which i may add are pretty damn expensive. 

Parking isn't THAT bad. I always go here after 6PM so parking is free. There is a lack of space to eat your crepe- standing outside in the cold is your best option.

Good place! Try it out!
author: Mya M.

description: Delicious! So great and affordable. Nice variety. The line to order and people waiting to pick up is confusing but worth it!
author: Sean B.

description: Savory or dessert crepes...it's all good! It's located inside a Japanese mini mart. The wait can be long, but so worth it. The best crepes served like a cone. No other crepe has come close. They are fresh and delicious. I never stray from my usual strawberries and nutella although I'm sure others are great too. I miss this place!!
author: Giselle B.

description:
i really like the fact that u can customize your crepe from sweet to savory but this place is dirty and the workers r wack.  

**make sure u have cash or else u need to spend at least $1o to swipe ur card

tbh the sophie's crepes in japan town is alot better even tho they have less selection and variety.

ppl come here because it has a ton of reviews and its across the street from burma super star (GET DESSERT THERE, SKIP THIS PLACE)

glad i got finally try this place out but i won't be coming back.
author: jocelyn n.

description:
The crepe I had was only okay. I had the Cinnamon Apple + Brown sugar crepe. I felt it could have been more carmelized with sugar if anything... like apple pie filling. That's what I was envisioning... And then a la mode! Genki needs some improvement for this crepe. 

I also had an order of the egg puffs because I haven't had them since my childhood when my parents used to bring me to Chinatown (NY) on the weekends while they go and shop for groceries. To appease the cranky kids in the car, there was a lady who made egg puffs. They were the best things ever! And then to see egg puffs in San Francisco, I just had to order them. They were a huge disappointment because they were nothing like what I remembered. There was much more air than puff, they were crispy instead of moist and cakey. I think they could've used more batter probably and it would have solved it.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Yummy crepes. Wish there were more things you could add on it like in Japan town. It has a small assortment of Japanese goods.

Whilst coming here I had made an order for a red bean crepe. The worker had accidentally given my crepe to someone else. They handled it well and remade my order. 

The only complaint is that papaya seems to never be stocked here as whenever I come and order it none is available.
author: Monica Z.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! I'm an extreme ice cream fanatic and nothing's better than a couple scoops of vanilla ice cream, strawberries, and Nutella. 

It's a little pricey for just ice cream and fruit but it's worth it for that once in a while treat.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
EGG PUFFS! Oh and good savory crepes too!! Really wanted to try their dessert crepes but I was a little too full from some Purple Kow and their savory crepe so I just went with a small order of egg puffs instead. BUT, this place does have some pretty good savory crepes. I had the beef with melted pepper jack cheese. It was delicious, had sweet caramelized onions and the whole thing held together fairly well.

The egg puffs were very light and airy, I opted for the original. Really should've gotten the peanut butter flavor ones though, those sound more nomlicious. 

The place itself is kinda funny being located inside a small mart, but service is good and the orders don't take too long even though their was a fairly good amount of people there when we went. Definitely want to get some of the Nutella dessert crepes next time!
author: Edison T.

description: Great place for dessert. The honeydew puffs is the best and when you finish one, you would want more. The crepes are good too and my favorite is the green tea ice cream with lychee.
author: Joseph R.

description:
I have a new standard for dessert crepe's after munching on Genki's. I would say, these are probably some of the best crepes in San Francisco. 

The crepe batter is always crunchy and perfectly browned. Never burnt. Never soggy. I love the way you can fold it, but it still stays attached. It's like a miracle pancake.

 I always get a fruit filled crepe. I'm always satisfied with my choice. Add Nutella or ice cream, and I'm in heaven. I dive in, as soon as they hand me my crepe. I would say it's gone within 2 minutes.. Tops. 

The store itself is filled with asian snacks, toys, and beverages. Very entertaining while waiting for your order to be made.
author: Andrew V.

description:
Yay for Genkis! Yummy Crepes on any day! You can also get bubble drinks, toys, candy and snacks. Lots if peeps but your sweet tooth will keep you patient! 
The wait isn't too long and you'll be all smiles once you taste your treat!!
author: Marie P.

description:
I give this place an A+! They have CREPES! Savory crepes. Sweet (including ice cream) crepes. Crepes, crepes, crepes... This time, I got a snack crepe with Nutella, almonds, and strawberries. The crepe was a bit firm - would have been perfect if it was a tad bit softer but it was all good. Btw, they have an array of fruits to choose from - pineapple, kiwi, mango, banana, and more! 

And, they have goods (i.e., unique Asian sweets) = the "mini mart" part of this location. My fave part = they have MOCHI! ... different ice cream flavors wrapped in sweet rice dough. I got the Green Tea & Kona Coffee flavors - each box of two for $1.99. Also macha flavored Kit Kat candy bars & Pocky Sticks! Yum! Other treats, too... 

Anyhow, I plan to return! Btw, they accept credit cards - after a minimum purchase.
author: Pina U.

description:
Desserts for the win! My favorite  is the strawberries with vanilla ice cream. There are tons of different combinations you can make and I want to try them all!!!

I recently moved to inner richmond and had dinner at King of Thai II. I saw the long line of college kids and locals at Genki and decided to stop in to try the crepes. While in line I bought myself a couple of Japanese chocolate treats. It's a great place to get late night Japanese snacks. 

Once I got my nice crispy warm crepe with my whip cream and ice cream I was in HEAVEN! Price is less than $5 and I think they sell boba there as well.

Soo good, can't wait to go back!
author: Linda L.

description:
Japanese Lesson Part 27: Introduction in Da' Hood: 
"O-Genki desu ka, asu-ho?" (How are you, my fine friend?) 
"Genki desu, be-yotch." (I'm quite well, my constant companion.) 

What is it with my homies and crepes? Genki...Sophie's...Belly Good...uhhh... OK, well, three is still a lot. Hey, I don't generalize about my peeps. Stop judging me. Anyhow, Genki was not a destination Jamie W. had in mind for dessert last night. We were thinking about going to Toyboat (...say that word five times fast...NOW!), but it was so brisk that at least Jamie's desire for ice cream diminished as we ventured along Clement. 

Ah yes, Genki. A creperie that multi-purposes as a mini-mart...so at the same time, you can buy a canister of Drano, some laxative tablets, Krazy Glue....and a crepe! Lots of variations to choose from, maybe too much...just ask the loud New Jersey family in front of me who couldn't make up their frickin' minds while the rest of us heaved impatient sighs. Get the strawberry and get the hell out of my way, Frankie Valli!

I finally got my chance to order the $4.95 Vanilla Ice Cream + Nutella Crepe (see my photo). Hey, I still wanted ice cream, inclement weather be damned. I got it in a rolled up crepe that was just north of burnt. The nutella was slathered on the inside. Once I finished the ice cream, I didn't bother eating the crispy remains of the remain, so I tossed it in a planter disguising a waste can.

At least I thought it was a waste can. Anyway, Jamie had better luck with his more modest $2.75 Nutella + Banana Crepe. Genki met our momentary sweet-tooth needs and apparently those of the cast of "Jersey Boys". 

CREPES - 3 stars...middling crepes, heavy on the crispy side 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...well, it's the front of a mini-mart...Midol anyone? 
SERVICE - 2 stars...so why was she nicer to the Jersey Boys cast and not to her own peep? Remember Nagasaki! 
TOTAL - 3 stars...saved by the middling crepes, I guess
author: Ed U.

description: After a sushi dinner I still managed to eat an entire dessert crepe. I had the mango ice cream with strawberries. I was pretty good. The crepe was nice and thin. The convenience of the market/crepe shop actually works out. They carry Asian products like, seaweed snacks, Japanese goodies and etc... The place is really tiny but their menu was a little over whelming, I definitely have to go again maybe try a savory one the next time around. There are so may choices to chose from so there isnt really any room for disappointment.
author: Sothary C.

description:
AMBIENCE: The place is kinda easy to miss because it's actually located in a mini-mart, but the place has a kitschy really genuine feel to it that I like. 

SERVICE: I've never had a problem with the service here! It's fast, the workers are friendly, and you can actually watch them making the crepes so you know what you're getting is quality. 

FOOD: LOVE the amount of options you have here. Whether you like fruit, ice cream, nutella, or savory crepes, there is literally everything on the menu. And the crepesss ohmygod. Crispy at the right spots, soft at the right times, and the flavor combinations from the fruits. To dieeee for! 

OVERALL: I'll be back for sure! Definitely a great stop after a day in the city!
author: Crystal H.

description:
Wow this place gets PACKED in the later hours.  The line was out the door and around the corner.. 

I've been here a few times, but the wait is just not worth it to me... The line is always ridiculously long, and on top of that, it takes forever for them to make the crepes too.  So expect about 20 minutes of waiting.. if not more.... 

In addition to a crepe place, it's also a convenience store with lots of Asian snacks and drinks.  I think it's kind of more fun to just walk around and see what they have.  

Overall, I probably won't go out of my way to come here.. but if my friends insist... well.. then I guess I don't really have a choice ha!
author: Cecilia S.

description:
A- for perfectly crispy thin crepes.
The filling- ice cream and nutella only made it that much better.

It's a hybrid dessert shop/convenience store, so don't expect a lot of room to sit and lounge around. We sat outside and it was fine.

Great place to get my sweet tooth fix.
author: Jo M.

description: One of my favorite places for crepes. Nutella with strawberry and whipped cream is my choice, always. Love how it's crispy enough, but not too crispy to the point where everything crumbles apart. There always seems to be a lot of people but the wait is not bad since there's a whole bunch of junk food n stuff to look at.
author: Tina S.

description:
I came here today with my cousin to try Genki's crepe. We ordered our crepes pretty fast since we already knew what we want. Then we wandered around the shop and found lot of amazing things! There were Japanese drinks, GLASS BOTTLE sprite (is that rare? I don't see it often, so I found it rare...), miso, candies, etc... There was no eggs though (me and my cousin were shopping for eggs for dinner, so yeah). 
Finally, we got our crepes after wandering around for 5-10 minutes. I think my green tea ice cream with red bean paste crepe without whip cream was pretty decent. The green tea ice cream was amazing! Except that I kept dropping the ice cream as I bit the whole crepe. So try not to eat the crepe too fast, or the stuff inside the crepe might drop. 
Um, my cousin didn't like her green tea ice cream with lychees crepe as much as I did. She said that the crepe itself was crispy but kind of salty... But she loved the green tea ice cream and lychee. She kept saying the ice cream didn't taste artificial and the lychees were so good even though they were canned lychees. 
The price is not that bad, crepes are kind of expensive overall. It costed $10.77 for two ice cream crepes. 
Overall, if you don't mind cold and a bit salty crepe, you will enjoy Genki's crepe like I did. Because my cousin's comment, I subtracted one star. Oh, forgot to mention, the staffs were friendly too.
author: Yuy H.

description:
Prior to now the only types of crepes I liked were the ones with eggs in them (see my review for 611 Supreme in Seattle for more info on this).

Genki Crepes has changed this world view tremendously! Japanese style dessert crepes - they are definitely a thing. (Maybe straight up stolen from the French, but oh well.)

I have come here stuffed from Mandalay and thinking there was no way I could possibly consume more food only to find myself scarfing down a perfectly crispy lemon and sugar crepe: the perfect complement to a huge, greasy Burmese meal.

It is light, thin, crunchy and fabulous - word on the street is that the fruit and ice cream crepes are also quite delicious, but I think the lemon/sugar version is the much-better-than-fortune-cookies fortune cookie treat to come here for.

They also have a very impressive selection of Japanese candies.

It's a haul out to the Richmond, but if you're out there, you should definitely stop by.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
This is for the customer service. My 7 year old daughter bought an ice cream cone and her very first lick in front of the ice cream scooper guy the ice cream scoop dropped on the floor. I asked them if they could please give her a new one and the ice cream worker said no. I asked the Asian girl with glasses who was the cashier if my daughter could just get another scoop (with my daughter still holding the cone in tears) and they said I would have to pay for it still. That's whack and karma is a biatch if you ever have kids may they get played one day because of your cheap selves . Acting like try are losing money off one scoop. 

Worst customer service ever.
author: Remeca A.

description:
OMG! If you haven't had a crepe from here, you're seriously missing out or are in denial!

I always get the one with chocolate ice cream, cheesecake, and whip cream. My mouth is watering right now!

I have yet to try their tapioca drinks, but considering how good their crepes are, they must be just as good. 

Great place to go for dessert!
author: Fallon P.

description: Love love this place. The food choices are amazing and delicious. On top while you wait for your order you can shop around for other yumi goods that the store offers! What I love about this place besides the food is that it is open late which is amazing for those who have midnight stack cravings.
author: Galya T.

description:
Been here a few times with friends, but maybe it's just me, but the crepes here, or the crepes that I've tried so far, just do not blow me away to warrant it more stars. It's sitting less than 3.5 stars for me, so this place is not bad. 

My staple selection of crepe at this place would be the strawberry and banana with nutella. Crepe is fused with vanilla ice cream so it's a pretty good combination for a quick sweet treat. To others, this may sound just amazing, but I've had better, but this place isn't bad either.

I would have to say I would only come by Genki Crepes only if my friends decide to go, but never to come here in a planned trip. Sorry. Even if I'm near by and if the place is open and me and my friends are craving dessert, only then this is an option!

Cash only as well. A couple ATM's around on Clement should do you no wrong.
author: Sam K.

description: Quite possibly my happy zone. It's a minimart so you can get all the Japanese yummy snacks you want and the crepes are really good. The only complaint I have is in regards to the lack of seating space. More often than not my friends and I can sit on a bench together and it's fine otherwise we HAVE to eat our crepes on the walk to another location since there is nowhere for us to be.
author: Celyn C.

description: I love this place!!! My favorite thing to order is the almond, banana & Nutella crepe. Whenever I'm in the city for dinner, I head to this place after for dessert. I yet to try the savory crepes.
author: Jev C.

description: Perfectly crispy crepes with a crazy number of filling combos.. ice cream obviously, fruit, sauces, whipped cream... I think we got strawberry mango. While you wait, you can shop for some Japanese treats, or in my case, have nostalgic flashbacks about your super Asian childhood and try to make your very white boyfriend understand your love for little mushroom-shaped chocolates. Open pretty late, so it's a popular dessert destination in the inner richmond.
author: Vivian H.

description:
A little piece of sweet Japan in the heart of San Fran. 

Highlights: 

-fluffyyyy crepe!
-HOME MADE WHIPPED CREAM (I know it's fatty, but you have to, have to, have to!) Definitely one of things that sets itself far from the rest.
-fresh fruit
-NUTELLA!!!
-vanilla / green tea / sesame ice cream 
-Not craving anything sweet? They have salad crepes too that look so yummy, I plan on trying one next time. 


A little big for a dessert after a meal, but perfect to share between two people. Don't try to stuff it too much; I feel like less is more... And I recommend getting either whipped cream OR ice cream and not both. ANNDD They have Japanese girly magazines.  It's a DONE DEAL! LOVE IT.
author: Amy K.

description:
I used to come here and enjoy the crepes, but now, they don't seem to taste the same as they used to. 

Maybe its just me, but when I went, my crepe tasted salty.. They don't add much into your crepe either. The fruit on the other hand tastes pretty fresh.

I honestly don't think its worth your money. I'd say you're better off going to a different location for crepes.
author: Vernice T.

description:
Upon my friend's recommendations, I got a crepe with bananas, nutella, and green tea ice cream. YUM! 

the crepe was still warm, and it was both crispy and chewy. (how is that possible?!) the green tea ice cream was smooth and delicious and there was ALOT of nutella smeared onto the sides of the expertly rolled up crepe-cone concoction. It was a huge portion for just one person, but rightly so, since i paid nearly $7 for it! The line is long but fast, and as you wait for your crepe, you can browse the market area for Japanese snacks, toys, drinks, shampoos, accessories, backpacks...you name it!!!

It was a great late night snack, and a nice walk from my friends' apartment. The street is quite lively and bustling, and with crepe in hand, great to walk around. :)
author: Eileen K.

description:
I ate here for the first time last night. My friends and I ordered two strawberry, nutella crepes and a coffee milkshake.

Food quality: the two crepes were tasty. I liked that the outside of the crepe was crispier than most crepes I've had, but I feel that there could have been more nutella inside. Also, I would have preferred the crepe to be a little hotter, mine was pretty cold. The coffee milkshake I had an issue with... I didn't taste the coffee at all. It tasted mostly like milk and malt. 

Ambience/Service: It's a mini-mart. Nothing too special. The people were friendly though.

Cost: Average. The milkshake seemed pricey for what you got, but nothing too strange for SF, I feel. One annoying thing - it's a $10 minimum for credit card payments.

Would I go again?: Yep.
author: Karina K.

description:
Mmmm.. crispy thin crepes.. I got the ham and cheese crepe, Delicious at first but towards the middle, I suffered through a cheese and mayo overload. I never thought I could have enough of both, but it was actually a little overwhelming with just one piece of lettuce to balance it out.

The boy toy got a nutella crepe with fruit. That was delicious too but I have more of a salt and cheese tooth than a sweet tooth.

 I will definitely be back for more crepes and ask for an extra piece of lettuce or 2.
author: Sharon N.

description:
Oh genki!
What can I say? Their crepes are delish! My favorite is their #1 crepe with vanilla ice cream, nutella, strawberries, and their home made whipped cream. Yum! I love how their crepes are so crispy and crunchy and that while you're waiting for your crepe to be made you can shop around their store for Asian goods.
author: Kristine K.

description: Damn, that was a good crepe. The texture was a little crispier than a traditional soft French crepe (it was almost like a thin fortune cookie) but the added crunch was delicious and the ice cream cone-style wrapper made it easy to eat with one hand. The crepes are a little pricy (my strawberry, banana, & peanut butter crepe came to $9 and change) but worth it for a filling treat on the go.
author: Regina P.

description: Got a banana, Nutella, vanilla ice cream crepe. It was pretty good but nothing too special. There was not a lot of bananas and the crepe was decently sized.
author: Jonathan T.

description: I think I may have been expecting more since this place has such great reviews, but I thought the crepes were okay.  I got an ice cream crepe with strawberries and blueberries.  The ice cream and berries were great, but the crepe itself was kinda salty which I thought was odd.  Maybe they use the same crepe batter for both the sweet n savory crepes, but I wanted the crepe to be sweet to compliment the ice cream and berries.  Although I thought the crepe itself was on the salty side, I do want to go back and try another one!
author: Elena N.

description: Wow I'm surprised I haven't found this place sooner.  When I walked in there, I didn't really expect much because its in a small Asian grocery store.  But after eating the mango ice cream crepe I felt like I've hit jackpot.   The fruit that they place on top was fresh too.  I can't wait to come back here when it gets hotter.
author: Lynn L.

description: Yum yum yum! Long lines = good sign! Savoury ham, cheese & pineapple is delicious and all sweet crepes are great. Ice cream can be too much but so good nonetheless! Highly recommend this hole in the wall to a friend!
author: Kalia J.

description:
=)
I usually come just for the blueberry cheesecake crepe, though I took a longer look at the menu as I was waiting for them and some of the boba options look pretty good. Might have to try it one day.

LA LA LA. Crepe is lightly crisp and NOT soggy and comes with a good amount of filling.... num num num.......... I usually share b/c you get REALLY full off one crepe.

Also nice that they have 2 benches, one inside and one outside, for people to wait, or to sit and chat if it's not too busy :)
author: Emily C.

description:
I love Genki's green tea ice cream filled crepes w/azuki red bean and whip! Mmm mmm! The crepes are perfectly cooked and are so soft. Most crepe places I've been to always seem to burn the edges of the crepe, but not Genki! The place can get real busy at times and I've seen lines out the doors before, but the one time I went there was no lines! Score! The crepes are made fast and ready to go within minutes.

I love how Genki Crepes has a small little mini mart with lots of goodies. From snacks to sweets, to drinks to beauty supplies. Reminds me of the convenience stores in Japan. I was able to find green tea kit kat bars here as well which is real rare! Haven't had these goodies since my last trip to Japan. The snacks and items here are quite pricey. My guess is because a lot of the items are rare. Genki does take plastic but there is a $10 minimum which isn't hard to surpass once you look at the menu and browse around the store!
author: Hannah L.

description:
I thought I wrote a review for Genki's, but I guess not...

Every time I'm in the area grabbing dinner, I have to stop by here for dessert. I love that this place sells my Japanese snacks & drinks but the crepes here are so good ! It gets busy so don't expect to be in & out of that place. Good luck with parking around dinner time, it gets hella packed. There's a $10 minimum for credit card purchases.
author: Sara L.

description:
There's a bunch of dessert places on Clement like Kowloon Dessert Cafe and Sweet Delite. But I prefer going to Genki whenever I have people with me like my younger brother and sister who may not be as as food adventurous yet. They just haven't developed a craving for glutinous rice with lychee jelly balls in a ginger syrup, yet. So Genki and their awesome dessert crepes it is. 

What I like about Genki is it's more than just a creperie, it's a cool hangout spot for all sorts of folks. Everyone comes here, from people tired of waiting in line at Burma Super Star, to people wanting dessert after some pho down the street, to people just having a craving for some Asian snacks. Genki has it all. 

I mean who doesn't like vanilla ice cream and nutella within a light and crispy crepe?
author: Earl G.

description:
Lots of Japanese candies and snacks selection.
Lots of sweet or savory crepes. I usually go for ice cream crepes..either green tea ice cream w azuki or red bean ice cream w mangos. Crepes are crunchy on the top and soft/chewy with ice cream.
Savory crepes are cheesy!
Popular in evenings with younger generations
author: Linda T.

description:
One of my friends told me about this place, so I checked it out today with my fam. Low priced crepes here!
Crepes here are pretty good, they're crunchy and you eat them like you're holding an icecream cone.
 -1 star for not putting nutella in my crepe and charging me for it ):
and -1 star for the clueless cashier :P
author: Ian S.

description:
Oh, Genki...you are just plain awesome!

Nothing makes this kitten purr like a crepe with banana and nutella. And that's saying a lot since I'm not really a cat person.

If I'm in the neighborhood, you bet I'm gonna stop by Genki.

Purr
author: Greg S.

description:
After spending a good three hours at My Tofu House, my friend and I decided it was time for dessert, with Genki winning out over Schubert's. The shop itself is set aside as the front half of a little mart that sells various Japanese and Korean goodies, and offers up a an extensive collection of sweet and savory crepes, as well as a variety of egg puff flavors. With my friend getting their chocolate cake and Hershey's sauce crepe, I opted for a simpler sesame egg puff.

And boy, I wish I'd gotten a crepe instead. The egg puffs aren't bad, with the sesame flavor being quite distinct, but overall, a fairly underwhelming pastry. The chocolate cake crepe, on the other hand, was amazingly tasty - they certainly did not skimp on the chocolate sauce or cake. Served on a crispy, thin crepe, my only complaint was that the entire crepe was not crispy - understandable though, given that the sauce and whip cream are bound to soften it up.

It can be a bit of a wait (~10 minutes) until your order comes out, especially on busy days, but it's well worth the short wait. And at $4 for most crepes, and $3.25 for egg puffs, Genki definitely won't break the bank (remember to bring cash though, as they only accept credit over $10).
author: Johnny W.

description:
I HATE THIS PLACE.
The service is TERRIBLE.

I came here a year ago and had a BAD experience, but I decided to try it again due to the hype from friends. But never again....

After I witnessed a huge group in front of me receive large "packed to the max" crepes with their toppings, I was so excited to get mine. I ordered a crepe with strawberry, nutella and vanilla ice cream, NOTHING MORE, NOTHING LESS.

They gave me my crepe and the first thing I saw were 4 slices of bananas on top. I kindly said, "excuse me, I asked for strawberries?" and they replied "no. you asked for banana" and I said "no.. I clearly asked for strawberry" then the people working behind the counter all gave the "who the fuck she think she is?" look to each other and they said once more, "NOO.. you asked for banana.." Then I started getting irritated. DUDE. HOW ARE YOU GOING TO TELL ME WHAT I ORDERED?! The girl rudely grabbed my crepe and scraped out all of the bananas and put strawberrys in there.

Once I got my crepe back the ice cream was literally at the "bottom" of the crepe and there were only THREE strawberrys in there. And the people before me had like 10 each in their crepes, NOT EVEN EXAGGERATING.

I sucked it up and let it go. I took my spoon and tried to dig up my vanilla ice cream with my strawberry, but the ice cream sunk to the bottom! The crepe nearly filled the cone shaped paper that it is served in and my half a scoop of ice cream was disappointing. 

I HATE THIS PLACE. I AM NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN.
author: Linda K.

description: Freaking delicious!  The place is like a weird convenience store/crepe take-out.  They have crepes filled with ice cream or warm, gooey stuff (Nutella, chocolate, caramel, etc.)  I had both, of course.  The first one was lychee flavored ice cream.  Yum!  Then when my teeth were a painin' from the cold, I bit into my Nutella banana crepe.  OMG, I love this stuff!  They also have bobo teas.  I had the lychee one; it was just ok - too watery.  But other than that, this place rocks!
author: Ha D.

description:
I've walked by and used my cadaver dog's nose to smell the pancake-batter at many crepe places in the past. But I've never ever had a crepe of any kind until this last weekend. It took me nearly 40 years to finally had a crepe. And if you want to tease me, you can call me the "40 Year old CREPE-VIRGIN!"

Well, this long debut has got me at one of Clement's busiest place, which specialize in crepes of any kind, smoothies, ice cream and other yummy treats. The busy shop is also a grocery store that sell imported groceries. Although with the pretty good selection of imported goods, the store's money-maker is definitely the fresh crepes. 

I went straight to the menu posted on the wall and ordered the #25: the mixed fuit crepe. For $3.75 I get a fruit combination of sliced bananas, strawberries and mandarin orange with whipped cream and a Nutella spread for an additional $1.00, which comes to $4.75+ tax. I was waiting in line with a bunch of crepe-experts and I try the best I can to hide my crepe-virginity. Many of the people, who are waiting, are twice as young than me and have the looks of a Hong Kong Cantopop icon. 

My military-look doesn't blend in well with the other young Hong Kong hipsters. Maybe Joe Cool is getting old and Hello Kitty is the biggest trend. 

After a 10 minute wait for my crepe being prepared and absorbing the younger kids talking on their cell-phone with their annoying but creative ringtones, I finally got my first ever crepe. After one bite of my first crepe, I thought I was in sweet-heaven. The fruit-compost was fresh and with the awesome combination of sliced-bananas, a cloud of whipped cream, and a spread of Nutella makes my crepe very unique. Man, I wish I had this stuff when I was younger. Now I know what was I missing for the past thirty-something years. After that crepe, I felt like a kid again. Even my wife and kids had this unique treat before I did.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/83dXgt2nG98JJG2F7ai8AQ?select=CrH-XBvIB_cEe6p0Ob5f7g

"Where have I've been?"

I paid my treat in cash. I'm pretty sure they accept credit cards too.
author: Matt G.

description: Japanese minimart with crepes. Plus, they give you a cone to eat it on the go. Probably better for desserts though. Prices for snacks are a little on the pricy end.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
If you have room for a large dessert after dinner, then this is the place to go! If you've got an Asian snack/product/toy from your childhood that you've wanted to get your hands on, then this mart has got it in stock for you!

I would say that the crepes section of the shop is $ while the mini-mart section is $$. Because everything from the mini-mart is imported, it will be on the pricier side. But sometimes, that Asian candy/snack is worth it! My boyfriend loves Kit-Kats and he loves coming to Genki to buy the different flavors that are available (sometimes, Genki stocks different flavors of Kit-Kats. Their usuals are the regular chocolate and dark chocolate flavors. So far, I've seen strawberry, green tea, and milk chocolate). I also like to occasionally buy aloe jelly drinks from here. They've got a wide variety of brands and sizes in stock.

I personally most frequent the crepes section of the store, which serves both dessert and savory crepes. I like buying their dessert crepes with ice cream and my favorite is the strawberry ice cream with kiwi fruit. Their crepes are very large and very crunchy and can get a bit messy if you order the dessert crepes with ice cream. The size of the crepe is large enough to share between two people, but the way they serve the crepes makes sharing difficult (the crepes are served wrapped in an ice cream cone-like paper, so you'll have to hold it upright.

On a side note, this place does not accept card for purchases under $10 so why not buy your favorite childhood Asian snack to go with your crepe?

There isn't very much seating around the area so you may end up standing around outside. There are a few small benches inside and outside of the store, but they're usually taken up by other people. I always see customers in this store, although it's never overly crowded.

I love to take friends here for dessert after a dinner out. I always have fun walking around the mini-mart and looking at all the imported Asian products. Overall, it's a great place to end the night or to end a meal date. I would recommend stopping by if you're ever in the area.
author: Nirel R.

description:
only 3 stars this time because I barely get any fruits.

I ordered the red bean ice cream with banana crepe w/ whip cream for $4.95.  When I got the crepe, there were only 3 pieces of banana -_-

3 pieces?! Im sad.  But I do like their red bean ice cream a lot.  Genki is delicious, I just wish that they will provide more on the ingredients.
