And the items in the store? I have never purchase anything cause everything is so pricy, it's not even worth it.
author: Stephy L.

description: Is it just me or is it a little weird that a crepe place is inside of a small market?  Nonetheless, the crepes are pretty tasty.  Although, their crepes are a tad bit crispier than I prefer and it had huge chunks of bananas, which made it slightly hard to eat without the use of a fork.  But hey, I don't really discriminate against banana nutella crepes.
author: Rose A.

description:
I've been here twice and after the second time I think I've been successfully converted into a fan because I can't stop thinking about their yummy crepes!!

I've only tried two different variations: Nutella, banana and strawberries with lychee ice cream and Nutella and strawberries with vanilla ice cream. I enjoyed every last bite of both!

I think the crepes are a pretty big size for a sweet treat, so my boyfriend and I usually share one. This way I can satisfy my craving and not feel guilty about it. =)

The store itself is always fun to peruse while waiting for your dessert to come out. They have a plethora of AZN products and goodies like dried squid, green tea Kit Kats and cute toys and trinkets.
author: Sabrina P.

description:
When you will be consumed by the smell the this place the second you step foot on this block.  It's hard to avoid it and 99.9 % of the time, you will walk in even without knowing. I think i come here more for the candy and snacks than the crepes itself.  This place sells crepes and other surprises.  But since this place is called Genki Crepes, let me start out by reviewing their main sale item.   They have a huge selection of crepe, but I never like having ice cream in my crepe, so I usually stick to my Nutella and banana crepe.  I normally don't have to wait too long for my crepe, it's just finding a place to stand in the crowd as you wait that's the problem.  I like how my crepe was crunchy and the ingredients are fresh, but I really wish i had a place to sit down and enjoy it without all the customers looking at me.  There's only one bench there, but i guess that's because they don't want to convert this place into a sit down cafe. 

The snacks and goodies is worth exploring here.  You will be surprised by what you will find.  They sell hair and body care here from Asia, but it's almost double the cost from asia. I saw some items that was double the price of what i bought it for in Hong Kong.  I guess it makes sense because they might ship the items over.  It's hard to walk away from their snacks section, they have lots of green tea and matcha snacks here, so if you are a fan you are pretty much screwed, because you want it all.  Don't be surprise if you walk out of here for bags of delicious snacks!
author: Belinda C.

description:
Came here because Good Belly was closed but this place is pretty good! For about 6 dollars, I got a HUGE crepe filled with chocolate ice cream, whipped cream and chunks of cheesecake! It was AMAZING. A bit too sweet for my liking, but overall a good experience.

What's really cool is that the mini-mart part sells a bunch of asian products that you normally can't find at your local Safeway or Vons. I picked up some wasabi peas, a couple of Ramune sodas and Boob enhancing breath mints. Yup, that's an asian market for you!
author: Kathleen N.

description: Not too fond of crunchy crepes and also pigeons in the aerial kitchen area...
author: Chantal P.

description: Gone downhill...make sure they repeat your order as they got mine wrong and stated I didn't order what I stated.
author: Jssk M.

description:
Cool Asian snack food market that also serves crepes and other Asian desserts. Stick to the crepes. I like the strawberry with whipped cream or the lemon and sugar crepes. But tonight, I was too full from dinner at Off the Grid Haight and just ordered a Thai iced tea. Not Thai. Not iced. Not tea. Tasted like grass jelly drink.

Interesting note: we were commenting on the steady line for Burma Superstar across the street on a Thursday night even at 9pm. We bookmarked it to try some other time. Then they end up on the news Friday and were shut down for E-coli poisoning. Un-bookmark.
author: Carrie W.

description:
I've been coming here since Junior High and believe me, that was at least 7 years ago. At one point, the cooks knew who I was. XD 

These Crepes are so good; wether it's the dessert or savory crepes, it's always worth it. The crepe itself it always crispy and crunchy on the top but soft as it gets to the bottom of it. Definitely recommend this place to anyone who's visiting SF or is a local!
author: Amanda T.

description: We don't come to SF often but when we do, we ALWAYS stop by here to get a vanilla ice cream, nutella and banana crepe and 2 orders of the egg puffs.  I like to try new places, but this place is too good to pass up.
author: Mai T.

description:
Finally I get to try Genki's after much anticipation.  I ordered the kiwi with strawberry crepe and my friend ordered the crepe with chocolate ice cream and cheesecake.  The crepe is well constructed and crispy.  I felt like I didn't get much toppings though, I only had three kiwi slices in mine!  My crepe was okay but we loved his crepe more.  

Wait for the crepe was about ten minutes, and I was surprised to see the place busy on a freezing cold Tuesday night!  I thought how random it was that it's a market too with some Hello Kitty sweets!  The downside of this though is only a couple of benches to eat your crepe at.  

Maybe I'm just not crepe crazy like everyone else, afterall cupcakes are my sweet of choice, but Genki made a well constructed crepe that didn't get messy in my friend's new car, so props for that!
author: Cat C.

description:
Wow what an amazing little place but their crepes will knock you out with their big flavors!  i got hooked when i visited Frisco and i started to go with my daughters
i just wish i could find them in LA...I love the ham & cheese with lettuce or breakfast crepes will do for me!
author: Leticia D.

description:
This place is pretty cool. It not only sells crepes, both savory and dessert, but it also sells random Asian stuff as well. You can find anything from medicine, to candy, to stuffed animals, to drinks, to car fresheners, everything! One stop shop for all Asian randomness.

The crepes are pretty good, not amazing. I usually get the strawberry ice cream with the kiwi on top, or the red bean one cuz red beans are crazy good. There was also one time when the server only gave me one scoop of ice cream on my crepe... it left a huge pocket where the other scoop was suppose to be, not cracking at all. AND it was $5+! 

2.5 stars for the crepe, 3.5 for the store = 3overall. Not too shabby.

This place is cash only until you reach like $10 or so.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
Genki Crepes is my absolute favorite place to get egg puffs in the city! When you take a bite into the egg puffs, they aren't airy, crispy or hollow like many of those crappy egg puffs I've eaten at other-places-that-shall-not-be-named, but filled with the egg puff batter that is not too dry, not too wet.  Juuuuust right!!

They have different flavors of egg puffs such as chocolate, coconut and stuff. I personally have no tried all the flavors because for me, original will always taste the best!

The crepes here are very delicious. My favorite one would probably be #1, the strawberry/banana crepe! Can't ever go wrong with that!

Overall Genki Crepes is a pretty fun store to hang out at. There is always a lot going on inside. They sell a lot of anime figurines, gashapons, capsule toys, jdm air fresheners and a lot of jdm snacks, candy and drinks. I highly recommend this place for quick dessert on the go!
author: Caroline L.

description:
Genki Crepes sell their hot items in front but there's a very compact mini mart in the back that sells all sorts of things. I come here mainly to get my bags of Green Tea Kit Kats when they have them in stock.

I tried the Mix Fruit and Nutella Crepe once but it was soggy and the fruit tart. I had also ordered an egg puff but that was soft and doughy as well. What a disappointment as they smelled so good as they were making them! =/
author: Kitty K.

description:
Delicious is all I can say.

The place is bustling with crowds of people and there's a mini mart too! The crepe's wrapping is made just right so its slightly soft, slightly crispy and holds the ice cream well. I got the Green Tea Strawberry crepe with Nutella. You can ask to substitute the ice cream for another flavor if you'd like!

I came here during a trip to try different foodaries in SF and this was one of my must-stop places. 

In the OC there is NO. None. Japanese/Taiwanese crepe specialty shops other than Beverly hills. Which reminds me... That is my next stop. :P
author: Monique N.

description: Holy crap, this place totally exceeded my expectations. I like crepes and all, but this one was on a whole other level. There is/was a Genki Living down in LA and I'd had less than impressive crepes there, so I think I was associating the 2 places together every time I passed by this one, which is why I've never tried it until now! But, glad I finally did. This place is a crepe place + mini mart, so it was fun to browse through the Asian snacks while waiting for our crepe. The 3 of us shared the cheesecake crepe, and this was the first time I'd ever had such a combo. The blueberries really topped it off though, and every bite was creamy and sweet, with the crepe helping to balance it out so it wasn't too rich. At $6/crepe, it was the perfect after-dinner treat to share between us without feeling TOO guilty about all the calories!
author: Kathy L.

description: Walk into a small asian market...you see hi chews on one side...some green tea on the other....oh and a small section making fresh crispy crepes filled with whatever your little heart desires. I was full walking into this place but I could not say no to having a crepe after seeing a little girl outside of the shop eating her genki crepe. I decided on nutella with vanilla ice cream...sounds simple right? So simple but so freaking good....get the image of crepeville crepes out of your head because those can not even compare to these crepes. These crepes were nice and crunchy, not soft and limp....combined with the sweetness of the nutella and the delicious ice cream....oh my goodness, you are literally closing your eyes and savoring each crispy bite. These crepes are so good that I want one every day of my life.....oh how I wish.
author: Hong T.

description:
Super yummy crepes! Had both a ham and cheese as well as a Nutella with strawberries. The crepes taste great and they don't skimp on any of the ingredients. You can smell this place from a block away and it did not disappoint!

It's located in a mini-mart and there isn't anywhere to sit, but it's wrapped in such a way that makes it easy to eat on the go. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in the city.
author: Cristina F.

description:
My late night mission to end the night with a sweet tooth, we always end up here. I love the "JDM' candy varieties, so I get to shop while I wait for my crepe. 

I like things plain and simple, strawberries, ice cream and whip cream hold that nutella thing... fresh, fresh, fresh and warm.
author: Zane T.

description:
I've been here twice. I like getting the green tea ice cream with red bean paste too. I agree with Cynthia C that it's not as good as Sophie's Crepes. Their crepe is more dry and crunchy, and green tea ice cream is just not the same as green tea gelato. It's alright for the price.

The place has an amazing variety of overpriced, Asian candy.
author: Tes Y.

description:
One of those hyped up 'foodie' places in San Francisco, although it does live up to the hype and popularity.

You can't go wrong with any of the selection, both sweet and savory crepes are delicious.

The fact that it's located inside a small Asian grocery store adds a subtle vibe to the experience of getting and eating these crepes.
author: Oliver D.

description:
i didn't believe my friends when they said Genki Crepes was the best. In fact, I made fun of it and called it Janky Crepes. At first glance when we walked in, I was surprised it was a Japanese market too. How good can these crepes be? 

I got the Red Bean ice cream and Banana crepe and it has changed my views on crepes forever! These crepes aren't eggy and soft, they're crunchy, thin, and crisp goodness! I've never had anything like it! While you wait, there's tons of snacks and candy to look at, including interesting kit kat bar flavors and hello kitty snacks.

Genki gives the crepe to you in a paper crepe holder, so it's easy to walk around and take bites out of this savory dessert. The red bean and banana really go well together! Sigh,  I can still hear the crunch in every bite, take me back to Genki!
author: Joanna S.

description: I get my favourite crepes here. If you go late at night there's usually a lot of people but they are quick and efficient and I never had to wait a long time even with a lot of people
author: Sherry F.

description: Nutella, bananas, and red bean ice cream crepe!!!! This little market has a bunch of my favorite asian snacks including green tea kit kat, gummy choco, and hello panda :)
author: Michelle H.

description:
Before I talk about why I like this place, the only one major critique I have is the amount of cheese they put into the crepes-- TOO MUCH. 

So I tried 3 of their crepes: (1) Nutella & banana, (2) Beef Sugiyaki & Green Onions & Cheese, and (3) Avacado, Turkey, Sour Cream, Cheese. 

(1) Nutella & Banana-- YUM YUM YUM! So delicious!! I loved the crepes because it had just the right amount of crunch in it. In addition, it had a good amount of banana and not an overpowering of nutella. However, it's very hard to mess up nutella and banana, in my opinion.

(2) Beef sugiyaki, green onions, and cheese-- The beef sugiyaki tasted great! But the cheese was just too much. This is probably the crepe I would recommend to everyone!

(3) Avacado, turkey, sour cream, and cheese-- This could be a great crepe IF it had less cheese and avacado so that I could actually taste the turkey. 

Overall, they make their crepes really well and there's a various of selections. The only problem is I feel like they add a lot of the "cheap ingredients" to fill up the crepe-- cheese, green onions, etc... 

But still... this is worth trying except I'm sure there's much better crepes shops in San Fran.
author: Funglin W.

description: Great spot for late night crepes after drinks on Clement or just hanging with friends.
author: Tamara D.

description:
The flavors are on spot but when weighing portion size, it just doesn't compare to the Genki Crepes in southern california.  The crepes are just an extension of an actual Asian store filled with goodies that you wouldn't find at a regular market.

There's no way to mess up a strawberry, nutella, and vanilla ice cream crepe. It's even better that it's wrapped like an ice cream cone! The crepe is thin, hot, and crunchy. This causes the nutella to warm and melt over the ice cream and fruit. 

Choose your fruit to ice cream ratio and enjoy! :)
author: Samantha L.

description:
I love my crepes crispy so Genki Crepes gets 5 stars from me.  

That's right, I love driving up in my pajamas at 10pm at night, waiting 5-10 minutes in line to order a hot and fresh, crispy, perfectly sweet but not too sweet with a hint of vanilla crepe stuffed with Nutella, strawberries and bananas.  

If I'm really feeling like a fat kid, I'll order it with a scoop of ice cream.  

It hits the spot every time I go.
author: Cristina W.

description:
For a quick, simple crepe stop...go here.
I got the green tea ice cream crepe with strawberries with whip cream added. Just about $5. The service was fast. The crepe didn't drip or fall out of place while I ate it and other times I've had crepes in the paper cone, they fall apart leaving me in a mess. STUFFED with ice cream, strawberries distributed from top to bottom throughout the crepe. An easy dessert. There's also other Asian goodies in the store so pretty convenient if you crave other things.
author: Candice L.

description:
Really good crepes! My husband and I got the lychee and custard crepe, and both of us added nutella. The crepe itself was just the right amount of crispy, and I love that they didn't skimp on the nutella.

I would dock the place 1 star on its ambience, but in my opinion, it's not fair to do this if the food is good and service is acceptable. The area the place is in is just okay. It's inside a market with very limited seating, and because the doors are wide open, flies kept harassing us.
author: Faith C.

description:
This place is over rated and dingy. I almost missed it driving by because I spotted quickly across the street first with its bright and familiar lights.

Their crepes have nothing on sophies in Japantown!
author: Vi Vi V.

description:
My go-to's are:

Sweet:
#1- Vanilla ice cream + strawberry + nutella + whipped cream

Savory:
#17- Beef sukiyaki + green onions + monterey jack cheese

Dinner, and dessert! Mmm..!
author: Michelle C.

description:
#2: Green Tea Ice Cream, Banana, Nutella

Much better crepe than my first time. It was cripsy and had great flavor.

Line was a little awkward. There were two lines forming and people were getting confused.
author: Lauren K.

description:
If your craving for sweets & savory, this is the spot to go! It's always a line, but that's how you know it's "OH SO GOOD"! 

I've gotten the Nutella with strawberries & banana with whip cream and choc drizzle and Hotlink with cheese. Of course not all in one, lol. There is something about there crepes, it's super thin, but not to thin where it tears, and very crispy. 

I would definitely recommend this place to others. Very good on budget and gets you full. So if you want something to take on a run, this is the place. And while your waiting for your crepe you can shop in there lil store with lots of other goodies!! 

Parking can be a little hard, but just a few circles around and you find it.
author: Mona Lisa L.

description:
This has still been the best place if you need an ice cream pick me up.

The store itself is pretty cramped. It's serves as half a Japanese convenient store and a crepe stand. They can get pretty busy with long lines so while you wait, it's fun to look around the store and add to your bill. This is still the only place where I can find green tea Kit Kats. That alone will have me coming back.

Parking is tough.. Duh, you're in San Francisco. But it's worth the walk.

The Nutella-Banana-Vanilla Ice Cream is a must. If you ask nicely, they may add some strawberries.. for a price, of course.
author: Tricia F.

description:
Pros
Offers different treats

Cons
Crunchy Crepes
$10 minimum to use your debit card
Can have a long line
Parking 

Have you ever read rave reviews, decided to go because it just looked so darn good, then taken a bite and thought "what is wrong with people"

Well that's exactly what I thought after I took a bite of my over cooked Banana Nutella crepe here. I felt obligated to eat this crappy-crepe because I stood in line so long. Decided I will only buy crepes from Japantown.
author: R. D.

description:
Perfect egg puffs that i cant find in the south bay, on top of that! There are flavor options! But original still wins it.

Deesert Crepe: im in love with you!!!! Their redbean ice cream rocks my world! 

Savory crepes: the suki yaki was delicious, and the chicken was good as well. I felt that the cheese was a little too overpowering in flavor, maybe ill have them go easy next time.

Cant wait 'til my next visit!!!
author: Jenny L.

description:
I love Genki! Dinner isn't complete until I've followed it with a crepe from Genki's ^_^

My absolute favorite is the vanilla ice cream with strawberries and Nutella and whipped cream crepe. The strawberries are always super sweet and anything that has Nutella on it has my name written all over it. 

Now, I hate whipped cream and the first few times that I would get this crepe, I would make my boyfriend eat all of the whipped cream before I got to all the good stuff on the bottom. One day, he decided to trick me and I got fooled me into eating all the whipped cream. It was delishhhhhhhhhhh- tasted just like ice cream! And that was the day that I fell in love with freshly whipped cream. 

The crepe itself is super light and just a bit crisp on the edges, which adds a great bit of texture to it. It holds the contents really well and just balances all the sweetness out. Service here is also great and I love browsing around and grabbing some candy while I'm in there.

I really miss Genki's :( It'll be my first snack when I get back to SF!
author: Leanne M.

description: Always loved the crepes here.  This time, I tried the chocolate ice-cream with cheesecake, AND it was fantastic!
author: Shirl L.

description:
Maybe I'm just picky about crepes, but I thought these were way too crunchy and huge chunks of my crepe fell onto the floor with every bite. And the ice cream was meh. It tasted like generic, no-name brand ice cream. 

I hate to say I didn't like it because I've heard so many people that do. Maybe I'm just crazy.
author: Ashley E.

description: Love this place. I hadn't been here in a while   Today I tried Cheesecake, Nutella & mango.  I usually get strawberry, banana & Nutella.
author: Funnywino W.

description:
Oh man, right when you walk in the store the aroma of fresh delicious crepes smack you in the face!

It was a good idea to follow Toucan Sam's advice: " Follow your nose"

If you are reading a buncha reviews to figure out yay or nay, let me just tell you right now:

YAY!
author: Julia D.

description:
Genki Crepes is delicious. Came here late one night because I was in the area and had been recommended by a friend. 

First of all, they make Crepes with ice cream  and fruit in the middle! Amazingly delicious concept. I had the vanilla ice cream & mango within a plain crepe. It was so simple yet so fulfilling. I might be biased because I love sweet crepes so much but first bite and I was in heaven. 

The interior could be nicer and a bit more welcoming. I perused the Asian grocery store within while waiting for my crepe to be made. They didn't carry my favorite ramen noodles (Mama noodles) but they had plenty of other good snack foods. 

The crepes are delicious and cheap. Will be back soon for sure to try other varieties.
author: Vidya K.

description:
Been here a few times before and was here again today. My friends love this place and it's actually pretty good! Better than the crepes in San Jose. 

I usually go for something with nutella in it (can't go wrong with nutella, according to a friend) and/or ice cream and fruits with whip cream. They definitely need one of these in San Jose. 

It's awesome, but I would avoid night times since it's usually when it's the most busiest or avoid weekends, too. Even so, they're pretty fast with taking orders and getting the food out. 

Love the mini market that's within. Highly recommend coming here if you're craving for some good, low-priced, and freshly made crepes, if you're in South San Francisco area.
author: Josephine C.

description:
If you're near or on Clement Street in the city, it is a must that you go here. Whether you have a sweet tooth or not you are going to love everything about this place, especially the crape desserts if you go after a night of dancing.

I feel this places gets bonus points for the tons of random but flavorful toppings and options for the crapes. but It's not just desserts this place has a neck for the novelty items that you can't find in your regular store. Everything from overseas candy and games, to trinkets. Their need to be a one stop shop definitely works if you're into that kind of Genre for toys or trinkets.

It was a real battle on figuring out whether it's a four or five star review and I decided on four only because you can get lost in the store just wondering through everything they have. I found a lot of it to be fun but pointless. The crapes are the star of the show and should always be at the forefront. But Warning if you bring children here, be prepared for them to have a major sugar overload.
author: Donald W.

description:
Alright, so we all know their crepes are amazing.

But even their pearl milk tea is good! 

And I don't understand how their watermelon is ripe year long, no complaints here. I always ask them to put half sugar and it is PERFECT.
author: Jess C.

description: The green tea ice cream w/ choco cake it my absolute fav! The best green tea ice cream.
author: Rhea C.

description: Genki Crepes in english means "Best Crepes". Enough said.
author: Ryan R.

description:
I need to get more adventurous and order a more complex or savory crepe.  But I keep it simple.  Crepe with butter, sugar, and whip cream.  So delicious and simply delightful.  I have not had one in years and it was a joy falling back into the warm, buttery, sugary goodness of it.  I also remembered why I have not had one in years...the guilt from eating pure sugar, butter, crepe batter and whip cream.  But it is worth it everyone in a while.  
I think Genki is a Clement street wandering must!  But they only have one crepe maker so they can be a bit slow.  The girl at the cashier was not so friendly and clearly not big on eye contact.  But the store is adorable and fun to browse through.
author: Chelsey G.

description: In the Richmond and want something sweet? Look no further, their crepes are soooo good. I liked their banana and nutella. Another solid one was their strawberry ice cream one. Gets busy so you may have to wait a bit. Also, there is little to no places to sit so be prepared to walk and eat, stand, or wait for a spot. Been here two times and will come back.
author: Soroosh A.

description:
Oh Genki, why did I delay in trying you out?

Now I feel that I missed out on something amazing for so long!

The crepe here is delicious. Big and filling, Though I couldn't finish it because toward the end of my crepe, there was too much nutella to crepe ratio. But none the less delicious and just enough crispy to house my fillings without being soggy. I also understand that there is a necessity to more fruit in the crepe.

I love their little mini mart, it carries selections of japanese snacks and toys that I have not been able to find in any asian grocery, and something to entertain you until you recieve your crepe. Truly a gem in San Francisco. Can't wait until my next trip.

minimum of $10 purchase for card users.
author: Ellie C.

description:
Ok... I'm going to get a lot of crap for this but man... the milkshake that I got was freaking salty! YUP, you read right... salty!

We (siblings and BFF) went here for dessert this past Monday and since I didn't want crepes... was too full from dinner... I opted to try their milkshake. 

I got the honeydew milkshake... thinking its going to be fresh and cool and delicious... yah no.

First sip... EWWW. No joke, salty.

I tried to sip some more, but I couldn't... just couldn't ... eck! 
 
The rest of the siblings were happy with their crepes... so the lesson here folks: get crepes and nothing more... don't be spontaneous like me and get a milk shake... 

Quote of the night: "is yours salty?"
author: Cath M.

description:
3.5 solid stars for the taste and quality.

It would've been nicer if there were a seating areas. There are a couple of chairs (less than 10) along the wall and outside, but that was it.

I ordered a green tea ice cream with lychee crepe and moo cow ordered a savory crepe (sausage and cheese). 

They were equally delicious in different ways. 

What's unique about this place? The crepes are slightly more crispy than your other crepe stores. Other places have a chewy texture, but Genki's crepes are thin and crispy. I guess it is up to people preference. 

Nice place to stop by if i was in the area again, but not something I crave for when I am sitting at home.
author: Jen H.

description: Just to warn you, If I could eat just Nutella for the rest of my life, I would. So this place is just heaven. They take crepes that they make right there and then and smother the inside with nutella- you already won me! My fav crepe is the nutella and strawberries...you just cannot go wrong. The whipped cream is just the icing on the cake ;)
author: Michelle I.

description:
Nutella banana crepe... yummy!  And I love browsing the little Japanese shop while waiting.  

The service is quick.  Nice place to grab dessert when wandering Clement.  Sorry, I gotta say that even though I like these crepes, I still prefer Sophie's.
author: Lyn C.

description:
WOW!! I'm a GENKI FAN!! I like this place a lot! Everytime I walk in I get super excited for the Candy and Snacks that they have.

 I ordered my FIRST GENKI CREPE last Sunday..I dont know why it took me so long to try one out, but it's a shame because I've been missing out on some GOOD FREAKING CREPES! =)

I ordered the Strawberry nutella vanilla ice cream with chunks of cheesecake crepe!! Goodness Gracious, I was a fatty that night, but it was SOOO worth it! I love this place and so will  you!
author: Rosalyn T.

description:
I've been coming here for years, no matter how far I lived and I can't believe I haven't wrote a review! 

Located on the corner of clement and 5th, this place is the SHIT!!!!! In a Good way! I always make it a MUST to stop by this place when I'm even near the city!

I've always got their crepes and crepes only. 

Crispy, HUGE, and filled with heavens ingredients. 

My favorite: banana, custard, and Nutella. 


It's surely an awesome date spot, or an indulgent spoil yourself spot... :) 

Keep doing what yall do! As I would be devastated if you ever go away!
author: Antoinette S.

description:
Having a hard time seeing what the other thousand reviews are seeing - anyone can fill a crepe with yummy stuff, sweets and various fruits, so it really has to come down to the quality of the crepe. Here they serve something impressively sized but ultimately overcooked - it has that kinda cardboard consistency at the very top. 

Good service and it does take awhile to get your order but it helps to browse the market - and I just mean browse, because their snacks and drinks are marked up quite a bit.
author: Steph C.

description:
Genki specializes in three types of crepes:

a) Ice Cream (8 main flavors offered: vanilla, strawberry, chocolate, red bean, lychee, mango, green tea)
b) Savory (i.e. spinach, mushrooms, cheese, wasabi, beef sukiyaki, tuna salad...)
c) Other Sweets (fruits, nutella, chocolate syrup, whipped cream, etc.)

You can also create your own combination from the items they have available. After you've decided, order at the counter and they'll call your number when it's ready.

To pass the time, there is a lot of Japanese eye candy to browse through from their stock of toys, sweets, snacks, drinks and beauty supplies on sale.

A great place if you're in the mood for a twist on the typical dessert.

PS: This is a sister store to nearby Genki Ramen.

PPS: On this visit I was too full, so I opted for a scoop of strawberry ice cream on a sugar cone. Lovely.
author: Cathy K.

description:
I've always been a Sophie's crepes fan and resisted trying this place because I've always thought no one else can top Sophie's. This place doesn't top Sophie's but it comes pretty damn close! The crust of the crepe is super crispy and tastes more like a cookie instead of a soggy crepe like the american crepes. I usually get the green tea ice cream with red beans paste. I'll ask for one scoop of ice cream instead of two to make me not feel so fat. haha. The egg puffs are good too. Had the coconut egg puff and it's so addicting that you can't just eat one. 

Been back here like 3x already since I came here the first time. hehe
author: Cynthia C.

description:
I'm not really sure why Genki Crepes got so many reviews. It was just your typical asian crepe-- add a scoop of ice cream, throw in some fruits, nutella and maybe top it off with whipped cream. I didnt find it to be extremely special or super delicious. The location is also a little hectic--crepe-eating and grocery shopping is a bit of a strange combination. I think crepevine and sophi's crepes are both better alternatives to genki.

lasty, doesnt genki mean healthy in japanese? i didnt quite feel very healthy after consuming a giant chunk of sugar. :P
author: Annie Z.

description:
There is just something about Asian snacks. Whether it's candy, pastry or frozen treats I just love them all. So when my friend introduced me to Genki Crepes some ways back I knew I was in trouble. Their sweet and their savory crepes sure are delish and worth the wait. Mind you, you most likely will be waiting amongst young teens and groups in their early 20s laughing and crowding up the doorway and the benches, it's worth it. It's also worth the circles around the block of the neighborhood looking for someplace to park your vehicle and worth the walk to and fro once you do settle on that spot you skipped over before you realize you're not going to find anything closer. 

You should definitely give it a try if you happen to be in the area. If you decide none of the many varieties of crepes offered here are for you, you can browse through the Japanese snacks, cosmetics and other toys and trinkets from the Far East. For me, I'm enjoying their crepes and My waistline is glad I don't live anywhere close to this neighborhood.
author: Esther A.

description:
1st time here! We ordered a savory crepe and a dessert crepe-mushroom spinach crepe and a lychee crepe.
The mushroom crepe was decent, but had a lot of cheese!! I'm not a big fan of cheese, so the plentiful amounts of cheese wasn't that great. I picked out some of the melted gooey-ness.

The crepe counter was near the cashier by the door in a little cramped convenience store that sold little Japanese snacks and goodies. You line up in the store to place your order. There's no seating but 2 benches: one in front of the ice cream display where all the customers walk in; one in front of the store. We ended up eating in the car since there were no seats (plus or meter was about to expire).

While waiting for the crepes, I overheard that they make their own lychee ice cream!! Yay for us ordering it. The ice cream melted somewhat quickly--or probably because we were trying to eat both at the same time.
I will definitely come back here next time I'm in the city to try the other flavors.. and have $5 to spare on dessert.. but will probably pass on the savory stuff next time.
author: Julie K.

description:
Right on the main drag of Clement. This was the second place I ever went to when I moved to San Francisco. I had a smoothie way back then and this time I followed up dinner with a shake, filled with giant tapioca balls. The shape was a strawberry chocolate combination and it was gooooood. While there were lots of people and it took us a bit to be oriented to how the line went, once we figured it out, getting our confections was quick. 

There's a nice little wall seating area to sit on and enjoy and they didn't mind that we kept talking and talking and talking. 

Also, the store itself is interesting. Lots of obscure candies and products. Great place to get sushi mats, nori, mini freeze dried crab snacks, and all sorts of other things. 

Of course, I have to say, the crepes are soooooooooooooooo good. You can go anywhere from sweet to savory and they are so fluffy and tasty.
author: Lily K.

description:
I was surprised that Genki Crepes is also part of an asian market! It kind of makes it a bit more ghetto but hey, while you wait, you can roam around the asian drinks and snacks to pig out even more on during your walk on Clement Street. 

I ordered the standard crepe of sugar and butter with green tea ice cream, which didn't completely hit the spot. I should of ordered a fruity one like everyone else that rave how delicious it is. I am sure it is delicious also!  It's ok, my excuse is because I am on a strict Diet ;) .I enjoyed how thin the batter turned the crepe to be and how light it was.  It was a nice crisp just like how I like it.. I still have not found a crepe joint that is as delicious as the one that I ate at from a crepe cart in France.. I will some day unless I go back to France soon...
author: Kathy D.

description:
This place is the Mecca of Japanese style crepes in my book. Not going to lie. I made an hour-long voyage to SF today from Oakland (yay for slow public transportation on Muni and Bart!) just to have a crepe from Genki today. They have a great variety of both sweet and hot crepes to try out, but my favorite one of all has to be their Green Tea with Red Bean. The red bean paste they use is definitely high quality and they do not cheap out on the portions there. The whipped cream that comes with it also acts a great complement. 

Customer service is great here; definitely service with a smile. There was quite a number of people waiting for their crepe as I ordered mine, but my order was completed in less than 5 minutes. Only drawback folks is although they do accept debit/credit cards, there IS a $10 MINIMUM. So bring that cash unless you plan on buying more!  

Although Genki is a little further out than the popular Sophie's Crepes in Japantown, I would say that the extra 15 minute bus ride on Geary Blvd is worth it. You get a wonderful value (their Green Tea Crepe is two dollars less!), large portions, AND most importantly, a satisfied sweet tooth.
author: Amery Z.

description:
EGG PUFFS makes for a happy yelper! I am huge on boba but am going to have to admit that I haven't tried Genki's drinks yet. Always end up there for their crepes and egg puffs!! Their crepes are pretty good and always crunchy, although sometimes I'd hope for it to be a little less crunchy and more so just on the crispy side, if that makes any sense (i.e. a little chewy, haha)? Nutella is a must and I love my crepes with strawberries, bananas, and green tea ice cream! Awesome combo - do try! :D

Their egg puffs are NOM! Maybe it is just me, but I just love playing with/eating them. They taste kind of like an Asian styled waffle and flavored like a fortune cookie! Can never go wrong with the original flavor. I've also tried the chocolate (it's okay), as well as the red bean and sesame one...both pretty subtle but a good change if you're looking for something different. They offer a lot of other flavors that I'll try and get to eventually. Curious to try the strawberry one next.

They also have an amazing selection of Asian treats. I'm literally a kid in a candy store each time I go so approach with caution or just bring a finite amount of dollars with you!
author: Ellen N.

description:
One of my favorites to get crepes in NorCal! I don't recall the price but it's around $6 dollars for a HUGE sized crepe. I usually come here at night with my friends, and sometimes there will be a line, but it's not too bad. One bad thing is that they don't have tables.
It's conveniently located inside a small store that sells misc. chinese things. Usually my friends and I walk around while we wait for our numbers to be called. I usually get mixed fruits with nutella and cream, since it's cold everytime I go, I opt out for ice cream. They make eggettes too! Different flavors! They are REALLY GOOD, soft on the inside and a bit crunchy on the outside. I would totally recommend this place to anyone. But it is located in Richmond, so parking might be hard to find. Not a problem for me since my friends at I go around 9 or 10pm.
author: Winnie T.

description:
I've tried a few of their crepes.  One sweet (the lychee ice cream with custard) and a few savory (the beef sukiyaki, and some sort of pepper chicken one).  Overall I prefer the sweet crepes.  The crepes are a good since they are nice and crisp, however I found the beef sukiyaki to be too sweet.  

Also they  have a small market.  LOVE that they have unusual imported snacks (such as aeros, cherry blossom kit kats, asian drinks).
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Their crepes are amazing!  They fill it with all sorts of yummy fruit, whipped cream, and ICE CREAM!!!  

The back part of the shop also has some fun knick-knacks and snacks that you can buy, but why bother when the crepes are this good???

I highly suggest the nutella, strawberry, and banana with whipped cream and vanilla ice cream.  I WOULD, however, suggest asking them to go a little light on the nutella - they're pretty heavy handed with the chocolatey goodness~!
author: Vicky P.

description:
This is my go-to late night sweet tooth satisfier.  

The crepes are not what you would expect but they are actually really good. They aren't are soft as most pancake-like crepes that you might have had before.  They are actually closer to the texture/flavor of a waffle cone.  

Genki also has a small Asian market with mainly sweets and some random cosmetics
author: Angelica  C.

description:
Yummas! 

Favs: banana, vanilla ice cream and nutella. Red bean ice cream with banana. 

This is not a sit down spot, so do becareful of the ice cream drippies.
author: Jamie T.

description:
Best crepes in town, AND it's open late; what's not to like?  The crepe itself is the best tasting I've had... it's probably butter.

I always get banana and nutella (sometimes with vanilla ice cream).  I like them a lot better than Sophie's Crepes @ J-Town, Crepevine locations, and fancy crepes from upscale restaurants (which are always a mistake... but sometimes you don't have a lot of choices for dessert).
author: Erika C.

description:
I love Genki's because it's so conveniently located. However, sometimes parking is a pain to find, especially at night right after dinner where crepe cravings are at a high. 

My favorite is definitely #1, Crepe with Nutella, Ice cream, and Banana. But they have an assortment of ice cream flavors and fruits you can put. They even offer savory crepes if sweet/dessert crepes aren't really your thing. What makes Genki really good is that their crepes aren't soggy from the start. It's crunchy at the top and soft on the bottom, the way it's suppose to be! They also position the crepe holder so that when your ice cream drips to the bottom, it stays in the holder rather than all over your clothes (a messy experience I have personally witnessed.... HORRIBLE!).

In terms of seating, to the side is a bench that can sit about 6-8 people, and outside is a table that can seat another 6. Most people usually get their crepe to go anyways, so finding a seat is never really much of problem. But on cold nights, almost everyone is trying to find a seat on the bench to avoid the cold! 

Definitely a go-to dessert place in my books :)
author: Gelene V.

description: I had the nutella, banana, and vanilla ice cream minus the whip cream  and it was pretty much sex in my mouth. Their crepes are different from other creperies I have tried. Genkis however is cooked crisped and flaky. Yum! This is a go-to spot for dessert if anyone ever decides to try. I will definitely be back for more.
author: Mary S.

description:
I can't even begin to describe how good Genki Crepes is. I am not the type of person who would see a Chinese Mini Mart with a crepe counter and immediately want to try it out.. but after a serious sweet tooth kicked in, I was looking for something in the neighborhood that would satisfy my craving. Thanks to yelp, this is my new favorite place to get something sweet to eat. 
I always try something different but current favorite is a 27 w/o whip plus strawberries. The best.
author: Rachel E.

description:
My favorite crepe in the city.

Vanilla Ice Cream + Strawberries + Nutella Crepe:
- crisp sweet crepe - i like my crepes crispy, and this is definitely the crispiest one i have had, unlike sophie's crepes which are softer/soggier
- fresh strawberries - all perfect, with no bruises or mushiness
- nutella - awesome addition to any dessert crepe
- ice cream - nothing too special, but great in combination with fruits

Service:
- efficient
- BRING CASH!

Merchandise:
- fun to look at while you wait: anime figurines, random asian cosmetics, TOTORO WALLETS!!  everything in this place is really adorable

Overall Impression: good crispy crepes and cute merchandise!  worth coming here if you like dessert crepes!
author: Tina A.

description: I ordered a crepe with strawberries and whipped cream ($4) and it was good but nothing great. The crepe itself was cold and a bit soggy but the ingredients were fresh.
author: Regina W.

description: I can't get enough of this place! I will literally drive here from Santa Rosa just for a nutella and banana crepe....just writing this makes my mouth water. Huge, delicious crepe! Sooo good! Words can't describe, go try one!
author: Jessica R.

description: What a find! They have Japanese groceries here! How long has it been since I've seen green tea Kit Kats and red bean ice pops?? It's like a mini Nijiya without the hustle and bustle. Get yourself a milk tea or crepe and browser away!
author: Sherry L.

description:
I would have given this place a higher rating but I'm writing this review to call out the attention of the person that prepared our crepes. Me and my wife came here around 11 pm on a Saturday night and the place was packed. We ordered the most basic combination available on the menu which is strawberry, banana, nutella and vanilla ice cream. Both of our crepes came out within 15 mins and we were delighted. Unfortunately, our order got mixed up. Instead of the vanilla ice cream, they put green tea ice cream. We asked the lady at the cashier if they can change it. She said yes, and so we both gave our crepes back, she offered her apologies and told us that she will take care of it. 

What happened next was utterly unbelievable. As we were watching from the side, she handed our crepes to the other lady and began scooping out the green tea ice cream, banana and strawberry out of our crepes and into the chopping board. Then she started to weed out the banana and strawberry from the rest of the green tea ice cream, forked them up and placed them back in the same crepe and then added the vanilla ice cream. I was mind blown! LIKE WTF, THAT'S WAS FREAKIN GROSS!!!

We really don't care if we have to wait an extra 15 mins as long as they get it right. We told the cashier that the way our food was handled was so unacceptable and unsanitary. In return, the cashier just rolled her eyes and yelled to the other lady telling her to make us a new one. That was one very bad service! I hope that they learn to acknowledge their mistakes, make some good out of it and in the end make their customers happy.
author: Jansen S.

description: Finally got to try this place after seeing a tons of rave reviews. The crepe was pretty okay, more on the crunchier side. Love the variety of fillings they offer here compares 2 the one at Japantown. I got the cheesecake, banana and honeydew ice cream crepe which i quite like. It was BIG and VERY filling. The egg puffs was kind of a let down though. Original was the best out of the 3 i tried. Honeydew was wayyyyyyy too sweet and banana was just ehhhh...Kinda regret not getting coconut :(
author: Jenny N.

description: I ordered the vanilla ice cream with fudge brownies in a waffle cone. Pretty good but not super awesome. Cute spot though and I can see why it does well. A-ok.
author: Kristy F.

description:
Mango + banana + strawberry + nutella = heaven!!!

Gosh I'm still salivating as I think about this.
author: Irene C.

description: Best crepes I've ever had. If it is midnight and they're very busy making crepes. They MUST be doing something right. I've gone here quite a few times and even though they offer a variety of crepes, I always order the chocolate cake crepe with nutella and whipped cream. The chocolate cake is always mouth watering moist. I've tried other places to try and find someone who can come close to this but have failed in finding one. I guess that just means more trips to S.F. for this.
author: Binh L.

description:
Damn this place is good, this is my new favorite crepe place. At first glance: crepes in a mini Japanese mart? The line that was out the door was enough convincing for me. The crepe is crispy and tastes like the love child of a crepe and fortune cookie and the smell of it being made is even more enticing than when you walk by a Coldstone.

I had a strawberry crepe with vanilla ice cream, nutella and whipped cream with an iced green tea with honey to wash it down. Both have me hooked. Despite me being intimidated of driving into SF, I'll suck it up or sucker my boyfriend to driving because this is worth coming back for.
author: Krizelda M.

description:
I haven't been to genki's for a long time actually, but the memory of it is still fresh in my mind.  I thought of it because I was eating nutella & go (the spread & breadstick pocky like thing) and I ran out of food grade transport devices to transfer nutella to my face.  I looked around my desk for something... pens, stapler, finger... nothing seemed suitable.  What I need is a USB crepe maker.

Until that's invented, I suggest going to genki
plus you can look at the cool shop for random japanese things!

There's a ton of random food things and toys and things that don't seem like they should exist but they do because the japanese are like that
author: Van W.

description: Everytime I go to San Fran I make a point to stop here for crepes at least twice on my trip. Have not had any that compare anywhere else.
author: William H.

description:
The crepes are a definite must. I always order mine with chocolate or vanilla ice cream with mandarin oranges or strawberries with whip cream and nutella. So delicious! I love how they make their crepes; very crispy just the way I like it. 

I also like the fact that at the bottom of the crepe, there's fruit there too and not just on top. The whip cream is really good, always fresh! 

I removed one star just because the location of this area sucks. Always hard to find parking :/

**CASH ONLY. If you're using a card, purchase must be at a $10 minimum. :(
author: Grace Anne D.

description:
My first time coming here with my boyfriend because a friend told us about this place.  Glad we listened to her because this was delicious.  Apparently, we came just in time before the rush because 5 minutes later after putting in our order, there was at least a dozen people lined up for some crepes.  

The crepes are big enough to be shared by two people so we got the vanilla ice cream crepe with strawberries, nutella and whipped cream.  The vanilla ice cream was very soft and tender.  Strawberries tasted fresh and how can you go wrong with nutella...you just can't!  Whipped cream has the right amount of sweetness which is just right for your taste buds.  The crepes are freshly made with each order and made right in front of you too.  We sat down eating our crepes on the two long benches across of the cash register.  There's hardly any seating area in here but I wouldn't mind standing up and eating a delicious crepe either.
author: Crystal A.

description:
Doh!!! It was soooo good I ate it all before I realized I didn't snap a picture :(

Vanilla Ice Cream & Nutella Crepe mmmmmmmmmmmmm
author: Dennis H.

description: Nice, clean and sanitary crepes.  Customer service can be better though.
author: P S.

description: By far this is my favorite go to crepe spot for 2 reasons. 1) it gives me a reason to go to San Francisco  2) It's so so delicious! I love love love love crepes but I only have it once in awhile so of course I'm gonna go to the city!
author: L T.

description:
Wow...can you be anymore 'bad for my health'? 

The sweet smells just grab you from the street and pull you right in. They are consistant with their crepes and man...do they slather on the nutella! 

They also carry all sorts of asian goodies from chips to drinks. 

Minus on parking...but I find that everyone just double parks and sends their friends in. =)
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Probably my preference for an Asian-style dessert crepe.
Crispy crepe outside.
Nutella, whip cream, vanilla ice cream and strawberries.
author: Kent T.

description:
This is a great spot to go to when you want to satisfy that sweet tooth craving.

They have crepes with almost any kind of filing (even cheesecake!), smoothies, ice cream and milkshakes.  On my most recent visit I had a Red Bean Milkshake with tapioca pearls - it was great!  Good, quality ice cream at the perfect milkshake consistency (not too thick, not too thin) and just enough tapioca to make it great.  

If this place weren't so far away from my area (SoMa), I'd be here more often.
author: Ken G.

description:
G E N K I 
crepes so good, you can't deny .. (it)!

Seriously though, this is my favorite crepe place.

Perfectly made crepes -- crispy shell with whatever you want inside! Neatly served and easy to eat. Get fresh fruit in your crepe!

FRESH LYCHEE FRUIT ON EVERYTHING.

Friendly staff and lots of Asian snacks and other miscellaneous things well organized and fun to browse while you wait for your order.
author: Sheena W.

description:
GENKI. This is my go-to-stop for fast and deliciously tasty Asian desserts! Not only are the crepes here awesome, but so are the egg puffs! My friends always give me crap about not getting the crepe, but those egg puffs are warm and fluffy and come in different flavors including chocolate, green tea, and sesame, which are all pretty good! The crepes, which are definitely delicious as well, are not soggy as some other ones I've had at other places, and the crepe is crispy on the edges! While it's pretty simple, my favorite kind is the Nutella sauce and vanilla ice cream combination! 

In terms of the store itself, there's not much seating available so don't expect to be able to necessarily sit down - you'll probably have to end up standing around eating your dessert, which at least will be warm if it's a typical foggy/misty night in the Richmond District. Parking basically sucks there so I'd suggest carpooling if you can, but, all in all, if you're in the area and desperately craving a dessert (and not down for Quickly's across the street or Toy Boat for ice cream), this is a great place!
author: Cheston W.

description: um this crepe place is the shizzzz! Got the green tea ice cream and strawberry crepe with whip cream and it was delicious. I love how thick the crepe batter is, and it just flakes off!! The green tea ice cream has a strong green tea flavor which I loved. Def satisfied my sweet tooth!!
author: Sarah S.

description:
I really don't like how much I crave Genki Crepes. I live an hour away, so I don't get to come here very often. I'm always finding an alternative to their crispy japanese street style crepes. I get the #1 ice cream crepe with vanilla ice cream, strawberry, banana, and nutella with whip cream of course. I highly recommend this crepe to people who love ice cream sundaes. It definitely makes me happier than an ice cream sundae. There's nothing like receiving your freshly made warm crepe with fresh fruits and cold ice cream in the center. It's like heaven in your mouth!

This place is amazing and you won't regret giving it a try.
author: Ashley T.

description: Smoked salmon crepe for savory and strawberry nutella for dessert. Fresh and crisp crepes... Perfect for late night cravings
author: Luna L.

description: I've been on a crepe craze lately, as mentioned in my previous review for Banana Crepe in San Jose, but OMGOMGOMG. ME LOVEY THIS PLACE. Their selections for fillings and what not is a lot bigger than Sophie's. I really liked that everything sounded SO delectable! I just wanted to try everything!!! But being the boring/safe person I am, I stuck with the strawberry &vanilla ice cream! STILL MUY DELISIOSO! I would definitely come back and try their other creations. THAT NEW YEARS RESOLUTION DIET WILL HAVE TO WAIT!!!!
author: Yannie S.

description: All things Japanese when it comes to sweets. Many hard to find candies here with your typical Asian drinks. The egg crate things are yummy and worth the wait as all are made fresh. We'll be back.
author: vic f.

description:
A few reasons why I love Genki Crepes.

1. They have crates of nutella. Anyone with that much nutella is doing something right.
2. KOALA COOKIES. You know, the ones with chocolate inside. 
3. Oi Ocha (my favorite bottled green tea) by the liter. 
4. Thai tea milkshakes. 
5. Amazing green tea & red bean ice cream.
6. GREEN TEA KIT KATS. Seriously. 

Oh and the crepes, how could I forget those? A little bit crunchy on the outside and so much sweet goodness on the inside!
author: Sara P.

description:
If I could actually get reception in here ... you'd all know that I've been here 2x in the last 3 days.  And I live 25 miles away.

My new favorite crepe is #27, chocolate cake + whipped cream + hershey.  I'm getting fat just thinking about it .... no wait ... I'm getting fat b/c I can't stop eating crepes.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
Ok. One word.....YUMMY!!

I think this is one of the best crepe I ever had thus far.  Been to a few and this takes the cake.  The crepe is crispy with the right amount of flour to not over shadow the taste.

I ordered the crepe with nutella and banana.  It is like eating a piece of heaven.  And for that brief few minutes there I actually felt I did.  It looks like I will be back for more and more....

I like this place because they also have other goodies.  Now that is a plus in my book.  Every snacks you can think and imagine is here.

I was never a big fan of crepe until now.  Crepe here I come...........
author: Angela L.

description:
These crepes get five stars from me. 

I've never had crepes like these but they taste like a glorified crispy chewy drumstick. Way better though because the quality of the cone is a frickin crepe! And nutella makes everything a wet dream. The ice cream is a MUST.

Tip: at first, I was eating the crepe by taking a bite of the shell and then eating the ice cream with a spoon. After watching others, I copied them and squished the ice cream between the crepe and ate it all together likea a sandwich. This completely changed the experience, everything was texture combo perfection after my new approach. 

The crepe/ice cream station is at the front of a cute lil japanese market. It's a good place to browse while you're waiting / after you're done.
author: Kelly Z.

description: Lemon sugar crepe $3 (2/5) - a large and well made crepe with hints of lemon and plenty of powdered sugar. The only downside is that I was expecting more lemon taste.
author: Gabriel C.

description:
Genki = magical! It's fast (the line goes fast), fun (asian snacks galore!!! fun to browse through while you're waiting for your crepe), and most importantly... DELICIOUS. 
Go for the banana/nutella/vanilla ice cream combo. Or just anything with nutella. And/or ice cream. Or just anything. It's all da best! 
I will say that the lack of seating often causes me to find myself eating an ice cream crepe outside in the freezing, foggy richmond weather.. but it's worth it!
author: Robyn B.

description:
i love this place.. whenever i'm craving a crepe this is where i want it from.. i've been to a few other places in sf/la but they don't come close.. it's the crispy edges here that does it for me

some combo's i like:
-lychee ice cream + custard + nutella 
next time i'll have them add red bean paste to it..

-mango ice cream + strawberry + banana + nutella + custard
author: Raquel T.

description:
Such a cute shop! They have crepes and Japanese goods. I'll make this a quick review because I was completely won over by this place. 

I went here and got a savory crepe (Hawaiian) and a Dessert crepe (strawberry cheesecake). Both crepes were crispy, sweet, and really tasty. 

This service was very friendly and helpful also. 

AMAZING and yummy!
author: Stacey L.

description:
Well over 1100 people have weighed in and I agree, this place is a really nice snack stop.  With all of the coffee shops and bakeries in this neighborhood, you would think it would be easy to get a nice hot drink and dessert.  Not so.  This place serves up one of the only good options for such foods.  They have hot and cold drinks and a variety of crispy crepes (both sweet and savory).  To top it off, they have a variety of ice cream flavors (asian flavors of course).  Lychee, red bean, etc. 

These are Japanese style crepes so they are crispy and have a bit of tartness to them.  If these snacks dont meet you taste, there is a whole store of drinks, candies and cookies (overpriced but convenient).  They also stay open past midnight in case the late evening munchies come a callin.
author: Scott C.

description: Love Genki crepe! The banana nutella with vanilla ice cream is just yummy. (I'm not that adventurous) The crepe itself is perfectly made every time!
author: Samantha F.

description:
Anything with nutella tastes great, but at Genki crepes it has a new level of taste to nutella.  I like the crepe with nutella spread and marshmallow.. delicioso .. The crepe was crispy on the rim and perfect texture as you keep munching on.  I'm yet to try their other variety of crepe flavors and for sure will hit this place if I'm around Richmond.  

Best crepe place.. hands down!
author: Hema K.

description:
Genki crepes is okay. 

I remember coming here when it first opened when no one really knew about it yet. No lines & only a few choices. Now, there are so many different options, so I tried a crepe with ice cream, strawberries, & nutella. They gave me two strawberries & I think charged $2 extra. The line is also super long now too. It's so crowded in that store, you can hardly breathe or walk around. And there is no where to sit. 

For a similar price, I prefer Sophies in Japantown. They get crowded too but atleast the space is open so you can walk/wait in Japantown. They also are more generous on the fruit.
author: Alysha K.

description:
Not too sure what the big deal is about this place- the crepe skin is pretty good since it's thin and crispy, but not worth the price in my opinion. It's about $4.95 for an ice cream crepe and it is LITERALLY just a couple scoops of ice cream on the bottom, dotted with some fruits on top and a dollop of whipped cream to finish it off. When you get to the bottom of the crepe, you're basically only eating ice cream. There's not much to it. 

In my perspective- you can spend $2 to buy your own tub of ice cream, cut up some fruit and all you'd be missing is the crepe skin.

Other than that, the store was actually pretty cute! It's kind of a convenience store. There's lots of Asian candies, trinkets, face masks, and small random things that you have probably never seen before. Aisles are small and a little crowded, but I enjoyed going through it while standing in line for my crepe.
author: Sally C.

description:
My roommate and I were exhausted after a long day at Alice's Summerthing at Golden Gate Park, and we were really craving crapes. As usu, I turned to Yelp and got to Genki Crepes.

I wouldn't expect the place to be a crepe place because it's also joined with a Japanese market. The menu includes a lot of different sweet crepes and several savory crepes as well. Price was pretty good, I think I paid about $6-$7 for a nutella and banana crepe. Roommate got a red bean and banana crepe too! 

What really stood out to me about these crepes were how CRISPY they were. The crepe itself was pretty thin, but absolutely so crispy. I'm used to having the crepes be a little more softer, and more fluffy, almost like a pancake, but these crepes were the opposite. I'm def a fan of the crispy crepes, so would def. come here again!
author: Evelyn S.

description:
Crepes are great.

The last three times I've been here, I got the #2, which is green tea ice cream, whip cream and your choice of red bean paste or lychee.

I also really like this place as a market too. It offers a wide variety of Japanese products including anime toys.
author: Michael T.

description:
Okay, I can't say much about their sweet dessert crepes but I had their savory crepe w/ turkey, avocado, jack cheese. It was pretty good and pretty filling. I left pretty satisfied and if anything, too stuffed. 

I like that it's also a "convenient" store filled with a crap load of Japanese candies. I LOVE candy and Japanese candies are one of the best!

PS. The only seating you're going to find are two 2-3 seater benches right next to the door without any tables.
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
I got a strawberry egg puff. Not good. It was too sweet, and the mix doesn't seem at all fresh or clean.

This place is extremely popular, but I think it's just one of those overrated trendy places. I don't think I will come here again.
author: Nona T.

description:
oh why do you have to be so far away? 
I wish a genki would open in san jose very soon, but until then, i guess i just have to wait, or drive hella far to get me some crepes!!

This place is a gem within the city of sf! near USF, tons of people go here!
warning: parking is ridiculous because it is street parking and not to mention hella asian drivers, but i'm not hating....I'm asian too!!

So what to get: EVERYTHING! but if you have a limited time then get these items:
any crepe here is hella gooood, so you can never go wrong with either an ice cream crepe or just a plain one! I prefer getting an ice cream crepe with the ice cream on the side because it annoys me how the ice cream melts so fast!!
EGGpuffs!!! i prefer the original flavor, but i have also tried chocolate, which is pretty good too!
THe milktea is decent here, but there is a quickly right across the street if you want more flavors.
AND if you go further into genki, it is a small japanese market, with hi-chew galore, AND flavored kit-kat, yes i said it, flavored kit-kat! from green tea kit kat to strawberry kit kat and even milk tea!!! 
you can also find the common japanese drinks and mochi and instant soups for a late night snack!!!
author: Monica G.

description:
I think I may have a mild addiction for Genki.  

I live in the East Bay but the drive to Genki is worth it!!  :)   I always order nutella, banana, strawberry with wipe cream.  It is made to perfection every time!!
author: Alice L.

description:
How does Quickly's even stay in business!?
(regarding to the Quickly's RIGHT across the street, I hope your reading this!)

This magical Japanese mini mart is home to the best crepes in town, and then some!

No Contest: 
- Genki's Ice Cream Crepes are no runner-up to "Sophie's" or "Belly Good Crepes" (in Japantown).
- The Snack and Savory Crepes blow "Crepe House" out of the water, as well as for the price!
- The Egg Puffs trumps "Eggettes" (in the Sunset) by far with their delicious pancake-like batter and over 8 varieties of flavors: Regular, Chocolate, Red Bean, Honeydew, etc! Eggettes only  has 3 flavors at a time.. comon, egg puffs is in your name!
- What? Genki has tapioca drink too? You better believe they trump "Quickly's", because they do!

My favorite Crepe to order for half a decade now is still the Green Tea Ice Cream + Lychee! I love the lychee pieces the best! Soo good.. 

Don't forget this is also a Japanese grocery shop that sells a bunch of imported random goodies, from candies to merchandise to miscellaneous car doo-dads! (I usually just stop by to pick up a 2-liter bottle of Aloe drink).

Where else can you get a delicious crepe on Christmas or New Years Eve? That's right, Genki stays open on the holidays too! TOO MUCH WIN.
author: Albert L.

description:
Crepes- GREAT! Definitely one of the best

Service- SHITTY! Those bitchy workers can kiss my ass
author: Verdina P.

description:
I haven't had a crepe in forever and this was AMAZING.

The aroma wafting out from here was so drool-worthy that I was instantly won over. We got vanilla ice cream with strawberries AND RED BEAN, which was an insanely good combination. You can mix and match whatever flavors you want (they're not strict about only picking from the menu's options). Ice cream + warm crepe + red bean was a genius combo.
author: Vandy P.

description:
The smell of fresh crepes is intoxicating from down the street. We just finished dinner at B Star, but did not get dessert.

We walked around the area and then returned to the busy little store and stood in line for some crepes.

I don't remember what everyone ordered, but I couldn't make up my mind and the gal at the register recommended the nutella and strawberry which was delicious,  The crepes look huge when folded, but they were not and they were not too sweet.
author: Anisha G.

description:
I drove my family here because I recall my father really loving the crepe he had here once upon a time, and it was Father's Day, and we were in the area....and my brother, who is a pure lover of crepes, was in town....

So I bought them a nutella strawberry crepe (hey, I offered to get 2!), and *certainly* didn't refuse when offered one bite....oooh, fresh crepe! Ok generous with the filler ingredients, which also are fresh.

If inner Richmond happens to be your whereabouts, consider coming here. I've noted that of late there have been a few creperies erected, which I always love... why? Competition always helps to drive quality assurance!
author: Jana C.

description: Cash only so added ice cream to crepe to meet credit minimum. After paying, was told they couldn't add ice cream to the Apple cinnamon crepe I ordered. Never offered to put it on the side or why. Crepe lacked full apples and only had a few small pieces. Overall disappointing crepe and poor service. I heard other crepes were decent, but ruined the experience for me.
author: Nick G.

description:
This place does not make your typical crepes. They're mostly filled with ice cream, and are absolutely fantastic. I have brought all sorts of people here with fantastic success. First date spot? Yes, for sure.

It really is a mini creperie in the front of a cute Japanese mini-grocery store. I love to browse the interesting Japanese foods and toys while waiting for my crepe.
author: Jeff W.

description:
One of my friends ALWAYS visits this place when she visits from LA. She has not found anything as good as Genki in LA.  I've never tried these crepes so I decided to give it a try tonight.

I ordered the nutella with lychee. I gotta say it was pretty good. The crepe was not mushy, even after all the lychee juice fell to the bottom of the crepe cup.  The crepe stayed relatively dry and chewy.  Good texture and flavor! Prices are not too bad.

Its weird that the crepe shop is at the front of the store and a grocery store is at the back of the store. But hey, whatever works for them! By 10:00pm, there were 20 people in line waiting for their crepes! Craziness!!!
author: Janet E.

description:
Along with friends and family My wife and I  have been loyal customers and fans, coming here for the past 7 years.  My daughter had purchased a Genki gift certificate for us. When we presented it, the girl at the counter very rudely said  "WE NO LONGER SELL THAT!t!"  We pointed out to her that it was clearly purchased  in this specific store, with no expiration date on it, and the fact Twenty dollars was paid to the store for it.   We asked to see the manager.  She appeared surprised and stuttered there was no manager.  We asked for a number to call and she refused. Finally one of the veteran Crepe preparers (a latin male) spoke to her. She then quickly took our order.

We are now led to believe one of two things--either this was a scam or the counter girl was truly ignorant and should not be in a position dealing with the the public.
We asked for her name, she paused and gave us a false name, as we found it she had lied to us about that as well.  

This is a popular and even beloved place, but this is the kind of employee and incident that give a good place a bad name.   As we do not want this to happen to anyone else who has purchased a Genki gift certificate--We intend to follow up with the owner and the better business bureau.
author: Eric Q.

description:
6/12/11
After a slightly deflated experience at Burma (not so much) superstar we crossed the street to try a famous street snack of Hong Kong called Egg Puffs! Even though they r known for crepes we can get those anywhere down south so decided to try something different...crazy lines...and the setup is sorta weird the front end is the crepe cooking and the back is a mini-mart of all asian groceries...
author: Belle N.

description:
I was craving for crepes, so my cousin decided to take me to the one they always go to, and that is Genki Crepes.  

I had a really hard deciding what to get! I desired something that contained ingredients that I didn't eat too often, plus a combo that made sense, but I ended up getting a Peach and Nutella Combo!!  I thought to myself, what did i do?!  Peach and Nutella go together?! I don't think so?

Key Points:

--  Tasted alright!  Peaches were juicy and Nutella was yummy and creamy

-- Peach juice leaked at the bottom
author: Tina R.

description:
At night, you usually have to line up for at least 5 mins before you reach the counter. But they prepare their stuff quite fast (and fresh!). 

I had a simple nutella crepe and banana-strawberry smoothie the other night and it was just what the doctor ordered for a fat friday evening!
author: Gordon O.

description:
Ooh they sure do know how to make one mean dessert crepe! I like how their crepes are balanced in terms of flavor - nothing so sweet that by the time you're done, you've got a stomache. 

Try the green tea ice cream with red bean paste - they're not heavy on the paste which I love. The lychee ice cream crepe was amazing... so rich in lychee flavor! I'm not a nutella fan but I have heard nothing but great reviews for it here. Eggettes (regular or chocolate) are always safe to get.

Oh and you know those yummy green tea kit kats that you can only find in Japan? Well, don't hate me for blasting the secret (or maybe it isn't a secret anymore) but they sell 'em here! Yup. But only if you can find them in the store...they sell out alot.
author: Liana L.

description: Took the wrong order and would not change it when we we questioned them.  Very poor customer service!  Would not ever come back again!  Beware as receipts do not say what you ordered so you have no way to see what they put down.
author: Tommy P.

description: Holy crepe heaven!!  This place doesn't look like much from the outside but the ice cream crepes and mochi ice cream selection is top notch!! I have to come here every few weeks to get my fix.  My recommendation is a crepe with Nutella, vanilla ice cream, and strawberries. And you can't go wrong adding some whip cream :-) They also have a freezer in the back with every flavor of mochi ice cream balls you can imagine! (Same brand as trader joes but 20 different kinds!)  I always stock up while I'm there. Definitely a hidden gem :-)
author: Karina N.

description:
Place is great! Except when they call the wrong number and expect you to know they actually mean you. Usually get the dessert ones which i love. Parking is tough sometimes though. They have all kinds of cool treats in the market too.
I would get the nutella, cheesecake and ice cream crepe
author: Scotty G.

description:
It was my first time, so I walked in not knowing what to expect. Immediately my attention was fixed on all the japanese toys, foods, and beauty products. Not gonna lie, but I found myself in the beauty products. I was gonna buy some products for my face, but i couldn't read japanese, so I ended up not buying it. 

ANYWAYS, the food. I was in the mood for food, but also ice cream. So i ordered #17, which was a crepes with beef, your choice of cheese, and green onions. IT WAS AMAZING! DELICIOUS! I WAS SATISFIED. My friends kept wanting another bite from me, but i was like, NOOO!

This place was sorta small, and really, it isn't a restaurant. It's like a small market you find at a gas station, except it has lots of toys and beauty products. So don't expect too much. Anyways I also got an ice cream crepe because i'm a fat ass and I really wanted to try. I got Green tea ice cream and it wasn't that good at all. I should have gotten a different flavor. OH WELL. try it out. GET #17 CAUSE IT'S REALLY GOOOOOD.
author: Huy N.

description: I love this place. Always a nice place for dessert with friends, especially at night. I love the ice cream crepes, especially the vanilla with mango.
author: Victor Z.

description: The crepe is good but the ice cream is not. I mean it's popular and I do love their crepes but this is not the place for ice cream. Do come here for some great tasting sweet crepes. I always get strawberry, banana, Nutella and whipped cream crepe.
author: J C.

description:
#500! 

I wasn't sure what to review for this milestone. Usually for milestones, I'll pick something special, something sentimental, something memorable. 

For this review, I just took the next business on my review list. For those who know me, I love anything sweet, be it candy, donuts, pies, mochi, ice cream, yogurt, malasadas, chocolate,...... 

So happens this next business was of the sweet variety.

Full from dim sum at Tong Palace (http://www.yelp.com/biz/tong-palace-san-francisco#hrid:wrWhg-VMQqvkH7LGX6_DZw/src:self), my daughters wanted to know what we were doing next, or just go home. I told my oldest that heard about this place about 5 blocks down on Clement street that makes dessert crepes. 

"Did you read about this in Yelp?" she asked. 

"Yep," I said. 

"I should have known. Sounds good let's go, but could you drive down?" 

"Nope, were going to walk off lunch first" I said. 

After a nice stroll for 5 blocks, we arrived at the store. We studied their menu on the back wall, then placed our order. While we were waiting for our order, the kids browsed the inside of the store, oohing and ahhing the Japanese stuffed animals, toys, and snacks (ended up buying some of these goodies for them as well). 

Five minutes, our orders were ready.: 
chocolate egg puffs 

-Nutella and Marshmallow Crepe (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/83dXgt2nG98JJG2F7ai8AQ?select=I92LpezSoRIV13itV30GbA): My oldest saw this on the menu an had to order it. She said it was like eating a S'more, but instead of Graham Crackers, it was neatly wrapped in a crispy crepe. 

-Mango ice cream and strawberry crepe (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/83dXgt2nG98JJG2F7ai8AQ?select=uhyGipT557R7WVI6wn7Qsg): Crepe was crispy at the edges, and slightly chewy and crispy towards the center. Just enough to hold the ice cream, strawberries, and whipped cream together. Quite good and refreshing, even for a cool day like that day. 

-Chocolate Egg Puffs: Fresh off the waffle iron and hot. As far egg puffs go, these were OK, but my youngest was happy because it was chocolate. 

Kids liked it so much, we returned the next day, with my oldest daughter's friend, after spending the afternoon in J-Town. 

They had: 
-Strawberry Nutella Crepes: What goes well with Nutella, but strawberries. We order one each for the older girls, and they must have enjoyed them because they were pretty quiet while eating them. 

-Chocolate Milkshake: This was for my chocoholic youngest daughter. Thick and creamy. She liked it as well, but couldn't finish it. I did my fatherly duty and helped her finish it.
