On both days, we enjoyed our crepes and other snacks while sitting on their wooden benches. Not much room to sit, but enjoyed looking at the foot traffic coming into and out of this store. 

Glad I finally made it here.  My daughters can count on me to find anything that is sweet, and love to try out these places with me.  It was a perfect afternoon break on the two days we were in the area.
author: Steve L.

description:
This place has got to be one of the best places for crepes. They toast the crepe, so it's crispy as you bite into the sweet, gooey yumminess. This was the first crepe that I kept going in for a bite after another. An after dinner treat and benches to chill on.. Highly recommended!

Side note: There's a bathroom for the drunkies that come through! Yes!
author: Anne T.

description:
Kudos for selling crepes and other sweets within what seems like a Japanese convenience store. Things are made to order, and you can choose from lots of ingredients in your crepe: red bean, pb, bananas, nutella, chocolate, etc. 

The fold the crepes into a cone so that it's easy to hold in your hand in eat. Generous with their filings, which is a plus. However, the crepe itself was a tad too hard and plastic-y, so was a bit disappointed. 

They also have the waffle eggs that they sell on the streets in Hong Kong - maybe I'll try them next time when I'm in the area.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Yum! Great crepes.
I went with savory smoked salmon and wasabi was delicious.

Can't wait to go back.

And while you are waiting for your crepe you can also do some of your shopping.
author: Anelya S.

description:
This place in my opinion is a really overhyped. 

I got a strawberry and banana crepe with Nutella and whipped cream. It was delicious but it wasn't the most amazing crepe I've ever tasted. Maybe ill try it again next time. My crepe was made too crispy and was kinda burnt. Hence the 4 stars. 

I guess I just expected a little too much based on the reviews. It was good though! Really small place.

Grab your crepe & eat in your car or you'll have to awkwardly stand amongst people in the entryway of the supermarket.
author: Joanne R.

description:
LOVE IT.  definitely not as good as harajuku crepe in LA, but it has a much more hole-in-the wall charming feel and is much cheaper as well.  the crepe itself is not chewy, but is slightly crunchier than i expected, making the crepe more like a super-cone.  Still, the ice cream they put is extremely rich in flavor and the combinations blend well.  For 4.50 a crepe genki is definitely a place i'll frequent when i'm in area.  

oh, the market that it's in has some neat asian things to look at while you wait.  honestly, i think they'd be better served converting the market into a nice seating area.
author: Mason T.

description: A friend brought me a crepe full of strawberries, bananas, and cream. I like how it's not too sweet and you can really taste the fruit.
author: Brian E.

description:
The place itself is inside a small market type ish store. Been here a few times, and I definitely have a favorite. I always get the Green Tea Ice Cream Crepe with Red Bean Paste and Whipped Cream, but there's plenty of options. So goodd. The portion is pretty big especially if you come here for dessert after dinner. I came here after dinner with my girlfriend, and one order was enough for the two of us. You can get this for around 5$ which is a great price for dessert for two.

This place has a minimum charge for credit/debit card, so bring cash.
author: Johnny L.

description:
Semi-embarrassing story.  Went here on a date after dinner a few months ago.  Ate our crepe in his car while he drives me home.  Talked, laughed, thought to myself I was quite the charmer.  Get dropped off.  Walked to my bathroom.  Turned on the lights.  There was Nutella smeared on my chin, like a blob of it.  Shook my head in complete embarrassment.  Either he was really nice and didn't want to say anything to embarrass me or it was dark in his car and he didn't notice it at all.  I never asked him about it and he never mentioned it afterward.  Therefore, it never happened in my book.

I absolutely adore Genki Crepes.  Sure, there's usually a line but it's worth the wait.  There sweet crepes are a lot better than the one in Japantown.  The fruits are fresh, the crepe batter is perfection, and they make their crepes with love.  I also love how this place has every single flavor of hi-chew, special flavor Pocky and hard to find yummy Asian candy (Marshmallows stuffed with strawberry cream are my favorite).
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
They put crack in their crepes...

i MUST go every single time i'm in san francisco... 
its so weird because it's in like a small grocery store... but... the simplicity of the crepes... its just amazing. 
seriously don't understand what they put in there to make you think about CREPES.
author: Soo N.

description: These are not good crepes by any standard, I went there twice 6 months apart, the second time I just threw my order away, it was that bad
author: Jonathan F.

description: When talking with USF students about where to grab a late-night dessert, ALL of them said Genki crepes for an ice cream crepe cone!  The end.
author: Melanie C.

description: This place has gone downhill. The tapioca is no longer fresh, the dough lacks eggs, the toppings are not fresh. I loved this place but will no longer be coming back.
author: Olga B.

description: The crepes are great and it's open until 12:30 on weekends. I've definitely ended up here late at night a few times.
author: Brian M.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, i really did. But for some reason it just can't beat Sophie's in my heart. 

The crepe get really crispy after it cools down, and it makes it really hard to eat. It's definitely a bit over-cooked. I just think my perfect crepe should be softer as i get closer to finishing my crepe, but my bff thinks it's better crispy so it just a matter of opinion. 

Long story short, if you're like me where you like your crepes soft, then maybe you head over to J-Town for some Sophie's instead.
author: Christine L.

description:
Interviews make me sad. Genki Crepes and japanese candy make me happy. 

Visiting Genki Crepes is never good for my diet. First, I'll stand in line and order my scrumptious crepe. I always try to control myself and wait patiently for them to make my crepe, but it never works - I HAVE to wander around the store and pick out dozens of unique, interesting, and cool looking Japanese candy. Needless to say, I always walk out of this place with enough sugar content to last a few weeks.

The nutella crepe with strawberries, whip cream, and vanilla ice cream is delicious. The crepe pancake is very thin and crispy, but not flaky. The mango ice cream is also a good choice but it might taste too sweet/fruity if you add too much fruit. 

As for the candy... Green Tea Kit Kat bars. Yum.
author: Andrew N.

description:
I hate to go against the grain, but the crepes here were OK. The portions, though, were real nice as they give you huge crepes.

Maybe it's just a matter of preference but I prefer the the pancake part to be soft like at Belly Good in Japantown, while Genki's is crispy.

It was a popular spot when we got there late night. Overall, thumbs in the middle.
author: Alex T.

description:
What I ordered:
Vanilla ice Cream + Nutella Crepe (C-)

Maybe I have higher standards or maybe I'm just completely uneducated in the world of crepes but i've had better. 

I prefer my crepes to be warm and soft, like a fresh off the stove thin pancake. The crepes at Genki just reminded me of an ice cream cone. I got the vanilla ice cream + nutella option, it was just whatever...hard, flaky, cold. To me, eating a crepe should be like having sex: salivating, warm, exciting, and sometimes a little messy. Genki's crepes is the sex you regret as soon as you get into it and hate yourself afterwards for it.
author: Jason O.

description: Awesome no other word necessary.  Crisp crepes w cheesecake, strawberries and chocolate... yum
author: Troy C.

description:
What is it about Genki Crepes that lures you in after you're allegedly "full" from dinner and yet still feel like you can fit in dessert? Cherylynn N. called it. It's the enticing smell that wafts down the street, teasing you to come in. 

My favorite crepe is here is custom-made: Lychee Ice Cream with Lychee. Yes, lychee on lychee on lychee. Lychee for days. Mmm, the perfect bite: crunch of the crepe, creamy & cold lycheeice cream, and tender lychee. And just when you think "No, I can't do it. This crepe was a mistake. I can't finish it"... You get to the bottom of the crepe and there is a lychee waiting for you. 

Damn you, Genki with your seductive, tantalizing ways.
author: Monelle A.

description:
I have a LOVE-HATE Relationship with Genki. I LOVE how their crepes give your mouth a "happy ending" it so deserves. But, HATE how the smell emanates from blocks away only to lure you into the store. BOO for being one block away from the laundrymat I go to weekly! LoL!

Genki's Crepes has nothing on Sophie Crepes and their Egg puffs has nothing on Eggettes. 

I discovered Genki several years ago when they opened. And after that, it has been LOVE AT FIRST BITE.

My usual order is the #8...Vanilla Ice Cream w/ Nutella Crepe Topped with Whip Cream. Genki's batter is similar to pancake batter with a hint of vanilla. I love the texture of the crepe...crispy on the edges and soft in the center. After cooking it to order, it's generously slathered with Nutella and topped w/ a scoop of Mitchell's vanilla ice cream, folded, placed in a paper cone and topped with whip cream. The first bite is always orgasmic...all sorts of flavor and texture combos: the warm crispy crepe w/ thick, ooey gooey chocolately hazelnut spread, and rich, creamy vanilla ice cream! WOWZEERS!

If I want a light dessert, I always opt for the Original (Vanilla) Egg Puffs. It's made form the same batter as the crepes. Genki's version surpasses Eggettes version. It's like a mini popover....crispy on the outside, hollow in the inside w/ a small pancake pillow. I can't tell you how something so simple can be so damn good. It's has just a touch of sweetness to satisfy your sweet tooth. 

Besides Genki's staple items, it's also a Mini-Snack Mart with a variety of bottled drinks (aloe vera, green tea, yogurt drinks, asian sodas, etc), Asian hard candies and gummies, dried snacks (chips, jerkey, cuttle fish, prunes, ginger, etc), and even has bath and beauty products (face blotters, pluckers, soap and hand lotion). 

Being that it's in the heart of the Inner Richmond with no shortage of restaurants, it gets very busy at night after 8 PM from nearby diners. But, service is always fast and efficient b/c they normally have 3 employees making the crepes, egg puffs, and drinks. 

I've always recommended to Genki to friends and others and they have never been disappointed. They even make it a point to make a pitstop at Genki;s when visiting which says A LOT!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
My favorite is still Sophie's Crepe, however, if you like thicker more waffle like crepes than you will probably like this place. Sophie's is thinner and more crispy. What I do love about this place is they have egg puffs. Light, fluffy, and crunchy. Simply addicting. 

Pros-
1. Open until midnight while Sophie's close around 7pm.
2. Inside a mini mart which carries a variety of things such as snacks and drinks.
3. EGG PUFFS
author: Uyen L.

description:
Yummy!  It's a pretty decent price and they kind of stuff the crepes :) They don't cheat you out of your money with empty crepes, and the shells are delicious. 
The downside is that it can get crowded. I was here Friday night and mannn was there was crowd. They have a couple benches, which was great, but most people had to stand.  
It's far from my house, but if I'm in the area I'd definitely come here again. Plus they have a lot of yummy Japanese snacks :)
author: Yifen J.

description:
I la-la-la-love Genki! Almost every time that I've been to the City, Genki's is always the last stop no matter how full I am or how tired I am. 

While the service of this place is not that great, the crepes make up for everything. It's oh-so-crispy-tips with the nutella and the fruits always have me coming back. During the summer, this place is usually more packed than normal. The line moves very quickly so don't hesitate! 

Lately, I've been all about the ice cream with the crepes, and believe me, it does not disappoint. It is seriously heaven (and heavy) in your hand. I ate that thing like a soldier (approx. 5 minutes...maybe even a little less)

 If you are not looking to spend around $6- $7 for a crepe, buy one that only has nutella and a fruit in it. As for me, I would never go back. Good luck =D. Don't eat it too fast and always try to get water if you have a long way home. Don't ask me why...just do it!
author: Lan N.

description:
With a name like Genki Crepe, I had imagined a little shop that sold desserts and probably drinks like pearl milk tea. I was surprised to see that it was actually a dessert place and japanese mini mart all rolled into one. 

We came here for dessert after having dinner across the street at Burma Superstar. The store didn't have many people inside before dinner, but boy was it crowded when we went afterward! There were lots of high school kids hanging out outside, and a throng of people inside eating crepes, ordering crepes, and waiting for crepes! 

We ordered the vanilla ice cream nutella crepe with mangoes ($6.35): http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/83dXgt2nG98JJG2F7ai8AQ?select=0YqtK-_Mf_7saEqAC2udSQ
It was actually quite delicious; nutella makes everything better! The crepe cone was nice and crisp, and not too hard. It tasted really good with the ice cream and mangoes. There's a bench inside the store and one outside to sit on, if you can snag a seat when it's crowded. 

It took about 10 minutes to get our crepe since there were so many orders ahead of us. There were 5 people making the desserts and 1 person manning the cash register and taking orders. I like how there's a mini mart here. There were drinks, food, sauces, candy, assorted ramen, bags, toys, and toiletries--just in case!

They also sell egg puffs in a variety of flavors. I enjoyed my crepe, so I will be back to try a different flavor next time or maybe some of those egg puffs!
author: Cat H.

description:
I don't know if it was because it was a hot day or I was just craving sweets.  But, the banana nutella vanilla ice cream crepe hit the spot perfectly!! Delicious!!  Such generous amounts of ice cream was served in the crepe, it made my eyes round and mouth water.  Of course, it's not everyday that we can eat them, but when I have a craving for sweets and 
my diet permits, it's nice to know genki crepe will be there!! 

I also enjoyed browsing the Japanese snack aisles while I waited for crepes!
author: stephanie c.

description:
It's fitting that my official welcome back to San Francisco was spent snuggled up on a bench at a creperie/convenience store.

Skip the savory crepes here--dessert seems to be what most people go for. I split a mushroom, swiss cheese and spinach crepe with my partner in crime; we were sorely disappointed after seeing the sweet concoctions other patrons purchased.
author: Erika W.

description:
This place makes one of the best dessert crepes in San Francisco. Also, their shakes aren't bad, and their egg puffs are crispy chewy heaven. Prices are good, but it's cash only when under $10? I think. I love browsing through all the miscellaneous items they sell in their market.
This is my go-to place for ice cream crepes when I don't feel like going all the way out in the avenues on Judah (Crepe Temptations, my favorite).
If you like soft crepes (yuck), go elsewhere.
author: Karen C.

description:
I came here on a Sunday night after having dinner. I love how there's a random assortment of novelty snacks such as a Super Mario Brothers energy drink and a huge variety of Hello Kitty candies.

My friend ordered a strawberry kiwi crepe that had strawberry ice cream and fresh kiwi slices. It was okay tasting but nothing special. The portions are huge and there was definitely enough to share between two people who weren't that hungry, but would I travel all the way to San Francisco from Oakland for these crepes? My lucky 8-ball says, "chances are slim."
author: Annie L.

description:
To compensate for an underwhelming mani pedi at Aqua Spa, I comforted myself with a dessert crepe.  Oh what bliss!  Who knew a little store which sells snack & sundries would turn out such delish desserts?  Smart to place the crepe prep in the front window.  

The crepe was thin with crispy edges - just how I love them.  My made up combo - nutella smeared inside the crepe before it was folded into a cone, then filled with a scoop of strawberry ice cream, sliced bananas & squirts of whipped cream.  Heaven!

In addition to crepes they have eggs puffs & ice cream.
author: Kim S.

description:
OH MY YUMMY!!! I am a huge fan of Crepes a Go Go and I have finally found a to go crepe that compares! Big plus that it's in an Asian market too (filled with Asian snacks and drinks).

I made my own crepe (Ham, cheese, spinach and mushrooms). They have a variety of cheeses to choose from but not Monterey Jack.  I ordered one crepe for around $6 and within minutes I was biting into pure happiness. They serve it a paper cone and the bottom is wrapped in foil to catch the juices. They gave me extra cheese per my request. Everything in the crepe was flavorful and I'm glad they don't use simple deli ham. BEST part of the crepe was the crepe itself. Perfect crunch and perfect flavor. The crepe wasn't dry and held it flavor with the toppings. 

I wish we had a place like this in San Jose!!
author: Caroline T.

description:
Update: 
Note to self.....the lemon/sugar crepe was a little dry.....try cream with it next time maybe?  I should try a different savory crepe next time, but the chili sauce on this chicken one is just plain yummy.  :o)

Crazy me!  I was craving a savory chicken/chili sauce crepe so bad that I walked a half hour to get it from here!  Of course I walked out with a sweet lemon/sugar one as well, along with a frozen green tea soy latte.  Delicious as always!
author: Chylene K.

description:
In my hometown of Toronto, if I want to munch a fat-ass crepe while browsing an octopus-load of Japanalia I have to visit TWO separate stores. That's some bullshit. At Genki Crepes in Inner Richmond you can do both. At the same time. When people say SF is ahead of the curve on things, shit like this is what they mean.

We visited this spot after an epicly gut-busting Burmese food orgy across the street at Burmese Superstar. They've got everything you need as long as you need crépes, Japanese groceries and trinkets. We're talking toys, keyfobs, cellphone accessories, disturbingly clear fruit drinks, cereal-box sized cartons of Pocky, mysterious beauty products, backpacks, and much, much, more.

Eating French dessert in a Japanese shop shouldn't make sense but it does. The crepes are thin, papery, perfect. And it was stuffed with more decadence than the French aristocracy c. 1780. (Amirite, nerds?) My crepe weighed as much as a newborn, and I dove in face first. The crepes are as delicious as that analogy was unsettling. Go here now!

Obligatory Title Pun: Knick knacks, GENKI Shack, these CREPES gave me a bone.

Menu Readability: There is a huge list of numbered options and they don't just do crepes here. You might be overwhelmed.

Need to mention: They sell Pokari Sweat here. In case, you know, you have a taste for drinks with revolting names.

What this place teaches me about myself: I think I'm turning Fra-panese.
author: Vivek S.

description: If I could eat a Nutella strawberry crepe everyday, I would. This place has never disappointed me! Only downfall is that there's a $10 minimum for credit cards :( It would be okay if they did a 50 cent fee so that I don't have to spend more than I need to. At least they got cool Asian snacks and candy for you to buy to meet the minimum.
author: Leanne E.

description:
I ate the crepes quite a few times time here, including once that I was asked to speak with Newsom just down the street that I refused as I thought it would be a brain washing session from some politician! 

The crepes were on the harder side that you can hold up like a flat-out ice cream cone instead of on a plate. 

More to attract me is the little vending machines where I can get my little action figures of Hello Kitty and others so I can decorate my work desk and home work area. I also buy the imported coffee candies, noodles, mascara, eyeliner, lip gloss and face masks here. None of those was cheap and I walked out, 90 dollars later, with a couple bags of goodies in 2 reusable bags that are much more fashionable than those from Walgreens or Bristol Farms. 

When it comes to food, yes, Japantown has way more choices but it is not always easy to find import cosmetics and those cute pencils and rulers stationery.
author: T L.

description:
I love japanese crepes and this place satisfies my crepe craving like no other!  (It's way better than Sophie's inside the Japantown plaza)  The crepes here are nice and crispy and I like how you can dig into them like a big ice cream cone.  The nutella, strawberry, and vanilla ice cream make me feel like I'm in heaven.  I hate getting to the end of the crepe though b/c it gets a little soggy by then and I want to start on another one...  

I wish they would be a little less stingy w/ the fruit b/c I sometimes get only 5 strawberry slices in a big crepe.  Also, there's no seating so it makes it a little difficult to share w/ your friends, but all the more reason to eat your own!
author: Chinh T.

description:
I don't like the crepes here. They're too thin and too crunchy. They taste as I imagine sweetened, burned paper would. I much prefer Pier 39 crepes.

I really like the Asian snack selection.
author: Paulina F.

description:
Decent crepe with variety of selections. The crepe is a bit thick and salty, but it is pretty chewy.

Great price if yo want a snack or crepe around.
author: Jay J.

description:
I hate reading reviews raving about a place, coming in with high expectations only to be shut down with mediocrity. I mean this place is good don't get me wrong but this is far FAR from the best crepe place i've been to. The shell of the crepe is not soft n fluffy like I'm typically accustomed to for crepes.. It's more of a "cookie" feel wiht the ends being crispy.. if that's how you like your crepes this is the place to go. 

I had the strawberry and ice cream crepe which was standard, nothing amazing but nothing bad about it. 

I personally think q-cup crepes are way better.. but this place is decent and its attached to a japanese grocery store so you can kill both your craving for crepes and your grocery shopping in one trip
author: James H.

description: I love the crepes here. I recommend the strawberry, Nutella, and vanilla ice cream or the chocolate cake, whip cream, and Hershey crepe. Parking sucks and its inside a mini Japanese market.
author: Tina B.

description:
So,coming here unexpectedly was already pretty awesome. It might be a small place, but this place has a lot-candies, cute mini purses, beverages, etc. you name it! I've been here once with my sister but never tried the famous crepes. Though, my boyfriend took me to Genki's by surprise and bought me my very first strawberry and banana crepes w/nutella and ice cream. From the moment i shoved it in my mouth, i couldn't bear the wholesome goodness of this delicious dessert. I have to go back there again and taste the savory crepes! It's a must!

xoxoxoxoxo
author: Christina B.

description:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 3 Stars
Average: 3.25 Stars

+ Open kitchen so you can see how they make it
+ Fresh ingredients
+ Open late

- Crepe was too Sweet, and had too much almonds

[W] Its weird how its in a half store and half crepe spot. The crepe was too sweet.

[M] Having the need to satisfy my sugar craving, my BF and I decided to go to Genki Crepes for some yummy dessert. It was around 9pm when we arrived and the place was packed! Mostly of teenagers and locals hanging around. There were 3 workers. One person in charge of making the crepes, one who serves the crepes and one in charge of handling cash. Service seemed quite slow from what I observed.

They have a pretty wide variety of sweet crepes to choose from for a decent low price. Wayne and I shared a Sweet Crepe with Vanilla Ice Cream, Bananas, Honey and Almond Flakes. The Crepe was crunchy, just the way we wanted it. However, there were too much almonds and honey, so it made it taste a little too overwhelming for the both of us. It certainly satisfied my sugar craving but we weren't able to finish it... :/

The store is separated into 2 sections. The front end is the crepe shop while the back end is a little Japanese goodies store. They have a good variety of Asian snacks, toys and even a small beauty section for the ladies. We were so tempted to get bring some snacks home but decided we had enough sweets for one night. Perhaps next time : )
author: Mona C.

description: It sure worth the journey from downtown to Richmond just to get the strawberry-kiwi crepe. It was really good, crunchy crepe and soft ice cream. The best choice in a sunny, warm day!
author: Terezinha S.

description:
The crepes are tasty and you can shop while your dessert is being made. In the back there are aisles with snacks and a frig section for juices like aloe water or yokult. 10 minutes on average to get your order. 

P.s. parking is tough
author: Thurston W.

description: Okay crepes are awesome. But workers are b*tches. Sorry to say this but they need to learn their manners. They dont deserve a job
author: Valerie H.

description:
Yummy, I love burrito style crepes!!  Easy to devour with no utensils needed.

Genki offers the typical Savory and Sweet Crepe filings and more. 

I had to get the cheesecake and strawberry tho, I've never had those flavors in a crepe. 

Good stuff!! A little crispy to my liking, but still delish!  

I'll be back for the ice cream!
author: Earlene C.

description:
ATTENTION out of town people don't miss out on trying a Genki crepe before leaving SF! Out of all dessert places I've been to I STILL crave Genki crepes about once or twice a month. I made it my GO TO place whether is be afternoon snack or late night, it doesn't fail to satisfy your cravings for sweets.

The crepe itself is crispy on the outside and best part about it is you get to pick different fruits/ice cream flavors to add in it. I'm happy with just my crepe and nutella because it's THAT good. But I also like it with banana + nutella or strawberries + nutella.  

Don't miss out on this delicious dessert. It's the next best thing to just you everyday ice cream or even better!
author: Elsa Y.

description:
I really wasn't impressed with the nutella crepe I got here.  
I've had crepes in Paris and these tasted really like egg puff batter in a crepe shape.  There was hardly any nutella, maybe 1/4 the amount there should be. I was disappointed. Maybe this place is only good if you get it full of ice cream to cover up what the crepe lacks.

Great crepes taste great with just nutella or lemon and sugar. This one did not.
author: Skye W.

description:
Was kinda excited to come to this place just cause we were really craving for dessert. Long line, people waiting outside = good sign. people waiting, and then getting their food really quickly = even better sign. 

i personally didn't like my crepe - i got the lemon & sugar. It was kinda cardboardy. my friend got the apple cinnamon and ate it in 5 blocks of driving, while driving. we got egg puffs too - original and that was yum. what's money about this place I personally think is actually the asian market. its loaded with so many goodies that we actually walked out with like 5 bags of snacks while we are waiting... and hi-chew

thumbs up: asian snacks
thumbs down: eh my crepe was eh
author: Lauren Y.

description: Large selection of crepes, must try the ice cream filled. Always a great place to stop by when in the area.
author: Krish P.

description:
This review is based solely on the egg puffs and the fact that they sell Hawaiian Sun drinks as well as a number of ridiculously cute knicknacks.

JL wanted me to try these egg puff things she had as a child. On the walk over, she described them to me and they didn't sound that tasty. Then when we got to the store and watched them make them, I was intrigued. They're really quite tasty. Like a more flavorful Belgian waffle with a vanilla/coconut aftertaste.

The crepes also looked delicious. The only negative is you have to be prepared to wait at least 10 minutes for your after-dinner treat and be prepared to elbow your way through a sea of teenagers in order to place your order. But if the crepes are as good as the egg puffs, I think the wait and the chattering teens  is well worth it.
author: Dani D.

description:
"I don't always eat crepes, but when I do, I prefer Genki crepes" - me/not the most interesting man in the world

For a good reason, too.  Their crepes are the perfect balance of crispy and moist.  Definitely go for a nutella + fruit combo. That said, don't go for lychee & nutella...that's just weird.  Their egg puffs are also worth getting, if you're feeling like something a little lighter.  They're like eating air - you can't feel guilty for eating air.
author: jon y.

description:
So crispy.... so light... soooooo goood.

I got the Crepe with red bean ice cream and banana... so good. i'm drooling just thinking about it..  The minute the worker gave me my crepe, i was in love, it looked sexy, it smelled sexy, and tasted sexy. It was just the right crisp when you bite into it, i  swear i heard heaven playing a song in the background.

I also ordered egg nuggets for my brother.. i wasn't going to touch it, i was going to give it to him, but then i smelled it, so fresh, it called my name so i had to try just one nugget. it was AMAZING.

I love this place, i want to go back now, too bad i live so far.
author: Elisa T.

description:
Just went here yesterday for the millionth time.  I swear, if Genki crepes flashes through my thought process for even a split second, nothing can stop me from munching on a deeelish, crunchy sweet crepe from there!  It always reminds me of eating these handheld, ice cream cone like crepes (my personally preferred style of crepes, very different experience than French execution!) during my stay in Japan.  Pretty much ate two of these a day.

Anyway, adore the little shop it resides in - fun little Japanese toys and imported snacks, candies, and drinks.  Bright decor and lighting, and ALWAYS crackin' with folks.  There's a few bench for seating, but really, I love that these crepes are styled to easily eat them standing or for on-the-go.  Never had the savory ones, but I'm sure they're just as bomb.  Very little wait time and open late!!

Would for surely recommend anything with nutella, almonds, or honey.  If you want to go super cra-zay, try the cheesecake or chocolate cake crepes.  Blow your mind.
author: Nadia D.

description: Crepes are well made here. The crepe has good buttery flavor with the right thickness. I'll bet their egg puffs are really good too.
author: Carrie T.

description: Hands down the best crepes I ever had... and the taste is always consistent!  It's the closest thing to a japanese style crepe (Crispy yet chewy).  Every time I'm in the bay area and near by I must get one.  I always get vanilla ice cream with Nutella and almonds. Very simple yet sooo delicious!! Gotta try it peeps!!
author: Kathy S.

description:
I am a huge fan of this place! not only do they sell & make crepes, but they also have a little mini market in here! its so adorable.

i personally like the strawberry and blue berry with whip cream crepe. :)
author: Vicky H.

description:
The crepe selection is simply mind-blowing. Think: crepes stuffed with cheesecake or chocolate cake; beef sukiyaki or smoked salmon. Holy mother of god. 

When I need a good umami punch in the taste buds, I go for the spinach/mushroom/jack cheese savory crepe. It's juicy, so be careful. Then I like to top it all off with a honeydew ice cream + strawberries & whipped cream crepe. Keep in mind that you can make your own crepes, so go crazy. Just beware of the extra charges. 

Don't miss out on their unique selection of ice cream! Have you ever had honeydew ice cream before? Or lychee? Go. Explore the world beyond your plain ol' vanilla and chocolate. But hey, if you like being boring, Genki has those too. 

While the friendly folks up front prepare your crepes, explore the rest of the cute little shop. You'll find a fascinating collection of Japanese skin care products & cosmetics; funky, yet familiar snacks (like strawberry Kit-Kat!); cute plushies & car air fresheners you don't really see anywhere else. Check out those dice-shaped fresheners! 


*note: There is a $10 minimum purchase for credit cards. Parking? You're in the Richmond, buddy--there's no such thing.
author: Lillian D.

description:
Should be 2.5 stars... Crepes are half as good as Sophie's yet costs about the same.  Some of the products in the market appear to be quite old.  $10 min for credit cards.
------------------
After waiting for ages, was finally told the crepe pan had a short & got refunded.  Wish they told me earlier... Got a $62 parking ticket too, bitches!

Went to Sophie's where, despite the huge crowd, real pros deftly & seamlessly churned out crepe after crepe nonstop.  A stark contrast to the team of most inept mouthbreathers bumbling about Genki.
author: Miss K.

description:
DAMN! WE NEED ONE IN SJ

This place is situated in a small market in SF but DAMN! this place is so good. For the price of how much you pay in San Jose, I didn't expect much but over here, they give you so much for a relatively cheap price. I got a number 1 which consisted of a crepe with vanilla ice cream, nutella and whipped cream and all for about $5.40 with tax. I can honestly say, after all the crepe places I've tried, this is my favorite by far. The line wasn't bad at all especially for a Sunday afternoon but it was completely worth the wait on a nice warm day in SF. We need one in SJ for sure.
author: Verik K.

description:
Hong Kong Egg Puff = Guilty pleasure 

Nutella strawberry banana crap = Explosive 

milk tea= ehh.

grocery store = nostalgic 

Clean store Nice service Fast food that will not make you loosen your pants and its easy on the old leather.
author: Wendy C.

description:
1 vanilla ice cream, nutella spread, bannna slices crepe please...

Can't believe I never wrote a review of this place. lol 

This is definitely the munchie dessert when you're high/hungry. It will hit the spot every time. hahaha. Late summer night be prepared to see a line, but it goes by pretty quick. 

They sell other desserts too but almost everyone comes here just for the crepes. If it wasn't so damn cold outside I would go tonite.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I really like this place! First off, it's a really cute super market with unique foods you can only find in Asian supermarkets or in Asian. I seriously have not seen some of the stuff in there. 

I ordered the strawberry and whipped cream crepe and my bro order the green tea with lychee. I loved the way they folded the crepe. It was so easy to eat. I loved the fact that my bro's had actual lychee or longan on it! Super yummy! I can see why this place is always crowded. Would definitely come back for dessert.
author: Hang T.

description: Fresh strawberries and bananas draped in melted Nutella and wrapped in a warm crepe...what a time to be alive!
author: Liz G.

description:
This place had good crepes. Crepe hunger satisfied.

Had cool asian toys. Cool!

They ran out of eggettes , though. :(
author: David A.

description: Genki was the perfect last stop before we left SF. Not only is the size of the crepe enough for four people, but the variety that they have available for you to choose from makes it hard to choose just one. We'll definitely be coming back here!
author: Carlie Marie B.

description: My new spot for crepes! Green tea ice cream crepe with strawberry and nutella was satisfying. Loved the crispy thinness of it. You can pretty much customize your own crepe. Next time I'm trying the egg puffs!
author: Micah Anne M.

description:
Genki has mastered the art of the dessert crepe - crispy texture, light buttery flavor, and just the right amount of heavenly fillings..including lots of ice cream options, fruit, nutella, honey, whipped cream, and more. I was lucky to stop by when there was only a short line, and I was served within a few minutes. I ordered the strawberry and nutella crepe, which was perfectly warm, cheap, and held together for the whole time I was eating (which was not long, I gobbled the whole thing up in 5 minutes tops!). I agree with my pal Tammy who says this place "kills" Sophie's crepes in Japantown. I won't be going there again, now that I know what's possible at Genki Crepes :) 

Some little things: $10 minimum for credit card, and I don't recommend the bubble tea because it's way too sweet.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
While I'm not a big fan of desserts, I do enjoy the ice cream crepes they have here... I'm not really a fan of the mushy and flimsy crepes at other crepe places (I know it's supposed to taste that way but I don't like it). The vanilla ice cream with strawberries, bananas and mangoes and whipped cream is my favorite (and I hate whipped cream, so go figure). 

I am also in love with this little convenient store. It's one of the few places I know where I can get these little anime action figurines (I know I'm a big dork!). I remember getting a set of Rei and Asuka (from Neon Genesis Evangelion) here. Loved it. It's still sitting on my desk back in San Francisco. Aside from the toys, there's Japanese snacks here too. Why doesn't Chicago have a place like this? I really miss this place!
author: Jennie T.

description:
You don't NEED to cram a $4 crepe loaded with nutella, bananas, strawberries and crème fraîche into your maw after gorging on Burmese food at Mandalay (or Burma Superstar), but you'd be unwise not to indulge. I mean, you're already in the Inner Richmond, why not let loose??

A veritable playground of Japanese trinkets and office monitor adornments, and it's open till at least 11pm. Hurry!
author: Kat F.

description:
Genki Crepes are sooo good. Your first bites are crunchy (love that) and then you get to the rest that is packed with everything you ordered. The crepes come folded in a cone (which make them pretty easy to eat)

I had Strawberries, Bananas with Nutella and whipped cream- Loved it. I wanted to keep it a bit simple being that it was my first time there. It really had me at first bite. That crisp edge just makes it so different from other places.

The bf however went all out on his. He had Strawberries, brownies, whipped cream and vanilla ice cream- I had a couple bites of his and it was a-maz-ing. The brownie pieces were huuuge, soft and so moist...paired with everything else. Yummm.

While waiting for our crepes to be done we looked around the store. They've got a lot of snacks and candy that you dont normally see (or at least not often)
author: Heather P.

description:
One of my favorite crepe spots. I usually go in the evenings for after dunner desserts something to cleanse the palette. 

Today I went after lunch. I usually order the strawberry/banana/nutella crepe. Which usually turns out great but I noticed the crepes are WAYYYY BETTER made by the staff at night. It wasn't as appetizing  when the lady at the counter gave us our crepes.. The fruits were cut into chunks of 4s instead of slices. The icecream was melted before it was even put into the crepe. 

Best time to go to genki is in the evening or at night.

Presentation was just disappointing.
author: MariaHazelyn M.

description:
I've helped my boyfriend find his beloved peach-flavored water here for $4.59 (large bottle). I bought one in Japan a few summers ago and haven't been able to find it in Asian supermarkets in Japantown or Sunset district. Luckily, Genki Crepes had it in stock.

They've also got a whole bunch of other flavored drinks, chips, candy, shampoo & conditioner, soaps, key chains, etc. etc. for cheap! However, I've seen the 6-pack vita drinks slightly cheaper at Asian supermarkets.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Avocado shake and banana, chocolate ice cream, crepe with
Nutella is what we get here all the time.  Try it..this place 
Will do u justice..
author: Joel C.

description:
This is based on the one crepe I tried today, that I would actually give 3 1/2 stars.

Stopped back in to try the crepes, being I was not able to last time, and unfortunately it was not as great as I had anticipated for.

I got the Lychee ice cream crepe with Red Bean paste-Sounded delish.

So first off, I noticed the girl working the counter did not clean her hands to well after handling the cash register; it was a brisk run through the water (not good)

It was not long before I got my crepe. First I noticed that the crepe was a little to hard (maybe that's how it is supposed to be in order to stand up)I actually ended up just breaking off the hard shell part of the crepe. The rest of it was pretty good-Lychee ice cream was creamy and flavorful, red bean paste was a little hard ,though still tasteful especially towards the end of the crepe where the ice-cream and red bean paste melted to gather from the warmth of the crepe, end of crepe was soft and chewy.

Overall I still do like this place, they have a ton of yummy treats to choose from and I have not tried the rest of there crepes.

Service is friendly, however I am a little worried about the cleanliness part. I have always thought there should be one person handling the food and the other working the register. Overall I would still come back for other treats, just a little disappointed with the crepe.
author: Shannon H.

description:
I love crepes from Genki! Mango ice cream!! 
They're great and better than others. They make them quick and their price is average.
author: Carmen L.

description:
Dessert crepes from Genki are like tasty on top of awesome with a side of fantastic on a bed of delicious. Oh yeah, rounded out by bliss. Let me explain.

Tasty, classic American and Asian ice cream flavors to choose from. Fantastic topping choices, from staples like nutella and whipped cream to Japanese favorites like red bean paste. Delicious, perfect, hot, sweet, fresh crepe wrapping it all up. And the bliss? That's the harmony of enjoying it all in one hand-held dessert, AND knowing that there are (thousands? millions?) of possible flavor combinations just waiting for you to try.

As other reviewers have mentioned, your indulgence isn't cut short by Genki closing -- they're open pretty late and normally stay open on holidays. You may have to be patient for your creation, but fortunately there are shelves crammed with Japanese imports to peruse, and a large bulletin board filled with strange postings. The only downside is a lack of indoor seating upon which to savor your just-made scrumptious treat, but those witty people at Genki knew that your joy was likely to cause oversight in your normally perfectly clean and tidy eating habits, leading to all kinds of goodness spilling onto the sidewalk on Clement Street, instead of in their tiny store and cafe.

They do actually offer many options for savory crepes and even other food categories, but who are you kidding? If you're hungry, just get two desserts.
author: Ashley L.

description:
CREPES. ASIAN SNACKS GALORE. Man, I love this place!

My girlsss and I were so obsessed with this place that every time we would head to the city, we'd try to plan around to make it to Genki. (Of course, that hype has died down :D) But, as for the crepes, I always order a green tea crepe with Nutella strawbs and bananas! Super noms. Their green tea ice cream just makes the crepe even better. I don't like it when the crepe is super "batter-y" and this place doesn't do that. The ends are perfected with crispiness. 

ALSO, besides for their crepes, they also have tapioca drinks, eggettes, etc. AND there's a little "store" where you can wander and pick up goodies while waiting for your food. I was able to find the green tea kitkats here thanks to a friend that told me about it and was super excited for that. I never leave here unsatisfied and I'm sure you won't either.
author: Krystal O.

description:
Oh my goodness. I have been hearing about this place but finally was able to stop by after spending some time at Danube. There were so many kids and teenagers to show that this has to be the best candy store around town. Sure enough, after working my way through the creperie at the entrance, the rest of the store is a mini mart that sells more Asian and Japanese candies, chips and crackers, and mochi ice creams and sundaes than Nijiya or El Rancho 99. I was feeling right at home.

In addition to getting their fresh kiwi boba, my order of red beans and lychee ice cream crepe with house whipped cream was surprisingly good. The crepe was smothered with red bean paste and once it left the steel it was rolled up into a giant crepe cone. Then they stick a huge scoop of lychee ice cream into the center to melt and top it off with soft whipped cream and whoomp there it is. 

[Putting on my shades]

Party people (Hollaring at the little kiddies in the store)
Yeah Yelp Elite Triple A music
In Full Effect
That's me DL the Triple A Yelp Supreme
And my sweet palate Roll'n
We're kicking the flow we're milkin' the flow
And it goes a little somethin' like this

Yelp Team back again
check it to wreck it, let's begin
Party on party people let me hear some noise

a party over there

And make this sweet crepe a party hype

'Cause I'm a red been fool who's lychee cool
If you want to get down
I'm gonna show you the way whoomp there it is

Whoomp there it is.

Can you dig it? (Little girls: We can dig it!)

Can y'all dig it? (Cashier: We can dig it!)

To the flying Elite from the Hammer of old

Mad skill, lychee flow ill, on the mess of crepe steel 
That's the thrill of the crepephone I just melted 
Party people, there's your kiddie party; Yelp Team is through 
Whoomp there it is, I thought you knew!

Hollar to MC Hammer!
author: Daniel L.

description:
My friend has been raving about this place being the best crepe joint so I decided to finally check it out.  What's odd is this crepe spot is located inside a small convenience store. 

I ordered the #5 mixed fruits w/ Nutella. I also added ice cream.  The total came up to $8.10.  To me, this was a lot for a crepe but if it tastes good then it'll be worth it.  So I waited patiently while the lady made our crepes.  The lady who made the crepes seemed to have a rude attitude.  She did not look like she enjoyed her job at all by her facial expressions. I even saw her punch her fist on top of the counter :(

When I finally got my crepe, it looked appealing.  The crepe was crispy.  One bite of it and pieces of the crepe would fall off.  It was good but not $8 good lol

I highly doubt I will go back.  The price and customer service were really a downfall for me.
author: Nai S.

description: Awesome place with awesome crepes! You can also get little Japanese snacks and toys too! My favey is the banana Nutella crepe. MUST TRY!
author: Ashley D.

description:
Late one night after eating dinner I felt my sweet tooth poking at me.  So my boyfriend and I drove around trying to find a place that was opened and looked appealing.  We saw a crowd in front of this place and thought that it had to be good.

So we parked and walked on over.  When you first walk in, it can get a bit cramped since that is where everyone is sitting/standing just waiting for their order to be called out.  After you get through the crowd there is a line at the other end of the counter.  If you walk past the counter you then walk into their little Asian Market.  They have a wide variety of items, from toys to drinks to foods to personal care items.

After placing our orders, I had a great time looking around at all the interesting things they had.  I feel like this place could be a one stop shop for all your basic Asian needs (i.e. stationary or face blotting pads or even some mangos) and still grab a nice little dessert, drink or coffee on your way out.

It took about 10+ minutes for our order to come out, but there were so many people that I didn't really expect anything less.  I ordered a Crepe with Strawberry Ice Cream and real Cheesecake.  The crepe itself was good ... the top part is sometimes made a little to hard causing to be more crunchy then soft, which I did not care for(-1 star).  But as I got closer to the middle of the crepe it was perfect -- and so were my fillings.

This place brings a smile to my face and is worth the wait.  They have such a wide variety of fillings to chose from that the combinations seem endless.  So if you are ever craving crepes, make a stop here and they'll satisfy that craving for you.
author: Pia V.

description:
You know when you see a picture and it's straight out of a magazine and you think... nothing could ever be that gorgeous or delicious. Surely... it's made out of plastic. So that's what ran through my head when eye-ing the perfect pics on this yelp biz listing. But clearly I was 100% wrong. 
 
So we go to this Asian market full of crazy stuff like oversized pockies and mario brothers candy tins and dried crabs and order a number one with nutella, crepe, whipped cream, strawberries. It takes a good 15 minutes but what comes out is this astonishing concoction of all those things and so much more. 

We ate whilst walking down the street, trading bites, savoring the flavors meshing and melding and crunching and delighting our mouths. I haven't had a dessert this good well... since I can't remember. Mostly because my mind was absolutely blown to bits by the decadence of it all
author: Kelly S.

description: I ordered a snack crepe with strawberry, whipped cream and nutella. It was almost perfect. The crepe was crispy and tasted good. The only component I missed was ice cream. That would have made it perfect. When you are ordering yours, ensure that it has ice cream.
author: Pavithra R.

description:
I'd give Genki Crepes maybe a two and a half stars. I took my sister and cousin here with high expectations but came out pretty disappointed. I got number 10, avocado, cheese, and tomato since I didn't have any breakfast. I found that there was too much cheese and it cooled and hardened pretty quickly..  I tried some of my sister's sweet crepe with green tea ice cream inside and the green tea tasted too sweet. Not the usual green tea flavor you think of.

The mini market inside is cool. They have a ton of drinks and candy, which I'm a huge fan of. I read one review on here that said they had Popin Cookin candy but I couldn't find any. Again, disappointed, but I got three small packets of candy and those were delicious. 

I think I came here expecting toooooo much. The crepes are only five dollars, but make a wise choice picking what you want to eat. Candies at the mini market are good.
author: Christel L.

description:
Not horrible and not the best, but definitely yummy and worth bringing friends and family over :)

Ordered the honey, banana, and almond crepe! It was a good snack, not too heavy, and still was enough to satisfy me.

Relatively inexpensive.

Will be back to try others :D
author: Lisa L.

description:
The people here are amazing and super nice! 
I am a regular and only bothered to write a review b/c of a dude in front of me. He cut me to complain to the cashier that the crepes that day were made bad-- too crispy and he wants it soft ("softer like soggy"). The crepe looked perfect to me, but the cashier was kind enough to listen to his complaints then offer to remake his crepe. This didn't even seem to satisfy him since he said "fine!" .... this shows how nice service is. So with awesome service and deeeeeelicious crepes = FIVE STARS BABY!

My favorites: green tea ice cream + lychee and mango ice cream + strawberries
author: Jen L.

description:
Their crepes with ice cream and nutella makes me happy. The crepe reminds me of a not sweet fortune cookie with a slight crisp to it.

Certain evenings the line is longer than others, so be patient as crepes are made to order.

If you are in the area, definitely must try their dessert crepes and spoil yourself with the all Japanese snacks.
author: Panda G.

description:
Came here one night ordered an icecream crepe for $5. Loved it 

Came the next night ordered the exact same crepe and girl at register wanted to charge me $8. 

When I told her it was $5 yesterday she didn't understand . Staff needs to train their employees better.
author: Quyen T.

description:
This is one of the best place to go for a delicious crepe at clement.. If you are looking for a desert after a dinner try giving a crepe a try.  

Usually when I go to clement I would go to this shop with my friends. I would recommend the crepe with the cheese cake inside. Because the cheesecake combined with the ice-cream wrapped together into  a crepe is the best.
author: Siuhin C.

description: I've only tried dessert crepes and tapioca drinks at Genki, but they're all served up quickly and the ingredients are fresh. [The drinks also use real fruit; always a plus.] Their ice cream is also pretty good quality, in my opinion. Overall, I've not yet been disappointed here!
author: Delia Z.

description:
Do you know that feeling after dinner where you're so full you can barely walk but you still have room for dessert? Yeah that's what Genki Crepes does to me. 

Order the strawberry, nutella, and whipped cream crepe for about $5, and relish in the flavors. 

Even though it gets crowded here, service is really fast.
author: Le T.

description:
Is it wrong that I have had their nutella and banana crepes for dinner more than once? 

Maybe.  

Was it totally worth it?  

YES!
author: Cork C.

description:
Finally tried a savory crepe from Genki! I got the spinach, mushrooms, and cheese crepe, while the bf got the beef sukiyaki(?) and cheese crepe. We had a choice of mozzerella, swiss, or cheddar cheese. I asked for swiss, and bf asked for mozzerella. His crepe was covered in a massive amount of shredded mozzerella cheese, while my crepe was layered with three thick slices of swiss cheese - that didn't melt quite as nicely as the mozzerella did :( I was so sad!

My savory crepe had potential, but the swiss cheese killed it for me... I had no choice but asked my bf to keep switching crepes with me cause his crepe was fricking delicious. The beef got a pat of butter before the crepe maker added it to the crepe.. mmm BUTTA. My first bite of that crepe was messy cause it was dripping with buttery, beef juice. I ain't complaining though cause that crepe was amazing.
author: Annie S.

description:
after been stuffed beyond your wildest imagination from Burma Superstar, I did the impossible -  I found a little empty space and immediately filled it with a #8, Crepe with Vanilla Ice Cream with NUTELLA!!!!

I said Nutella, now go. Pick up some Japanese goodies while you're there.
author: Dave K.

description:
Mmmm their egg nuggets are delicious, it's a must try!
Their crepes are just as good, I like how there's a crisp to the batter.
This place is loaded with junk food lol, so it's nice to stop by here and grab some snacks before you hit the beach. I always have to make a stop here for their yummy egg nuggets.
author: Ruthie T.

description: Sucks. Genki Crepes used to be the BOMB.COM....They always carried my favorite White Chocolate KitKats here(no longer available). The portions of the fillings in the crepes are not as generous as they once were before. This picture was taken awhile back. Lately, Genki has been a dissapointment. The crepes are OK. Don't think I'll be coming here anymore...unless I need change for a dollar or something.
author: Ane T.

description:
Every time I am on Clement, I MUST STOP IN HERE FOR EGG PUFFS!

Ironically I never ever gotten a crepe in here (yes I know... shame on me) But now I`ll consider it when I come back some time. I usually get the Chocolate or vanilla egg puffs :) Last time I went I was somewhat disappointed, because I ordered chocolate puffs once and a few pieces lacked batter (meaning some of the pieces I ate were just shells)

Regardless.. I still will come back for more! :D
author: Johanah I.

description:
I don't know. I am not a huge fan of crepes. LOL.
Anyway, I heard about how good this place was so a bunch of us came here after eating dinner at burma superstar across the street. around 11pm. 
There is a huge line! O_O and a lot of Asians.
I like how they have a lot of Asian snacks and products. Their ice cream in their freezer looks really good. 
The line goes pretty fast but waiting for the crepe is a while which I guess is understandable because they have to make it. 
I shared a green tea with lychee crepe. The green tea ice cream is good. I think my friends really liked it. 
They also offer egg tarts and I believe their egg tarts has filling inside. I've tried them and they are pretty good. They also have boba.
author: Sarah C.

description: Not as good as Sophies Crepes and super limited on ice cream selections. Crepe was not as thin as I'd like it to be even after asking for that. Green tea ice cream is the Taiwanese kind, not Japanese. Don't think I'll be back.
author: Samantha K.

description:
If I'm within a 10 mile radius of Genki, it is a rule that I must come and eat a delicious crepe. If we can't find parking, I'm not opposed to doing a drop and roll out of a moving vehicle, that's how much I love this stuff.

One important lesson I've learned in life -- if it's soft, limp, and is not holding up, it just isn't gonna get the job done. Crepes, of course! I love how the Genki crepes are nice and crispy and do a better job at holding everything in. I try to keep it uncomplicated and go for Nutella and Strawberries, though I've tried the ice cream concoctions from others -- equally yummy! 

And while you're waiting for your crepe, go let your inner Japanese school girl loose and squeal over how cute everything in the store is. If you prefer a more thuggish appearance, feel free to join the chain smokers in the front. You know they're thug life because they drink boba.
author: Vinh N.

description:
Best crispy crepes in the city, period.

If you're used to places like Squat and Gobble and Crepe Express (and etcetera) that serve softer crepe shells, you might want to give this place a try. It's a different kind of crepe entirely, and so so so so so SO good. 

The store is also extremely interesting; random little Japanese knick knacks, candies, snacks, and those Asian care fresheners that smell oh-so good.
author: Colleen M.

description:
One of the best crepe places out there. I always seem to get the green tea crepe with lychee and nutella sauce. SOOO GOOD! Their tapioca drinks are about average but if youre thirsty they also have a ton of other Japanese drinks located in the middle of the store (in the open fridge). They also have a ton of Japanese snacks and some toys/accesories. 

If youre in the area or not in the area and want a crepe I would definitely try this place out. It will not disappoint you. GET WHAT I GET!
author: Tim M.

description:
*** Parking sucks!!! ***

I nearly passed on wanting a crepe because parking was blah! But when I finally got there, I was happy.. hehehe...

I ordered their #1 Vanilla ice cream with fresh mango and banana. When ordering, I asked the cashier if I can have half mango and half banana. She said no. Then she said yes. I was like cool! I waited for about 7 minutes until my crepe was ready. There were only about 2-3 people ahead of me so I was pretty lucky.

While waiting, I walked around the store and saw some interesting and cool snacks. I didn't buy any though. I was trying to limit my sweets.

When my crepe was ready, I was like, "Where's my iPhone???" Gotta take a pic. and post it on Yelp. =) I took a scoop of the vanilla ice cream with a side of mango and their homemade whip cream and YUMMY!!! It was good!!! Their vanilla ice cream was fairly solid, rich and thick. The mango and banana were just right. It wasn't over ripe or not ripe enough.. it was just right. The whip cream was fluffy and sweet, but not too sweet. The crepe was crunchy and crispy. I was very happy.

Oh, after I took a few steps away from the place, I looked at the receipt. It turned out that the cashier charged me an additional 85 cents to have bananas. I wasn't so happy about that because I thought she was going to make it half and half like I requested.. but NOPE!

Aside from that incident, the experience was cool. Oh, the cashier isn't too friendly so don't expect much. There are a few benches in front of the store for you to sit and eat.. or you can walk and check out the stores around there.
author: Kaycie Y.

description:
Henceforth, this place will be known as the place with the dessert that defeated me. I love desserts. As far as desserts go, I love absolutely anything sweet and I don't discriminate because I truly just love it all. I could have dessert before my meal, replace my meal with a dessert, or just keep having multiple desserts. That's how much I love it. One of my friends describes me as a "bottomless pit" because I eat everything and I usually want more a couple of minutes later. 

However, the size of the crepes here were too much for me to handle last night. Their crepes are absolutely freaking massive. It's like a McDonald's Supersize back when they still did that. Anyone remember the McHeartattack sized portions? But I digress, my point is that these crepes are meal sized. You can actually feel the lbs you're about to inflict on your body because mine was heavy in my hand as well as in my stomach...as well as my ass and thighs the morning after. No joke. 

I got the red bean with green tea ice-cream. That's the #2 order and it came out to $5.37. Halfway through, I was already full but I kept going because it tasted so good. I threw it the towel with 1 bite left. Weak defeat, I know. Every nook and cranny of the crepe was evenly slathered in the red bean paste. The edges are slightly crisp and the crepe is perfectly thin and not too chewy. 

The lines tend to get ridiculously long. Here's an insider tip for you. There are always breaks in the line because the long lines go in cycles. If you don't feel like waiting it out, go browse the fun things they have around the store or go take a walk around the block and check in again later. Their crepes are worth the wait though. I might have been defeated the first time, but like The Terminator...dessert Terminator, "I'll be back."
author: Nancy C.

description:
Every time I have cravings for crepes, my boy friend will take me to this place.  They make the crepes perfectly crispy.  The menu options here is overwhelming and I usually just tell them what I want.

The place lacks seating as it is part of a convenient store.  

We ordered the egg puffs too and it taste just like the ones in HK!
author: Wendy K.

description:
I need to review this place again. Why? Because it's that AWESOME. STILL the best crepes ever... Oh and I am STILL addicted to the mini mart. 
Their cheese cake+chocolate ice cream+whip cream is to d-i-e for!
Actually... All of the items on the menu and what's in the mini mart is greeeeat!
I just recently visited this place last week after having been absent for almost a year. Let's just say that I missed this place so much. This place is getting the fame that it deserves. Great items, good service.... and someone needs to remind me to take my nephews here as a treat!
author: Monina C.

description: I came here super excited to try the most popular Japanese style crepe and left confused/disappointed :( I really wanted to like GC but I just couldn't, there was not one thing I liked about crepe at all and I wouldn't come back. That's how bad it was for me and my partner even agreed it wasn't that great. I've had other Japanese styled crepes here in SOCAL and it's definitely much better with more than half less than the reviews here.
author: Kimberly P.

description:
You can smell their crepes and egg puffs from a mile away. It's divine! If you eat anywhere near here, save room for dessert. This place is always crowded, but the workers move fast.

I get the nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream and no whip cream. I cannot believe how much ice cream and nutella they cram in this crepe. The portions here are so big here so sharing is still satisfying. 

I just wish they had more ice cream choices like Sophie's Crepes in the Japantown Plaza. 

I also like how they sell all kinds of Japanese crackers, beauty products, candy and tchotchkes. What a great way to kill time waiting for your dessert!
author: Caroline L.

description:
Crepes, move aside! I could care less about them...

But ice cream?! Yum yum in my tum tum! Genki has some delectable ice cream. It's rich, creamy, and not a single bit of icy. I love it! You can taste the quality of their exotic flavors. So far I've tried honeydew and lychee, both are great. I love the lychee though. 

I'll be back to try all of the flavors! There's only about 6 or so. $2.50 single scoop in a cup or cone.
author: Stine H.

description:
My name is Suany Pants and I'm an emotional eater. I am at my thinnest when I'm happy and in a relationship, fattest when I'm single and sad. After a particularly stressful month and a string of unfortunate events, I unleashed the gluttonous beast in me this weekend and binged on enough food to sustain a small nation: a box of Girl Scout cookies in one sitting, a box of Raisinets, McDonald's, Jack in the Box, Starbucks blueberry coffee cake and a Genki crepe. 

While I normally prefer the sweet ice cream crepes over the savory options, I chose an avocado, tomato and mozzarella concoction today. Wrong combo! I should have selected a more flavorful cheese as mozzarella tasted too bland with the other ingredients. Oh well, I'm an out of control binge-eater so I wolfed down the whole thing while walking back to the car. I also bought some chocolate with fruity centers and lychee Hi-Chew, which I finished while driving home. Oh no, my thighs hate me.

I also love the egg puffs here, but thank goodness I didn't get any today or my ass would have exploded out of my pants.

Look for my name written in the cement a few steps away from this store! I'm so special.
author: Suany W.

description:
I was already stuffed from lunch at Burma Superstar when I walked past Genki Crepes. Against my better judgement, my curiosity took over and I had to go in *just* to check out their menu (I really need to work on my self-control). 

When I saw that they served a variety of flavours of egg puffs, I couldn't resist and HAD to try the peanut butter egg puff (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/83dXgt2nG98JJG2F7ai8AQ?select=tw8neu_BtUUcFVy8oYbM2A). While I was waiting for that I looked at the rest of their menu, specifically their crepes. Since my plan to not overeat that day was already shot, I decided to get one the apple & cinnamon sugar crepe (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/83dXgt2nG98JJG2F7ai8AQ?select=Ev8KcPurVra38na0yhikvA) (at least it's healthy-ish, right?)

I was kinda disappointed. The egg puff TASTED good and I really liked the peanut butter flavour, but the texture wasn't right. It was more crunchy than chewy/crispy. The crepe was decent and I liked the cinnamon apples, but the batter they used was a little salty for a dessert crepe. I also prefer chewy crepes over crunchy ones.

I do like their selection of Japanese/Chinese snacks, candy, and chocolates in the store though!
author: Steph L.

description: Horrible service. The cashier is very unfriendly and not helpful at all. The crêpes are tasty but too crunchy to be called a crêpe. They are rather cookies filled with fruits. Tip: they write a number (or something that looks like it) on your receipt to receive your crêpe.
author: Patricia D.

description:
Long overdue, sorry Genki...better late than never, right?

This is the kind of place that brings you in even if you've just had a massive bowl of Pho right next door...the aromas of fresh hot crepes, mixed with nutella, whipped cream, cheesecake, etc are just too strong for me to avoid.

My fav is a crepe with custard, blueberry sauce, cheesecake and whipped cream-I do this about 3X a year and it is divine and worth every single calorie. My normal to-go crepe is a scoop of ice cream with nutella, still awesome. I think its important to note that they have a delicious honeydew ice cream that I really like all on its own too. I've never had a savory crepe here, sorry!

Prices are pretty affordable for dessert and what you get, bring cash unless you plan to spend at least $10 here with an atm card. The store itself has tons of cute asian items-from make-up to little packaged snacks (dried fish or fruity gummies?), I always enjoy looking at everything while I wait for my crepe. 

Dont let the crowds scare you, even at its peak hours its only about a 7-10 min wait at max to get your scrumptious crepe in your hands. Enjoy!
author: nina B.

description:
Cheesecake crepe... one would think that would maybe involve a bit of cheesecake filling and maybe some fruit.  Scratch that- lets just slice up a big slice of cheesecake, smush in some whipped cream, and THEN somehow find even more room for a blueberry topping all in a delicious crepe.  A buttery crunchy crispy light and delicious crepe at that.  

My friend just moved near here and apparently has eaten here 4 times in the past 2 weeks.  How could he possibly only go that often?  Can't wait to try some more items off the menu but if anything is even in the realm of the cheesecake I know where I'm stopping for dessert anytime I'm here. 

Don't get me started on the rest of this spot.  This place is a stoner's dream: poorly translated and altogether ridiculously odd Chinese foods and toys combined with obscure candy and crepes stuffed with cheesecake.
author: William B.

description:
Enjoyed their banana-honey-walnut crepe. Nothing too special though ... 
Found it interesting that the place was also a minimart with lots of asian toys and goodies. 
Genki's also has lots of other little treats .. like egg puffs! However, I have not tried them.

Unfortunately, Sophie's Crepes will always have my heart.
author: Ashley N.

description:
Customer service here is aweful. They are rude. I will never go back to a place as degrading as this one is. I went into the store with the intentions of buying a crepe only to be distracted by the products and snacks they had for sale too. I decided to look around. As I came back to order a crepe, the cashier asked me where the "purple stuff was." I did not know what she was talking about. She mentioned that she saw me grab a purple product from the shelves. I didn't. After publicly accusing me of being a thief, she then proceeded to act as if nothing happened and did not even offer an apology.

As a registered nurse that takes pride being a trust-worthy person, this is by far the WORST customer service I have ever received. I will call the management to let them know. This happened on 03-17-11 at approximately 730 pm.

DO NOT GO HERE. DO NOT RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE....
author: Sharon E.

description:
I like this place so much! Besides their crepes being a delightful goodness I like the other products this store sells! There are a variety of imported Asian snacks that all look so tempting to try. The only thing is, it is quite pricey for a small snack...but then again they are imported. 
I usually always get the strawberry, nutella, and vanilla ice cream crepe, but the other day I decided to get the Chocolate brownie and vanilla ice cream crepe. It was sooo much better! This place is always busy but your delicious crepe will make it worth the wait.
author: Katrina T.

description: After eating at Shabu House, a couple a businesses down the street, my boyfriend and I stopped in here to get dessert. I absolutely love their crepes. It had the right amount of crisp on the crepe (usually the crepes I get from other places aren't as crispy as here). I ordered a crepe with nutella (a must!), strawberries, bananas, and strawberry ice cream. Needless to say, it was AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS :)
author: Tracy L.

description: Truthfully Im not a big fan of sweets so I maybe a little bias.  My girlfriend likes this place.  But not being a fan a sweet this place is not bad.  I would say you should try it if you have never tried it.
author: Richard M.

description:
My friends told me about Genki Crepes and once they said "crepes" I knew I had to go!

The establishment is basically a mini mart (filled with lots of Japanese goodies) and a crepe/dessert place put into one. Really cute but kinda weird! I visited this place on two occasions: once with my girls and another time with my family. 

The first time, I came here at about 1pm with a couple of my friends, not too busy. The girl who took our orders was very patient while we made up our minds. The second time, I came here at about 6pm with family and they were super busy. The girl who took our orders was super rude and obnoxious! She kept on rushing us! 

I got a dessert crepe with vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, strawberries and nutella! The crepes are delish! However, when I say I want a strawberry crepe, that doesn't mean I want two slices of a strawberry! The crepe itself is shaped into a cone, sort of a like a fortune cookie consistency. Nonetheless, it was very good both times. :)

Minus one star for the rude worker, get your 'tude fixed.
author: Joyce E.

description: It was my first time eating here and I just thought it was ok. I much rather prefer Sophie's Crepe in Japantown. I had the dessert crepe with vanilla ice cream, strawberries, and Nutella.
author: Collin W.

description: I love this place!  Been coming here since college...and since I'm from the east bay, every time I'm in the SF area, I always have to pay a visit and order the usual: Dessert Crepe w/ Green Tea Ice Cream, Strawberries, Nutella and WC.  My BF also orders a savory crepe: Hot link and mozzarella. I think these are the best crepes I've had in my life.  I also love how they have lots of asian treats here too!
author: Nicole M.

description:
I love this place for it's yummy crepes! Favorite crepe is the banana nutella with vanilla ice cream. It is to die for! It can get pretty packed Friday an d Saturday nights but it moves pretty fast. I love the crepe smell, it will make you want to have one when you pass by.

The savory crepes are ok. They use the same batter to make the savory ones and I personally prefer the batter to not be sweet. I have also ordered their chocolate peanut butter shake and that is also amazing! The Thai coffee is a bit too sweet for me but it was tasty.
author: Julie L.

description:
Never really been a fan of crepes but my friends always want to come here so I'm not gonna watch them eat. 

I first came here with my family after eating at Lee Hou Restaurant next door for some dessert. I came here before for their tapioca, which is above average I would say but I decided to try the crepe one day out of the blue. I got the banana and nutella one and it was just so-so. I felt like I could make it at home by myself. Pancake mix + banana + nutella. Overall, I wasn't really satisfied with my purchase because it just wasn't worth it to me. Not special enough to make me want to come here again for the crepe but then again I was never really a big fan of it. Next time my friends come back here, I'll just stick with the tapioca.

Service here is so-so. The workers making the crepes are usually pretty efficient.

***Parking***: Can be a pain to find at night. It's usually crowded around the evening time so come here during the day for better parking.

CASH ONLY!
author: Johnny G.

description:
Yummy!  That's all I can say.

I kept it simple.  Nutella only.  No toppings.

What emerged was light and delicious, with just the right amount of Nutella so I could wolf it down easily even after a super huge meal earlier.

It's kind of cool that this place is actually inside a convenience store of sorts.  Wonder if anyone comes here for actual store items?  The line for the crepes is pretty impressive!!!

They have a nice assembly line going and you can watch them assembling these awesome delicacies from the large windows that overlook the street.  Something to keep you entertained during your inevitably long wait for that circle of magical goodness - mmmmm, nom nom nom!

The green tea ice cream topping sounded intriguing - saving that for the next time :)

~ 5 stars overall - quick (though the wait may be long due to the crowd), efficient, and unbelievably TASTY!!!  I can still relive that moment by just thinking about it :)

# 228
author: Badri N.

description: Best Crepes I have ever had in my life. They are cooked to perfection. The crepe is crispy just like I like it. I usually get nutella and strawberry.
author: Tatyana R.

description:
My experience FIRST TIME trying a crepe (Most of the time I don't like trying new foods) :

This place was highly recommended by a friend, and when I checked out the menu online, I thought the cool looking one was the apple cinnamon.

It was my friends birthday, and I heard you get a free crepe if its your bday. Apparently, there was a mix up, and the guy made us pay for my friends crepe. That ticked me off. Anyways, I order the apple/cinnamon/brown sugar. When I get my crepe, it looks kinda weird....I stare at it...smell it. Hmmm. I take a bite:

A sweet wave of cinnamon and apple surfed my tongue. The soft crunchiness of the crepe made it feel like a hurricane of awesomeness on my tongue. 

I scarf it down in about two minutes. I want another one! My friend got the ham/avacado/sour cream/jack cheese. I think, WHAT? that sounds nasty. But I want another crepe! (says my stomach) I ask for a bite. Again, deliciousness! :D 

Definitely will be back :)
author: Sophia G.

description: Despite the location and the look of the creperie, it's delicious! It's not "supermarket crepe". The crepe skin's texture is perfect, especially with Nutella and ice cream. They wrap the crepes in a personal holder so it's easy to walk and enjoy! Sometimes I will finish one and want another... So I recommend this place!
author: Elle L.

description:
Two words:  Delicious!  Okay, that was only one... but there would have been two if I wasn't too busy wiping my mouth cause I was drooling! :)

I'm not a huge crepe or sweets person but this was, as we say back home on the islands, ONO!!!  When our friends brought us here they had asked us if we liked the crunchy kind or the soft kind of crepes.  I was like crunchy-wha??  Sure enough, they make these crepes to have a crunch to them and a very very thin layer of softness in between (which is hardly noticeable because they're already thin as it is).  And to top it off, you can choose it with filling or with ice cream (bummer that you can't have both, though).
