It started as a "oh man, I forgot her birthday!" And now, I've started to make the trip purposely to Genki to buy their birthday gifts. The cool surprise boxes with little toys and different flavored snacks. I've found cheese flavored kit kats, green tea oreos, and many other amazing things we don't sell in the US. The good and bad thing is - the products do rotate a lot - so you may see ginger ale kit kats one week and never again!
author: Julie L.

description: U know it's good when eating takes your mind and body to think and be at peace at same time. Also for you to eat and forget about the outside world.
author: Megan M.

description:
I haven't had that many crepes in my little life, not usually a fan, but this place easily makes the best sweet crepes I have ever had.  And as if that were not enough, they have an entire cool little asian market to boot! I got the bitter-chocolate kit-kats and they were yummy.  I try to stop by this place everytime I am in the hood.

Parking and the wait sometimes kills the deal, though.
author: Lenza M.

description: Crepes here go for around $6 ~ $8! Genki will always be my top choice for crepes just because the crepe batter comes out very crispy--but not crumbly--and has a bit of saltiness to it. The saltiness goes extremely well with their dessert crepes!
author: Erica S.

description:
4 stars = "YAY! I'M A FAN."

Their crepes are surprisingly delicious. They are never too sweet, and the ingredients taste fresh. The crepe itself is always crispy and clean and never wet and soggy or oily.
I also like that they have imported Japanese snacks and toys. Takes me back to the Old Country.
SUGOI!
author: Nigel F.

description:
This is one of my fave places to get a crepe.  I love the flakeyness of the crepe and the warm yummy goodness of the nutella.

You can pretty much get a crepe anywhere in the city now... but this place is great because while you are waiting for them to make it... you can look around their little shopping store and buy imported candies and snacks from Asia.

Not a place to sit an hang out (unless you like sitting on a park bench in the cold).  But quick and yummy!
author: Sheenie L.

description: I came here with my sister one day and really felt the place. In the back, they have assorted sweets and products from Asia such as almond kitkats. Their crepes are awesome and Genki has a wide variety. However, I normally buy their eggpuffs.
author: John B.

description:
Their crepes aren't bad, but I like their egg puffs better.  They have lots of different flavors of egg puffs, but I have to say my favorite is the original flavor.  If you're into crepes, they have a lot of different toppings and fillings you can put in them.  They can be quite filling.

My only gripe is that it can get really crowded at times and there's always quite a wait while they make your dessert-y goodness.  And I almost tripped on their floor the last time I was there.  They need to fix that.
author: Kris L.

description: Lychee ice cream with my crepe!!!! Can't wait to return here. Great japanese store too. All sorts of fun imported snacks.
author: Logan N.

description: I once had their crepes twice in one day (maybe more) and constantly find myself craving them! Must try. Delicious!
author: Malika A.

description:
Came here on a busy Sunday night. What a mistake.

First off, let me say that I have been here before several times, just never got around to reviewing the place. Fully intended to make good on previous promises to review Genki crepes and give them five stars. Was so dissapointed I could barely give this place two stars, and almost gave it one. I mean, I'm ok with a line of people waiting to get delicious crepes. I'm ok with the crepes being a bit more expensive if it is delicious, freshly made, and filled with deliciousness. But as I stood there watching them make crepes, my heart sank. They weren't using the full crepe cooktop, so they were making crepes like 2/3 the size they normally do. They didn't use the little wooden paddle to spread the batter out correctly and make the crepe crispy and delicious (instead, it was thicker and slightly chewy). The lady working the egg puff station had a poor additude, and kept telling us to wait 5 minutes for our egg puffs (it took twenty). That, and the egg puffs were so poorly made they were doughy, chewy, and overall not good eats.

Maybe it was just a busy night, or maybe the quality of this place has just gone down. Either way, I won't be coming back again in the near future if they insist on not making crepes the way they are supposed to!
author: David H.

description:
I love this place!  Good thing I don't live near here, or I'll have to start taking diabetes medicine.  My fav thing is the coconut egg puffs and their other flavors (honeydew, choco, etc).  I love trying to see how much puffs i can stuff in my mouth cuz its soo delicious, as weird as it sounds ....

Anyways, they are way better than eggettes because its crispier & has more choices, i think.  They usually have a long wait time, but well worth it.  Their crepes soo good - lychee ice cream with fruit or nutella or both!  I like that its just a small asian food market and they serve/sell polly ann ice cream.  Why the other weird objects like makeup, car freshners, and useless keychains are there is a wonder to me.  I just get the food and go.  Leave instantly so you don't get attached, and want to try everything else... there will be another time.  So far its been 4-5 times just this yr.  Caution: this place is addicting!
author: Sandra W.

description: Deliciousness at it's best! I had been to Sophie's a couple times before, but on my most crepe adventure, my friend wanted to stop by Genki's instead. I honestly wasn't very hungry, but I ended up ordering one w/ the bf and IT WAS SO AMAZING! I think we got banana, nutella, and vanilla ice cream. This crepe was HUGE compared to the ones a Sophie's! Now if it were of lower quality, I'd understand why people would still prefer going to Japantown for a crepe, but Genki was simply bigger and better. They also have the cutest little grocery store where we found some POPIN' COOKIN' sets! I still haven't made my edible sushi candy yet, but I can't wait!
author: Christine L.

description: Best dessert crepe in the city. 'Nuff said.
author: Sophia K.

description:
YUMMIEST crepes ever!! I ordered the crepe with green tea ice cream, chocolate cake and bananas. I could never finish the whole thing cause the portions are always so generous. My bf has never fiend for any dessert/ crepe spot ever but this is a MUST everytime we're in the city.
 He swears that this place has the best Honeydew ice cream. Can't say for myself since i'm not a crazy honeydew fan but we both agree that this is one of sf's best kept secrets!
author: Esther M.

description: Crepes, candy and crepes. Oh my! This place is a museum of Asian candy and the service is phenomenal.
author: Janet L.

description: First time I came to this place, I was wondering why it was located inside a grocery store? Totally random but anyway this place gets packed especially at night on the weekends! They have some bomb dot com crepes! I tried the nutella, the fruity crepe and the brownies one and it is so good! Everytime I get the chance to be around the area, I love stopping by here to buy me a $5 crepe.  Its just so good! Thanks to my friend for introducing this place to me.  I am hooked! Although, parking around here sucks especially at night! Clement street is busy but within a residential area! This place gets packed even at 11 at night especially on a weekday.  After eating at King of Thai this is our place to go to for dessert! If you haven't tried Genki's your hecka missing out!!
author: Sharjah M.

description:
mmmmmmm Genki crepes...love the ham, cheese & tomato crepe...mmmmmmm

This is a cute little shop on Clement Street and smells really good when you walk in.  There are other items on their menu board such as egg puffs and tapioca drinks but I haven't tried them yet.  After you place your order you can stroll around their store and check out their snacks and Sanrio type products on display.  They also have a couple of benches on the inside and out for waiting or munching.
author: Emy B.

description:
I've been told that Genki's egg puffs are as close as you can get to the real stuff in Japan or Hong Kong. Although I've never had the opportunity to travel outside of the country, I just know it's gotta be true. Out of all the dessert houses i've been to, no egg puff has tickled my taste buds the same way that Genki's has!

I always order the Coconut Egg Puffs and the service is always super fast.

Random thought: I wish this place was open later. I always find myself craving for some sweet batter after a night of drunken debauchery. This place would make for a great place to satisfy some midnight munchies!
author: Marilyn L.

description:
Is it necessary to put a brownie, vanilla ice cream and whip cream inside a crepe? Not at all... 

Might eating something like this put you into a diabetic comma?

Perhaps..

Should you eat one of these after devouring a pie at Giorgio's?

Probably not, especially if you're lactose intolerant. 

Would I do it again? 

Yes.
author: Jason R.

description: I love this place. Would totally drive miles to get their ice cream crepes.  The grocery area has a lot of cool stuff too!
author: Laiza S.

description:
The only reason I dare deduct a star is because the people here SUCK. Their customer service is preposterous, but that doesn't make me think twice about coming in when I pass by (or making special trips to get crepe-y deliciousness!). 

I definitely am one of those people who searches for justification when I eat something terrible for me. Genki comes through. Why? FRUIT. I order strawberries, bananas, Nutella and whipped cream. MMMMMMM.  I would eat that all day everyday, and say that it's acceptable because I'm getting in my servings of fruit.

Their Egg Puffs are good too, and don't make you feel like you just ate your entire day's worth of calories in one sitting. I wouldn't dare cross the street and go to Quickly's for them. Genki for the win. 

Aside from their oh-so-awesome crepes, Genki is a bizarre convenience store. They have a lot of random toys and candies like HiChew and all the Asian drinks you could ever dream of. 


Some drawbacks (aside from their TERRIBLE customer service) are the lack of seating and that the credit card minimum is $10. Unless you're buying multiple crepes you probably won't spend $10 though, so be sure to bring cash. If you like sitting you have to be a bit of a vulture and hover over people, but if you don't mind walking, their crepes are very mobility-friendly.
author: Alex J.

description:
I feel so lucky to live 3 blocks away from this place. SOOO YUMMY!

My favorite: #2 Green Tea Ice Cream Crepe with Red Bean Paste. 

I seriously dream about it. I tried the same crepe at Sophie's crepes, but I'm sorry - Genki wins. It's bigger, a little more pricy, but better.

This place is really cool. It's a small asian grocery market and at the same time they sell boba and crepes. One of my favorite desert places! 

They're a little expensive though. About $5+ a crepe. Oh - and you need to spend at least $10 to use credit card. But.. definitely worth it!
author: Stephen P.

description:
So I was supposed to be on this diet with my friend Elan K. for a week, but on the first day...and every day afterwards, I've broken it. If you were wondering, the diet was a no dessert diet aka no really sweet things. 

Food:
Mango Ice Cream and Strawberry Crepe - it was pretty good. I'm actually more used to the "French" crepes where they are a lot softer. The strawberries were nice and fresh. The only downside was that there is not enough of ice cream...or strawberries. Total diet killer.

Store:
So you order the crepes up front and that's also where they make them. The store also has so many Japanese foods. I liked walking through the store while waiting for the crepe.

Overall, I don't really like these types of crepes so I'm kind of biased. I like the softer crepes. I know my favorite has nutella, ice cream and strawberries. Just thinking about it is making my mouth water.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Eating here reminded me so much of being in Kyoto and walking by this crepe stand each day when I was there.  When I saw the place, I thought it was just simply an asian convenient store, which it sorta is, but right in the front is what they're popular for: crepes.

Behind the counter, there were two people working behind it that makes crepes to order and upon entering the place, I instantly craved the delicious dessert crepes that I had when I was in Japan.  I had a momentary lapse just thinking about it and proceeded to delineate what it was like when I devoured it 3 years ago.  So this place had shoes to fill right off the bat.  And you know what?  They did a pretty good job; if their was a gripe, then that it would be that they didn't have as many toppings to choose from.  Otherwise, my crepe with mango ice cream and strawberries with whip cream was just peachy.  The crepe skin was warm and crisp and the mixture of the ice cream, whip cream, and fruit blended so well together with each bite.  I wish they were more generous with the strawberries, but it was still adequate enough.

Taking a quick glance around the store, it really is a convenient store with the Asian flare to it.  They sold a ton of Asian drinks that you won't find at your local Safeway and cosmetics and little toy knick knacks.  And those little toys are no joke... like $7 for a miniature toy that's no taller than a quarter.  I guess that's the price you pay for imported goods.

I don't know about shopping at this location, but definitely get those dessert crepes if you're in the area!
author: David Y.

description:
This was the first place I ever had crepes at. & I'm still a fan of Genki's except now, they definitely give less toppings and skimp on the nutella. Not too much of a bad thing, I guess I don't need all those calories anyway! 

The crepes here are delicious & crispy. You can customize it however you want, but remember those additional things do add up fast! 

The last time I came here, the total for 2 crepes that had nutella, strawberries, ice cream, and cheesecake came out to about & $17 or so. 

Kind of pricey since they do skimp on toppings. But nonetheless delicious! 

I'd also advise that you kind of tally up how much you are spending on the additional toppings because the lady there tried to overcharge me because she rang up a few items twice. So just kind of pay attention to that! 

Other then the crepes here, Genki is also a little mart. They sells beauty items, snacks, candy, drinks, backpacks, purses, and other little knick knacks. It's pretty cool. 

If you're in the area, and craving something sweet or savory, I'd definitely say to try this place out! You most likely won't regret it.
author: Rebecca T.

description: If you like a crunchy crepe with icy ice cream... Then this is your place. As for me I think that this was probably the worst crepe I've ever had in sf. It was late and also my first time to this particular establishment but a crepe should NEVER be this way.... I hope other experiences have been better.
author: Jocelyn T.

description:
Genki is also a mini market that sells quite a lot of Japanese and Korean snacks and candy. They have a large section on drinks also ranging from green tea bottles to UC coffee. They also have a small collection of anime figures and some random plush toys here and there. There's a section for hair product such as some hair dye and Gatsby hair wax. Their prices are a bit higher than other places, but it's conveniently there.

The crepes here are freshly made and taste pretty good. I usually order the strawberry ice cream crepe or the green tea ice cream crepe. Their service is a bit on the slow side depending on how crowded it is. They're open late night which is definitely a plus!
author: Steven B.

description:
I've never had a crepe I didn't like.  I've never had a Genki crepe I didn't love.  I recommend the crepe stuffed with red bean.  Not too sweet and great texture in your mouth!  

Pick up some Neoguri ramen and some Hi-Chews while you're waiting for your order!  And maybe.....just maybe, a Hello Kitty cell phone charm too!
author: Eddie L.

description: A few years ago my sister took me here & I had my first crepes with ice cream & nutella. IT WAS SOOOOO GOOOOD! YUMMM! Came here again this past weekend & got the same thing I got during my first visit. #6: Mango Ice Cream with Strawberries, Nutella, & Whip Cream! NOM NOM NOM. Now i'm craving it! :( I have yet to find a place in Socal with crepes as good as Genki's! I also tried Sophies Crepes last year, but Genki's is still better in my opinion.
author: Sandy H.

description:
I am a huge fan of this place! not only do they sell & make crepes, but they also have a little mini market in here! its so adorable.

i personally like the strawberry and blue berry with whip cream crepe. :)
author: Thao N.

description: The ham and cheese crepe was big, but my Nutella banana was flat and skinny with very little ingredients. Usually fill it more. Usually look forward to going to Genki.
author: Jen T.

description:
Being that both crepes and Chinese people seem to be pretty common in San Francisco, it only makes sense that Chinese people open a crepe joint.  That's my theory of why Genki Crepes exists.

Having just stuffed ourselves over at Burma Superstar, my friends and I walked over to Genki Crepes to further stuff ourselves with crepes.  Ok, I'll admit I was actually the only one who did the further stuffing of self with a crepe.  And not with a thin and wimpy crepe.  I had an ice cream crepe, and it was big.

Genki Crepe was pretty busy when when we got there.  It seems at least some of the people there had the same idea of getting dessert at this establishment after having dinner at Burma Superstar.  I also talked to some people who made a trip to the neighbourhood specifically to have the crepes there.

I had the vanilla ice cream crepe with nutella and strawberry.  Ice cream + nutella.  That's genius and makes so much sense!  On my next visit I think I will have to try the red bean ice cream crepe, because red bean is one of my favourite ice cream flavours.
author: Radford T.

description: Very good crepes at very reasonable prices. Like any crepe cafe, you get your choice of fillings from fruits to ice cream. It is located inside a store, so if you need to pick up any random odds-and-ends, you can do so while purchasing a crepe!
author: George T.

description:
Blueberry and Cheese cake crepe is a must after dinning out in the city, or just in the city.  My wife and I love this place, very good service is quick and taste outstanding.

We have had the other crepes also and they are good too.  The salmon and wasabi with capers is excellent if you dont want something sweet.
author: Scott D.

description: my kids love this place. ever since my sister brought them here years ago on a visit, it has become a tradition to get a crepe from Genki every time we visit now.  I've never gotten one because I think it's a bit much to pay $6 for one.  but it taste good & the kids love it.  but I have to say, this time going back we noticed that they were really stingy w/ the extras... 1 strawberry quartered & 4 slices of banana w/ a s scoop of ice creme for over $6 each I think is a bit much.  and the workers here NEVER smile!  what's up w/ that??
author: Judy S.

description:
I used to work around the corner at a Salon on California St.  We used to walk up to Genki to satisfy our sweet and or savory tooth.  They have dessert crepes, nutella, bananas, strawberries and any ice cream you'd like, whip cream and the list goes on.  They also have savory one's, my fave was actually the Ham and Cheese with Pineapple so I got a little bit of both worlds.

Definitely stop by if you're in the neighborhood...man I kind of wish I was still in that neck of the woods.  So many good places to stop by in that neighborhood!

They also sell all types of goodies, candies and imports from Japan!
author: Nissa Z.

description:
Once more, thanks to Cooking Mama 2, I remembered about this place and decided to yelp it.  

Now this place has served me the best crepes I've ever had, so far, in my life.  

I came here at night and man, was there a line of people of all ages waiting for some yummy crepes.  While I pondered what toppings/fillings I wanted in my crepe, my mother and brother browsed the drinks and candy...  Both came back with puppy dog eyes asking me to buy them Ramune.  Finee...  So I relented and kept pondering what I wanted...  Finally....  After mucho consideration, I settled on kiwi, strawberries, whipped cream, and green tea ice cream in my crepe.  

It was so, so very good.  I can almost taste the whipped cream and delicate flavor of the crepe even though it has been 3 months since I've been here.

I also love how the store has so many things to look at.  I bought some candy like a roll of Haribo gummies...  Those were very yummy and it was actually on my Christmas wish list, though, no one got me that...  hmmph, it's okay I got other stuff that I wanted.  Anyways, yeah, this place is good and has a comfy/homey feel to it.  If you're ever in the area, go here!  You won't regret it.
author: Elizabeth A.

description: I had #6 (crepe with chocolate ice cream and cheesecake). The insides tasted ok. But the actual crepe itself was pretty terrible. It was brittle and broke almost on contact. The flavor was a little sour. No sweetness to it at all.
author: Mai H.

description:
I can't even remember when i started to make crepes at home, but i do remember that i have been through hell and back searching for that perfect batter recipe. I've finally come to believe that i've found the perfect one, so help you god, if you have a funky batter, i will have something to say about it! 

Two of my girlfriends expressions of approval led me to believe that Genki would be my new standard. After a year, my anticipation magnified and my expectation rose. What was suppose to be a sweet moment turned out to be a salty one-literally. The crepe batter tasted more like a tortilla than a savory crepe and when mixed with nutella, bananas and ice cream, it didn't leave the impression i had hoped for. Boo.

Although, the crepes weren't to my liking, i can't deny the fact that the store is like this (not-so-little) girl's dream come true! It has every Pocky and Japanese candy one could ever hanker for. They even have a Pocky Men in, none other than, Bitter Chocolate;Isn't that appropriate? And the cute plush animals and toys?! Talk about a cute overload. I nearly malfunctioned, tipped over and sparked out heart-shaped confetti. 

The likelihood of my return would be very slim, but i can't say i wouldn't return again.

Side note: Schuberts Bakery is across the street. Go there for some excellent princess cake and other baked confections!
author: Kelly S.

description:
OMG! this is my go-to place when i crave for crepes! I always get the nutella+ banana and mango ice cream!sooo good!

i give it 4 stars coz its kind of far from where I live! but other than that, the food here is super tasty!
author: Emily V.

description: A friend introduced me to this place shortly after I moved here.  Since then, I've been to a couple other places for ice cream crepes, but this is definitely the best out of all of them.
author: Joe S.

description: I actually come here for the imported toys like Animal Crossing and Pokemon figures. Sometimes they have blind box toys that aren't easy to come by.  They rotate often and the prices are not too bad, sometimes they're cheaper than what you would find on Amazon or whatever. Get it when you can because once they're gone, they're gone. Candy selection is pretty good too.
author: Melissa N.

description:
Things that I like about Genki:

1.) It's pretty yummy. D and I ordered the number 3, which was green tea ice cream with red bean. Didn't look like the picture, there was no whipped cream, but still yummy.
2.) They have CC Lemon, which is this drink that D introduced me to in HK. Delicious and so happy to have found it in the states.
3.) The candy and snack selection is impressive. Brava!

Anyways, definitely down to go again. Hip Hip! Hurray!
author: Jessica H.

description:
One word. Legit. 

It is so good! I love this places. The crepes are just so delectable and yummy that I would totally drive the 55 minutes to come here. They have an awesome menu that is just so cool and the combinations (as strange as some of the might sound) are really good!
author: Sophia J.

description:
You are the main reason I never try any desserts in the Richmond restaurants... because your strawberry, nutella, and whip cream is awesome!

I could probably make this at home, but who does???  And there's a huge variety of crepes with ice cream or with almonds and everything with nutella and whipped cream.  You just can't go wrong!

Also, you make a great hot almond milk.  Screw the nasty Quickly across the street.  

The only downer is the lack of seating.
author: Christine K.

description:
as compared to Sophie's, I like this place more because the line isn't as long, it's not as packed, and the crepes are just as good. 

The downside as compared: the portions aren't as big, and there isn't as much space to sit down. 

Overall, i would come back again, and again because it's in a cute neighborhood, and the crepes are yummy. and easier to find (free) parking
author: Vicky L.

description:
GENKI CREPES I LOVE YOU !

I ordered the savory crepe w/ the mushrooms, cheese, spinach and added advocados. YUMMMMM !

It was a quick wait. I love how their located in a supermarket. we ordered our vita soys and were ready to sit down on their bench and inhale it all.

their egg puffs were good too!
author: Jenna L.

description: Late night in esseff and you need a snack? This is a great place to get some late night crepes and this thing called egg crates...YUMM!
author: Orlando J.

description:
Tonight I had a HUGE craving for a yummy dessert crepe from Genki but since I'm back on my fitness/health craze, I had to prove to myself that I could resist making a trip over to stuff my face w/ their treats.
 
So in support of my (determined) decision to practice self-control, I figured indulging in writing a nice review for this lovely place would suffice.  :D

This cute mini-mart, random knick-knack shop has always been a place I look forward to stopping by whenever I'm in the neighborhood. (which is quite often). 
They've got all kinds of goodies that whether or not I end up buying anything, it always gives me a reason to smile about. They've got a pretty good Asian candy, snack, drink, noodle, cosmetic/make-up and beauty selection but they also sell some cool/cute random knick-knacky Hello Kitty/Super Mario Bros type things that remind me so much of the stores I frequented while on my recent trip to China, Shanghai and Hong Kong. 

As for their desserts, I can only speak of their sweet/dessert crepes. 
(I have yet to try their boba drinks, ice cream or savory crepes.) 
Overall the portions aren't as big as I've had at other places like Crepevine but they're still very good b/c they're freshly prepared, warm, flaky and consistent. Every time I've visited this place I know exactly what I'm getting and its a definitely something I appreciate.

The down side to this place is there isn't any good place or much room for sitting. You usually see people tightly seated next to each other on the 1 or maybe it's the 2 benches that they have inside the store. The other patrons just have to stand outside in the cold to enjoy their treats. 

Although writing this review didn't really do much for quenching my crepe craving, it was nice to think about the yumminess that I'll soon reward myself w/ once I reach my desired fitness goal AND keep me occupied at least til they close shop before I succumb and submit to satisfying my sweet tooth craving... LOL.

GO TO GENKI, they will NOT disappoint you!!  ;o)
author: Karen G.

description:
Love, love, love this place. 

I'm more sweet than savory, so I only get the ice cream crepes (normally the vanilla ice cream with nutella and whip cream). They make to order so while you wait, you get to smell the freshness of the crepe itself. There's always a wait and it's completely worth it. Plus watching everyone dig into their crepes gets you more and more excited to get yours. And they are open late for a nighttime snack after drinks or dinner. 

While you wait, you can take a look around at the knick knack that are in the back of the store. It's always interesting the random stuff you can find there. 

Sometimes I just come for the ice cream alone. The lychee is my go-to flavor. It tastes almost exactly like lychee. I don't get honeydew, but my sister loves it and it does taste just like honeydew. 

And their egg puffs are tasty as well. My mom loves those things. She normally wants the red bean ones and if you're thinking that it doesn't have enough flavor in it, you can ask for extra red bean and they oblige. 

Overall, just a great dessert place when you're craving crepes and ice cream. Yum!
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Delicious crepes!

They come in the style of a ice cream cone rather than folded up on a plate. It's located in a small asian store so I tend to buy little snacks while I"m waiting for my crepe to be made. There's not much space to eat these once you've gotten them so I'd plan on walking around unless you end up getting the one bench that's outside. 

I think they have a minimum of $5 or $10 on credit card purchases so just FYI

AND it's open pretty late which is nice because we were at Japantown watching a movie at the Kabuki theater and when it finished at 9:05 we were sad to know that the crepe place inside was closed at 9, so we yelped this place and found out it was still going to be open for a couple hours!!! There's plenty of street parking late at night though I'd imagine a lot harder during the day. 

I'd suggest: The Nutella, whipped creme and strawberries crepe mmmmmmmmmmm!!!!!!!!!!
author: Heidi G.

description:
The winner for most unique tasting crepes go to *drumroll... Genki Crepes! The crepes had a crunchy yet bendy texture to them. Generally crepes that I had before were chewy or softer which isn't necessarily a bad thing. It's just different. I still think Sophie's Crepes are a little better but I still enjoyed Genki's version. A few friends of mines and I came here on a weeknight and the wait as soon as we walk in to when we leave the door with our food was about half an hour. There were quite a few people there.

I ordered the banana, almond and honey crepe. What can I say? I like almonds and banana isn't too bad either! I was debating on Nutella and strawberries but wanted to try something a little different.

Maybe I'll get one with ice cream next time?
author: Darryl P.

description:
I guess I've been eating crappy crepes my whole life until I met Genki.   Having always ate soggy and chewy crepes, I thought that's how they're supposed to be.  Then came Genki.  The crepes here are so delicious and crispy!  They make them fresh to order so they're nice and fresh when you get them.  They make sweet and savory crepes!  I have yet to try the savory crepes but I'm sure they're great at well!  My fav is just nutella, ice cream, and whip cream!

The place is very small as it is part of a small mini market so things can get busy and cramped.   It is well worth the wait though.  Also parking around the Clement area can be hard to find.
author: Steven H.

description: Dmn. I was starving after hiking up a huge hill to get back to our car. I had a sweet AND a savory crepe. The savory was delicious with cheese, avocado, and tomato. The sweet had nutella and banana. The come out warm/hot and in a easy to eat cone. Service is fast and it's inside a grocery store so you can browse around to kill time. Would come back.
author: Irene L.

description:
I've been wanting to try Genki Crepes for the longest time. One night we finally came here at 10:30pm.  This place was packed.  

I waited patiently at the front window for my cone shaped crepe.  When I got my order, it looked nothing like the crepes displayed in the pictures. It was as flat as a PBJ sandwich (exactly like this photo: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/83dXgt2nG98JJG2F7ai8AQ?select=Ev8KcPurVra38na0yhikvA). Nevermind, who cares!  I was too excited to finally eat the crepes everyone had been raving about.  So I took my first bite of the apple, cinnamon, brown sugar crepe **CRACK**  M'Okay that was a little crunchy like a waffle cone.  Took another bite.  Same thing.  What is this?  I have never had a crepe this crunchy and the filling this dry in my life.  Two bites were enough for me.  My crepe was so dry and crunchy it tasted like a fortune cookie *hah, I made a rhyme* 

So why was my experience at Genki so disappointing?  Maybe it was an off day?  Maybe I didn't add ice cream?  Maybe I should've ordered one with whipped cream?  Maybe I should've ordered the honey, banana, almond crepe or the cheesecake whipped blueberry crepe?

I really don't want to give 2 stars to Genki but I could not come up with a good enough "Maybe" to change my mind.  Genki is known for their crepes so I expected their crepes to taste just as good as a standalone regardless of the additions of ice cream or whipped cream. 

I won't go out of my way for Genki again.  Maybe if I am in the area, I may try a different flavor or buy something else since this store also serves as a mini-mart where you could also buy hi-chew candies, pocky sticks, instant noodles, and other knickknacks.
author: Hannah C.

description:
The crepes here are way too crunchy, fortune cookie crunchy, hardly what I wanted in a crepe.

The egg puffs I got were freakin' burned.

Not a great experience.
author: Jayne A.

description:
I love the crepes here! I've been here a handful of times (pretty much every time I visit friends who live nearby, I make a pit stop at this place), and the delicious crepe smell always tempts me to order more than I originally intended to. My favorites are the green tea ice cream with red bean paste or fruits (strawberry, banana) w/ Nutella. Can't go wrong! The store also sells Japanese goodies and treats.

-L.
author: Leeann C.

description:
As you walk down Clement street, the smell of fresh crepes is lurking near by... you quickly turn to follow the mouth-watering smell... And its genki crepes!  I love their desert crepes, especially the ones with green tea ice cream and lychee.  Their crepes are thin and yummy! What an awesome treat! 

Its a cute little market too with japanese goods, including candy and noodle packages.
author: Tramy V.

description: Try the number 1 in any variations.  Never tried the savory crepes but if you're in the mood for savory- it might hit the spot.  My favorite is the egg puffs and a watermelon juice and boba combo.  Winning.
author: Erika S.

description:
Ever have the problem of finding a late night dessert? 

Problem solved. They are open late. Not only great crepes, but egg puffs! The mini mart is cool for all your japanese snack cravings and desired knick-knacks. Got boba as well!

Beware the long lines, but it moves fast. Don't plan on sitting. It's not that kind of place. There's benches if you want to be cozy. Great for stopping by especially if you are already on Clement, since parking is a challenge.
author: Boris C.

description:
After reading SO MANY GREAT reviews about this place I HAD to give it a try.

I got the Strawberry and Vanilla Ice Cream Crepe with whipped cream. It was awesome. I shared it with my girlfriend and we BOTH loved it. It was gone in about 5 minutes. They really lived up to their reviews. Heard great things and it was awesome. Definitely will be back.

The actual place is small. Its a crepe place combined with a mini mart that sells drinks and what not. Not that much seating but we just walked around Clement.

It was just a little weird that this place was also a little mini mart as well. Didnt really walk around to see the mart. I guess the main reason why people come here is for the crepes haha. Im definitely coming back. This is my new crepe place! =) haha
author: Daniel S.

description:
I don't eat crepes that often, but DAMN these were good!!! 

They have dessert and savory types of crepes but I'd go with the dessert ones. There's a big menu of different toppings you can get and you can choose if you want a large or smaller portion. Genki is a small Asian convenience-type store with a crepe-making station in the front. I think most people come here for the crepes so the wait can get quite long. 

PW and I got the #1 with vanilla ice cream, mangos and whipped cream. Delicious! I would want to try one with the Nutella next time. 

Also, the min charge for credit cards is $10 so prepare accordingly. They've got a ton of random knick knacks and Asian snacks so if you're well-versed in the snack arena, you'll probably leave very happy.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
Genki makes me wish I went to USF instead of SFSU.

5 stars for amazing Japanese-style crepes AND the price is a lot cheaper than Sophie's in Japantown.  I'm a simple girl so I only get Nutella and bananas but it hits the spot every single time.  I don't care how full I am from dinner, I will ALWAYS try to go to Genki if I'm in the Inner Richmond area.  One time, the BF and I went here after sushi and he said he was full and only wanted a bite off my crepe.  Mind you, I do not like to share things so I told him I'd buy him one and eat whatever was left over.  He ate about 3 bites until he handed the rest over to me.  So here I am, 4'10 little Asian girl, holding one and a half crepes and I happily ate it all before we even got to 19th Ave.  

Yeah...that was a pretty awesome day if I do say so myself.
author: Alyssa S.

description: Our go-to spot for a crepe snack or dessert!  We normally get the green tea ice cream with red bean paste or lychee, or the vanilla with nutella and strawberries.  All super yummy!  This place doesn't disappoint.  Next time we make it over to the Richmond district, we want to try the custard and check out their savory crepes as well. Highly recommended!
author: Christine S.

description:
I overdosed on crepes a few years back because I came to Genki every. single. weekend: both Saturday and Sunday. But now I'm back in business and cannot wait to go back for the singlemost inspiring crepe I've ever tried:

smoked salmon, cream cheese, wasabi, onion and avocado.

It's of the gods. 

My only complaint with this place is that the open so freaking late! I am a morning person and I am pretty baffled that the kids who run this place don't stroll in to make my breakfast until like 10 or 11 on the weekend. Psh!
author: Rachel L.

description:
A couple months ago my parents and my boyfriend went around the blocks in Clement. We didn't have time then, but recently, my boyfriend and I went back and tried this place. 

Ordered a strawberry and vanilla ice cream crepe (#1). Loved it! Fresh and it was big enough to put your mouth into. Not thin like others I tried. :) 

Going here again.
author: Gen M.

description:
Crepes!! One of my favorite desserts right after dinner... or even for dinner!

This place is the only place I've had that the crepe didn't turn soft and mushy after 10 mins. This crepe fought and remained in its crunchy and delicious form, still strong enough to let the ice cream and fruits chill inside. 

Even though the wait may be a bit long, you can shop between aisles or just browse. They sell mostly asian snacks and even some makeup too. I think i would rather have them replace the aisles with chairs and tables though.

One downfall... I think I saw a roach.... crawling somewhere when I was about to leave...
author: Jamie Y.

description:
It was raining like I should be helping Noah build an ark, but that wasn't going to stop me from finally paying a visit to Genki Crepes (after some great ramen at Genki Ramen around the corner).

When I lived in Japan, I probably had a dessert crepe 3 to 4 times a week so I was very happy to discover that Genki Crepes is pretty close to the real thing.  I had the cheesecake with vanilla ice cream and it is just simply awesome!  

It's too bad I don't work or live close enough to come here on a regular basis. I'll just have to be content with making the occasional visit whenever I'm in the area.
author: Eric D.

description: Crepes here are amazing! Crispy and light. Can't go wrong. I usually get just the nutella crepe. I haven't tried the other flavors, but I'm content with my usual pick.
author: Patricia T.

description: For some people it might not be as good as it's hyped up to be. But I absolutely love crepes here. I used to enjoy coming here when I lived in SF. It's just a small place, not much space to eat, and it can get pretty crowded. But that's just the kind of place it is, so it doesn't lower the ratings I feel it deserves. And while waiting for your crepes to be made you can walk around the store and get some snacks and whatever. Haven't been here in so long, but all the other crepes I've had haven't made me as happy as my Genki's crepes did. One day I will go back again..
author: Andrea M.

description:
Sweet and savory crepes! Or you can get egg puffs if you just want something smaller.

I come here whenever I'm sorta hungry and don't wanna spend much or I had a filling meal and I'm ready for dessert. All the crepes are good, pick one and your belly will be happy. The only savory crepe I've had was the beef sukiyaki with spinach, mushrooms and cheddar cheese and it is very very tasty! The mini store is pretty nice. Genki is perfect to come to when you're in the mood for snacking! Although the prices for them are kinda up there, you can find so many different things you may not be able to find elsewhere (maybe at the Asian market but where's the closest one?)
There's usually somewhat of a wait. They give you a number, you listen for it to be called, you pick it up, and you eat away! 

A plus, they're open late! Stop by if you're in the Richmond. There's a $10 credit card limit so pick a drink or a snack in the back to make it up to 10 dollars if you don't have cash. Parking will suck. But don't let that discourage you! The crepes will be a definite nomz in your tomz!
author: Nandiya A.

description:
food: 3/5
service: 4/5
decor: 5/5 its a grocery store with crepes, nothing special

This place has been here for years. I've come here several times for the crepes and the quality really depends on the person making it. I've had great fluffy crepes and then I've had extremely dry thin crepes that break apart. So, every several months or years when they get new people, the crepes change again. I suggest you get the ice cream crepes because they usually are alot better than the ones with just fruit and a random topping. They used more batter for the ice cream crepes so it can hold together, so you usually don't end up with that super thin crepes.

The grocery store portion of genki's is awesome. They have all these asian snacks and even cosmetics.
author: Cecile S.

description:
Genki Crepes is a very popular dessert area.  Often crowded on weekends, but never enough space.  

On a weekend night, when you walk by, there's usually a group of people blocking the road, refusing to let you pass through -- just kidding. But there is usually plenty of people outside.  When this happens, it is hard to get through to order your crepe.

I usually get the ice cream + nutella crepe, or I get the mayo,ham,cheese one.  Yummy!! :)
author: Tina L.

description:
Oh my goodness. Genki Crepes is the place to go for amazing desert crepes. 
I had the vanilla ice cream crepe with bananas and Nutella and it was absolutely delicious. Everything is so fresh and all the flavors just melt in your mouth. They have a great selection of ice cream to choose from and you can mix and add different toppings if you want. They are also really really quick so you don't have to wait too long to enjoy your treat! Best part is that it comes in a nice little cone so you can walk around with it and not make too big of a mess. 

Genki Crepes not only sells crepes but is also an Asian market so you can browse through the aisles while you are waiting and check out the interesting selection of snacks. I did come across a very odd snack though: tiny crunchy little crabs packaged and covered with sesame seeds. They didn't look as good the crepes, that's for sure.

Such a great dessert to walk around with, share and enjoy after dinner.
author: Denise S.

description: I had a craving for a Nutella crepe so I looked this place up and walked on over.  Not only was that crepe $3.50 it was ready super fast and it was really good.  Totally hit the spot!  Really easy to walk and eat it too!
author: Kirsten M.

description:
Tooo many options to pick from, almost anything on the menu from crepes,smoothies and snacks are super tempting.And they make egg puffs/eggetts here :)

One of the best hole in the wall places in the city, nice small and cozy and open daily too .If you can find a better place for such things, i'm pretty sure you're still sleeping.
author: Eric C.

description:
Yummmmy. I got a standard banana and nutella crepe, and my sister got the one with cheesecake. Mine hit the spot for a dessert right after lunch, while the cheesecake one seemed very decadent and heavy. Overall, they were both very tasty. Price-wise, it's cheaper than Sophie's Crepes in Japantown, but I think Genki has more variety in filling. 

Also, the mini-mart is pretty cute for Asian snacks.
author: Marian M.

description:
Since I moved out of San Francisco, I miss Genki the most!!! After hours, or even DAYS, of studying hard, I used to treat myself to a well deserved ice cream crepe from Genki! The 15 min drive and countless minutes of circling around for parking was always worth it!!!

There is no other crepe place that makes dessert crepes quite like Genki. I always got the strawberry & banana crepe with Nutella and vanilla ice cream. Mmmm, mmmm, MMmmm!!! Goddam, I can't stress it enough.

While you're waiting, you get to browse the cute little shop that compliments it so well. Typical Asian stuff like figurines, stickers, stuffed animals. It's always so much fun to dig through these Asian shops that seem to love carrying miscellaneous items. LOL!
author: Frances T.

description:
This place is VERY good.  After a nice crab dinner my party was craving for some dessert so we went to Genki's for some ice cream crepes with the recommendation of my cousin that's from the city.  I was a bit surprised that it's a crepe/grocery store so that came as a bit of a shocker.

There are MANY different types of crepes that you can purchase.  I ordered an ice cream crepe consisting of vanilla ice cream and nutella.  YUM.  The crepe comes out a bit warm so it gives you a great taste when eaten.  The ice cream is decent but is excentuated by the nutella.  It's a great snack.  Apparently, you can add fruits on top of it with no extra cost.  I would have probably added some strawberries or something if I knew.  

This place gets an A from me.  I'll be back when I hit up SF again in the near future.
author: Christian M.

description:
This store has a gigantic selection of Japanese candies, snacks, and drinks.  Also disturbing anime action figures of women with skirts flying up (luckily, with panties on).  

They also  make huge crepes and egg puffs. Makes you proud to live in SF.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
I really wanted to get some eggettes here, but was too full.  They have nice looking crepes too.  They also sell many Japanese products: ear picks were only $1.5! 

I got a Meiji Rich Matcha for $2.79.  It's chocolate green tea candy bar.  Will try it soon.

I think it's cash only, not sure.
author: Ann L.

description: Love crepes so i like this place! Fast and yummy. It is also a mini asian grocery store and i like their selection of goodies. Had the strawberries with bananas and nutella with ice cream crepes before and recently tried their red bean ice cream. I love red bean so i liked it a lot and loved their crepes too :)
author: Trisha B.

description: I dont know what seperates this place from other crepe places but i must stay this is the go to spot. I get nutella, kiwi with strawberry ice cream and whipped cream. Ive tried the spicy sausage one and that tastes like pizza! Great crisp texture but not crunchy or soggy which is how i like it. For my birthday i got a gift certificate and i cant wait to use it. Oh they also have different kit kat flavors and other cool candies you cant find in usual places
author: M A.

description:
I love, love, love this place.  Not only is it open late, but the crepes are cooked up fresh for every order.  U can smell the sweetness in the air! 
I enjoy several of their pre-set ice cream options, but love creating my own more.  Note:  they also have savory menu items with crepes, but I PREFER sweets!!!  U can add fresh mangoes, bananas, kiwis, etc. Yay!

In addition, they have a mini-mart towards the back with tons of imported Asian/Japanese convenient store items.  They have a few benches outdoors, not an official dine-in spot.

Great place for small group, first date or steady, grab-n-go, friends/fam in town, or to wind up children.
author: McCracken C.

description:
Yummy Crepes!
-Had the nutella strawberry crepe
-Crepes are cripsy, warm, served to be eaten with your hands.
-Con: There are only 2 benches inside for you to sit at, and the rest of the store is a market, so its not the coziest place to eat your crepes!
author: Linda C.

description:
Here I go again with my half star rating. I will give this place 2.5 stars. 

After our little Asian adventure to My Tofu House, my friend and I were driving through Clement Street and saw a fairly large crowd gathered outside. She mentioned that she read that this place was highly reviewed for its crepes, so being yelp snobs, we decided to immediately park and check it out. 

We both were craving green tea ice cream, and ordered a plain crepe with just the ice cream. I figure, if the place is THIS good, it should be able to perfect the crepe.

First of all, there were many people that got their complex orders of nutella, banana, caramel, nuts, whatnots before we did, even though they ordered long after us. What the heck is up with that? I just wanted a freaking scoop of green tea ice cream in a crepe. Is it that much to ask? At least there were a bunch of asian things that kept me occupied while we were waiting for our order. I completely forgot about all these Asian snacks that I used to eat as a kid--this place brought me back to my ROOTS. 

Anyways, our crepe and ice cream combo finally came and they placed it in a to-go cone shaped paper concoction. Aren't crepes supposed to be soft? Well it was crispy, and it almost felt like I was eating a taco shell. Ok, maybe I'm exaggerating regarding the taco shell comment, but this ain't RIGHT. Ice cream was delicious. Definitely hit the spot, but for such a highly reviewed crepe place, one would think the crepes would be amazing. However, it is not. It's fine, and maybe I'll come back for the ice cream, but not a crepe.
author: Victoria B.

description:
This place was located inside a supermarket, it was our last resort since most dessert places that serves ice cream closes pretty early on a weekday. 

I ordered the strawberry banana crepe with nutella topped with vanilla ice cream. The fillings were great, can't go wrong. However, I think the crepe was a little bit too thick. It just tasted like flour, but great customer service.
author: Nhung T.

description:
This place has nearly a thousand reviews, and I'm sure every one of them feel the way I do.

Great, awesome, fantastic crepes. Particularly awesome at 11pm =) Also great that it's a little supermarket, so while you wait for your crepe, you can browse the many interesting knickknacks and get yourself some aloe juice and grass jelly to enjoy later.
author: Razel M.

description: Tasty and cheap sweet crepes. I had a boba tea too which was delish. I want to come back on a hot day and have a crepe with icecream. They look so beautiful! Like culinary art!
author: Vanessa M.

description: I have been here a few times with friends. I like their crepes especially the sweet ones. I tried their mango ice cream it's good. They got a big menu on the wall. I like their fruit smoothies too.
author: Serena Z.

description: We were craving crepes, so decided to go off of great Yelp reviews. A real disappointment. Not only were the crepes crunchy like cookies, but the insides of the crepes were cold and really left much to be desired. We ordered a cinnamon apple one - I imagined the cinnamon apple filling would be like apple pie, but instead it was cold, crunchy apple. We also tried red bean paste and mixed fruit. Both were OK, at best. The place smelled great, but the taste did not line up!
author: Wendy L.

description:
Mmm Genki Crepes is fun .. 

Lots of cool candies, snacks, and drinks in which I have never seen before. Little tinker toys and all kinds of eye candy n such ... 

After growing up in Jersey it's fun and refreshing to see a place like this ... all I can say about Genki looks like it has been said before ... so yes indeed its fun n yummy ...
author: Anthony S.

description:
My first time going to Genki Crepes was during my vacation to San Francisco.  Being the dessert person that I am, it was a must to grab something sweet after dinner at King of Thai.  We decided to try Genki Crepes, which was just a few doors down.  I soon realized it wasn't a very bright idea to go there late on a Friday night as the line was out the door and wrapped around the store, but I figured it must be worth the wait... and boy, was I right.  

I ordered a vanilla ice cream crepe topped with strawberries, bananas, and their home-made whip cream.  The first bite was orgasmic.  The softness of the ice cream and fruits balanced out the crispiness of the shell (the bottom gets a bit soggy as the ice cream begins to melt, but is still delicious) and the whip cream had just the right amount of sweetness.  The best part is that they put the fruits at the bottom as well (but it seems as though they have been a bit stingy with their fruits recently). 

The portions are definitely worth it for the price of about $5.  The ice cream crepes are big enough for two people to share, especially after a filling dinner.  Be sure to bring cash because the store only accepts credit cards for purchases over $10.  The only other downside is that there is no place to sit besides a bench inside and a couple of chairs outside.  We found ourselves having to stand up and eat. 

Living in San Francisco for the past two years, I have never been let down by the crepes at Genki.  The only suggestion that I have is to ask for a sample of the ice cream before they put it in the crepe.   I must have had a bad batch of the vanilla ice cream because it tasted more like yogurt.  Definitely recommend this to any one have a craving for sweets and are in the Richmond district.  You will not be let down.  Oh, and don't mind the line... just have someone wait in line for you, while you browse through the yummy Asian snacks =)
author: Mary Rose L.

description: Amazing. Super packed late nights but the wait is relatively short. It's inside a grocery store with some pretty awesome stuff (and candy!!). Got the chocolate hazelnut crepe and it was DELICIOUSSSSSSS. My gosh I'm salivating just thinking about this place.
author: Diana Y.

description: It's called genki's crepes... I've never gotten a crepe here! I usually get their egg puffs here which are really good. I used to go to eggettes but they don't always have the coconut flavored one! Then my friend brought me here and they had it on their menu. Mmm, so good! It goes away so fast too, especially when you're driving and you're popping those suckers in your mouth like its crack. I have to say my favorite flavor is the blueberry one because it tastes like a blueberry muffin! Give this place a try!
author: Johnson S.

description: I love this place.  I've said it to the cashier, even though she didn't say anything back.  But I'll say it again, I love this place and their delicious crepes.  I love their cheap little Japanese toys/pencils/pens which I find more expensive at other places.  It's a little mini mart with a menu at the entrance of dessert and gourmet crepes, boba, and egg puffs, and to the back the store sells a bunch of Japanese goodies.  I had the mango ice cream with strawberries crepe -- so good! and for under $5.  I also bought these cute little Hello Kitty pencils with a bow (which would cost around $4 at Sanrio) for my younger sisters for $1 each. I love this place!
author: Kayla A.

description: I'm really surprised to see all the good reviews this place has. If you're coming here for crepes, I would ask you to pass. You'll find much better crepes at japantown or Haight for the same price. I've been here maybe 5-6 times considering my school is fairly close, and all of the crepes I had there were bland and there's nothing special about them. I gave this place two stars because they offer a larger variety of Asian candies in-store which is difficult to just find anywhere else.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Genki's is one of the best crepe places I have been to. Though parking can be a pain in the Richmond, it is well worth it to get a HUGE, savory crepe for less than $5. Not only does the place serve crepes, they offer ice cream as well. All the crepes are made right in front of you and the size of it is massive. They serve it like an ice cream cone and one bite will leave you wanting more. 

NOTE: CASH ONLY
author: Surge C.

description:
Amazingly good crepes? Check.
Cute toys/Asian snacks? Check.

Aaaannnddd that's all it takes for me to be happy. Seriously though, I'm thoroughly satisfied with the crepes they have. Sure there's the basic Nutella, banana, strawberry and whipped cream crepes. But then they have other awesome additions like cheesecake or chocolate cake chunks. Add ice cream to that and it's golden.

I think prices are decent. Average for a dessert crepe. The toys are on the expensive side but it's one of those things that's a nice to have. They're cool to look at  and keep the customers occupied while they wait for their crepes to be made. They also sell other things like snacks, toiletries, drinks, food, etc. It's like a mini mart with a crepe bar.

I'm not from the city but I find myself asking, after every meal, if I can go to Genki Crepes for dessert. Nope, I'll pass on froyo, ice cream, Asian dessert places, pastries, or anything else. I'll just have a crepe, please.
author: Susan J.

description:
EGG PUFFS!  Crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside.  *Homer Simpson drooling noise*  The only downside is that they take a while to make, especially when it's crowded.  And they use a separate numbering system between the crepes and egg puffs, so don't get duped by the fake-out.

Crepes are good, but I'd the dessert crepes over the savory ones.

The Japanese snacks are great when all other similar outlets are closed, but know that they're more expensive here.  They also have a larger selection of miniature items (those boxes that come with cute mini toys and like a stick of gum) compared to other stores on Clement.
author: Jenn C.

description: Sorry Genki, I have to downgrade your rating because Crepe Temptations showed me that there is better out there, and not very far away either!
author: Vivian H.

description:
This review is dedicated to Megan.

I see this place packed at 1am on weekends, and always wondered what a small asain market had to offer at such an ungodly hour. 

When my co-worker Megan asked me, "Have you ever been to Genki?" And surely enough, i had repleid "Noo..." Before i could finish the on syllable word, she interrupted and said, "GOOOOOO, GOOOOOO ! They have this Crepe with Neutella, mangos strawberries, 'OMG' It's soooo GOOD!!!! GOOOO!!"

I was sold. 

I have been to Genki Twice this week and my tongue has had a hard-on for it ever sense.  I have had the Crepe Megan recommended, and another desert crepe with Neutella, Bananas and Almonds. 

They also offer several Crepes with ice cream, as well as Savory Crepes. Sevory crepes are lunch crepes with ingredients such as ham and cheese, salmon and cream cheese - etc.

After you drink at bitter end, and you find yourself walking home  alone and dateless go to Genki for a good time!
author: Peter T.

description:
Want dessert after dinner or drinking and hanging out at one of the many bars and lounges in this area? This is a good place to satisfy that sweet tooth. 

The crepes are great. Nice and warm but I think it's all about the filling. The most popular is nutella. I personally love nutella and strawberries. But they have a wide range of other fillings including ice cream. 

Warnings: this place is popular so there's a bit of a wait but feel free to look around their little store as you wait. Parking is also hard. It's in the outer Richmond so you have to expect circle around a bit or drop someone off and order as you wait in the car. 

So my suggestion would be to get your crepe and walk around the neighborhood.
author: Angie P.

description: Crepes were aight, I had beftter else where. ~$5 for a tiny thing of crepes. A skin thing with a scoop of ice cream and drizzle some chocolate on time. Oh wells the girls liked it.
author: Frederick A.

description:
Best place to go for a late night crepe run.  Prices are decent.  Lines can be long but the wait time isn't too bad.

I always get the dessert crepes -- mixed fruit with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, nutella & whipped cream.  YUM.

Parking isn't too bad either and there's always a spot on the same block whenever I go with friends.

Definitely would recommend!  :D
author: Bernadette D.

description:
Half of this store is a market that sells various types of Japanese treats and candies, and the other half operates as an outfit that makes some downright delicious crepes.  Both the crepes that I tried (nutella, strawberry, and vanilla icecream) and (greentea, mango, whipped cream) were rather good. My flavor choices weren't very adventurous but it was my first time and I wanted to play it safe. My tastebuds are also not so well-versed in crepes but I appreciate that the crepe was on the crispier side and thus did not get soggy as I enjoyed them.

This is Inner Richmond so of course parking is terrible, and it's also a decent twenty-minute drive if you don't live in any of the adjacent neighborhoods. It's worth it to come out here on a nice day, if you linger around the area. Maybe not worth a drive solely just for the crepe itself.

I could see myself back here again in the summertime.
author: Gina L.

description:
As if you didn't read it already, these crepes are SO good. It's worth the drive, worth the headache looking for parking, and definitely worth your $$$. 

My regular order- strawberry + ice cream + nutella + whip cream

Check it if you're in the area and if you're not? Come anyway!
author: Sandra T.

description: 5 stars just for the egg puffs.  They're especially good to snack on when you're walking around and it's cold outside.  They'll warm you right up, and they're easy to eat when you're on the go.  They have an interesting selection of Japanese snacks and toys in the store too.
author: Karen W.

description:
I absolutely love this place. Best crepes ever. Nutella and strawberries wrapped up in crunchy crepe by teddy bear making them. (at least thats what we would call him). I never tried the ice cream crepe but they seem very popular.

They have every japanese candy known to man, little plastic mineature foods in a box, hello kitty stuff, coconut milk, lots of fun stuff.
author: AL S.

description:
I liked the azuki bean paste crepe. It's not too sweet, and it's healthy compared to the other sweet crepes. I tried the nutella with banana and strawberries - really good as well. 

The store also has a lot of Asian snacks, such as Pocky and all that good stuff. One thing that I didn't like about this place was that it had a bench for people to sit and that was it. I know it's supposed to be a mini mart, but come on! Have some tables.
author: Christine A.

description:
betty: Genki Crepes-Can I say this? I think I love you.  I've been searching for a boba place in SF and everything disappointed until we arrived at Genki Crepes.  Genki offers a plethora of milk teas/smoothies and they have an excellent selection of crepes! The regular milk tea is creamy and yummy but the taro milk tea didn't have any taro flavor to it. The crepes are freshly made right before your eyes.  We ordered the fresh fruit (strawberries, bananas, mango) & nutella crepe which was yummo! It was a little bit crispy so it might have just been a tad overcooked but it was still really good. We also had some of those egg waffles-red bean flavor, it's like a pringle-you can't just have one!

Genki is popular during the day and night as we've visited in the am & pm. While you are waiting for your crepes or drinks, (which can sometimes take awhile because it's a small place and there's usually only one or two people working) you can shop in the little market selling all kinds of japanese goodies and treats.
author: Betty C.

description:
Had the egg puffs and an ice cream crepe. They're yummy and I want more, but...

The egg puffs could use more flavor and the ice cream crepe can use more ice cream and less crepe.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
An after dinner dessert stop better than this? Unlikely. Although manned by non-Japanese, this mini Japanese mart is a jewel on Clement. Their dessert crepes are the best in the city (try a Nutella, vanilla ice cream, fresh strawberries, fresh banana, and whipped cream combination). Also holding Japanese drinks and ice creams, along with other foods and products, Genki Crepes is the place to go. 

The main downside is that they hold back on the amount of fruits they put into the crepe and the workers don't really know anything about any of their products. Definitely worth going, though, they have the best dessert crepes in the city.
author: Barrett I.

description:
must hav the almond, banana, nutella
crepe with some hit thai coffee AND ue LOVE ( whoever he or she may be)
author: Jenny P.

description: above average crepes here, I like their savory crepes more than their desert ones. My go to crepe here is a mushroom, tomato crepe with ham and jack cheese. On the rare occasion when I am feeling a desert crepe, I will get the nutella with bananas and marshmallows. Only thing i do not like is the lack of a seating area and the fact that the bigger girl who works there does not seem to like to smile much.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Tasty crepes!  Strawberry!  Custard!  Whipped cream!  A delightful experience!!!  The crepe was slightly crisp, almost a thin cookie.  The filling was nice and delicious.  

The shop itself is cute.  It has a lot of Japanese goods, candy for sale.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: Not only is it packed with a vertiable cornucopia of cool munchies and things to look at, but Genki Crepes also wins my love for being open past midnight on weekends. This little Japanese market has hit the spot on more late nights than I can count. Try their crepe with red bean paste and green tea ice cream. Oh god. Cheap, quick, and unbelievably good. Why are you not there right now?
author: Emma M.

description: It was busy so it must be good?  First, let me say I would go back but this was place is mediocre. I ordered the vanilla ice cream crepe + blueberry. There was no extra charge for the berry even though it was not listed as an ingredient. The 3 stars comes from the poor quality/tasting vanilla ice cream.  There is a mini mart in side with foreign candies.
author: M H.

description:
Soooo good. Who doesn't love crepes? (Crazy people, that's who.)
We came here for dessert fittingly after ramen, and it was pretty poppin' for a Wednesday night. I got the crepe with vanilla ice cream and strawberry and nutella. 
The crepe was delicious... it was a perfect balance of chewiness and crispiness in the crepe, plus a very generous amount of fillings. I like that they weren't stingy with the nutella like some places can be, so it was extra hazelnutty. (: I think it was better than the crepes I had in Harajuku earlier this year.
The only thing I thought was kinda gross was the fact that the cashier was using Elmer's glue to glue the paper cones that hold the crepes. Ugh... at least it's non-toxic.
author: Jen T.

description:
Ill make this review short.

Cheap
Taste great
Parking is a coin toss
Long lines
Fast service
Total it all down:
WORTH IT!

You can't beat the company;)
author: Michael m.

description:
Love, Love, LOVE this place!

They offer a variety of different crepes (ice cream, savory or snack) and know just how to make them right (light and crispy).

I really enjoy their ice cream crepes, especially the ones served with nutella & fruit. The cold vanilla ice cream mixed with the warmly melted nutella and tasty fruit makes for a sweet combination that cannot be resisted. Mmmmm.

It's also a great snack stop destination because the rest of the store is a mini-mart, loaded with all kinds of tasty treats. The crepes keep you coming back for more, while the mini mart will get you to stay a little longer.
author: Andrew C.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Strawberry Nutella Vanilla Ice Cream

a.) The crispy skin = tastes like fortune cookie. I think it was just a fluke that the last time I happened to get burnt skin. Sooo this is what the fuss is about, huh? Gonna have to try it for reals but then, why waste my time. Just go to Sophie's where it's guaranteed goodness. (Except Sophie's closes earlier. Grrr)

b.) Soft skin = eh... not terrible, but not the greatest. Skin tasted a little bit salty? And the nutella wasn't spread out evenly, so I'd get mouthful of nutella in a bit. Bleh.
author: Angela L.

description: prices are higher than sophie, and their crepe is too flaky
author: Long C.

description: I've been to Sophie's at the Japan Center ages ago, and remember 30 minute lines for expensive crepes.  At Genki's there was no line (Thurs night), and I paid about $4 for my banana, almond, and honey crepe.  It was perfect.  Very, very perfect.  I swear off eating banana nut pancakes...this is what I want for breakfast in the morning.  It's too bad I don't live here.  I saw their egg balls or whatever they called them.  $3 is more than I would want to pay for that, but I've had them before and they are good.  It's hard to mess that one up.
author: Lan N.

description:
Evey time I try to take a picture to post on Yelp of my crepe...it never happens. I gobble up the crepe in the time it takes me to walk a few blocks home..that's how YUMMY they are. Okay, this place is legit. They're open late, crepes are inexpensive, and they have nutella. That about sums up this place. I live very close to Genki and let me just tell you that this place is always busy. My favorite are the dessert crepes. I get the usual strawberries, nutella, and whip cream. Sometimes i mix it up and add some chocolate cake. I wish I had created this place because I would have made a fortune! If you're ever on fifth and clement and smell something to die for, it's probably Genki. 

Now get your butt over there and see what you're missing..before I eat everything!
author: Cherie A.

description:
Yum! I had the strawberry crepe with nutella, whip cream and vanilla ice cream: it was delicious. Only negative was the crepe fell apart, meaning the ice cream and whip cream started dripping from the sides, once I bit into it (after spooning the ingredients). 

The strawberries  and batter taste fresh. The crepes are made to order. Great 'TO-GO' desserts  (ice cream cone shaped)-- I'll be back next time i'm in town!!

Why only 4 stars? The service is ok, and they are a little stingy because you get charged extra for everything.
author: Harvinder K.

description:
Well I went here the other day and I was excited because the place was exceptionally busy so I figured it must be a good day.  We waded through a group of asians to get to order and wuickly decided on a crepe with mango ice cream, strawberries, and whipped cream. We also ordered peanut butter egg puffs which came out to just about $9.  We walked around the cute little store while we waited for our food and  after about 10 minutes we were walking out with a nice warm crepe and a bag full of egg puffs.  

My gf and I started eating the crepe as we walked along Clement and the first thing i noticed was that the edges were super crunchy and not in the good crispy way,  but the burned crunchy style.  I figured that it was okay since the center was my favortie part anyways, but when we got to the center the crepe was too soft.  It felt like it was undercooked. Oh well i thought i still have egg puffs.  I opened my bag and I felt as if i must have wronged the people making my food because the egg puffs were horrible. Not a single one had the egg shape and they were all burned.  The "eggs" weren't even closed and the center was hard and crispy. It was like eating a fortune cookie, a tasty peanut butter fortune cookie, but a fortune cookie.  

Maybe we just went on a bad day, but Genki you really need to teach your workers to not burn everything they touch. And to whoever i angered at Genki's I'm sorry for whatever i did just please don't make me eat anymore of your burned desserts, I promise I'll be good.
author: Domingo D.

description: I frequent this place mainly for their Japanese snacks. Their crepes are good, but I'm not a big fan of their selection of the ice cream flavors they have or more the texture of it. But I do like the banana/strawberry vanilla ice cream crepe. It's defintiely good with NUTELLA. Their choices for a breakfast or lunch or dessert crepe are good. Lots to choose from. I like that they accept debit/credit cards...just a $10 minimum is needed. They have lots of Japanese candy, snacks, drinks, makeup, and toys to browse. Benches inside and maybe one or two small tables outside. But, it's San Francisco. It's can be too chilly to want to eat your ice cream crepe outside.
author: Shall P.

description: Very interesting store. They sell drinks, snacks, japanese things and on the side, they make milk tea, crepes and eggettes. Their eggettes are pretty good because they have variety flavors you can choose from. Regular milk tea is something I've never had before. It's very strong and dark and good. I have to try their crepes on of these days but i'm always carried away with their blueberry eggettes.
author: Ella A.

description: They're okay, not that great. I got a banana, custard and caramel crepe. If i wanted a savory crepe, i would've gotten one! The batter tasted like it had salt in it.. i swear. It just made my crepe all eww to me. Salt & sweet works sometimes, but not for the batter of the crepe. just gross. I'd rather go to crepe temptations.
author: Bernice F.

description:
I LOVE crepes!! Pretty average price I guess at around $5.. although my favorite places are cheaper. But this place gets 4 stars for the sheer deliciousness and being open when everything else in the area was closed.

My recommendation: grab a crepe and then hit up one of the many surrounding cafes for a good ole cup of joe on a chilly evening.
author: Brad Y.

description:
Crepes with green tea ice cream and lychee! my favorite! I would eat their dessert crepes any day. 
Other than that, Genki crepes provides a variety of snacks from asia starting from pocky to hi-chews. They have a lot of pocky choices that aren't provided in supermarkets. 
The service in Genki is great and people are always so friendly. Always bring cash because they have a minimum charge of $10. They don't really have a place for people to hang out and sit, but their crepes are totally worth it. Reasonable prices, great crepes!
author: Tessa A.

description:
delicious savory and sweet crepes!
just went there today and got 1. savory crepe with mushrooms, spinach and cheddar cheese and 2. sweet crepe with strawberry, nutella and whip cream! yum.
author: Karina A.

description: This is the way crepes should taste. Crispy with a flaky crust and very edible. You can fold it and hold it, then walk and eat. Great for SF. It is somewhat overpriced and tacky (the place doubles as a mini mart). I would go again though.
author: Ricky N.

description: good crepes, cute little market with a nice variety of asian snacks. they offer both sweet and savory crepes. since this place is a market, the seating is limited to benches outside the market and in the doorway. the reason I'm giving genki 3 stars is because the service is just decent. the times I've been here no one was ever friendly, the last time, the girl at the cash register didnt even look up at me once and seemed way overwhelmed by the lack or order in their system. but I paid, got my crepe and ate it with a smile on my face because no one can be that grumpy with strawberries, nutella and vanilla ice cream, except maybe the girl at the cash register....
author: Serena L.

description: I absolutely love this place.  I don't understand how any person would want to go to Quickly's right across the street.  This place is not only amazing, has a great selection, but even the people working here exponentially are better.  I can get some snacks for later like Japanese crackers and fruity gummies while I eat my delicious dessert crepe with cheesecake.. Yummy!!  Plus getting a wonderful boba or fruit smoothie.  They literally have everything here that I could want for dessert.  Not too sweet, but definitely good enough to hold me off for several weeks.  I brought friends from Texas here and they all loved this place.  Plus get the egg puffs here too;  they're so delicious and I think you'd enjoy it very much!  Plus the ambiance seems to have less annoying children that go here for some reason.  LOL.
author: John H.

description: The crepes were alright. The best part was the fact that it was open late and the store had ALL the asian snacks that you'll remember from your childhood.
author: Charlene R.

description: I love coming here for a night snack! The store itself is filled with various kind of snacks and candies which I don't see often and their crepes are really good here. I love the crepes here topped with ice cream and fruits, but i love the savory crepes even more. For around $5 each, I find it very cheap for a snack that will satisfy you without getting you really fat.
author: Philip T.

description:
My favorite place for dessert crepes! There are always lines and crowds at Genki at any time of the day.  They are known for their dessert crepes, but you can also get savory crepes, smoothies, and oriental/imported knick-knack snacks here, too. 

My all time favorite dessert crepe is the red bean paste with lychee ice cream. It sounds disgusting, but you have to try it! It's definitely not the usual strawberry, nutella, and vanilla ice cream combo but it's worth the stretch. Just writing about it makes me want to go get one!
