There is very limited seating (literally two benches) so i suggest you grab your crepe and go. Don't be intimated by the long lines late at night - they move pretty quick. Genki is always worth the wait!
author: Linda T.

description: Crepe was on point. But it was too crunchy for my tastes. The crepe itself kept falling apart due to the fact that it was too crunchy.
author: Vince P.

description:
Oh goodness gracious. Genki is soooo good.

Parkings a beez, but it's worth it. 

It's not like your average crepe, which is light and fluffy. Genki crepes are chewy & crispy on the edges. It's a little different, but trust me, if you can accept change you'll LOVE these suckers.

Anyways, my friend & I always get the number 8. Chocolate cake & 'nilla ice cream. You should too (;
author: Krissel A.

description:
What's really great about this place is that their crepes are always crispy. I've had crepes at other places and they all end up coming out soggy. I've only tried one variation, but everyone else seems to love the other flavors there. I also tried their eggettes, but those aren't as good. I'll stick to Eggettes in San Bruno for that treat and strictly go to Genki for the crepes. 

The Best: vanilla ice cream, nutella and strawberries.
author: Jane H.

description:
This is the best crepe I've had in the city. 

And I've had 3 crepes in the city. 

But really, It's amazing. Weird little general store that was packed at 10pm. Really speedy crepe making. And choices, choices, choices. 

The reason this crepe blows all other crepes out of the kitchen,  is that it lands itself somewhere between crepe and full-blown pancake. It's not too thin or too thick,  and it won't fall apart in your hand. If you've never had a crepe fall apart in your hand, imagine watching your life's work splatter all over the pavement and your shoes. Then imagine stepping on your dreams. Then imagine realizing that your dreams left a trail of nutella down your last clean shirt. If this sounds frightening to you, steer clear of imitators, and choose Genki for all your crepe needs.
author: Chanti B.

description: Crepe filled with Strawberries, NUTELLA and Honeydew Ice Cream = LOVE and a super happy tummy ^___^
author: Jonathan W.

description:
This place is wayyy too hyped up....well, at least judging from the cinnamon apple/brown sugar crepe I had today. My friend didn't like his crepe either, and it had ice cream! I don't know, I enjoy the crepes at Sophie's more...there the crunchiness/softness ratio is just right there, and they seem to have more selection. 

To be fair, the egg puffs at Genki are pretty good, so if I'm in the area I'd drop by for that. But the crepes are a bit overrated. Just my two cents though =X
author: Chrys U.

description:
I never liked crepes.  I never got WHY people liked crepes.  I always thought the idea of a crepe is useless considering the shell is always flappy, too soft and it just doesn't really go well with the deliciousness wrapped up inside.

Genki changed me.  It was like god himself striking down my hate for crepes by showing me what a real crepe should taste like.

I had #6, mango ice cream and strawberry with whipped cream.  No doubt the mango ice cream was perfectly tasty and a hint of sour from the strawberry made the filling well balanced and delectable, but OMG, the crunchy crepe on the outside was the best part.

It was like eating a really fresh ice cream cone that wasn't TOO hard and the sweetness of the crepe was perfect and well paired with the filling.  

I can't think of a words that are worthy of describing just how damn good that crepe was.  So I guess you'll just have to go try it.  Trust me, and all the other yelpers, This place is not over rated nor hyped up.
author: Zu W.

description:
After eating at Burma SuperStar right across the street, I end up at Genki for a nutella crepe. YUM. The crepes are not too soft and have a bit of a crunch to them, just how I like them.

I also love browsing their aisles as I wait. They have neat little air fresheners, Japanese cosmetics, stuff animals and figurines to look at. I find myself purchasing some candy and other snacks while I'm there.
author: Caroline V.

description:
Dy-na-mite! Sweet Crepes? Open late? Assorted kitsch and yummy asian candies, gummy and otherwise. That's enough for me!

Try and walk by Genki down Clement St. and see if the vanilla-y, warm smell of crepes cooking on the circular hot plate doesn't lure you in....
author: Dee I.

description:
how come no one told me about this place? i was expecting a normal pancake-like crepe but this is so much more.  it's a crepe/ice cream lovers dream come true.  don't be discouraged by the long lines, i always get my order quick! 

nutella + vanilla crepe = heaven
author: Ray R.

description:
My partner and I love making/eating crepes so he took me to try this place.

The gal behind the counter didn't smile, ever, or greet us. She never really said anything. Awkward. We placed our order and walked around the shop, checking things out. It's definitely an eclectic little spot.

We tried one savory soft crepe that was delicious. We also tried a crispy sweet nutella peach crepe. The sweet crepe itself does taste like a fortune cookie, or similar to an ice cream sugar cone.

Very tasty, worth going back to despite weird awkward customer service. 

Nom.
author: Sophia v.

description: I love this place! So many different crepes to choose from. They have ice-cream crepes, savory crepes and sweet crepes. Now it's not only a crepe place but they also sell snacks, toys, and toiletries. So it's kinda of like a convenience store with DELICIOUS CREPES!
author: Majileen C.

description:
I don't think there is any better crepe place. 

I absolutely LOVE this place. Especially since they have the ice cream crepes which are the best. My favorite is the vanilla ice cream with nutella and whipped cream. The crepes are pretty big but it's a good size. 

I also like to eat the egg puffs here too. They make everything fresh so it comes out warm. But even if you save it for later, you can pop it into the oven and toast it, and it'll be just as good. 

I've tried another crepe place but that store did not have any ice cream to put in the crepes so I just got a fruit crepe with whipped cream. But it was not nearly as good as these crepes. 

The store has candy and drinks and many toys you can shop for. I always like coming in and looking at the one dollar machines that you can get toys and cell phone decorations at the front of the store. 

I came here one time around Valentine's Day and they put pink whipped cream on the crepes. I thought that was pretty cool and a happy surprise. 

This place is good to come to at anytime day or night.
author: Jenny L.

description:
my new go-to crepe place in the city!! i've always gone to sophie's (mainly out of convenience), and never had the chance to go to genki until last week. 

we went after ayce kbbq. and i managed to find room in my stomach to share a green tea ice cream + nutella crepe. i wish i had my own!!! i can't wait to go back and have it again...but next time i'm not sharing.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
I love love love their dessert crepes! I only go here to get the dessert crepe and nothing else. I love the cripsy crepe and as you eat more and more it gets softer and softer until it practically melts in your mouth. So fresh, so good. 

I'm craving one right now.
author: Jean T.

description:
Icecream.nutella.bananas.strawberries.mangoes! ahhhhhh i love crepes! Genki crepes know just how to make them perfectly and i've never been disappointed by their service. I love the variety of crepes they offer and their prices are incredibly reasonable. 

I love their ice cream with fruit and nutella crepes if you didn't catch it!
author: Connie C.

description:
I am always down for a crepe from Genkis! You can get fast and delicious savory and sweet dessert crepes here and while you wait, you can also browse and shop for more delicious Asian treats in their grocery aisles!

My fave savory crepe has got to be the turkey and spinach with jack cheese and to satisfy my sweet tooth it's got to be the ice cream crepe with vanilla ice cream, nutella, and mixed fruits (bananas, strawberries, and pineapples) topped with fresh whip cream made in house! I also request that they add almonds as well. Just typing this up is making me want one and I just had one over the weekend.

Parking sucks here but I always somehow end up finding a spot--near or far, I don't mind the trek for that crepe!

Warning for those that have never eaten a crepe by hand--it can and will get messy! The savory crepe tends to leak their juices at the bottom of the paper holder so I tend to fold the point up and wrap it with a napkin. And as for the ice cream crepes, I suggest you grab more than a few pieces of napkins and attack the filling first with a spoon. Once you've gotten deep enough, it'd be safe to finally take a few bites of that crunchy crepe smothered in Nutella! This is wisdom I've acquired after years of practice at Genkis.

I've been so consumed by my obsession of crepes that I'm ashamed to say that I've totally neglected the rest of the snacks they also offer which include egg puffs and tapioca milk tea and then some. Something that a large group of people ordered simultaneously the last time I was there was hot milk tea which sounded really good since it was a really cold day. So I've decided to try something new next time I visit which won't be far from now.

Another tip, if you really need to use the restroom, the staff there would be nice enough to let you use their private one. not many grocery or corner stores would be that nice! It's actually pretty clean too so if they do let you use it, please don't make a mess in there and ruin it for the rest of us.
author: Ivy Z.

description: Disgusting crepes I ever had!! Totally overrated! I ordered strawberry + chocolate crepe! Yuck...I don't understand why the crepe taste salty??? If you craving for crepe go to Belly good cafe & crepes in JTown, those r real CREPERIES
author: Momo K.

description: I was looking for a crepe place for me and my boyfriend can get some dessert and this place was our pick. This is one of the best crepes I've had. The crepe was so crispy kinda like a fortune cookie. I wanna go back here again when I'm craving for crepes.
author: Janice V.

description:
Probably the thing I'll miss most about going to USF.

Anytime I bring someone visiting the city here, they're amazed. They have the BEST crepes in the city. and very reasonably priced! 

I'll probably end up stopping by their tonight...

My favorites:
Avocado, Tomatoe, and Cheese Crepe
Sugar and Butter Crepe
Strawberry and Whipped Cream Crepe
author: Pahneez H.

description:
Man, every time I have a crepe from here I keep thinking about the time I read that someone said Mocha 101 had better crepe than this place.

ARE YOU EFFING KIDDING ME!?!?!?@!

I like the tuna salad, I like the hawaiian, I like that spicy sausage with onions or something. All these things wrapped up in a crepe. Something about their crepe, somewhat addicting. Man o man....and whats so much more fun is that this place has lots of snacks and drinks.

So if you are about to head on out of the city on a road trip, stock up on snacks and buy a crepe...
author: phillip w.

description: So the location of this place is inside a mini japanese mart.  I can see how it can easily get crazy on a busy night!  There's a bunch of people hanging outside because theres no seating so at first I couldn't tell where the line was.  The crepes took about 15 min to make and thats probably bc they were busy.  It comes out looking like a cone with ice cream and whatever fruit you choose.  The outside of the crepe is crispy and I think the strawberries are fresh.  I thought it was decent.  I would recommend and I would come back.
author: Trini T.

description:
Eh. Maybe it's because I'm not a fan of crispy/crunchy crepes, or because I am completely in love with the texture of the crepes and the Double Rainbow ice cream they use at Belly Good (by far, the BEST and my favorite crepes ever), but I was not at all impressed by the green tea ice cream crepe I had at Genki's.

However, I'll give it 3 stars just because the rest of the place was awesome - tons of Asian snacks and beverages. I'll come back sometime to try the strawberry/nutella/vanilla ice cream combo, but as long Belly Good exists, I don't think this place will ever get another star from me.

Edit: Tried the strawberry/nutella/vanilla ice cream combo. Again, was not impressed.
author: Cecilia L.

description:
So I believe I over-hyped this for myself. I've heard stories about the Genki Living down in SoCal and everyone raves about it. I love sweets and I love crepes, so I was pretty excited about getting Genki since I tend to really love Japanese interpretations on foods (check out Mochilato in Irvine I think... Halo Halo and Shaved Ice are dunzo)

Overall, I thought this place was OK. The service was insanely fast, which was impressive considering the line was long but the turnover was quick. 

The Lychee Custard was OK. The custard provided an extra creamy contrast to the ice cream... though I think I would rather get Lychee Ice cream from Polly Ans or Mitchells. They don't give you much. 

The Vanilla Ice Cream w/ Nutella was good. Lots of Nutella, but not too much ice cream. Again, BiRite, Humphry Slocom, or Mitchells would have been a better option.

The Cheesecake was meh. If you want a cheese cake, get a cheese cake... it costs the same per slice. The novelty of this wore of quickly. It was nice because it was portable, but its not like I'm going to eat cheesecake on the run.

I think what failed me was the crepe batter. It was thinner than I am used to and was too salty for a dessert crepe (and I like salted caramel and bacon chocolate). I liked how it was crispy on the edges, but it was overcooked throughout. It was almost like eating a slightly soft but salty fortune cookie. I prefer my crepes to be crisp on the edges and a bit softer and thicker throughout, but to each their own.

I don't think I will get a dessert crepe from here, but I will definitely consider getting a savory crepe next time I'm in the area.
author: Marc T.

description:
Wow so many good reviews!

Crepes are crispy which I like. They are a bit skimpy on the fruits though. They were out of Strawberries tonight so MIXED FRUIT constitutes:

BLUEBERRY, MANGO, and some other fruit that I already forget.  $5.20.

BENCH SEATING. NO TABLES.

SUPER POPULAR AMONGST the TEEN CROWDS and right across from Burma Superstar.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Sukiyaki Crepe

"What kind of cheese you want on it?"

What the eff, man...

Gross.
author: Keane L.

description: This place is a little conflicted. They have crepes and eggettes in the front and in the back is a tiny little Asian 7/11 with snacks, drinks and toys. I go there not to shop but to eat some crepes. The dessert crepes are good but can be a little dry and crunchy if you get them by themselves. So what you need to do is get the ice cream with it to counter balance the dry crepe with some creamy goodness. Eggettes were a little crunchy and hard here as well, maybe it has something to do with the batter they use or how long they cook the food but regardless its not good that way. Haven't had a savory crepe from here but maybe if I go back I'll try it and see if its better but I've definitely had better.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Double nutella and a scoop of chocolate ice cream. Do it. Make sure to get ice cream because these are crispy crepes you can really only appreciate if you use it as a deluxe ice cream cone.

At the front of a quik mart. You can shop for various Asian snacks while you wait for your crepe, win.
author: Lynn B.

description: I love a good crepe.  A portable crepe?  Even better.  A crepe available on the late night?  WHOA!  So many crepe options to choose from, too!!!
author: Nora S.

description:
They're not as good as they used to be when I first started eating there about 6 years ago...but it's still DAMN GOOD!!  I rarely get their snack crepes with the nutella and such, but their Savory Crepes are the best.  The crepe is cooked to perfection...crisp, soft, tasty...all that.  The ingredients are always fresh.  Every savory crepe I've ever gotten was so good that the thought of getting another always crosses my mind.

My favorite savory crepes are the Mushroom/Spinach/Cheese or the Tomato/Avocado/Cheese crepes.  The cheeses are always gooey and the flavors are always fresh.  

No other crepe place can compare to this spot...at least for the savory crepes.
author: Raymond L.

description:
I am officially a crepe snob. For some reason I can only eat crepes from here. This place can get busy during late hours (9-11pm) but its worth the wait.

The 'crepe station' is situated in the front of an Asian mini-market. You can get either a sweet or savory crepe. Me and wifey usually go here for dessert after eating dinner in the city.

After a little experimenting I found my favorite combination which provides texture and taste: Nutella, Strawberries, Marshmallows and chopped almonds. 

I heard that their egg puffs are outstanding and will be a must-try when I go there again.
author: Sunny D.

description: I love this mini-mart! Aside from having crepes until late into the night, they have a wide assortment of Asian goods, which is awesome! I find so many odds and ends here that I can't find elsewhere, which makes it really fun to shop there.
author: Kelly D.

description: Super crispy crepes. Lots of options in their menu. Cute little store inside too. The service was meh, kind of unperceptive, borderline rude, but with the amount of fans that this place has I'm certain that my small service complaint won't even make a dent in this place's near-perfect reputation. And to be honest I don't want to make a dent--this place is overall pretty great. I'd like to come back someday when I'm actually hungry and maybe try something different on their large menu.
author: Idk A.

description:
This is my go-to place for crepes for as long as I can remember.  I have driven 15 miles from Oakland a number of times before in the past.  Now that I have love-handles and a conscience for the environment, I will refrain from driving to Genki if I am far away.

This is my favorite place because the skin is sweet and crispy, the ice cream is good, fruit is good, and the evil whip cream is awesome.  If there were no consequences to eating Genki's crepes, I would be eating 5x more.

This store is also fun to browse.  I could be looking at hard to find asian snacks, turn around and look at hard to find asian shampoo...walk down the aisle and put on a Super Mario hat, then turn around the corner and grab a fizzy drink.  It's perfect for someone with ADD.
author: Larry L.

description:
Now they know how to do crepes! One of the things I miss about living on sf were all the food joints. This definitely was the spot to go for late night snacks. Don't know if it was just me but I always make a Mess while eating here! The nutella vanilla ice cream and strawberry crepes are for the win by far. Drooooool.

Time to revisit!
author: Deanna G.

description: Craving for some good crape at night? Nom nom nom Genki crepe is the place to go. I'm not a fan of crapes but this place makes good crepes and the best thing about this place is that they open late night! I believe they open til midnight on the weekends and 11 on the weekdays. If your in the city and roaming to find some snacks and drinks, they have a small market inside for you to shop as well. I usually get the banana, strawberry with vanilla ice cream and spread of nutella. My friends usually get that with brownie on top. It is really good if you like brownies with your crapes.
author: Sora K.

description: Love genki crepes, as the crepes are delicious but the authentic Japanese items are overly priced and the service leaves more to be desired. Thank goodness the crepes (which remind me of a waffle cone) are amazing!!
author: Sandy C.

description:
Red Bean egg puffs!! Not worth the wait though.
Oh their crepes are the hype.

Supppperrrr lonnggg waiit.

This store has everything I look for in an asian supermarket. 
Popsicles, Icecream, vitasoy milk, japanese drinks, japanese pan..
author: Alyssa Z.

description:
ever since my best friend took me to this spot.. it's a "must-stop-at" place whenever i'm up in SF! 
My sis and i have tried to find an equivalent in SoCal, and have yet to do so! ... any SoCal peeps have suggestions??
author: Angel D.

description:
If you like your crepes sweet, crispy, filled with fresh fruit. cake, ice cream, or all of the above, then you're in the right place. 

Genki has mastered the ice-cream-in-a-crepe crepe.  The ice cream doesn't melt too fast from the heat of the crepe. The crepe doesn't get chewy from the cold of the ice cream.  Maybe they use the fruit or the other toppings as a buffer. I haven't figured out the mechanics of this magical crepe yet, because I've been too busy scarfing it down.

There's savory crepes for you salt fiends and egg puffs for those of you who like your treats bite sized.

Arrive hungry. This crepe is a meal in itself.
author: Melissa H.

description:
This place is super hyped up. 
The crepes are good, but not super special. Their mango ice cream tastes off - they skimp on strawberries in their ice cream crepes that are supposed to feature strawberries. 
Average prices, average service. 
Really crowded in the evenings, can barely walk anywhere. 
No where to sit to eat crepes aside from a couple of park benches placed.. in the store.
author: Angel D.

description:
ATMOSPHERE
It was in dingy neighborhood, but it was definitely a haven of cute Asian snacks and tasty crepes. The venue was small but it was crammed with aisles of Asian snacks and treats. There was a small row of chairs lined up against the wall (right next to door), so there was virtually no room to enjoy your crepe in the store.

FOOD
My date and I ordered 2 crepes:
1) Strawberry and nutella
2) Strawberry and whipped cream

Pros: the crepes are huge, which is great because it was stuffed with a lot of strawberries and nutella/whipped cream. 

Cons: the strawberries weren't as fresh as I'd hoped and the crepe itself wasn't as crispy as it should've been.

Overall, the crepes here weren't the best, but it gets points for being the closest thing to my hometown Japanese crepe joint.
author: Krystie M.

description: This is our favorite place for crepes and a must go place on every visit to SFO. Last time we tried Belly Good Cafe & Crepes in Japan town after my daughter insisted, but were not impressed. Genki is the way to go.
author: Tajinder S.

description:
I've heard lots of good things about Genki Crepes, but I have to say I'm not impressed. I'll admit their dessert crepe is tolerable but definitely nothing special.

CONS
Overall, I have more cons about this place than pros. For one thing, it's so hard to find parking on Clement St. (even at night). Second, the line for Genki Crepes is extremely long. Third, even though the line moves at a decent pace, there's only one bench inside to sit on (seats about 3-4 people) and has no other tables or chairs to use to eat. Not only is there no sitting space, there's hardly any standing space as well. Everything in this place is so closely packed together that waiting customers have to stand outside in the cold. When the line gets long, people start waiting in the aisle space, making it all the more difficult to walk through the already narrow aisles. Fourth, in terms of the crepe itself, it's very tough and difficult to eat--I was literally gnawing on mine like a beaver chewing wood. 

PROS
Even though the crepe itself doesn't taste good, at least the ice cream and toppings are good. My crepe was very simple and only had vanilla ice cream and bananas inside (can't go wrong with a classic, right?). The ice cream tasted fresh and so did the bananas. Another good thing about this place is that even though customers have to wait quite awhile for their crepes, at least there's aisles full of little goodies and trinkets to look at during that time (items that look like they belong in a $0.99 store but are items that people actually use or eat). I found some Ramune drinks in the food/drinks aisle, some velcro patches for hair (used for bangs) that I actually currently own, some bathroom towels/shower caps/soap/etc., some deep conditioners and shampoos from Asia (a couple of which I own as well), and a myriad of other things. These items are priced about the same as any other place that would sell them, so there's no dire need to buy any the non-food items there.

SUMMARY:
If you can, go somewhere else to get your crepe (like Sophie's Crepes in Japantown!). I still have yet to try a savory crepe from here, but I have no inclination to ever come back here.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
The first time I tasted a crepe here, I turned into a giddy 5-year old and almost started skipping down the street. I had the banana caramel custard crepe and haven't had anything else since. The crispiness of the crepe paired with the smooth texture of the 3 fillings was amazing, and the light sweetness of the custard coupled with the creamy caramel was fabulously decadent. I was nervous that they would put too much custard in (which makes me feel fat for eating it) but it was perfect. 

The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is because there's not really any place to sit besides a couple of benches that are often crowded by people standing and waiting for their crepes, and one time they forgot the caramel. Either way, I'm glad that this place is across the bay, otherwise I'd gain 50 lbs from going there every day!
author: Laura J.

description:
Best place for assorted Kit Kats! 

I like thier crepes cause they use polly ann's ice cream. 

This place does get crowded and it becomes a pain to try to walk into the back area from the front.
author: Derek N.

description: I used to come here a lot because I lived near by. Now, I go here once in awhile. The items I have tried are their dessert crepes and honey dew shake. The shake was ok, but not the best. However, their ice cream dessert crepes are good. I usually get the number 1(vanilla ice cream and nutella) and add strawberries. The skin is crunchy on top but soft on the bottom. It's about $6 per crepe (extra if you add things). There are also lots of Asian vending machines to get goodies in a plastic capped ball. They are $1.00 each item and only takes coins. You can make change with the cashier. This is a cool joint to hang out with friends. They do get busy but the line goes fast. There is only street parking and it is limited.
author: Anh W.

description: the extra crispy crepes are definitely better.  Bananas and crepe go great together.  good green tea ice cream (though still a bit too sweet for my tastes).
author: Di Yin L.

description:
My favorite dessert stop in San Francisco. I use to frequent this place when visitors came into town or when I had a sugar craving. Their crepes are so deliciously crispy. 

Today, I was reunited with my favorite cheesecake crepe. Give their mixed fruit and nutella crepe a try. It's another favorite of mine. 

After spotting a great brunch spot in the area, I have a feeling I will be dropping in again soon!
author: crystal e.

description:
Had to see what the hype was about after seeing lots of pictures of their crepes from friends on Facebook. Darn you Facebook and your mobile uploads! 

Parking was a b*tch to find, so beware. Ofcourse, after we find a parking space, all these other parking spaces that are close by or in fact, in front of the darn store, open up. What's up with that? 

You can tell this is quite a popular place to go to amongst the other Crepe places that are around. No line, just people hanging around the store eating their crepes. It's also a little Asian market too, so that could also be the other reason.

I opted to order a crepe with Nutella, Strawberries, and Whipped cream. The husband orders the one with vanilla ice cream and strawberries and whipped cream. 

It took about 15 minutes for our order be ready. Not a long wait as we were quite entertained with the people watching and their ways of dressing. I gotta say that Asians be dressing like they don't give a rat's ass! HAH. 

Anyways, we get out crepes and I gotta say that I had no idea how to eat this darn thing. Crepes to go-genius, but man I was scared that once I took a bite of it, all hell would break loose. I can see why the little girl sitting next to us was whining to her dad on how to eat hers. 

The crepes were scrumptious in appearance. They tasted good. Heck, anything with Nutella tastes good though right? I just wished that the crepe was a little bit softer so that it would crumble onto your clothes when you take a bite.
author: stacy k.

description:
Red Bean Crepe! Nomss. 

Want to try everything on the menu.
author: Melissa T.

description: Fantastic crepes and they have a HUGE selection of Asian products too! I stocked up on my favorite Japanese candy when I was waiting for my crepe!
author: Jessyca M.

description:
I have no reason to write a review for Genki Crepes when I'm supposed to be on the wedding diet. 

Do I really need to remind myself of the crispy yet chewy, soft and buttery crepe? Do I have to recall how I took a bit of my whip cream and nutella infused crepe filled with strawberries, bananas and vanilla ice cream? Gosh darn it Genki Crepes, I can't quit you.
author: Nancie T.

description: The crepes here are AWESOME! I love the nutella, banana crepe. It is delicious! The crepe skin is crispy and not soggy like other places I've tried. Although, it's kind of cramped and small in there. Also, the service is not satisfactory.
author: Melanie W.

description:
Not bad at all. My guy got an apple crepe with vanilla ice cream and he devoured the whole thing after I took a few bites to taste. The apples were sweet and crispy and the ice cream was smooth and creamy. The crepe itself was very thin and crispy as well but very well complimentary to the rest of the ingredients.... 

Yeah, that was probably the most boring review of mine up to date. Forget the part where I passed by this place so many times after dining at Q, or after dining at Pho Clement, or after dining at King of Thai. The sweet, sweet smells, I believed could never taste as good as what wafted up my nostrils, so it took me a while to get there. But it wasn't a disappointment for sure, but it also wasn't a home run. We'll go back and try again for a better assessment. Now time to go back to scratching my bug bites... T.M.I.?
author: Susan C.

description:
I always want to get a crepe with Chocolate ice cream, Nutella, and Cheesecake. Sometimes I give in, but its just too intense. 

There's always a crowd on weekend nights. There's no space to sit except for a couple benches and sometimes 2 tables outside in a really cramped area. 

Also, theres so many asian candies! Few of them are in english, so its always a gamble when picking candy, but they're all pretty amazing!
author: Jane N.

description:
Everything Japanese + delicious and cheap crepes.

Hello Panda, Hi-Chews, seaweed crackers, Pocky Stix for men?, you name it.
author: Enji L.

description:
Got a sweet tooth? Yes? Well if you are in San Francisco's Inner Richmond District definitely wander into Genki Crepes. We've been snacking here since it opened and the sweet crepes are good. We enjoy ordering a mix of fruity (lychee, stawberry, kiwi, bananna, tutella, ice cream) crepes. Genki Crepes are particularly enjoyable on a sunny day wandering Clement, Golden Gate Park, and the Lake Street areas. 

ADVANTAGES:
+ Quick turn around time. Less than ten minute wait (good) and you can peruse the marked up Asian goodies available if it tickles your fancy.
+/- Portions are decent but not great. This is not a meal and only a snack/ desert, so the smaller portions is acceptable. 
+ Crepes are crispy and lightly golden brown. Depending on how much you customize your crepe (e.g. filled w/fruit or ice cream) it can get really soggy fast, so plan to eat quickly too.

DISADVANTAGES:
- Prices need to be more competitive especially since for the same price down the street, you can get a meal. If you are on a limited budget reconsider visiting often because this is definitely a luxury.
- Does not accept credit cards for purchases under $11. This practice is actually illegal.
- Crowds happen on weekends especially at night. Plan visits accordingly.
- Extremely limited seating. For people who need to sit while eating, there is only a bench inside and sometimes a table w/chairs outside.

Final 10 cents: Genki Crepes is a nice to have "treat". Very tasty and a nice desert or mid-day snack to cheer you up. Portions are decent, but watch your wallet; the costs keep creeping up w/all the "extras" especially if you have a major sweet tooth. This is a nice place to stop by for sweets with your sweet. Cheers!
author: Teddy ..

description:
In terms of taste, its hard to beat Genki. They serve some of the best crepes around, and if one happens to be in the area with a mild hungry than this place should be their first choice. 

In terms of the negative, it does get slightly docked for service. The register person always seems fairly grumpy, although given how busy they place is at all hours this might be a little understandable. The grocery store-style place also isn't the best as well.

The positives far outweigh the negatives though, as the prices here are super cheap while the crepes are mouth watering. They are fairly big as well, and really make the ideal after dinner dessert option. 

Overall, the fantastic food here will probably lure us back again before you know it. Highly recommended.
author: Sami R.

description:
You know those places that EVERYONE talks about and you have to force yourself to go out of your way and just try?  Genki is one of those places for me.

I'd heard all about eggettes (or egg puffs, whatever) and crepes, so finally I headed in there and ordered regular egg puffs and a strawberry/banana/nutella/whipped cream crepe.

Can we say amazing? I meant the crepe, not the egg puffs.  The egg puffs are literally like an inverted waffle (I know I'm Asian and all, but it was seriously the first time I'd ever heard of "egg puffs" and I was like, wtf?).  Since I'm not a fan of waffles to begin with, I found those rather mediocre.

I love the crepes and drinks though.  It's like a major upgrade from Lollicup (which, by the way, sucks).  Too bad parking here sucks, and there's always a troupe of Asian high schoolers trolling around.
author: Tori S.

description:
Mmm I've just recently tried Japanese crepes and was very impressed, so when my friend suggested that we try Genki crepes after running a healthy (but tiring) 6 miles, what better way to celebrate?

I had the Lychee ice cream with custard topping while my friends had the cheesecake with blueberry sauce.  I loved mine!  It was like eating an ice cream cone of tasty lychee ice cream but better because cones don't usually come with a topping and whipped cream, and the cones are never the same flaky sweetness as a crepe.  

I'd like to try the fruitier crepes next...yum!
author: Alison S.

description: One of my favorite places to grab a crepe, but it's a little pricier than other places I've been to. But since it's in Clement, I just gotta get something there. In addition to the cute little mart they have (with their GREEN TEA KIT KAT BARS), I usually come here for their crepes. My usual's are nutella & banana: a classic that you can never get wrong, cheesecake & strawberry ice cream; sometimes I forget they stick a whole slice of cheesecake into the crepe alone, which is WAY too much; each time half way through, I start to get a little sick and tired of the cheese cake, and strawberry & strawberry ice cream; I love this one because it's just a classic in my book. Some other ones I've tried was the strawberry & nutella and one of their savory crepes Turkey+ Avocado + Jack Cheese + Sour Cream...something I'm not familiar with (never really had many savory crepes). I used to come here quite a lot several years back but I think it was a bit pricey after a while ($4-$6 per crepe) so we just didn't frequent the place as much. But whenever there's an opportunity, we shall come!
author: Judy C.

description:
Arguably one of the best crepe places I've been to. It's situated on Clement, which is a hub for delicious food. And what better place could it be located at? It's a hungry college student's paradise.

If I didn't give up sweets for a bit, I would be here almost every week. The first time I went here I ordered a crepe with nutella, strawberries, vanilla ice cream, and topped off with whipped cream. SO GOOD! They have an array of choices on the menu and you can customize it any way you want. Cheesecake? Check. Mangoes? Check. Lychee? Sure thing! There's usually a line but you get your order in a good amount of time. Plus, you can chat with other patrons waiting for their crepes or wander around the aisles of Asian goodies around the place. The only downside is that their drinks aren't that great. But who goes to Genki crepes for the drinks anyway? If you want a good drink to go with it, go to Quickly's across the street.

After writing this, I'm actually craving some Genki crepes right now.
author: Leslie K.

description:
YAY! Go! 

I got the red bean with banana crepe. YUM!

Also had the chocolate ice cream with cheesecake crepe. Share this one with someone. 

Unique flavors and common ones. So don't be afraid to try them all!
author: Joyce L.

description:
3.5 stars. It was OK :P
A bit cheap on the fruits =(

Ordered a Mix Fruit with Whip Cream and added a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Tasty but nothing super. Kind of hard to eat because the strawberry and bananas were in huge chunks. I wish they were sliced into smaller pieces so they could be spread out more within the crepe and not only in 2 places (the very top and very bottom). So it seemed as though they didn't put any fruit in it. Felt like I was just eating ice cream with whip cream -__- for a long time and at the end the fruit came back. 2 half strawberries, 2 slices of banana, and a couple chunks of peach was not enough fruit =(

It was $3 something about $4 for the mix fruit with whip cream and about $1 extra for the scoop of ice cream. I don't know it still isn't that expensive yeah, but i really wish they had more fruit or like i said, sliced it more and spread it out. Also, to pay by card you have to have a minimum of about $6? I think it was, so I had to go find something extra to make it $6.
author: Sachiko K.

description:
love!
the portions are huge and price is good (:
on our trip to sf, we got crepes here 2days in a row (fatty life).

i got the crepe with vanilla ice cream, nutella, strawberries and bananas and it was FANTASTICO! also, the egg bread thing? (it's like little circle bread things) are really good too!! 

definitely worth a visit if you're in the area (:
author: Clara C.

description: Not a fan of crunchy crepes, prefer soft crepes. Thankful to find a place better than Quickly in the Richmond district
author: Jan S.

description:
This place is great for a quick dessert snack! My first critique when arriving here was the actual crepe wrapping itself. I was looking for two important characteristics of a great crepe; Texture and Taste! 

I ordered the Banana Strawberry with Nutella and WOW! it had everything i was looking for in a great crepe. 

This place is fun! Its your typical japanese mart. A lot of random items. Seating is limited to a pair of benches (two inside and two outside)  but who cares! its all about the FOOD!
author: Oliver D.

description:
Delicious crepes!  Crunchy outside...soft gooy inside!  They also have egg puffs which I must try next time!

This place is like a mini japanese supermarket with little snacks and stuff.  So cute!
author: Eegnam A.

description:
The dessert crepes are WARM and COMFORTING. Mmm, mmm, mmm, I haven't tried a single crepe that I didn't like. 

Genki offers a variety of dessert to savory crepes from opening to late night. Its good to know that there's a late night place still opened for a midnight snack when everywhere else is closed. 

Genki crepes is not only a dessert spot but it's also a small grocery store in the back! There's no fresh produce or meats, but there is plenty snacks to go around! Genki has a large inventory of drinks and even a larger stock of crunchy to-go snacks to munch on along with misc of gifts and toys. 

If it's your first time, I would recommend getting a dessert crepe because you can never go wrong with a sweet tooth craving. The crepes at this place will satisfy that sweet aching in all the right ways.

**Highlights: GREAT dessert crepes

*Low points: LONG late night lines
author: Amy C.

description:
THE BEST EVER CREPE ive HAD so far!

i can admit that i was so hooked on this place,that i was showing up at 10 oclock at night for a crepe fix...3 times a week is tooo much!! i even got  other people hooked on this place.

My usual- Nutella with strawberries, vanilla ice cream and whip cream.
My other favorite- Nutella, Cheese cake, strawberries....

Keep in mind that they use a whole humugo slice of cheesecake..

10.00 minimum for CREDIT CARDS
author: Cali L.

description:
I don't live in San Francisco, but I do visit every year and have been to Genki several times. I'm from Austin which has a lot of crepe stands/trailers..but Japanese crepes is where its at! and none of the places in Austin have the Japanese-style ones :(

and I have to say, the Crepes here are soooooo good..my fave kind to get is one with Nutella, bananas and whipped cream..mmmm....

I actually went to Tokyo recently, and had a couple crepes there, but even though they were much more elaborate than the ones here at Genki, I actually enjoyed the Genki ones a little better because of the consistency of the crepe itself, which is more crunchy, the Japanese ones I had were much much softer, and once the crepe got colder, eating something cold and soggy isn't as enjoyable as something not so soggy. I like crunchy..if you prefer super-soft crepes, Genki may not be for you..also, I really like Nutella..that hazelnut chocolate spread is much tastier than just regular chocolate syrup, which is what the Japanese ones used. So its really more about personal preference.

They also have pretty good bubble tea..Avacado Milk with pearls is delicious..so creamy and avacadowy....

So if you are in the area, and are craving a good Japanese crepe check this place out!
author: Alex L.

description:
I'll be honest, I'm not a fan of crepes and all.  But swinging by here, I decided to try one.  I ordered an apple+cinnamon+brown sugar crepe, and while I knew that it wasn't the best thing to order, I was stubborn enough to try it anyway. Kinda heavy on the crepe itself, but the insides weren't too bad.

However, I did enjoy the rest of the place, which is like a 7-11 with a lot of Japanese snacks and drinks and what not.  Also, the hot coconut milk tea with bubbles was delicious, and was actually needed to down the crepe.

I'd come back for everything but the crepe itself basically, lol.
author: Ren L.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of Genki's & I'm very picky about my crepes. So far, I've only really liked going to Sophie's in Japantown, SF. My expectations were pretty high considering a bunch of my friends would rave & crave this place ALL THE TIME. 

It was like an unusually perfect, sun dress wearing type day. We wanted a not so heavy lunch so we decided to try Genki's. We found really good parking right in front of the place, its metered so make sure you have quarters. The place was tiny; it was half grocery store, half concession stand type thing. Regardless, they had a bunch of things to choose from. 

Two of my friends got dessert crepes while my cousin & I got savory crepes (of course). My cousin got the beef sukiyaki & I got the avocado, tomato, cheese & I asked for mushrooms, too. My crepe tasted SO fresh & my cousins tasted like a full on dinner meal wrapped in a crispy cone. LOVED IT. The dessert crepes weren't bad either. The beef sukiyaki was so good both of my friends who ordered the dessert crepes got one each to take home!

This place seems like a stop & go place, seating are a bunches a couple of benches & is limited. But I guess thats all okay since the crepes are nicely wrapped in a cone, convenient meal to-go.
author: Kris B.

description: Go just for the purpose of taste ... No proper seating area but worth going and having Crepes .
author: Masiha H.

description:
MY ALL TIME FAVORITE PLACE FOR A CREPE! 

I love the banana, nutella, with ice cream crepe! I never had a savory one, but I'd def go back to try it. I just always get the crepe I know that tastes good, although I will admit I need to step out of my comfort level and try a savory crepe sometime!

happy eating! :)
author: Liberty C.

description:
Crispy Japanese crepes. I miss them from my LA college days. 
Genki delivers tasty, crispy, frangrant Crepes in savory+sweet form. Enjoy them on the benches they place around the store front, Ok enough said. I'm drooling over that thought already. 

Yelp wants to know if it's good for Breakfast, dinner, Brunch, Late Night, Lunch or Dessert. How about ALL OF THE ABOVE! :)
author: Amy Y.

description: Genki is my absolute favorite "fast food" creperie in San Francisco. Whether it's 2pm or 11pm, there's always a line! But, the wait isn't bad. Part of what makes these crepes special is they're made crispy; very reminiscent of a delicious fortune cookie. Yum-O!
author: Kara L.

description:
Genki means healthy in Japanese.  Yay, lesson of the day.

However, the people here are Chinese.  Funny, funny, funny.

Crepe/Ice Cream/Asian Mini-Store like place.  I prefer their Savory crepes over their dessert crepes.

They are always SUPER crowded and SUPER slow.

We waited about 20mins for two crepes on a Sunday @ 8:30PM.  Failll.

They're crepes are good, crunchy and hot.  The customer service definitely needs improvement.  I'd go here more often if they weren't so slow.
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
Fresh fruit, huge selection of crepes, nutella, fruit drinks, tapioca options, and ice cream and Asian snacks.

And really reasonably priced too.

But if you are looking for the more traditional American dessert or ice cream flavors this is not the place.

Yum.
author: Denise B.

description:
Numerous recommendations, and 2 visits later...I'm torn if I like Genki's Crepes or not. When you've had authentic French crepes straight from France, you'll have a hard time comparing. 

Consistency, consistency, consistency. I think what sets Genki's apart from other crepes I've had is it's crunchy texture. My sister and I agreed that authentic crepes are doughier. Taste wise (crepe dough), I'm not a fan. If anything, it's their ice cream and various toppings that will have me coming back. The vanilla ice cream is bomb. I have a thing for ice cream that keeps its consistency. Genki's ice cream does just that. I tried the chocolate cake crepe and the vanilla ice cream and strawberries crepe, topped with fresh whipped cream. Pretty good toppings! Chocolate cake is delicious! One good thing about the crepe, it kept my toppings in-tack (mess free!) I look forward to trying their savory crepes on my next visit. Prices of the items on the menu are pretty affordable. Lastly, they have boba drinks on their menu. 

Genki's is a crepe place and Asian mini-mart. They have loads of quirky Asian things. When there's a long time for crepe orders, strolling the aisles for hi-chews, every Asian drink, candy, chips, etc. you can think of, passes the time just fine. There isn't a lot of seating (tables & chairs) but just benches up front. It gets packed and movement inside can be impossible.

Parking on Clement is a pain. But so many good restaurants on that block it's worth it.
author: Pamela P.

description:
Good thing Genki is across the bay from me or I would have to slowly grow horizontally and scrounge for money in this crappy economy. But then again, a little crepe here and there won't hurt!

I ordered number 2, which was the crepe with green tea ice cream with a choice of either red bean or lychee topped off with whipped cream. I chose lychee because for some reason, the thought of a tortilla with a spread of pinto beans popped into my mind when I thought about crepes and red beans. So, lychee it was.

The crepe came out perfect! For those of you who likes crispy crepes, Genki is THE place for you to go. The crepe itself was thin and crispy from top to bottom, whereas some places the crepe gets all soggy by the time you reach the bottom of it. I've had better green tea ice cream elsewhere and they only gave me 3 lychees. Pretty skimpy if you ask me. 

Service was ehhh, ok I guess. I asked the lady at the cashier if I can substitute the ice cream and she flat out said no with a "don't fcuk with me" look on her face. She definitely was scary and had some attitude which explains the lack of 5 stars. 

Until then Genki! I still like you, but I'm going to Sophias =)
author: Cindy C.

description: It's no Ti Couz, but it's one of the best places to get a quick and portable crepe. The service is great aside from the somewhat longer than normal lines this place gets. If you're in the area, come check it out. The chocolate ice cream + cheesecake crepes are TO DIE FOR, I LOVE them to death.
author: Ed D.

description: Had to try this place and take advantage of being in the city.  Had the crepe filled with lychee ice cream with red bean paste.   Pretty good - hit the spot!  They wrap it up like an ice cream cone. Much easier to devour than your standard crepe on a plate.  Very comparable to Sophies Crepes in J-Town.  Oh yeah, and this place is open later than Sophies.
author: Lawrence L.

description:
Pineapple topping + vanilla ice cream + whip creme + crepe shell = me pigging out after dinner!

There's also a ton of super Asian goods, like pocky, "cute" items for the car, and other goods.
author: Ming S.

description:
i'm so glad our dinner plans fell through and we ended up at genki crepes!

the boyfriend had the spinach, mushroom, and cheese crepe, and said he really liked it (or maybe he was just starving, i'm not sure).  i had the honey, banana, and almond crepe, and can't believe i never thought of adding almonds to a crepe.  the almonds really made the crepe.  the crepe itself was more on the crunchy side, which i didn't mind (as long as it's not soggy) and since it came in a wrapper, i was able to catch the crunchy pieces before they hit the floor.

genki crepes is a multi-purpose establishment (crepes in the front, mini mart in the back), which could be a bit off-putting for some, but for people who live in the area, it could be viewed as a convenience.  i didn't check out the prices of the grocery products, however.

i was surprised to see how large of an asian following genki had (even at 9pm on a monday), but how silly of me not to remember that we, asians, like our snacks.  please, just leave the 'tude at home.
author: Foodie C.

description:
Pretty Awesome. Got strawberry ice cream and chocolate cake crepe. I never knew such combination exist. Every bite of it was awesome. It gets crowed and there's no where to sit only 2 benches on the side. It gets really cold in richmond too.Eating ice cream on a cold winter night isnt what I wanna do but damn it was awesome. 
They also have a variety of asian snacks, i love trying new things and got carbonated filled candy. It was pretty interesting
author: Lisa D.

description:
Late night Snake - that's what I am talking about!
Great place - great crepes!
I really love this place. 
They have amazing combinations of flavor for their crepes.  Anything you want you can find it there! They also have other things as candies, drinks, other snacks. The only thing that make me laugh is there make-up for sale! WHy would you sell make-up at the crepery. I don't understand. However, I kill some time while stading in the line. 
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place a lot. Always recommend to grab a desert from there instead of staying at the restaurant and pay a lot for a desert that you might not even like!
author: Jenna F.

description:
I have to say Genki Crepes make the best Crepe, they are so CRUNCHY compared to similar type crepes I've had from Crepe places in Japan Town and Quickly. They sell eggpuffs too, in many flavors like blueberry :D

There is a Quickly right across the street and they sell both eggpuffs and crepes and the place looks dead.

This place gets a bit crowded, but it goes by pretty fast. Perhaps because they sell other Japanese snacks and goods, so customers can entertain themselves roaming around the stores while waiting for their order. 

I always always have to have Nutella in my crepe and the portion is very generous. I got Nutella + Vanilla ice cream + strawberries, but it cost extra $6.25 instead of $4 if I had gotten just 2 out of the 3, but it was worth it!

I just went last night and their savory crepes selection look very appealing, I already want to go back for more today! :D
author: Elli C.

description:
This crepe place is located inside a mini market, so naturally.. it's probably the best smelling market ever.

we got lucky w/ parking, and the lines were not very long.  but after we ordered, it did take a pretty long time for our number to be called.  there is only a bench, so get your crepe and stand/walk around eating it.

the crepe itself was very good - thin w/ a slight crisp.  there was ample ice cream, which is great.  the Nutella was laid on thick, which was a bit sweet for me.  and sadly.. there wasn't enough fruit for me.  but that's just me being demanding.

3 stars because there wasn't enough fruit, and Sophie's Crepes in Japantown is a bit better.  But if i'm in the area, i'm definitely coming back here for more dessert crepes.. 'cause i gotta have my sweets.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Genki isn't as good as it was the first time I had it.. Has anyone else noticed that the crepes went from soft to really crunchy? I mean if you like crunchy, good for you! But I personally don't like crunchy crepes.. It makes me sad, so I don't think I'll be buying crepes from here anytime soon.

& By the way, the place is called GENKI, not GENKIS. There's no S. Sorry, it just really bothers me when people say GENKIS. Get it right.
author: Emily V.

description:
Got the mango ice cream and strawberry crepe. It was amazingly good, definitely try it!

Wait times can be quite unnerving on weekend nights, bring friends.
author: Jeffrey Z.

description:
When I used to live within walking distance to this place, I would LOVE coming here when I was craving something sweet. They have great dessert crepes. Banana, nutella, strawberry, whipped cream, ice cream... the list goes on. 

Aside from the dessert crepes, the savory crepes are great and very tasty. Everytime I come out here with my old roommates, this is a MUST STOP at location.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
I absolutely love how the crepes here are also like ice cream cones! Cold ice cream + warm crepe + your preferred fruit/topping = ingenious dessert combination

The other great thing about this store is all the asian candy, drinks, trinkets, etc...yay! =)
author: Jean B.

description:
It's. So. Good.

I usually get my japanese crepe fix at Sophie's Crepe in J-town, but they close by 9p (or even earlier maybe...). And I was craaaving for some. And my sister knew of Genki and told me they stay open late.

I went and the place is tiny!. The front half is the small kitchen/cash register where they mak the crepes, the back half is a small market where they have japanese food, snacks, drinks houseware etc.

Of course, there is a massive line along with people sitting/standing around waiting for their order. This is the only con. It sounds like it's pretty busy all the time (esp at night)....so be prepared to wait. And parking can be a pain in the area, with all the restaurants around.

I ordered the blueberry cheesecake crepe (or something like that) and it was soooo good. Very rich, very heavy, very bad (but oh so good). And they have so many kinds, so it was so hard to make a decision :)
author: Radha X.

description:
Best crepes in the city? Maybe...
Open semi late, 11pmish, great dessert crepes. Love the nutella, banana, and ice cream crepe, super good munchie. Non-dessert crepes aren't bad, but when i'm here i'm getting dessert. Clutch performance for a post dinner-date dessert stroll. Fun browsing through the various imported asian foods, candies, etc. CREPES ROCK! Prices are very fair. YUM!
author: Adam S.

description: Besides being a small Japanese grocery store, they serve Japanese crepes (basically cooked to a crisp rather than soft). The crepe menu is pretty big, and it's quite delicious. Our favorites are the standard Nutella with strawberries or bananas. They also have ice cream crepes which really are a tour de force. If you're used to more authentic French crepes, be warned that this is a bit different but also quite unique. They also have egg puffs now. The only drawback is that the line can get pretty long sometimes, but it's 'cuz the crepes are so great.
author: Dave Y.

description: I was handed my ice cream crepe and felt like it wasn't as stuffed as my memory served. I looked behind the counter and the scooper had a full scoop still sitting in it. What gives? I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and drop them only 1 star.
author: Allen F.

description:
3 things I like:
little erasers, crepes w/ Nutella, amazing packaging on candy and drinks.
author: Julia D.

description: Highly recommend this place if your around the avenues and looking for a snack or dessert. This little crepe place has a great variety or savory, sweet and ice cream crepes. And while you wait for your order to be called  you can roam around the store and find some great Japanese or Asian snacks. They also have some great Japanese makeup and hair products.
author: rae m.

description: For some reason Genki Crepes always sound good at 11 at night.
author: Trang N.

description:
One word... WOW!

I didn't know Genki existed until a friend of mine dragged me over to the Inner Richmond for a night of Pho and Crepes.  Honestly, I hate parking on Clement anywhere near 4th street.  It's HORRIBLE, but I gave in and went because yes, I am a good friend :)

When we walked into Genki, it was like a 7 Eleven and an Asian Market had a baby that made desserts, excellent!  I placed my order with a polite teenage girl and got a dessert Crepe filled with Nutella (yumz), Strawberries and Whipped cream then proceeded to walk around the store to buy lots of Lychee candy and gum.  The whole place was filled with a bakery like aroma... wonderful.

Received my crepe after 5-10 minutes (any night, it gets busy) and bit... into... heaven.  The crepe was crispy with a hint of a soft center.  All of the flavors of course meshed well and I ended up cramming the entire thing down my throat.  It was a really good treat.  

Every time I go back, I get the same thing.  I have tasted the Banana, Nutella and Whipped Cream... that is also good, but the Strawberries give it a tangy flavor I like.  Uber... Yumz!

side note:  if you do decide to go, take the bus or be prepared to drive around for a while.
author: Crystal R.

description:
I am utterly obsessed with Genki. 

The crepes are to die for!! I have nothing but love for this place.

They have a mini-mart too which is kinda cool (& a little wierd at the same time but there's cool stuff (imported from Japan) such as makeup, hair products and ...lube? Yeah...

Anywhoo...Great crepes! YUMMY...super delish, gotta try it!

Tip: I highly recommed the Tomato, Cheese & Avocado Savory Crepe if you're hungry and don't want mixed fruit :)
author: Diana T.

description:
After Burma, we stop by Genki to get our dessert. Once you walk in you smell the crepes.....so heavenly yummy.

We ordered strawberry vanilla ice cream.

While were there, we got some groceries, Kimchi's, some fruit gummy and Haribo Fizzy cola fix.
author: jubi l.

description:
Given that the boyfriend needed to satisfy his sweet tooth after dinner, we stopped by to pick up an ice cream filled crepe.  He chose the pineapple/vanilla combo with whipped cream.  This turned out to be much too sweet for my liking and was a great crepe shell, but a store-bought inside with canned pineapple and ice cream.  However, for the price and the satisfaction of the bf, it must've been OK or better.

The stars come off for my drink.  I understand this is a crepe place, but the drink menu does take up half of the menu board, so they should be decent... even the most obscure of choices.  I choose a green tea latte milk shake.  This turned out to be a light green, slush-like, non-sweet concoction of chalky milk powder-tasting something or the other.  It may have been my choice of drink, but others in the store did seem to like the drinks they'd ordered --I saw a coffee/mocha milk shake and sesame one which did in fact LOOK like a milkshake should.  Probably should ONLY stick to the crepes here.

On the other hand about atmosphere, this place offers other trinkets (cell phone accessories, car air fresheners I thought I only could buy in Japantown, convenient store merchandise, and a WIDE assortment of Japanese snacks).  Service is quick and polite --there are a lot of workers (counted 6 in the rather small workspace on a Friday night around 9:30pm) to help expedite the food delivery.  

So finally, after some contemplation, I'll have to put one star back on for the crepe itself.  That was the memorable part of our trip here.  I'd be back to try just a plain crepe --crispy and still slightly chewy.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: I've only been here as a pitstop between stuffing my face at Mandalay and playing some skeeball and drunkenly admiring the taxidermy at Buckshot on some sort of increasingly common Richmond weeknight circuit, but each time Genki has hit the spot with an over the top crepe that makes even a badass such as myself grin like a damn fool (Proof: http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/photo/aRFJUbyQDDq0T-bfVMvG9w/l.jpg). I mean really, do you NEED a crepe with cheesecake, chocolate ice cream and whipped cream? Absolutely not. But do you deserve one? Of course you do.
author: Mark A.

description:
When ever I'm in the Richmond, or remotely close to it, this is a regular stop for me, especially if I want to fulfil a late night snacks or post dinner treat, this place itches that scratch for me...  I should say I'm a fan of the wafer thin and crispy crepe, and as some of my friends have mentioned to me they prefer their crepes on the lighter and fluffier, softer side, as a result I don't bother eat crepes with them, personally, like my crepes this way, and they are pretty reasonable when it comes to cost as well.

Some personal favorites of mine include:

-Vanilla ice cream, cheesecake & fresh kiwi and mango
 
-Nutella and fresh strawberries

-Lychee ice cream and Azuki Bean

-Chocolate ice cream, cheesecake & strawberries

Also I should note that I did ADD whipped cream on these as well.  (Seriously, I'm already putting a freaking cheesecake in my crepe, at this point I've already wronged just about every diet out there, I might as well go all out...)  Don't limit yourself to what is on the menu, pretty much if you can think it up, they can put it together for you, which can lead to some pretty interesting alcohol influenced crepe combinations.  While the staff behind the counter is hastily assembling whatever crepe you envisioned, feel free to peruse the shelves and take in all the vibrant colored packaging containing an assortment of sweets, treats and drinks.  

I've never tried their savory crepes as I'm usually go there for dessert, but it is on the list of things to give a try, I must admit I am intrigued by the Beef Sukiyaki/Green Onion/Cheese crepe...  Oh they also have those egg puffs, which I think is pretty good, but I still prefer coming for the sweet crepes!
author: Chris T.

description:
The egg puffs come in blueberry flavor now!
Blueberry flavor egg puffs are good. They are like the strawberry egg puffs, only the color of blue instead of straw.
I mean... you know what I mean.

I think I prefer the strawberry and regular ones over the blueberry, but it's a nice change of pace. The egg puffs were a bit more tender than usual (I ate them pretty quick), but still hot and crispy. Some puffs are hollower, others more doughy. Something for everyone. Didn't take long to come out, either. 

Browse the candy, instant noodles, and chips while you're there. Or check out the blind box toys. You can get food figurines as stocking stuffers.
author: Amy N.

description: To be honest I am not a huge fan of sweet crepes but am a sucker for savory crepes.  They are quick and always fresh.  I am personally like their Tuna crepe, yes it is not the best quality fish, but something about a crispy and hot crepe with a savory seasoned cook tuna that really is amazing.
author: John T.

description: Yummy crepes! Similar to Sophie's in Japantown but a bit cheaper. Lines can get long so you gotta go during non-peak hours to avoid them. Stopped by around 4pm on Saturday and there was absolutely no line. Opted for the vanilla ice cream, nutella, and whipped cream this time, and it was delish! Love that their mixed fruit crepes come with mango!
author: Katrina L.

description: I truly adore this place. Not only is this a crepes shop, but they also sell other merchandise as well. When ever I come here, it's usually packed, so you have to make sure to go at the right time. I always order the strawberry ice cream and kiwi crepe. And each time, I was always satisfied.
author: Sylvia b.

description:
I have been here quite a few times. The crepes are made infront of you and the workers do a good job. Each time, the crepes were made so good. 

The service is not bad. While you wait, you can look around the store. They have a lot of random food and toys. 

The place doesn't have table and chairs to eat at. I think there is only two benches: one inside and one outside. 

Go check it out!
author: Ange G.

description: You can never go wrong anything with Nutella! My fave would be Nutella+Banana the subtle taste of crepes made it a perfect snack. They have all kinds of stuff, from crepes with Ice Cream to crepes with Ham and Cheese. Long lines at night, good luck for parking but all worth it!
author: Donci B.

description:
I like crepes...especially dessert crepes.  My friend took me here and I'm a fan.  I think its a strange place to have a crepe place (in a mini mart), but its good!  They have a variety of crepes from savory to sweet.  Love the mix fruit with nutella.  Prepare to stand while eating because there are only two benches to sit on while you eat or wait. 
And while you're waiting for your crepes you can browse their mini mart isle and find asian candies and chips-my fav!
author: Liz Q.

description: If you're in SF, and if you want to eat crepes, go to Genki. Always. No other place has crepes even remotely so good as this one. period.
author: venu p.

description:
Friendly Staff and Welcome Staff.

Fresh Ingredient use for their crepe Dessert.

Delicious and Price Reasonable.
author: Gruber T.

description:
I can't give them 5 stars because their crepes aren't always consistent.  It's good, but it's super freakin awesome when that one short Mexican guy makes it.  I wanna tell him I love him every time he makes it for me, but that's weird..

Mine:  Strawberry with Nutella, that's it.
His:  He just gets a coke; he doesn't like sweets.
author: Anna C.

description: Hidden gem! This is probably the best place for a quick dessert in the Inner Richmond. $5 buys you a huge and fresh crepe stuffed with fruit, nutella, ice cream, and whipped cream if you want it. Line can be long but hey they are making the crepes fresh so its worth the wait.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
BEST CREPES EVER!

Ok, maybe im just a sucker for nutella and ice crream.  Mmmm, who isnt?!

Caution:  will cause food coma
author: Juv C.

description: It's all about the egg puffs. They're non-guilty pleasures, about $3, come in a variety of flavors, crisp and airy, warm and fluffy. Great for on the go snacking. I always try to grab a few japanese candies and snacks from the market section. It's fun to peruse the toy aisles and wonder who would play with the miniature toy furniture and kitchen sets.  Perhaps people who like pretending to be giants?
author: Jenny H.

description:
A small shop it is but dang they have so many asian goodies I can't help but keep coming back

I've been here about three times now and eh all the dessert crepes I ordered were so so then yesterday I discovered my favorite: mango ice cream and strawberry! It's so light and fruity and perfect mmm I want more. The crepe itself is perfect for snacking on. 

Come early in the day if you don't wanna wait too long. They get super busy at night but it's worth it. If you get bored waiting, you can step outside and watch the crepe man makes crepes. What an art
author: kathleen d.

description: I was introduced to crepes with ice cream recently...yeah, sad. I've always had the ones with just the whip cream and fruit. What a good dessert to satisfy my cravings at night. Mmm.
author: Mandy D.

description:
I've gotten crepes here plenty of times and this place never fails me. This time I ordered a simple crepe dessert with nutella and ice cream, their crepes are always fresh, leaving you bloated after wards ... yet satisfied (: 

But while waiting for your number (because it tends to get busy), you can just kill time by doing a lil grocery around the store or just sitting down anticipating for your crepe and number while looking at everyone else devouring their crepes.
author: Johanna M.

description:
You can't find any crispier, more delightful, more fulfilling crepe anywhere else in San Francisco.

Crepes range from about $5-$7 depending on what's in it, but my personal favorite is green tea ice cream with Nutella and light whipped cream and bananas. The savory crepes are also pretty delicious but it's all about the dessert here.

Oh yeah, and this place also has a mini mart that has all the Asian goodies you can ask for. Perfeeccttt.
author: Winnie T.

description:
Yummy! We went after Benihana's the other day and I got a green tea ice cream with nutella and strawberry crepe! 

I loved it! I also bought some of the Asian snacks...

They accept Visa and Mastercard, but there's a $10 min.
author: Alison N.

description: This place is such an unexpected little gem. Located inside a mini mart, expert crepe chefs create delicious savory and sweet combinations. I wouldn't say it's the best atmosphere being that it is located inside of a convenience store, but the crepes are definitely worth the trip.
author: Chloe A.

description:
I have no idea what it is about these crepes, but its makes me quiver with joy every time I think about them. They are honestly the best crepes I have ever had and rain or shine, at any given time, there are always people there. 8pm on a rainy Tuesday? Yep. 10pm on a cold Sunday night? Yep. Its nuts.

The service is quick, but its always fun to browse through the store of Japanese goodies while you wait. It seems like I always find something new every time I'm there. Today I found corn flavored caramel candy. CORN FLAVORED CANDY! What the hell is that? Love it  :) I may have also figured out what the secret is to their incredible crepes (exactly the same as one of my favorite Japanese restaurants) which is that Mexicans make the best crepes. Totally serious - don't tell them I know.
author: Candy C.

description:
Genki is awesome! Fast, cheap Tasty.  Go eat your Burma then come over for dessert, or get frustrated that you waited an hour + for Burma, then just come over get the ice cream crepe with mangoes and a boba and you're set.  MMMMMMmmm. . I want a boba now.

Plus, great random asian trinket-type of shopping.
author: Leia K.

description:
inside an asian/japanese convenience store with trinkets and snacks --- are the MOST DELICIOUS crepes ever. freshly made, generously filled, affordably priced, amazingly addictive.

my favorite is nutella, banana,almond. they have oodles of combos, and savory ones too.  flavored eggpuff pastries (kinda like waffles, but with round bumps instead of square grid indents?) are popular as well. you can watch them being made in the window!

the line is long, but seems to move at an decent speed.   the smell is so delicious as you wait! watching everything get made also helps pass the time.
author: Dora F.

description:
Now I have only had the Egg Puffs here. So this review will only be based on the egg puffs 'til i try other stuff and the store itself. 

We got the coconut and honeydew flavored egg puffs. While they were nice and crispy on the outside, they were practically hallow on the inside. It maybe they put too much baking powder in the batter. I dunno but when i bit inside i was expecting some fluffy texture to greet me but no. It was air. I was like what where are the innards?! Also my honeydew egg puffs didn't have any honeydew flavor at all. It tasted almost like regular egg puffs with a little more sugar. 

So Genki is also a store too. They sell all sorts of drinks and pre-packaged snacks. They have all sorts of japanese gummies which are pretty good and a large variety of CalPico and ramune. So if you are in the mood for snackage this is a good place to stop by.
author: Jess G.

description:
This place is the cool neighborhood dessert place.  I used to come here at least once a week to get a crepe.  

Do not be mistaken and expect a soft French style crepe where you fork and knife.  These are Japanese more crisp style crepes.  They are filled with fruit, chocolate, ice cream, whipped cream, etc. The crepe is essentially  the "ice cream cone"  but SO much better.   
The combo has every thing.  
Sweet, slightly savory, hot, cold, crispy soft.  So good. 

I usually get vanilla ice cream with strawberries and whipped cream with a extra crispy crepe.
author: Erick L.

description:
Dear Genki,

I used to be in love with you.  You and San Tung were my go-to food/dessert combo.  However, after my obsessive infatuation with you, I took a break.  Distance makes the heart grow fonder right?  Well it was true. Except when I came here this past weekend after a looong hiatus (I lived in so cal, but recently moved up here), you were a bit of a letdown.  I ordered the mango ice cream w/ strawberries (you had never let me down before) and it was not what I remembered.  The crepe was warm, but the batter could have been a little sweeter for a dessert crepe.  Why was there only three strawberries in my crepe?  What happened??

Maybe I need to give you another chance, maybe I just wasn't feeling it that day.  But nonetheless, I was left a bit disappointed.  However you are still cute as ever, with your little Japanese snacks and drinks.  You know how much I love my Japanese snacks.

Love, Me
author: Pornsakdi T.

description:
I usually end up passing by here when im in the Rich ( ex. going to Fizzees, Burma Superstar, or Quicklys) and finally got a chance to get a crepe one night with my cousin. We split a Nutella and Peach with whipped cream Crepe for $3.25, not bad at all! Pretty good stuff, ive had the boba (bubble tea or tapioca) drinks also, and i think i prefer to go across the street to quicklys for those. 

Genki also sells tons of japanese candy, snacks, drinks, and other household items
author: David D.

description:
Service: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 3/5
Price: $
Presentation of food: 4/5
Presentation of restaurant: 2.5/5
Overall: 4/5
author: Eva H.

description:
We like their crepes the most out of all the other crepes places in. Go there occasionally, for afternoon snacks and desserts.   
Banana nutella crepe (without wrap cream or ice cream) and Turkey, sour cream, avocado crepe are my usual choices. The edge is crispy and the center is soft . One word " delicious." ^o^
author: Stacy L.

description: This is my second time getting this.  I love the crepe here.  It's crispy and not soggy.  The flavors are good but I wished they would of added a little more ice cream though!
author: Alice T.

description:
I have never seen crepes made like this before, and its pretty damn good. The first thing i had to try was the Nutella with strawberries , banana, whip cream, and vanilla ice cream. You will love it. So many many different ways you can make your own crepe. the possibilities  amaze me. 

They also have savory crepes. which is a good variety if your not in the dessert mood.  I tried the turkey and and pineapple savory crepe. Its pretty good, and i should try more savory crepes and ice cream crepes but im still addicted to my usuals. 

I like how after you ordered, you can browse around their little Japanese mini 711, haha. 

5 stars for sure.
author: Henzley Z.

description:
I've seen dozens upon dozens of Asians congregate here, so you know Genki's gotta have some really excellent sweets inside that small, glowing-bright-in-the-dark-night exterior.

I've tried two things from here & they both involve NUTELLA: vanilla ice cream & nutella & my favorite- nutella, banana slices, whipped cream & chocolate sauce (less than $5 each.)

I love coming here with my BFF late at night. We always end up eating our entire crepe (in it's cone shaped paper holder) before we get back to our parked car, about 3-4 blocks away.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Sunday. 10pm. What else would I be craving? CREPES of course! I love that Genki is always open late. I was already in my PJs but I didn't care. Nothing can stop my late night cravings! Genki provides all the necessities: crepes, egg puffs, boba, all kinds of cutesy Asian snacks, and lots of cold drinks. But don't try to buy the mushrooms, eggs and other produce at the corner of the refrigerated section. Those are for the crepes. Good to know they are using fresh ingredients! 

So the Genki crepes are not the soft, fluffy kind which is what I prefer but they're still delicious in its own crispy, fresh, made to order way. Yes, there are places that pre-make their crepe skins. Blah! I think the prices are also very reasonable. You could be paying a lot more for a crepe that's half as good. Our late night munchies were:

Lychee & nutella crepe ($3.50) - Sweet on top of sweet. Give it to me! 

Cheesecake, whipped cream & blueberry sauce crepe ($4.75) - The cheesecake slices aren't super thick so you don't just get a mouthful of cheesecake. These aren't original flavors but in crepe form, they're somehow tastier and even more fun to eat!

We finished those pretty quickly and started eyeing a savory crepe... Okay okay, just one more and we'll make it healthy. One spinach, mushroom, & cheese crepe ($4.75) coming right up! What I love about Genki is that they always make sure the placement of the ingredients are well spread out so you always get a bite of everything when you chomp down.
