I think I like the savory crepes just as much as the sweet ones! Perfectly melted Monterey cheese, meaty mushrooms and fresh spinach all in every bite. Yes, I'll be back again and again.

4 solid stars!
author: Julia T.

description: I go to this place so much its ridiculous. Their savory and sweet crepes are both equally awesome. Their crepes are crispy and crunchy, which I like, because I do not like the regular soft crepes. The crepes are "cone" shaped and they put all the awesomeness inside. My favorite savory crepe is the Hot Link, Red Onion, and Mozzarella. The Turkey, Avocado, Jack Cheese, and Sour Cream savory crepe is also great. My favorite sweet crepe is the vanilla ice cream with mango. My bf loves getting the vanilla ice cream with chocolate cake. The crepes always come out fast after ordering and I like how they are open late. Cheap, fast, and awesome service!
author: Sue L.

description:
They never have any Horlick! Never. The 23 times that I've been here. 

Their crepes are the bomb though! 

Vanilla Ice cream, Bananas, Nutella and Whipped Cream Crepe. I do believe that I have found god, but he doesn't accept credit cards. It's true, Nobody's perfect.
author: Tushar V.

description: I was just at Genki. Sunday, November 3rd. When I walked in there was 3 workers, they were girls and there was no customer at all. My sister and I ordered 2 chocolate milkshake and 1 green tea milkshake and the original puffs. We got the milkshakes but not the puffs. And we see that they haven't started it. So my sister asked the girl woth the red hair, " we ordered the egg puffs also", she replied, " oh wait ". I said to my sister, "wtf?", then she started the puffs. We waited about 10minutes, no customers and it's still not ready? So my sister asked again " is the puffs ready?" She was like "ummm " amd turned away. And you know, wait 20minutes for the original egg puffs when there is no customer but my sister and I, is really a waste of time. So I said " I'm cancelling it, it's a waste of time, I want my money back" and the red hair girl said "oook " with the bad attitude face. That is why I never tip! Because if your not satisfied you really don't have to right ?
author: Nanthaporn a.

description: I love their Green Tea ICE Cream Dessert Crepes!! Very Great! The mini mart is a bit pricy, but it is focused on the crepes and the to go food !!!!! I would recommend it to anyone who wants something fast because their crepes are delicious!
author: Sophia W.

description:
This place fit the bill for a quick bite to eat we could stroll around with after shopping at my new favorite dress store (Kisha).

I lived in France for a year, so I am in no way going to make any comparisons to a French Crepe and a Genki Crepe (they are totally different beasts!). However for what it is, it's really yummy.

Nice crisp crepe filled with fresh tasting ingredients and the best part is that they get the cheese to melt just right so it's oozing inside the crisp crepe.

Makes me want to head back to my favorite crepe spot on Rue Mouffetard in Paris.
author: Abby Z.

description:
If you are single, or stuck with a partner who can't give you what you need, then maybe you need to get seduced by a banana, almond, and honey crepe from Genki.

   He will treat you right, won't make you cry, and won't diss the ass you grow after enjoying said crepe.  He will do things to your tongue that I bet no man can do, and when he's done with you, you'll only want more.

   Spoken best by a girl who feels whorish about this place already: moi.
author: Lea N.

description: Crepes here are delicious!! I got the mixed fruits crepe and it was amazing! I will be back next time to try one of the ice cream crepes.
author: Jessica C.

description: Yummy! I got the Cheesecake crepe with blueberry sauce, I love cheesecake and this cheesecake was light and fluffy , the crepe came with huge slice of cheesecake, and the blueberry sauce was sweet and simple, my friend had gotten one of the ice cream crepes, (He's never had a crepe), he was in love. The place has a wide variety of crepe fillings. A good place for first timers and crepe lovers alike, plus it's also a mini mart. Only down side the front could be cleaner...
author: Sydney P.

description: Must try this place. Have to drive here from san jose but its worth it! I usually get the strawberry ice cream with nutella and fresh strawberries. Two scoops of ice cream is better than one!
author: Yen N.

description:
Get your coins ready for street parking.

Imagine a japanese mini-mart wiht a crepe place in the front...there you go.

You can grab the normal crepe and they can add ice cream in it.  At least they did this for us.  We had the strawberry, banana, and carmel crepe, but had them add vanilla ice cream.

It's sweet...it's handheld...it's like soft thing fortune cookie in a cone shape and stuffed full of deliciousness (It's my new word i've been using, don't judge me).

If you are in the area, try one....they have benches in the front too and they are strong.  I didn't hear them creek at all when my fat butt sat  on one.

We tried the Almond drink...they used the good almond powder mix...I liked it alot.....mmmmmmmm.  not many places use the powdered almond mix for their drinks anymore.
author: F' The Polic E.

description:
I love Genki!!! 

We usually go there after dinner twice a week and we were so delighted to eat their crepes.

I tried the banana nutella and the ham and cheese crepes and they are so delicious!

Highly recommended!
author: Shiela D.

description:
One time I ordered a crepe from here, and while I was waiting for it... a pigeon flew into the cooking/prep area. The two crepe-makers scrambled to catch the wily pigeon... jumping here....diving there. 

I watched in amazement. The pigeon slammed into the window, they finally caught it, released back into the wild of Clement St, and finished up my crepe. 
I still ate it.... and I don't even regret it. MmMmM... pigeon crumbs. 
That's how much I like this place.
author: Darlene S.

description:
Cash Only!

I'd advise you to get the Cheesecake and chocolate ice cream crepe, but you must add Nutella and fresh strawberries to complete the Genki experience! Soooo yummy
author: Michelle I.

description:
crispy crepe deliciousness made fresh!

1) get ice cream crepes w lychee ($4.95)
       ---- avoid the non ice cream crepes, not as good!
2) go on a weekday to avoid waiting
       ---- weekday lunchtime = zero wait!
3) enjoy random assorted asian goodies in the store
       ---- japanese makeup, toys, snacks, drinks!
author: Cynthia G.

description: Yea I Know They Make Desert Crepes..  But Im Fat..   I Had A Crepe With Cream Cheese,  Smoked Salmon, Wasabi And Red Onions..  I Will Be Sure To Revisit When Im Back In SanFran..
author: Gee T.

description: mmm crepes... I wasn't hungry enough to get one to try, but I got the chance to try it from sampling it off of my friends. The process in making a crepe was creating a work of art, you need to know when it's the right time to flip it so it doesn't burn, although it was not perfect but the end results was pretty tasty. I say it's better than Sophie's, they had the right amount of the chosen toppings, so nothing overwhelms each other, it was crunchy and delicious, and the price is not bad too! I like how it's located inside a mini mart, neato.
author: Shirley G.

description:
I was craving a crepe so I decided to stop at Genki's. As usual, it was very crowded. I think this is a hot spot because they open late. 

I ordered the lychee ice cream with cheesecake. The lychee ice cream was prescooped so it was semi melted when they served it. The cheesecake bits were good.

I agree with Aaron (hi Aaron!), the crepe was unappetizing; it almost tasted like thin cardboard.
author: Nance H.

description:
This place is kind of like a Japanese Mart you would find in Japan. Most of the products in this store are made in Japan. You'd find cool chocolate bars, fruit candies, snacks, drinks, daily use products, etcetc. And they're all pretty cool looking. Some stuff are actually pretty cute too. If you're the type to look for "Kawaii" food/ items, check this place out. This place also sells fresh crepes. If you've been to Sophie's Crepes in Japantown, this is the exact same thing. Everything is fresh and the people are nice. Give this place a try if you're craving a snack. :]

Try the mixed fruit crepe! :D
author: Janice M.

description: I love their crepes! Try  all of them! Doesnt matter what you get because you will enjoy it! I tried their hot milk tea...didnt like it but I loved my crepe!
author: Angeline H.

description:
Asian (herrroo!) Sweet.  Heppy!

This is clearly the hang out spot for young, Asian, 20 somethings who know how to satiate their sweet tooth.  The place was bustling at 11PM on Friday night with kids who couldn't get enough ice cream filled, fruit filled, nutella filled, red bean filled, whip cream doused, CREPES!  

The ambrosial, sticky-sweet wafting smell of the crepes made me shriek with glee (literally).

I don't think you could wrench a smile out of the girl behind the counter (probably just jealous of all the crepes she's not having) but the goods served are pretty satisfying.  

Hot CRIPSY crepe with mango filled ice cream - pretty good.  Only, the name should be "Mango ice cream crepe with 2 strawberries on top" - I was expecting chopped strawberry infused ice cream...too much?

The show stopper however is the coconut egg puffs that I graciously stole from my Clement-ine go-to girl Krystle S.  The warmth of the pastry beautifully complements the subtly sweet coconut, and the crispy on the outside, chewy on the outside combo is deadly.  No seating except one bench inside.

I am so heppy!  I'll be back!!!

$3-4 for crepes - Asian paraphernalia available in store as well (magazines, trinkets, candies, random weird stuff)
author: Jane L.

description: Blueberry cheesecake crepe!
author: Art O.

description: Best creeps ever! The boba drinks and eggettes are one of the best also. I come here at least once a week!
author: Anthony N.

description: Was in SF yesterday and after lunch we had to get some dessert! My friends recommended some crepes. Parking was not good, took awhile to find a spot but of course we're in the city so I didnt expect much. Ordered a crepe with green tea ice cream with strawberries...MMMMMmmmmMMMMMM delicous! We need somethiing like this where I live! Good crepes, quick servers, fair pricing, crappy parking... Either way, will be back next time I'm here in SF!!!
author: R. C.

description:
Oh my gosh, the dessert crepe is an orgasm in my mouth. Extremely well priced too.

Good regular drinks too.
author: Mark A.

description:
How did I ever live without putting ice cream and fruit and whip cream in my crepes!?!

Mmmm...just thinking about the crepe I had last night at Genki Crepes is making my mouth water. 

The boyfriend ordered an AMAZING crepe with strawberries, bananas, strawberry ice cream and whip cream. SO GOOD!!!! Usually, I don't share or go halvesies on my dessert, but we had a huge dinner and I figured I couldn't finish a whole crepe on my own anyways. (Don't tell anyone, but I probably could have finished my own crepe...)

It's cool that Genki is a store too. You can get your Asian sodas and drinks while waiting for your crepe. AND, you can check out the creepy Asian figurines in the corner by the bench (the boyfriend showed me and I don't know how I feel about Asian figurines only in underwear).

I think I'm going to go get another crepe...by myself...while everyone is at work.
author: Maureen B.

description:
Crowded mini-mart that sells crepes? WTH?!? Yea, odd to me too..but DAMN! Their crepes are downright DEL-I-CIOUS! Melt-in-your-mouth kind of delicious!

Yea, it's a little Asian mini-mart that sells crepes in many different flavors. We got there, and it was pretty crowded. Certainly worth the wait, though. I ordered a Vanilla Ice Cream Crepe filled with mango pieces and Nutella spread on the inside. My BF ordered a Strawberry Ice Cream Crepe with kiwi pieces and Nutella spread on the inside of his, and his friend ordered a Vanilla Ice Cream Crepe with Nutella. All 3 smelled absolutely delicious. It took no longer than 10 minutes for my group and Me to get our orders, and we happily made our way to the sidewalks of Clement Street to avoid the never-ending line that formed outside of this mini-mart..that sells crepes. Munching on our tasty Nutella-filled desserts, which by the way are messy but in a good way, we watched the employees of this mart make more crepes as we looked in from the outside. 

They also sell fresh smoothies and snack crepes, which are crepes filled with real food such as chicken, beef, or whatever you choose from their list. 

Absolutely messy, absolutely delicious, and absolutely worth it all. Genki Crepes, you have won my heart. =]
author: Clarissa C.

description: I just had a crepe back home in Toronto and I felt like it was a waste of my time and $$ eating it after devouring a real crepe a few weeks ago from Genki in SF. Although I was told Sophies in Japtown is the real #1, i'd have to say my banana red bean was pretty damn delicious. The paper thin goodness should be mandatory at all crepe joints. I hate it when the shell is thick and spongy like some places serve them. Service is quick and painless. I shall return on my next visit to the city.
author: Joe C.

description: Absolutely LOVEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE this place, you get a big delicious crepe for an unbelievably low price that makes you wonder if they put some drugs in it because it makes you want to come back more and eat eat eat! The first time I got the chocolate ice cream and cheesecake crepe (#7) and it left me in awe because it was just so good. It's a great place to get desserts or even the candy's and other random stuff they sell around the store. While it does take some time to make, you are able to window-shop or even buy stuff from their wide variety of candy, food, and even hair products. LOLOLOLO. Definitely give this place a try if you are in the mood for a breakfast AND dessert type of meal/snack with your friends/family. :)  It gets crowded a lot at night so if you don't plan on staying inside, wear a jacket or something warm!
author: Dustin W.

description: Sure, they have fresh and amazing crepes that come in a variety of sweet and savory flavors, but I was more so excited for the market side of this store. They had all the Japanese snacks you can ever imagine and then some. While waiting for a table over at B-Star Bar, we wandered over here and I ended up spending more than I should by buying every green tea-based product that they had haha.
author: Steve Y.

description: This place is great for dessert on the go. I got the nutella and banana crepe. The crepe was nice and crispy and there was a good amount of nutella and banana filling on the inside. They also have some benches if you want to sit down and eat. The store is also filled with a lot of snacks and drinks.
author: Alexander L.

description:
Crepes are usually expensive, but this place it is CHEAP! I doubt i'll find anywhere that is cheaper or as good! 

I tried the strawberry and the turkey crepe. Both were good, but I think I would prefer the turkey one. 

Don't expect there to be seating, there is only a bench that can fit 3 people so either take it to go or stand if someone takes the bench. I would definitely go again
author: Dorris W.

description: Tiny spot on Clement Street but the watermelon blended drink we waited 15 minutes for was well worth it. I can see why this place gets packed so easily, delicious crepes and tasty drinks. Street parking available if you're lucky :)
author: Anonymous P.

description: Got the nutella + banana + strawberries with extra green tea ice-cream.  The crepe itself was good.  Thin and crispy on the side.  But the service was just soso.  Not very friendly and polite.
author: Liza T.

description:
Whenever I am in the area (which is not very often), the smell of Genki Crepes gets me. I can't walk past without going in and getting a nutella crepe. They probably have much better options, but I'm a purist.

All the crazy Japanese stuff makes me wish they were in my basement. I mean, who can say no to mysterious chocolates and candies? Can't read the box because you don't understand Japanese? Screw it. Fish scales and octopus ink never hurt anyone.

Comparing the crepes to Chez Maman or to France as a whole is unfair, but I did it anyway so -1 star. But really, if you haven't been, don't start going now because the line is long enough.
author: Alexis C.

description:
1 star = they're open late
1 star = they're cheap
3 stars = nutella, banana crepes. 

need I say more? 
nom nom nom
author: Megan L.

description:
Asian crepes are awesome. 

I ordered strawberry and nutella with whipped cream (no ice cream), and lemme tell you, IT WAS A PARTY IN MY MOUTH.

The biggest and coolest difference is that you can hold these crepes in one hand and the sleeves make it so convenient!  I like regular crepes, but Genki's crepes have a crispy almost ice cream cone-like texture, and I just can't say NO to them. 

They've got a whole bunch of other cool stuff. I love looking through the make-up section. I can spend an hour in here if my husband would let me.
author: RACHELLE T.

description: We came here late to have some dessert and I really wasn't that impressed ONLY because I ordered the wrong thing. I had the apple and brown butter crepe and my friend had the nutella and banana crepe. Her crepewas pretty good but mine was dry and not too flavorful. Next time I go in, I'd love to try some ice cream with mine. (definitely getting the Nutella)
author: Sheeva G.

description:
Best crepes, ever.

I was first introduced to this place by a close friend of mine. We went pretty late on a Saturday night, explaining why it was so crowded. The crowds also don't lie. They're all in there with good reason!

The crepes at Genki are so delicious. I especially love the crispness of their crepes and how fresh their fruits always are. Although I always order the same thing whenever I go - strawberries with Nutella, and vanilla ice cream, I have tasted a few others from my friend's orders and they too are to die for.

The only thing that stops me from frequenting Genki is the parking. I hate having to drive around trying to find a parking spot but it is always worth every mile.
author: Gabby T.

description: Super Delicious Crepes!!! Really nice thin crispy crepes with nutella and strawberries and whipped cream and vanilla ice cream?? how can you go wrong? plus all the candy and drinks you can think of buying at a asian store. A+ Ooo they have savory crepes too.
author: Joseph G.

description:
Hands down, the best crepe I have gotten in the bay area thus far. Unlike most crepes that I have eaten, the crepe itself here at Genki's is thicker but not too overwhelming. Because of the crepe being thicker, they also offer generous proportions of whatever topping you decide to put on your crepe. I do not lie when I say that every single one of their crepe is good, at least there were no complains for everyone I have had.

Oh, and they have benches for you to sit down and eat there while googling your eyes at the numerous other pedestrians that come in to buy their awesome crepes. Before I forget, their egg puffs are amazing too, I recommend the red bean one. Hands down, thumbs up.
author: Kei T.

description: The crepes are way too crunchy like fortune cookies. Don't come here if you like soft and goeey crepes. Butter&sugar crepes are supposed to be like warm thin tortillas lathered in melted butter and sprinkled in sugar, but instead I got what seemed to be a piece of cardboard. So disappointed!
author: Alexa M.

description:
so this was the second stop on our genki night.  after genki ramen we walked over to genki crepes.  on a thursday night it was relatively crowded.  i got black sesame egg puffs while other got crepes.  i was supposed to share but i wanted to finish them.

they also sell a lot of japanese candies, snacks, and random toiletries.  even thought waiting for the crepe or egg puffs is a drag i dont mind spending the time wandering the few aisles exploring.  even though they probably dont have anything new japanese candies always have the neatest packaging!
author: claudia y.

description:
I have passed this establishment many times on way to King of Thai, but never really knew what was inside. Both my friends and coworker talked highly of this place, so my friend and I decided to be adventurous and try some of their sweet treats.

We had "snack crepes" - one strawberry, chocolate with whip cream & one strawberry, banana, nutulla with whip cream. Both were delicious and the easy-to-hold cardboard pouch helped us keep the crepe under control. Personally, I am more about the crepe itself than the ingredients, so for the crepe, I give three stars - it was a tad crispier than I like, but it wasn't burnt and reminded me of a thin fortune cookie.

As for the store in the back, Genki overprices much of the food products. You can buy all of their items for half the price at one of the many Asian markets down the street. Can't pull the wool over these ABC eyes!

For crepes, Crepes A Go Go is still my #1!
author: Jaclyn T.

description:
I love this store because it is like being on a mini vacation. I love trying to figure out what everything is and yes. It is always fascinating to see what other cultures find acceptable. Don't judge... we probably do some pretty weird stuff in their eyes too. 

My fav... Nutella, banana, and cinnamon. YUM! 

And when I am there I usually pick up a box of Delicious Meiji  brand Chocolate covered almonds!
author: Amelia M.

description:
mmmmmm, their crepes are excellent!! never soggy, always crispy and delicious. After trying a few different kinds, I settled on my own custom combination: Nutella, Chocolate Ice Cream, and Bananas. SO GOOD. This is my favorite place to go after having dinner in the neighborhood for dessert, or just for a mid-day snack.
They also have a mini-mart inside, filled with all kinds of asian snacks, toys, and necessities.
author: Erika B.

description: genki genki genki. ohh how much I love you. You have ice cream, you have crepes, you have drinks, you have candies, you have chips! and you have air freshers!???? I love you for what matter the most and thats what on the inside. Keep serving those delicious crepes and keeps those shelves stocks cause sweetie i'll be back!
author: Lind G.

description:
My friends and I have been going here for years; it's one of those places that brings back memories for us. Memories occurring there and memories of us rushing there to cheer ourselves up with crepes.

Normally I get dessert crepes; I'm not much of a savory crepe type of person. My regular is vanilla ice cream, bananas, strawberries, nutella, and whipped cream. Last time I went I tried my friend's mango ice cream, bananas, whipped cream.

There's also an Asian market area in the back; if I walk through the aisles I swear I always find something to waste money more on; like hi-chews haha. OH but they do have the air fresheners I love; I don't even know the name of it but if I smell it I'd know because it's glittery black and smells like man lol.
author: Caroline A.

description: Honestly I don't come here for dessert....I like purchasing their little Japanese candies and boxed toys. I've gotten dessert once or twice and it's ok. I can easily spend 50 bucks on little nik naks here, it gets a bit pricey but their prepackaged snack are yummy!
author: Heather H.

description:
Pretty nice staff. 
They get very crowded around 9-close.
The crepes are great! I usually get the icecream with bananas! yum
They have a large selection of imported candy and junk food.
However, the prices could be easily be beat, but its not too expensive.

I always buy my large thai tea from their open fridge for 1 dollar!

Everytime im on Clement I think about goin to Genki Crepes. 

Their smoothies are really good too!
Also the eggettes arnt that bad either. I like the plain vanilla though!
author: Tony C.

description: If yelp gave me the ability to give a million stars I would probably use them all on Genki Crepes. I have been on a dessert high lately, looking for all the best desserts the bay has to offer me. Thus, I looked up crepes and saw that this place had over a thousands reviews. I begged my friend to take me. Literally. He finally had enough of my yapping and took me there after dinner. I ordered the cheesecake, whip cream, and blueberry sauce crepe while he had a nutella and strawberry crepe. It was sooooooooooooo good! It was light and crispy with a good amount of stuffing to make it delicious and not overwhelming. I  highly debated about getting a second crepes but sadly I told  myself "no." I didn't have enough room to stuff another goody into my belly nor did I want to get a snicker from my friend since I proclaimed I was on a "diet". At the end of the night, I asked my friend if the crepe was worth all the pestering and his response was "Yes, it worth it."
author: Anna K.

description: I've only been here on weekends around 9-10pm and there has always been a line...although the staff keeps it moving fairly quickly so it's never really more than a few minutes wait.  I always get the red bean ice cream with bans crepe...don't think I've really tried anything else from here because I don't go here all that often so it's one of my only chances to get a favorite of mine...red bean ice cream.  I like how the crepes are made to order ensuring your dessert is fresh and tasty. The back 2/3 of the shop sells Asian candies, beverages, and many other items that you won't find at your local corner store. Definitely a good place to check out if you're in the area and craving something sweet. Note that this is pretty much a to-go place as there are no tables, just a single bench next to the door, but the crepes are wrapped so they're easily eaten while standing/walking.
author: Kent W.

description:
After an afternoon at the Walt Disney Family Museum, K and I worked up an appetite for some crepes. We stopped at Genki Crepes in the Inner Richmond to satisfy our craving.

The scene:

Genki Crepes is a mix between a grocery store and a dessert spot. They have a little something for everyone - crepes, boba drinks, egg puffs and ice cream. They've got an impressive assortment of imported chips and candy from all over Asia. I copped a few unusual flavors of Kit Kat bars that I've never seen before. The packaging is completely in Japanese, but it looks like the flavors might be coffee and chocolate mochi.

The food:

For egg puffs and a crepe, the total came to $4.50.

Lemon Sugar Crepe - I wanted something light, so I overlooked the chocolate ice cream and cheesecake crepe for the lemon sugar. The crepe was thin and crispy, but soft enough so it didn't crack and fall on the floor. It was very lemony and it had just the right amount of sweetness.

Egg Puffs - The egg puffs were much different that others I've had at other dessert places. Usually, each egg puff has a huge pocket of air, but not these. They were dense, chewy and crispy. The only downside was that it was a little cold by the time we got it.

I'm definitely coming back to try their other crepes. The cheesecake one sounds delicious, but I'd probably have to skip dinner to eat that one.
author: Sam L.

description:
HANDS OFF MY nutella and banana crepe!!

D-desserts to die for..ok, maybe not die for..but super yummy....
E-excellent taste...excellent and quick service
L-love the mini-mart, and hello kitty toys
I-ice cream crepes!!
C-crowded! that always shows love and legitimacy...
I-I LOVE the taste...the crepes have a great contrast between the crispy outside and warm gooey inside!
O-orgasmic nutella & banana (or nutella, ice cream and mixed fruit crepe)
U-uhh, do I need anymore reason to convince you to go?? no, I think not!
S-satiated!  yum!
author: Jac T.

description:
One of my favorite dessert spots in the city. The crepes, the egg puffs, the milkshakes.. All have endless possibilities that really satisfy your sweet tooth. And let me tell you, I am THE definition of sweet tooth. Genki is always there to satisfy my dessert needs. My favorite dessert crepe to get is a combination I ask for: vanilla ice cream, cheesecake, fresh whipped cream and nutella. It may or may not need some fruit for more balance. Possibly some banana or strawberries, or.. Both! It's up to you to decide. The possibilities are endless!!

The savory crepes look delish also, but I honestly have yet to try them. Blame my sweet tooth... But judging by the freshness and taste combinations of their other items, I'm sure I'd be very satisfied.
author: Tay R.

description:
This is the crepe place that brings me back to my childhood. My parents would eat at the chinese place next door and my sister and I would go to Genki for crepes. We would always get the ice cream crepes with TONS of whip cream. YUM. Since we were annoying hyper brats, I could just imagine how obnoxious we were.....

(now think of screaming little grubby kids who are anticipating sugar...)

YUP. We had our sticky little kid hands all over their selection of sweets and imported novelty toys. We begged our mom for quarters so we can get cheap plastic disney characters or pokemons from the coin machine.

FINALLY our wait would be over. We would get our sugar fix and get dragged out of there. 

The workers probably sighed in relief.....
author: emily g.

description:
order @%.  You heard me order @%.
OK if you don't get it, 25 (2=@, 5=%)
You'll be very happy with the #25 Crepe.
Sesame egg puffs, were ok, 
but that depends how much you like sesame.
Fake Yakult = 1, Real Yakult 2.99,
Either way Yogurt drinks are GOOOOOOOD.
author: Po L.

description:
Amazing. I passed by and the scent and sight of crepes made Genki so irresistible, I just had to order one, even though I wasn't planning on it. So much for impulse control. The prices are cheap, in my opinion, and I didn't have to wait long at all. I devoured my Nutella and strawberry crepe in under 8 minutes (approximate walking distance between Genki and my friend's place). I got some Nutella all over my sleeves, but it was too good to stop eating while walking at the same time. The slogan on their crepe sleeve, "It's so great"? Not a lie.

I think about it every so often and it makes me sad I don't have a crepe place by me. Next time I'm in town again, this will be my first stop.
author: Emily C.

description:
crispy crepes filled with strawberry ice cream, topped with fresh strawberries and whipped cream equals to.....

CONTINUOUS MOUTH ORGASM.

enough said.
author: Miss C.

description: Cute little place, makes good crepes. If you are a crepe lover, it's worth a trip. Good place for a date or a cute little gathering with the girls!
author: Amiee H.

description:
I've never had west coast style crepes. In Houston, they're soft, pancake-esque, and you eat them with a fork. Over HERE, they're made as a crisp, thin cone-like structure and pile their toppings/whatever inside the cone shape. DELICIOUS!!!

I got the cheesecake with blueberry sauce. OMG. Fresh pieces of cheesecake (with the crust) with a gooey, sweet but not-too-sweet blueberry concoction. I sat on the benches inside the store (like an Asian convenient store) munching on my crepe while talking and laughing with my friends who also got their yummy crepes. It's definitely a place where I'd go back to!
author: Becky K.

description:
Say you like crepes?  I'm not a huge, huge fan..but I do like sweets.  As a result, by association of flavor...I like dessert crepes.

Crepes here are money.  It's weird, because the store hawks all kinds of shit.  It's like a mini grocery store for snacks, etc. but also a store for some crepes and your boba lai chai fix!  Aka - tapioca balls, pearls, empty calories..whatever you want to call it.

Swing by this place if you're in the inner Richmond.  Fairly quick and it's a good stop to shop on some japanese or chinese snacks.

I'd like to add they also have those Hong Kong style street vendor Waffle-like snacks.  Pretty good..too bad its $3 vs. in HK it's like 50 cents.  Nonetheless, a taste of HK for $3 isn't bad!
author: Yup S.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE. I could have eaten 3 crepes myself but refrained and had just one - my usual strawberry and nutella. Sampled Cindy N.'s green tea with nutella as well and will probably be getting that next time. Wish I lived closer!
author: Juliana C.

description: Yum!  Nutella crepe with strawberries. The crepe portions are huge, big enough for two people to share after dinner. Place only accepts credit cards for purchases over $10.  Beware there are no places to sit...only a small bench located inside. This place can get really crowded but so worth it....it is located in a market filled with lots and lots of candy!.
author: Omi Y.

description: I absolutely LOVE THIS PLACE! This is a popular spot to get some Crepes. It's also an Asian Convenience store packed with munchies and refreshments from the Far East. On a busy Friday night, expect to wait in line to order from their sweet and savory menu. It's worth the wait. I recommend ordering the #1 Crepe on the menu. I think it consists of Vanilla Ice Cream, Nutella, Strawberries, Blueberries, and I think Mango. #SoooGood
author: Troy P.

description:
mmmmmm deliciousness

love the crepes and egg puffs here.
author: Michael E.

description:
I am a total fan of Genki and their delicious crepes. My friends introduced me to their nutella and vanilla ice cream crepes on a cold winter night and let me tell you- I didn't mind one bit eating that cold crepe. It was worth the cold hands and chattering teeth. I've since returned to try their redbean crepe, which I highly recommend! I love redbean- forreal. 

Genki also sells other random candies and foods. I bought my car freshener there because the smell reminds me of my old Sanrio erasers. Total love
author: Krystinne M.

description:
I've only recently been introduced to crepes this year and this is only my second crepes place that I've been on and I have to say that this is my favorite by far! My first time here went a lot smoother than I had expected. There must have been 20+ people in the store itself, either lined-up to order or waiting for their crepes to come and the flow of ordering and receiving our crepes was seamless! Also, it didn't hurt that they had a grocery section full of oriental goodies that are interesting to look at and would be a good buy if it wasn't so expensive! 

All-in-all, I would go back to this place whenever I want to grab a dessert or if was bored and had nothing else better to do.
author: Cedric G.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!
The store houses an assortment of products that are not common to see at an ordinary grocery or corner store.  The aisle i go to every time we are there is the candy/toy aisle that contains random yet interesting stuff, from kissing mint gum to mini toy furniture collections.  But these on the reasons why i go here, its the CREPES.  My favorite, the chocolate cheesecake crepe, is the BEST thing ever.  I can only wish that it was close to BART, or even better, have another location in the east bay.
author: Brian I.

description:
I should really give this a worse review becuase of the first time that i was here, there was a pigeon inside the building, right above the food area, and noone was trying to get rid of it.  I couldn't pull my eyes away from the bird, and inevitably i saw it poo out somewhere into the area (looked like it went either straight to the floor, or in the section where they had dirty dishes).  Still, Ugh.

But I've eaten there since, had the egg puffs (which were good) and the sweet crepes (which were much better).  So tasty, yes.  But probably not so clean.  It definitely wasn't that day.
author: Phil J.

description:
An evening at Genki;

Amir: "Drue, why do you need a miniature set of plastic sushi?"
Drue: "I don't, but look how cute they are. I WANT them."
Amir: "Drue, they are five (insert expletive here) dollars. I thought you were watching your money."
Drue: "They are cheaper than new shoes and I (insert expletive) want them."
Amir: Okay, but they are stupid and useless. Aren't the grape Pocky sticks and other snacks we already picked out enough? You could buy 2 PBRs at the bar for the same amount of money, plus you can't even pick which set you get."
Drue: "I am buying them."
Amir: "Fine, but I am NOT splitting the cost of those, they are going on a separate receipt!!"

2 hours later, at the bar, with 2 PBRs in front of us;

Drue: "Jason, look what I got!!" (as I tear into the box)
Jason: "ummm, cool."
Amir: (tearing the box out of my hand and removing the series of tiny plastic bags containing miniatures) "Let me see that!!!"
Drue: "But, but.......they are mine!!!"
Amir; (handing me 1/3 of the bags and turning his back to me to shield me from the rest) "Here you can open these ones. These are soooo CUTE!"

I know this place sells crepes but it is really the store of strange Japanese snack foods, drinks I have never heard of and crazy little knick knacks that get me excited. I could spend hours in here. I could buy tons of useless crap and foods with no nutritional value to speak of. 

In fact I might have to buy more soon because SOMEONE might steal the latest useless knick knack I just acquired.
author: Drue C.

description:
4 times in the 3 days we were here!
My bestf overdoses on the crepes here, every single kind.
She would drive from OC to SF just for these.
I enjoyed these little crispy crepes filled with goodness too.
Here's my little guide so far...
Ham + Cheese + Lettuce + Mayo: decent.
Beef Sukiyaki: yum, SAVORY
Strawberry + Banana + Nutella: basic. sour strawberries. yum.
Banana + Nutella: my personal favorite b/c bananas never fail me like strawberries.
Cheesecake + Chocolate Ice cream: EXPLOSION. too much of everything but tasty.

Cute little store with unique snacks, drinks, and toys for you to explore but easily gets crowded and packed with hungry crepe fiends like us.
author: Lisa N.

description:
Ice cream crepes from Genki is a must-do if you visit or live in San Francisco.  I associate SF with a Genki ice cream crepe.  It's an SF landmark just as much as the Golden Gate Bridge.  OK, I exaggerate but it's hard to find something like this anywhere else.

The crepe batter is thin and crispy which I really like. There are about 8 ice cream flavors and several options of fruity and other toppings, but vanilla ice cream with nutella and strawberries does it for me every time.  But beware, it ain't just a bite... it's like a meal, so make sure your second stomach is ready for it.
author: Christy I.

description:
I was taken here last night, and this was before I checked Yelp.  I like Japanese crepes because the crepe is much softer and doughier than its French counterpart.  I had a crepe with vanilla ice cream, Nutella, and whipped cream, and it was quite divine.  Unfortunately, this place is so far away.

I did have a lot of fun looking at all the Japanese candy and toys.
author: Koh K.

description:
Someone needs to stop amir a. and I. 

So we have this habit of going out for veggie/mock meat Chinese food. A ritual, really...

Something happens when you eat that shit. I mean, I know -- "Chinese food syndrome." You're hungry again right away, right? But I mean, ours has MOCK MEAT in it. It can't be the same thing...

Oh, but it IS. We are EATING MACHINES afterward. We can't be stopped. Or can we? We MUST. Somebody, please -- stop us.

So we walk up to Clement to try a new mock meat place Tuesday night... And it's closed. Luckily, our current favorite mock meat place is across the street. And open.

So we don't miss a beat. We go there instead. And we gorge. And gorge. And gorge. Sizzling rice soup? Let's try it. Fried wonton platter? Please. Eggplant? Yup. Whole crispy fried taro fish? Bring it on...

And then we decide, immediately upon leaving, that we need to take a walk to burn some of it off... 

That is, walk it off, and walk TO some more food. 

Genki Crepes.

14 blocks down Clement. That should burn some calories, right? 

Oh, who the fxxx cares. After six blocks we were totally over Bok Choy Garden and were pontificating about the Genki glow soon to appear on the horizon...

This place is CRACK! CRACK, I tell you!

I've never even had a crepe here (man, they smell good, though). I bought DRIED SQUID and "Hey, Tea!" (my favorite iced green tea import from Japan). 

What the fxxx did I buy dried squid for? And EAT it for? I don't know. Because I could. Because it was there. Because this is Genki Crepes. 

I also considered buying another miniature plastic sushi set for Drue C. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/83dXgt2nG98JJG2F7ai8AQ#hrid:Jppbqo6sTaX1qsJ3Qn1xtA) but I got distracted by the DRIED SCALLOPS. And the FISH CHEESE.

Amir got some Pocky. And some Shrimp Chips. And some other stuff. We munched the whole way home. 

So, 9 blocks back home, plus the 6 we'd walked to get to the restaurant earlier in the evening, plus the 14 to Genki, then we overshot my place and made a trip to Walgreens, back to my place, that's like 6 more blocks... It's like 35 blocks total. That's how much we walked. 

I think we earned the right to eat as much as we ate. And if you don't think so, add on the TEN BLOCKS we logged INSIDE Genki Crepes, getting our CRACK FIX!!!
author: Lisa T.

description:
If god were a crepe, heaven would be Genki Crepes.  I love this place.  The crepes here are huge and one in a million. The thinly crispy crust  covered with sweet goodness such as vanilla, nutella, strawberries and whip cream is a must have.  I get one everytime I find myself in the Richmond.  The crepes have the magical power of turning any bad day into a good one.  Long live Genki!!!

P.S.  The prices are reasonable and if you enjoy boba this is a great spot , too.
author: James M.

description: Super cute place but I like the softer crepes instead of the crunchy ones =)
author: Desi V.

description:
Had a deviously good crepe with nutella.

in the mini mart, we didn't know what anything was, but got excited anyway. Note to self, next time must grab the guy behind the counter and make him hold my hand, explain to me the various brightly colored packages and dried looking things so I can fill up my cart with mysterious goodness.
author: Liz S.

description:
Genki is miscatagorized on Yelp. It doesn't serve desserts and snacks. In an age when people take pills to wake up, pills to get through the day, and pills to go to sleep, Genki serves warm, wholesome, hand-made medicine for the soul.

Genki means healthy, happy in Japanese. You'll feel that when you try a crepe here.
author: Perci N.

description:
I've always came here whenever I was craving for crepes. I've never been here for egg puffs and decided to come here since I've been sick for the pass couple days and didn't get to eat anything besides a bowl of soup within those couple days. I was starving a craving for some egg puffs so I came here and got some after work.

They have so many choices to choose from I didn't know what to get. If I could, I wish I got all of them but I stuck with the Original ($3.00). I wanted the coconut one but I thought I needed to try the Original first because if they can't get Original right, they probably can't get the flavored ones right also.

Choices were:
Original-$3.00
Chocolate-$3.25
Coconut-$3.25
Honeydew-$3.25
Peanut Butter-$3.25
Red Bean-$3.25
Sesame-$3.25
Strawberry-$3.25
Banana-$3.25

The Original was actually really good.. It had vanilla taste to it. Some of the other Original flavors I've tried elsewhere usually lack the taste.  

As for crepes, I've had their #11-Ham, cheese, lettuce, and ,mayo ($4.75). It's a great lunch, dinner, or even late night snack option. 

Sweet crepes, I like to get the vanilla ice cream with strawberries and add nutella on top! ($4.45 + nutella)

They not only sell crepes, egg puffs, ice creams, smoothies, iced drinks, hot drinks, milkshakes, fresh juices, they have aisles of everything else. Like Asian snack aisles, hair dye, toothpaste, cotton swab, etc.  It's like a one stop shop!

Services is also friendly. Parking is rather hard to find but it IS Clement!
author: Juliane N.

description:
I was first introduced to Genki by my brothers, who told me that there was honestly no better crepe place.

I've always been a big fan of dessert crepes, but had never tried any of the savoury ones.  So I ordered the mushroom, cheese, and spinach crepe and was blown away completely.  All the flavours were perfectly balanced and it was very filling (even though when I first got it, it didn't look like much).  

I'd planned on ordering the dessert crepe, but I just couldn't eat anymore.  My friend was able to eat a pepperoni, onion, and mozzerella crepe PLUS a dessert crepe (which I had a bite of and was pretty good).  Also, joining the crowd of people gathered in front of the window to watch the crepes being made was pretty fun too.

I can honestly say that compared to all the crepe places that I've been to in the San Francisco Bay Area, Genki is one of the best places hands down.
author: Kristen D.

description:
I've tried everything here.. crepes.. egg puffs... smoothies.. tapioca.. it's all solid. They're open late (weekday at least until 11pm) and it's a good place to go after a trip from the Rock It Room, Club 50-ho's or if you're hanging in off the Clement hood late at night. It's not as good as Sophies but gets 5 stars because they are open late and have the craziest anime toys. 

If you're on a date.. and want to a nice walk.. get some crepes here and head off to Mtn Lake Park for a walk near the Lake. It'll be dark, chilly and scary but unless you're dating Linda Hamilton from the "Terminator" she'll be holding you close.
author: Dan T.

description:
By far the best place for dessert crepe. Why? Imagine a very crispy crepe, folded into a cone in which delicious ice cream, fruit, and nutella spread may be housed within. Delicious! Large enough to share, but any able bodied dessert fiend can finish it solo. To top it off, they have an assortment of ice cream flavors, from the traditional western vanilla, chocolate, strawberry, to the asian flavors such as taro, lychee, green tea etc...I love the fruit options they provide (lychee, mango, strawberries and such). My crepe combo of choice? Green tea ice cream, lychee fruit, nutella and whipped cream. YUM!  try it, you might like it. If not, create your own combo! Exciting! 

Note: Its kind of a Japanese mini-mart/crepe station. There are a few benches to sit and eat but not really a place to eat and have an extensive conversation. It's more of a grab-and-go kind of place. (Note, the last time I ate here was back in 2008...things may have changed!)
author: M N.

description:
Excellent little crepe spot and market with reasonable prices and an interesting selection, both of crepe toppings and goods on the shelves.  

Although it took a while to arrive, the dessert crepe filled with whipped cream, ample blueberry sauce and a WHOLE SLICE OF CHEESECAKE was the perfect compliment to the big Chinese dinner I had just consumed.
author: Quinn S.

description:
Genki, my friend, It feels like it's been eternity
I'm going to need another to keep my sanity
I want you, I want you bad
You could have my children, if I were a dad

I love chocolate, I love fruit.
The combination makes me toot.
Wet dreams of lychee and nutella.
Kiwi, Strawberry, Banana, hell ya.

Layer on that nutella, deep and hard
It's hot, sexy, seductive, orgasmic
I don't care the cost, just charge my card
One bite gets me high. My mind, cosmic
author: Joe Z.

description:
I'm a big fan of crepes, I remember the first time I had one... I went home and tried to perfect my own recipe. This was the first time I had a Japanese style crepe. I guess I am used to the thin, soft, and doughy French version you mostly see. I did like the change to a flaky and crunchier crepe, but still prefer my soft crepes. 

So, I ended up ordering a nutella and banana crepe with a scoop of ice cream. I waited about 5-10 minutes before my name was called. At first look, I didn't see any nutella and assumed it was in there somewhere.  I handed over the crepe to Juliane and asked if she saw any, but she assured me there was none at the bottom anywhere. SOOOOO I took the crepe to the girl behind the counter making them and told her there was no nutella. She quietly took the crepe from my hand and kind of stood there puzzled for a minute. Just when I thought they were going to make a new one, she decides to somehow take it and attempt to shove it down the sides and finish it by throwing some on the top. End result, NO NUTELLA ON THE BOTTOM HALF OF MY CREPE. The bottom turned out to be a dry, flaky, banana crepe.
author: Steven T.

description:
I've had crepes at other places before, and before you get into this review I must first confess something: I'm NOT THAT big of a crepe fan.

Gasp, I know.

At any rate, the reason I gave this place five stars is because it actually made me like crepes.  I had the crepe stuffed with vanilla ice cream and topped with pineapple (my favorite fruit) and the crepe was both soft and flaky, and perfectly offset the creamy goodness of the ice cream melting inside.  I think this crepe would be good with any fruit, so you probably can't go wrong (unless Genki crepe makes a liar out of me and serves bad strawberries or something).

In addition to the crepe flakiness and ice cream goodness, I am a sucker for cute things. While scarfing down an ice cream cake like a sugar-addicted five year old I loved looking at the little plush and plastic toys and debating on whether I should buy some Chinese desserts that induced a wave of nostalgia from my childhood.

Crepes and cuteness.  Yes, I give it five stars!
author: Shay F.

description: Oh goodness, where to begin?! Small line on a Tuesday at 10pm, but so worth it. Crepe was very quickly made once at the front to order. We got the chocolate ice cream and cheesecake crepe. Amazingly good. Could not be more perfect. The cheesecake was rich, and the chocolate ice cream combined with it was unexpectedly delicious. The crepe itself did not break and leak anything when I took a bite, which was nice, and the crepe had a good not too sweet taste. Shared between my Husband and I, it was definitely enough for 2. We will be returning to try the savory crepes one day. If you haven't tried it yet, I recommenced it!
author: Serena W.

description:
Another one of my favorite crepe places to go to whenever I'm in San Francisco. It's in close proximity to my sister's apartment in the Inner Richmond. Plus, I like hitting this place up whenever I walk around Clement.

The boyfriend's crepe of choice is chocolate ice cream with cheesecake. It's enormous, but very delicious and perfectly sized for the both of us to share :)

I finally tried egg puffs for the first time here and I must say: I approve. The thing is, they do take a long time to make. Combine that with ordering two crepes during nighttime on the weekend = extremely restless. Then again, I'm used to coming here during the week in the early afternoon. At least I amused myself with all of the little Japanese snacks and goodies they have for sale.

Sometimes I'd rather come here to get some blind-box toys than to Japantown. They actually have a decent selection to choose from!
author: Mylene A.

description:
Me and my sisters come here to satisfy our cravings for sweets. The crepes are awesome and the egg puffs comes in different flavors. The only downside is parking during the day.
I always order Sukiyaki beef and I add mushrooms and spinach sometimes... Yummy!!
author: Lilith L.

description:
I so wanted to like this place based on recommendations.  Everybody else in my party of 6 that night had already been.  "Wait, you mean the one in front of that grocery store?"  "Really, you want to go there?"  "Yeah, it's okay, not like Sophie's though."  

I attempted to put their opinions out of mind to give Gengki a fair review.  We walked up and I thought, oh, this isn't what I expected.  Ordered the vanilla ice cream, strawberries and nutella.  3 halved strawberries and 1 scoop of ice cream for $5 bucks.  WTH?  At other places the ice cream and strawberries are to the rim, but here I had to eat a good 1 inch around the crepe to even get to the ice cream.

If this was the first crepe place I had ever been to, I would have enjoyed it, but compared to my other experience it wasn't that great.  The ice cream and crepe were good.  Strawberries weren't sweet.  Servings were small.  Overall, I'd rather get crepes somewhere else.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Strawberry and Nutella crepe was really good $4. That's saying a lot because I usually do not like Nutella (I know, I know, I'm an oddity). The staff is super cute, like Sailor Moon character cute (don't hate, I LOVED Sailor Moon when I was younger)!
author: Shira O.

description:
I've been here a few times now, and in all fairness the crepes are delicious.  I also never cease to be entranced by all the little random toys they have at the endcaps of their aisles - I have no idea what they are since everything is in Japanese, though my guess would be itty bitty replicas of food and other assorted items.  For what purpose I'm not sure, but I did almost buy one (just as I was tempted last time).

I can't give them more than 3.5 stars though, and it's because it bothers my stomach a little bit everytime I eat the crepes.  I'm sure that's my fault and not theirs, but yeah, I'm blaming on them anyway.  

Sorry. :(
author: Sus... B.

description:
GEE-ZUHS!!

This place rocks my friggin socks off!! :0

The smell is so alluring and the chocolate icecream/cheesecake crepe blows my mind... Divinity in my MOUTH!! If this thing can't satisfy you, you may be insatiable!

Cute place, too... Lots of weird/cool/funky Japanese snacks and trinkets... Sugoi! Not uncommon to see some cute girls haunting this place! Open late, too! A+

God, I LOVE my new neighborhood! :) :)
author: P A U L.

description:
I tried their "Thai Tea" but when I went to taste it, it was pretty BITTER. o_0 I never in my life had Thai Tea that tasted that BAD. -_- It wasn't just me, my friends tried it too and they agreed. I went back and told them about it, and although there was some hesitation to exchange my drink they did it. I got the "Thai Tea Coffee" instead.

Of course its a crepe place & you cant go wrong with their crepes. But I'm also a firm believer if you put something on your menu, be sure its decent. 

Moral of the story: Go across the street to Quicklys. But if you dont want to cross the street ONLY GET THEIR THAI TEA COFFEE. :D
author: Anne T.

description: Soooo good.  I miss this place so much!  If you like nutella, try it with some strawberries.... OMG... so so delicious!  I'm in Chicago now and I haven't found crepes like this place!  Makes me sad!
author: Jenn C.

description:
This place is amazing.


Seriously.

I've only had dessert crepes and bought a few drinks, but the crepes are worth the walk for me. 
They're always large, filled abundantly, and fresh. 
And they're flexible about substitutions and add-ons.
author: Makenna S.

description: I love their sweet savory crepes! The vanilla ice cream crepe is good! I will normally get the nutella with banana, vanilla ice cream and whip creme on top & nothing else!
author: G P.

description:
Prices are average for crepes.
An awesome selection to choose from.
Parking on the street with meters, it's SF.
The perfect treat on a hot summer night.
They're also a convenience store.

As i'm sitting here writing this review, i want to go there right now.  I've tried the Spinach, mushroom cheese crepe and the smoked salmon, red onion, cream cheese, and wasabi crepes and they were delicious.  I've also tried the chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.  They were all so good i could get dinner and desert here and be happy all night.

Wish this place was bigger, and i wish it was closer so i could enjoy it at home.
author: Kevin C.

description:
I'm a Yelping fool.  I dragged my roommie up to the Richmond to try this amazingly Yelped crepe place and got there only to realize that we'd stumbled upon the place a month ago after eating at Spices, just around the corner.  And when we'd went there, I was not impressed.  At all.  

Sophie's in Japantown makes a way better crepe; they use better batter and more filling.  The crepes at Genki are crispy, though, which I like, but if you want a crispy crepe at Sophie's, you just tell them, "hey, can I get a crispier crepe?"  The egg puffs at Genki?  Drier than they should be.  You know those little egg puffs they sell on the street in Asia?  They're moist and full of eggy flavor.  These ones, not so much.  I was sad.  They looked tasty.  But I give Genki 3 stars instead of 2 because of their solid snack selection and the fact that even though they're not a terrific crepe place, their food's still acceptable.

Yelp gets me too excited.  I need to check in with reality sometimes, instead of following these red stars mindlessly all around town like some zoinked out Yelp cronie.
author: Diana Y.

description:
Genki means "fresh."  Per the site, it also means "lively and good-spirited."

My friend and I popped into this place after eating Thai a couple doors down. We swore we were full off Pad-Se-Ew, but after seeing the line, we were too curious to pass up the opportunity to see what all the buzz was about.  With a $10 credit card minimum, we ended up getting a sweet crepe each and two bags of candy.  While waiting for our crepes, we experienced the funniest, janky (not to be confused with Genki) situation.  

An order came up, so customer #1 picked up the two crepe items, examined them, then turned to her friends and said, "I don't think these are what we ordered."  Before she could turn around to tell the worker that the order was wrong, her friends "nabbed" a few berries off of the top and popped them in their mouths.  As soon as she turned back, customer #2 who ordered the two crepes, approached the counter to claim them.  Cust. #1 looked stunned, slightly embarrassed, but 'fessed up, "oh, um, well my friend sort of nabbed a few berries off the top, but I'll totally pay you cash for it."  Cust. #2, looking confused and not satisfied with the offer was puzzled.  Fortunately, the manager offered to make cust. #2 a new one, and add cheesecake to the 'nabbed' one to make it into the creation cust. #1 originally ordered.  It was a Seinfeld moment.  You had to be there.

I ordered the fresh strawberries and whipped cream, and added bananas to it, while my friend ordered the banana, honey and almond crepe.  Both were delicious, but definitely too much for one person to finish off.

Genki--"fresh" crepes in the dopest way possible, "lively" crowd of customers, and "good-spirited" workers willing to solve "nabbed" situations.
author: Liza S.

description:
So let me just start by saying that I have no idea about crepes. What makes one good, bad or excellent. But today I went for a visit to my local Genki crepe shop for the second time and loved it. I went by myself, ordered a crepe and fresh carrot juice, sat at one of their tables in front and took in the sun.  

The crepe was made right in front of me with fresh ingredients. The crepe itself was sweet and delicious and I enjoyed every bite of it. The staff is always super nice and eager to help. I've never purchased anything from the rest of their store so I can't really comment on that but it's there if I need it.

Just a great place to go on a weekend for a cheap and good meal. As long as I live in this neighborhood I will continue to go here when I can.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
I am asian, I love snacks, i love ice cream. whenever i drive pass this area and if it's not cold. I often stop by to Genki. 

I usually order my Lychee Ice cream with red bean paste all the time. It's so good. Also, Genki sells some candies and snacks ( japanese snacks) and other random cutie things, something like Sanrio products. 

Plus, fast service.
author: Sasitorn O.

description:
Mannn... I'm totally craving genki crepes right now.

My usual is the strawberry with nutella or whipped cream.

my one gripe... WHY DO THEY MAKE ME CHOOSE BETWEEN THE TWO!? Seriously every time I go there, I hesitate for a good 15 seconds thinking, do I want nutella? Whipped cream? Man... I want both... but I don't want to pay more for it. 

So I always end up getting nutella since whipped cream gets the crepe all soggy since it melts so fast in the hot crepe. Never once have I regretted making the decision for nutella, though I STILL want just a nice dollop of whipped cream on top. The crepe is nice a crispy with a slight vanilla flavor and sweetness. The heat nicely melts my nutella and compliments the tartiness of the fruit. YUM. 

I have also lived large and got the strawberry, ice cream and whipped cream crepe. If I could re-do it, I would have asked for nutella in place of the whipped cream only because after the first few bites of my crepe, all the whipped cream and strawberries were gone. They need to put more strawberries in there. 

4 stars. WHY? The strawberries aren't THAT fresh. You can tell they've been sitting around all pre-cut for a while b/c they're kind of bruised looking, but flavor wise its fair enough. I'm going to knock them for that violation only because the pre-cut strawberries at yogurt shops aren't all bruised and ugly so why shouldn't these be the same?

And Bubble tea here is AITE. 

Will I come back? Of course, I have, and I did, and I will!
author: Irene C.

description:
I love this little shop of Japanese/Asian snacks!  Gotta buy them roasted baby crabs---great for late night study snacking! 
I love the crepes (crispy) and fillings are always great.  I love how this place is open late.
author: Grace M.

description:
Genki has the best of the best crepes!!!  Genki makes other crepe places look like really bad wannabes.  One bit of Genki's crepes would make you scream, "Now this is what a crepe should taste like!!"

I think this might be the only crepe place in the bay area that have really crispy crepes. My favs are Green Tea Lychee, Cheesecake Nutella, Strawberry Mango. YUM!!!  The egg puffs are good too but I perfer egg puffs from Eggettes.

Genki is also a Japanese snack convenient store.  They have tons of Japanese candy and cute anime toys. Instant ramen and Japanese bottled drinks.  They even have Japanese beauty products sold there!
author: Jannifer H.

description:
Bailed on dessert at Slanted Door to drag the party here. Genki Crepes is worth the trip from across town, down the street or escape from overpriced $9 desserts. Parking can be a bit of a bear. A few laps around the blocks and you will eventually find something. Parking far away (a few blocks) is not bad, Clement St. has many stores to admire along the way.

Genki gets crowded as the night wanders on. We found a somewhat empty version this time. Promptly placed orders for four crepes. Number 1, 8, 24, and 7. You can order by number or type. Make sure to walk into the store front to place an order. They ring you up at the same time. Find a seat on the bench inside or outside, purchase some Super Poky or find that bag of Super Lemon. 

Number will be quickly called. Number 94! Rush up to the counter and get ready to dig into the delight. Crunchy on the outside with all the goodness packed in. Went the standard strawberry, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream route. They make the whipped cream fresh and get their ice cream from elsewhere. 

Nothing like the pleasure of crepes on a cold night. Price is right, and you can always eat more than three.
author: Ryan G.

description:
I got an account just so that I could rate this place. 

I'm a very picky crepe eater. I like my crepes crispy on the outside, not soft and that is surprisingly difficult to find. I really like the Nutella and Vanilla Ice cream crepe. However, if you ask for strawberries as an extra topping, prepared to get 1 strawberry cut into 3 slices for .50 cents. Other than that this is my absolute favorite place to go to. 

Plus, while you wait for your crepe you can scour the aisles for Asian candy and drinks!
author: April K.

description: Whenever I visit the bay area I always make sure there's time to come to this place. It's awesome, I always get the green tea ice cream and lychee crepe!
author: Alice T.

description:
Japanese items galore at this little market/crepe store. From candy to snacks to sweets to little keychains/toys to spices/sauces to drinks. So cute, I wanted to try and buy everything! But I only came here for one thing, and the only thing that I've been longing to try here...Crepes!  

Strawberry, Green Tea ice cream, and Nutella Crepe: Under ice cream crepes, they only had mango ice cream and strawberries (I wanted this fruit only), which I substituted the mango ice cream for green tea. Added nutella and asked for my crepe to be extra crispy. The crispy crepe was indeed crispy like an ice cream cone, which I liked. I hate it when my crepe becomes a soggy mess towards the end with crepes from other places. 3 halves of fresh strawberries were on top and I found more thin slices on the very bottom covered in Nutella. 

The only con that prevented me from finishing my crepe to the end was there was too much Nutella to the point where it was delicious at the beginning, since it was warm and gooey. With the ice cream and extra crispy crepe, the nutella morphed into a hardened mess. Which I had to sadly say Bye-Bye to for my bottom half of my crepe. The BF's strawberry ice cream and kiwi nutella crepe was good too, but he ended up tossing the bottom of his too. I think it's a sign that I sadly need to SHARE a crepe. No way!  I'll just make sure to say less nutella (drizzle instead of spreadin' it, fo shizzle!).

P.S. They sell Smart Water here too. My savior from being like the peanut butter licking dog in the "Got Milk" commercial, but in my case...substitute it with NUTELLA! My crepe was pretty damn good though.
author: Tracy T.

description:
I have gone here a couple times already and finally have time to write a review.  I am from the East Bay and every time I make it out to this part of The City I try to come here.  I gotta say each time I've been here, they didn't disappoint.

My 1st time going here I got the Strawberry w/ vanilla ice cream crepe.  One word... delicious.

2nd time I got the Cheesecake w/ vanilla ice cream & nutella.  Two words... Hella Delicious.  I don't know what kind of cheesecake they use, but it was so moist and rich.  Sooooo good.  I could have eaten the cheesecake by itself.  But with the added strawberries, whipped cream and nutella, it just set it off.

If you want a good dessert crepe.  Genki Crepes is the way to go.  Can't go wrong.
author: Chris L.

description:
Even when I am walking by this store the aroma of the crepes being prepared captivates me and reminds me that it's been a while since I've had a crepe from Genki. My favorite is the #1 snack crepe with strawberries, whipped cream, vanilla ice cream and nutella. It does not take long at all for your order to be prepared. The look of the crepe is very appealing and the taste is even better. The shell has a nice and crispy texture, the whipped cream and nutella are put in different places, and it is all wrapped up nicely. For me, it gets better as I finish because the bottom becomes soft and rich with whipped cream which adds even more flavor to the amazing crepe.
 
Genki is a great store to grab a quick and filling dessert. It even has aisles where you can browse through snacks and drinks among other things while you wait.
author: Pryor V.

description: Oh Genki's, you are so tasty. I am not a big fan of crepes because I don't like the mushy-ness. But this place changed my mind about them. The crepes here are so crispy and fresh. I absolutely love Genki's. I usually get mango and something. I'm not into nutella either (I know I sound picky) so I usually get it with whipped cream and ice cream. The part I love most is the actual crepe. The place smells so good and it's also a little market, how convenient! Everytime I go, it's always packed. Another added bonus- this place is open late. 5 stars!
author: Dara S.

description:
Pretty good. Not bad. 3.5 stars. 

Tried the savory crepes on one trip. Pretty good, but wanted it to be more flavorful. The next time we went, we had the egg puff in original vanilla flavor. Again, wanted something more. Wanted it to be sweeter. 

Oh well. It is cheap food(recession food!) and fast service. Cute asian snacks and knick-knacks. 

They also have limited ice cream flavors and a cooler full of all sorts of asian drinks and Pellegrino.
author: Caroline C.

description:
I agree with most of the Yelpers!  Great tastey dessert after dinner snack.  I go just about every weekend after dinner with my girl friend and have a nutella, strawberry and banana OMG!  

I also love the community of kids and other adults that pour in and out of this cute little store on Clement.  You are in for a real treat if you haven't been to this destination before :)
author: Patrick W.

description:
Super Tokio was closed so i walked across the street to check out Genki's candies. I ordered a  cheesecake and green tea ice cream crepe and browsed the store while I waited. Great selection of Japanese candies and beauty items. Tons of Japanese eyeliner, mascara, face washes, and hair products. The funny thing is that Super Tokio sells the same items like 50 cents cheaper. Nice drink selection though! 

When my crepe order finally came I was surprised to see a monster cone filled with 4 heaping slices of plain cheesecake, a large scoop of ice cream, and a dollop of whipped cream. It was very reminiscent of the crepes in Harajuku except Genki doesn't use chocolate sauce. So glad that my bf and I shared or else I would have felt like a major fatass. Definitely like this place better than Sophie's even if parking's a B*TCH!
author: becky s.

description:
YUMMMM - I love Banana and Nutella crepes but their banana, honey and almond one has me questioning what my favorite is! At $4 a pop its fantastic!

It's so good. It's So good! It's so good. It's So good! It's so good. It's So good!
author: Jessica L.

description:
I came here after eating way too much galbi at Korean BBQ House. I was already full so why did I order the chocolate ice cream with cheesecake crepe? Because I'm insane, that's why. 

You've heard of chocolate sprinkles or peanuts as ice cream toppings but you've probably never had big hunks of cheesecake as a topping. I was expecting the chocolate ice cream to be good and the cheesecake to be mediocre but it was actually the opposite. The cheesecake was good quality but there was little bits of ice in the chocolate ice cream. The crepe itself was pretty unappetizing and I ended up tossing it after I finished the ice cream and cheesecake. 

Overall, a pretty average dessert. I'd come back but only if I was already in the area.
author: Aaron V.

description:
Yummmmmmmmmmmmmyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy
Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
The lychee ice cream in my nutella crepe is oh so good!
thinking about it is making me drool.......
And while you are waiting for your crepe, you can wander around and look at the cute Japanese snacks/candy/whatever.
This is one of my favorite crepe places, the crepe is hot and fresh and a little crispy, and it taste oh so delightful with the lychee ice cream and nutella! Parking can be a pain though...... that's the only down side, and probably the fact that there's not really proper seating. I usually just sit on the bench and finish it, I feel like a little kid when I do it haha.
someone get me one NOW! mmmmmmmmmmmm
yummyyyyyyyyyyyyyy
author: Jenny W.

description:
Genki never fails when it comes to hot fresh crepes and Japanese snacks!

My fav : nutella strawberries and banana... numnumnum. looks like i'm heading there tonight! haha
author: Sheena S.

description: This place is OK...I don't see why people are so sold on this place with 5 stars.  The crepes are good....but not the best....I like Sophie's crepes in Japan town much more.  The price is decent...my favorite here is mango or green tea with Lychee and strawberries but I've had combinations of almost everything here since I work nearby and I'm always eating at Burma Superstar across the street.  This place is more of a mini-snack market...but all the goodies in here are EXPENSIVE!  I'm referring mainly to the snacks and candies...they were all over a dollar or two more expensive than the Chinese market across the street selling the same exact snacks....overpriced snack market...best crepes for the Richmond area but not in SF...parking sucks around the area.. ok la...
author: Eric H.

description: HUGE crepes for a delicious price too. I've been here before, but it was late and I didn't catch the name. Found ,myself in the neighborhood yesterday and since it was a special day, we had to get a treat. I had Mango Ice cream with blueberries and whip cream. My Boy had Nutella and Banana with vanilla ice cream. SO good. I also dig their egg puffs. They offer different flavors too. This time, I had chocolate. I could eat Egg Puffs every day. The prices are good for crepes and ice cream and they have a great variety. The only reason they aren't 5 stars is the service. Nice enough, but the girl behind the register really didn't know or even understand what she was doing and that can be frustrating.
author: Jena D.

description:
Crepes are my new love; forget my previous obsession with coffee, chocolate, Gerard Butler and Scott Weiland (oh...sigh!)...watch out Crepes!  Mommy's comin' to getcha!  

I lost my crepe virginity (why does this always sound worse than it is?) on Friday at Genki Crepes.  I ordered the green tea ice cream with lychee crepe; my friend ordered the strawberry ice cream crepe with strawberries and whipped cream.  The experience was out of this world.  Is this what I've been missing?  Why did I wait so long to experience such pleasure?  

Now that I've started, I'm afraid I won't be able to stop. Genki has earned my undying devotion.  Next time...the vanilla with nutella crepe!  Yum!!!
author: Daniela L.

description: Visited Genki's to have crepes for the first time in 2008, and made sure I went back again during my 2011 visit. So many delicious options, generous serving size for affordable prices.
author: Nancy T.

description: One of the best places in San Francisco to get a crepe. They are open late and there are always people there.
author: Anthony V.

description:
I didn't know it could get THIS good, holy crap. These things could end Wars. I've only tried the desert versions so far but oh man, they are so damn good it's hard to get anything else. Though I have tried a friends milkshake and it was damn good in itself. They also have lots of other seemingly rare candies, ice creams and drinks. Mochi balls are MUCH cheaper here than @ one of those specialty grocery stores!

I live clear across the city and it's well worth the drive, only 15 mins through the park, and you will not regret it... just don't get on a scale ;c)
author: Jim O.

description:
This place was so freaking great!

The last time I had a crepe was probably when I was in France 6 years ago.  I was always under the impression that crepes were to be filled with fruit & sweet stuff, whipped cream etc.

Van Ness D. ordered my crepe while I was picking out some kiwi gummy thingys to snack on.

She ordered the Nutella & banana for herself, I got the fresh spinach, mushroom & cheese.

The Nutella & banana was really good, but the fresh spinach, mushroom & cheese was pure heaven.  It was so good, before we were even finished eating either crepe, we ordered another!

There are two or three mini tables you can sit at inside to eat if you don't want to take your food to go.

I can't wait to come back here and try some different ones.

A BIG thank you for Grace for taking us here to eat!
author: Karlita C.

description:
I don't remember the other crepes, but the Lychee Ice Cream with Red Bean crepe was yummy in my tummy. So, I'm a fan of THAT. 

The things in the store are a little pricey.
author: Janet C.

description:
WTF!!! Genki Crepes is to deliciousness as Kobe Bryant is to best basketball player in the world! In the first week that I moved into Inner Richmond, I probably went here 4/7 days! It's just so tempting, especially when you can smell the freshly made crepes and the sweet eggettes from outside. 

The green tea ice cream, nutella, and whipped cream crepes are so good, they're sinful! 

This place is clutch when you're feenin for something sweet to add to your taste buds after eating at one of the neighborhood's salty Asian restaurants.  

Mmm
author: James C.

description: How can you go wrong with a cheesecake and chocolate ice cream crepe? I mean, come on. If you're not feeling that intense, there's always nutella and strawberries. I've never had a savory crepe here, but all the dessert crepes are great, and pretty cheap. Plus, while you wait you can check out all of usual and not-so-usual japanese snacks and trinkets. If you need a bad translation laugh, check out the descriptions on the bags of fruit gummies. This is one of those great places in the city that you may have never heard of, but all your friends know about it, and for good reason.
author: Louis D.

description: Genki crepes have pretty much become a staple in my diet since I moved to the Richmond almost 3 years ago.  Luckily (for my waste line) I live far enough away now that I don't come here too often but its become the traditional meeting spot for my roommate and I after a long day.  We were recently here celebrating two years of living together.  I got my usual banana nutella crepe and, as usual, it totally hit the spot.  This place doesn't have a tone of seating and isn't much on atmosphere but the crepes are delicious- just the right about of crispy without being burnt.  Mmmm just thinking about it makes me hungry!
author: Heather D.

description:
The savory crepes are so-so, but that's not why people come here.  I love coming here for the ice cream crepes!  Its fun to make your own crepe.  We went with the standard strawberry with nutella, but got more adventurous the next time with lychee with red bean.  Both were delish!  They also have the coconut egg puffs which are more popular in Asia, but that also was good.  This place is also a market for japanese candies and snacks.  Try the little Pinkie's Candy at the counter.  They are like flavored breathmints, but extremely addicting.  I'm waiting for my next craving so I can grab me another crepe from this place.

*nom nom*
author: Steve H.

description:
Mmm! I had the green tea ice cream crepe with red bean and it was soo goood! The crepe itself was super fresh and crisp! I loved eating away at the edges. It was almost like a cookie! But it wasn't overly crisp either. Just enough to have good texture contrast and also the ability to withstand and hold up the crepe filling.

I love green tea and red bean. I just think it's the perfect combination and this crepe definitely had it all!
