The green tea ice cream was really flavorful and the texture was nice and firm, not all melted and liquidy. The red bean was also running throughout the entire crepe--not just at the top! So you got delicious red bean in every bite. 

Even after a big lunch I definitely had plenty of room for a Genki crepe!
author: Elaine L.

description:
My favorite banana crepe with nutella,,,,i Love it,Nothing especial on this place,but there crepe are awesome..

awww hell yeah.
If i we're you,if you're craving for dessert try this place..
author: janelle t.

description:
Expansive crepe options! I like that their crepes are slightly crispy. I wish they wouldn't keep their ice cream were rock solid frozen, however, I don't like gnawing on ice cream and feeling my teeth freeze over.

Browsing unexplainable drinks in the cold case is always fun. Out of curiosity, we bought a small metallic pouch resembling an IV-drip that purportedly contained a high-fiber drink. We lost our nerve, however, and it still sits in our own fridge.
author: Stacy J.

description:
I like this place because their crepes are crispy. In most other places, their crepes are too soft to me. Well, it is totally a personal preference. My favorite ones are nutella and nutella with banana.

Another must-try is their egg puffs. It is a snack that I miss so much from my hometown. Outside is a bit crunchy and inside is soft and airy. It is perfect. Although there are different flavors, including red beans and chocolate, original is my most favorite. Genki has the best egg puffs I have had in the whole Bay Area.

Another thing I like about Genki is a mini-Asian convenient store. It is stocked with all kinds of stacks and drinks from Japan and Hong Kong. I usually buy a bottle of Japanese iced milk tea or yogurt drink to go with my crepe or egg puffs, and it is a perfect "dessert set" after dinner at another restaurant.

This place has a shorter line and a lower price and put more fillings in in the crepe than Sophie's Crepes in Japantown, which I would never go back again. However,  at Genki, it would have been nicer if the cash register were a bit friendlier.

Because it is on that part of Clement where there are many eateries, parking can be a problem if you don't go at the right time. I only go to SF on Saturdays, and after 9:30 pm would be the best time to find a spot.
author: Edmund L.

description: Nutella and Strawberry crepe is da bomb here! I think it's the best combo here. The place is efficient, but the waiting area can get a bit crowded. They also have a lot of japanese snacks, beauty products and cute products in the store. I wish they had another location.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
my favorite crepe store! the crepes consistantly come out thin and crispy. both sweet and savory crepes are excellent.

for savory: there's a spinach, mushroom, and mozzarella crepe that is delish! also there's a turkey avocado one that is equally as mouth watering.

for sweet: the ever so simple butter and sugar crepe...sometimes the best foods come from uncluttered simplicity. but if you want to clutter it up with fruits, ice cream, and nutella...i definitely won't object!

i wish this store was next to my house. i'd frequent it daily and turn into a whale...but gosh i'd be one happy whale :)
author: Charmaine L.

description:
I thought it is only crepe.  Why so many people talk about this?   I am not too thrilled with those soft crepe.  

When I make to this tiny store with my family, I am greeted with simles.  All customers seem happy and very satisified.  You can feel the atmosphere.  I order 2 crepes with ice-cream.  What can I say?  I am hooked the minute I take my first bite.  I know I will come back many more times or whenever I get the chance to make to the city.  

We also order the chocolate egg puff for my boys.  They are so so.  I think the crepe is the only choice for me from now on.
author: Becca Y.

description:
This is my favorite place to get a dessert crepe.  They use fresh fruit and fluffy whipped cream.  The ice cream is soft, cold, but not frozen (never any ice chunks).

And while you wait, you can browse their aisles for Asian snacks.  I always walk out with more than I bargained for, and also a very full and satisfied tummy afterwards.
author: Jenny L.

description:
4 stars for the awesome cheesecake and ice cream crepe!  I've never seen any dessert crepes at any cafe/restaurant that come with cheesecake as a filling and it was a treat, even though I was already full from dinner.  The crepe normally comes with chocolate ice cream, but I decided to order it with strawberry ice cream instead -YUM!  

I love the fact that they fold up the crepe so that it can be placed in a paper cone - you can walk around Clement without spilling cheesecake and ice cream all over your new shoes.  The crepe was crisp, and the filling consisted of a large scoop of ice cream and several slices of cheesecake.  Definitely a decadent dessert and its best if shared.

The store not only offers a variety of dessert and savory crepes, but there is also a lot of Japanese snacks and candies within the store.  I'd definitely go back to try out more of the crepes and get some of those snacks!
author: Angela H.

description: They are open late, I will give them that. Otherwise, sort of over priced for what it is. I got a turkey crepe, it was not bad, fresh avocado, and melted cheese. If you are drunk and its late, go for a pizza  at nazarios or king of thai next door.. this place is more of a novelty but not worth the price .
author: Try E.

description: ...place seemed delicious but too bad cashier girl had a bad day and my god her attitude was just awful, walked away!
author: R. L.

description:
From the Visa Website:

Minimum Purchase
Visa merchants are NOT permitted to establish minimum transaction amounts, even on sale items. They also are not permitted to charge you a fee when you want to use your Visa card.

When I mentioned this to them AND told them that I would contact Visa, they ignored me and told me that they didn't care. how rude...
author: Alicia V.

description:
So ours friends from San Jose were in the city a couple of nights ago and gave us a call last minute to meet up. They were thinking a sweet treat of some kind so we decided to meet them at Genki. I had never been before but discovered it on Yelp! The actual place was alittle random...its really a market with the crepe making magic in the front and nowhere really to sit down just a couple of spots that get easily filled up. We were there on a wednesday night at 9p.m. and it was busy!!

Anyways the crepes were slammin! They are crispier than your usual crepe and presented to you like a ice cream waffle cone. Which you can get ice cream if you choose. I had the marshmellow and coconut and its was yummy! Our friends both got nutella with strawberries and after eating they wanted another one! My husband got a savory one cuz he had missed dinner and was very happy with his choice but would like to go back and try a sweet one. 
Thanks Yelpers for my new fav sweet spot!
author: kelly p.

description:
This is the type of hidden gem that I love to find. Giant delicious crepes that make a perfect dessert treat, making it worth it to venture off Geary.

I decided to make my own creation and ordered the green tea ice cream crepe with red bean paste. The crepe is rolled around in a cone shape where the ingredients are placed inside. The crepe was huge - a perfect size for sharing. The taste of the crepe tasted a lot like a fortune cookie, without to hard cookie-like crunch.
author: Cristofer P.

description: Hands down I love the crepe with vanilla ice cream and nutella and hold the whip cream, please. The sesame egg puff is really good, but it got a little too sweet overtime.
author: Janet Z.

description:
Ordered the crepe with green tea ice cream and a hot thai milk tea.

The neon green ice cream was good but the crepe batter was disgusting.  I ended up tossing it away after eating the ice cream.

The hot thai milk tea was yucky.  Too sweet, no essence of tea, definitely from one of those 3 in 1 type packaged drinks.  Ya know powdered milk, sugar, and tea extract, just add water and voila. 

Too much hype. Its cool if you want to pick up the pre packaged snacks or ...  actually that's it.
author: Sun T.

description:
Big cheap crepes.  By big I mean huge.  We got 2 dessert crepes, nutella + banana and some other cheesecake + blueberry creation they had.  Both were rich, delicious, and filling.  They were much bigger than we anticipated and we were stuffed afterwards.

The shop has a wide vareity of Japanese trinkets, snacks, candies and such to buy while you wait for your crepes.  I don't really have anything negative to say, they satisfied my sweet tooth completely.
author: Mary R.

description:
Open until 10:30 ... 
ice cream, 
walking distance of Mike's apartment,
 the trip there includes a nice stroll past  Alpha Bar, G3 Club, and sometimes Fizzy's ... 
it's become a weekly, sometimes more, ritual.

Love it.
author: Alex C.

description: Small place - with amazing crepes! We had bannana and nutella.  Its definitely a large portion - so be hungry or prepared to share.  Not much place to sit and hang out.  Its actually a Japanese store that happens to make crepes.  The worst case scenario the wait tends to be ~15-20mins.
author: Bhavin M.

description:
There is nothing like getting your Genki on, on any given night around 10 pm this spot is packed with young people. It is worth standing in line and waiting for your Nutella and strawberry crepe with whipped cream !
This  is a very San Francisco spot LOVE it!!
author: Pez B.

description: Great crepes, with a great selection of them. The wait was long when I went there, but the store has a bunch of interesting stuff, so you can have fun looking around in your free time.
author: Zach H.

description:
crepe+nutella+strawberries+ice cream+whipped cream=how can you go wrong.

for less than $5 you can get a cheap dream dessert all wrapped up in a crepe that you can take anywhere.

there are 2 little benches to sit on so don't expect to sit at any tables (the crepe place is just the front area of a japanese candy/trinket store). they're not exactly friendly, but one bite of the ice cream crepe, and you'll forget about it.

it's no gourmet dessert but it gets 5 stars for the category of quick and easy desserts. I'd definitely go back!
author: Traci H.

description: All the crepes look delicious but I decided to try the egg puffs and I was not disappointed. Their like crunchy little puffs of goodness. Great selection and reasonably priced.
author: Ivy B.

description:
Awesome little place to get dessert after a nice meal on Clement or California Street!  I highly recommend you visit this store for their selection of various cookies, candies, treats and more!

Can't think of a gift?  Before visiting Genki, pop into one of the stores on Clement (i.e., Super Tokio) and purchase a cheap ceramic bowl and fill it with some hard to find import candies and goodies from Genki.  Trust me, unique sweets in a presentable (and functional) decorative bowl will make anyone smile!!
author: Dorothy S.

description:
Wow, I didn't expect such high reviews for this place. I used to really love it, back when I made more trips up to the city and knew less around San Jose. I would walk around the snack area and collect things into my palms. I'd have to tell myself "No, three packs of ice cream would never survive the hour drive back to San Jose. Stop staring!"

Now that I make regular trips to Mitsuwa Market and have Nijiya bookmarked to check out asap, I don't need to go to Genki for Japanese sweets. So what's left? The Crepes? The gelato? For Crepes I like to go to French places and for gelato to italian places... if not for any other reason, but that it's just higher quality. Put low quality ice cream and low quality crepes together and what do you get? Nothing of note. 
The flavors are original (at least compared to french and italian places), and it's a nice pit stop to stock up on haichu after a big dinner at Brothers Restaurant, but it's not really worth it just to go there. I'm sure there are better places to get japanese crepes.. dianasaurus suggests Sophie's... well I'll have to see about that!
author: Sasha W.

description:
Try their Green Tea Ice Cream with Lychee Crepe.  You wouldn't be disappointed!  Green Tea Milkshake also hits the spot.

I returned to try their tapioca too...pretty good too.  The pearls were soft and chewy.  No sweetness to it though.  I had the peach juice tapioca...and it was quite peachy!!  Made with real fruit not powder mix!
author: Mick S.

description:
You can't miss this dessert store/snack shop. The mere whiff of waffles and crepes draws you in. Serving up indulging ice cream crepes, HK eggettes, sundaes, boba drinks, I always try to save room for dessert.

Not only is this a great dessert stop, but you can also find tons of Japanese, Chinese snacks ranging from candies, cookies, drinks, and instant noodles, plus various cartoon/anime figurines. I only wished they had a larger seating area for customers to enjoy their purchases. 
 
What I found strange, was that they also sell beauty products and condoms on the side. I'd say, "Save that for a drug store!" There are little kids that come into this place.
author: Jeanette W.

description:
My friends call the egg puffs crack. We are on a downward spiral. We huddle on the corner sampling personal favorites: for me, peanut, for M, coconut, for R, coffee, for M, chocolate. We polish off whole dime bags and immediately stake out our next fix. 

And when the warm flavored pancake dough runs out, there's always fish jerky and Japanese-clad Snoopy figurines to be had. 

Egg puffs, man. Gimme gimme gimme! Yeeeeaaaaaahhhhhh...tilt head back, close eyes, submit...
author: Stephanie B.

description: I really love the variety of crepes they offer. My favorite crepe is the ham and pineapple combo. The second time I came here, I thought, "Ham and pineapple on a crepe? No way," but I wasn't in the mood for something sweet and my friends all ordered it too, so my next thought was, "Oh well, why not?" It was soooooo good. I totally recommend ordering it. It's really tasty, if not better than eating it as a pizza. Prices are fairly inexpensive and the wait isn't too long.
author: Vicky P.

description: I am usually not a crepe person when it comes to desserts (probably because I haven't had very good crepes - either the ice creams is too melted, or the crepe is too soggy, or it's just too much trouble and messy to eat) so I usually get the egg puffs here because they're the best I've found in the bay area.  And then I decided to try the Crepes.  I got the strawberry ice cream with strawberries, whipped cream and nutella.  These guys know how to make crepes.
author: Nin J.

description:
Super Giant Pocky!!!! Super Giant Strawberry Pocky!!!! 

Woah super giant pocky costs $12. That just seems wrong. It's a frosted breadstick! Nonetheless the store is superfun with tons of asian candies and snacks and the smell coming out the door is just divine. 

I only had the lemon & sugar crepe as I was stuffed full from Burma. But everything looked and smelled delicious. The store also looks much more cheerful than the other boba/dessert places.
author: Princess Pompom Patootie W.

description: Like their crepes and ice cream. I had the chocolate cake one. It was good, but it tasted more like brownies, than cake.
author: Jazzlynn L.

description: second time coming here and its pretty good. It is always busy and there are plenty of options of what kinda of crepe you want to try/eat. Be warned, if you're getting ice cream don't expect it to come on a plate, its a to-go thing!
author: Linda L.

description: Terribly underwhelming. The crepe itself is too salty for my liking especially paired with ice cream. The quality of the green tea ice cream is very mediocre. I am having a very hard time understanding what all the rave is about...must be all the overpriced Asian candies and novelties in the other half of the store people find to intimidating to walk into a legit Asian grocery store to find.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
French food, in a Japanese Supermarket, made by Mexicans. 

If the ethnic diversity is not the reason for how great their crapes are, I'm not sure why that is. Most people get their dessert and snack crepes, I opt for the Savory crepes, green onion chicken and mozzarella. 

Aside from the obvious, Genki Crepes is also a supermarket. Filled with interesting collectibles like, tiny cats in litter boxes, and collectable women's breasts in various colored bras. These are but a few of the amazingly finds during your unregretable visit.
author: F B.

description: Every time I visit San Francisco, I always have a sweet tooth craving for some crepes.  I have had a ton of crepes, but my favorite type of crepes are the ones that comes in cone as they are usually thin, crunchy, and tasty which is how they make it at Genki's. I had thought I have had found the perfect crepes at Sophie's in Japantown, but when I found out that there was a Genki's Crepe across from Burma Superstar I had to get my crepe fix. This was my first time at this location, but I believed that Genki is a chain as there used to be a location in Rowland Heights. However, to my disappointment they've been shut down now for some time. They also had a small convenient store with your typical asian drinks, snacks, and treats. I customized my own crepe with nutella, strawberries, and of course the green tea ice cream which is absolutely perfect. My boyfriend even thought it was the best dessert crepe he ever had. Definitely go here, it's delicious!
author: Ann D.

description:
BEST discovery!

Beware, it's in a convenience store. But oh soooo worth it!
The crepes are delicious, warm and crunchy and soft all at once. Like an ice cream cone on steroids. I was scared at first: a classic French crepe with Asian toppings? Result = Best Desert Ever! 
I was a classic French crepe girl, and was at first upset that this crepe did not live up to the French name. Then I had a couple more bites and now these are the only crepes I want! 
I always get the red bean paste with green tea ice cream - a very good combination. It's not on the menu, but ask for whatever combination you want and they'll do it. They are quite large, my husband and I split one after dinner. And we come here often! 

Got the egg puffs once, bland and boring. I wanted to throw them away and get a crepe instead.

There will be a line, but it goes fast.

The only thing this place needs is to ditch the store and replace with tables. But even standing out in the cold to eat them is totally worth it.
author: Zee S.

description: I ordered the almond milk tea with tapioca, and it was terrible. The tea was so gritty that I just couldn't drink more than a few sips of it. My friend ordered the nutella banana crepe and raved about it, so maybe bubble tea just isn't their strong suit.
author: Pema L.

description:
Dude!  Cheesecake crepe with blueberry sauce.  E'nuf said.
Gaining weight just thinking about it.  Sad to say, I've had it - and I want more.
author: Denise M.

description: If you are craving crepes after visiting a restaurant on clement street this is the place to go to satisfy that sweet, sweet satisfaction (and keep your wallet still slightly full). Along with crepes you can choose asian candies, drinks, toys, and snacks (and instant noodles if you need some for the food pantry). I'm a fan of this place but I don't come here often enough to give it all 5 stars.
author: Marie G.

description: My favorite crepe place and it's walking distance from my pad!!!  I love the savory crepe that has spinach, choice of cheese (i like mozerella), mushroom and I add avocado if it's in season!!!  Yummy...now onto dessert!  I love the chocolate cake with whipped cream and chocolate sauce and I add fresh strawberries!  Oh my gosh, this review is making me hungry.  Anyway, it's worth the wait if you have to...love this place!!!
author: Meli B.

description:
Yayayay!  Crepe was great -strawberries and Nutella.

And they have Crown condoms...interesting.
author: Kerrie L.

description: This always seems to be the logical place to come to right after eating at Burma Superstar and I have no problem with that at all. This is a great place to have some dessert crepes. The crepes are well-made and delicious. I haven't tried everything on their menu (I usually get red bean or anything with nutella), but I'm sure I would enjoy all their dessert crepes (not a big savory crepe person).
author: Brent C.

description: This is a cute little place that also has a little shop that sells Asian foods, toys, etc. I'm not a huge fan of crepes, but the ones they make here are crispy and worth your money. It's delicious, and not so expensive either. Parking can be a problem in the daytime, since it's located in the busy streets of Clement. In addition, this place is more of a to-go order, because there is only one bench for anyone to sit on.
author: Candy C.

description:
So a classmate of mine and I decided to get lost and stumble upon this little treasure of his that he happen to forget the location of. Fortunately for me the area was quite familiar as I've been to ze French restaurant called Clementine right down the street (awesome French toast dessert by the way -- that's a review for later fo' sho).  

So I was really happy to see reasonable prices than my usual favorite hangout offered and we enjoyed a banana, almond and honey crepe. I picked it only because my classmate loves almonds -- that and I think he's an emiciated chinese poor college student and his gf doesn't feed him enough or something. Heh ... kidding Jay kidding!!

The other cool thing about this place -- its got a JAPANESE STORE!! I totally forgot about those japanese varieties of POCKY. God I love Pocky. I need to stay away from sweets though, but *sigh* can't resist.  

Another plus according to a friend is that cute girls hang out on the weekends here. That doesn't pertain to me obviously as Im strictly dickly. Anyways.... where were we.

I will go back to try their SAVORY CREPES AND Milk teas but don't get the Lychee Milk tea. I was better off crossing the street and heading to the friendly neighborhood Tapioca Express or even better ... Quickly. Dangit.  What a rip. 

Anyways, try the Sweet Crepes and browse through their selection of neat Japanese goodies and eat the egg puffs from HongKong. It was alright -- nothing spectacular. But I definitely recommend the almond, banana and honey crepe. I'll definitely be back for more Sweet Crepes like Nutella and Strawberry -- too many choices!!!


Enjoy....
author: Misty O.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE. i always stop by this place when im in the bay before i go home to sacramento. I love grabbing snacks, candy, juices, and of course crepes. oh what the heck! maybe even some asian lip balm! 

the only bummer is it gets super crowded sometimes, so they rush you & the service could be better. other than that, they are great. oh and they have a minimum spending if youre NOT using cash.
author: Virley L.

description:
I used to be a regular here.  I'd stroll down the aisles with a friend in tow, more amused than I should be by the Engrish text on Japanese candy wrappers--noticing, say, a dark chocolate bar by the name of "Ghana" or a package of jellies that proclaimed that it was "happy to be eaten by you".  Sometimes, a virile package of Men's Pocky would catch my eye as well.

In addition to candy and the toys that accompany them, this minimart japonais carries a correspondingly mini selection of  toiletries and refrigerated products, such as mochi, milk, and yogurt drinks.

The crepes served by their dessert cafe are standard--not as fancy as those packets of heaven at Ti Couz, but they suffice.  If you're a processed-food fan (i.e. naughty, naughty) and want to try something unique and tasty, order the crackly egg puffs.
author: Momo R.

description:
Really good place!  I wanted to give it 4 1/2 stars (knocking it down a bit only because of little to no seating), but since it wont let me do that, 5 will have to do :-P

The best thing about this place is the reasonable prices.  Tourists all flock to those crepe places in the market st mall and at pier 39, and those place are complete tourist traps!  This place is not only reasonably priced, but they have a pretty good selection of food.  They not only have crepes, but ice cream and different kinds of shakes and teas with the option of boba.  

The crepes at this place are very good.  They are also flaky and crusty but never burned or soggy.  The fruit they use always looks fresh and every time i've been there they always taste fresh.  Ive had a variety of crepes here, but my favorites are definitely the nutella and banana or nutella and strawberry.

Another bonus of this place is that it doubles as a little market.  They dont have a big selection of products but they have enough things to merit a good review.  

Oh and this place is open late! Till 1AM, so if your ever in the mood for crepes or are at any of the good bars on clement and want a place to grab a reasonably priced and very deliciously filling snack, then this is definitely the place for you.

Like i said before, this place does lose a little bit of my rating because it has almost no seats except for a bench or two.  Other then that, this place is great!

Check it out! :-D
author: Mark R.

description:
Tiny eyebrow razors  - check
Unidentified foodstuffs with cute mascots - check
Pokka- check
Transforming famous inventors figurines- check
Mysterious hair wax - check
La-Yu- check
Hello Kitty suppositories- check
Egg puffs and strawberry/whipped cream crepe- check

Looks like a good time tonight!
author: GIR ..

description:
remember the days of visiting my sister and she would take the family to clement, apparently the usf kids hang out, but as i entered this little crepe shop and ordered my first sandwich crepe it was love at first bite

i was never really into dessert crepes that's why i much prefer this place over sophies in japantown, and i can run across the street and get some boba at quicklys

for me it's all about them sandwich crepes!! my favorites would have to be the salmon creme cheese, mushroom and cheese,  tomato cheese one, and basically can't go wrong with half the sandwiches

some people compare it to a panini, but i just think awesome! if i'm in the neighborhood i always pass by and get myself a crepe
author: Ryan S.

description: I think this place definitely beats sophie's crepes. I love how the crepes are crispy and warm, in synchronous opposition to the soft coldness of the ice cream and fruit.
author: Caroline C.

description:
here's a secret.  whenever i have any friends visiting me in the inner richmond area, i ALWAYS bring them here to impress them.  their crepes never disappoint!!!!  their savory crepes and dessert crepes are super large, delicious, and really hits the spot.  i never order the same thing over and over, i really enjoy most of the selection that they have.  the egg puffs are really good too- i esp love the red bean one.  

there's a reason this place is usually packed, it does get hard to find a space to stand or sit since the area is so cramped.  if you're ever on clement st or in the area, you have to drop by genki crepes.  you can also pick up your favorite nostalgic asian snacks and drinks (CC LEMON!) while waiting for your order.
author: Irene W.

description:
After a friend came back from a trip to Japan raving about the crepes from Kyoto, I knew I had to find me some Japanese-style crepes. What makes Japanese-style crepes different from French crepes? I don't really know - it wasn't me who had them in Japan. But from what I can gather, the primary difference, aside from different types of fillings, are that Japanese crepes are crispier, and possibly less spongy and eggy.

I had the beef sukiyaki crepe and the cheesecake and blueberry sauce crepe here. I really enjoyed the beef sukiyaki crepe - I found it very flavorful and unexpected. However, what I didn't love was the cheese to beef ratio - it was too cheesy, which I didn't feel went well with the beef. An easy solution though, next time I will just ask for little or no cheese.

I found the cheesecake with blueberry sauce crepe delicious as well. However, the reason this review gets a 4 star review is because in between the ordering of the beef sukiyaki crepe and the cheesecake crepe, a massive line formed at Genki. The crepe dude got really overloaded and was very inconsistent with the amount of time he let each crepe sit on the heat. I was watching him make the crepes through the window, and when our crepe was cooking, he took the opportunity to wipe down the other crepe machine and do a bit of cleanup. It was probably no more than 30-60 seconds extra, but it caused our crepe to be WAY too crispy, especially in comparison to our perfectly cooked first crepe. The edges were cracker-crispy, and I could only think of how much more delicious it would have been had the crepe been cooked properly.

I will definitely go back, but will try to order at a less busy time!
author: danae c.

description:
Whenever I'm up in the Bay and I'm feeling like a stuffed crepe. I get my splurge on from this little joint. Cop myself  #21 Nutella + Banana with a scoop of Vanilla ice cream...yum! If I'm feeling super duper hungry for dessert, and there's room in my little belly, I include the egg puffs with the order.  They are light and easy to pop in the mouth =).

It's also like a mini-mart with food and snacks.  Everything is affordable and just so damn delightful.
author: Pilar B.

description:
I miss this place so much. Seattle crepes are PUNY compared to Genki crepes.  The crepes are like crispy cake batter filled to the rim with ice cream, fruit and whipped cream. You cannot deny one. If you do, you are crazy!

Good for: impressing dates, getting in touch with your inner Japanese, innocent sugar fix
author: Nancy H.

description:
Walking into this place just makes me grin uncontrollably like a kid in a candy store.  Fobby Asian snacks in general make me happy, but this place has nearly everything you can think of, including 7 diff types of Pocky sticks, and the atmosphere of a high school hangout on a Sat. night.  This place also gets an extra 6th star if I could give it one, b/c it's the place where some friends and I hilariously caught a friend on a secret date w/ another friend and teased them to death. This place has it all, I'm telling ya. :D

And then the crepes -- even if I'm super stuffed from King of Thai or Burma Superstar next door, there is *always* room for these crepes.  My favorites are the mixed fruit crepe (strawberries, bananas, peaches with whipped cream or nutella) and the apple pie crepe (cinnamon flavored apples) -- none of that canned fruit crap, but totally natural and not overwhelmingly sweet!
author: Erica Y.

description:
Love the crepes.

Just the smell of this place can give you a sugar high. Its rather funny because if you walk by genki the smell does everything to drag you in by the nose but if you somehow walk past you will then get a wiff of the nastiest Chinese herbal store smell that will completely nullify that Genki smell.

The selection is rather large but I can't seem to ever order anything else but my favorite crepe.
author: Patrick B.

description:
NOM.. NOM.. NOM.. DELISHHHHH! East Bay needs a Genki around.

Genki has the best crepes around. I particularly love the idea serving the crepe on a cone than those restaurants that serves on a plate instead. The cone makes it portable, and eat it while you're walking. You don't need any utensils to cut or fork it.. blah blah blah.. and yeah, you get the idea. =P

I usually come here after dinner for dessert, my favoirte.. Green Tea ice cream with bananas and nutella.. deeeelliiiishuz. My other favorite, Turkey with mayo, lettuce, tomato and cheese... Can you say foood orgasm? Lol.

They also have a variety of Japanese snacks. The snacks are more on the pricier side. You can find some of them at a local asian supermarket for a cheaper price.
author: Genalah T.

description:
This has to be my uber favorite shop for desserts in SF. I loved it ever since I visited SF for the first time last year. And on every trip out, my friends and BF would spoil me with late night trips out to Genki for crepes and egg puffs.

In NYC I would hunt down the egg cart guy in Chinatown everytime I'm in the neighborhood, at Genki's there's an assortment of flavors. What more can you ask for. Brownie points for banana and strawberry flavor. And when I get a crepe, I add a little ice cream to it, I'm not a big fan of mango ice cream, but this place hits dead on in flavor. Really good.

Brownie points for the random cookies and snacks you could find, and I love the little Japanese toys you can get. Very affordable, decent location on Clement, great for a late night craving.
author: Jacquelyne L.

description:
Strawberry and nutella crepe. I thought it was going to be like Crepes on Haight or something, but the crepe was crunchy and thin all folded up into a nice wedge, for our walk down clement st.

Kawaii!
author: choad x.

description: Crepe skin was disgustingly salty. If the skin is nasty then what's the point of a crepe?  I ate 2 bites first and by the 3rd bite, I spat it out. Green tea ice cream was regular, lychees were canned & borderline gross. Do not recommend whatsoever. Feeling jipped as though I paid $5 for a scoop of blah green tea ice cream & fake lychees.
author: L. B.

description:
I used to live in the city, and since moving to San Jose a few years ago, I sorely miss and cry over the loss of my beloved Genki! In fact I think I'll trek up there this weekend. Major craving has been triggered!

Genki is not only an ice cream/crepe place, but also a candy store in the back. I love getting my red bean ice cream and nutella crepe. The crepe is freshly made (you can watch them making it after your order) so it is hot and crispy. The ice cream is smooth and delicious, and nutella, well...nutella speaks for itself! The candy store in the back is great for your Pocky fix! 

*They only accept credit cards with a minimum $10 purchase*
author: Nilam P.

description:
my cousins take me here with every family visit to the bay area and the first time was fine, the crepes are pretty good, and they sell some of the best japanese candy (and make-up)

the reason why i'm giving this 4 stars, is because when we went here on christmas day, the cashier lady snapped at me and my cousins & my cousin snapped back. i completely understand that you close in 15 minutes, but lady, if you want to make money, you have to be nice to your customers.

after we were done ordering, there was a customer rush.

karma bit you bad!

.... but their crepes are good. :)
author: Uriah P.

description: Ordered a Cheesecake with whip cream and blueberry sauce crepe. I wasn't expecting much out of it... but it tasted great. And the cheesecake tasted like real cheese cake. It's kind of neat that they carry a variety of Japanese items like candy and novelty toys.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Everything about the beef gyudon & cheese savory crepe was so artificial that it made me feel like I was in Japan.
author: David A.

description: This place is pretty damn good. I absolutely LOVE crepes. They are quite unique here. I haven't tried any savory crepes, but the dessert ones are definitely worth it! Peace!
author: Lynn K.

description:
Yummy crepes, but not so yummy egg puffs.  The egg puffs totally pale in comparison to those from Eggettes in South SF.  The moment I went to grab a piece from the bag, the entire thing was crumbling at my every touch!  That's a sure sign that they were overcooked.  And the texture of the egg puffs was way too dry and cakey.  None of that chewy goodness that egg puffs are supposed to have.  What a disappointment.

I'd only come here for the crepes, and all of the enticing Japanese snacks you are tempted to buy while you're waiting for your dessert.
author: Diane L.

description:
Evil, evil crepes...so yummy so delicious sooooooooo addicting!!!

These sneaky little devils don't resemble the traditional soft crepes the French are famous for - oh heavens no!  These wonderful crepes are crisp and folded! FUN crepes!

My favorites: Nutella and banana with green tea ice cream and chocolate ice cream with cheesecake - oh gooooodnesssssss.  The crepes are always crisp and rarely soggy.  They never skimp on the goodies either.  You'll be in sugar rush heaven in three bites flat.

I'm glad that this place isn't down the street from me otherwise I'm sure I'd be tipping the scales at a ton by now.
author: Christy L.

description: This is my FAVORITE crepe place :) Basically came here as a youngster and kept coming back no matter how many other crepe places there are. Sad part is that it's rather far from my house :( I usually order something green tea and strawberry but I never had green tea here. It doesn't taste as good but everything else is delish! I usually just end up ordering strawberry and nutella with ice cream. BEST THING EVER. OH, their crepes are CRISPY !
author: Kristina L.

description: Every time we're in S.F., we have to stop by here and get a strawberry w/ whipped cream crepe that is absolutely my daughter's favorite dessert in the world.  While I may dispute the claim that it's the best in the world, I do agree that it's pretty darn awesome.
author: Lucius M.

description:
They're like... really flat pancakes.   They shape them into a cone and fill it with ice cream or cheesecake or whatever.....nutella?  Its really good and totally worth it.  You're getting exactly what you're paying for.  There seem to be alot of highschool kids hanging out here though...
Next time I get the chocolate ice cream and cheesecake, Ill pick up some milk to supplement.
author: andrew l.

description:
i love sweets.  i love that feeling of sugary goodness in my mouth.  i love genki crepes!

let's forget the crepes for a moment and discuss their wide variety of asian snacks of happiness.   you got your yanyans, your hello panda, your hard fruit candy, your soft gummi candi, kit kats in various flavors, and my most recent find:  an oreo bar that is green tea flavored.  YES!!!!  while the cost did not make me smile (almost $3) the taste sure did.  it was perfect.  

okay so for the crepes i don't even know what to say.  how can anything go wrong when you ask for nutella, peanut butter, bananas and honey in a crepe?  tell me!  see...you can't.  because it's not possible.  they use chunky peanut butter which i actually can't stand.  and i can tolerate it in their crepes because it is that yummy.  

i usually don't finish my crepe in one sitting, and i eat the leftover on my drive to work the next day.  this will disgust most people but i don't care, it's better than a pop tart.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
If you haven't gone here late at night for a dessert crepe, you're truly missing out. The crepes are incredible and they sell tons of great japanese toys, & figures, as well as many other asian products. 

All this typing about it is making me hungry for a delicious nutella & banana crepe. I'm going to get one now...
author: Justin B.

description:
Peanut butter egg puff, where have you been all my life? Long have I searched for a dessert that was lighter than a funnel cake, tastier than a waffle, more interesting than a crepe. And here you are. To think, I had to move to San Francisco to discover you, because I sure as hell couldn't find you (or anything remotely similar) in my former home state of North Carolina. 

I think this is the beginning of a long, beautiful, fattening relationship.
author: Beth T.

description:
After reading rave reviews of this place and being teased by all the crepe goodness it holds, I finally forced my bf to try this place. By golly, you guys were right on! 

We ordered a Strawberry & Whip Cream and a Cheesecake w/ Whip Cream & Blueberry sauce. You can pretty much guess which one was mines. All that cheesecake goodness! *drool* *nom nom* There goes several hours of workout for me. The place is a mini-mart of Japanese goodies and nifty useless Japanese concoctions. Mmmm...Pocari Sweat!!

What else can I say that 370+ reviews haven't already said about this place! I will definitely be coming back!

4.5 stars.
author: Serena W.

description:
Hear about the Crepes and went out to check it out.  Great tasting crepes as well as a nice lil store.

Service was fast and the price was good.
author: Roger A.

description: Their milk tea is actually pretty decent. :) I didn't get it with tapioca/boba this time, but I was satisfied. :) Only 2.50! They also have thai tea (my friend said it wasn't too great, but it's worth trying if you're curious), milk green tea, etc. as well other fruity drinks as well. I saw a family getting a lot of their fruity drinks, so it shouldn't be too bad when it comes to taste. They also offer their drinks warm, so it's even better! lol
author: Susan Y.

description: I got a pretty standard banana, strawberry, nutella, and whipped cream crepe. I split it with two other girls. That thing was huge and filling and fabulous! I am going back this weekend for sure! Maybe this time I'll add ice cream to the mix.....
author: Jessie M.

description:
We were driving around looking for parking to eat on Clement Street when I seen two kids eating what looked like ice cream from a crepe shaped like a cone. I immediately thought "YUM, that's what I want for dessert!" 

So while eating dinner, I busted out my trusty Yelp iPhone application and searched "crepes" and Genki was the first place to pop up. It had over 400 reviews so I figured this had to be the spot. It was a block away from where I was eating dinner. Perfect!

Whoever thought up the idea to eat ice cream from a crepe shaped like an ice cream cone is a genius. I love the selection of crepes - ice cream, savory & snack crepes. They also have tons of drinks. This place also happens to be a Japanese mini-mart full of asian snacks, candy and stationary. SCORE! If I lived near here, I could see myself hitting this place up when I have the "munchies". LOL. This is a stoner's paradise.

I had the red bean ice cream with banana and my partner had the lychee ice cream with red bean paste. The combination of red bean ice cream and banana seemed weird at first, but it was actually really good. The lychee ice cream was delish!! I always forget how much I LOVE lychee ice cream until I have it again. (note to self: next time at the asian grocery store, buy lychee ice cream)

I'm glad I don't live so close to this place or else I'd really be a fat ass. I'm sure there are some places like this in Oakland, but I'd rather not know about them. It's times like this when I'm so glad to have the Yelp iPhone application. "When you see two kids eating ice cream from a crepe and you want to know where you can get some - there's an app for that!"
author: Joshua C.

description:
Craving dessert?  Don't wanna settle for some plain ass ice cream?  Come to Genki's. 

You can buy cool japanese food items and other things here...it's like a small japan shop.  I especially liked the japanese sodas that have the little ball in them, so clever!

But most importantly, this little place sells amazing crepes that will most definitely fix your dessert desires.  You can make pretty much any time of dessert crepe here, from mango fillings to strawberry fruits, whipped cream, and nutella.  Just don't forget the napkins.
author: Dedrick S.

description:
I skip dessert after dinner at fancy places and run to Genki for crepes! LOVE LOVE LOVE everything about the place. The fact that they have a bunch of candy and cute little toys, the variety of drinks and that they accept credit cards ($10 min). Their crepes are everything I'm ever looking for, perfect amount of crunchiness and amazingness all for $4.25 (I paid $6 at Sophie's in Japan Town and regretted it soon after!).
I don't know what I would do without Genki.
author: Bella S.

description:
you know you talk about something too much when multiple, distantly-linked friends call you just to tell you they are eating something or somewhere that reminds them of you.  Crepes are that thing for me.  And while I will forever remember my first european Crepe (summer before 8th grade... crete... vespa... white linen... a little stand off the side of the road... olive-skinned cutie... nutella... not an uncommon story), i never thought i would find one that i loved in quite the same way as that one (just like your first love).

genki has proven me otherwise.  it made me realize that there are other Crepes out there that i could love as much.  Crepes that could stir my soul (aka stomach) and melt my heart (...like melted nutella) as much as the first place in greece.  sweet, savory, or stuffed full of ice cream or cake (try the ridiculous cheesecake and blueberries but definitely share it....), genki Crepes are paper thin, light as air, and have the perfect balance of crispiness and softness that complement whatever goodness you decide to put inside.  

my friend swears by the red bean.  there are many who love the fresh mango and vanilla ice cream.  i am a classicist myself and often end up with the nutella + strawberries or the occasional green tea ice cream.  they also wrap them into a nice cone shape that is so much more satisfying to eat than on a plate with fork and knife like most Crepe spots in this city (i.e. the Crepe house, etc.).

be warned that there is a $10 credit card limit.  but when you find yourself short, just browse the millions of teas, fresh fruit juices, taro mochi ice cream, all types of east asian seasonings/mixes, random toys, a thousand flavors of gum (try Watering Kissmint), japanese gummies and chinese haw flakes (try it) until you have enough to pay for your delicious new love.
author: Elain S.

description:
I ordered a number 18, which is chicken, cheese, green onions, and sweet chilli sauce crepe for $5.50. 

I did not enjoy it that much because it tasted bland and boring. 

I also ate the Checkered Sundae. Which is chocolate ice cream, vanilla ice cream, sliced bananas, whipped cream, and Hershey's chocolate syrup. It was $4.95. 

It tasted delicious. 

I don't really like this place because there is really no place to enjoy the food. There are benches available to sit on, but I rather sit at a table. It usually is too cold to sit outside and when you sit inside, it can get crowded.
author: Joseph F.

description: Love their crepes. I've had crepes at other places and Genki definitely ranks among the top. Love the nutella with almonds combination.
author: Joe Y.

description:
What a strange little place-- love the plain egg puffs-- some how what I envision warm fortune cookies to taste like; definitely get your own bag--these little bites disappear surprisingly fast.  

They have random figurine toys (some are rather PG-13) and vending machines with things like the little pooh bear key chain that all my students collect (OK so I popped in 4 quarters and go a Hello Kitty key chain thingy myself, but hey I loved HK growing up). Also if you ever need an eyebrow razor--this is the place.

But what I really fell in love with was their coconut ice (and add the large tapioca).  My girlfriend and I have been in search of a good coconut ice drink.  We used to drive all the way to Kevin's in Daly City--but it started getting watery; so sad!  Then we tried Genki's... Yummmmm.  

Also for all those gun shy of Clement parking,  Monday night is awesome!
author: Ana d.

description:
Crepes are awesome. Savory or sweet, they are the perfect snack or meal. Genki is as a pretty convenient spot in the neighborhood. They have pretty good tapioca drinks and their ingredients are pretty fresh. 

The crepe itself has a good texture and is always crispy and soft. It's served in a cone shape and has that waffle taste to it. 

I usually order a Turkey Crepe or a Banana/Nutella/Vanilla Ice Cream Crepe. The crepes are always consistent, but sometimes they barely put any filling in it. The turkey crepe consists of just turkey as the filling. They charge me the entire Turkey, cheese, sour cream, & avocado price (about $6) opposed to just the plain crepe with 2 slices added (approximately $3.75). When asked about the price, I was given a nudge with no price change. As for the banana/nutella crepe, it's usually a crepe slathered with nutella, folded with ice cream and banana barely thrown in the middle. Half way through the crepe, there really isn't much to look forward to. At time, whoever is working at the register has the worst mood. Sometimes it looks like they don't want it to be there and barely acknowledge your existence.

This place has decent crepes, but they lack in consistency and customer service.
author: Vivian L.

description:
4.5 stars~ Delicious crepes! My boyfriend like to have a Banana + Nutella crepe every time we go there, but usually I would ask to add almond to his crepe for my flavor, lol~ My favorious is volcano with two green tea ice cream and tapioca.
They also sell other cute stuffs~ eggpuff, bubble milk tea, candies, snacks, toys......(some are over-priced)
author: Jun L.

description:
this review isn't necessarily about the establishment or the product, but about a specific employee

one of the young female asian workers (don't know her name) is super rude and condescending. i went in with a friend once and we asked for soymeal smoothies. she looked at me, confused, and rudely asked "what?" i asked again, and she still said "what?" so this time i looked down and saw a menu on the counter, pointed to it, and asked for the soymeal smoothie. she looked at me kinda funny, then wrote it on the order paper. i hesitantly asked for blueberries and peanut butter to be added (it was done once before and okay'd by another male employee during a previous visit), and she told me it wouldn't taste good. we informed her that it was quite good. she looked puzzled and turned around to ask her coworkers behind her if they could include those additions. she turned back only to rudely say that they couldn't do it, so we just got regular soymeal smoothies instead. so a first time miss, i was okay with it

a separate time we came in, it was around 10:45 or 11 but we didn't know they were closing. the door was wide open and there were people waiting for their crepes. when we approached the counter area, one of the employees looked around, confused as to why we were there. then all of a sudden, the same female asian employee from last time rudely called out from the back that they were closed. it didn't make sense to me that if they were closed why they wouldn't close the door at the very least to show that they were. so strike two, i was still okay with genki

my friend came in on two other separate occasions and encountered the same girl who wouldn't let her/us add peanut butter and blueberries to the soymeal smoothie. and every other time she's gone in, the female asian worker would be rude and condescending and so would some of the others. that was strike three. we won't be frequenting genki solely because we don't want to run into that specific girl. call me a baby, but i work at starbucks and i know what it's like to have needy customers, and i NEVER have treated ANYONE the way she treated us nor will i ever!

/rant
author: Nik H.

description:
I love this place.. (when its not super packed)

I always get the strawberry mango icecream crepe.. But last time I went I tired the mixed fruit crepe with nutella.. I love how the top of the crepe is crunchy and as you work your way down it gets softer.. = the perfect crepe..

I try to hit this spot up everytime I go to the city.. Yumsilogs!!
author: Mare L.

description:
I've been coming here since it opened.  It was run by a young couple back then.  The man made the crepes and the woman was the clerk.  Ahh those were the days... when lines were minimal and Burma Star had no wait.  How I miss those simpler times.  Now whenever I have a craving for a crepe I can always count on the fact that a line will be waiting for me.  Some days I get lucky and a cute guy is waiting for his crepe.  I barely ever see the cute young couple anymore, but the last time I saw the woman she was pregnant... so if you read this CONGRATULATIONS!  

Crepes I LOVE:
Nutella and almond 
Strawberry and whip cream
Ham, Cheese, and mayo
(Yes, I am a simple girl who loves her simple crepe)

The prices are reasonable.  Parking is a pain, but you can get lucky.  Overall nice place to try.
author: Lyly P.

description: I've tried other places that had crepes, but so far Genki has the best ones! Their crepes are more crunchy than the ice cream place at Japantown, not Sophie's. The crepe place right across from the Sanrio in Japantown has the soggiest crepe. Love Genki's sweet crepes, but haven't tried the savory crepes. Anyway, good stuff!
author: Jane Z.

description: Those egg puffs are close to Hong Kong's standards.  I always remind them to underbake them a bit so it's not too crispy and dry.  Sesame flavor never lets me down.  I could barely taste the red bean version.
author: Yvonne Y.

description:
My review is only for the crepes and not the market.

A crepe place opened late night!!! What more could I want lol!
Too bad it's so far from me... all the way in the Richmond.

I came here last night with friends after eating at De Soleil. Generally speaking, crepes are one of my most favorite foods so I was glad to have came here to satisfy my crepe cravings.
author: Natalie G.

description: something about Crepes....and Vanilla Ice Cream...and  Nutella...and Bananas...and whipped cream....its supposed to be French right?...this one has a Japanese name...hmm....not as good as the one in Tanforan...but after fried chicken and fried mushroom this is definitely the tasty dessert you want to finish with....will definitely come back.
author: Malou C.

description: Had a chocolate cake crepe with ice cream or something here. Don't remember it being quite memorable. Very crowded. Cool little store to walk around and chomp on food. But too crowded lol Probably wouldn't come back cuz it's not that convenient (parking-wise and have a few crepe places closer to me in the Sunset).
author: Timothy L.

description:
One day I went in here and I guess I was dressed a little punker than normal - if by punker than normal you mean a hoody and chuck taylors. The manger accused me of shoplifting something and demanded I empty my pockets. Are you fucking kidding me? What am I a 12 year old in 7-11? What the fuck did you think I was stealing, a robot shaped lychee scented air freshener for my pimped out Honda civic? Fuck you pal. I'm a 31 year old professional. I'm not pocketing fucking hi-chew and dried shrimp snacks. Bitch. He didn't even apologize. From now on I get my shit from Super Tokio.

I still like their Nutella crepes though.
author: Zac H.

description:
Waitwaitwait... genki means "fresh"?? That's what it says on one of the posters. Unless genki is a chinese word, according to my four-year education in the japanese language, I'm pretty sure genki means "healthy". But, whatever.

For me, the highlight of this creperie was actually not the crepes, but the japanese products they're selling behind the creperie. I LOVE LOVE LOVE Japanese snack and knick knacks. They have this miniature cafe display case that you can fill up with lots of miniature foods like cake and ice cream.... SO CUTE! If I had the money I would buy a whole set and dig out my secret collection of Licca dolls (japanese equivalent of Barbie). Well, not really, I don't have any Licca dolls... okay, I used to have one... What?? They're cute! Okay??

Ahem.

Okay, let's get to the crepe, shall we?
I got the mango ice cream with strawberries and whipped cream. The ice cream was really good. Not too sweet, not too creamy, just right. But the crepes was not as good as Sophie's. It's crispy, which is nice, but not as tasty. I do like how they put some whipped cream on the bottom of the cone so it doesn't leak with melted ice cream. Sophie's crepe always leaks.

Overall, a close second to Sophie's, worth a visit.
author: Ari C.

description:
Wow! 
Need i say more, as most of my favorite places a friend took me here one night and ordered a crepe with nutella, strawberries, and whipped cream which was did not sound that appealing to me but after that one bite i was hooked.  This is somewhere that no matter what you get on your crepe or what your preference is, it is always going to be good.  Genki god me hooked on crepes and i am thankful that i was nowhere near this place or i probably would have put on 20 pounds!
author: Michelle M.

description: Brilliant dessert idea! Love the dessert crepes!! Love the ice cream too...especially lychee ice cream with crepes Also love banana and nutella on crepes. It is a little hard to eat the crepe with a large chunk of ice cream on it, but taste is what matters most right?? And you would expect the crepes to get soggy? (i have had this happen at other places), but no! the ones here stay intact and crispy.
author: Liwei Y.

description:
Good crepes, not over-priced!  I love the strawberry/nutella crepe with whipped cream the best!  They sell tons of snacks, from different types of candy and chips.  I also like the individually wrapped dried seaweed.  

There's 4 Peek-A-Pooh vending machines outside, too!
author: Celeste M.

description:
Perfect dessert after eating at any one of the nearby restaurants. 

I can see how some people might not care for the crispy edges of the crepe but when you hit the lower/middle part of the folded triangle its the perfect crepe texture, chewy and soft. The nutella & banana crepe was only $3.50, I've paid up to $5 for some crappy crepes. 

Genki is totally worth it.
author: kate r.

description:
Vast selection of crepes; probably more than what Sophie's Crepes (in Japantown) offers. There are ice cream crepes, savory crepes, and snack/dessert crepes. Ice cream can also be ordered here, and also tapioca drinks. I'm so happy to see they serve mainly Asian flavors (i.e., lychee, green tea, red bean, etc.)...that's just me, I guess. Sweets, sweets, sweets! 

There's a small mini-mart in the back, a lot of basic Japanese/Asian snacks and random goods. I ordered the Red Bean Paste Crepe and it was warm and fresh. They have benches inside and outside for customers to sit and enjoy their sweets. Will be back here to try the tapioca soon. Yum yum!
author: Helene K.

description: Next time Mel and I come here we need to try the crepes, but all I have to say is Hello Panda cookies.  Those things are so addictive I almost bought a second huge box.  Nice store overall
author: Joseph Z.

description:
Red bean paste crepe with green tea icecream....solid 5 star.

The crepe is soooooo crispy, all the way to the last bite with melted ice cream, not at all soggy, which is pretty amazing. At first, I was wondering why the crepe was already cold when I took the first bite, I saw them make it there, while wandering around the little cute shop. But then I soon realized that they actually are so thoughtful that for the ones with ice-cream, they let the crepe cool down a little bit so the ice-cream doesn't melt right away because of the hot crepe. And the red bean paste and green tea ice cream is the best combination. Can't go wrong with the two most essential ingredients in Japanese sweets.

One more start for having this specific milk tea drink that my bf has been looking for for so long. None of the asian markets carry it, but Genki does. Yay!
author: Yuchi C.

description:
#24 - strawberry + nutella add whip cream!!!  the crepe was light and crispy....and it's cheap!!!

only downside no where to sit and enjoy but it's ok...who can't multi-task with eating and walking at the same time??!!! ;-)
author: Mao K.

description:
How can you say no the yummy goodness of NUTELLA? 

This shop on clement serves as a sweet tooth haven for me.  I love how they serve their crepes.  They make the crepes fresh and put it into a form of a cone where all the fillings that you choose are neatly packed into it.  The best thing about the crepes here is that they're semi crunchy!  I love it!  My concoction consists of nutella, lychee and mango ice cream! It's fab that they have tropical and Asian flavors added to their crepes.  It's absolutely delish!!

the egg puffs aren't so bad.  I've tried them before but I could never say no to my crepes. 

Other than being a creperie, they also have cute items for sale like stickers, figurines and other little trinkets.

If you haven't had one of their crepes, though, you MUST go and try one!
author: Anne M.

description:
Haven't purchased their crepes, but they sure do smell nice.  I mostly come into Genki for random Japanese snacks and drinks.  They have a nice selection for being outside of Japan town.  I have to try their crepes sometime though seeing as my girlfriend always get them.

They have a $10 minmum for credit cards.
author: Serge S.

description:
I've been here a couple times. The sweet crepes are great, their savvory ones are just eh. It ends up being almost like a pizza. 

There's also no place to sit!! I guess that's to be expected b/c its not really a crepe house.. it's more like a snack shop.
author: Helen H.

description:
(wiping drool off my face)  yes, this place is amazing.  they have a huge variety of crepes.  i've never tried the savory ones because my sweet tooth just gets in the way of that.  my personal favorite is lychee ice-cream with fresh mangos and whip cream.  my bff got the banana and nutella ones when she visited and that looked like heaven too.

besides the yummy crepes, they make decent egg puffs.  they're sort of "bouncey" and not crispy like the ones at Kowloon Tong Desserts.  

another plus here is they carry all random different kinds of japanese snacks, toys, drinks, and even beauty products.  like, i'll never buy my facewash from a crepes place, but hey, if you need some japanese face products and you're in a bind, they've got you covered!
author: Sally T.

description: Never had crepes before but this was my favorite dessert I've had in recent memory. Make sure to get both nuttella and whip cream too!
author: Gordon C.

description:
Mmm...the coconut egg puffs are really good and somewhat fragrant.  I also tried the red bean egg puffs, but I couldn't taste the red bean.  The blueberry egg puffs were too flavorful.

I like the variety of toys and snacks that they sell.  They are all reasonably-priced.
author: Cindy H.

description: I can't believe I eat next door all the time and never come here for crepes. Maybe it's because I'm usually super full after dinner and can't eat anything else. I usually just drop by for candy or other snacks. Finally decided to drop by and get a crepe since Sophie's was too far. And the wait was actually not that bad! The bf and I got strawberries n cream. It was good. The crepe was nice and crispy and not too thick. Definitely would come back and try other flavors!
author: L M.

description:
What a DISAPPOINTMENT!

Sometimes yelp can really make you have WAY too high of expectations.  I'm hoping that was the case for this.  I was expecting the best crepe of my life, like even better than the ones in Paris.  I didn't get that.

They totally skimp on the nutella, ice cream and fruit. I added banana and I got about 3 tiny slices.  I felt like the crepe itself was overwhelming big.  In general it was more like an ice cream cone that was a crepe instead of the cone and was a lot bigger than a cone with a lot less ice cream/chocolate.  And the worst part about it, the crepes are almost 6 bucks each.

SO sad... I may come back to try those cookie things.
author: Rachel S.

description: Came here as a second resort from purple kow. I got a nutella strawberies and wc crepe. It was alright. Everything inside tasted normal but crepe was overcooked. The little mart is good for random chips and candy. Nothing too memorable but prob will come here again if in the area but would not make the trip out.
author: Adrienne C.

description:
As another yelper mentioned, this is a huge candy store! I was amazed by their selection of japanese snacks and other random items like toys, hair dye, makeup, and household items. But I spent most of my time staring at their big menu trying to decide what to get. 

I opted for their sweet crepe with vanilla ice cream, bananas, and nutella. For $5, you get your money's worth! I couldn't finish the whole thing because it got too sweet with the nutella but it was GOOD! Definitely coming back again!
author: Linda C.

description:
this place is muh-fuggin sweet. You get to look at hilarious japanese toys as you wait for your desert.  

The crepes are soo satisfying. I make space during dinner for them. 

I've probably been there 15 times now and have only gotten the Fruit drinks or the Mango Ice Cream Crepe (freaking awesome mang!). My room mate has only gotten the Red Bean drink. Gotta stick with the favorites hah. Fine, i will try something new next time im there! Happy?!!
author: Michael N.

description:
Pros:
-crepe place that offers many flavors 
-ice cream shakes/smoothies with pearls!  Very rich.
Cons:
-Milk tea is WAY too SWEET, comes from a PACKET.  Wasted my money.
Note to them:  Please have a 'to go' menu!  Or at least put the whole menu on your website!  The website does not show any of their shake/smoothie drinks.  only crepes.
author: Mimay W.

description: Seriously, I don't get the hype.  Don't get me wrong, the crepes aren't bad, but I have had a lot better.  Go to any other Asian crepe shop and you will find the exact same product. I have to say though, they are fast and it is reasonably cheap. They got that going for them.
author: Vinh N.

description: Damn it...i really wish people wouldn't yelp about this place. The parking sucks no matter what time u go. There is always people in line. And i just cant help myself but browse the isles for candy and toys.  Did I mention how much I love this place and  for shame on my friend we double parked in the middle of the street to run in for crepes and then he almost got a ticket and I pretend like who is this ass for parking in the street.  Hahaha the things we do for crepes.
author: Christine M.

description:
NUTELLA + BANANA WITH A SCOOP OF VANILLA ICE CREAM!!!

Can't beat that!! The crepes are so huge you can share one!  Although I can't have my crepe without nutella, it's kind of overpowering. Regardless, still delicious as hell.  

I usually visit Genki around 10:30 at night...the same time everybody else visits Genki.  But while I'm waiting what seems like forever I like to go around the store fetching for snacks and looking at Super Mario Brothers car accessories and Naruto figurines!   

This place is for sure poppin!

Lost it's last start because of the price...$1.25 for a scoop of ice cream? Seriously?
author: Helen V.

description: Crepes?  Whatever.  The reason I go here is for the freakin' cute Japanese toys!  They usually have a different selection from Super Tokio across the street, so it's worth it to visit BOTH!  The last time I went to Genki I found little wooden toys in the shape of different household appliances (a stove with a tea pot, a coffee maker with a coffee cup), with ridiculously cute little eyes and smiles painted on.  Why the heck would you buy these things?  I have no idea, but I just had to.  Their little eyes plead with me, "Take me home!!"
author: Cassidy P.

description:
The Smoked Salmon + Red Onion + Cream Cheese + Wasabi Crepe is tops.  The salmon is nice and fatty. The cream cheese adds more richness.  The red onion is sweet and crunchy.  And the wasabi tops it off with a kick!!

Genki is not a true sitdown place.  They do provide a couple of small tables at the front, but its like eating at a 7 eleven.
author: Sam T.

description: It's good. It's also a candy and snack Mart so theres tons to browse while waiting!!
author: Veranna N.

description:
I love Genki Crepes!

They have pretty good crepes (I like Sophie's Crepes in that weird mall in Japantown better), but they also have a lot of the snack foods I remember from the convenience stores in Japan.  Plus, they have a buttload of those giant instant raman bowls, if you're truly lazy.
author: Akemi Y.

description:
Like the heffers we are, we decided to stuff our gluttonous faces with a dessert crepe after licking our plates at Burma Superstar across the street. 

Genki makes crepes the way they're supposed to be. Thin, crispy on the edges, and batter with just the right consistancy. It takes a little while for them to make your crepe but you can parouse the aisles with all of the asian snacks while you wait. The only place that closely compares to Genki is Sophie's in J-town. So sinful. So delicious. I'm so crepeful for Genki Crepes :)
author: Jen Y.

description:
I'm super lucky to live in such a food-rich neighborhood!  One reason is because of Genki Crepes.  The ice cream, the fruit, the crepes, the boba, the egg puffs...one word: YUM.  
My favorite: Lychee ice cream crepe with fresh strawberries and whipped cream.  Top it all off with a side of strawberry egg puffs and I'm GOLDEN!
author: Jennifer L.

description: great place to go if you like crunchy crepes and the smell of cooking batter.  Salty or sweet crepes are good and they do NOT skimp you on the filling.   however, more often than not I come here not for the crepes or the japanese snacks in the supermarket section, but for the egg waffle thing...I can't remember its real name right now but the remembrance of that sweet, crunchy taste is making my mouth water.
author: Shinny L.

description: Asian store with Hispanics making crepes. Who would have thunk it? These are by far the best crepes that I have had in the states. I especially loved that you can get them thicker or crispy. There is a wide selection of crepes and you can ask them to mix different things. I had the Nutella and banana. My friend got strawberry, banana and whipped cream. They were amazing. I wish they had this place in Minneapolis or Chicago. I can't wait to come back.
author: Ericka A.

description:
number 1: vanilla ice cream with a choice of (nutella, strawberries, bananas, and others) - i finished every single little bite out of this crepe. it is so worth waiting for! they open pretty late too

and extras are 85 cents i believe, and i got nutella!

it takes awhile to get an order, but there are plenty of benches to sit around. though i had no idea it was in a mini mart kind of place ... there are so many people crowding the waiting/paying/sitting area
author: Linda L.

description: This place was crackin' on Friday night! The smell is overwhelming of buttery, eggy goodness. I think the crepes are reasonably priced and the options are aplenty. I love that they have traditional flavors as well as more unique, Asian ones. I insisted on having ice cream in mine so we opted for red bean ice cream + banana. It was surprisingly delicious. I had my reservations about this combination but I would recommend it to anyone who doesn't want to feel the itch to brush their teeth immediately after eating a too-sweet crepe. It's refreshing and light, and the balance of ice cream + semi-warm hard crepe is fantastic. Also, while you're waiting for your crepe you can peruse the rows of colorful Asian snacks in the store! So much fun.
author: Lydia W.

description:
This is the ultimate food night out: after dinner at PPQ with the family, some of us felt like we didn't get enough ice cream with our dessert. So we went to Genki.

This place reminds me of a Sanrio store/Asian market selling goodies that you can't read because nothing on the label is in English and you only know what you're buying by the picture on the package. They definitely have tons of snacks and toys here, but they also have yummy crepes! You can't resist the intoxicating fragrance of fresh crepes as you walk by. Most people who come to this small store are buying their sweet crepes stuffed with the filling(s) of your choice. Our favorite is vanilla ice cream with banana and nutella. They also have savory crepes, too but I have yet to try them. They have different ice cream flavors also - green tea, strawberry, and red bean to name a few. This definitely satisfied our craving for more ice cream. 

I like this place better than Sophie's in Japantown. It's pretty busy at night, but the line moves fast. Note: if you are coming here at night, make sure you come with someone else so they can wait in the car while you go in and get your crepes. Parking, as anywhere else in SF, can be an issue.
author: Kimberly S.

description: I'm more so writing about their Egg Puffs than the crepes. I love me some egg puffs. They come in a variety of flavors, but I usually stick to vanilla, banana, and honey dew. The eggs puffs always come out nice puffy with a little crunch to them. Such a wonderful delectable treat! All the other egg puff places I've been too *cough* Eggettes *cough* don't cook them right where they aren't cook fully and they don't have the "fluffiness". Gengki is number #1 spots for egg puffs hands down!
author: J B.

description:
Ice cream. Crispy Crepes. Boba drinks. Minature toys. Many varieties of Pocky and other sweet candies from Asia. Nice lip gloss from Japan. Wasabi chips. 

The best part: peanut butter + nutella + ice cream on a crepe. If its cold outside, skip the ice cream.
author: Judy L.

description:
So I stumble out of the Dogs Bollix and into Genki... I always forget how HUGE their crepes are.  Their #14 - Turkey, jack cheese, avocado, and sour cream is one of my favorites, but really they're all good!  

They also have an interesting assortment of asian goods like wasabe peas, pockey, picari sweat... no need to go on, even if I could remember the other stuff I saw.  Bummer they no longer carry LIPOVITAN-D, the japanese energy drink that's like red bull but w/o the carbonated water.

Absolutely delicious crepe, and way bigger than I thought!  Well time to find a cab and head out to Murio's...
author: Theron L.

description: The best! Had the Chocolate cake and ice cream crepe. So light, fluffy and satisfying. Interesting how they package it so there is no mess while eating it. Definitely will have this again.... and again.... and again....
author: Julie M.

description:
i've tried several japanese crepe places and this by far is my favorite.  

strawberry/banana/nutella
or mixed fruit nutella 
can't go wrong!
author: Kae B.

description:
OH BABY!! Spread on that nutella and I'll lick you inside out!!!!!  I LOVE the way they make their crepes.  I like them crispy with a nice spread of nutella, a scoop of vanilla ice cream, and topped with fresh fruit.  DELICIOUS!!!!!!!

I usually don't mind waiting while they make my crepe cuz I enjoy browsing through the aisles looking at cute Japanese items.  If you're in the area, you have to go there.
author: hello k.

description:
Ricky Bobby, I want you to say, "I love crepes" or I will break your hand.  

I will not say "I love crepes"

Come on Ricky Bobby, Crepes are those little skinny pancakes you love, you had some last week!

These crepes are not half bad. I can't always say there is room for dessert because everytime I go over there, I'm always pretty full no matter how much I love crepes.
author: patrick o.

description:
This is my favorite crepe place. I always get the ice cream/strawberry/nutella/whip cream crepe, which isn't on the menu but I always ask for this anyway (you MUST try this combination!!!). I don't know how they make their crispy-on-the-outside-soft-on-the-inside crepes. If I feel like classic (soft) crepes, I just make them myself, and they're comparable to a lot of crepe places. But Genki crepes are special.

I just wish there was more space to sit and enjoy the crepe, but at least they're wrapped in a way where you can walk and eat at the same time.
author: Anvy A.

description:
I can't think of any dessert that can beat the crepes at Genki. It is a mini-mart/dessert combination...which is not what I expected. After I order, it's fun walking around the store and reminisce about the Asian snacks I use to munch on while I was a kid. If you have a ton of quarters, knock yourself out and get those Winnie the Pooh figurines! 

My favorite crept at Genki is the Banana/Nutella Crepe with Vanilla Ice Cream. I would recommend that one if you can't decide on the various combinations. 

It is definitely a small place. There are a few wooden benches inside to sit on. If those are taken, there are seats outside. Being in San Francisco, it's a little too cold to eat outside. I like to just walk up/down Clement and eat while conversing with my friend.
author: Allan M.

description:
Genki=Happy 

When I have a Genki Crepe I am overcome with excitement, kind of like a little puppy dog who is excited to go for a walk. 

The first bite is orgasmic, followed by the feeling of being surrounded in a nice comfy warm plush comforter, wearing the coziest slippers...that is the feeling I get when eating  genki crepe.  To be more exact it is like a state of Euphoria mixed with a little bit of some hardcore drug. haha. 

Um excuse me, why is there not an option for 10 stars???? Could this place be anymroe Asian?!!!  I think it could. So since I have an Asian fetish I give this place 5 stars for it's Asianess. I usually come here with my favorite Asian his name is Andy you can find him on my friends list. 

The crepes here are to die for!!!! I love love love their crepes.  If I could eat any food and not gain weight then I would seriously choose to eat a Genki crepe a day...hmm maybe 2. I order vanilla ice cream, strawberries, nutella, and whip cream and it is sooo yummy.  It is also pretty darn cheap too, which makes the experience even better.  If there is a heaven, then they would be serving Genki Crepes to me on a silver platter. 

Did i mention that I love this place??? Well I do!! The best thing about Genki Crepes besides the Asianess is that I cannot stop smiling when I am eating my crepe...it definitley puts me in my happy place.
author: Cellina B.

description:
Wonderfully-tasting crepes! If you're into savory, get the chicken, cheese (swiss), and green onion crepe. The sauce that they put in it (sweet chili sauce, not spicy don't worry) makes the taste wonderfully delicious and unique.

I've only had the vanilla ice cream with red bean crepe. It was declious, but I'm sure they all are.

It's part of a japanese snack store, so you can pick up a bunch of snacks as well! I recommend getting the aloe drink with the chicken crepe. That really hit the spot for me

Damn I wish I were in SF right now
author: Albert D.

description:
I love, love, LOVE Genki. Just THINKING about this place puts this ridiculously huge smile on my face, and all I can think is "I want, I want, I want!!" 

Their dessert and ice cream crepes are not only incredibly good, but they come out quickly and are super cheap (especially in comparison to Sophie's Crepes in that Jtown mall). I love every one of their crepes with nutella. Green tea ice cream is good in crepes, too. AND they have Polly Ann's Ice Cream! They also have eggettes and fresh juices and other yummy things.
