I also like this store because they have all these cute Japanese miniature toys and snacks. It makes me feel like a little kid again. :-)

The one gripe I have about this place is that there's very little seating if you just want to enjoy your crepe/drink/ice cream and chill with friends. I wish it were bigger to accommodate people who would like to sit and relax.
author: Yvonne W.

description: Amazing crepes w/ lots of variety. I love how they have flavored egg puff. I don't know where else can you get flavored egg puff. Love the strawberry flavor.
author: Annie Y.

description: AHHH!! This place is soooo good!! The Crepes are the best I have had in SF for sure!! I get the crepe with strawberies, nutella, vanilla ice cream and whip cream!! Sooo good!
author: nabil s.

description: Great crepes!! Prices aren't bad. It's a small shop/crepe stand. Not room to seat and gets pretty crowded! Otherwise, the crepes are bomb!
author: Jeanette D.

description: Good place to grab a crepe. You can't go wrong with a vanilla ice cream, neutella, and strawberry crepe. The only down side is just like some people said, they tend to skimp out on portions. If you order your crepe with strawberries, they basically chop one strawberry into fourths and throw it in.
author: Robert S.

description:
horrible customer service, I'm never going back again.

I wanted crepe with ice cream, the price displayed was incorrect and owner refused to honor it.
author: Sydney L.

description:
It's no secret that I love dessert. It's also no secret that I think Asian and Middle Eastern desserts are not really desserts. To my mind, desserts are things that you can order a la mode if you choose. I've been known to throw down some gulab jamen now and then, but more often than not, my husband orders rice pudding, I just have a coffee, and then I keep my eyes peeled for a frozen yogurt place on the way home.

Funny imported snacks and beauty products aside, that's the main reason I love Genki... it's perfectly situated to be your rice pudding alternative.
author: Christina S.

description:
These crepes cannot be beat. They are the perfect combination of crispy and soft if that makes any sense at all. Don't be scared when I use the word crispy - I am actually a fan of the inside of bread and not the crust, chewy pizza crust and not thin crust, etc etc.

I much prefer these over Crepes a Go Go (although a nice second choice) or Yogo Gelato (they have no consistency when making crepes, sometimes it's crispy, sometimes it's soggy). 

I've only had the red bean crepe here...it's not just the paste that comes from the can, it actually has little beans in it! Definitely one of my favorite dessert spots, when I make my quarterly journey out to the Richmond/Sunset ;-)
author: serena l.

description:
Be still my heart!  I love love love Genki! OOooo wWeee!!!
WHAT IVE HAD: nutella and strawberry crepe, green tea with lychee crepe, nutella with vanilla ice cream and banana crepe
LOVE: the fact that you can shop around and buy asian candies, yan yan dip, poke sticks with almonds, etc. while you wait for THE best dessert crepe that always hits the spot!  Love that they shape the crepe in a paper cone so that you can eat it on the go!
author: Deanna A.

description:
My sister-in-law introduced us to this place as the best place in the city to get crepes.  We decided to try it and have been fans every since!  Any time I am in the city, I will stop there and get one before I leave!  They are so good!  Very fresh and delicious!  My favorite is the green tea ice cream with the strawberries.  Not only does it have great crepes, but they offer many other goodies as well although I can review that since I only get my usual!

The store is so cute too!  They have a great selection of hard-to-find Asian and Hawaiian snacks and candy.  My girls love to look at all the little trinkets and toys.  I usually buy them a little something too because they love the Japanese toys that come in the boxes.

Parking is the only problem but that is the city for you. If you can, have one person just drop you off while you grab something and then you don't have to worry about parking!  Because that is usually my last stop, I don't have any problems just grabbing it and eating it in the car!
author: Jenn C.

description:
WOW. this crepe is amazing! and gigantic! make sure you share! haha :)

we had a hard time even selecting a crepe, because they all looked so delicious! we finally decided on the Chocolate Ice Cream + Cheesecake...the cheese cake is dense and with the addition of the ice cream is enough to satisfy this sweet tooth!

the crepe itself holds up really well too as the cone! i will be back!
author: Wendy T.

description:
This place is AMAZING. The crepes are like 3.00-4.00 ucks and it comes in this handy cone shape that you can just walk out with, no fuss, no mess. You have a choice of fruit and nutella crepes (strawberry, banana, etc) or even have ice cream in them as well. Considering most crepe places are 5 or 6 bucks for a crepe, this place is a life-saver if you want a sweet treat. They also use FRESH FRUIT so that's a plus for me. 

The store also has all your Asian snacks and miscellaneous items. They even sell Shiseido products here!
author: Megan M.

description:
Ohhh yeah. This place carries crepes, too. Almost couldn't find it in the directory.

My Asian culture obsessed friend and I were strolling down Clement Street a couple of years ago, just as the sun was slowly descending down in the horizon. We had just eaten some delicious food - and you know how humans get after we masticate something warm and satisfying - we want to shop for knicknacks we don't need!

My friend's 'online identity' includes the word 'Genki' which apparently means 'energy'. So it's not surprising the bold marquee caught her eye from across the street. She proceeds to almost run into the middle of the street, such was the magnetic pull of this retail establishment. 

We walked in and proceeded to find an odd mix of college students, old people and small children. Clearly this store caters to more than one type of human. The crepes are for the students, the old people come for the bargains, and the little kids - well, my friends, they only desire one thing. Cheap toys.

Genki is basically 90 percent imported Asian goods (skin care, tea, snacks, tchochkes), and 10 percent eatery. My friend proceeded to go apeshit (apparently there are no Asians in Michigan) and I got some gummi candies and generally stayed clear of the madness.

From what I can tell, Genki has good variety and delicious crepes (I prefer the sweet to the savory). Need I say more?
author: Lily E.

description: I love the little market inside because they have all sorts of asian goodies and snacks. Personally, for the crepes I prefer Sophie's which isn't too far from here, but the good thing about Genki is they're open late! If Sophie's is closed, we head straight to Genki for our crepe fix! They accept credit cards which is another plus! Parking can be kinda tough even at night but whatever, it's still worth it so I can get my crepe on!
author: Dijonne M.

description: This place is fun! I buy way too much Japanese candy, the kind that resembles pink starbursts in flavor. I once bought a whole bunch of weird little buttons with weird little Japanese characters on them. I like the glass case with the weird little slutty anime characters. Most of all, I like the crepes (not weird nor little). Strawberry, nutella, and whipped cream. Uh huh. That thing is a meal in itself. So good that I used to double park my car (when I had one; I could deal with having a car when I lived out in the sunset) and risk getting a ticket.
author: Natasha P.

description: Blueberry cheesecake crepe is like heaven in my mouth! I highly recommend coming here for dessert after a rockstar meal across the street at Burma Superstar!
author: Aman B.

description:
I heart Genki.....

everytime I go there, I always get strawberry with whipped cream crepes and Volcano - two ice cream scoops of your choice ( get the Green Tea and Vanilla!!!) with tapioca pearls on top. I eat them both.. I'm a pig

I love you Genki....
author: s d.

description:
One of my good friends said that this place is his favorite so one day he took me to get some crepes.

We went there&ordered. I think I got the Cheesecake one. It was alright. I thought it was interesting that they had a crepe with cheesecake in it. I didn't tell him but I thought it was plain. I wasn't too impressed.

I went there another time with one of my girlfriends. I thought that I should give it another try. I ordered the Green Tea Ice Cream with Lychee. This was much better. I loved the combo of the green tea and lychee! But i felt like they didn't give me much. I didn't get a lot of fruit :( 

I like how Genki is also a mini market full of asian things! haha. We got some Vita Lemon Tea while we were waiting for our crepes.

I do like Genki but I prefer Sophie's crepes more.But I don't mind coming back.
author: Presh G.

description: Whenever I'm in the Richmond I always end up here for dessert. They have really good crepe n a wide variety of Asian snacks.
author: Helen L.

description: All I remember is stumbling over here in a tipsy haze and being wowed by the crepe I got. Nutella & strawberries, I believe. Perfectly packed inside a deliciously crisp golden-brown crepe. The staff works incredibly hard, so it's worth the wait. Plus, you can look at all the cool foreign candy/food in the meantime.
author: Rachel F.

description: I love the strawberry tapioca drinks and the strawberry + nutella crepes. This place isn't bad and I will definitely come back next time. One of the biggest problem is finding parking, and you know, it IS Clement....
author: Jeffy Y.

description:
Me and My Friends loves to go to this store.. We buy crepes and many other japanese stuff... It's like a little daiso..

 I always get lychee drink here.. Plus its open late at night and next to it is chinese restaurant which is also open late at night..

 We always order dimsum next door when we go here. last words COOL STORE. Lets hope it will not get hit by the economic recession
author: irwin v.

description:
highlights:
- ice cream crepes
- mini mart is stocked
- park benches, indoors

lowlights:
- very crowded after dinnertime
- they store their meats and fruits for crepes in the same refrigerated section as the cold drinks you buy
author: Aaron T.

description:
i LOVE this place, i LOVE their crepes!!

get the crepe with chocolate ice cream & cheesecake. it is SO SO yummy! mmmmmh, i'm drooling thinking about it!

they also have loads of imported japanese candy such as flavored kit kats (royal milk tea, cheese, oreos, etc)
author: michelle h.

description: Very very yummy crepes and egg puffs that are a great snack/dessert on the go! There were so many choices of what to eat and with cute, colorful displays.Mmmm....giddy. Came here when visiting a girlfriend  and she highly recommended this place. It was a rainy, chilly evening, but this store was still pretty crowded. I tried this one crepe combination of banana, walnut and honey and loved it; the crepe was crunchy and helped balanced out the sweetness of the honey and banana (but then again, i'm a dessert lover to a fault so i have a pretty high tolerance for sweet stuff). Must come back to try other varieties and other desserts.
author: Tracey T.

description: 4 Stars? Come on people, are you kidding me? Where else on Clement are you going to find amazing dessert crepes made before your eyes at 11 pm on a Tuesday and get the opportunity to try all the crazy types of Japanese Kit Kats we don't get in the US? They have a great selection of random gifts, crazy weird candy/snacks and specialty beverages, not to mention ice cream and more. So no bitching about the line! Put your order in and look around. You'll be entertained while you wait, I promise.
author: Robynne W.

description: What can i say this place is awesome!  Its pretty much one of my favorite spots to go to when I have a sweet tooth/nutella craving.  Not only do they have some cool import stuff.  still trying to build my appetite for a savory crepe but that day will come soooon!
author: Alex B.

description:
"One nutella crepe please." 
[Okay, I have about 5-10 minutes to kill]
Hey look, they have a miniature of SoiFong from Bleach.  Maybe I'll splurge.
SoiFong will be lonely, she'll need that miniature of Breath of Fire 4 Nina.
If I'm going to buy a CAPCOM figurine, might as well pick up Hsien-Ko from Darkstalkers too.
Holy crap, Kingdom Heart toys.  Damn, you can't find out which one you're buying, and it's a 1-out-of-6 chance to get the black hooded Mickey Mouse wielding the Keyblade.  Better get 3 for a 50-50 chance.
What? Edison is involved in another sex scandal and dodged 5 Triad bullets fleeing his bedroom?  I should pick up that magazine.
"Number 96" (that's me!)
"That'll be $4 for the crepe... and $65 dollars for all that junk."
Um, just the delicious, crispy, better-and-cheaper-than-Sophie's crepe then please.
author: Mercutio k.

description: Fantastic crepes and the most interesting shop I've been in. They have a wide variety Asian candy and treats, fun to look , and fun to eat!
author: Bobby B.

description: Mmmm mmmm mmmm! Anything i get here is deeeelicious! My fave is strawberry ice cream crepe with nutella and cheesecake bites. Heaven in my mouth! I haven't tried any of the savory crepes except the hotlink/cheese one, but that was awesome too! This place can be a little pricy, but if you love dessert then it is well worth it. =D
author: Michelle T.

description: A lot of choices between savory and dessert crepes. I like the blue berry cheese cake and the strawberry banana NUTELLA crepe. Prices are very reasonable and affordable. It's cash only but if you need to withdraw from an ATM Quickly (across the street) has an ATM with a $0.99 fee. The wasabi salmon is also really good. Genki also has ice cream and boba drinks. There is also a mini mart inside so you can get your assorted asian drinks (aloe drinks) and snacks (shrimp chips) and other stuff. Parking is kind of a b*tch and its all metered so dont go there if you are in a hurry!
author: Brigitte M.

description:
Every time I go to San Francisco, I plan my itinerary around Genki. It's true.

Maybe it's because Orange County does not have crepes to offer me or maybe... Genki was just the best thing that ever happened!

The evenly spread fruit over the perfect amount of nutella creates a beautiful explosion in my mouth. Every bite comes with the perfect amount of fruit. I've come here at least 30x over the last 2 years and I've never been disappointed. If I were rich, I would fly to San Francisco just to have a Genki crepe... 

I've had..
Beef Sukiyaki 
Strawberry, Banana, Nutella 
Banana, Nutella 
Strawberry, Nutella, Cheesecake
Ham, Lettuce, Cheese
Nutella, Ice Cream, Cheesecake

ALL WERE GREAT.
author: Amandore D.

description:
After circling around numerous times to find parking, I finally ended up one block away from where I wanted to be. As soon as I some some guy holding a giant crepe in his hand scooping chunks out with a spoon, I knew what I wanted for dinner. I was in the neighborhood after visiting my preferred Chinese Doctor to buy food for my wife's lunch tomorrow at King of Thai Noodle House. After ordering her ground pork Larb, I rushed over to Genki Crepes next door to see what they had to offer.

When I used to drive up to the Clement area on a regular basis to visit my grandma and run errands, I always walked pass Genki Crepes and smelled the crepe aroma from the walkway. I never had the urge to pop in as I did today. There were a lot to choose from including Sweet, Savory, and Ice Cream crepes. Since I was yearning for something simple, I picked #12: Ham, Pineapple, and Mozzarella Cheese Savory Crepe for $4.75, $5.20 after tax. While freshly made to order, it took at least five minutes to make. As I was waiting for them to call up my number, I took a look around the store in the back and saw a lot of Chinese and Japanese candies and snacks. I know my wife would go crazy here and buy one of each of everything. I'm glad she wasn't with me today. Whew!
When they called my number, 32, I got my crepe and it was huge! I could clearly see Ham and Cheese poking out of the crepe. I'm used to eating crepes in a restaurant and this was a new concept for me. It was like holding a flat snow cone because the thin white cardboard was in the shape of a snow cone but maybe five times larger. Sorry I couldn't take a picture, but it was almost pitch dark in the streets  =(
(Next time!) With my crepe in hand, I went back to the Noodle House and retrieved my take-out order. When I walked in, virtually everyone was staring at me, not just because I was a dashingly handsome guy, but because I was holding this absurdly large crepe in my hand. I grabbed my food and left in a hurry. 
You really can't go wrong with a Hawaiian style crepe. The crepe was crispy on top and juicy inside. The only juice that squirted out was towards the end when I took it out of the cardboard shell and proceeded to finish it off. Luckily, the cardboard opened up to make a nice little flat dish for protection from unforeseen mishaps. Ham, pineapple, and oozing cheese in every bite. To make this crepe more authentic and perfect in every way, I would suggest a marinara dipping sauce. Totally Delish and definitely a Quick Bite! 

Genki Crepes is truly recommended if you're on the run, want to devour a good tasty crepe, and comes with a really affordable price. I can't wait to go back and try something different soon!
author: Hogan W.

description: I went here right before I was supposed to go to dinner...woops! I really wanted to try crepes here and I couldn't pass up this chance since I'm not in SF too often. I was not disappointed. I actually don't remember what I got, but it was probably something like...almonds and chocolate. Whatever it was, I know it was really good because I didn't want to share!
author: Mads N.

description:
I LOVE Genki!! This is one of my favorite places to go for dessert! 

The number 8 dessert crepe with vanilla ice cream and nutella is my favorite and it's always yummy and amazing. The plain egg puffs, which taste like waffles are also good and fun to eat. 

This place is usually crowded, especially if it is late at night, but you don't really have to wait very long for your order. But while you are waiting, you wont be bored because you have options! You can wander around the inside and look at all the interesting things they carry in the store, or you can go outside and look through the window and drool as you watch them make your treat!
author: Katie I.

description:
I had the pleasure of going here with my brother and his friends when they graduated from college. They told me that it was the most fantastic place for crepes, and they were right! I ended up treating everyone in the group.

I love that they were open so late and didn't mind serving a group of 5-6 of us who wandered in just before midnight. Fast service, and there are cute little knick-knacks like knockoff Hello Kitty toys you can browse while waiting for your treat.
author: Ivy V.

description:
When I moved to the neighborhood I thought this place would be making bank off of me because of their dessert crepes--specifically their red bean ice cream and banana crepe. (can't branch out...too delicious...)

Turns out they ARE making bank off me. While I've managed to scale back my crepe intake, I am 110% addicted to all the lychee candies they sell. And I've started trying new flavors (a dangerous thing) like apple, mixed fruit and some mystery ones as well. I think the prices might be on the high end for candy, but I've yet to find a place with such a dizzyingly vast assortment. I'm willing to spend the extra $.30 or so.

If you're already spending waaaay too much at this place, do yourself a favor and stay within the confines of the front counter ordering area. Head toward the back where they stash the chewy/gummy goods and you'll surely suffer a fate as damningly sugary as mine.
author: anne s.

description: The best crepe place I've found so far outside of Japantown. Yum!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Good Lord, I had such a massive sweet tooth today. I had literally texted 10 friends inquiring about any local hole-in-the-wall that offered chocolate desserts, with generous portions, and at a reasonable price. One of my homegirls referred me to this spot. I live on the southern tip of the city, mind you, and this place is located aalll the way on the other side of town. I knew I was about to have one of those "Harold and Kumar" moments, except not as dramatic nor such a lengthy, hard toiling odyssey.

It took me approximately an hour and a half to get there (this is within San Francisco on Muni and Bart so it's not that bad). I took the 14 up Mission, sitting at the back of the bus with the local "wanksta's" giving me the casual mean mug. A normal person probably would've been sweating his thighs out due to paranoia or just the simple thought of the person next to me, whose all tatted up, concealing a glock nine or how the Nortenos call it, a "filero." But no, not on this day, not at that moment, surely not with this bold, salivating man on a mission. I just looked at the fellow, gave him the samoan eyebrow raise and turned my eyes towards the window, deciding to enjoy the view. Hahaha, lil kid. Next...

So I finally end up at 24th and mission, and quickly paced pass the panhandlers, the homeless, and the druggies and dashed down the escalators towards Bart. Hop on Bart, doze off a lil bit, and hop right off at Powell Station. I walk up the escalators right in front of Forever 21, and WHOA, whaddya know, there's some "turf" dancers who came aaalll the way from Oakland just to perform their lil' sideshow for all to see. What a treat. I showed some love by dropping a dollar in their money box, HOLLAAAA!!!! Btw, if you're into seeing this young kids showcasing their amazing talent, be sure to walk through this area. Anyhoo, I proceeded towards my goal as I walked up a few blocks to Geary. Waited a a few minutes for the 38, hopped on, and headed westbound towards my heavenly destination.

The 38, smh, is always crowded. Folks rubbing up on each other heck you don't know whose hand is rubbing your butt on this line, lol, yes that's how crowded it is. Yet all I can think of was my blind date with this mysterious crepe. So I didn't mind the unintentional back rubs (at least I hope they were unintentional eww). 20 minutes pass and I hop off between 4th and 6th. Anxiety-stricken and my heart rate rapidly increasing with every step I made up the block towards Paradise.

As I approach my destination, I see two asian cats eating what looks like waffles cones with blobs of ice cream on top. I'm like, "Hell yeah, this must be it." I walk in to Genki's and am suprised to find that it's actually a market of some sort but the crepery is at the entrance on your left. Funny thing is, I pratically bogard my way past folks to get to the cashier hella hyped and abruptly startled her saying, "I'd like to order please." She saw the urgency and so took my order, "Yes, a chocolate cake crepe with ice cream and throw the hershey syrup on top." "Are you sure?" she asked. "That's an additional 2 bucks for what you're asking." I gazed at her with the eyes of a tiger as if I've never been so serious in my life, "Just throw the damn thing on there will you!" I shouted. Nah nah nah, Hahaha just joking. I was nice, no seriously I'm a nice guy folks. She completed my order and I sat on the bench against the wall, number in hand, patiently waiting . Finally, she calls my number, and my date, this chocolate cake, soft, hot, vaniila filled, wet hershey syrupy crepe makes her entrance and I'm just salivating, anxious full of anticipation. I grab her with ecstacy and just lay my fat samoan lips on her as we make out for the first time. I don't want to go into any more intimate details, all I have to say is that I walked out that day devirginized. Lol. Mind you, the cashier who took my order was staring at me the WHOOOOLLLE time either because she's never seen a Samoan, never seen anyone eat so enthusiastically (or with a countenance that conveyed a near orgasmic experience), or just had never seen a Samoan or anyone for that matter devour a crepe cone so fast. (I downed this baby in 2 to 3 minutes, no lie, yes it's huge but that's how excited and hungry I was lol) I just told her, "Hey, it's my first time here." She gave me that, "you're weird," look hehehe. I felt like saying, "Well, welcome to San Francisco baby!!!" 

 I fell in love with this place and highly recommend it for not only all you crepe lovers, but for dessert lovers as well. Oh and just for the curious mind, they do have other desserts on the menu besides crepes. Meat lovers as well.

 The ride back home was great and satisfying. Oh, and remember, leave the car at home, ride public transportation on your way here, you never know who or what you might run into on your way to Paradise. PAAAAAYYYCCEEE!!! =p
author: Aaron F.

description: The crepes are very good. I like the ones with real food in them - avocado, spinach, swiss. Very tasty!
author: Em L.

description: The crepes here are pretty decent, however i miss the crepes at the tapioka dessert place up by my old HS Wash...they not only had lower prices but used fresh fruit for all the crepes and it was much softer and delicate crep. I guess perhaps I was used to the crepes there since it was the first place I even heard of a crep and it was the place to go during lunch in HS. But Genki's has other tasty snacks as well and I mostly enjoy thier eggpuffs and flavered tea's and the fact that I live only blocks away and can go here late at night when i get the craving.
author: Petra S.

description: 100 plus reviews for Genki, time to add one more! I have past by this place countless times while heading to Burma Superstar which is directly across the street from Genki! 5 stars I might add; however, when it comes to a quick bite and an amazing candy selection, Genki takes the top honors for impeccable customer service and a selection of toys, candies, food, ice cream, and much more to die for! My dining partner and I tried Genki's crepes for the 1st time recently. I had grilled chicken with green onions, swiss cheese, topped with sweet chili sauce. Never had a combination of a crepe like that before and it was very gratifying. The crepe has a nice crispy texture and the chef was not stingy on the fillings whatsoever. After that, I have gone here a few more times and love it even more. 79 cent ice cream to chewy strawberry candy, Hawaiian guava drinks for 89 cents, and savory crepes, I love this cute place!!!
author: Danster L.

description: Crepes are yummy here too, but I like Sophie's crepes best still.
author: Caroline L.

description: The store is great, I spent almost 40 dollars there. By the time I got home, my crepe was hard! But other than that.. everything is great!
author: Eugenia W.

description: Our favorite crepe place, it's a small japanese focused grocery store with lots of snacks and a crepe/ice cream counter.  my personal favorite is the mixed fruit crepe which contains diced fresh mango, bananas, and strawberries, then topped with nutella and whipped cream for a delightful snack. they have lots of varieties of fillers including savory items like green onion steak and cheese and others.  the snacks in the grocery store are decently priced as well. great place to grab a quick snack!
author: Justin H.

description: The perfect crepe. Just enough crispiness with a variety of toppings.  Red bean paste, green tea ice cream, fresh fruits, whip cream, and different savory flavors, too. Great snack food.
author: Becka T.

description: I love Genki crepes! Their crepes are crunchy and so tasty! I always get the strawberry, nutella and vanilla ice cream! Yummmmmmmy!!!
author: Julie F.

description:
i don't know what i was thinking when i gave this place 5 stars.... it was probably because i had never been to belly good in japan town - now those folks deserve 5+ stars. i guess my main gripe with genki is that they don't have custard... 

dear genki, what is a crepe without custard? yeah, i don't know either! so please get some. xox tara

while i would no longer stop here for crepes, it is still a great place for japanese treats and whatnot. especially the weird ice cream cone in a container in the frozen aisle. yeah!
author: Tara A.

description: my wifey's favorite dessert crepe spot.  a good place to go to after eating at king of thai which a couple doors down.
author: Kurt N.

description: I visited Genki Crepes last weekend after a SF Giants game.  Maybe all the beer and food during the game, got to me bc I just wasn't feeling Genki.  I wasn't hungry. Still, I ordered the crepe with banana and nutella.   I love nutella and bananas, but biting into that crepe was nothing new.  I'll rate 3 for now.  Hopefully I'll have another chance to visit Genki and this time ice cream in my crepe.
author: romeo b.

description: I try to go to this place everytime I am in thr city. Im always satisfied. My favorite is the #1! or anything with Nutella in it! They also have a great deal of asian products in the store as well. Next time I need to try a savory crepe! BUT.......the egg puffs are alright. Just go to Eggettes on El Camino.
author: Derek S.

description: Mmmm, my favorite go-to crepe place in the city! I always take out-of-town friends here. Genki has a large variety of crepes you can choose from, as well as egg puffs, smoothies, and boba drinks. I always get the nutella crepe with banana and vanilla ice cream for around $6. It's a beautiful combination. :') Genki doubles as a Japanese mart. It's fun browsing through the aisles when you wait for your food. There is also limited seating inside, with just two benches and a few benches out by the sidewalk. Parking can be difficult to find, but it's worth the hassle!
author: Emily C.

description: Simple crepe. I ordered the green tea ice cream with red bean paste. My brother got the chocolate ice cream with cheesecake and nutella and his girlfriend ordered vanilla with chocolate cake and nutella. Nothing special but it was good. I wouldn't make it a trip again though.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Delicious combination of traditional crepes and modern day Asian ice cream! I really like the variety of flavors and combinations of items (nutella, fruit, yogurt, etc.) that really serves a wide range of tastes. Definitely recommended because it is open late, priced well, and tastes great!
author: Kevin L.

description:
I'm not a big fan of crepes and usually don't get specific cravings for them, but I've been to Genki's twice now and and both times my crepes have come out better than expected.

I've yet to order a sweet crepe, but I've never expected to enjoy a savory crepe either (always thought of crepes as more a desset deal than meal, so more kudos to Genki).

The first time I came here I ordered the turkey, avocado, and jack cheese crepe and added spinach as well.  What a mouthful of flavor, yum!

Today I ordered the chicken crepe with green scallions, swiss cheese and sweet chili sauce.  It was so yummy as well.  My only criticism is that I wish they had put more sweet chili sauce because it's starts to get a bit dry to difficult to finish half-way through when you start getting full.

I tried my roomie's beef sukiyaki crepe last time and that's got to be one of my favorites.  It's soo juicy and flavorful (my bad I've used flavorful way too many times already).  

I love Genki's crepes because the quality of the crepe is an A+.  I've never had crepe that's slightly crunchy on the outside yet still soft and chewy on the inside.

I have to caution that these savory crepes get pretty heavy (especially the ones with cheese) so prepare yourself.  But for the size of these crepes the the prices they're at, this place is a steal.
author: Ashley S.

description: I always try to make an effort to come here when in the area. Quick, fast and easy!  They're located in a random store with the craziest items. Makes for great rummaging for a few minutes while waiting for your crepe. Cheap prices and an awesome variety. For a couple bucks you get a nice warm, crepe filled with whatever your heart desires. My fave consists of nutella, strawberries n bananas. I usually always get the same kind when I go there, so am never disappointed. Happy creping!
author: Remy-Anne V.

description: OMGAH! I'm addicted to their egg puff! Peanut butter egg puff to be exact! (thanks Liberty) Honestly, I don't even like peanut butter all that much, but DAMN! I crave for those egg puffs with little peanut butter mini chips inside. Definitely check it out if you don't feel like getting a crepe that day.
author: Tina T.

description: Follow my friend and found it is a great place, don't know if they have another store in east bay
author: Crystal L.

description: Very popular place day and night. Go there with visitors all the time and most are quite impressed.  It's good crepe and the ice cream is rich as well.
author: Bob S.

description: I love this place!  I live in the neighborhood and stop by whenever I feel like having some boba/bubble tea.  It's cheap here, and quenches my thirst on a hot day.  The crepes are yummy too.  Can't get enough of this place. I would go here everyday if my waistline could afford it.
author: K C.

description:
This crepe place has been around, but never got to try it out until recently.

Let me tell you this, the line is crazy long but it goes by fast. Usually when I eat crepes, I always aim for the sweet ones, but this time I had the savory ones. There were so many selections on the menu, but I chose the spinach, (swiss) cheese, and mushroom one. It was pretty good, I'll tell you that and it's pretty huge and fulfilling.

Subtracted 1 Star because the employee at the register was very rude and she seems to hate her job.

But I will most definitely come back if I'm around this area and is craving for some crepes.

Also, since this place is on clement, it's difficult to find parking. If you do, you're in luck.

Lastly, if you don't have cash. credit card charge is $10 min.
author: Virginia L.

description: Fun and tasty! The selection of crepes is great. They are open pretty late so it's a good place to catch something sweet to satisfy your sweet/ savory tooth. While waiting for your crepe it s fun to browse all the different imported goods!
author: Robin B.

description:
meh, it wasn't as good as I thought it to be. I still like Sophie's Crepes in Japantown.

What really got me was that the crepe itself has a sour taste to it. 

I had the Vanilla ice cream + Bananas + Whipped cream crepe. I ate all of that and was sad that there was no chocolate in it  :(  (that would've made it much yummier).

I nibbled at the edge of the crepe, but the slight sour taste turned me off and ended up throwing it away.
author: Cookie Monster Z.

description:
came here around the end of summer, so late post.

was feeling like dessert after kitaro.. so friends and i walked over here b/c i haven't been here before! the prices were similar to those of crepe temptations. 

i ordered green tea ice cream with lychee; it was very good! they stack the lychee so that even though you finish the ones on the bottom, you'll still have some in your last bite.

it was pretty cold outside.. which kinda made it taste better :)

i'd go here again, and try to try to add nutella :)
author: Diane L.

description: Banana-Nutella Crepes? Drool! The crepes here are fantastic. They really know how to get you with their variety of desert and savory crepes. The crispy thin crepes are done to perfection. And while you wait you get to shop around for those "hard-to-find" Asian candies like Ramune hard candy and gum. Seriously a sweet tooth heaven.
author: Eila S.

description:
Used to come here weekly during the summer when a bunch of UCSF summer research students and I were dorming down the street. It was definitely good bonding time :)

 A great place to grab a semi-quick snack! I get my usual strawberry and nutella crepe, which has been consistently good. I also really like the chocolate ice cream and cheesecake crepe. Sometimes if I'm in the savory mood, I'll have the turkey, avocado and cheese crepe. 

I love browsing the mini mart and picking up all those yummy (and cute?) Japanese candies, too.
author: Michelle T.

description:
why i like genki crepes:

1) it's a crepe. what's not to like?
2) you can make your own combination of toppings!
3) one of those options is nutella. NUTELLA PEOPLE! chocolate+hazelnut = scrumpdiddlyumptious!
4) another option is strawberry. i never met a strawberry that i didn't like. except the rotten ones.
5) they roll up the crepe like an ice cream cone! a giant, nutella+strawberry filled cone!
6) you can put ICE CREAM in your cone!!!!!!!
7) the crepe is reminiscent of a thin, soft fortune cookie. whilst i do not care for fortune cookies (aside from the laughs made by the fortunes), i reallllllly enjoy these crepes.

that's all. i have but only love for the crepes.
author: Aletheia W.

description:
Perhaps it was just too sweet in my memory, the people and happening itself and not the crepe. Because I came back here yesterday and the thing only had 3 half strawberries. I had the mango ice cream w/ strawberries and no whipped cream (dammit I should've disregarded my cough since whipped cream on top of what I was having wouldn't have made a big difference anyway). Maybe it had 3 half strawberries 5 years ago as well, but either way, they should have more!! There was a little slice at the bottom though. 

But besides from them being stingy on the strawberries, they were quite generous on the ice cream part. And the flour part of the crepe was good and crispy! 

This place was effin jam-packed on a Friday night. I'm guessing that's how it usually is as well, because I've seen people standing around and occupying the inside multiple times before. And like most other crepe places, there are barely any seating in and out. Two benches while you wait and probably a small little table outside. It is also like a mini mart with lots of packages sweets, drinks and other items inside.
author: Elaine H.

description:
This store is so cute. I love the random Asian goodies all over the store. If I was 12 years old, I'm sure I'd waste a lot of money there buying toys. But I'm 24 years old, and I waste a lot of money there buying snacks. 

I mean, where else can you find a store that sells condoms (fobby ones at that!) in the same aisle as candies and gum?

Its bubble tea drinks are very tasty and they have a lot of varieties. The menu allows you to mix and match ingredients which allows for a new flavor experience each time.

I haven't had their crepes but they definitely look tasty. The prices are a tad high but I'm willing to pay that for the ease and variety of snacks there. Definite impulse shopping.
author: Viv C.

description:
Come and get your crepes! The best crepes around town.. almost even better than the Sophies, and theres parking! Good food overall and they are quick.
 
They give you hella food and make it in front of your eyes. If that's too bold for you, you can check out their aisles of snacks and yummy goodness inside. A total snackfest for your snacking cravings..

Don't double park your car and runin to get your crepe because I'm already doing that! :P
author: Wilson L.

description:
I love crepes, I love Japanese/Asian candies, I love stores where you can buy miso salad dressing, so therefore I love Genki.  

They have a ton of candy and other (what it seems like) specialty things, like that weird kewpie mayo...the retarded amounts of different ramens, my favorite hichews AND pinky mints? 

Oh my god, asian snackfood/candy junkie heaven...
author: Linda C.

description:
Went here after a long night of Inner Richmond bar crawling and after a Scorpion bowl, beers, Tommy's Margs, and goodness knows what else this place was orgasmic.  Now that I have had time to process said events I can safely say this place is the bomb....but not nearly as good as Ti Couz (however that being said they are quite different in style).
I had a savory crepe with ham, egg, and cheese, but the sweet crepes looked amazing.  This crepe is stuffed in such a way that you employ a fork to dig out the goods, leaving you a seasoned crepe to pick apart after the fact.
Not only was I able to eat a yummy late night treat, but I was also able to walk the aisles checking out the unique Japanese candies.  This is a perfect light lunch or late night alcohol soaker...:)
author: Sheila Y.

description:
Great crepe place. I chose the Crepe with green tea ice cream and lychee. The crepes were crispy and wrapped around the ice cream and lychee in a cone shape. I thought that the proportion of ice cream to cream could have been higher - it made it less interesting to eat the crepe once the fillings had disappeared. Looking forward to trying the other stuff like nutella or red bean ice cream.

Also - you can get Pocari Sweat here! Reminds one of Japan or Taiwan!
author: Hubert H.

description: I love crepes so whenever I'm in the mood for one, I go to Genki's. Nutella is my best friend so whenever I order a crepe, you bet your ass it's going to have Nutella in it. I like to keep things simple, so vanilla ice cream with Nutella in a warm crepe is amazing. Seriously, you don't need to have a whole bunch of fillings in your crepe to make it delicious. At night, there's usually a line but I've never had to wait a long time. I like their crepe, it's never soft and it still holds its texture with the ice cream in it. When you add the Nutella, it's like a rainbow of flavor partying inside in your mouth. If you haven't been here yet, GO GET THAT DELICIOUSNESS!
author: Lauren L.

description:
This place is your Asian snack central.  Not just Crepes, but a small Asian market as well.  Everything from instant noodles to Asian candy and treats.  
The smoothies are good.  It's good for a late night snack, especially if you live in the area.  You can just walk there.
author: Ryan K.

description:
DE.LI.CIOUS.

Really cheap ($2-$5) for fresh, tasty crepes :) The ice cream was yummy (well worth the stomach ache from the lactose intolerance afterwards)! 

Also a great place to pick up my fave candy (from back when I was in HK) - get yourself some hi-chews and other gummy candy, although these are a bit more pricey. 

Absolutely loved it - and they have more nutella than I've ever seen in my life (who doesn't love nutella?)
author: linda t.

description:
Salty or sweet, every need is met.

Try their chocolate candy with "French Salt". I love it big time.
author: jodes l.

description:
I can literally eat my heart out here! I feel like a little school girl when I'm at Genki.

Their crepes are fresh, crispy, and delicious. 
The ice cream selection is full of favorites and exotic flavors. 
The candy isles have all kinds of Asian delectables. 

It's such a happy place to be. =)
author: Aromy X.

description:
Came here one night after a friend's birthday dinner, but didn't get anything. Boy, did I regret it as we were walking back to the car and everyone had a crepe but moi! 

So of course, when I had the opportunity to go again, I jumped at the chance! The crepes were crunchy and the ice cream (which seems Polly Ann-esque) was a nice contrast to the crunchiness. While waiting for my crepe to be made, I was wandering through the aisles and they carry so many different kinds of Asian goodies. I found some green milk tea candy that I've been looking for since FOREVER! Now, I know where I can find it, and I'll grab a crepe while I'm at it!
author: Audrey T.

description:
Tasty, flaky crepes filled with the goodness of ice cream, nutella, marshmallows, whip cream, and banana's. The best combination of cold, and warm is remarkable. I feel like places like genki are a diamond in the rough; so many of them are around the bay area, but to find that one that is so perfect for the palette is damn miraculous. 

Genki is not only great for their crepes, and their other hand made bake goods. They have a mini trendy asian grocery market inside filled with little trinkets like air fresheners, top ramen, Japanese candy, asian hair dye, etc. It's pretty cool and I love stuff like that because you can't find it in the bigger asian markets. So you get to have your crepes and eat it too hahhaha
author: Nina M.

description: Genki's is pretty good.  I finally tried this place for the first time.  I went with my default order of nutella, strawberries, and green tea ice cream.  I liked that the crepe itself was a little crunchy.  Belly Good and Sophie's usually don't make their crepes like this, so this was a nice surprise.  However, the green tea ice cream used wasn't as good as one used at Belly Good and Sophie's.  The green tea ice cream wasn't terrible, but it certainly wasn't the best I've had.  Overall, it was worth the trek.  I'd come back
author: C E.

description: Yum! What's not to love about a cheap and fabulous dessert! You can's go wrong with a strawberry, Nutella and vanilla ice cream crepe! This place is cheap, quick and delicious.
author: Rachel G.

description:
I come here cause it's close to my house and has pretty damn good crepes. It's open at night, so me and my friends stop by for some tapioca or crepes. They have sweet and savory and more flavorful choices of eggettes then eggettes!

They're use to fast service since it's always pretty packed. Too bad they don't just give up the back store, or expand the store separately. Since most of the customers are forced to sit on two benches and some out side seating or just walk away after they get their food. It'd be nice if they had more seating INSIDE. 

Though they're store has unique items, I do wish they'll have less, = more seating space = more customers for them.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Ok, seriously maybe I'm just a sucker for anything Asian but I LOVE this place, yes, L-O-V-E. I've been going here ever since FOREVER and seriously I've tried pretty much all the crepes and I've got to say it's the best ever.

I love how they not only have a mini dessert place but a market inside. I just bought some wannabe Gucci look-a-like Hello Kitty bag and I'm quite excited to use it for school; Mind you, I'm in college. This is my secret place that I used to always go to and now I'm back. It's still the same as I remember, if anything better.

The crepes are delish and if you enjoy walking through a quick market of Asian sweets, I'd recommend stopping by. Clement is just one of the cutest places to be in SF, but that's just my opinion.
author: Janell Y.

description:
Had their mixed fruit crepe with Nutella. Yummy! 
Genki also offers ice cream, eggettes, and many other dessert items and drinks.

Wide variety of Asian snacks on the grocery store side. But I guess we're now supposed to stay away from those made in China (due to expired milk products?)... sad. 

Only downside, not much eating space.

Fun place to visit after a nice meal in the inner richmond. For those of you who like sweet crepe batter, be forewarned - genki has a savory one .. a little on the salty side.

The guys making the crepes are funny too. When they're calling out numbers for crepe pick-ups, customers sometimes can't hear them because there are so many people in the confined space of the store. So one time, the guys, being mexican, joke amongst themselves and call out the numbers in spanish. but AHA! I know how to count in spanish. So when they call my number 18, I say "dieciocho" as confirmation, with a wink and a smile. ; )
author: Christine C.

description:
The crepes are the pitch-perfect "walk around" types that come in paper holders. Puts Crepevine to shame. Thin crepe, perfectly melted cheese, fresh veggies... hard to complain about. 

The store is also cool - lots of stuff you can't find elsewhere, like the rice crackers that my daughter loves. 

Would be just a little bit better if they had more seating, even if they actually ditched the store part in favor of more seating... as long as they kept selling the rice crackers!

MINOR UPDATE: 
Genki is not a restaurant - just a store front crepe place with a bench inside to sit on while you're waiting for your order to be completed. Think "japanese style 7-11 meets a crepery."
author: Hannah Q.

description:
More like 3.5 stars. 

I had the mango ice cream, strawberries, nutella, and whipped cream crepe. It was delicious enough, however, it just pales in comparison to Crepevine in Oakland Rockridge. 

The nutella hardened against the crepe because of the cold ice cream, which reminded me of the chocolate covered inside of a drumstick. The crepe was also different in texture. It was more crispy instead of soft and crispy on the edges. The mango ice cream didn't really taste like mango, but it was still all right. The almond milk shake my boyfriend got was pretty good--very strong almond flavoring. 

The store is really a store/mini mart that carries all varieties of Asian candies. I think it's a cute little place to go to with some decent desserts. Everything just pales in comparison against Crepevine.
author: Angela L.

description:
I don't know how I lived without this jewel in my life until now.  I think anytime I'm near here I'm going to stop by whether I need to or not.  After having dinner at Genki Ramen, my friend and I decided to continue our genki times with Genki Crepes.  

It was rather late in the evening, but this place was packed with people getting crepes of all kinds, sweet, savory, and snacky.  When we walked in, but couldn't help but feel I was in a Loony Tunes cartoon as the font for the signs was comical and matched the canary yellow and bright orange that accented the ceilings and decorations.  

Having been induced into a kid-in-a-candy-store trance, I ended up ordering the green tea ice cream with lychee and nutella crepe.  While I waited for them to make it, I perused their store and found the essentials I love from Nijiya, excluding the groceries.  Essentially, if you take the snacks and drinks from Nijiya, add some Japanese essentials and throw in a creperie, you have this place.  

I grabbed a handful of amazing treats: sweet ginger, pudding and marshmallow candy, dark chocolate mushroom candies, sriracha, and aloe Calpico.  *drool*

If you have a great affinity for things Japanese, you should not pass this place up.  Also, if you love crepes or egg puffs (a Hong Kongese pastry treat), you definitely need to stop by here.  You'll regret it for a very long time if you do.
author: Brent A.

description: This is as hole in the wall as you can get.  I was skeptical when I walked past, seeing that it doubled as a mini mart, but I saw the long string of customers enjoying their delicious crepes.  My roommate and I gawked at the menu ooing and awwing at the different combinations.  I had a savory crepe that consisted of mushrooms, cheese and spinach and man oh man did it hit the spot! After devouring my crepe (which was pretty big and could easily fill you up) I wanted to try a dessert crepe since I'd never been there before and they looked TO DIE FOR.  Let's just say people walking by the place could have thought we were having sex in there from the way we kept moaning about how delicious it all was.  I am definitely going back there!
author: Meena M.

description:
Ordered the banana/custard/caramel crepe, which was way overcooked to the point of being crumbly.  Ingredients were fresh and plentiful, but for me it's the consistency of the crepe that makes or breaks it and sadly this was quite deficient.

Price was cheaper than most creperies in the city and the store itself was filled with cute snacks and other Japanese paraphernalia.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
It's really overpriced, but kind of the only place in the area besides Quickly's that has dessert. There are always college students there late at night, hanging out. :/ I guess that's okay but there's always a ginormous bunch of them clustered around, when not everyone is ordering something.

The drinks and asian selection of products is decent. I need to say though that if you want legit crepes and Japanese products, Sophies in Japantown, Ichibankan, and Nijiya are better.
author: Shizuka L.

description: MMMMM, crepes. Let me start off by saying that thank goodness that Genki is cash only, because if it wasn't I'd be 20 pounds heavier, because I only live like a block away. Sure, I'd be fat but I'd be happy. I love crepes, and Genki does not mess around. There's one crepe that has chocolate ice cream and cheesecake, and I swear they just got a whole slice of cheesecake, cut it up and stuffed it into a crepe. It's good, really, really filling and yummy. Plus, there's fun Asian snacks, candy and drinks to peruse while you wait.
author: Sandi V.

description: Haven't felt this strongly about anything I've eaten in a while but I had a crepe from Genki's with nutella, strawberry, and vanilla ice cream that caused me to forget everything that happened to me before that moment while eating it. $5 can't buy you more happiness than that.
author: Trish P.

description: I love it! Nothing better than crispy crepes. There is always line but is worth the wait. The crepes are pretty big so its good for sharing with another person. They have savory and dessert crepes. I tend to stick to the dessert crepes, but I would imagine that the savory crepes are just as yummy.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
The menu is a little overwhelming to study when the entrance is jam packed with people.  But now I have my order down.  The crepes are really good.  My crepes don't get mushy as I enjoy them.  

Nutella + chocolate syrup + strawberries + bananas
author: Anon P.

description: I love coming to Genki whenever I'm in town and have a late night craving for a dessert or savory crepe. I always get the strawberry, nutella and whip creme crepe although they have some delicious savory crepes as well. Also, it also serves as a mini mart complete with trinkets and decent priced drinks and snacks if you're not in the mood for a crepe. However, the only downside to coming to Genki is the parking. All parking is street parking so be ready to make a couple trips around the block before finding a spot.
author: Jayna T.

description: Very awesome store and great crepes. I like the Ice Cream with Nutella and whipped cream. It hits the spot and is lotsa calories but well worth it. I don't think it's the best crepe place in SF but very good and in great location.
author: Nir B.

description:
Their crepes are delicious.  What else do you want to know?

I like looking at all the unusual (or unusually packaged) Asian things that they have on the shelves while waiting for my crepe to be made.

Have a nice meal on Clement (invariably something ethnic and delicious), and then top it off with a great crepe from Genki's.

I haven't tried any of their savory crepes, but I suspect that they're also good.
author: Ben C.

description:
The best milkshakes I have ever had were at Genki - ginger and Thai iced tea are my favorites. Mmm Thai Iced Tea shake aghgh. The downside is that every time I went I would HAVE to get a milkshake and you can only have so much sugar at once, so I actually have never tried any of the crepes or eggpuffs. They smell damn good though.

And the store itself has lots of fun japanese goodies you can browse through while you wait.
author: Dan C.

description: Best damn Green Tea milkshake ever! The Red Bean milkshake's slammin too. Even better, both at the same time. Oh Hellz yeah!
author: David G.

description:
I've been here in the past but never noticed the name and tonight we made it in since there was a crowd in the front. Crowds are always good in keeping the store busy and also to draw in further curiousness from passer by, us. :)

I love Japanese snacks and grocery stores in general. They had the cutest and tastiest snacks..., chips, chocolate snacks, Yan Yan sticks, strawberry marshmellow, etc etc...

I found my favorite candy, Azuki Caramel Morinaga which is this red bean tasting chewy candy! It's sooooooooo good. My colleague brought some back from Taiwan but this is actually a Japanese candy. I also bought this Ice Bar, box Uji Kintoki Bar imuraya (green tea ice-cream bar filled with red bean)! I hit the jackpot....the Japanese candy is seasonal according to the store personnel, they also have green tea ones but they are not available at the moment. I'm so back to check out their supplies from time to time....I've not tried the crepes here but the kid holding the greentea icecream crepe should looks good...the crepe that is....
author: Yan M.

description:
I don't understand why this place is so popular. Their crepes taste pretty styrofoamy to me.  All I ask for is a decent lemon-sugar number. It shouldn't be that hard.  Lemon juice (fresh). Sugar. Crepe. That's it. Yet every time, it's all lemon and no sugar, the batter tastes like nothing, and I end up tossing it a block away.  I guess I should move on to Nutella.  

I do like their selection of Japanese candy though.  And an extra star for egg puffs.
author: cindy m.

description:
Genki Crepes really came through for me the other night when I had a late night crepe craving...they are open until 10:30 even on weeknights, so I hightailed it from the mission to Clement st. at around 9:45 pm on a monday night, and viola, next thing I knew I was eating a crispy crepe bedazzled with nutella, strawberries, and vanilla ice cream. 

I honestly prefer softer style knife-and-fork crepes, but Genki is still pretty good. I can't complain about the prices, which are in the $4 to $5 range. I also got some ice cream bars and a pack of grape hi-chew, so the trans-neighborhood trip was well worth it.
author: Shannon R.

description:
Genki has some mouth-watering crepes at this place. 

The dessert crepes resemble a huge ice cream cone. Gotta love nutella and ice cream. And it's so affordable. So, college students: rejoice, and enjoy!!
author: Courtney P.

description:
Every time I walk by Genki Crepes I want to go inside and get a crepe, even when I am totally full!  How can you resist the sweet sugary smell of crepes?  It's like going to a Dunkin' Donuts or a Krispy Kreme and not buying one!   So all weekend I have been craving a sweet crepe filled with nutella and lychee from Genki. It costs only $3.50 and I am a happy camper and my craving is satisfied. By the way, Genki doesn't do crepes like Ti Couz or Crepevine. They do crepes like they do in Japan.  It's all about the same size but they fold it up in to a large triangle the size of a slice of big pizza, put it in a paper wrapper and hand it to you.  You can sit at one of their lovely wooden benches (but usually these are taken) or take it out and be on your merry way. 

They have other crepes - like savory ones filled with spinach, mushroom and cheese, ham and cheese, etc. (I think these are all under $5) but I always like my crepes for dessert here.  They also have this egg puff thing which Gigi ordered chocolate flavored (they have 7 flavors or so).  Gigi described as "it's like a puffy crepey dough thing, perfect!"  They also have ice cream and tapioca drinks and juices.  Genki not only sells desserts but also is a type of high end mini-mart for mostly Japanese items, like 50 SPF Shiseido sunscreen and miniature hello kitty sets, giant Pocky and the occasional bag of wasabi shrimp chips.  One more honorable mention for the crepes, my friend A. got the crepe filled with whipped cream, cheese cake (large giant triangular pieces), and blueberry topping which was fabulous and I only had one bite.

Genki Crepes really hit the spot!  You might have to wait in line and wait for your order, but time passes quickly when you're trying to figure out what the new savory snack is between the Indonesian Shrimp Chips and the Toblerone in the last aisle.

I love Genki Crepes!
author: Betty L.

description:
I tried this place for the first time since my hubby raved about it and we went to SF for our honeymoon.  Get the nutella & banana crepe.  Now it is unlike any other crepe I've tasted because it's crispy and it's in portable form!   They put it in a triangle wrapper and you hold it in your hand and bite it like a sandwich.  It's warm and tastes delicious.  We also got the nutella & strawberry one but the strawberries were a bit too sour so didn't taste as good as the banana one.
They also have little goodies like snacks and such to buy.  We sat outside the store on a bench since no real seating in there.
I'd go there again!
author: Amy L.

description:
Lychee green tea.
Jap snacks!
open late!
good prices!
delicious crepes!
ahhhhhhhhh=HEAVEN!

also they have this really good ice cream in the freezer-it's waffles with vanilla ice cream coated in hard chocolate in the middle. SO AMAZING.
Try their lychee ice cream as well. TO DIE FOR!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Minus one star  - they need a bigger waiting area. Genki is interesting with all the overpriced Asian knick knacks (seriously, go to May Wah or Ichibankan if you're craving Pocky) but I feel like their aisles of stuff is taking up precious floor space. Sure, you can wander through the aisles until they call your order number but they don't call your number very loudly. Customers usually end up crowding around the order counter and they aren't always courteous and you have to shove past them to order.

The crepes are great though. The crepe is usually crunchy around the edges, which I like as the texture contrasts with the semi-soft ice cream. I find satisfaction in crunchy food. The sound gives me a little happy rush. :P You can get a crepe with whatever ice cream flavors and fruits they have; I usually get Nutella and vanilla ice cream. My fiance usually gets just vanilla ice cream. (He doesn't like Nutella. He's crazy.)

Besides the crepes, they have smoothies, tapioca drinks, eggettes, juices.
author: Amy O.

description:
Okay, four and 1/2 stars; -1/2 for ambience (or lack thereof).

But damn, those are some BOMB a** crepes.

Perfect for that quick fix.  I actually had one for DINNER last night (banana, nutella, and whipped cream)!  Okay, not exactly a complete meal, but it was exactly what my soul was calling for!  It was SO good, and SO memorable, that I'm making hubby take me again tonight.  Okay, okay...NO more desserts for the rest of the month =(   - but I will GLADLY make the sacrifice =]
author: Samantha M.

description:
I have loved Genki since I was a wee child. I still do. Their crepes are AMAZING! So sinful! I love the random things they have in their store. I'm a huge fan of their ice cream crepes.. with NUTELLA! Yummmmm :)

Beef flavored erasers? Ramune soda! NORI FURIKAKE! The actual brand from HI that I love! Random Asian things! 

Their tapioca is good, but you can't beat Sweet Delite up the street. And their eggettes are great too, but they aren't better than Eggettes. Haha. And there is nowhere to sit, usually. :(
author: Coco C.

description:
this place is a mecca for young disheveled young kids in need of sugary treats at 10pm. i honestly stood out as having celebrated my 18th bday more than a few times.

this place is part of a convenience store specializing in import asian junk food. having said that, the crepes are fantanstic. get the egg waffles
author: S F.

description:
It was a cold rainy night and after a warm bowl of pho at the Pho Garden me and my date decided that we wanted dessert, particularly tapioca but once we discovered that Quickly's was closed we decided to embark on a short journey for a place that actually had it. 
The last plan we had in mind was "Genki Crepes" so we walked in and I was excited to finally get my wish of the night. Little did I know that it wasn't what I was expecting. I ordered a hot milk tea tapioca and my date got the strawberry banana tapioca, we shared honeydew egg puffs. I put the straw in the coffee container (since the item was hot) and started sipping but ended up sucking on the straw of course to only learn that one of the tapioca balls must be stuck. So I did what most people would do, take off the top and fix the straw but as I did this I discovered there was a tea bag (chinese if that helps) that had broken inside the cup, this would explain the leaf-like material when I drank from the straw. After this scenario I went up to the girl who made the drink and asked her if the tea bag is suppose to be broken, in broken english she said "yes, it's like that" I begged to differ but put the top back on my cup and drank the milk tea some more, I swear it was not normal to be consuming tea leaves in this manner. 

Genki Crepes seriously needs new staff or changes in the way they make hot milk tea. How the hell do you expect me to drink the tea bag along with my tapioca drink?? I think the girl lied. Not to mention the egg puffs which came out deformed looking and tasted like they had been left out all day on the counter. 

Although the crepes are good, the one in japan town is still my favorite. My advice, go to Eggettes....their much much better.
author: Jade D.

description: Delicious crepes! I came here because Cynthia's crepes was closed and I think I'll be coming here from now on. I ordered the crepe with just Nutella and it was so good! They also have a great selection of Asian snacks and candy.
author: Stephanie W.

description: This place is pretty cool, one part mini-mart and another crepe factory!  I've been on a crepe hunt these past few weeks.  The crepes here are crispy, and ice cream was good.  Got one with strawberries and bananas - the strawberries weren't ripe, and the fruit topping was limited, but overall I was happy.  Also given they were open passed 1130 on a Thursday night after a late dinner is another big plus!  When i'm back in the area, I'll go back for sure.
author: Kev C.

description: Run of the mill crepes that won't leave you wishing you just spent that $5 dollars across the street at Quickly, but also no eye-rolling-slap-your-brother proclamations of deliciousness.  This is as standard and basic as you get - fillings are just enough, ice cream can be on the icy instead of creamy side and the service, well you're not coming here for the service.  What really knocks this place down a few stars is the tea. DAMN calling it "tea" feels like an insult to tea.  We got the green "tea" and it tasted like water ......and sugar.   They couldn't even bother to put in the artificial green tea flavoring....that is just plain lazy. With that said, there are a few gems in the attached convenience store. Do try the Haribo coca cola fizzy gummy candy and they even have an assortment of 70% + dark chocolate that I've only found at niche stores.  Random? yes, but I'm not complaining.
author: Dianna W.

description: I love coming here when I have a sweet tooth. Although they are more known for their selection of crepes, waffles, and ice cream, it's also a mini mart so they have sodas, juice, chips, and other drinks and candies. When I'm here I usually order a sweet crepe. This place is in a central place on Clement with other local shops and restaurants. Nice place to stop by for dessert.
author: Frances V.

description:
Holy crepers!
Crepe with green tea ice cream and lychees. Amazing...even eaten on a butt cold freezing night.  I will say that they only give you like 2 or 3 lychees, which was sad, but still good.

I also enjoy their egg puffs - they have a variety of flavors: original, honeydew, coconut, chocolate, peanut butter, red bean, and there are more, but I am blanking on them. To be honest, I've just had the original because every time I want to be adventurous, I still tend to gravitate back to the originals.  Well...what're you gonna do? One of these days, I will try another and let you know. 

It also tends to be crowded, but I will say that they are very meticulous in making the crepes and such.  They always come out so nice looking. So good looking that...a lady walking by asked, "What do you want me to do with this?" Her presumed bf replies..."Uh..eat it "(you idiot - is what he would've added, but the crepe may have landed on his face). True story.
author: Dolores L.

description: Zoo-like, lively atmosphere even on a rainy freezing night. And the crepes? Yum yum yum yum. Get one filled with ice cream.
author: Mandy H.

description: I make it a point to visit this place every time I'm in San Francisco.  The green tea ice cream crepe with lychee and whipped cream is so good that I've never tried anything else!
author: Michelle L.

description:
This place is OK. Just a crepe, nothing over the top good., But then I've had crepes all over Asia so I am a bit picky. I dont like my crepes to be crunchy on the sides but really soft and buttery, which this place does not do right. Their toppings are the usual stuff, but I perfer a place in Japan town (not the one by the japanese book store) but on the 1st level...can't recall what its called but their crepes are really soft and good...just like how crepes should be! This is a decent place to go if you are in the area adn just want one and don't want to hunt for parking somewhere else.

I wish they would make them like in Japan, and 1/2 the price!
author: Petri Y.

description:
Thin crispy crepes. Long lines at night.

Things to try:

Strawberry, nutella, whipped cream.
Avoid banana. Gross...
author: Will W.

description:
I really dislike this place.  I tried their savory crepes more than once --- and there's just something really disgusting about them.  I could never really put my finger on it...I think it might have to do with them being really greasy, but there's something majorly wrong with them...just the taste, the texture, eghh.  Just catching the smell of it when I walk by makes me feel sick.  Also, their ice cream/desserts are way overpriced.

The market is okay - it's really small.  It's useful if you want to buy a gummy hamburger or hello kitty shaped anything.   Normally, I don't complain about having a limit for using credit card, but their limit is $10...and that's really annoying.
author: Liz C.

description: Crispy crepes aren't for everyone, but a warm crepe slathered with nutella and filled with slices of banana with vanilla ice cream is difficult to beat. I'd advise going later at night, around 10:30 or 11, to avoid waiting in line. Bonus: the wide selection of Japanese snacks, drinks, and candies.
author: Lauren S.

description: THE best sandwiches and THE nicest owners!  We ordered there almost every day while we were filming The Full Picture (feature film running at the roxie in SF through June 17 '10 and then again, at the RAfael in S. Rafael June 24th @ 7 PM).  Jesse and his wife, Roberta (the owners) are the best people.  The sandwiches NEVEr disappoint.  U can't go wrong.  they even came to see our film!
author: Bettina D.

description: So as it turns out the dessert crepes are YUMMO! I get the ones without nutella and the end result is a wonderfully light, melty, crispy crepe-ice cream bonanza. I really recommend the one with fresh strawberries and ice cream. I goes without saying that I shamefully retract the previous review and encourage all to go to Genki Crepes and have some Dessert!
author: Beatriz A.

description:
Yum egg puffs.
Yum Nutella crepes.
Yum salmon crepes.
Yum green tea ice cream.
Assorted chocolate, candy, and odd food items.
And Japanese condoms.


What more could anyone possibly want from life?


P.S. Unfortunately they no longer sell the "Hello Kitty" toaster. 
A great and tragic loss, and a minor blemish on an otherwise 
fine establishment.
author: Max R.

description: For a place who does mass production... U would think they'd have a better system & get d crepes right?!! It was poorly prepared(sloppy), crepes overcooked & surprisingly slow service. I guess it's cheap for a reason?! Going back to Japan town's crepes. Blah...
author: Jays D.

description:
Skip desert and head straight there after dinner. 

*Strawberry ice cream & kiwi with Nutella crepe. 

Anna's and Juan's favorite place.
author: Marcelo B.

description: Me likey! I wouldn't make a special trip, but if you are in the area and you want something quick & portable to eat, you gotta check them out. The crepes are on the crispier side (which I prefer) and I will have to try a dessert version next time.
author: Claudia P.

description:
I like this place.  Lots of late night energy, fun desserts + plenty of curious japanese knick knacks and snacks to browse while you're waiting. 

0. I agree, crepes are a little more like stiff cone structures, but as an asian style crepe its still tasty.   (Sophie's Crepe's in Japantown is better)

1. Really like the egg puffs.  Not as heavy as the ones at Eggette, and delicious when its nice and hot.  We've had the plain and the red-bean flavors before, plain is better.
author: Carol P.

description: Been going here since 2004 with sisters and a few friends. Love this place, hate the parking..well its expected since it is in SF. I like the crunchy texture of the crepe. I like it simple, just nutella and whip cream for me.
author: Jacqueline D.

description: I have really enjoyed myself every time I've gone here. I always get the nutella banana crepe, and although it isn't as great as other crepes I've had in the past, I still think they're pretty darn good. But what makes me love this place most is the little market area where I can get Japanese rice paper candies along with various other goodies.
author: Andrea N.

description: For my money, the best red bean milkshake in the city. No complaints about their dessert crepes either, although I split my crepe-eating duties between Genki and Sophie's in Jtown. The benches inside the store were rather dirty today, though, and the lack of space to form an uncramped line is never pleasant. Then again, Genki deserves extra love for being open on a Monday (unlike Sophie's).
author: Albert L.

description: I think this place is mainly just hype. Their crepes? Just average because there isn't anything special about them. Their crepe menu isn't very extensive either. There isn't anything fancy about the place either. Their DESSERT crepe is too SALTY. Is that even right? The last time I came here I figured that their crepe is a bit gross. I would not come here again for the crepes but perhaps one of their other snacks, or if I just happen to be in the neighborhood. Bottom line: Genki crepes are nothing special.
author: Jenn D.

description:
Japanese style crepes made to order. It's no wonder I don't go here every week and blow up like a balloon from all the ice cream crepes I'd eat. If I lived closer, I probably would.

I get bizarre enjoyment from watching the guy slather the batter and do the round and round move to create the light and crisp crepe. Genki workers do this pretty quickly, even if there's a long line. For me, it's usually green tea ice cream, some kind of fruit and Nutella. It's all about the Nutella. Yea, put Nutella on everything.

The egg puff things are solid, give those a try. There's also boba tea and grocery items (e.g. Asian snacks, weird Manga stuff, Japanese hair product) but who really cares about that when you have crepes.
author: Michael S.

description:
genki is a cute little half creperie, half asian snack mini-mart. the service is really fast, but i wouldnt suggest going up to the register unless you know exactly what you want because they'll just end up asking other people behind you what they want if you take too long [im not saying this in a complaining way]. 

the menu has a bunch of choices, both savory and sweet. they also have smoothies, juices, and boba [although i have yet to try it]. for me, simple is better, so i just got green tea ice cream inside a crepe. even though it wasn't dripping with chocolate and whipped cream, my crepe was still delicious. the texture is great - crispy on the edges but still soft and fluffy enough that you can peel off pieces of the crepe with your hand. 

the only complaint i have is that i kind of had a very subtle weird after-taste in my mouth that i think was from the pan thing that they make crepes on. i also have really sensitive senses of smell and taste, so maybe it's just me. *shrugs* regardless, i'd recommend this place to anyone craving something sweet after eating at one of the millions of places on clement.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
droool.

+1 for sweet crepes (banana nutella whiip cream and strawberries)
+1 for the other crepes (turkey avocado and cheese)
+1 for great location -- on clement so you can just grab a seat outside and chill. 
+1 for decent prices

Crepes are soft but crunchy. Good flavor and not too heavy.

Good place to stop at if you're not uber hungry and want a snack.
The convenient store that is also a part of it has yummy asian snacks.
author: Ashley C.

description:
I was gonna share this crepe with my wife who was doing her hair in the salon next door:

Banana + honey + almond + strawberry for less than $5.

The first bite was kinna disappointing.  The crepe was too crispy for me and has no taste.  The fruits were not fresh.  After 2-3 bites, I realized most of the fruits were gone!!  (They only put fruits at the top of the crepes.  Toward the bottom .. nothing much).

My wife still wanted to have a bite, so I let her.  She found it was ok -- then the next thing she noticed, the honey dropped through the wrap onto her pants and dry-clean-only jacket.  Well, our lesson learnt on crepes can't contain honey - duh!
author: Alex T.

description:
Yummmehh... creperies are everywhere now.. these on the go pocket meal / desserts are just what you need when roaming clement street.
anything that is tasty sweet or savory theys got it.  good selection of japanese drinks, snacks, foods, teas.. candy toys and hair products car freshners.... nice.
author: JASON L.

description:
I love this place! Not only as a restaurant but also as a convenient store! 
This is the first place I've ever had a crepe and I loved it x3 I got the 26, which was the cheese cake one with blue berry and I think I'll be ordering that till I get sick! 
Aside from the crepes there are tons of toys and snacks to look at and adore. They sell the white rabbit rice candy for only 2 dollars! 
I love this place!
author: Allie W.

description:
Yay for strawberry and nutella crepes made while you watch!

Or if you're not into watching, made while you browse the men's pocky, dried squid, and aisles upon aisles of hello kitty crap!

Yay for hello kitty crap!

Also pretty neato are the egg puffs, like Hong Kongian bubble wrap made out of pancake.
author: Meredith K.

description:
Holy moly...walk by this place at any time of day and your mouth starts watering... they have the BEST frikkin crepes and they fold 'em up so you can walk as you eat, which I alway appreciate. They have the coolest stuff in the isles too! All kinds of ittle bitty toys that come in a box and you have to put 'em together, all kinds of interesting/weird candy and drinks - NOT TO MENTION they sell Polly Ann ice cream in their freezer section!!! If you've never had it, try it - sesame is my favorite so far, but lychee is a close second. 

My personal favorite crepes are: 

Sweet Chili Chicken (chicken, cheese, green onions and sweet chili sauce.)
