Salmon Onion Cream Cheese Caper (it comes with wasabi, but I'm not a fan of that, so I get it w/o)

Nutella, Banana, Lychee Ice cream - watch out!!!! So goooooood!

Plus, note that they are open late (hardly ANYTHING is open late in this area) - 11:30 pm on Friday and Saturday, 10:30pm otherwise. 

You have to go.
author: Alexa S.

description:
I like the odder crepe combinations here- lychee, and of course the green tea ice cream with adzuki and yomogi.

Genki sells some pretty wild Japanese combini (convenience store) items here, including the glue that some Japanese girls use on their eyes to enhance the crease there.  I'm not making that up.

Another funny thing about Genki: try to take a photo.  They will flip the hell out.  I think it's because they are in a rivalry with the other crepes place in Japan Center, but it may just be because they have a chemical imbalance.  Good crepes though.
author: Brian D.

description:
Very good crepes, although I've found it is difficult to really mess up a crepe.  You can burn it, make it too thick, not have it fresh etc. but really, it is just some fluff stuffed with sweets, not rocket science here!

Having been a while since I have been back I have to wonder, is it as great as these reviews make it out to be?  Hmm, I really should get back and re-sample the goodness to verify it still lives up to the four star experience, but I'd say it still warrants a try if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Stephen H.

description:
The atmosphere of Genki's crepes is interesting. The store is a crepe place, as well as a mini-mart where u can purchase drinks and other random things. But to get to the point, Genki's crepes are great.

Service: The people who work there are not that enthusiastic ( except the guy making the crepes, since hes pretty funny), but Genki's doesn't require great service, they only need to get your order right and not be total jerks.

Crepes: The crepes at Genki's taste wonderful. The dessert crepes and snacky crepes always taste fresh and sweet. The  Savory crepes are also pretty good if you decide to get one of those. Plus, the crepes are fair priced. Another option besides crepes u can get are egg puffs, which taste pretty good, not great, but decent tasting enough to enjoy. 

Pretty much they get a rating between 3 and 4 to me. I'd recommend it if you want to get a quick snack in the mid day or need to pick up some snacks for a party later.
author: Dylan T.

description:
Micro Japan, seriously. If you ever tried Sophie's Crepes in Japan Town, this place is almost as good, but with a better location smaller lines, and a more reasonable price. I tried the crepe with strawberries, whip cream, and nuetella - definitely recommend, esp with Ice Cream if you can handle all of that (will probably set you back $6, $8 with ice cream compared to 2-3 dollars more at Sophie's).

They even have all of those asian candies and drinks that you can only find at either Ranch 99 or a small asian market, pretty cool. It was funny seeing people's reaction when we walked back to our car eating the crepe, it must have some type of enchantment because everyone was staring like they were going to steal it.
author: Mike B.

description:
We pretty much always visit this place after eating at King of Thai because of their crepes/ice cream.  The crepes are good, but I'm always too full afterwards to eat purchase one, so I end up getting one scoop of either Green Tea or Lichee ice cream.  Delicious!

Unfortunately, I've had better crepes before...
author: Tisha Y.

description:
I love Genki Crepes!!  I didn't discover this place until maybe about a year ago or so.  Even if I didn't get crepes when i came here, i always ended up getting some kind of drink or snack.  Reasonably priced...can't go wrong for dessert.

WORD OF ADVICE: get the dessert crepes!  Ice cream and all.
author: Mike D.

description:
Banana, Nutella, Strawberry, with Vanilla Icecream crepe. Top that off with an avocado smoothie with boba and BAM!!! THE BEST COMBO!!
Tie that together with all the Asian candy and magazines and toys and you have Genki.

I have to say that this spot is choice. You walk in and dont smell the sugar mixed with chemical smell that most boba shops have, you smell fresh crepes being made. 

I've gone to this spot in years and the only gripe I have is that there isn't enough damn parking on Clement street..
author: Eric A.

description:
I have seen different workers there all the time; it seems that the turnover rate is high.  Usually, there would be a line for the crepes as there's only 1 worker making the crepes, rarely that I have seen 2 workers.  The quality is not stable.  I have seen the crepes burnt a few times.

Considering the price, I don't feel tempting when I take a look of the menu and everything seems to be so expensive.  Instead, I like to take a look of the snacks, toys and drinks sold in the store next to the kitchen and the cashier.  Again, these stuff are overpriced too.  You possibly can find a better deal in the supermarket at Japantown.
author: Roserrele W.

description: Not bad for the price (around $5) for a crepe. Their crepes were very satisfying. The skin was a bit salty, but I don't mind it since it's a nice balance to the ice cream and strawberry filling i got.
author: J K.

description: I've been going here since my middle school days at Star of the Sea down the street. I always get a vanilla ice cream crepe with bananas, nutella, and whipped cream. Never fails to satisfy me. I've also had their egg puffs which are also good, but definitely just come here to try the crepes. I've tried other crepe places around the city, and Genki's is the best!
author: Zherr-Anne A.

description:
I just LOVE this crepe place. Yummy crepes and very cute shop. I must have come here like a hundred times!! No lie either.

I always get the Vanilla ice cream + Nutella crepe. It is a bit pricey (they could lower it a buck) but hey, I hardly have crepes anymore and we come here everytime after eating somewhere across the street. Worth saving dessert and heading here.
author: Star B.

description: I like coming here for their dessert crepes. I've never actually tried their savory but I've always been more into dessert crepes anyways. I used to be ok with the way they made their crepes but then I noticed they started making it more crispy than usual. So now I request a soft crepe and they make it soft for me. =) I love that they have polly ann's ice cream. I usually get honey dew but I tried mango and it's pretty good too. They have the best egg puffs too. I discovered honey dew egg puffs - I would get those from now on!
author: Helen L.

description:
Hmm. Judging by all the previous 4-5 star reviews, maybe I just ordered the wrong thing at the wrong time.

Last night my friend took me here and hyped it up a lot beforehand.

Too bad I pretty much had the worst crepe and green tea of my life. No joke. The actual crepe had a weird flavor and was very cardboard-y. I had it with green tea ice cream and strawberries. The 5 slices of strawberry were good, however the green tea ice cream was frosty and tasted like it had been sitting there for a looong time. It wasn't creamy at all, just crunchy and icy; it also didn't help that it took up 90% of the crepe. To compliment my lousy crepe was a lychee green tea with tapioca pearls that tasted like it was made from dirty tap water. 
Also, since it's also something of a little market, there wasn't that much room for seating so we had to walk back to my car to eat.

I don't see myself coming back here again, at least not by choice.
author: Micaela G.

description: Ewww. Maybe it was a bad experience but the crepe I had was not well mixed in with the other ingredients. It was more like a whip cream crepe at the top, then the ice cream portion, and the strawberries all at the bottom! Whatttt!?! I honestly prefer sophies! They are the bestt!
author: Maggie C.

description: ice cream?  YES.  crepes? YES.  sold.  sign me up!  after a delicious dinner on clement street, what better dessert could you ask for?  it's a great place to satisfy your sweet tooth.  with asian candies galore, you can also get your fix of hard-to-find favorites.
author: Josie P.

description:
Always wondered about that bubble soda/boba drink.

Now I know, what a taste sensation!

Had the Honeydew Milk tea (with tapioca balls), yummers. They also have all that asian candy crap, which my dentist would happily endorse. 
Sanrio and manga type stuff too, if you're into that stuff. 

A good place to shop for cutey gifts for young and old(ish)!!!
author: wayne s.

description: Ive passed by here one time but i never gave much thought about it until my friend started talking about it haha! Every night we find some place to try and find new places, and this was the place we had to check out. So me and my 2 friends drove here around 10ish and there was still alot of people. It smells great! Ordered the strawberry crepe with mango ice cream .. it was heaven! my friends loved there to, the good thing about it also is that there a mini store in there, so theres drinks and snacks. Another thing is that theres quicklys right across and you can still use there wi fi from genkis haha! good stuff tho.
author: Armand B.

description: I love their crepes and fair price. It's a good spot to grab a small snack at night in the Richmond district. I've always had good experiences here but I'm not satisfied with the new cashier's customers service. When I was placing my order she gave me attitude, yelling "what what what" to the customers. I just hurried and paid for my crepe. While I was waiting, I noticed the conflict in the kitchen with the cashier and the crepe chefs, she started rolling her eyes, bobbing her head and throwing tantrums. It caused a delay on all the customer's orders because she made multiple mistakes. Even the crepe chefs were really frustrated with her. She yelled " if you guys want me to quit I will, today is my day off I'm not supposed to work anyways." But work is work, you're getting paid. My order ended up not on the list where the chefs prepares the crepes. I had to asked them to make it because I've been waiting forever. But thanks to the crepe chefs, and their nice customer service, I got my delicious crepe.
author: Jia C.

description: Very tasty crepes. Perfect as a sweet dessert after having a dinner in the area. Kids love it
author: Ron H.

description:
Amazing! Enuff said!!

MESSAGE TO THE OWNERS:
DON'T CHANGE ANYTHING (especially the prices) it will keep everyone coming!
author: M R.

description:
i think bi-rite lost a star after i ate this crepe. vanilla ice cream served in a huge crepe cone with whipped cream, nutella, and strawberries is genius. the staff was friendly and there are lots of little cool japanese trinkets/snacks in the store. 

quick tip: don't make a u-turn in front of a cop for a parking spot. you'll get pulled over and the crowd in front genki will laugh at you.
author: B Y.

description: We usually come here for their ice cream and fruit crepes.  The most recent time we went the ice cream crepe was much better.  They made the crepe more crispy to better contain the contents (melting ice cream and fruit) and give more contrasting texture.  A soggy crepe just isn't as good.  It makes all the difference!
author: Alex H.

description:
i reallly love this place.
crepes, YUMMMY! service, awesome. 
what more can you ask for?
crepes, asian snacks, asians drinks. 

i like this place so much my BF uses genki to bribe me.
"if you do this, we'll get genki tonight" HAHAHAHA :)
author: Jackylyn C.

description:
nutella/banannas/mango/strawberries

any combo of that and you'll be just fine!

waiting for your crepe will be a snap, i could spend days looking around at all the japanese toys/candy/food there!
author: Alan C.

description: late nite. super good. mann what more can you ask for. service is nice and super quick. great place overall.
author: Julian H.

description:
UPDATE: thanks to the new increased demand for Japanese/HK-style crepes by snobby white people who live on California Ave.... they now let their original staff members go and hired "Manuel" and "Jose" there working under the table making crappy-crepes. Suit yourself. I guess you can't go big unless u cut some corners, hire illegal workers and lower quality and service. Good going, Genki~!  ={

-----

We saw this place blow up within the period of one year.
White people caught up and now it's busy every damn night. 
Good for Genki, because they're serving good quality crepes and selling a cute selection of Japanese foods and goods. Though I'd rather go to Super Tokyo just down the street for miniature toys, nihhongo candy, and beauty supplies. 
I have a hard time deciding if I don't like them better than Sophie's in J-Town.
author: Tomas V.

description:
I used to love Crepevine for my sweet crepes, but this place wraps it up so you can walk around with it!  Big yummy street food, gotta love it.  We just stuffed ourselves at Good Luck Dim Sum so I couldn't get myself to order the huge cones of love.  My friends however could and they made it look so damned good.

I actually only ordered the green tea ice cream, but I'm sure as heck coming back for the chocolate ice cream crepe with cheesecake. Stay tuned....
author: Sonic D.

description:
Went to Genki crepes last night for the millionth time, and despite the annoying drunk clement street girls (one was dancing to the "don't cha wish your girlfriend..." song) who couldn't make up their minds as to which crepe they wanted, I still love love love Genki.

The crepes are out of this world, drop dead yummy.  This get's the Julie B "hands down, the best!"
author: julie b.

description:
Hot sweet Genki crepes
Ice green tapioca tea
My favorite things
author: Thomas M.

description:
The best flavor combo ... banana nutella and ice cream/whip cream!
The crepe has just the right amount of crunch and chewy.
author: Blu n.

description:
I LOOOOVEEEE this place!  95% of the time I order their #7, ice cream with 4 pieces of cheesecake crepe (3 at the top, 1 at the bottom)....I always replace the chocolate flavored ice cream with something else.

Ive always wanted to try their savory (hot food) crepes but it seems weird eating that stuff with the crepe texture of pancake/doughy outside.

I also like all the other stuff they sell inside their store.  

This place is a snack HAVEN!

BTW, I go here much more often than Sophie's crepes on the 2nd floor @ Jtown cus this place is more easy to get to right off the street.  That crepe place on the first floor @ Jtoen is pricier than Sophie's btw.
author: Gilbert C.

description:
Very average crunchy crepes served here.

Packed on a Saturday night, g/f, me, and three other friends decide to try this Crepe shop based on recommendations from other friends.  Imagine a small Asian market with an assortment of Japanese/Chinese candy and drinks with a Crepe booth at the store front, and this is what Genki Crepes is like.  

Anhie T. and I shared a Nutella & Strawberry with Vanilla Ice Cream crepe with no whip cream.  Three half pieces of strawberry adorn the inside top of the crepe, stuck to the side by a thin spread of Nutella.  Three half pieces of strawberry?  Wow, do they skimp!  The crepe was too crunchy at the edges for my taste.  I like it a bit crunchy...but not like a wafer where everytime I bite into it, I have to worry about pieces of crepe breaking off onto my clothes.  As we got to the bottom of the crepe, we noticed a bit more sliced strawberries.  

Don't be fooled by the "outdoor seating."  It's two wooden benches outside, and two inside, but always occupied by teenagers.  And one of the outside benches seem wobbly.  My guess is it'll break under the weight of three people.  We will see....

My opinion has been formed about this place, and it's a one star establishment.

You want a good crepe?  Try Crepevine or Crepes-a-go-go (my personal favorite) instead!  

+1 star for selling Squash air fresheners.
author: Daniel M.

description:
I came here a few times and was never disappointed. I loved the crepes, very yummy The egg puffs were good tooSo far I had:
1. green tea ice cream w/ lychee
2. lychee ice cream w/ red bean pate
3. mango ice cream w/ strawberry
4. strawberry egg puffs
5. vanilla egg puffs

The egg puffs were tasty but a bit expensive. Sometimes it gets pretty crowded especially later at night and its hard to find a parking spot. So far I never had to wait a long time for the food. They accept credit/debit card on with a minimum of like $10-20 purchase. Overall its one of my favorite desert places.Oh yeah, and the snacks that the market part of the shop carry is delicious. I couldn't find a variety of their chips else where.
author: Audrey M.

description: I tried the mixed fruit crepe with nutella and eggettes. SO GOOD
author: Vivian L.

description: This place has great desserts and boba tea drinks, but to be honest, the main reason I frequent it is for all the wonderful toys. There are shelves of Japanese toys and gashapon machines filled with tiny figures and crap. If you just finished eating on Clement or something, check this place out for some sweets and peruse the store for all kinds of cool Japanese stuff like hair clay! Aw yeah.
author: Nat L.

description: Came here with a friend of mine and as I expected, the crepes are uber yummy and just like what I imagine Japanese-style crepes to taste like. I had the nutella+mixed fruits. The combination of chocolate and fruits is just heavenly. I love everything about the crepes but then...the location. It's located in a little Japanese market. When we got here after dinner on a weekend, it was fully packed so we had to wait around, but then again I guess that's what it takes to be able to taste such great crepes. So overall, it's worth it. 5 stars to the crepes, 4 stars including the location.
author: Melissa S.

description: Good Crepes. Reasonable price. Ice cream and cheesecake was very good. Nice location, parking can be a bit tough though.  Overall good experience.
author: Matt F.

description: This place isn't as good as it was when I first went there, I'd say around a year ago. The last time I went, I ordered a sweet crepe and the crepe itself was too salty. So extremely salty with ice creme and fruits is not a good mix. And the girl working at the cash register and taking orders gives genki a bad feel. She looks pissed off and takes the order rude, therefore makes the whole process of ordering and eating the crepe a bad experience. I hope genki improves.
author: Shirley M.

description: Decent Asian style crepes. Has a little supermarket selling Asian snacks and merchandises. Ok but won't specifically come just to buy crepes in here. With the long line, no seats and wait, it's a no-no for me
author: Cliff T.

description:
I thought it's a regular crepe....nothing great nothing bad....ok.
I probably recommend some crepe with ice cream.
I guess the wrap is little bit salty and crispy than what I expected.
author: Ringo T.

description: I think crepes are good but really overrated... this place is pretty good though. I only come here when the gang drags everyone along here during our SF eating adventures, but I always give in and order something even when I'm stuffed from what we ate not too long ago. They have a mini market inside too with sweet Asian snacks/candy and random stuff. The stuff in the market is overpriced, of course, being in a crepe shop, but it makes everything convenient! Everything smells so good in here. It's always packed in here because it's delicious!
author: Anna V.

description: So happy the French Crepe made it into the Japanese store. Genki's Nutella, strawberry, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream crepe makes my day every time. Always great, always a line, don't even mind waiting. It's never more than 10 mins or so. They have all my favorite Japanese snacks, too. Chocolate Pucca, Meiji mushrooms, and other cool treats.
author: Suzanne O.

description:
Mmmmmm!  Love coming here after dinner to treat myself to a Nutella and banana crepe.  They have just enough Nutella, and they don't jank on the fillings like some other places.  

The retail part of the store is entertaining and helps kill time if they are busy and you have to wait for your order.
author: Violet S.

description:
Nutella and bananas crepe... need I say more?

This is a great place to satisfy your late night craving for Asian treats.  But I only come here for the crepes.
author: Mei C.

description: I went again today.  :/  I told you I was obsessed!  This time, I went for a Savory Crepe #17 - beef, scallions, cheese.  It was a messy crepe but it sure was good.  I think I'll be a fan for life.  Until I get sick and tired of crepes, that is.  With the pace I've been going these days, I won't be surprised if that happens soon.
author: Linh V.

description: A lot of my friends came here before and say that it is delicious. So I've decided to give this place a try. The crepe was too crispy for my taste. Felt like I was almost eating a waffle cone. Sorry. I still like 'The Sweet House' crepes better. Service here is very nice. Their store sells a lot of things. Some very cute things also. I don't like how they charge you for extra everything. Their drinks were too watery. It seem like they mixed it with a lot of water. Egg Puffs were pretty good. I like how to make the egg puffs on the stop. I wouldn't come all the way here for crepes again. If I am around, I might stop by and try a different flavor to see if it would be different.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Delicious crepes + reasonable prices = 5 stars in my book!

I typically get the Nutella, strawberry, and whipped cream option, and if I'm feeling especially glutenous I will add ice cream. That's my meal for the day and it's totally worth it!
author: Petra J.

description:
decent crepes. lovely juices. and a packed to the rafters market behind that, which is really the best part of all. 

first of all, it's got EVERYTHING. from housewares to food to purses to cell phone charms to re-ment mini foods to ramune sodas and i don't know, but i'm pretty sure i could live on it. second of all, what it's got is good. third of all, so cute!

and i think that's plenty of reasons to hoof it out to the richmond.
author: Irene S.

description:
A great treat after a Clement Street meal.  Try the whipped cream and strawberries.

It is also a Japanese convenience store with lots of cool items--from beverages to candies to mystery stuff!
author: Narendra R.

description:
So far I've practiced restraint when coming here.  I tend to order crepes with fruit and/or nuts and honey.  But I don't know how long I'll last.  My friend had the cheesecake crepe, and he his face was making ecstatic gestures the whole time, with his cheeks puffed out with cheesecake.

Plus, you gotta love the Japanese stuff all over the place.  Reminds me of when I was in Tokyo a few years ago.  Ah Pocari Sweat.  Brings back memories.  Too bad they don't carry Refreshing Drink.
author: Nadine T.

description:
Had a super yummy Nutella with mixed fruit crepe! So many choices on their menu and so hard to decide. My friends had Nutella with strawberry; Nutella with banana; red bean; vanilla ice cream with some fruit (I don't remember what it was exactly) and everyone was happy. Plus, it was made fresh and quick! Ooooo, the candy they sell are great! They've got all the old-school candies (ie Pocky, Super Lemon, Super Orange, panda cookies) and cool Japanese candies that are so yummy! AND they've got great Japanese products that you'd have to go to Japantown to find. Such a cool lil place for everything!

UPDATE:
Went there again yesterday because I was craving a crepe since the last time I went there. Still ever-so-yummy... Nutella and mixed fruits. Plus I got a great waterproof eyeliner there. Yup, love this little store because, in addition to some yummy crepes, there's just a bunch of stuff for you to browse through while waiting for your food. Oh yeah, my husband got vanilla ice cream with Nutella (his first dessert crepe) and loved it too!
author: Felicia S.

description:
Not a crepe place for me but I go there for their "mini-mart" shopping.

I tried their crepe once, but it wasn't so impressive.  Crepes in Japan are more moist (maybe I'm too used to that style).  Not bad, tho...

Like I said, I go there for shopping. What do I buy there??  RAMEN... They carried my favorite RAMEN(Nissin TONKOTSU).  but NOT ANYMORE.....  Genki was the only place I could buy that Ramen.... Where should I go now to get the ramen??   We can buy "chinese" version but I want a Japanese one... ugh!!
author: Mike M.

description:
Update: It hasnow become the cool place for HS kids to kick it when the parents let them out at night.  The scene has calmed down even with the kiddies.  The prices at Super Tokio have come up so they are the same or close.  
But I stand by my defense that the Crepes are not 5 star more 2.5-3 star at best.  It truely is a lesson that you eat with your eyes and nose before you do with your mouth. 


Always full of silly rich white or asian kids...or yuppies.  
The ice cream is third class!!
The crepes....are AVERAGE at best.

"How can you say that Spank's?" I can say that after eating enough of these in enough places around the world to have some opinion about it.  

while they do have some interesting combinations.....Cheap cheese, vegetables, or fruits and gnutella.  The flavor is barely worth the price. 

DO NOT buy any drinks or food here.  IT IS all JACKED UP!! Super Tokio another Chinese owned shop kiddie corner to here is cheaper, has  agreater selection and does nto have the same annoying clientele. 

I once heard a girl running screaming look at all the PahKi i just bought..."It's prononunced POKI, you silly broad, go back to the marina and eat your pancakes with your bourgiese crap"

In the end If you want to wait in line for mediocrity and pay too much for it then have at.  If you prefer to avoid hanging out with shallow marina types or pompous hipsters...then check genki OFF the books.
author: Spanky M.

description:
Pretty tasty ice cream concoctions.

I think the crepes themselves are a bit on the thick and tasteless side, however....And, it'd be nice to get something other than Hershey's chocolate syrup for the chocolate sauce.

Otherwise, a lot of interesting choices
author: Barca F.

description:
This place has the best crepes and most affordable in the city. Luckily, I only live one little block away so I frequent it quite often.
Whether you chose a savory or a sweet crepe, you will never be disappointed!
author: Kehaulani K.

description:
That's like "wow me" typa place for grab`n`go.

Crepes are really good and satisfy your cravings just right.
Especially that cheeze-cake creep and the ice-creams they have there, DAMN good!

The only thing might annoy is that sometimes (just cause they r the best of a kind around there), it takes a while till you get ur order due to the line of parents with their babies.
author: Cat of a Donut J.

description:
I love this place!!!! I always have to come here for egg puffs yummy and their milk teas aren't bad either. Seriously there are many places that sell wanna-be so so egg puffs, why not go for the real thing?

PLUS while waiting for yo food you can shop around in the fun little mini mart, whoever thought of the concept is brilliant hahahaha
author: eeerleni d.

description:
Yum, yum and more yum. Make your own. I did:

Chocolate Ice Cream, Peanut Butter and Whip Cream!  

MMMMM!M!M!MM!M
author: Dre D.

description: Delicious crepes for cheap! Strawberry banana with nutella.... the best! This place seems kind of random since it is like a convenience store that sells Asian goodies and it also sells crepes. But it is good and also sells savory crepes.
author: JC C.

description: Everytime I come to the city to visit my bestfriend we have to get a late night snack at Genki.  There crepes are so good. They have a crepe with cheesecake, vanilla ice cream, whip cream, nutella, and brownie bites.  Its so good and the crepes are not soft which i hate.  The market is cute has a lot of little nick nack stuff and toys. They have a great selections of asian candy which I love.  Best place to get crepes in the city by far!
author: jenny l.

description: I love this place. They have almost everything you'd find in Nijiya Market in Japantown in a small shop. I love it. I usually get the #22 crepe~nutella, bananas, whipped cream, and pieces of almond. Delish. They also have all the drinks I grew up drinking in Chinatown. So it's a little of Japan mets China.
author: Isabelle L.

description:
3.25
slightly above average crepes and egg puffs at a decent price

located on clement between 4th and 5th ave, parking can be a hassle but once you get to this asian mini mart, you can smell the crepes from the sidewalk. Half the store is dedicated to the asian merchandise that ranges from car fresheners, asian wallets, and asian snacks. its good to look around after youve ordered. 

Their selection of crepes, egg puffs, and drinks is quite good as it offers a some flavors of egg puffs (notably the red bean flavor) that other places don't have. They use real red bean and I recommend trying it if you come here. I also tried their strawberry crepe and comparing it to sophies crepes in japan town, it was definitely more crispy and would prefer the ones in japan town more. I also got their lychee boba milk tea which wasn't anything special. One thing i think this place needs are some tables as they only offer some benches to sit on as you enjoy their food. 

Overall, not a bad place to get crepes, egg puffs, and boba milk tea all at one place, but I could definitely get a better value on taste and price at other places.
author: Robert Y.

description:
What a great idea!  The crepes are rolled up like an ice cream cone and you get to choose from an array of fillings and toppings. I chose mango ice-cream with strawberries and whipped cream and it was very good.  The service was excellent and the guy at the counter was cracking jokes left and right.  I'm not sure about all the asian knick-knacks, and some of the weird candy looked pretty gross.  

All in all: If you're looking for a late night snack, splurge on a crepe.
author: MC S.

description: Kinda of small and over crowded, but all worth the wait.  Ice Cream crepes was to die for, and while you're waiting, walk around their Japanese market place.  So many cool things to buy. =)
author: Theresa W.

description: The strangest set-up for a store... They make the crepes at the front of the store-- and the rest of the store is a normal Japanese market. But I'm not gonna complain, because the crepes are just wonderful... They pack as much fruit & nutella as the crepe could handle.. They really are one of the best crepe makers in the Bay Area.. I love that they open so late, too.
author: Jo S.

description: After we had Sushi at "Old Town Sushi" we came here for our desert. They are always busy, but it worth a wait. The good thing about this place, you can actually use credit card here if you order more than $10.00. Some other places you have to use only cash. I had a great crepe yesterday. I will be coming more often here now. So far they are the best for me.  But I still want to try the one in Fishermans Warf.
author: Anya M.

description: Everything tastes good with Nutella on it. I keep getting the same thing here (crepe with Nutella), so I feel like I need to try the savory crepes before I make any more judgements. For some reason this guy I'm dating has a hankering for this place every time we go out to dinner. It's a little suspicious. Anyway, thin crispy crepes, better if you pay for extra Nutella.
author: Merrilee T.

description: Place is getting popular and when busy may take a while but the food is still good. only advice is to tel them to hold the grease!!! but cream puffs are good and light and they had nutella before it was popular. I thought I was the only one to discover nutella years ago.  Also don't double park there to get your fix. There are cops a plenty on foot, bicycle to give out tickets....you know to get money from us to get counseling for the supes....
author: Ariel W.

description: soooo goooood but why cash only??? theres like a 10 dollar credit min. and im not going to pay 10 bucks for a dessert.  Finally a nice samaritan girl donated 5 bucks to get me a savory redbean paste & lychee ice cream crepie!! and it was worthhh every biteee to the end!!! it gets messy the last 2-3 bites, as it drips and gets all stuck to your napkin and on your hands, jeans and shoes. Maybe it's just me.
author: Fat C.

description: Mmm, I had the lychee ice cream with custard and it was yummy! The crepe is a bit crunchier than I would like and a bit saltier than I would like, but I still downed the whole thing. No assistance necessary. The lychee ice cream was GOOD and the custard was decent. I could do without the custard. I think it would have been hella good with some fresh strawberries. When you stand in the long line, you want to eat everything! All the snacks look delicious. The guy workin the cashier knew to move everything right along. "Your change is 5 cents. NEXT!!!" I think next time I'll try the cheesecake with blueberries. Mm, sounds so good.
author: Linda Y.

description: They have some pretty delicious crepes here.  Always a nice snack whenever you need to liven up your spirit.  They make em fast too.  They also have a bunch of candies and snacks here in the back, pretty interesting stuff that you can barely find elsewhere.  Drinks aren't too much of their thing (for that, run across the street to Quickly)
author: Chai S.

description: This was my first crepe on the west coast (it might have been my first crepe). It wasn't amazing (kind of crunchy, but is it supposed to be like that?) but it was still yummy. I love all the choices they have and they also have bubble tea. The store itself is cute (not decorated cute, but they have a lot of groceries, candies, drinks that aren't readily available where I live). I wish they had more seating outside. I also wish they had this in NYC.
author: Geraldine T.

description: Genki Crepes! Cute little store that sells a BUNCH of them asian snacks that you can't get at safeway or albertsons. They also sell other things like makeup.. like the expensive japanese ones. Yeah but I usually come here to eat the crepes. They have a huge menu for crepes. I've tried the mixed fruits with nutella. Yummy. Next time, I'm gona add ice cream to that. And it opens late!
author: Amy X.

description:
The good o' USF days!  Yummy crepes...definately need to pay this place another visit .

 Crepe with nutella, ice cream and banana...extra crunchy is my recommendation.
author: Tess Y.

description:
For some reason they think that crepes should be crispy and that is puzzeling to me.  Why?  I don't think that the french intended to create a ice-cream cone when they made the crepe.  That is not the point.  So forget about all the ice-cream filled ones and if you absolutely have to, order a Nutella/Strawberry crepe.  

Attention:  The BEST VALUE in the store is actually this japanese macademic nut chocolate candy.  There are maybe 12 in a box and it's no more than $2.  It's amazing - it's simply the best!
author: Riri S.

description:
I was not prepared for the incredibly huge selection of snacks and such that I'd find among the few aisles of Genki. I usually need lots of time to browse places like this, but having only 10 minutes to spare before my waxing appointment at Victoria's, I frantically piled my arms high with candy, cookies and noodles (in order to hit the $10 credit card minimum) and ordered a strawberry & nutella crepe.

On my walk to Victoria's, I polished off half the crepe. I planned to save the rest for post-waxing comfort, but the damn thing disappeared as I sat in the waiting area.
author: kristen m.

description:
This place is a cute little takeout-creperie-slash-Asian-grocery. Not bad for late night sweet cravings. 

Parking's tough to find in the area, though.

Try the BLUEBERRY CHEESECAKE CREPE! 
The "Vanilla Ice Cream with Nutella" crepe is good, too!
author: J K.

description:
The dessert crepes (green tea!) are great - but be sure to grab some napkins or, better yet, bring a bunch of handi-wipes because they can get a bit messy toward the end. 

But, the best part of Genki is the mini-mart. Lots of Japanese candy, toys, teas, snack foods, drinks, and knick-knacks. Even my Mister, who would rather get his eyes gouged out with a fork than do my Clement Street circuit, likes it there. Call Ripley's.
author: laila p.

description:
As if you don't already wonder why there's a crowd, the scent alone draws you in already!  They offer all kinds of crepes, from dessert to snacks to savory.  Their savory snacks are a bit pricey, I think, for what you get...we ordered a smoked salmon and cream cheese and a spinach and mushroom....they both came out kinda thin and small.  I guess we expected thicker and chunkier...(just like crepevine does theirs).  Their dessert crepes, however, rocks!  We had nutella, vanilla ice cream and added cheesecake as extra...YUMMY..and HUGE!  

You can pass the time, while you wait for your crepes, smelling the different types of air fresheners they sell, or the 20 million sanrio dolls they have for your car. :P  I wonder if people actually buy their grocery stuff....
author: Abby E.

description:
This place is so cute!! So it's mostly a little Japanese store that sells random things. But attached to it are the best Mexican crepe makers ever!! I had a lychee ice cream and red bean crepe! MMm...other ordered among my party was a vanilla ice cream and nutella, banana and nutella, and mixed fruit and nutella. I don't get the whole nutella craze but I guess others don't get my lychee craze!! The place is pretty small with no seating area other than a few small benches. 

The workers here are very patient!! My party and I pretty much harassed the egg puff maker girl from the outside glass window as we were leaving but she still had a smile on her face!
author: Charmayne O.

description:
They have "Beyond Seven Studded Condoms" here, get them if you're kinky.

I saw hello kitty pasta here once too, I wanted to get them last time I was here but they didn't have it anymore.
author: Csndra L.

description: I recently moved to the Richmond area and when walking on Clement Street after eating dinner I smelled the most amazing smell.  It literally lured me into the door and I got myself my first Genki crepe.  It was AMAZING!!!  I have gone back a couple of times a week since I live so close and have brought many close friends by to try the dessert crepes.  I am a pastry chef in SF and I know great dessert and these crepes are simply delicious!!  I highly suggest trying the Nutella Banana with whip cream (also known as the #21).  ENJOY!!
author: Marianne C.

description: My go-to crepe place! Sweet crepes run around $5. I usually get the Green tea ice cream with red bean paste crepe. Sweet combo, not overwhelming since I prefer my crepes without nutella or whipped cream. Downside about this place is that there's limited seating.. so whenever I come with with others, we end up eating in the car. This place gets crowded at night!
author: Nancy L.

description: I give it kudos for having crepe at night when you're craving it the most! YUM! However, the crepe is a bit flat. They can add a bit more fruits or ice cream in it instead of making it seem like it's low calories. Anyways, thumbs up for opening late!
author: Sandy T.

description: My friends suggested we came here for crepes.  This is my first time here and I ordered a honey + nuts + banana. It was lovely!  Just the right portion and not too sweet.  It costs under $4.00 which is very reasonable.  I also noticed they have ice-cream with flavours such as, green tea, mango and lychee which is very unusual!   It's a very popular place, long queue when we got there.
author: Bella A.

description: The crepes here are great I think.  It is nice and crispy.  The ice cream is good and so are the prices.  I cannot complain about anything really.
author: T.  A.

description: Mouthwatering dessert crepes! Crunchy crepes filled with fresh strawberry, bananas, nutella spread and whipped cream. Enough said!
author: Lorraine G.

description: GENKI IS SO DELICIOUS!!!  I've been here twice (both times while visiting from out of town).   Tasty, crispy, delicious NUTELLA crepe that's not available in Chicago?!?!!? YES PLEASE.
author: Cathy H.

description: love the texture and crunchiness of the crepe. tastes like perfection! i always get the dessert crepes such as mango ice cream + strawberry, i love this one! or i get cheesecake+blueberry sauce and whip cream! my two favorites along with anything with nutella in it! i also like doscovering little snacks and candies in here, always fun!
author: Stella J.

description: I don't think Genki needs an additional review since they have over a thousand! But I wanted to add my two cents. If you like your crepes to be crispy rather than the traditional soft and mushy crepes, than this is the place to be. My fav combo is nutella, fresh strawberry with vanilla ice cream. YUM. It would be awesome of Genki would branch out in Campbell/San Jose so I can indulge more frequently.
author: Kaitlyn H.

description: This is a good place to go to if you're feeling ridiculous.  Like, you're willing to spend 5 bucks on a crepe filled with cheesecake, vanilla ice cream, and blueberry topping.  They have savory crepes, but I have a hard time resisting the sweet stuff, which is wonderfully extravagant.  Plus, the idea of eating eggplant tofu in an ice cream cone form isn't as exciting to me.
author: Liza W.

description: never really a big fan for crepes but im mainly here for the cool stacks they got, little on the expensive side but i careless... got to love the muchies :)
author: JessePanda C.

description:
Genki is a super cute crepe spot that also sells a bunch of cute little gifts and Asian snacks. They offer both savory and dessert crepes. I have only tried their sweet crepes and my personal favorite is the combination of strawberries, Nutella, and almonds ($4.50). The thin crepe always comes out crispy on the edges and soft in the middle. They are sooo yummmmmy. And, the crepes always come with enough "stuffing." You can choose from a list of many ingredients so personalize your crepe and call it your own. Nutella can get a bit messy sometimes, so be careful! They also sell tapioca drinks and ice cream.

The only negative thing I can say about Genki is that the place is really tiny. They have two tables inside that sit 2, and 2 tables outside. I wish they would expand because I would totally live there. 

P.S. I'm sort of biased because I'm addicted to Nutella. I could probably put Nutella on smelly socks and love it. : 9
author: Phoi B.

description: Something happened here to make me deduct a star- i'm not sure if they have a new recipe or something but the texture of the crepe didn't feel/taste the same! Still good and still a fan, though not as good as it use to be!
author: M W.

description:
If there was a "happy place" in San Francisco, this would be mine.  Hehe!  The sweet aroma that comes from the store alone gives it all the stars I can give!  It's truly the first thing you'll notice aside from the bright yellow and orange awning!  I would liken the experience to walking into a land of yummy ice cream crepes and rainbows.  mhmm!  Anyway, I'm a loyal fan of Genki because, to me, it's one of the only variety store plus crepe stand situations you can get in SF that's truly consistent with that over the top Japanese variety store style.  You walk in and instantly have a choice of ice cream, all kinds of crepes, savory and sweet!   Once you walk past the food zone, you're in the lil store area where you can choose from little capsule toys, asian candies, cosmetics, packaged ramen, frozen mochi and those funny ramune sodas.  The list of what this little mini mart has packed into it goes on and on.  It's fun for sure!  I totally recommend wandering into Genki if you are on Clement, even if it's just to pass time while waiting for your table at Burma Superstar!

My Favorites:

Savory Crepes:

Beef Sukiyaki + Green Onion + Cheese or the
Chicken + Green Onion + Cheese + Sweet Chili Sauce
Cheese 

The flavor is off the charts delish!  I drool thinking about it.

Sweet Crepes:

Chocolate Ice Cream + Cheesecake

For serious, cheesecake and ice cream in a crepe, what?!  Yeah it's that good and a delish change from the norm!  

And finally,  I like all the candy, so no favorites there.  All are equally awesome.  The weird Kit Kat flavors are a bonus though!

Happy Genkin'
author: Tiffany C.

description: Oh my gosh, this place is soooo Asian. I walk in and the place is lined with Asian candy, Asian cookies, Asian drinks, and Asian people!! I ordered a banana nutella crepe, which was very yummerz. I especially liked the crispy-ness factor! Who would of known a French dessert like the crepe would be such a popular thing for Asians. Did I mention the Asians!?!?
author: John W.

description:
I live in San Jose and I would literally drive to Genki Crepes in SF for their mouth-watering desserts!  I've never had such delicious desserts in my entire life.  The crepes are so yummy.  

Parkin' is a biatch!
author: Amy H.

description:
While I'm partial to the Nutella crepes, they definitely have some interesting combinations. I've also tried the chocolate egg puffs and I loved them. It's a little cramped in there, especially on a nice night, but that's not too much of a hassle. They have lots of other treats in the store itself but if you're looking for that sort of thing you can probably find it just a little bit cheaper down at May Wah  (though Genki has the advantage in terms of hours since they're open late). 

My only problem with the place is that they can be off/on with the crepe texture. I couldn't make the crepes myself so I shouldn't complain but sometimes I'll get one that's so crispy that little pieces break off as I eat and other times it's barely crispy at all. But the prices on their crepes are good and it's a great treat. If I could get away with eating there every day I just might.
author: Rachael E.

description:
The crepes here are deeeeelicious. I usually get the banana nutella, but have recently ventured out and tried the strawberry whipped cream, the strawberry nutella, and even a savory turkey, jack, avocado and sour cream crepe. Genki has yet to let me down. 

The yummy asian treats like pocky and shrimp chips are a little more pricey (by a few cents) than at other stores like richmond new may wah down the street but they are open late so we'll call it even...
author: Christine M.

description:
Banana, strawberry, and Gnutella crepe & real Coke with SUGAR.
If that was all Gengki had I'd be satisfied. But no. It has all sorts of little toys and drinks, and crunchy snacks and chewy sweets too.

I know you can get a lot of that stuff at other places on Clement or in Chinatown or Japan Town, but they don't have crepes.

Come for the crepes, stay for the cell phone chachkas.
author: Dan W.

description:
These crepes are great. Especially if you like to have them in your hand and walk and eat. Not the silverware kind.

I especially love the savory ones here and being a vegetarian you can customize yours. I would recommend one thing. the Swiss cheese is  processed so choose wisely on what kind of crepe you add Swiss to. Mozzarella is my favorite here and will order that as my cheese of choice.

This shop is a very good place to get some snacks as well. They have a great selection of japanese items even though being away from Japan Town.
author: Siavash G.

description: Genki Crepes is AWESOME!!! I love the nutella, banana, and vanilla ice cream ones. I would walk around the store and look at all the cool Japanese candies and toys while waiting for my crepe to be made.  They're the best and the people that work there are super nice. Whenever I'm on Clement, I always make sure to stop in and get my crepe fix.
author: Sarah L.

description: A for the selection but C for the overall taste. The crepe was WAY too crispy (I cut my boyfriend's lip on their crepes) and way too salty for a dessert crepe. Sorry, Genki, but Sophie's my first choice, I don't care if it's more expensive with fewer selection.
author: Camille T.

description:
when i first heard of genki crepes, i thought it was gonna be the normal crepe served on a plate. my cousin kept telling me that it's the best around and its convenient since you get to carry it everywhere with you. we went there and the menu had the picture of every single crepe they had so it was even harder to decide what to get.

i ended up getting the mixed fruit crepe with nutella and whip cream. the fruits are fresh especially the mangos. they are perfect and sweet and the strawberries and bananas also.

while you wait for your crepe, there's the mart to look around and it has Asian things like the japanese candy or cosmetics.

end result: crepe was delicious as can be!!! going back to try the ice cream crepe.
author: Erika T.

description:
4 Stars for the Crepes 

2 Stars for the Japanese Snacks 

The ice cream crepes are delicious and is the only place where you can get them in the Richmond district.  Store also carries Japanese snacks i.e Japanese seasonal flavors of KitKat.  However the price for the snacks are outragous!  A bag of Calbee chips are 2.59, I found several stores in Chinatown that sells the same chips for only 1.00.  Other snacks i.e Japanease Pocky were half off also in Chinatown.  I suggest to go to chinatown and stock up.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: This store is awesome... and I still have yet to explore the entire space. You get lured in by the scent of fresh crepes. For us: banana, custard, and caramel. Lots of Japanese goodies. Are you listening, Asiaphiles?
author: Maximillian M.

description:
The best of this style of crepe that I've ever tasted! Perfectly crispy and  has fresh ingredients... I love all the crepes that I've tried at this store, which include the green tea ice cream/red bean paste crepe, the sugar & butter crepe, and the nutella! mmm, thinking about it just makes me want to go there right now and have one.

  I also love how the store itself sells random items... keeps you entertained as you wait for your crepe to be served.  Snacks, drinks, and random japanese imported toys.  Fun store! 

http://fishandbunny.tumblr.com/post/860095406/after-dinner-i-was-craving-some-crepes-we-went
author: Freya B.

description: Japanese snacks and egg puffs!  Om nom nom!!!
author: Gary L.

description: I love this place! Reminds me of my college years (haha I talk like that was years ago). Love their red bean tapioca drink and the crepe with mango ice cream and strawberries. Plus they have a big selection of snacks. Best place to go to stock up on munchies for all nighters. I wish they still sold the pint of coconut ice cream. Polly Am is the best tropical ice cream flavor brand!
author: Theresa L.

description: I love Genki Crepes! Especially, when late night cravings of Banana and Nutella crepes kick in. Even when they are busy, you can keep yourself busy by taking a look around the store; they have the cutest little treats! I choose Genki Crepes over Sophie's Crepes (in Japantown) any day. The only downside is, their minimum credit card charge is $10, so you are either forced to pay for your friends crepe or buy something from the store to make up for the minimum. Although, I could have easily taken out cash from any of the ATMs around the area. I'm just a lazy butt. Just writing this review right now is stirring up a craving. Ahhhhhh.... Must have one soon!
author: Maggie H.

description: Delicious snack after filling up from the neighborhood resturants.  I see lots of people walking around with this triangle waffle like thing they are spooning up some kind of fruit and cream into their mouth.  Finally I see the line from the street.  OK I want one of those.  Around $5 its not too expensive but not cheap.  Its one of life's wonderful little treats.
author: Mar H.

description:
I come to this crepe place pretty frequently, and I must say that I am, indeed, a fan. The crepes are very large and buttery tasting, and they are usually pretty generous with the amount of filling they give you.

Sunday night around 7:30pm, and there was already a really long line. I don't know how long I waited, but the girls working at the cash registers were super cute and nice that I didn't really notice the wait. I also really like how the line goes through an aisle of japanese snack foods because there's always something interesting to look at.

Today I ordered the caramel, banana, custard crepe but instead of caramel, I asked them to replace it with nutella. They were very willing to make the switch and when I finally got the crepe, I was really pleased to see a very nice, thick layer of nutella coating the entire inside surface of my crepe. The custard was also good, but I couldn't really say much about it because of the amount of nutella in the crepe. I'd say the crepes are very large, and if you get an ice cream crepe, it might be smart to share after a large dinner. 

Good food, pretty good/quick service.
author: Virginia C.

description:
Crepe place that also sells cute Japanese toys? It's like Sophie's Crepes meets Hello Kitty! Anyways, I have yet to try the crepes, since every time I come to do so, I empty my funds on their little toys! Super awesome! I just went and bought armfuls of toys like Super Mario, Hello Kitty, and some dog miniatures. Even my mom was a fan! Had a huge selection of Rement toys. 

Final Verdict: According to the reviews, the crepes are to die for. All those cute little toys, what more can a girl ask for? I always have trouble deciding what to buy, if you love Japanese toys, you'll understand why!
author: Dana F.

description: I get the Ice Cream Crepe with Nutella. Pure LOVE!
author: Kelsey W.

description: Great desert crepes. Ok, I have only ordered the banana and nutella crepe, but that's because I'm addicted to it! I did order the egg puffs before too, but I was too preoccupied with eating my crepe, so I don't remember what the egg puffs tasted like. The best part is that they make the crepes crispy.  And don't forget to grab some napkins.  I usually eat too fast and it gets everywhere!
author: Flora C.

description:
I give genki an overall 4 star, but it's crepes deserve 5 star!!!
There're also a lot of Asian snack.  You'll love it!
author: Michele K.

description: This place isn't what it used to be. I used to love my strawberries with whipped cream and nutella, but when the economy got bad they skimped on the strawberries so I had 1 1/2 inches of empty space in my bites before I had anything tasty. The plus though is the way in which they keep the crepe itself crisp and golden brown. Other places tend to make it soggy
author: Leslie L.

description: I came here the other night with a couple of friends 'cause we all never been here before &we wanted to try it out. I ordered chocolate ice cream &cheesecake crepe, while my friends ordered the blueberry with cheesecake crepe & the mixed fruits crepe. They were all delicious. Way better than the other creperies I've been through. Crepes I've had before were all soft, however, Genki's were crispy &really delicious. I like how Genki's is also a mini mart with toys & treats from Asia. But I really wish that they have a bigger seating area; there's only two benches inside & a bench outside. Overall, I will be coming back to try the rest of their menu.
author: BrendaJoy G.

description: No one does dessert crepes better!  Forget about those French dessert crepes you eat on the plate, it's all about the Japanese ones you can hold like an ice cream cone!  This place is one of my favorite after dinner destinations.  I usually go for a crepe with Green tea ice cream, nutella, and strawberries...Mmmm.  My mouth waters just writing about it! I also love the store with its cute little toys and loads of Asian snacks!  Warning, this place can get crowded and there is minimal seating, but that hardly keeps me from enjoying my delicious crepe!
author: Anne A.

description: One of the best Crepes Ive ever had.The crepe itelf reminds me of a soft ice cream cone. I will fo sure be back, the next time I am in the city.
author: Jackie D.

description: There are these puffy things that smell like shrimp sort of but taste like squid and they come in these ball-like squarish bite sized pieces and there is some kind of stuff inside them but I'm not sure what because I can't read the package, but it tastes really good and it's healthy I think because it's mostly fish. I am trying to go vegan so I am glad they have this snack, and I think it comes in other flavors too like salted skin flavor or something.  I really like these kinds of snacks, and they have them here, along with a bunch of other kinds of snacks.
author: Starla D.

description: I tried the green tea ice cream with red bean paste and mango ice cream with strawberries crepes, I think they were just okay.  The crepes were thin and crunchy, not soft like they were supposed to be.  I had better crepes elsewhere i.e. Crepevines and Sweet Indulgence in Millbrae.  I think this place is over rated.
author: Avocadoagogo L.

description:
okay i'll be reviewer # 257....

how could you not be attracted to come in and order their crepes here when that captivating "crepe batter" being cooked on their "commercial crepe machine" can be smelled four doors down or up or whichever way you are coming from......Mmmmmm.....

when you step in you will see this extensive choices of snacks (fruits), savory (meats/veggies) and ice cream crepes like hallmark has cards.
it was really a dilemma to decide which one to pick. smoothies, bubble teas, egg puffs are also included on that numerous options!!

decision...decision...decision...

so, i opted for #21 which was under snacks that has  fillings of: nutella, bananas & marshmallows.
after that first bite, i felt i was in cloud nine!!!!...deliciously divine.
but there was a mistake i made.....i should have not include the marshmallows because it was super, gooey, sugary sticky after it melted in the crepe while it was being folded on the crepe machine!!!

i also adore their mini-mart that basically has japanese snacks and other caboodles of stuff.

this joint is delightful and adorable indeed!
author: Nelle A.

description: Most ppl come here for the crepes, but I come for the egg puffs.  So warm and delicious.....mmmmmm  Plus its fun to check out the cute asian snacks and trinkets while you wait for your order.
author: Chris Y.

description: OMG !! I LOVE this place ! I've been going here since it's been open and i always order "Smoked Salmon + Red Onion + Cream Cheese + Wasabi" MY FAVORITE !! They make the crepes just perfect !! I love how it's a bit crunchy rather then soft ^ ^ I wouldn't go anywhere else for crepes than Genki ^ ^ YuMmmY~ Drools ahaah
author: Trina M.

description:
my bloodhound senses tell me that genki puts salt in their crepe batter.  everytime i eat here i ask myself - why does my nutella crepe taste salty when it should be sweet?!

beggars can't be choosers.  what else am i to do when sophie's crepes closes at 9 pm and my craving is at 11 PM??
author: Josie M.

description: Egg puffs!! These are almost like bite-sized waffles. But lighter and not as soft and fluffy. The original/vanilla flavor is the best. Strawberry wasn't too bad, maybe a bit too sweet though. And honeydew just tasted like the original ones.
author: Lubs Y.

description: Yelpers, are you on crack?? Genki?? Genki is not that great.  This place serves tapioca drinks, eggettes, crepes, and six flavors of mediocre ice cream.  I've been here at least two or three times, and every time I wish I could be at Sophie's Crepes in Japantown instead.  Genki is like the Starbuck's of tapioca cafes...a lot of moolah for mediocre to nasty stuff.  There is nowhere to sit except a few benches that frequently get taken up by high-pitched, shrieking high schoolers because they're so excited to be out at 9pm. Go home and do some homework and give me my bench!!! Us senior citizens need a place to rest... Genki is OK, definitely not the best out there.  If you just want a quick fix to your waffle/crepe craving, come here to smell the aroma, but if you want the real deal go visit Sophie.
author: Chow Mein Ninj A.

description: If Yelp had half stars, I would give it 3.5 stars. The apple cinnamon and brown sugar crepe I had was not good at all. It lacked the brown sugar and it was a little mushy. But, my cousin had the mixed fruit crepe and it was pretty good. Next time, I'm going to ask for crispy, please. The mini-mart has some nice selection of Asian snacks but a bit over-priced. I would come back if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Emma T.

description:
dropped by last nite after dinner at B Star, and finally found LOOK-brand chocolates, in those slim wallet sized boxes, with strawberry filling, mmm... been searching for 2 years, in the city, and san diego.... also an abundance of japanese candies, drinks, canned coffees, chips, anime-video game toys...

u can find the best eggies/eggettes in SF here.  anybody care to refute my claim?  if ur ever waiting for burma superstar to call u back, just cross the street on over, order the original eggies, and chill on the in-store bench...

i wonder how long the girl has been working there... doesn't smile much, doesn't show expression, EVER... even my joking small talk doesn't tickle her funny bone... ima keep trying though... now that i think about it, she kinda looks like the lead female in "Lust, Caution", no?....
author: Ethan L.

description: I don't know one person who has not been here.C'mon,if you want a crepe don't go anywhere else. that would be plain ol' stupid. No other place would put chunky ass cheesecake in your crepe,they practically put the entire cake! and the cheesecake is GOOD. i don't eat these much anymore becasue I am trying to be skinny, but if my weight wasn't a concern I'd be here once a week,at least. If you go make sure you get a nutella crepe with strawberries and cheesecake,or substitute the strawberries for banana,if not go wild and get both.but i think that would get a little pricey.
author: Peeta B.

description:
just back from Genki.
um....everything is good,
crepes are delicious, as usual 
but, did the price go up AGAIN?
author: ManGi X.

description:
"Karlita!  Karlita!  What kind of crepe do you want?  KARRRRLITAAAA!  Sir, sorry, I'll just order for her - because I'm Bossy like that.  And I want a little taste of salty, and a little taste of sweet.  So if I order a sweet crepe for me, and I order a cheesy mushroomy-spinachy one for her - she'll give me bites.  I know she will.  She's nice and that's just Karlita.  Graceypoo, which one do you want?  The nutella and bananas too with whipped cream?  That sounds goooood.  What did Bernadiva and Cindy get?  Where's AJ?  Oh him and Karlita are looking at gummy stuffs. Why does he look like he's wearing a bullet proof vest?  I just noticed that! Oh, and sir these chips too - the Calbee hot ones.  Have you had those?  They're HOT!  Makes you all sweaty on your forehead. And these other chips too.  Wait, why am I calling you "Sir" - you're like, maybe 22? HAHA Just kidding. Thank you, Mr. Registerman.  Thank you.  Oh, wait - I have to pay?  Oh yeah, huh?  HAHAHA!  Okay, here's a Twenty.  WOW! Only $14 dollars?  For all that?  Thas' so cheap!  Okay, thanks.  Oh, that's my change?  Okay.  Sit down where? Oh, there?  Okay I'll sit down here to wait for my crepe."

Those poor workers at Genki... We were laughing and boisterous, and gallavanting around the store...that is until they handed us over our crepes, and we began stuffing the delicious goodness into our pie holes.  How do you quiet a group of drunks? Easy... Give them food!
author: Van Ness D.

description: Crep is too hard and crispy .... Maybe good crepe for some ppl just not me ....
author: Nat W.

description:
i was feeling frisky one late evening so it was a night of whipped cream, melted chocolate, and lucious strawberries...and i devoured it all with satisfaction.  

they do make yummy crepes.

and unlike sophie's crepes, it's a one stop shop for bubble tea to wash it down and for all the little pretty little candies wrapped up in pretty packages to put in your pretty mouth.  my fav are the white rabbit chewy candy that taste like sweet condensed milk.  yum!
author: Anh V.

description: a pigeon that had been lurking around inside this joint flew on to my crepe as it was being made.  Homeboy making the crepe caught it with his bare hands and threw it out the door.  Then he went back to making my crepe. I got the hell out of this place asap. no refund requested no questions asked this was just plain nasty.
author: Art F.

description: I like my food fresh and made-to-order, but usually, have to make-do with pre-made desserts. Genki is a refreshing change - you get fresh crepes filled with icecream, fruits, or other toppings of your choice...and you get to watch your dessert being made. My favorite - snack crepe with lychee icecream and fresh mangoes...yum! Be prepared to wait for a while though...it's that popular even on chilly winter evenings.
author: Shweta V.

description: Very similar to Sophie's Crepe at Japantown, but not quite the same quality, but it's still good. I like the hand-held, walk & eat type of crepes. I think they give you more filling than Sophie's, but the crepe wrapper isn't as crisp. And the place is part of a japamese mini mart, so you can look around the place while waiting for your crepe
author: Eric B.

description: the smoothies were excellent... the service however is by far the WORST I have ever experienced. Get some new people to represent your store please.
author: Clara A.

description: This place is da bomb!! My cousin had been hyping up this place for a while, so one day I decided to go with her and check it out.  Whoa! this place lived up to her hype.  I had gotten a Banana w/ vanilla ice cream crepe.  That this was awesome along with the smell of waffle cone that dominates the smell of the air in the place.  That crepe was so good that I probably looked like an ass sitting on the bench outside with ice cream dripping on my clothes and around my mouth.  But I didn't care, that thing was soo good I didn't care what was goin on in the world at that moment.
author: Robert L.

description:
i will drive from san jose to get me some nutella crepes. i've tried their competitor sophie's b/c everyone says it's just as good- IT'S NOT.

they have the best batter for their crepes and they come out nice and crispy. don't come here if you're looking for the kind of crepe that is served on a plate and soft.

i love their employees, always friendly. 

while you wait for your crepe, you can shop through their little market for fun stuff like snacks, drinks, car accessories and make-up. and fyi- their trolli candy is cheaper than most other chinese market

 i *heart* genki, if only they'd open a south bay location or cater my wedding!
author: t c.

description: I tried the strawberry with kiwis crepe and it was really good. The pancake part was really crunchy and the price was decent for a crepe not too expensive. This place is crowded at night and it seems to be a place where everyone goes for a late night dessert.
author: Polly W.

description: Genki, I love you and oh how I hate you.  You know I have a crush on Japanese sweets, it was a torrid long distance relationship.  Who would have thought a local could have turned my eye away from the land of the individually wrapped rising sun?  Since your arrival I've nearly lost my desire to see dear Tokyo.  No routing through Narita on the way home just to be near her, no hunting to go see steaming Octopus-on-a-stick, or seaweed pocket rice triangles at her Seven-Eleven.  Straight home to California I go, straight into your arms.  You tempt me with all the new charms Lotte and Moranga and Glico produce.  Long distance homewrecker you are.  Well, at least my love affair for dear Argentina is safe, until you start importing her Alphahores up here.  Keep your tempting thick mago shakes away from me Genki, I warn you.
author: San B.

description: I'm a big fan when it comes to tapioca drinks and crepes. They have really good boba drinks here and their crepes aren't perfect but are good enough. I think that they should try to avoid leaving the crepes on the pan for a long time because they become too crunchy, and this is the problem with their crepes, they aren't soft, but they're burnt and so the crepeness kinda wears off. Other than that its really good.
author: Clementine D.

description: Good for a bite on the go.  I ate here a couple of times and enjoyed it very much.  The savory crepes are not as good as the sweet ones, but maybe that's because I have a thing for sugary food.
author: Honey L.

description: If crepes had some type of holy grail, this just might be it. The joint is located inside a ridiculously cool mini mart. Lucky #21 was my crepe of choice. In addition to its combo of Nutella and bananas, I also added strawberries and mango ice cream. All orders are served wrapped, which is good because plating them would actually be kind of an insult. Why? As far as I know, this is the only place whose crepes have a buttery flavor and a crispy exterior. Did I stutter?! You heard me right. The inside was lined with a generous amount of Nutella, fluffy whipped cream surrounded the big chunks of fruit, and the ice cream sat right in the middle. OMGah! It was phe*nomnomnom*enal from start to finish. Totally worth driving around nearly half an hour to find parking. You should've seen me cursing like a sailor and my "crepe date" laughing. But alas, all is now forgiven and forgotten. Once you find out how good they are, you'll do anything for one of these crepes....ANYTHING! Domo arigato Genki! I'll be back soon!
author: Rhia R.

description:
by far the best place to get crepes! 

i love all the random stuff they got in that little store. (but no hawflakes : ( 

the crepe i had was a mixture of three of my most favorite ice creams.. green tea, red bean and strawberry cheesecake.
author: Kurt M.

description: Good crepes. Reasonable price and very fast turnaround from paying to putting the warm crepe in my mouth. Hit this spot early on the weekends as lines can get long once 9pm starts rolling around.
author: Jon W.

description: CHO-CO-LATE egg puffs...go get some! fluffy on the inside, crispy on the outside, the supermodel of egg puffs.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
fast. yummy. and you can grab something in the convenience store if needed.

the best part: THEY HAVE EGG PUFFS!!
author: S V.

description:
this is a mini-mart type of establishment that also sells pearl milk tea, crepes and other little snacks. 

I went on a Monday night,and this place was PACKED at past 9pm! out of curiosity I went in and ordered a strawberry  + Nutella crepe. 

That was an excellent choice since the slight sourness in the strawberry complemented the sweetness of Nutella really well. The crepe is thin and very crispy, holding this warm dessert in hand in the cold night air was quite a treat. . ($3.75)

I really liked their crepe, will come by again if around this area.
author: Winifred X.

description:
my boyfriend and i actually make a semi-weekly trip to clement street from the tender-nob specifically to stock up on candy from genki.

purchased at genki on a recent trip before viewing strangers with candy at the bridge theater:

almond crush pocky
strawberry pocky
lotte peach pies
meji pucca banana cream choco fishes
morinaga's coffee milk caramel
one package strawberry milky
one package monkey fruit chews
one package white rabbit chews
one mandarin orange and nutella crepe
one miniature chair toy

ok, so i'm a pig and have issues with low-impulse control.  at least when i'm in genki, that is.  genki is a cornocopia of snack foods.  if you like candy and find yourself with an extra $12, get yourself to genki and go to town in their candy aisles.  they also have an impressive instant-noodle selection (impressive meaning 1.5 aisles of the stuff), as well as a lovely selection of rice seasonings, (somewhat cheap) green tea, and various exciting japanese beverages...
author: genevieve g.

description: Egg puffs are delicious...like warm bite sized cakes that melt in your mouth.  Plus, Genki is open LATE so you can enjoy your egg puffs post bar hopping... DO IT.
author: Katherine C.

description:
sung to the tune of "oh mandy"

oh genki, you came and you made me a crepe-y
when i came back from worky
it was so damn tastey
and it made wish that i could marry you, oh genki!

yes, i wish i could marry genki (but i would keep my last name). their crepes are AMAZING. not only do i get to have amazing crepes, but i also get to enjoy running up and down the aisles of their store and buying random ass japanese food. they have the koala crackers with the liquid in them!!! thank god i walk here, otherwise i'd be 700 lbs. i still love you genki even if you give me a belly tire.
author: Aly L.

description: Wow, this place is yummy! Ice cream wrapped in a crepe, I love it.  You can smell the crepes from blocks away.  Try the Lychee ice cream w/ the custard and whipped cream.  Under $5 and fast service.
author: Hesam E.

description: After hearing about this place, I finally got the chance to try it out. I knew parking was going to be hard to come by so I'm dreading myself to drive here. But I thought I might get treated with some good crepe... it didn't do it for me. It wasn't worth going in circles to find parking for such a sub par crepe.
author: Rodel M.

description: It's ok.  I didn't like it much probably to sweet.  Too pricey.  Always a line and hot Japaneses girls waiting.  Rather go to Chinatown to buy japanese goods made from Thailand.
author: John F.

description: I'm the kind of person who like salty foods and would prefer salty foods over sweets so I decided to order a tuna crepe. I remembered I ordered a tuna crepe in Southern California and it was OH SO DELICIOUS. I can't say the same about Genki. It smelled and tasted weird but I was super hungry so I ate it as my dinner and had dessert somewhere else after. I guess that is my mistake for ordering salty foods. I will go there one day and order a sweet one with ice cream or something. Maybe it will taste better.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
best crepe place in the city... our fave is strawberry/nutella. this is also where we get our supply of probiotic drinks. so cheap!

we're here at least twice a month.
author: Marisol T.

description: savory and sweet crepes galore!  a great candy selection to boot!
author: Sheri N.

description: MmmmMMmm.. genki crepes always hits the spot when im in the mood for some crepe goodness. my favorite is the nutella, vanilla ice cream, strawberry and banana.. yes on the whipped cream too please. i love how they make their crepes nice and crispy, i guess some people like it soft though so you've been warned. while you wait you should browse the aisles, they have a nice selection of weird asian candy and drinks and some of them look really interesting haha.
author: Trina D.

description: The nutella and fresh fruit crepe is my guilty pleasure.  God I love this place.  Super-fun asian snacks and hard to find food items.  Yum, yum yum.
author: Gaping F.

description: i had never had crepes....Oh boy i am hooked :-) these were amazing!!! :-) the staff was prompt and curteous. The place looked clean especially since it was later in the evening. Their crepes are a must :) i had the nutella with mixed fruit.
author: Love To Run L.

description: Great little dessert shop for a bite after lunch/dinner on Clement. I tend to favor the sweet crepes, preferably with mango ice cream. One caveat, the ice cream seems to always have ice crystals so I'd only drop by if it's late and no other place nearby is open.
author: Nathalie L.

description:
Excuse me if I misquote this, "Egg puffs are the most popular street vendor snacks of Hong Kong." It's posted somewhere in the store.

DH (dear husband) and I were waiting the usual long wait for a table at Burma Super Star when a lady sitting next to me on the bench was munching on these 'things'.  She directed me to Genki right across the street.  Me not wanting to lose my seat (not to mention hungry and pissed off that I had I was hungry) asked my husband to 'get me some of that'.

Angry that DH gave me lip about making him buy something that looks like cocoons, he comes back with a bag with hole punches that smells like a fresh bakery.

DH reluctantly tries some and was hooked... even more so than me.

We have introduced this Snack Crack, which I've coined, to all of our friends and visiting friends.  They can't get enough of it either.  

DH likes coconut flavored egg puffs, I like the plain.

Oh other things that Genki also carries that is of interest:
- Flavored marshmallows.  A bag is about $1 and I found a fancy place on Polk that sells these for $2 for two pieces.
-I think I tried the crepes once and I liked it.
author: Mona B.

description: This was perfect for a Sunday morning after being disappointed about missing out on our other plans. (We mistakenly thought that the farmer's market at the piers was on Sunday... nope... Saturday!) Parking was not so bad on the back of the block--and the crepes were well priced, huge, and quite delicious! I will say that the apple, cinnamon, and brown sugar crepe needed something else in it (whipped cream, caramel sauce?), but the avacado, tomato, and cheese crepe was HUGE and perfect. Plus: a Japanese mini-mart in the back? I'll be coming back.
author: Jessica J.

description: All I gotta say is "how can you pass up Japanese crepes?!?" They've got a lot of crazy combinations and its quick and easy. Great place for a quick desert after a meal somewhere on clement... or really anytime!
author: Mark G.

description: Love this place, you can get some delicious crepes along with bubble tea, or you can get bubble tea from Quickly's across the street. The preparation time isn't that long and you can take it to go or sit down outside if seats are available. Genki also has a store that sells various junk food, drinks, and mini toys. I was in SF for vacation and read that this place was highly recommended. Glad I made several stops here with my gf.
author: Edward C.

description: This place is cool especially after having a good dinner then wanting something sweet later on.  Definitely a good place to get crepes, I've been there twice and the second time with my gf; we both got the mixed fruit crepes with nutella and vanilla ice cream. its a good pick just be careful there might be some extra nutella on the bottom. The wait is quicker than you would expect.
author: Cedric R.

description: Nutella crepes AND Hello Kitty Oil Blotting Paper AND giant Poky, all in one great place?
author: Michelle C.

description:
hands down the best crepes in the bay! 

I went here with my brother and his girlfriend after shopping on Haight St.  I got the crepe with vanilla ice cream, fresh mangos and nuttella.
