my brother's been raving about this place for such a long time but i didn't know what the big deal was until now.

the crepes are made to order.  they are paper thing and crispy and they wrap it up like a waffle cone.

again, all i can say is "BEST CREPES IN THE BAY AREA"

*and the girl working at the register was super cute =)
author: BigAppetite ..

description: eh! the crepe is satisfying. but man im sorry at least get someone who speaks english the line wasnt moving and the girl didnt understand anyones order  i had to explain and show what i wanted. workers super inefficient.
author: Maylene M.

description: This place is pretty good.  Wether you're in the mood for an Vanilla Ice Cream cake with strawberries and lychees or a ham, swiss and spinach crepe for a quick brunch genki has you covered.  And you can pick up a bottle of aloe drink or a box of Pocky Sticks while you wait.  I've been here a couple of times, and I've never been disappointed.  I don't think you will either.
author: Tony L.

description: Now i know why Asian girls are the best to date. So they can show me where all the good crepe places are...haha juuust kidding. But yes, i admit i never knew what a crepe was. But I  can still remember my first crepe...how can i forget, it was a warm sunny sunday afternoon. Strolling around and then i saw Genki. The aroma of the place sucked me in. I ordered the mango crepe with strawberries. That crepe is so good. Ive been coming here for years and ive been meaning to try other crepes but i always order that same crepe. I really need to see what the other ones taste like. But i have also tried their puffs which are also very good. They have a large menu of other crepes as well but i recommend the dessert crepes. The place also has a bunch of other Japanese groceries and candies.
author: Mark L.

description: Definitely the best place in the area for crepes. Despite sometimes long lines, it's always worth it. Surprisingly, I wandered in recently this time because the KIDS asked for it. How many 7 and 10 year olds ask for crepes anyway? There's a few other places in the area that sell crepes, but believe me, this is by far the best place for a good crepe!
author: cindy c.

description: Though I would much rather have a dessert crepe from Sophie's, the ones here are enough to satisfy me when Sophie's is closed.  Genki gets big points for being open fairly late.  It's a good stopover for a sweet treat after dining at one of the many nearby restaurants.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Upgrading Genki to 5 stars for two reasons: 
1) awesome savory crepes
2) giant plush Super Mario Bros. hats in the back of the store

there are more and more people coming here every time i visit but there's still only a short wait for the crepes even when they're busy, how do they manage that?
author: Aileen T.

description: I love this store. Has lots of candy, drinks, tapioca and crepes. I love the crepes here. Perfect crisp to them and they have a good selection of ice cream like mango, green tea and lychee. Come here to satisfy your sweet tooth!
author: Jackie M.

description: I like bubble tea. I like the Koala cookies they sell underneath the counter. I like the display of anime figurines with breasts the size of small babies. I like that I can get cell phone charms out of vending machines. I like spitting tapioca balls at my friends as we walk back to the car. They stick really well to car windows. I have yet to sample the crepes, but I am fairly certain I would like them as well. I always get the red bean bubble tea and it tastes like heaven.
author: megan r.

description: You can't go wrong at this place. The sweet and savory crepes are amazing, and don't forget to try out all the fun candy they have around the store. I usually go for the nutella and strawberry crepe as a treat, but the savory ones are good as a quick bite also.
author: Nick D.

description: Despite the long lines at night, I love me some genki crepes! Nutella & banana crepes....nomnomnom.
author: Maricel B.

description: This place is really great.  They have a wonderful selection of crepes and ice cream.  The store is packed with Asian snacks like Pocky and Gummy chews.  They also have toys, cell phone tassels, and Asian toiletries.  A bit of a secret, this place knocks the socks off of Good Vibrations for high end condoms.
author: apple r.

description: Am I stoned? Do I have the munchies? Damn I hella want a red bean ice cream & bananas crepe from Genki right now!  To any francophiles out there, no, these aren't real crepes with paper thin airiness. These are hefty crepes that defy gravity w/crunchy stiffness, sticking upright out of a paper cone holder stuffed to the brim.  And if you're more the 'salty snacks' type - hehheheh, how YOU doin'? - there's savory/breakfast-y crepes, but also the whole rest of the store to browse for other asian snacks-in-a-bag. Go ahead get some ginger candy, or dried beancurd, or squid, or sour dried berries - hehheheh - allright I'll stop.
author: CINDY K.

description: This place is awesome!!! How have I never been here before? This place has the best asian inspired crepes... Green tea ice cream with lychees or lychee icecream with red bean??? Yum. I'm definitely going to need to go back and try this chocolate cheesecake one that everyone has been raving about. Not only does this place have great crepes, but they also have an extensive snack and ramen section.  So many options for japanese candies, cookies, crackers... I was in heaven! This is the type of place that I missed when I lived in VT for 4 years.
author: Lauren Y.

description: I wish I lived in the Richmond district so I could be closer to fantastic places like Genki crepes. It is quite simple: they have the best crepes in the city, hands down. Not only is that enough, their store is super fun! They have a lot of cool and unique Asian products relating to anime, video games, and other things I haven't seen since childhood. I love this place!
author: Luis O.

description: Parking is the only thing that bugs me when i come here. Me and the boyfriend usually get the strawberry banana with vanilla ice cream crepe. We havent been here for a while but I'm sure it's still prett damn good. You can tell by all the reviews! =)
author: Tracy A.

description: Better than the J-town crepe place.  They have a wide variety or you can even make your own crepes.  I love the spinach and mushroom with swiss crepe.  Haven't been here in awhile, and my best friend and I paid a visit to Genki this weekend.  Even though it was really crowded on a Saturday night, we were able to find parking.  While you wait for them to make your crepe, you can shop around the store and oogle at nifty gadgets and japanese items.  They also sell those eggettes there in different flavors as well.
author: Carli F.

description: Come here for your Asian deserts. They offer bubble tea, ice cream, egg puffs and crepes. Not mention the fact that they also stock the typical items you would find in an Asian grocery store. If you've never had a crepe before, they're a flaky, thin crust. I find them to have an eggy taste and don't care for them too much. Instead of an ice cream cone you could have an ice cream crepe. You should still try one and decide for yourself since it's a unique desert. It's open late. Parking might be hard to find since it's on Clement.
author: Armstrong B.

description: There is nothing like a good crepe desert to top off a nice dinner with good friends.  It's a pretty popular place so there was a little wait before I could enjoy my delicious banana Nutella crepe.  However, I easily passed the time enjoying the Japanese mini-mart style store with lots of fun little goodies could be found.  There were drinks, little toys, car air fresheners, condoms, Asian snacks, candies and a bunch of other knick knacks crammed into a tiny little whole in the wall crepe shop on Clement St.  I will definitely return to try their other treats.
author: Nhat N.

description: No, I'm not going to write about their sweet smelling crepes or their selection of cutesy Japanese food products.  I'm just going to focus on their fresh watermelon juice.  I like the way they make it, plain and unadulterated.  You can add those boogerish tapioca balls too if you want.  Beats Jamba any day.
author: Pelle Y.

description:
crispy crepe is delicioso. the crispiest i've had in the city. 

i recommend the strawberry, nutella, and whipped cream. how delicious.
author: Jade L.

description: I love the crepes here and the egg puff is always a nice crunchy, fluffy treat! Plus the andy section is AMAZING!  The crepes here are more on the "pancake-y" side while the edges are nice and crunchy! its my favorite place for crepes and is open late!
author: drea U.

description: My husband was introduced by this place by his cousin.  My husband introduced it to me.  At first I thought he was exagerating about this place.  My first impression was... Gosh this place is packed, small, no where to sit.  What's so great about this place??  Until I had ordered the Mango Ice Cream, Fresh Strawberry, Whip Cream with Nutella spread CREPE.    One bite and I became hooked.  Ever since then I crave for this place all the time.  The bad is this place gets pretty packed and no where to sit.  BUT.... This Place is WORTH THE WAIT !!!    I just wish they would open more business locations.  LOOOOOOOVE This Place and I will always come back for more !!!
author: Mary C.

description:
Being the mother of an eight year old son is, in many ways, like being a factotum to a slightly potty dictator.  One must cajole and coerce Number One Son to do most anything not Star Wars-related (slowly slowly catchy monkey).  Now, I am not of the type that bribes (or gives in), but I do understand the benefits of well placed "incentives" in running a home as befits my high standards of grace and elegance.

One of the chores of life is the weekly shop.  I hate the weekly shop or, rather, I hate dragging Number One Son along with me on the weekly shop.  I hate the whining for sugary snacks and Lunchables (a pox on Oscar Meyer) and soda pop and other nasties, I hate it very much.  So, usually, we do not go where those things are sold---or at least, not in their recognizable form (see, eg, New Way Mah review).  

Now, Number One Son is sometimes recalcitrant even after the promises of seeing live fish and frogs and re-upping our stock of Pocky; it is at these moments that I bring out the big guns, I bring out the Genki Crepes. 

The smell hits you first-- if you are lucky it will drown out the funk from the herbal medicine/root shop---about a block away.  Like little fingers stuck inside one's nostrils pulling and pulling you inside with the delicious smell, the Genki aura is a seductive mistress... and an easy one, too.  For a nominal amount, one can have crepes most every way---thin and crisp and yummy.  Number One Son likes the Nutella crepes, I prefer the Nutella/Strawberry ones.  But Genki goes all ways---sweet and savory.  And there's more!  The egg puffs are also delicious and disappear quite quickly from the lickle paper bag they are served in.  The various juices, soda pops, candies, stickers, shampoos are fun and useful and colorful---I go here to pick up stocking stuffers and gifts for those living in less civilized areas.  The staff is helpful and friendly, the store is clean.  On a sunny morning, I love sitting outside and enjoying my crepes and, of course, Number One Son.
author: Nicola F.

description:
i thought Genki was pronounced "janky," but these crepes are anythang but that, yo....
in the past 4 days i've been there two times! dang!!...both times i got the #2 Dessert Crepe- Green tea ice cream, fresh lychee fruit, and homemade whipped cream. very nice, refreshing, delicious crepe.

FYI - when you enter there is a counter on your left, you pick up at the counter closest to the door, but you order and pay at the counter farthest from the door....took me a while to figure that one out. i was standing at the Pick-up counter for a good 2 minutes wondering why no one was taking my order.
author: Sammy G.

description: I don't think I've had better--dessert crepe-wise. If you have a serious sugar tooth, this place will satisfy and more! I always order my favorite: nutella chocolate crepe with vanilla ice cream. They always pack it with crazy whipped cream. You get to hold these delightful and fresh creations like a bouquet, and, at first nibble, marvel at the extraordinary contrast of hot crepe against a generous amount of oozing hot nutella, against cold vanilla icecream. It's obscenely good.
author: Christine S.

description: Yummy crepes. Always get the nutella, banana, and strawberry. AND they have chinese waffles! (egg puffs). They even add different favors to them, like red bean. Yum. They have a number of different Asian goods here like snacks and toys. Good for browsing while waiting for your food.
author: Jennifer L.

description: tons of awsome japanese hair dyes etc, and cute toys , also great for a late night snack after work , tons of things to choose from the menu
author: eric l.

description: Genki Crepes was surprisingly good.  My husband and I shared a banana/nutella crepe.  Yes, we shared since we had just finished a delicious dinner from Q Restaurant and Wine Bar down the street.  It was fun to stand by the window and watch them make the crepe and guess what they were making.  This place has a good selection of sweet and savory crepes to satisfy every palate.
author: Gigi G.

description: Very good crepes! I was pretty impressed, very cheap too. The only problem is this place is so popular for those 2 reasons that you should be prepared to wait a good 15 min for your crepes.
author: Tomo K.

description: I just don't get the hype of this place. Craving something sweet, was in the area and my usually trusty Yelp app directed me here. With all of the positive reviews and the line outside the door who could resist? Once in the door you realize that it looks so busy because the counter is right inside that door and there is a wait around the counter for the crepes as this little crepe counter is in the front of a ghetto supermarket or junky looking dollar store type place. My SIL ordered an ice cream crepe and I got a sweet crepe (ok- 2 but only because my first one was so gross it got tossed and I had to do a redo thinking it must have been a one off due to all the positive reviews. I was wrong all 3 got dumped not even 1/3 through. We couldn't figure out what the draw was. The crepe itself had no flavor at all and was so dry it was almost as though the burned it on all 3 while the fillings were also bland other than the little bit of Nutella in one we had. I'm not sure if it's a different type of crepe than I'm used to like the ones you would get from a Crepevine or Cafe Grillades in San Bruno but I won't be back to figure it out.
author: Christina F.

description: I am hard to please when it comes to sweets/desserts...however I just tried Genki Crepes for the first time last night and let me tell you, it was delicious!!!  I  munched on a strawberry nutella vanilla ice cream crepe and gawd, it was just heavenly!! Talking about it makes me want to drive over there and get one!!! In addition, Genki carries my favorite Koala no March cookies in chocolate and strawberry. I know, I know..a lot of asian grocery stores carry them HOWEVER the important part is that it's made in Japan and not China. Trust me - there's a difference in taste !!
author: christie y.

description: I love their crepes.  My favorite by far is lychee ice cream with nutella and cheese cake.  It is quite filling so be prepared.  You might be better off sharing this with someone.  I also like browsing through their unique japanese snacks/goods.
author: JACOB L.

description:
3 stars for the crepes: I had the green tea ice cream crepe with lychee. The green tea ice cream was really bitter and they only gave me 3 lychees. I wasnt completely satisfied. =(

4.5 stars for their huge selection of snacks, candies, ramen, etc. It woulda been 5 stars, but they have some XXX figurine toys (legs spread wide open with ?) around that children shouldnt be looking at.
author: Retired B.

description: solid desert food, I always go with the classic butter sugar lemon!
author: Eddie T.

description: This is my favorite asian dessert place to go to in the city. Extremely yummy crepes. I always get the crepe with strawberries, nutella, and ice cream. For some reason, I like this place better than Sophie's.  IIt was packed on weekend late nights when I went. Also, it's a cute little store that sell random Chinese stuff to browse through while waiting for your crepe. I wish there were seats to sit in, especially during cold winter nights!
author: Susan H.

description: This is bliss with nutella on top. Genki is great for crepes and also for random Japanese packaged foods, like seaweed, miniature (as in the size of a pea) candy hamburgers, anime babe figurines (well, those aren't food, but...). I also bought some decent sesame salad dressing, which I haven't had much success finding elsewhere. Rock on, Genki!
author: Patrick G.

description: i use to just walked by, roam around inside, or sit outisde this place all the time while waiting for a table over at China First, but i've never tried their crepes till about 2 weeks ago. And boy, have i been missing out! hehe since then, i've had it bout 3 times already! tried the green tea ice cream w/lychee, mango ice cream w/strawberries, and cheesecake w/blueberry sauce... and my favorite is the mango!!! not surprising since mango is like my favorite fruit! this is bad! when i get a craving for crepe now, its going to be tooo accessible then going all the way to japantown.
author: Sue Y.

description: Just rocks. Cute, adorable! While you wait for your crispy, warm, yummy crepe with nutella and banana, you can browse the tiny knick-knacks, full of complexity, cuteness, and meaning that I can only begin to understand. This place is just adorable, and super-tasty!!
author: Ryan B.

description: Great flavors and fresh tasting ingredients. I love Asian desserts because they're not too sweet.
author: Joy C.

description: This is hands down my favorite crepe place in the city.  It's not a traditional crepe though, it's a crispier, more thin cracker like on the edges.  I love getting the nutella + banana crepe here when we're in the neighborhood.  I also pick up random candies and snacks from the store section.
author: Joann C.

description:
okay, i'll admit. i was a crepe VIRGIN prior to eating here. haha. i came here with my boyfriend about a week ago. we didn't plan to go here for crepes either, it just turned out that way because we were across the street at quickly's. haha. we were both kinda hungry so we decided to walk across the street and get crepes. 

i am a fan of this place now. i had the spinach, mushroom, and cheese crepe, and he had the lychee and green tea ice cream crepe. it was amazing. good. wonderful. the green tea ice cream has this unique taste to it. i definitely would want to come back.
author: Betty T.

description:
this is a very different place from sophies. the crepe is thicker and served warm (instead of sophie's thin and cooled crepes). I think its kinda bad when its hot because its melting the ice cream faster, thus making it drip all over you. 

Though, I wouldnt go back here for crepes I'm sure some people would prefer this style.
author: Candice A.

description:
Crepes of all crepes.

If you haven't had the savory beef one, you're missing out. No joke.

The market it's in is lots of fun - great Japanese candy finds here.
author: Angela T.

description:
its stores like these that make me miss living in my old richmond neighborhood in san francisco. if i still lived here id be able to visit my favorite vietnamese restaurant, book store, and all asian grocery/boba/candy places all within walking distance!

crepes at genki's? never tried it. my eyes are easily distracted by the wide variety of asian goodies; from beverages to candies to nifty little toys.

----

5 stars: i am a loyal customer and cannot live without this place/restaurant!

4 stars: consistently great food. a place i would definitely frequent if i dont already.

3 stars: good food. id come back for more if a particular craving for something specific they offer hit me. 

2 stars: for the sheer reason of convenience and semi mediocre food [but convenience being the majority of reason] id come back.

1 star: id never be caught dead in the place ever ever again.
author: Nessa b.

description:
vanilla gnutella = best in sf

they even let u take pics of the mexican crepe maker too, unlike sophie's in j town
author: Bobby B.

description: I LOVE GENKI'S!!  they have the exotic fruit ice cream flavors like mango, lychee, green tea, and bunch of other asian ice cream flavors. I always get the Strawberry Mango combo crepe.  The only thing I don't like are the frozen strawberries at the bottom of the crepe.  For $4.95, I want real strawberries deng it!  Their crepes are fresh, quick to make, and so darn good.  Definitely beats driving to Japantown for Sophi's crepes.
author: Diane L.

description: They make egg puff desert thingys that remind me of delicious streetside food in Hong Kong.  Plus, you can get random asian groceries and toiletries all in one place... awesome.
author: Mary S.

description: A great place to go for ice cream crepes late at night.  Good value and quick service.  I think the egg puffs are really good too.  Try the strawberry or the original.  I also like the Japanese candy there.
author: Michelle M.

description:
a *must* stop on clement street.  a pit stop before a movie.

an ex called this place where god lived - represented by crepes, boba drinks, a *variety* of candy goodies, pocky sticks, yakult and 3 brands of kimchee. 

it is the ginger bread house of san francisco and it is a happy dangerous place if you love sweets - so take heed!
author: Carlo R.

description: Solid crepe joint in the Inner Richmond. Enjoyed it so much that after having this chicken, spinach concoction for dinner I returned after the show I was seeing at the Rockit Room for a dessert crepe. Apples, cinnamon and brown sugar. Delicious, and appreciated they have options not loaded with nutella. Minus one star for charging me extra for spinach when I asked if I could substitute that for cheese.
author: Jason B.

description: this place is such a local hotspot.  it's like the go-to place for dessert after probably a nice meal around any of the nearby restaurants.  when your at restaurant and get asked if you want to see the dessert menu, just say no and come here instead.  best tasting crepes in the area and comes in many different flavors of ice cream, so you can't find readily anywhere else. while you're waiting, the rest of the store is a asian snacks shop for your eyes to feast on, or your tummies.
author: A t.

description: Good, but not great.  This place has a lot of hype around it.. Its usually crowded and the crepes I have had are ok.. I would rather have Fro-yo. Kinda $$$ to
author: Scotty B.

description: O..M..G! I looove this place! When you first walk in the first thing that tickles your fancy are the crepes!! My favorite is the strawberry vanilla with nutella! The candies are also very intriguing because you can only find them at the Asian stores, reminds me of an adult sanrio. its kind of a hit or miss since most of the candy is written in a different language, but who cares!!
author: Karen A.

description: The crepes are soooo GOoOoOoooD! Best crepe around and cheap too and also good on the go!  The crepe is also big so it's worth getting for the cheap price.
author: Gino B.

description: I'm glad this place isn't close to where I live!  I'd get something everyday.  I walked into here and was like "natsukashii!"  They had yakuruto, snacks I grew up with, my japanese hair wax, chips...  I felt like I was in a lawson, family mart, hot spar...  you get the point.  I was strong (broke) and only left with a box of elise.  Oh, I used to love eating them and now I can.  muhaha. Arigatou Genki crepes!
author: John B.

description: Good Crepes, this are the crispy kind vs the soft and thick kind. With ice scream, bananas, and whip cream, it will set you back around 4.75. The store has a good assortment of random japanese foods and goods
author: B H.

description: There are very few things that will take me to the inner richmond. Genki Crepes will, without fail. Try a nutella crepe with green-tea (or red bean) ice cream and whipped cream. It will be one of the best decisions you have ever made. The ONLY reason I only gave them four stars is because there is nowhere to sit and enjoy your huge cone of sweet loving. I urge, beg, and plead you to try genki crepes, I promise you will not regret it.
author: Shyla B.

description: Mmmm... strawberry and nutella folded in a crunchy crepe.  This is love!  Crunchy is the key.  It's worth circling around for parking, even in the rain.  One day I had breakfast at Genki, then lunch.  Both times I had the strawberry nutella.  I thought about it for dessert after dinner but that woulda been nuts!  Mmmm....  strawberry, nutella and NUTS!  Gotta try that  :)
author: Jeanne C.

description: I made the mistake of following the yummy scent of crepes one night...now I'm hooked!  My personal fave: vanilla ice cream, strawberries, and nutella (hold the whip)...if you haven't had one yet, go, go, go!
author: Joyce L.

description: The heart of Japan Town. Why waste your crepe by piling on too much? Get a good ole' fashion crepe with plain vanilla. Love watching the crepe masters at work.
author: Han L.

description: Oh yeah...came here after eating dinner at Genki Ramen (yup, they are related), and I have to say, the crepes, egg puffs, and weirdly looking squid is still as fun and tasty as last time. I have to also mention that they sell a huge selection of japanese candies. Fruit gummies, white rabbit, pocky! Genki still rocks in my world.
author: Jan Z.

description:
personally, i love crepes, so maybe this review will be a little biased. haha. 
but honestly, genki crepes are amazing! i got a sweet crepe with nutella, strawberry, and whipped cream and i couldn't talk to any of my friends until i was finished eating haha. what i really liked about it was they're so simple, i think the whipped cream was almost too much on mine... just nutella and strawberries would have been perfect. another think i really like was that they folded it up into a triangle and then you got a little cardboard holder thing so you could carry it while you walk, which is just as well, as there isn't anywhere to sit in this place (oh well). the rest of the store has a lot of chinese treats/teas/foods for sale. everything is very cheap. i will definately be going back.
author: Amelia R.

description: Genki is okay. Crepes are alright. Service sucks. Cash only unless you pay some penalty. You can do better, but try it once if you're in the area.
author: Nathan E.

description: Yummy yummy in my tummy! Crepes with your choice of fruits, ice cream, and topped with nutella! What more can you ask? Well how about the fact its somewhat of a Japanese convenient store. They have a wide selection of imported Japanese candy. My big surprise were the shelf full of Poky Sticks. Poky sticks, for those who don't know, are cookie sticks that are dipped usually in chocolate- crunchy and addicting.
author: Bert T.

description: Mmmmm... Nutella crepes.... I like Genki better than Sophie's in Japantown because the crepes are good and are not crunchy all the way through (like they are at Sophies's).  Also, there are fun little toys to look at while you wait for your crepe and sometimes that can be a while...
author: robyn s.

description: You will smell Genki Crepes before you see Genki Crepes, and, like the sweet nectar of a carnivorous plant, it will lure you inside, but, instead of being digested by a hungry flower, YOU get to eat a delicious crepe! OK, that was a weird opening, but that's what you get from me after my mind has been blown by #26 on Genki's menu: a crepe containing Cheesecake, whipped cream, & blueberry sauce. Heavy and filling, but sooooo good. It should be noted (in case you prefer it, or in case you were worried about melted cheesecake) that the 4 wedges of cheesecake are chilled. I will be back, Genki Crepes, but you knew that; you ensure it by flooding Clement's 300 block with the scent of your sweet, sweet crepes.
author: Ben D.

description: OMG, these crepes are sooo darn good.  The nutella with fresh strawberries is heaven.  This isn't a sit down place, so eat them on the go and don't forget to check out all the wacky merchandise for sale.
author: LeAndra M.

description: I stepped in the store, and I was not sure if I really want to order anything. I still did. ate about 2 bites. the end.
author: Angie Y.

description: This place is so good, whenever you walk by here you can smell the aroma of the freshly made crepes! it's so good, you cannot resist the ever so lasting smell of crepes! I always come here after my dinner at China First and I always get the Nutella and banana crepe. Its heavenly! I also love how they have a mini market for all you people that love japanese sweets and snacks. They also have polly ann's ice cream for sale by the tubs, those tubs of ice cream are irresistable! I'm not kidding, the green tea ice cream tub has to be my favorite. This place is good, no regrets ever coming here. I been coming here ever since I was in the 5th grade and its still that good.
author: Johnny T.

description:
When I first moved to the area, I would see tons of people waiting for their crepe goodness.  I tried one; it was ok.  Maybe it's because I didn't order a very fancy crepe- I just wanted nutella.  Yes, kind of boring.  I still don't see what the hype's about.  Yes, it's good, but not to-die-for great.  I wish they had custard like other places...

On the other hand, the store is super cute filled with Japanese drinks, candies, and other novelties.
author: Christine H.

description: The ice cream crepes here were to die for!! I never had such a great tasting crepe before -- it was soft, hot, and with the perfect amount of crispiness. My friends came here at about 11 pm and I was surprised to see a dessert place still open. I ordered the green tea ice cream with lychee fruit crepe -- which was extremely delightful! The green tea ice cream was rich and delicious. It tasted like the authentic green tea ice cream that only Japanese Sushi restaurants serve. My friend ordered the mango ice cream with strawberries which was even better! The mango flavor was very distinctive, you have to try it for yourself to know. The only downfall is that the place seems to get really crowded so the wait was really long. Other than that, I would definitely recommend this place to dessert lovers and I will come back to try the other flavors soon.
author: Cathy N.

description: A fairly nice supermarket with an attached crepe shop, boba, and other sweet goodies.  The prices are a little bloated for what you get but the food is fairly tasty.
author: Patrick C.

description:
my BF's brother always talked about this place. Finally, we went in there just to check out what the rave was about while we were walking around  that area to burn off the rich Italian dinner we just had.

Unexpectedly, BF decided to ordered the crepe with green tea ice cream and some lychee fruits. I loved it !!! It's a great combo, what a genius idea as both were my favorites.The green tea was much lighter in flavor than the regular ones you get in the Japanese restaurant which I really like,  As for the crepe, it's crispier than the normal crepes that you've eaten at most places.

The only downside was the long-wait.  20-30 mins in average for a crepe...For someone who has no patience, I would not recommend it.
author: S Y.

description: So I tried the crepes without nutella this time.  I tried the green tea ice cream with strawberries.  This is definitely a winner when you do not want to be on a sugar high all day from the nutella chocolate.
author: Danny P.

description:
Seriously disappointed, this place seems to be the same kind as the ones you find in Japan Town, except this place is in the convenient Clement Street.
Seriously anyone can make better crepes at home, they really need to save less and replace the water back by some milk into the recipe.
Overall the crepes tasted and felt like paper.
author: Cedrick C.

description: No seriously it's the BEST crepes I've ever had...even compared to what I've had on the streets of Paris!  You will definitely agree if you like crunchy and crispy which is not traditional when it comes to crepes but it tastes so good!  The entire crepe to the very bottom stays crispy throughout your indulgence!
author: Tina L.

description: I had my first Egg Puff tonight and it was heavenly. I'll definitely be back! It was the perfect sweetness after dinner. Also stocked up on all of my favorite and soon to be favorite Asian snacks!
author: Jenni L.

description:
Whenever i'm driving down clement and can find a parking spot, i drop in to genki for a crepe and some japanese goodies (plum candy, etc.) 

Favorite is banana, nutella and vanilla ice cream - sometimes even some whip cream. It costs about $5. Haven't tried any of the savory crepes though.
author: C K.

description: A crepe/boba place slash supermarket.  There are benches near the front for you to sit and eat.  We enjoyed a spinach/mushroom/mozzarella cheese crepe and an order of original egg puffs.  The batter they used is amazing, as it has the touch of sweetness.  The egg puffs were easily the best I've had.  They also have ice cream crepes that look great.  I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a quick snack.
author: Henry L.

description: The perfect after Burma Superstar meal. And so much pretty packaging! The colors, all the pretty the colors! Who knew cotton swabs could look so appealing? Though I wish they had those little computer pets that would die if you didn't "feed" them. Then, this place would pretty much be complete. But since I only give out fives and zeroes...
author: Cpt. Scallywag N.

description: When my roomies and I are feeling down and out, we trek all the way out to Genki from the Mission and let their crepes make everything okay again.  My usual order:  strawberries, bananas, nutella, and green tea ice cream. Soooooooooooooooooo goooooooooooooooooood!  The only drawback is that parking along Clement is a pain in the butt...oh well, whatever, once you sink your teeth into that crepe, you'll be glad you found that spot four blocks away (hey, you'll be able to burn off part of that crepe walking back to your car).
author: Andrea U.

description: mmmm.... not bad for crepes here.  Price is decent, and they sell a good variety of sweet eats.  Ice cream, crepe, tapioca, and various snacks.  It gets crowded here a lot.  Place is small.  It takes awhile for them to make your order.  Not bad not bad.  I ordered the vanilla ice cream with strawberry crepe.  Finished the whole thing :) pretty satisfied.
author: Mimi S.

description: i have been to Genki for a few times and yet it is ok place for crepe.  other than that other stuffs are so so.... the snacks there are more expensive than those you can get from a regular supermarket.  They don't offer table to sit in either......  but overall, it is a good place for crepe.
author: Peter K.

description: Crepes here deserve 4 stars. Ever since my discovery of the fact that ice cream can be put on desert crepes, I have been nearly obsessed with Genki Crepes. Nutella, Crepe, and Ice Cream are all you need for the most standard of Genki Crepes. At a price of around 5 dollars, this freshly made desert, that opens at night, is the perfect after-dinner desert. The crepes are all very good, but I would recommend nutella and ice cream to anything. Genki also offers savory crepes but I would read someone else's comment for a true review on that option. The only draw back to the crepe is that their apple cinnamon crepe does not have the option to add ice cream on it.. no matter how much you try to bribe the crepe-maker with lint from your pockets. har har. oh well. other than that, crepes combined with the option to buy a buncha teen asian candies + drinks make this place totally deserving of 5 stars.
author: simon k.

description:
We've tried different kinds of egg puffs, the regular egg puff has been the best.  Gotta eat them while they're hot, they get stiff and tough when they get cold.  Addictive snack.

We haven't ever been satisfied with the tapioca ball drinks here... so we stopped ordering them.  

All the crepes we've tried have been tasty.
author: Kittarae S.

description:
I'd give a definite 2 thumbs up for Genki Crepes (unfortunately, my thumbs are occupied because I was double fisting my crepes - yes, that's right double fisting!)

I had the Tomato, Corn & Cheese Crepe, my cousin had the Spinach, Mushroom, Cheese crepe. We then both shared the Nutella, Fresh Strawberries, Whipped Cream Crepe.  All were excellent, tasty, fresh, affordable and easy! I only wish more friends/family were with us so I could try every item on the colorful menu.

Minus one star for the slow service - I understand it was busy for a Monday night, but must the male cashier flirt with a scantily clad girl trying to get him to comp the whipped cream topping on her freakin' ice cream cone? Step aside and let ME pay for the extra 0.75  - it's worth having to avoid holding up the entire line and saving the cashier from the crushing disappointment when he realizes she's a lesbian.
author: Caryn L.

description:
good crispy japanese crepes if you're in the inner richmond district.  i like the nutella strawberry with whipped creme.  you can try and cut calories and get it without whipped creme, but it's much better with.  :)

genke not only has crepes, they have a bunch of japanese snacks and health and beauty products.  yes, it's a strange mix, but it works!
author: Wendy S.

description: Pretty good crepes. Razor thin at the tips though! My first attempt at taking a bite resulted in a cut lip. WTF? Think paper cut except with a crepe. It was worth the pain though. Delicious!
author: Karen C.

description: Holy shit---a nutella and strawberry crepe rolled into a cone with ice cream on top?
author: Emma K.

description: don't expect the usual soft crepes here. the crepes are basically used as ice cream cones, very dry and crispy. if you don't get ice cream in your crepe, it will be too dry to eat. and then you'll have to order ice cream separately like we had to just to finish it.
author: Mary W.

description: Great for a quick crepe in the hand, eat-while-walking-down-the-street food...it's sticky and messy sometimes, but the sweet ones are definitely better than the savory...they also have a Japanese junk food theme going on in there and you can buy things I only remember seeing in convenience stores in Tokyo...
author: Kira B.

description:
lots of cute lil goodies in the shop, and overpriced but standard for jap goods. 

i had the mixed fruit with nutella crepe and it seemed pretty skimpy for the price, but the quality of the ingredients were top notch. the crepe was the best crepe batter i ever had. it was perfectly crispy yet soft. i may edit once i have some of their other crepes. i like this place. the end.
author: Lillian P.

description:
Went here tonight with my roomates and was surprised of how cool the inside of this place is. From outside, there were just groups of people eating crepes (seemed to me like a pretty popular hangout since they are open til 10:30 on a Sunday night!). 
I tried a strawberry/banana smoothie with boba which was delicious and thick. The boba was also perfect.
I also decided to indulge myself in a dessert crepe (one with vanilla ice cream and strawberry), which was also very sweet and simple!
Unfortunately since I had two hands full, my crepe melted quickly. but it was still good afterwards.
This place has tons of Chinese candy and also tons of toys! There are also lots of assorted Chinese crackers, ramen bowls, and cold beverages.
The price for the drinks and crepes are not too bad, its well worth the taste!
I would definitely try this place again in the future!
UPDATE: 3/16/2007: Returned here yesterday and had another delicious strawberry/banana smoothie with boba! I also decided to purchase some snacks and picked up some hello kitty pockie, apple and strawberry chews, and even a cool hello kitty keychain! (candy was included too!)
author: Miss H K.

description: yum, i like plain nutella crepes and this place makes it well. been eating it for like 5 years. plus while u wait u can buy japanese candy here!
author: Angel P.

description: My girlfriend and I always come here on the weekends to get some supplies that would last us a week. Got alot of different junk food and drinks. but the place is too crowded in there... some people just sit or stand inside to pick up there food... but those people gotta understand that there is only one entrance and you gotta let people go in and out...
author: Peter L.

description: we came here after going to burma superstar.  it is a decent little dessert place that obviously per the name, serves genki.... just kidding the crepes were pretty good, the way they serve them up the crepe kinda serves as a ice cream cone.
author: Nick S.

description: Came here for dessert after eating at Burma Superstar (Its across the street).. We ordered a number 1 Vanilla ice cream, bananas, nutella crepe (extra charge for the Nutella) with only half of the whip cream.  It was good and refreshing.  Would definitely come back again!
author: Jay M.

description:
This place is a trip. Its really an asian market that happens to sell Crepes.  hahahaha

So as you have read its got some cheap crepes and they are good.   Honestly with the icecream not as good. prefered just fruts with nutella etc.  Also tried the beef sukiaki and turkey avacado. Both very different but both really good.  And gosh darn it how did they make the batter crispy.  

Now if only they had some popcorn chicken or bacon this place would get that last star.
author: Joey N.

description: Ice cream crepes, plus wacky Japanese snacks and candy to gawk at while you're waiting.  What more do you want?
author: Tom H.

description: This place brings to mind that scene from the movie Boondock Saints, you know, they pulled the gun joke on thier friend after capping the mob boss in the hotel room, and the guy just goes off on that 30 second flip out using the f-word as the ONLY word? Yah, thats about what I did after trying one of these crepes. Only in my mind though, I didn't say that all out loud. That I know of. Though that might explain the looks. Hmm. Really good crepes. And all kinds of neat japanese stuffers too. Mmmm... I wanna go back.
author: Eric P.

description:
Crepes with nutella, ice cream and fresh fruits, awesome!

Lychee seemed very popular, it's all bananas for me. I love that after you're done with all the goodies, you get to savor the crepes, crunchy and soft (from the ice cream). Nutella makes it +++ (whipped cream makes it +++++)

Notes
- vanilla is ok, kinda plain
- strawberries are good

Would totally go back, they also have eggettes
author: xo x.

description: Their crepes are okay . Nothing really special - just another typical crepery   . However, don't get a crepe with cheesecake in it because it will be very dry and make you want to throw your whole crepe away which is what I did lol . The egg puffs are okay but stick with the unflavored ones because the flavored ones taste really weird . Their milk tea tapioca also tastes weird . They put WAY too much carnation milk or whatever milk in it . I like the mini mart that's here as well . It has a lot of interesting things such as little japanese toys that come in boxes . They have japanese magazines with interesting things in them as well as a lot of good candy and ice cream . This is a good place to bring your kids .
author: Eileen L.

description: Blehhhhh. Their crepes are all weird and crunchy, and pretty messy, too. They might be good served with the ice cream that they offer, as their consistency more closely resembles an ice cream cone than a real crepe. I DO like the rest of the store (all kinds of wacky toys, treats etc), though, so one extra star for that. But don't come if you're expecting a real crepe.
author: Lesley P.

description: You have my seaweed packets now! They're textured like styrofoam, but they're oh so good w/their hot and spiciness! Before, my friend had to bring them back from Asia, but recently, Genki started carrying them! Went today and bought 5 bags. Will be back soon to stock up on more...
author: ML N.

description: Love this place! Anywhere that sells Japanese snacks/ sweets is my friend. :) Aside from the lack of sitting area, I have no complaints!
author: Sabrina K.

description:
i ordered a nutella and strawberry crepe and LOVED it! it's in a cute little spot and my cousin and i managed to snag a bench just outside on a nice sunny day to enjoy our crepes. it also sells a bunch of other cute things but really the crepes are the reason to go here. 

i think they only accept cash if you're only spending a few bucks so be ready! just in case you're not ready, there's a bank of america a few blocks down. the crepes are pretty cheap too.

finding parking is hard but it's worth it if you have a minute. man, i'm craving a crepe just typing about it!
author: Janice F.

description: i could go for a softer crepe.  the crepe batter could be softer and poured a little thicker.  the idea of putting ice cream and red beans is great.  the store itself is cute.  have a wide variety of japanese snacks.  over-priced but all japanese things are.
author: Andreal W.

description: Yum. I could sit in a corner with a vat of Nutella....so it should come as no surprise that I'm a huge fan of the Nutella crepes here. Nice place. mellow...lots of cool Japanese products to browse thru in the store. i'm a purist with my nutella crepes...first one I ever ate was in Luxemborg Gardens in Paris..I have a picture of me, looking like I was experiencing pure bliss. Anyway---i'm reading the reviews on here and they are saying that the nutella with vanilla icecream is to die for. Great.....here i go again...
author: Bing B.

description: Egg puffs - yum, yum.  I had the coconut and tried the plain.  I wished I'd had the red bean (someone recommended it later).  Eat these babies right away.  They're not tasty once they cool off.  A friend described them as "reverse waffles" which totally doesn't make sense until you're holding on in your hands.  Think cartoon bubble wrap made out of crepe batter (?).
author: Chris D.

description: The crepes are pretty yummy and I had the best coconut egg puff there one time (but the mix can vary and be off on certain days). Also, if you are done having dinner with friends or are walking around clement at night and want some sweet-crunchy-starchy-thing then this is the place to go to. They don't mind that only one person is ordering something and they have a cute store that you and your friends can browse through while you are waiting for your crepe. I also firmly believe that there are certain things on the menu that you should not get because the flavors do not mix well together. For example, I wouldn't get their savory crepes because the crepe is a bit on the sweet side because I think they use the same mix for the sweet and savory. I wouldn't get the bubble tea drink because there is Sweet Delight to go to on the same street. I wouldn't get the Ice Cream because there is Toy Boat a block away. In fact, I wouldn't even buy their snack items because Super Tokio is around the corner and that place owns when it comes to Asian Snacks, plus its a bit cheaper.
author: Theresa D.

description: ahhhh yeahhh! i'm a sucker for sweets and living next to this crepe place is really convenient especially if you love sweets like I do. It's about $4-$6 for a crepe which is kinda pricey esp paying for nutella and bananas. I mean you can probably go to the grocery store and get more out of your dollar if you make it at home. It's located in inner richmond and right next to KING OF THAI and smelling the freshly made crepe makes your mouth water. Also the egg puffs are to die for . they're sooo cute.
author: Iba N.

description: I'm a big crepe fan, not necessarily the sweet ones, but I'll take a good savory crepe anytime.  I had been STARVING and my BF wasn't going to stop anywhere else, it was "you have to try these crepes, they're so good"  I was so biased, and pissed that I had to wait so long and I was sooo hungry, we pull up and parking was not the business, we got lucky after a couple circles around the block and found parking.  We walked up and the moment we walked in it smelled like heaven.  They have a great variety of both savory and sweet crepes. We both chose the turkey avocado sour cream crepe.  I grabbed a fork, seeing as how, every crepe I've ever had has come on a plate.  I didn't get why I was being looked at so funny.  Then the crepe was handed to me in a sturdy snow cone looking card board thing.  It was actually quite handy!!!  They were quite generous with the turkey and the avocado, I'm looking forward to visiting again :)
author: Ashley J.

description: Not a grocery store.  More like a snack store.  If you like those waffles/crepes, that's what your hit with in the door, and you can smell it cooking out on the street.  But I'm not into sweets so to me it's a bit sickening.  What they have on the shelves are mostly Japanese snack foods of all kinds, instant "ramen" type soups, a few condiments and some of those Japanese trinkets.  But don't waste your time thinking you might be able to find some Japanese foods (the nutritious kind) here--just set your mind that you have to make a trip to Japantown if you want to buy Japanese groceries.
author: Kai T.

description:
crispy crepes with a multitude of savory or sweet fillings.  a good friend introduced me to this place eons ago, and it's been one of my favorite treat shops since.  not only do they serve eggettes and crepes, but they also sell various japanese snacks, foods, housewares, toiletries, etc.  so while you wait for your tasty treat, you can do a little bit of additional damage on the wallet.

what makes this crepe so tasty?  the ingeniously crispy crepe batter which makes it easy to hold and carry out of the store.  if the traditional crepe and a chinese fortune cracker had a love child, it'd be genki's crepe.  just be careful with the first few bites as the edges are brittle and will spray little shards of the sweet crepe all over your clothing.

i've only tried a number of the sweet fillings and they were all good.  nutella with banana, nutella with strawberries, lychee ice cream, green tea ice cream or red bean ice cream with adzuki bean or fruit.  however, my all-time favorite is still the banana, honey and almond crepe.  that combo hits the spot every time.
author: Janet L.

description:
YUMMY

good for crepes to go, cause there isn't a place to chill/sit .... but i think its still worth going for!
author: Mikayo W.

description: After eating at Spice's II around the corner I needed something to wrap up my dinner. A cold scoop of mango ice cream with fresh strawberries in the freshly prepared crepe was a perfect way to wrap up the night. There was a line of folks waiting to be served and the crew kept me waiting for my crepe for less than five minutes. Pretty good job. Outside bench was perfect on a nice night. I will return again and again!
author: Robert K.

description: I was way too full from the dinner at Burma to have a crepe of my own but the bites I snagged from my friends were extremely sweet and tasty. The prices looked reasonable, but wow did it take forever to order and recieve said crepes. I felt like we stood inside for a half an hour. For crepes? Really?
author: Michael E.

description: Went to Genki after a really late dinner at Burma Super Star across the street. I could see Genki from the Burma window and it was decided that we would eat dessert there since there were a bunch of people outside hanging out. I ordered the banana, honey and almond crepe which cost a little over $4. The crepe was chewy and cruchy at the same time.  However, karen c. took a bite into her crepe and it cut her lip! I guess it was razor thin! Watch out!!!
author: Natalie S.

description: I had to remove a star because the last 4 times I went to Genki, the drink I ordered was really watery.  I like their crepes, but I really don't like their drinks.  Also, they seem to have stopped carrying Lipton milk tea.  Not cool.
author: Kandi K.

description: I was excited for crepes! I was hungry, had gotten a little lost trying to find the bus to the museum and decided to take a break and have a crepe.   I must say that I was underwhelmed by my crepe, maybe I had built it up too much in my head.  I ordered a crepe with apples, brown sugar, and cinammon, and found it a little dry, they didn't even put whipped cream on top! I'll return again and next time I'll get one of their ice cream crepes and hopefully things will be different.
author: Alana A.

description: When I am craving sweets, this place is second to none for crepes.  Plus I can shop while I wait.
author: o o.

description: I just love the sweet crepes at this place. This place is open late and I like the fact that it's also a mini grocery store in addition to a crepe place. It's nice to have something to do when you are waiting for your food. It's also nice to be able to pick up some additional snacks and trinkets even though they are a bit on the pricier side. You can get most of the same stuff in Chinatown or in sunset super for less. The downside is that they don't really have a place for you to eat. There is a bench and a couple of chairs but that's it. Also, the cashiers could be a bit nicer.
author: Diane M.

description: Crepes here are okay, but they are not the reason why I go to Genki. I go to replenish my junk food stash. Although, I can finally find the same goodies elsewhere for a cheaper price, Genki is a great place to go to when it's late at night.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I came here with a friend because she was gushing all about crepes. First of all, it is located in Clement and yeah, I never thought they have crepes over there. I always think of Japantown when it comes to crepes. But, to my surprise - they do have crepes in Clement! Wow!
Second, because it was clement street - it was not so crowded with people. They are parking around but it is side street. And yeah, their crepes tasted good - I always order nutella, whipped cream and chocolate syrup. I am a sucker when it comes to fruit crepes. My friend had lychee and green tea. 
Lastly, I think am gonna bring my entire family here because their crepes tasted good and it was so affordable - $4.25! (Not bad compare to Japantown where crepes are sold for $7.00 or more)! Also, they got mini market full of sweet goodies and snacks! So, while you wait for your crepe - you can take a look around and not be bored. And yeah, they got a bathroom for their customers ---that's really a plus because some crepe shops don't have one!
I would definitely be back (and yeah with my family - they like sweets! they like crepes!)
author: Rokayah S.

description: Yes, Genki's is going to be the death of me. I get the same thing all the time, #24 with both nutella and whipped cream. If you have not tried this place, you are not living until you do try and I recommend, as first-timer, to #24.
author: Debb M.

description: Best dessert crepes I've ever had.  The lines area always long, though, so plan to be there awhile.
author: Monika M.

description: I love the whole idea of Genki's.  The store is filled with random asian snacks and candies that I grew up eating.  The crepes aren't the best in town but they are good after eating at King of Thai or DNA cafe.
author: Fatty A.

description: I still regret not having bought an order of the Mango Shake to go...Their crepes were D-LISH!  I got my favorite usual the banana& nutella crepe.  ..and My brother got the banana with ice cream crepe.  My sister got some strawberry & cream crepe and my sis-in-law got a mango shake....ALL of it was SO FRIGGIN" GOOD!!!!  They also have a little market in the back with lots of hard-to-find Asian goodies like them little yogurt drinks in the mini bottles (It's a certain brand my sis-in-law loves and can't find in most places).
author: Gio G.

description: Crepes are okay, a little on the overly crispy side and don't try to order savory ones, I think they use the same batter that they use for the sweet ones. Instead, browse this store for the selection of packaged snack crisps and candies and bottled drinks. Then have an egg puff. If you must have a crepe, definitely do sweet, something with Nutella, you can't go wrong with Nutella. I like this place for convenience and because they're open late...but really, I prefer the egg puffs to the crepes.
author: cora j.

description: My crepe was salty when I ordered red bean and lychee ice cream filled crepes. Sigh... but they did have flavored hong kong pancake waffles which looked pretty promising. The ice cream was great and the beans were good, it was just a shame the crepe batter was a bit too salty for me.
author: Joel Y.

description: Great place for crepe-desserts.  They make the standard crepe, but fill it with ice cream and fruit...who doesn't like lychee.  They also have a nice market/grocery store with snacks and toys that make you feel like your on the other side of the Pacific....
author: Mark D.

description: Sophie's got one star more because they know how long to cook their crepes.  Besides that, they are practically identical.  I guess it's a matter of preference but I just don't like how their crepes are cooked until they're a rich tan color and crispy unlike the golden color and soft texture at Sophie's.  What I do like is that Genki carries a bunch of those Japanese candies and toys.  Everytime I come here, I gotta buy whatever miniature Transformers they have to add to my collection.
author: O'Shea J.

description:
i don't know why everyone gives this place such high reviews.

the crepe itself was awful.  it was hard, thin, tough, and cold.  a crepe is supposed to be nice, warm, and fluffy -- easy to eat.  eating this crepe was like tearing through cardboard.

if i wanted ice cream, i'd get an ice cream CONE, but i came here for a crepe, not card board.  thanks.
author: H. L.

description: Alright, the crepes are good, but the coconut egg puffs are where it's at!!!  Warm and slightly chewy with the subtle sweetness of coconut, these egg puffs are a tasty snack and are heavenly when eaten with lychee nut ice cream from neighboring Toy Boat.
author: Krystle S.

description: Not adding anything new. Just go there already and have fun wandering the aisles of weird Japanese kitsch as you wait for the crispiest and most delicate crepe in SF.
author: Jen S.

description: Cheesecake crepe = genki desu.
author: Albert D.

description:
oh my. 

After dinner, my friend stopped by Genki crepe to grab a crepe for himself and another friend as dessert. He then made the mistake of handing it to me while he drove. 

Despite the fact that i had gorged myself on all you can eat hotpot for dinner, already eaten a gigantic cup of ice cream for dessert, AND neither crepe was mine i found myself taking a bite out of the strawberry and nutella crepe due to the delicious aroma it was emitting in front of my face. This led to another bite. and another. and by the time my unfortunate friend turned his head one third of both crepes were missing (initially i had planned on just nibbling the tops off evenly, so that my bites were less conspicuous, but the nutella quickly weakened my self-control). The soft thin crepe combined with rich melty nutella, and gigantic sweet strawberries was love.
author: Leslie L.

description: When this place opened I was like, huh...crepes and ice cream in a corner store type market. Interesting. I've only gone into Genki to get my poky on.
author: Colleen B.

description: Mmmmm.....Genki......I'm glad I live in the neighborhood, because it just makes it that much easier to satisfy a craving of nutella spread on a crispy, paper-thin crepe folded just so you can fill it with vanilla ice-cream and fresh bananas.....Mmmmm....
author: Gail O.

description: This is where I get my fix of egg puff, which looks like little cupcakes in the shape of an egg, thus the name.  The sweet crepe is also very yummy here as well.  If you don't have time for a crepe/egg puff, just grab one of their many Asian ready-to-go snacks and drinks.
author: Jeannie L.

description: Good crepes.  Lines can be long at times.  I usually stick to the Strawberry Nutella crepes but the other crepes here are good too.  The crepes here are on the crispier range so if you're the soft crepe fan...these might not work for you.  There is also a grocery/mini-mart with Asian sweets, candies, teas & certain produce sold here as well.
author: Atif Q.

description:
genki gets a review from me because it has crepes and other snacks, like chocolate egg puffs. of course i also like to browse the aisles for  fun japanese sodas, treats, and toys that are typically different mini kitchen sets.  they used to have a frequent spender card which i had no problem filling up (i'm not sure if they still have it).

i think the chocolate egg puffs are my favorite treat there; they are made in a waffle like contraption, but look like eggs connected together.  they're served warm, are pretty easy to share, and are a lighter snack than the crepes.  i like their ice cream selection because they have good, fruity flavors.

they only thing about genki i don't like is the fact that every time i go there it's at night, after dinner, and it's always windy and freezing cold in the richmond.
author: Kristie P.

description: There are times when I wish I was bulimic.  Like everytime I come to this place, everything is crisp and just filled with goodness!  The crepe with cheesecake bits is just dangerous.
author: Joellene B.

description:
warm on the spot, crispy dessert crepes always brings me back for more...well, anytime i have dinner on Clement St, I will have to make a stop by Genki for a vanilla ice cream with strawberry crepe. it's a nice treat to end my meal.

the store also has wide variety of japanese snacks, beverages and toys. they're very interesting to browse through.
author: Oanh N.

description: What an interesting idea to put ice cream in your crepe. I like that they're open late and serve tasty treats.
author: JaM W.

description: Great cheap crepes! They have a small mini-mart type setup in the back where you can buy all sorts of weird stuff - like Japanese condoms and Korean shampoo. My only gripe is their limited seating, which is why I always get it to go.
author: Tony L.

description: Truly yummy crepes.  I think Sophie's in Japan Town is better, but Genki's price is better so we go to Genki more often.  I love coming here just to see all the Japanese/Hong Kong snacks that they carry.  Most of the time, I can't resist getting a crepe, but I usually try to hold myself back.  :)
author: Debbie C.

description: The crepes here are great, and it is so cool how they make it in front of you. Also, the place has good japanese candy and ice cream. Though, the crepes are the most original thing there.
author: Nikita K.

description:
probably one of the best crepe places i've ever had. i would skip the savory ones. the sweet ones are alot more interesting and inticing.

definately try it out!
author: cat k.

description: The crepes are wonderful. They are on par with Sophie's. This style of crepes is just like the ones I use to get on the streets of Paris. Hand held,  very thin, slightly crispy. Do not give money to the vendors that server spongy, mushy, pancake like things they try to pass off as crepes.
author: John H.

description: Cute place for a little after dinner indulgence.  There have a wide selection of crepes that they can make for you and the store also offers a lot of cute snacks and stuff from japan.  They have a few small tables you can sit and eat at but during the evening hours, it can get pretty packed.
author: Tiffany J.

description: A great place crepes, this place has a wide variety of crepes and other delicious treats. They also have a very wide assortment of imported Asian candies and drinks, so if you're into that stuff, this is definitely the place for you. I usually get a dessert crepe here whenever I finish eating dinner some place next door. I highly recommend Genki.
author: Rommel N.

description: Ended up here after eating at Troya across the street.  I had big expectations for this place after I saw the large crowd inside ordering crepes.  Unfortunately I must admit my green tea ice cream-lychee crepe, was just ok.  Don't get me wrong, the value is great, $4.45 + tax for a dessert crepe...you can't really beat that.  Also, if it's your b-day you get a free crepe along with a purchase of another crepe.  I would go back if I were eating at a restaurant in the area, but I probably wouldn't make a special trip.
author: Christopher W.

description: MMkay, I was unsure that this spot was the BEST-- but now I am totally totally sure.  MAN.  what do they DO?!  Nutella rocks.  and dude.. I saw the guy put a bit of whip cream, then my strawberry ice cream, then MORE whip cream--- but I stopped him before he could squirt my stomach out.  O dear.  it was hekka good driving home in almost grid lock traffic on 19th ave.  Traffic didnt even phase me because I had my crepe and spoon in one hand, and the wheel on the other!  but somehow I made it to the 280 south, wanting to throw up because I was soooo full.
author: Rainbow B.

description: Crepes and Japanese assorted goodies. I usually enjoy a crepe with either strawberry or banana + Nutella (everything is always better with Nutella!). I like how their crepes are crispy, I prefer that over the soft floppy ones. Better for eating and walking! Prices are reasonable and there is usually a crowd during the after-dinner hours. On clement so parking is a nightmare!
author: Tracy N.

description:
The crepes suck...they skimp on the nutella and the strawberries, and overcook it to the point where it's crispy even in the middle. Double Yuck....Go to Crepes a go go down on union (get it walking style) and see how they really should be made. But maybe I'm just not asian enough to appreciate the asian crepe...oh wait....i'm chinese..so no...the crepe really does just suck. 

So why do I still come here? Oh yeah....the bf's well intentioned mom insists on buying me ice cream after dinner on clement, I suddenly have the need to have dried squid and grape hi-chews at 11pm,  and haribo roleux are only 35cents!
author: Emily W.

description: I really love the crepes here. They aren't soggy whatsoever, like I've had at some other places. Also, there's lots of Japanese goodies... I guess the downside is I always come out with more than I intend :) BUT this place is a must. Sometimes they put too much nutella but it isn't too bad. I love Genki's crepes!
author: Jules N.

description:
Great place for a snack and for those loving the crepes!

4 stars because sometimes they do take a while to make the crepes.  I had one yesterday and I waited about 15 minutes for one but I was in no rush.  Also, 4 stars because frankly I had the best in Paris a while back and their crepes make these look like midgets.  Seriously, they take their desserts serious in Paris.

My all time favorite is just the basic nutella and banana crepe.  Simple, just the right size, and if you wait long enough, comes out warm!!!!

Make room b/c it's the perfect way to round out the evening after a huge dinner too!!!
author: JackBauerDude J.

description: This is such a yummy place!!  I discovered it 3 weeks ago and have been going back weekly.  I love the banana/nutella crepes.  Definitely #1.  I've also tried their savory crepes too.  Definitely try to eat it when hot.  It's just not the same if it gets cold.  The store was cute with lots of Asian items.
author: Otodermie M.

description: Its like Crepe Heaven, We love the nutella  strawberry slice crepe.
author: Jenny's N Quan's Adventure D.

description: ok finally I've tried the dessert crepe here after my Sophie crepe experience. The crepe wars are now over and I'ma call the winner and champ... Genki crepes!!! With bigger and tastier crepes, this is the place to go. Yeah so you might not be in Jtown with all the cool stores like the sticky pic store or the bookstore, but you get a better crepe. I had a Strawberry kiwi crepe and it was really good except Kiwis aren't in season now so it was a bit sour. Other than that, the Savory crepe was HUGE and heavy. We definitely compared the savory crepe to a pizza. Anyways, it's a must try or a must go back to.
author: Allan T.

description: my boyfriend and i enjoy a late night snack!
author: nguyet h.

description: I don't come out to Clement very often because parking can be difficult.  But when I do, I try to stop by Genki to treat myself to a simple vanilla ice cream crepe with nutella and strawberries because it always puts a smile on my face.  The crepe beats any kind of cone any day and the nutella makes the difference between an ordinary dessert and one that's truly satisfying.
author: Maria G.

description: You walk by Genki crepes and you can't help but stop in because of the awesome vanilla smell coming from the cooking crepes. Or maybe they are like Disneyland and they pump out the fragrance into the street so it entices customers?  Either way, the crepes are delicious, never soggy like other crepe places I've had.  I get the nutella/marshmallow crepe.  There is usually a line.
author: Ben D.

description: dude, this place is awesome. its 1/4 crepe place and 3/4 mini mart.
author: Wesley G.

description: I can't believe this place has so many good reviews cus it really isn't ALL THAT. My crepes have always been served to me CRUNCHY. I guess I'm just not a fan of eating it as if they were crackers of some sort. I'd like to eat my crepe without having it break into a gajillion pieces. If you want to have a REAL GOOD CREPE, get one at Sophie's in Japantown!!!
author: Lynn H.

description:
i am always - i mean always craving a dessert, something sweet and tasty! 
after our quick thai dinner... my good friend joe, took me to have desserts... i kinda was just craving the usual fried banana and coconut ice cream... he told me to hold out and we'd go somewhere - he knew i would love.

as we walked down the street...approaching only a few stores from genki... you can smell the fresh crepes and egg puffs being made. ahhh, what a delightful aroma! 
we had two crepes and two kinds of egg puffs...
joe had a red bean and vanilla ice cream crepe - i had a strawberry and nutella crepe.... and we had sesame egg puffs and peanut butter egg puff...
so yummy!! 
i definitely would go back... i'm kinda craving some right now!!
author: kiko v.

description: Super fresh and tasty. My standard strawberry, nutella and whipped cream is always good with the perfect ratio of each ingredient. A consistent place for a treat after a bad day when all you want is a sweet pick me up. Service is indifferent but not unpleasant. They let you use their bathroom if there is no where else to go. They also make bomb strawberry smoothies and their turkey jack and avo crepe is tasty if a bit heavy on the mayo. Anyway this place is hella cute and a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Nadia P.

description: i love, love, LOVE this place.  My favorite is the crepe that has vanilla ice cream, strawberries, and whipped cream.  The wait is never too long, and I've never been disappointed here.  Decent prices for delicious food, and it's fun to poke around the store while you're waiting for your crepe.  there's been many times that I picked up groceries (such as mochi ice cream, for example) while waiting for my crepe, making this place a two-bird-with-one-stone kind of a deal, making it that much more worth your time to stop by.
author: asia c.

description: Yum! Yum! Yum! That's all I have to say. They get the crepes right every single time and their fruit is always fresh and the crepe is warm...mmm got me hungry just thinking about it. My boyfriend and I have made some late night trips from Santa Clara out to SF just to get genki because it's that freakin good. It does get super busy on the weekends and some nights so you might have to wait a little while to get your crepe but it's so worth it. Amazing!!!!!
author: Lita L.

description: GENKI!!!!! I like Genki crepes better than Sophie's.
author: Beth W.

description: Yummy delicious goodness.  A great quick snack, they can give you the crepes in the form of an ice cream cone - very easy to eat.  Good stuff.
author: nicole h.

description: OMG! I love this place! They got these huge crepes and you can pick whatever you like! I like the nutella crepes! I also love their banana milk drink accompanied with chocolate egg puffs! YUM! I love this store because there are so many different things: candy, crepes, and other Japanese snacks! Can't go wrong!
author: Mel P.

description: Good place for crepes and all sorts of Japanese sweets. They also have egg puffs which aren't bad but I'd choose the crepes or just plain ice cream over that. I love that they're in my neighborhood and can just pop in for a crepe whenever the craving strikes.
author: cyndi L.

description: Always tons of people here at night on weekends. Awesome place to pleasure your sweet buds crepes, drinks, and ice cream. Their market is awesome with alot of different types of asian drinks and snacks.
author: David M.

description: I love this place. I discovered this place when m parents and I took my auntie in SF out to dinner at some chinese restraunt which was next door to genki crepes:D I kept coming back in and out every few minutes cause I hella wanted to buy those japanese redbean pancakes :] I miss coming to that store :[ I don't remember the look of the cashier lady's face when she noticed that I kept comig in and out ROFL
author: Jessica T.

description: Cheesecake crepe.   2 blocks from Green Apple.  Across from B Star.  Yes.
author: Nora B.

description: Aw, Man!  Are you kidding me?!? It's as if God was like, "OK, I'm gonna hook these humans up with a slice of Heaven. Mmmmm....you like that, bitches? Well, in Heaven, we got 10 foot crepes up in this motherfucker and you can't have any!" I suggest the Vanilla Ice Creme crepe with Nutella, bananas and whip cream. You can also stock up on a choice of a  million Japanese candies and whatnot.
author: Vinnie E.

description: Are you kidding me with the size?!?!  I am addicted to the mixed fruit crepe!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
as if genki needs any help from me.  but i love it because of the mouthwatering nutella crepe (it makes my opu grumble just to think about it) and the staggering array of awesome candy and other hula-esque food items.  plus, you can smell it down the block and that's always fun.  

save some room after eating at burma and waddle across the street for dessert.
author: nic f.

description:
you can get great crepes (i prefer the dessert crepes with lots of calories added for fun), a bottle of water and some japanese groceries all in one stop.

but get your stuff and go.  no sitting here, except about 4 seats along the entrance.
author: jen b.

description: i LOVE their ice cream with nutella crepes! DROOOL! i only wished they had a bigger sitting area, with tables and out of the cold, to devour their yummy crepes.
author: Vivian D.

description: Half the fun of this place is the checking out all the Asian tschotckes for sale in the store as you wait for your crepe to be made. I swear I could spend a small fortune here on quirky little gifties and things for my niece and nephew. They have a fair selection of packaged foods for sale too, like mochi, milk bars, sauces and noodles. I highly recommend the chocolate covered gummy candies too! The crepes are good - but too crunchy and dry for my personal liking. Still this is a great place for a sweet topper-offer when you are in the hood.
author: Aimee G.

description: Genki Crepes is berry berry good.  Fresh fruits and fresh ingredients make it a place to come back to.  I have yet to try one of their savory crepes, and had only eaten ice cream dessert crepes.  Next time i'll try their egg puff also.  Genki crepe not only serves crepes, but also has an array of other snacks you can purchase.  The only downside of genki crepes is that sometimes birds fly in and get trapped and fall onto the cooking area...they are quick to clean up the area though.
author: LittleBird 8.

description: Great place, very quick!  The convienence of the mini mart allows you to walk around past time by as you wait for your crepe to be done.  They are pretty generous with servings.
author: Leslie Y.

description: From their wacky selection of Japanese food to their delicious crepes, this place can do no wrong.
author: Tim G.

description: They have the best crepes! Crispy crepe filled with whatever you want! I always get my usual--Strawberry, banana with Nutella AND whip cream. MMMmmMmm Plus they have all the Asian snacks and drinks, you can shop while you wait for your crepe. Coming here is TROUBLE for me. I always want to get everything, which can get very expensive.
author: Kim D.

description: The sweet crepe is soo good.  I am a crepe's lover and I found this place while walking on Clement St. Stopped here for dessert.. I had the Nutela with almond ($3.50).. hmm.. yuumm.. so good! Haven't tried any other stuff yet, but for sure will come by and try. The only bad thing about this place is that it is like a store, so there is really o place to sit down and enjoy your meal. They have a bench to sit wile you wait for your crepes, but that is all. But, no doubt that the crepe that I tried was really good and kind of crispy!
author: Daisy S.

description: LOVE IT! I like the Mixed fruits with nutella crepe the best. N the matcha ice cream. So curious to know how a Wasabi milk shake will taste like. haha XD
author: Marlis T.

description: Come here for crepes when I'm not in the mood for Quickly's. But honesty I hardly come here, for the fact that it's so overpriced compared to Jtown. Though it may be pricey, it's good. It's also snack wonderland! From drinks right down to the candy. They're all so unique, I can't help but purchase and stock up on things for my sweet tooth.
author: Jenny L.

description:
If you're craving for sugar definitely go and check this place....When you passed by this place you just can't help but smell the oh sooo deliciousss crepes. It's like calling my name (hey, you know what I mean by that, hehehe)...so what do I do- after lunch or dinner, go here and order their awesome crepes. I personally love the banana, almond with nutella. I love bananaaaa (who doesn't unless of course if you're allergic with it) and chocolate. I also like their jasmine milk tea. 

So, if you're waiting in line at Burma Super Star- go and hang out here and try their crepes or milk tea with pearls. Yum Yum oh Yum!!!
