author: JM M.

description: I'm personally a hardcore Sophie's fan, but when in Richmond (even though Japantown isn't that far away) Genki hits the spot quite well. Their crepes are thicker and crunchier in comparison to Sophie's. I usually get just nutella + banana but with the texture of the crepes, it all fits in well together. The shop itself is pretty cool with a lot Japanese toys/food products. Overall, go Genki ^__^
author: Julie L.

description:
mmmm... crepes.

and the cutest asian snack packs.
author: Rosalee C.

description: It was just ok. I expected better. I guess the best thing was the crunchiness of the crepes.  Maybe I need to try it again. I think i didn't like the bananas in my crepe.
author: sharon m.

description: I've always wanted to come here, but I remembered their prices were too high for me a while ago (they still kind of are). So I finally came today, and boy was I surprised. They had an endless variety of crepes, egg puffs, ice cream, etc. It took me at least five minutes to decide what to get because everything seemed so good. I ended up getting the whipped cream, cheesecake, and blueberry sauce crepe. My friend and I shared some peanut butter egg puffs, which was indescribably delicious. While we were waiting, we had fun looking at all the cute little Japanese toys/snacks: Hello Kitty "Gucci" bags, Playboy candy, etc. Honestly, I did not know what I was missing until I came here.
author: Alex Y.

description: banana's, whip cream, honey, almonds..in a sturdy crepe? OH MY!!!
author: Aleli L.

description: I go all the way from downtown to the Inner Richmond just to go to Genki Crepes sometimes because when you have a craving for something warm, and sweet and savory (whether for a small meal or dessert), it really hits the spot.  It's better than the couple of places in Japan Center, and is open very late.  There's no shame about eating alone because there is no seating besides a couple of benches, invariably taken up by a family or a group of teenagers.  But it's perfect handheld food, so no problem with standing around or walking through the aisles of cool Japanese groceries and knickknacks with fresh, warm yumminess in your hand.
author: Chris B.

description: i come here every time im in the richmond district.  i always grab the japanese snacks that they have here.  the crepes here are delicious. my favorite is the blue berry cheesecake.
author: Cedric F.

description: I love this place! I've been a loyal customer for more than four years. I always get my crepe fix from Genki's. But  I only gave four stars because I noticed that they have been skimping out on fruits and Nutella now. They accept credit/debit cards but you have to spend a minimum of $10, so I would recommend using cash if you can.
author: Kit K.

description: Great ice cream crepe.. vanilla with nutella and strawberry or kiwi.. nice place to hang out too after dinner!
author: Faustino R.

description: Been here multiple times to get some really good crepes! I always enjoy the simple nutella and banana. They do have many other crepes that are very good as well. The minimart itself is a tad small and they tend to get busy, so you may find yourself bumping into a few other people when trying to pick out your favorite chewy candy there. A little expensive and not open late are the only things i dont like, but other than that, great crepes!
author: Daniel C.

description: Genki is one of my favorite places to go for some evening sweets and impulse shopping.  They have really great asian products that's hard to find anywhere else.
author: Dana C.

description: GENKI is very yummy and cheap, compared to all the other overpriced creperies! The crepe itself is nice and flaky. I ordered the one with mango ice cream and fresh strawberries. It was soooo good! They also have nutella crepes too :) I also looked around the store, and they have tons of cute knick-knacks, like little panda figurines! YAY-ness!
author: O K.

description: The crepes were too crunchy and hard. But I do enjoy all the japanese candies and drinks that they sell. It's fun to just browse around and look at the japanese cosmetics and foods that they offer.
author: Juli S.

description: I love this place!  Eggpuffs, Nutella, oh boy!  I am hooked on Nuetella crepes.  Besides the made to order desserts it has a nice little refridgerated area featuring a wide array of Japanese beverages.  You can also find cute little figurines.  Go for the dessert crepes and eggpuffs.
author: Kevin A.

description: Come for the groceries, stay for the eggettes. This is also a fun spot to burn some time while waiting for your table at Burma SuperStar.
author: Angela K.

description: i love this place for the the mini asian grocery store.. where i can get all of my favorite japanese, chinese snacks, chips, cookies, candies and drinks! and best of all.. it's opened late!!
author: Lisa C.

description:
Mmmmmmmmmmmmm

Need I really say more?
author: Misti L.

description: One of the better ones, crispy and delicious fillings! fast service and an assortment of ingredients;   dessert and savory choices!
author: Hana ..

description: I tried this place since everyone raves about it. But, I just didn't like it. I tried the strawberry nutella with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The crepe tasted like a fortune cookie and the strawberries were sour. I like crispy crepes, but I think I prefer belly good crepes. Even though they are soft, but then if you add corn flakes to it, you can get th crunchy texture.
author: dI c.

description: I've been here once. Try the Green Tea Crepe topped with lychee!! I'll be sure to come back here
author: Oh So Fresh B.

description: Crepes are pretty good; I had lychee plus nutella. I do have to admit that for the same $4 I think I'd choose a pearl tea from Sweet Delite right across the street, but today they have a big "grand opening" sign with the dreaded Quickly logo on it, so I'm afraid they might have sold out.
author: Rob T.

description:
yum!
tastes good !

yay!

good ice cream selection!

FAST!

kickass awesome!

yay!

calpico water and all the other little sugary ricey things i love so much ! late at night !

yay!
playing cards of characters i totally don't recognize !

awesome!

and six packs of malt soy milk in the back!

whee!
author: Domini A.

description:
i love crepes!! this is a good place to go. they are open late and usually pretty fast in completing orders. i love lychee ice cream and they have a good one. 

strawberries, nutella, and lychee ice cream...can't go wrong
author: Kelly D.

description: mmmm really good crepes. Not quite as good as you'd get on the streets of Paris, but definitely one of the best I've had in the States. In fact, I'm gonna go get one right now.
author: Joy T.

description: Wow. the crepes here are reallllly goood! I love how they put them in a little holder thing so that you can hold and eat the crepe. The first time I went there I got a strawberry crepe with nutella. OMG. delicious! I ate that thing in a second. They also have random asian candy. A very good variety. Price is decent. I bought my Strawberry and Nutella for about $4. Well worth it. I will come back for more!
author: Ricialg P.

description: I have to admit that I've never had their crepes. There's always a short line and it smells soooo good. I'm certain they are delicious. I'll try it some day. The real reason I like this place is their selection of Japanese goodies. I've found every type of rice cracker, mochi, baked goods, and candy that I've had during my month long sabbatical in Kyoto. It brings back good times and familiar tastes. The snacks are reasonably priced too. Oh, and they get an extra star for carrying Hawaiian Sun flavored POG. My favorite drink when I'm in the islands. This place is like being in downtown Waikiki. : )
author: Fil L.

description: Oh man, a crepe to go is one of the best food inventions since sliced bread! I crave these things! I usually get the strawberry nutella and whipped cream. Yum. The blueberry cheesecake is dangerously good too! The market area is filled with tons of Asian candies,drinks and treats. Too much good stuff, I can get lost in here. Mmmmm, fatty diabetic goodness!
author: Abby A.

description: Bubble tea was ok. Dessert crepes are fun after yummy meal at Burma Superstar.
author: miriam b.

description: Nothing satisfies the little fat kid inside of me like Genki.  I can stock up on coconut flavored Vitasoy (if you never had some, go get it now!), pocky, and the panda cookies, while i wait for my banana and nutella crepe.  Also, the fat kid inside really likes the cheesecake crepe, although he knows that you're about one bite away from heart disease.
author: Jasmine B.

description: Sweet crepes are better than the savory, but both are tasty. The crepe is a little thicker than some places though. While waiting for your crepe you can check out the array of products. A good place to introduce friends to Asian snacks and knick knacks. Always entertaining are the English translations on the products and the busty anime figurines in the glass case.
author: n m.

description: This is the first restaurant that I discovered through Yelp about a year ago. When it comes to just the best crepe, it doesn't get much better than this in SF. It's actually in a small Japanese food market, and has 2-3 tables with tiny chairs. Crepes are ordered over the counter, but just as the reviews claimed, the crunchy crepes, just like the ones popular in Japan, were just delicious. I wish they had an indoor place (the door to the market is always open, so if it's cold, it might be better to get that crepe to go) or had good coffee, it would simply be perfect then.
author: Aydin S.

description: I have to admit, I have been holding off on writing this review, as I really don't want the line to get nay larger than it already is.  Luckily for me, my schedule is such, I can avoid the weekends and shop at this super cool store when most are busy at their desks, on the computer or in that conference room.  The smell of the crepes lures one in, but the cool thing about this store is they carry alot of harder to find candy from Japan and Hong Kong alike.  Anyone who loves japenese candies, treats, drinks, or little gifty items- this could be a great store for your retail therapy, without breaking the bank!
author: frankee U.

description: It's great.  More fast food should be like this.  The avocado, turkey crepe is great lunch.  The nutella and marshmellow crepe is cravalicious.  And everything is better with their juices.  If you haven't tried the egg puffs, TRY THEM!  What a great snack.  Why don't we have more street food like this in America.  What do we need to do to make this happen?  This stuff should be everywhere.  Genki crepes definitely gets a tip of the hat!
author: Benjamin P.

description: Sooooooo good!!!  Leche and nutella crepe is awesome!  They have such good bubble tea.  Service overall is nice.  Setting is fun too, it is interesting to walk around the shop and see all the items for sale.  Great for a late night craving and snack.
author: Steven K.

description:
hello, meal or dessert for five bucks - i got my old-fashioned, traditional grandma a strawberry and nutella crepe and she was sold. i used to live around the corner from this place, so when friends, parents, and school mates were around, this is where we went. they have a great selection of savory crepes (i like the turkey/avocado combo) and anything with nutella in it for a dessert crepe is killer. i've tried the crepes with the ice cream and it's just weird to bite into them and not want to use a spoon. their boba drinks are pretty nice as well, and the mart with the candies you can't pronounce or read and the cutest stationary ever awaits you. and peek-a-poohs! don't even get me started...

i know the seating is pretty subpar but i think this place isn't meant to really be sit down and eat. if you're lucky to grab a seat outside when it's warm, the clement people watching is awesome.
author: Jenz y.

description: Ooooohhhh!  Yum!  This is currently my favorite place for dessert.  I love the ice cream crepes with fresh fruit (I love the strawberry ice cream with kiwi slices).  They have all types of crepes:  ones with nutella, ice cream, lox... you name it!  They also have these egg shaped waffle things that are also very delicious.  I love that there is a little Asian market too... you can buy everything from Japanese oil blotting papers to the Asian wash cloths.  Anyhow, it's so bad because I've been here 3 times in the past week, and I can just feel my pants getting tighter.  One of the girls who works there told a friend of mine that she's gained 5 pounds since she started working there.  I can definitely see why.  Yum Yum!
author: Sarah F.

description: I come to this place for the eggettes. I like how the eggettes are crispy with a little bit of softness on the inside. I don't know many places who make it like this. I've also tried the crepe with nutella, ice cream and strawberries. I watched as they made the crepe and they put a decent amount of filling. The combination is wrapped and put in a convenient paper holder which allows for easy transport. There is a bench and a few chairs on the inside for sitting. But it gets crowded during the weekends. This store also offers a variety of junk food and goodies from Japan. They charge a tad more for the same goodies you can find in Chinatown or in a Chinese grocery store.
author: Candace F.

description: I'm a simple girl - with simple tastes and this place has the best Strawberries & Whip Cream Crepe ever! Ok I'll be honest I'd never had a crepe before Genki, but I still know what good is and that's Genki!   It's  a nice treat to split with someone after dinner on Clement Street.  Lines are normally long - prices are very reasonable - worth the wait. Don't go crazy on the Nutella crepes - because I've seen them scoop spatulas full of that stuff all over - healthy snack my ass!  Stick with the light stuff - they of course don't go as crazy with the fruit but it is still good! Fun store with lots of Asian candies to keep you busy looking while you wait for your crepe.
author: J S.

description:
I'm going to make sweet, sweet love to Genki.
   The first time I went to Genki my friends and I had just smoked a big ole spliff and I knew from the moment I walked in that I had found my new favorite place.  
   -First of all, I totally put out for boba and/or eggpuff, and Genki has both in alllllll the flavors. 
   Can I get a Witness??
  - #2. A small collection of Sanrio-ish pencil cases, note pads, steering wheel covers, sunshades...you get the gist. Takes me back to when I was in elementary school and I lived in the Sunset and would go to all the Asian trinket-y stores on Irving. (cue music...."Back in the days when I was young, I'm not a kid anymore......")
   -Thirdly: HOLY SMOKES I could spend about $75-$200 everytime on candy, ice cream, chips, SHISEDO LIP GLOSS, candy, candy, GIANT POCKY STICKS, candy. 
   I want all of the candy there. Seriously. I want all the treats.
   It is a testament to my strength of character that I allow myself just ONE treat each time......in addition to my eggpuff and boba, of course.
author: sofia p.

description: I like the strawberry and mango crepe.  they also sell lil nick-nacks here.  I like to buy the cool japanese toys there.  *they also have a restroom for customers here.  :D
author: con c.

description: I've been hearing a lot of reviews of their crepes here so I decided to finally try one. I ordered the Vanilla Ice Cream w/ Nutella. I was SOO not impressed at all. The crepe was sooo salty and crispy like a fortune cookie. Everything was falling apart each bite I took; it was a mess. Only good thing about it was the nutella portion. I like how it's a mini-mart though, they have some pretty interesting stuff I would like to buy next time I go there. Definitely not getting the crepes though.
author: Sean E.

description:
so, we were on our way out of a nearby sushi place, and wandered past genki. i'm a fan of sophie's, so upon seeing the very similar images of crepes in the glass, we stopped. did a double take. and immediately went in... i only noticed two differences between genki & sophie crepes. 1.) genki's crepes were uber crispy. didn't love that, but it didn't really bother me. 2.) i got my crepe within 3 minutes of ordering it. AWESOME. no wait, all the deliciousness.

Also, this is a little convenience type store with all the fun, cute, ridiculous little japanese snacks, drinks & toys one could ever hope for! The only thing I can dislike about Genki, is that it's so far away from home, that I'd only get to stop here if I was in Richmond for some reason, and we rarely are... all in all, a definite "try this" next time you're close!
author: Krista H.

description: I come to Genki for two things: the strawberry nutella crepe and the bottled Korean aloe drink. Genki's crepes are slightly crispy and generally do not skimp on the Nutella (but are not overly generous either). In terms of crepe alone, I think it rivals Sophie's but for a cheaper price...Sophie's has the advantage when it comes to eating your crepe with ice cream though!
author: Jane K.

description: I got the nutella and banana crepe. I love my crepes crispy and these fit the bill. For $3.50 they were both cheap and really good. The crepe itself is stellar. thin, sweet and crisy. My husband got the chocolate ice-cream and cheesecake one, which we agreed was good too. But he said he would get the nutella and banana one next time....and there WILL BE a next time.
author: Lauren C.

description: I walked in here because I wanted some milk tea.  After skimming through some reviews, I thought I'd try a crepe.  I got one with nutella and bananas.  I was laughing at one of the reviews where the lady got nutella on her face, and I guess karma must have rolled around.  As I was taking my last bite of goodness, a piece of nutella'd banana landed on my dress.  I had to rush home and wash it before the stain set in.  Embarrassing story aside, the crepe was really good.  Next time I would probably go with one that has ice cream, but I would have to eat it at a table since I'm no apparently no good at eating neatly.  Four stars for the crepe, minus one star for service and the almond milk tea, which tasted like milk tea with some almond additives.  It didn't taste like it was mixed at all and there was just something off about it.  Plus they were out of boba.  The lady who took my order mumbled some things at me and didn't seem at all interested in anything other than writing down my order and taking my money.  I mean, I guess that's her job, but she did not seem like she liked being there.  I would go back and try something else though.
author: k h.

description: A 3.5 boosted to a 4 purely for personal, sentimental reasons.  The boba smoothies are great, thick and cold and richly fruity with perfectly chewy tapioca in the bottom.  The crepes are nothing special, but by their crepey nature are naturally delicious.  I do think Genki Crepes charges too much.  The tapioca cost extra; the crepes are around $4.  Some are more expensive.  It costs $8 to get my favorite crepe and a smoothie with boba, and that's not counting the tip I leave for quick service at a busy shop.  I still love you though, Genki Crepes!
author: elizabeth o.

description: I'm here! :D AT loves savory crepes and this is one of his main attractions i love the sweet ones, he loves ham and cheesse. i love anything with mandarin oranges. we're the complete opposites. which is really good because while hes eating the sandwich i'm eating the dessert and we switch! it makes an awesome meal! i love the store part when im waiting for my crepe i usually wonder around and see whats going on, what they selling mostly japanese things like facial wash, pooh backpacks, pooh stickers, candy, things that they sell at the yen stores. ya' know. it can get really crowded at like 11ish when you just finished dinner and you're waiting for something sweet. they have benches but not enough. it keeps me coming back for more! and whats even better they have lite whip. i hate whip it's so bad for you all that oil and sugar. CASH ONLY. dont stress your neck trying to read the meal they'll have one on the cash counter right in front of you or else you'll get a really bad cramp while eating crepe in the cold sf night.
author: Carolyn Y.

description: I visited Genki Crepes once and got a Nutella and Banana crepe. The crepe was decent, but the employee at the register was rude. I stood there for a few minutes before I finally got her attention so that I could place my order. Once I finally had her attention, I felt like she was rude and short with me, like it was such an inconvenience for her to do her job.
author: Bethany T.

description: The name of this store is Genki Crepes but they sell so much more!  It's a dessert place, Asian 7-11, toy store, and so much more all rolled into one amazingly cute little store!  On any given night, the line for food is very long.  People are waiting outside and inside to place/pick up their orders.  I've only tried the blueberry cream cheese crepe here, but it was delicious!  The crepe itself is fluffy and crisp at the same time and everything else was not too sweet.  I gotten a hot horlick drink here before but it was tasteless, I had to add a lot more sugar to it myself.  I love coming here to stock up on Hi-Chews, the ever so addicting chewy fruity candy and seeing what new stuff toys they have.  I am obsessed with what I like to call "tofu babies" and anything else in its family. I'm usually not out here in the Richmond district unless it's to eat and many times I'm too stuffed to get dessert.  But when I have the chance, I'll definitely come back to try all the other crepes Genki has.
author: Katherine C.

description: conveniently located near my old SF place and a great spot to grab a quick dessert crepe after having dinner on clement. a great place to pick up tons of assortments of asian drinks, candies, nick nacks and random goodies.
author: Daniel N.

description:
if you live in the richmond, you ve probably either been here or seen it since the sign kind of stands out. its a good place for a little dessert after a meal. its always fun to watch them swirl the stick thingy on the flat iron thingy in a wierd way. the crepes are good...they have a good variety of both sweet and the more meal type ones but none are too thick...if you re lookin for a meal crepe...goto crepevine. this place is pretty good but then again...i dont think crepes are that hard to make.

only gripe is that it isnt open later and doesnt cater to the after-hours crowd which is a big mistake. they sell asian candy too!!! so while your friends are in line go ahead and grab a handfull along with the "marble drink"....how can i give a bad review to places with the "marble drink"???...the answer....i cant
author: David L.

description: It's my best nite snack place.  They open till late 11:00pm.(it will be better if they extend their business hour).  I love their crepes and Japanese snack.
author: Melody T.

description: The perfect Taiwanese-style crepe, and a great selection of East Asian candies. Indulge your sweet tooth and go Genki.
author: Alberto Y.

description: Late night crepe craving....there really is nowhere else to go. And at Genki, I've never been disappointed. My only problem is the excess of ice cream in my crepe. Honestly though, the crepes are good and made quickly enough. Yes, it might be crowded but, as soon as everyone gets their crepes, they usually migrate outside to the benches or their cars.
author: Tiff L.

description: Dropped by for dessert and ordered a crepe with fruit and ice cream. Had to wait about 10mins before getting it. The ice cream was okay. There wasn't much fruit....like four thin half slices of kiwi which equals to two thin whole slices. As for the crepe itself, it was golden crispy which was good but it was also quite salty which I didnt like. I give them a three for mediocre.
author: Norton W.

description: My favorite - green tea with red bean paste! This place was my favorite spot for crepe cravings...however, I live in the sunset district and a friend of mine told me about Crepe Temptations.  They offer a similar selection and many more savory crepes.  If I'm near the clement area - I'll come come for their crepes.
author: Peter G.

description:
+ 1 scoop of Red Bean ice cream
(+/or 1 scoop of Green Tea ice cream)
in a crepe 
with Lychees 
and whip cream

It's the cure that ails me.
author: Tulip F.

description: I use to do half of my grocery shopping here! I love all the different assortments of candy here but i'm not big on their crepes sophies in jtown is much better.
author: Chrissy E.

description: Delightful crepes! I like mine with green tea ice cream and nutella. While you wait, you can check out all the interesting asian stuff they have in the store.
author: Brian H.

description: wow, this place is just amazing. Its like a little market where you can buy toys, junk food, car supplies, key chains, cups, make up, soap, hair dye and you get the point. And at the same time, they sell crepes, smoothies, ice cream and  tapioca. They are very nice (to me at least), and the mango-peach smoothie is like a dream come true. Its a must have!...except I find it  a little too sweet, but come on, nothing is ever too sweet!!
author: Vivian C.

description: Genki is so good it's like a Judo Chop to the face filled with sweet goodness. I am not the biggest crepe fan but turn them into dessert and I'm down for it. I love the fact they have the lil Japanese toys too. It's like baskin robbins, ti couz and kid robot had a menage tois and this was their bastard love child. A SWEET BASTARD LOVE CHILD.
author: santiago g.

description: Reviewing crepes only. Had my first Genki crepe last night. Nutella and coconut. It was decent tasting, hit the dessert spot perfectly, and it was nice to get a folded crepe in a wrapper rather than the stuffed-to-the-brim American style dessert crepes at Squat and Gobble. BUT IT WAS TOO CRISPY. I didn't get that. Maybe that's their style at Genki? Maybe the crepe cooker has the heat up too high so they can crank out a lot of crepes? I would probably go back there when I want crepe and am in the neighborhood, but so far I probably like the Crepe Truck better and I have yet to try Sophie's.
author: Paris E.

description:
ohhh, the strawberry bread ball things....are good!!

the crepes are reasonable and TASTY! and everytime i go, theres no line!!
author: Isaiah W.

description: after having buckets of beers & tacos @ underdogs sports bar/which btw started @ about 9 am in the morn for the march madness fiasco.....the conclusion of the day had to end with sumthing sweet~majority rules & we were in the avenues~desert crepes?....i was hesitant @ first~a cocktail such as a mohito wouldve been fine after the many beers i chugged....the sun was out but parkin as always was a bia here in the aves...no line was a good sign~from the outside this place looks like a grocery story....my sis ordered me a desert ice cream crepe~i really dont give a crap bout presentation but the way this was made/shaped was a huuuuge round ice cream cone....it took me only a couple of minutes to scarf down this crepe....there were so many other tasty items/flavors/different combos on the menu~ill b back
author: elmer d.

description: Crepes with ice cream and the add-ons of strawberries and/or bananas with whipped cream is all I have ever eaten here. These ice cream burritos are about as good of a dessert you can get. If you have to wait for your order stroll the aisles. They stock some pretty wild stuff. What is the deal with the miniature store coolers that would fit in a doll-supermarket? Am I missing something? Anyway I digress. Go here and get a good ice cream crepe.
author: alistair g.

description: After a meal at any one of the awesome asian restaurants around the area, it's a great place to relax.  You can peruse the aisles looking at cool  japanese toys and candies while waiting for them to make your crepe.  crepes aren't too thin, and are thick enough to contain whatever you stuff in them.  These crepes are definitely closer to their European bretheren than the ones at crepes a go go (large and in charge, but also some of my favorite crepes) but both have their merits.
author: Chris C.

description: Best Crepes EVER. I like to keep it simple with the nutella, vanilla ice cream, and strawberries, but it is sooooo good. There is no room to sit usually because there's always a lot of people, but it's still fun to go and walk around afterwards. It's definitely worth it.
author: jeanine t.

description: 5 Stars because they have the best egg puffs and the crepes here always smell great.  I also like the fact that it has a Japanese mini-mart in the back for all my Japanese munchy needs.
author: Janny J.

description: they make fresh juice here to order!  i got carrot juice yesterday, and it makes such a difference when they juice the fruit/veggie right in front of you.  they also have fresh kiwi, watermelon, orange, and other juices here.
author: Helen T.

description: this place is sooo yummy!  kiwi strawberry in a fresh crepe!
author: Rob J.

description: Genki makes the best crepes in Sf! I have tried many crepe places that were just ok to craptastic. Genki definitely takes the cake for their perfectly made crepes that are not too flaky and not soggy at the very end. They also dont skimp on the toppings and make sure they are filled with the best tasting ingredients. Great for an evening dessert after dinner or a late night snack. Actually writing about it makes want to go grab one now!
author: Tim L.

description: This crepes are the best and they are super cheap.  Plus you can browse the grocery store and find the most random things.
author: Tammy W.

description: this is my favorite place to go to when i go back home! the crepes are good, the store is cute, they have my favorite waffle ice cream bar, and it's open late!! perfect place to go to when you want desert!
author: Krystal L.

description:
I'm going to go against the grain and say Genki is not the best place ever. 
The crepes are awfuly overpriced and oftentimes i feel it's a little unsanitary. The best crepes on the menu are the dessert ones, especially because you can create your own. The savory crepes are not as good because they don't give you enough condiments (like 2 pieces of avocado) and don't have enough flavor. They do the same thing for all the crepes actually. Hey, only two slices of strawberry?! Whatsup with that?
Egg Puffs are great, mostly because they are called egg puffs.
I as well really enjoy all the pocky and japanese merch in the store attached.
author: montenegra m.

description:
Oh this tiny, tiny heaven smack dab in  little second chinatown aka clement street, is awesome as a whole. 

The crepes are pretty good. The egg puffs are even better. But the real thing I love is the store is the teeny little supermarket/drugstore in the back. JAPANESE CANDIES AND CHINESE SNACKS GALORE! Love those Meiji Chocolates.  They have a lot of the asian drugstore versions of brands of cosmetics/skincare like Kose, Shiseido, Kanebo etc. Little Tokyo down the street has quite a few of the same things, but I just like the environment of Genki more.

I can stand in this store for hours but usually the emplooyees start to look at my suspiciously, especially since I like to just stand there and look  at all the cool stuff and boxed candy with prizes inside. Or the boxed keychains, nothing can really beat a boxed keychain.

Overall a fun place to go when you have nothing better to do.
author: Nana n.

description:
I like this place because egg puffs are so extremely delicious and it's open pretty late for being as far out in the wilderness as it is. It's also bright and clean and filled with neat stuff that I never buy but love to look at (I guess they have Pocky FOR MEN now). It's a fun treat place but if I were with a bunch of manly dudes I wouldn't suggest stopping in as it's definitely got that sort of creepy I'm-a-kid-forever vibe. 

But this is the kind of thing my nerd friends would travel to Ann Arbor for, and now it's in my city. I'm satisfied.
author: Miranda J.

description: Went there Friday night...hrm lets see...the line was very long...so I thought I picked a great place to go...the Crepe isn't that great, the ice cream was good...got the lychee...didn't give very much fruits...so overall experience...crepe was not that great, but I have to agree with other people...the egg nugget waffle was to die for...it was great...and crispy...loved it!
author: Michelle H.

description: wow, this place is sooooo yummy and cheap. not only do they have crepes, they have those yummy puff ball snacks, ice cream, and they have a whole section on asian drinks, snacks, chips, and candy. (:
author: Claudia M.

description: I LOVE GENKI! I had the a sweet crepe with vanilla ice cream and fresh mangos. I loved it. It was so good. I wanna go back and try other types. It was delicious exactly what a crepe should taste like. :)
author: Je M.

description: decent crepes with a small area where customers can shop around for japanese snacks and goods.
author: Moko R.

description: Mmm so good! I love coming here for the cheap dessert crepes. They completely fill me up and are so delicious. They also have really cute Japanese candy and toys and drinks here. But the hours are a little weird...I mean, who is closed on a Monday?
author: Bethany D.

description: Really good. REALLY GOOD. I'm not a hand-held crepe person, I'm more of a crepe plate person but Genki's definitely hit the spot. Also, I never thought that I would ever try an actual real food (non-dessert) crepe but it was amazing. It was beef, cheese, and some vegetable. It was delicious! Highly recommended!
author: J L.

description: I love their crepes, especially the banana nutella crepe w/vanilla ice cream. They don't go skimpy on the nutella so that's a plus. They also have A LOT of candies and sweets + ramdom stuff. I guess the place is more of a super market because there's no where for you to sit down (except for a park bench out front). So this is not really a dessert place for those of you who want to sit down at a table and chat with your friends. You're basically getting your crepes to go. I've been here twice and haven't been disappointed. If I'm ever on Clement again, I will definetely come by and get some crepes, candy and maybe some random cute junk that I don't need.
author: Laura W.

description: 5 Stars for the nutella, banana, vanilla ice cream topped with whip cream crepe!! Sooo good!
author: K T.

description: If I was writing this review two years ago, i would give it 5 stars because I think it was better back then.  Recently I came here for Crepes. I ordered a chocolate cheesecake crepe for like 6 bucks. The crepe is not as crunche as before. I think it's probably too many people in line ordering them and the people making the crepes made too much and get tired?  Another thing is the cheesecake inside the crepe is not as fresh I think. or is it my tongue taste has improve for better quality of food? After all, I still love Genki because they have many varieties to choose from. So I will still come back if I have time but I won't make myself out of my way to come.
author: Vivian L.

description: I went here tonight Saturday, July 24th at 8:30pm.  I bought a coconut flavor eggette waffle, and it taste hard and dry.  It didn't even taste like a chewy waffle.  It came out like a dried thin crackling flat cookie.  Tasted like crap.  A hispanic guy made it.   Waste of my $3.25.  Feeding us dried crap.  The store Eggettes taste way better than this place.  I wish I got a refund.
author: Yelper Y.

description:
you cannot walk by this place without getting a violent punch-in-the-face whiff of sugar and vanilla. succumb to your nostrils and enter the little shop that houses a ton of japanese goods (read: kawaii galore) and a delicious crepe bar.

so much nippon-y goodness housed into one little mart!!! from miniature lunch toys and anime action figures to japanese cosmetic products (kose, kanebo, the list goes on and on)-- you'll find it here. there are rows and rows of japanese chips, crackers, and candies; it's enough to put you into blissful stupor.

wander over (or force your way, depending on the crowd) to the crepe bar and choose from a selection of savory or sweet crepes. the sweet ones have choices with ice cream (e.g. lycee + green tea ice cream, vanilla ice cream + nutella, and mango ice cream + strawberries) or without (banana + nutella, strawberries + whipped cream). de-frickin-licious, i tell you.
author: Kerry N.

description: While the sweets and the atmosphere are hard to beat, the quality of the crepe-making has been somewhat inconsistent the past few times I have visited. On occasion I have had several crepes that were cooked to a crisp, which makes it very difficult to eat without looking like a pig. The lychee ice cream (from Pollyanna's?) with red bean paste is to die for, but the red bean paste they use is quite sweet and many of my friends find it difficult to finish the entire crepe.
author: A. T.

description: Still a nice place and all but they stopped serving fresh squeezed oj :(
author: Mikiko A.

description: having crepes after king of thai is like the best thing ever. actually...having crepes anytime is the best thing ever. nutella, fruit, ice cream, all rolled into a not too soft not too crunchy crepe? heaven!
author: Justine K.

description: you haven't lived until you've had creamy vanilla ice cream, nutella, sliced bananas, marshmellows, and the best whipped cream ever, wrapped in a paper thin warm crepe.  you just haven't.  the crepes- both savory and sweet are delicious.  my only gripe with this place is- if i'm paying 7 BUCKS for a friggin crepe and i ask for extra whipped cream as an after thought- DON'T make me get back in line and pay an extra 50 cents!!! but i still go back =( i can't fight the nutella urge.
author: Shanti G.

description:
sooooo my bf and i tried the crepe with the bananas honey and almonds (i think) and iced thai tea.

the crepe was pretty good and tasty and the thai tea was legit too.
author: Jodi P.

description: i love this place. i come here everytime i come down here. it's really cheap and it makes me really full.
author: Melissa G.

description: i love genki! besides the parking issue, genki makes me happy. with the cutsie japanese mini mart  and the delicious crepes. my new favorite is the  apple cinnamon with vanilla ice cream, i like the mix of crunchy, soft and oh so sweet, and the egg puffs are good too. perfect for your little "adventures" for food, if you know what i mean.
author: Jackie S.

description: like the rating said: i have had better crapes. try crape temptation. its way better.. the ice cream is way better and even the crape it self.
author: Jessica O.

description: Delicious! I love their ice cream crepes. Lychee is my favorite =) The only thing I don't like is that you can't substitute anything in the crepes they offer. =/ But they're still good so its okay!
author: Navi K.

description: it's gotten so popular over the years! good for them... but for me it means longer waits.   the size of their crepes shrunk by half.  i used to be able to share the crepe with my boyfriend... but i could probably eat the whole thing myself now.
author: Cee L.

description: came here for a sweet treat the other day with my sister. got a sweet crepe with vanilla ice cream, nutella, and strawberries. it was really good. perhaps a bit too sweet in the end with the nutella and a bit skimpy on the strawberries but definitely yummy. they have savory crepes too which are apparently pretty good. i'll have to try some of the other crepes next time.
author: Linda N.

description: The crepe was good, but keep in mind that it is a mini meal in itself, not a dessert! I had the green tea + red bean crepe and didn't like the red bean flavor so much. Also had a bite of lychee from someone else, that was good too.
author: V W.

description: this place is addicting, makes me want to skip dinner and go straight to a stawberry and bananna ice cream crepe.
author: thuy m.

description: I LOVE their crepe's!! This place is what I miss about living in SF. I usually get green tea ice cream with strawberries, or once in awhile with lychee. Their green tea ice cream is the best!! I love that they put whipped cream, and hide some fruit towards the bottom. I also like how they are the type of crepes that you can hold. I haven't had a crepe that you can hold that I've actually liked besides the ones at Genki.
author: Astrid B.

description: I'm not sure it's any better than Sophie's in Japantown, but the shopping for candy and manga more than tips the scales. Great place to go for dessert after a meal on Clement.
author: Asdf A.

description: i heart genki not for it's crepes, but for it's fine selection of asian candies and other goodies.  on said night, i stocked up on shrimp chips and some peach gummies.
author: Sharlene C.

description: I've been hearing raving reviews about genki crepes for months.  So last night I finally found time to go and give it a try. And I must say I wasn't that impressed. I ordered the strawberry and nutella crepe and there were so few strawberries that I couldn't even taste them.  The crepe was way to crunchy..almost like eating a cracker.  Bits of crepe fell on the floor with every bite.  And the crepe was salty.  The only part that was good was the amount of nutella.  My bf got the green tea with lychee and all he got were four pieces of lychee.
author: Amelia L.

description: i love how these crepes are crispy and not soggy! and give you a lot of ice cream, bananas, nutella too! not stingy at all. they're egg puffs are hella good too! this place is cheap and they close when the crowd leaves!
author: Ame C.

description: Excellent crepes! haha... small stores that sells crepes, eggpuff, Japanese snacks, drinks, noodles, and soaps...
author: Patty P.

description: Genki is a wonderland! Moderately priced, quickly prepared, and well packaged to go; these yummy crepes come in a variety of flavors. Or you can mix and match to build your own creation. They also sell lots of cute Japanese trinkets, figurines, toys etc. Best of all, for all you bishi boys out there... they sell Gatsby hair wax! All the colors are present too, unlike in some Japantown stores where they are chronically sold out. Not much seating, just a few benches and a dirty table outside, so it is probably best to grab 'n go.
author: M. W.

description: Great crepes, with so many choices! I got Nutella, vanilla ice cream, and strawberries-decadent but so delicious! Even though there were four or five people in front of me in line, I got my crepe in like five minutes. Great service!
author: Mollee P.

description: I love this mini-mart/crepe place...everytime i go out to clement with my family for dinner, i'd always drop by for crepes or the volcano sundae thing...its so good! oh yeah..the little egg puffs too :D
author: Broc L.

description: I know I may get some sheit for this review but so be it. Anyhow, I have noticed many people writing rave reviews of this place and I have spoken to people personally about this place etc etc. The fact that it was this place was close by, I had to try it. Yesterday, perfect day (maybe alittle chilly) walked there with my couz. I did know what to get, my mind was elsewhere and there were numerous choices (also, suffering from massive hangover did not help me decide on something). Getting back to the story, i went with the chocolate icecream/cheese cake one. Yes for those of you healthies out there, this is not the crepe for you.  I honestly did not know what to expect, i've had crepes before, but with all of those ingredients, I simply couldn't picture it. For the price it was great, this thing was f-ing huge. Tons of cheesecake, good amount of icecream and whipped cream. In all honestly maybe it was my condition, but this was overwhelming. I kind wish I had gone with a plain crepe with nutela (spelling???). Another note, I thought that this place was going to be a straight up crepe place. It's kind of a bit of everything, Walgreen's, specialty weird Asian gifts, it kind of does not know what it wants to be. Anyhow, this is just  a first review, I am assuming one more star will be added on the next time around...
author: Cameron R.

description: I think its hard to mess up a crepe, especially when it contains nutella, strawberries and whipped cream. That being said, this place is pretty good. I also liked the fact that you can shop around the mini market (mostly Japanese products) while waiting for your order. There are no tables to eat your crepe but you can  walk around the block and grab a decent cup of coffee at one of the nearby coffee shops.
author: Diana B.

description: crepes? how about boba? how about cute japanese snacks and thangs? how about it? huh? huh? if you're waiting to get seated at any of the yummy places around clement (clementine, burma superstar, green apple books-- hee hee), you can get a snack or something to help you get out of your hunger pangs quickly at this here genki. yes, crepes too. and egg puffs. thank you very much.
author: ray e.

description: very cute store.  they had a wide variety of japanese snacks and stuff.  theres like a little bit of everything there.  i didn't eat anything there except the ice cream.  they let me sample it before i bought anything.  i love the honeydew ice cream and the lychee one.  the lychee one tastes kinda coconutty and it has a hint of lychee in it.  there are also pieces of lychee in it, or maybe it's coconut?  idk but it was hella good.  the honeydew one was really clean tasting.  it was very refreshing.  i can't wait to go back.  next time i get dim sum i'm gonna stop by again. :)
author: diana t.

description: I found parking right in front on a busy Tuesday evening - I was destined for crepes tonight for sure.  After all, I've been dying to try this place after hearing all you yelpers rant and rave.  Yelp hasn't failed me tonight.  The girl in the front took my order right away.  I opted for #24 which was a strawberry with either whipped creme or nutella.  I indulged myself by telling them to put both and it cost me $4.61 total - not bad.  There were a few folks in front of me but I got my crepe quick and I finished almost quicker.  It was pure ECSTASY!  I shall be back for sure.  Now, I got to check out GENKI Ramen.
author: Maryanne D.

description: best dessert crepes in the world.  ok maybe not the world but at least the bay area.  feel lucky to have lived only 10 blocks away and stumble upon these warm crispy ice cream fruit filled whip creamy tastes of heaven back in '03 when there weren't unending lines of eager genki addicts spilling out onto the streets.  since then times have changed and this hidden gem ain't so hidden anymore but the quality of their crepes has definitely not been compromised.  friends from out of town come to the bay with genki on the top of their lists of things to do/eat.  really... i don't mean to sound dramatic but... there's nothing like it.
author: Jane L.

description: i loveee to come here for crepes, my friend and I always crave it at work. and maybe cuz its the only crepe place near by...but its good. i alwayss get mixed fruit and nutella. yummmm the savory crepes are okay too...the stuff they sell there is cool too. yuppp im craving it noww as i type
author: Christine M.

description:
when im craving savory crepes, i go to genki.  just your typical crepery with a variety of cheeses and veggies to fill your crepe with.  their beef sukiyaki crepe is REALLY REALLY GOOD.  their dessert crepes are not all that great because they put way too much ice cream and are stingy with the fruits.  unless youre into that, then i guess genki is your place for dessert crepes.  its not mine tho.

this is a cool place to drop by and pick up food if youre really hungry but dont wanna sit at a restaurant, and want something quick but healthier than fast food.

oh and its also a little asian variety store with a couple of aisles of random toys, snacks, candies, drinks, and makeup (i said random) that i usually browse while im waiting for my crepe order.  

oh and bring cash unless youre planning on spending over $10 at genki.  one time, i just wanted an avocado/tomato/mozzarella crepe, but i ended up buying a bunch of random snacks as well because i only had my debit card on me.  talk about pigging out.
author: Shelly C.

description: they have those eggpuffs that i can't get enough of. other reasons to visit are: (1) you love japanese snacks, sanrio, kitchenware and toiletries (2) you just ate a honkin big meal at Burma Superstar and need some Polly-Ann ice cream wrapped up in a crepe (3) did i mention egg puffs?
author: Tin-Tin E.

description: genki means "feel good."  the name definitely lives up when it comes to their crepes.  had the banana and nutella crepe - ridiculous!
author: Paul A.

description: I always inhale deeply as I walk past this place because it always smells so freaking delicious. It smells like warm sweet crepes and I always avoid going there because I'd rather watch people stuff their faces with crepes than eat them myself but tonight I was feeling daring and bold and so after dinner, I walked past Genki and saw the egg-puff waffle iron and decided that it was egg puffs for dessert! Walked inside and saw that there were flavored egg puffs (I've only had plain and red bean-filled) and decided on coconut. I walked around the store as I waited for my number to be called and was just admiring all the japanese snacks and gatsby hair waxes. at least this store is open  relatively late. I mean, most japanese markets close early and Genki stands out as your one stop shop to get crepes or boba as well as pick up some necessities such as tonkatsu sauce, a totoro doll and moth balls at 10pm.
author: kristin e.

description: Delicious Crepes and good price too! The ice cream crepes are huge and I would recommend sharing with someone. Last night I had the Fresh Fruit Crepe with Whipped Cream and it was enough for two. It was not heavy, but light and the perfect after dinner treat! Yumm!
author: Camille B.

description: Wandered in here one night around 11:30 after a rousing time at The Bitter End. I was honestly surprised that anything was open that late on Clement. I just moved here about a month ago from sleepy Berkeley, where pretty much everything closes by 9. This place is fantastic! First of all, I love pretty much anything Asian, I mean, my boyfriend is half Taiwanese, and I'm hoping to produce a few quarter-Asian babies some day so that I can start identifying with my Asian roots. This place is awesome. I got a cheese and onion crepe and it was DELICIOUS. People are right about the crispiness of the crepe. So ideal, so French (although I've had much worse crepes in Paris), and from an Asian convenience store! I'm looking forward to trying the Red Bean Paste crepe next time. I also bought Red Bean ice cream, some White Peony tea, and some honey ginger crystals- all of which are delicious. I love Asian convenience stores and Genki is number one for also having delicious, fresh crepes, and staying open late!
author: Rachael S.

description: The crepes here are just so so for me. the place is pretty neet since it is like a lil japanese market. the crepes dont win me over
author: John C.

description: cheap crepes and a great assortment of japanese candy! i went there when it first opened and the crepes were a work in progress, a bit too thick with toppings either piled on or not enough. i think they've gotten the hang of it since. great for a snack when you want to walk around neuvo chinatown.
author: Shinn Z.

description:
man, lots of 5stars lately, eh?? must be the gorgeous weather.. =D
hehe

o genki, you are evil~* you are SOO* evil~~!!!

stop torturing me with all your goodies~!!!

tons of variety...
*ice cream, savory, snack/dessert crepes,  tapioca drinks, milkshakes, smoothies, juices and egg puffs...  

add $0.65 for extra goodies such as: strawberry, mango, caramel, tomato, spinach
add $0.75 for extra nutella, pb, hot fudge, avocado, cheese, slice of turkey/ham.

took me approx 15 minutes to figure out what i wanted..i mean, shiet, here, i'll throw out a few on the ones i was stumped on.
-mango ice cream, strawberry, whip $4.45
-chocolate ice cream, cheesecake, whip $5.50
-smoked salmon, onion, cream cheese, wasabi $6.15
-mixed fruits (nutella/whip cream) $3.95
.
.
.
ended up getting the chocolate ice cream, cheesecake and whip ... my my, they totally made me sick of cheesecake, that's for sure.. =D
mmm mmm ~**

it's sucha cute place -- from afar, it's simply a crepe place, but it's also a convenient store, selling all your goodies as well. i went on this japanese sweet binge buying my sweet drinks (lol, call me a fob, but i bought this hello kitty strawberry milk drink, but sadly, i forgot to take a picture!) and goodies for the rest of the month... 

arigato genki~!!!
author: Jennifer S.

description: one of the many reasons i miss living in the inner richmond. i loved walking here on warm night to get a crepe with whipped cream, fresh strawberries, and nutella, yummmy, and also picking up a small container of calbee wasabi shrimp chips and green tea ice cream. the crepes were always perfect, and i never minded having to wait when the line would trickle out the door. sooooo worth it...
author: Brokester C.

description: Turkey, Cheese, Avacado Crepe! This place knows how to make them.  While you wait for your crape/smoothie/hotchocolate or what ever else delicious concuction you have them whipping up, you can journey the isles in the store for rare japanese food and products.  If you ever find yourself on clement st at night time, be sure to stop by.
author: John D.

description: First off, let me start with the negatives: the place is small and has very limited seating, as it is a store rather than a restaurant. Parking is pretty hard in this area, but of course, where is parking ever easy in SF? On a positive note, their crepes are fairly good and reasonably priced. And they take debit/credit cards! Compared to the the Fisherman's Wharf Crepe 's, Genki is a bargain! I absolutely love anything with Nutella and fruit. I'm not so much of a fan of their savory crepes, though. Overall, I will continue to patron this business for affordable, tasty crepes.
author: Ro F.

description: Their savory crepe with spinach and mushroom is so good.  Of course sweet ones are good, too. I am used to egg puffs filled with sweet azuki bean, so I am not crazy about theirs, but not too bad.   I love browsing through their store to find out what's new in Japanese toys and nick nacks.  I find lots of Korean snacks, too.
author: Su Kyeong K.

description: this is my favorite spot for "egg puffs".  i discovered these little balls of pleasure in milpitas but the eggy taste with crispy texture and perfect chew conjures memories that i can't really identify but assume are from time spent in hk when i was in my single digits.  i don't know if it's my obsession with anything made of milk or eggs or if they are just that damn good.  you've got to try them for yourself.  also the store part is perfect for getting your snack on.
author: Cindy F.

description: every time i have to wait for a table at burma superstar this is where i entertain myself. god i love those ominous, impossible-to-determine-whats-really-inside japanese snack foods. i've never actually eaten a crepe here but how could i when tempted with such delicacies as lychee jellies, hello panda cookies, rice candy, and other treats i can only hope to guess at by looking at the cartoons and symbols on the packaging (cake? dried crab? stickers? illegal fireworks? who cares?!)
author: Lisa M.

description: their crepe is yummy with nutella, bananas, and whip cream.. u can add ice cream too... variety of snacks around the store.. after dinner walk to there and buy some candy.. they have tapoica tOO...
author: Lily T.

description: had crepes here 1 time. and i had the egg puff. im not super impressed but i know a ton of peeps who love it. ill try again sometime in the future to see if it was just made wrong. it was ok. sorry everyone dont get mad. ill promise to try again.
author: Mark F.

description: yummmm great for after having dinner on clement. i always get the crepe with strawberry and vanilla ice cream! a must if you are on clement.
author: Linda L.

description: Okay fine. I thought no other crepe place in San Francisco should get 5 stars other than Ti Couz, but this is different. I only tried the dessert crepes, but they're enough for this review. Their crepes are crispy! And I love the little store (selling mainly useless things but buys time). It's perfect for a cute after-dinner snack.
author: Judy L.

description: Sweet sweet crepes... mmmmmm. Strawberry ice cream with bananas and nutella = heaven. Not on the menu but you can pretty much order whatever you want. Besides their yummy desserts, Genki is a cute little Japanese market with all sorts of other goodies. Parking can be a pain sometimes, but sooo worth it. Egg puffs are also good. Dip them in nutella and they're perfection! Oh, and bring cash. They'll only accept card with a $10 minimum purchase.
author: Haim C.

description: Great crepes! Cute and tasty candies, but pricey!
author: M L.

description: i absoulty love the crepes here although i only get strawberry with nutella and whip cream but its hella good. i recently had the egg puffs for the first time and they are good too. the strawberry one actually has strawberries in it. oh and best part theyre open late. woohoo!! yet another discovered spot that is open late.
author: stacy l.

description: i used to really love the nutella strawberry crepes...but i've since moved on and found a new love - red bean egg puffs. trust.
author: eve l.

description: Really tasty, crispy crepes, and it's nice that they have other snacks and goodies in the store, but you can get those things for cheaper at other places on Clement. I always wish they had more seating too because it tends to fill up pretty quickly during peak dessert times.
author: Tami H.

description: I am thinking about Genki Crepes right now. They are better than the places in Japantown. yummy.
author: Luke F.

description: I'd just drove 5miles to genki just to get an ice cream crepe tonight and I asked if I could get a chocolate ice cream with kiwi and the pretty girl said 'yes' but when I got into the car I realized that it wasn't chocolate ice cream but strawberry! geez ! please do make it right next time
author: W M.

description: The crepes here are great and easy to eat. The store itself has a lot of neat Asian candies and toys. Its a good place to get desert.
author: Anthony M.

description: best crepes ever! open late and great! anything you want you got it! cheescake crepes with ice cream so goood!  perfect dessert very reasonable prices!
author: s b.

description: I love their crepes.  I always get the Mix fruit crepe with chocolate ice cream.  They have a variety of crepes, ice cream, and drinks.  It's a great place to get snacks and dessert!
author: Linda H.

description: best crepe i've ate so far. 5 stars, wooots! =DD
author: Valerie N.

description: I've tried crepes everywhere I see them.  I'm one of the biggest fans of crepes...only the fruit/sweet kinds though.  I don't eat the ones with salami/cheese/vegetables.  I tried crepes in berkeley, japantown, haight street, balboa street, duboce street, etc.  But this is still my favorite place to get crepes.  The flour wrapper part is always not tasteless, but not too sweet, the fruits are fresh, and the wait is not long.  The prices are about the same as everywhere else.  They also have all kinds of other junk sweets that are really cheap there.  If you are a total sweet tooth....try out genki.
author: Karen C.

description: I love their Green Forest smoothie. And I find it so cute that they have a little mini market where you can kill time while you wait for your drink/crepe.
author: Jane Y.

description: Delicious crepes!  It's great to have some okay sushi around the corner and then come here for dessert.  They also have a mini grocery store that sells Japanese snacks, but the snacks are a little pricey.  The only downside of this place is the lack of seating.  San Francisco tends to get really cold at night and the lack of seating really sucks when you're eating a cold ice cream crepe.
author: P L.

description:
my favorite dessert.  everything i love all rolled into one.

i get the same thing every time: crepe with nutella, mixed fruit and vanilla ice cream.

i also pick up my favorite japanese tea cookies and candies.
author: gail g.

description: This place is great for crepes to go. The crepes are crispy and delicious.  The wait is not long and they are very quick at making your crepes.  They have a large selection or you can always customize your own flavor.  I stop here for dessert crepes everytime I am done eating dinner at nearby restaurants.
author: Liz Y.

description: This is place has the best crepes. The price of the crepes are much cheaper than Sophie's Crepes down at Japantown. I think their pretty awesome to offer free whip cream. The little store itself isn't bad at all. It's like your typical Japanese shop lined with Asian snacks. Overall its a clean, cheap place to get crepes.
author: amandaaa s.

description: i like that this place is open late-ish. i tried a strawberry nutella crepe here once and would be happy to come back to try another crepe or their egg puffs. i also like their imported foods and knick knacks in the grocery store portion.
author: Kan L.

description: Are you serious? I don't care if the service is horrible or good; I'm not here to eat the people. Yes, the store has all kinds of Asian imported snacks, toys, etc.,but I'm here to savor a crepe. I've tried Genki Crepes a few times, and I think it's fair to say that I don't like it. The savory crepes are too salty. The only crepe I might get again from Genki are the ones with ice cream in it - and that's if I'm in the area, with the munchies. Unlike Crepes A GoGo, I will not go out of my way for Genki's. The chicken and cheese: chicken is Salty; nicely made, but salty and the chicken doesn't taste fresh.  Tastesllike chicken that's been salted for a longer shelf life. I couldn't help but read the reviews but whatever, everyone is entitled to their own opinion. I only waited to write up this review because I tried Genki's one more time before I finalized my opinion. FAIL. I don't think half of these people have ever been to a true, crepe joint. Maybe this store is in a convenient area, but i don't care; I much rather go further to get something worth the same price - and a true crepe. Nobody can say I'm judging wrong because the crepes at Genki are made by non-french people; well, there are a few non -french people also at the Crepes A GoGo. Still FAIL at Genki. Nice, clean store though.
author: S. F.

description: this is THE BEST crepe i've had in san francisco.  the crepe is this golden brown and has this perfect *crunch* to it, and the smooth chocolatey nutella just melts in your mouth along with the sweet strawberries and fluffy whipped cream.  damn..now i really want one..
author: Trisha H.

description: blueberry cheesecake crepe + black coffee from blue danube = best portable sweet meal.  the aroma of the crepes makes the whole damn block smell good.  they are open late and have a great candy selection.  i always pick up a couple of packets of ramen whenever i'm here.
author: why l.
